records.name: Bloem Syrah Mourvèdre 2020
records.description: A compelling Rhône-style blend that marries the power of Syrah with the earthy complexity of Mourvèdre. The 2020 vintage produced wines of impressive concentration and aromatic intensity. This blend showcases the synergy between these two varietals, creating a wine greater than the sum of its parts.
records.region: Unknown (likely warm-climate region based on blend composition)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals intense aromas of blackberry, dark plum, and blueberry compote, layered with meaty, savory notes of cured salami and black olive tapenade. Syrah contributes white pepper and smoky bacon, while Mourvèdre adds garrigue, leather, and wild game. Subtle notes of lavender, thyme, and fennel seed add herbal complexity. The aromatic profile suggests warm-climate fruit with classic Rhône character.","finish":"Long and powerful, with persistent dark fruit flavors and a savory, meaty quality that lingers. Firm tannins and a touch of black pepper spice extend the finish, while hints of graphite and iron add minerality. The substantial structure suggests excellent aging potential.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with bold, chewy tannins that provide structure and grip. Dark fruit flavors of boysenberry, blackcurrant, and black cherry dominate, complemented by earthy notes of truffle, mushroom, and wet stone. The mid-palate shows excellent density with integrated acidity keeping the wine balanced despite its power. Flavors of roasted coffee, dark cocoa, and charred oak add depth. The wine's rustic character is balanced by ripe fruit and careful oak integration."}

records.name: Adir Dry Riesling Mevushal (MD & DC) 2024
records.description: An aromatic kosher Riesling from the Galilee region of Israel, crafted with precision by Adir Winery. This mevushal certified wine balances rich texture with refreshing character, showcasing the winery's commitment to producing extraordinary wines from their hidden gem vineyard in the heart of Galilee.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromatics of petrol and honeysuckle, characteristic of quality Riesling, layered with white flowers and hints of spice. Subtle notes of citrus blossom and wet stone emerge with aeration, revealing the wine's mineral complexity. There's a beautiful funk typical of well-made Riesling, adding intrigue and depth to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and refreshing, with lingering notes of citrus pith and stony minerality. There's a pleasant tension between the wine's richness and its zippy acidity, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next sip.","palate":"Rich and layered on the palate, this dry Riesling delivers impressive weight without sacrificing freshness. Flavors of ripe apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach are complemented by a distinctive mineral backbone reminiscent of crushed limestone. The wine shows excellent structure with crisp acidity cutting through the generous fruit, while subtle notes of ginger and white pepper add complexity. The texture is surprisingly plush for a dry style, with a glycerin quality that coats the palate."}

records.name: Noughty NA White Wine NV
records.description: An exceptional dealcoholized white wine blend from organic grapes, crafted by Thomson & Scott. This non-alcoholic offering combines 55% Chenin Blanc with 45% Chardonnay to create a sophisticated alternative that maintains wine character and complexity while removing alcohol through gentle dealcoholization processes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright notes of yellow apple, lime, and chamomile dominate the aromatic profile, creating an inviting and fresh impression. Honeysuckle and citrus fruit aromas layer with delicate jasmine, offering genuine wine-like complexity. The organic grape sourcing contributes to the pure, clean fruit expression.","finish":"Clean and refreshing finish with lingering citrus and floral notes. The wine maintains the right balance between fruit and dryness, avoiding simple grape juice character while remaining accessible and enjoyable.","palate":"The palate delivers good balance between acidity and fruitiness, avoiding the pitfalls of excessive sweetness common in non-alcoholic wines. Flavors of yellow apple, lime, and melon are complemented by chamomile and citrus notes. The Chenin Blanc component provides crisp acidity and mineral freshness, while Chardonnay adds body and texture that give the wine satisfying weight despite the absence of alcohol."}

records.name: Stel + Mar Andrew Cabernet Sauvignon (DC/MD Only) 2023
records.description: A young, vibrant Cabernet Sauvignon exclusively available in the DC/MD market, this wine showcases fresh fruit character and modern winemaking. The 2023 vintage is incredibly recent, offering primary fruit flavors and accessibility while maintaining Cabernet's structural backbone. Stel + Mar's Andrew bottling represents approachable premium Cabernet designed for near-term enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and exuberant nose bursting with youthful Cabernet character: ripe blackcurrant, fresh blackberry, and dark cherry lead the way, supported by notes of cassis and red plum. The aromatic profile shows bright fruit purity with subtle hints of green bell pepper and fresh herbs that indicate youth and varietal authenticity. Light oak influence contributes gentle vanilla, cedar, and sweet toast notes. A whisper of violet and dark chocolate adds intrigue to this vivacious bouquet.","finish":"Medium-length finish with persistent dark fruit and gentle tannins. Notes of blackberry, vanilla, and subtle oak spice linger, with a touch of fresh herbs on the aftertaste. The finish is clean and youthful, with refreshing acidity leaving the palate ready for food or another sip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with juicy, approachable fruit and moderate tannins that provide structure without astringency. The wine delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis, with bright acidity maintaining freshness and vitality throughout. Oak aging adds layers of vanilla, mocha, and baking spices, while subtle notes of tobacco, cedar, and graphite hint at classic Cabernet complexity. The tannins are present but soft, suggesting some oak maturation to round out the wine's texture. The alcohol (likely 13.5-14%) is well-integrated, supporting the fruit concentration. Despite its youth, the wine shows good balance and drinkability."}

records.name: Eulila Red Blend (DC - MD ONLY) 2022
records.description: Eulila's Red Blend represents accessible, fruit-forward winemaking designed for immediate enjoyment. The 2022 vintage is youthful and vibrant, showcasing fresh fruit character and approachable structure. This is a versatile red blend that offers excellent value and food-pairing flexibility, perfect for everyday drinking.
records.varietal: Red Blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah blend)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry, dark cherry, and plum, complemented by notes of vanilla, mocha, and sweet spice from oak aging. Hints of dried herbs, black pepper, and subtle floral notes add complexity. The youthful 2022 vintage shows bright, primary fruit character with a touch of jammy richness. Subtle earthy undertones and a whisper of tobacco provide depth without detracting from the wine's approachable, fruit-forward profile.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long, with lingering dark fruit notes, soft tannins, and subtle oak-derived vanilla and spice. The wine concludes with a clean, slightly sweet fruit character that makes it highly approachable. This is an easy-drinking red blend that delivers immediate pleasure.","palate":"On the palate, the wine displays medium to full body with soft, approachable tannins and balanced acidity. Flavors of blackberry jam, black cherry, and cassis dominate, supported by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak. The blend's composition likely includes Merlot or similar softening varieties, giving the wine a plush, rounded mouthfeel. Mid-palate richness is balanced by fresh acidity that prevents the wine from feeling heavy. Touches of spice, leather, and dried fruit add interest and depth to the fruit core."}

records.name: Macauley Petite Sirah Napa Valley 2021
records.description: Crafted by renowned winemaker Kirk Venge in Calistoga, this blockbuster Petite Sirah represents the pinnacle of Napa Valley's dark, powerful wines. With only 70 cases produced, this is a gentle monster that showcases the intensity and longevity potential of premium Napa Petite Sirah, capable of aging gracefully for decades.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is remarkably saturated and complex, opening with layers of ripe plum and violet that immediately captivate the senses. Exotic cardamom spice weaves through cherry cavendish tobacco notes, while careful swirling reveals deeper dimensions of cocoa powder and dark chocolate draped over cherry fruit. The aromatic intensity is profound yet refined, hinting at the wine's structural depth and concentration.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and persistent, with dark fruit echoes lingering alongside hints of espresso and dark chocolate. Firm but velvety tannins provide a structural backbone that promises exceptional aging potential through 2044 and likely beyond, while maintaining immediate approachability for those who enjoy bold, concentrated wines.","palate":"A true Calistoga blockbuster that leaves no part of the palate untouched, this wine delivers budding black fruit intensity with cherry reduction and the entire spectrum of dark fruit stacked in layers. Medium-to-full bodied richness combines with perfectly integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness. The fruit concentration is extraordinary, with blackberry, black plum, and cassis creating waves of flavor that build rather than overwhelm, demonstrating both power and finesse in equal measure."}

records.name: Aratas Veneration Red Blend 2021
records.description: Veneration represents Aratas Wine's tribute to the art of blending, crafted by founders Stephanie Douglas and John Chohany along with John's brother Mickey. This Napa Valley red blend honors their Hungarian heritage, with 'Aratas' meaning 'harvest of gold' in Magyar, reflecting the precious nature of this wine.
records.varietal: Primarily Petite Sirah and Syrah (blend percentages vary by vintage, typically 65-70% Petite Sirah, 30-35% Syrah, with occasional Cabernet Sauvignon)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is powerfully expressive with concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry, dark plum, and black cherry, layered with notes of violets, espresso, and dark cocoa. There's a compelling spice character showing hints of black pepper, clove, and a touch of tobacco. The Hungarian oak aging contributes unique aromatic elements including subtle exotic spices and a refined cedar note that distinguishes this blend from typical American oak-aged wines.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful with persistent dark fruit, espresso, and exotic spice notes. Substantial yet refined tannins provide structure for aging, while the wine maintains excellent balance throughout its extended finish. Hints of graphite and dark chocolate linger beautifully.","palate":"Full-bodied and intensely flavored, the palate showcases the Petite Sirah dominance with bold dark fruit flavors, robust tannins, and impressive concentration. Blackberry jam, blueberry compote, and dark cherry mingle with flavors of mocha, dark chocolate, and sweet baking spices. The Syrah component adds depth and savory complexity with notes of cured meat, olive tapenade, and cracked pepper. The Hungarian oak influence provides a distinctive spice profile that's more refined and less vanilla-forward than American oak, adding sophistication and old-world character."}

records.name: Domaine du Vieux College Marsannay Blanc "Les Vignes Marie" 2020
records.description: An exceptional white Burgundy from the Marsannay appellation, the northernmost village in the Côte d'Or. Domaine du Vieux Collège's "Les Vignes Marie" is a special cuvée from a specific vineyard parcel, showcasing the precision and elegance that define great Burgundian Chardonnay. The 2020 vintage, widely acclaimed in Burgundy, offers beautiful balance between richness and minerality with the added complexity of four years of age.
records.varietal: 100% Chardonnay from the Les Vignes Marie vineyard parcel
records.region: Marsannay AOC, Côte de Nuits, Burgundy - limestone-rich soils with excellent exposure
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Refined and complex aromatics reveal layers of white orchard fruit including ripe Golden Delicious apple, Anjou pear, and white peach, interwoven with subtle citrus notes of lemon zest and Meyer lemon. The influence of quality French oak aging shows through delicate touches of vanilla pod, toasted hazelnut, and brioche, while the limestone-rich Marsannay terroir contributes distinctive mineral notes of crushed chalk, flint, and wet stone. With aeration, nuances of white flowers (acacia, honeysuckle), almond paste, and a hint of sea salt emerge, along with subtle oxidative notes of apple blossom and honey that speak to the wine's development.","finish":"Long and precise with persistent mineral notes, citrus zest, and subtle oak spice. The finish is dry and refreshing with a distinctive flinty quality and notes of salted butter and toasted almond that linger beautifully. The wine's evolution is evident in the harmonious integration of all elements.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a beautifully textured, almost creamy mouthfeel balanced by vibrant acidity that defines great white Burgundy. Flavors of ripe yellow apple and pear are complemented by citrus notes of lemon curd and grapefruit pith, while the mid-palate reveals hazelnut, butter, and subtle minerality. The wine shows excellent depth and concentration without heaviness, likely from careful lees aging that adds richness and complexity. Stone fruit flavors of white nectarine and apricot develop, along with a distinctive saline quality and chalk-like minerality that runs through the wine. The acidity is perfectly integrated, providing freshness and lift while supporting the wine's structure."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Pale straw color with greenish reflections. The nose is aromatic and fresh with notes of citrus, green apple, and white flowers. Hints of fennel, fresh herbs, and mineral character add complexity. The aromatic profile is clean and vibrant.","finish":"Clean and persistent with lingering citrus and mineral notes. The acidity leaves the palate refreshed.","palate":"Medium-bodied with crisp acidity and pure fruit flavors. The palate delivers citrus, green apple, and stone fruit supported by herbal and mineral notes. The wine is refreshing and well-balanced, with a slight creaminess from lees contact. The texture is smooth yet lively."}

records.name: Boxwood Ellie Bird Sauvignon Gris (Private Label) 2024
records.description: An intriguing and rare expression of Sauvignon Gris from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, created as a private label offering. Founded by former Washington Redskins owner John Kent Cooke, Boxwood has established itself as one of Virginia's premier estates. This 2024 Sauvignon Gris showcases the variety's unique position between Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris, offering aromatic complexity with fresh, vibrant character from Virginia's distinctive terroir.
records.varietal: 100% Sauvignon Gris (pink-skinned mutation of Sauvignon Blanc)
records.region: Virginia - Middleburg area with continental climate and unique terroir suited to Bordeaux and Alsatian varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating and aromatic with pronounced notes of white peach, Bartlett pear, and honeydew melon leading the way. The Sauvignon Gris shows its parentage with hints of grapefruit zest, lime leaf, and passion fruit alongside the variety's characteristic floral notes of orange blossom and jasmine. Virginia's terroir contributes distinctive elements of wet stone minerality, fresh-cut grass, and subtle herbal nuances of lemon verbena and tarragon. The young, vibrant 2024 vintage displays pristine fruit purity with touches of green apple, lychee, and a hint of white flowers.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with medium-plus length. Persistent flavors of white peach and citrus zest fade gracefully, leaving a mineral-driven impression with hints of herbs and a pleasant, slightly phenolic texture that adds interest and food-friendliness.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent texture and weight that sets Sauvignon Gris apart from its more widely known cousin, Sauvignon Blanc. The palate delivers flavors of ripe stone fruit including white peach, nectarine, and apricot, balanced by bright citrus notes of Meyer lemon, pink grapefruit, and lime zest. Mid-palate richness shows subtle tropical hints of guava and pineapple without being heavy, while the variety's natural acidity provides excellent freshness and structure. A distinctive mineral quality runs through the wine like a thread, with notes of crushed quartz and saline that reflect Virginia's unique terroir. The finish shows excellent persistence with citrus and stone fruit lingering alongside refreshing minerality."}

records.name: Trespass Escapade (Rendezvous) 2011
records.description: An intriguing aged red blend from the 2011 vintage, showcasing the complexity and evolution that comes with 14 years of bottle age. This wine likely represents a Bordeaux-style blend or proprietary California Meritage, demonstrating the tertiary development and integrated structure characteristic of well-cellared premium red wines.
records.varietal: Proprietary red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, or similar Bordeaux varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals evolved aromas of dried cherry, fig, and prune alongside secondary notes of leather, tobacco, and cedar cigar box. The bouquet shows mature complexity with hints of forest floor, dried herbs, and earthy truffle. Subtle tertiary notes of vanilla, caramel, and baking spices suggest oak integration over time, while faded black currant and plum hint at the wine's fruit origins. The aromatic profile displays the savory, developed character expected from a 14-year-old wine, with primary fruit giving way to nuanced complexity.","finish":"The finish is medium-length with gentle tannins and evolved savory notes. Dried fruit, leather, and cedar linger alongside subtle earthy complexity. The wine's integrated structure and developed character suggest careful cellaring, though consumption within 1-2 years is recommended to preserve remaining vitality. This is a wine in its mature phase, offering the complexity wine collectors seek from aged bottlings.","palate":"The palate presents medium body with softened tannins and well-integrated acidity characteristic of mature red wine. Flavors of dried dark fruit, leather, and tobacco dominate, accompanied by notes of mushroom, forest floor, and subtle chocolate. The wine shows evolved complexity with hints of dried fig, dates, and aged balsamic, while maintained structure prevents over-the-hill characteristics. Oak influence has fully integrated, contributing subtle spice and vanilla without dominating. At 14 years of age, the wine displays graceful maturity with tertiary complexity taking precedence over primary fruit."}

records.name: TVH LIBRARY Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
records.description: A library release from The Vineyard House, an intimate Oakville estate founded by Jeremy Nickel, second-generation vintner and son of Far Niente creator Gil Nickel. With Philippe Melka and Maayan Koschitzky as the winemaking team, this Cabernet represents over 30 years of combined winemaking excellence in one of Napa's most prestigious appellations. The 2014 vintage has had a decade to develop additional complexity in ideal cellar conditions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with concentrated dark black cherry and blackberry at its core, showing the ripeness and quality of Oakville fruit. Layers of complexity emerge with perfumed violets adding floral elegance, while subtle hints of anise and black pepper provide spice intrigue. A decade of bottle age has allowed vanilla, cedar, and mocha notes from oak aging to integrate seamlessly, creating an aromatic profile that balances youthful fruit concentration with developed secondary characteristics.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with dark fruit persistence backed by well-integrated tannins. Notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and cedar emerge in the finale, testament to the wine's development and quality oak program. The moderate structure ensures the wine remains approachable while still having years of evolution ahead.","palate":"Dark fruit envelops the palate with concentrated black cherry, blackberry, and cassis flavors that remain vibrant despite the wine's age. The structure is built on moderate to firm tannins that have softened considerably over ten years, now providing support without aggression. Layers of dark mocha and toasted vanilla from French oak aging add depth and richness, while the natural acidity of the 2014 vintage keeps the wine fresh and focused. The Oakville terroir shines through with characteristic power balanced by elegance."}

records.name: Zephaniah Adeline 2018
records.description: A tropical and aromatic white wine blend from Zephaniah Farm Vineyard in Virginia's Loudoun County. Named after the winery owner's wife, Adeline has evolved from its original sweet dessert wine style to a sophisticated dry blend featuring Muscat Ottonel, Vidal Blanc, and Petit Manseng, showcasing Virginia's emerging wine identity.
records.varietal: Blend: 50% Muscat Ottonel, 27% Viognier, 9% Petit Manseng, 9% Vermentino, 5% Vidal Blanc (composition may vary by vintage)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Highly floral and perfumed, the nose bursts with aromatic intensity. Prominent notes of lemongrass and fresh pine needles create an herbal-floral character unique to this blend. Tropical fruit aromas of ripe pineapple and juicy mango dominate, complemented by stone fruit notes of white peach and apricot. The Muscat Ottonel contributes its characteristic rose petal and orange blossom aromatics.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering tropical fruit notes. Hints of honeysuckle and citrus zest emerge in the aftertaste, along with subtle minerality. The wine maintains its freshness through the finish, avoiding any heaviness despite the ripe fruit character.","palate":"The palate delivers on the tropical promise of the nose, with bold flavors of pineapple, mango, and passion fruit taking center stage. Tree fruit notes of golden apple and ripe pear provide balance, while the fermentation in stainless steel preserves vibrant freshness. Medium-bodied with bright acidity that prevents the fruit from becoming cloying. The blend shows excellent integration, with each variety contributing distinct characteristics—Muscat for aromatics, Vidal for structure, and Petit Manseng for acidity."}

records.name: Philippe Guerin Muscadet Sevre et Maine sur Lie 2023
records.description: A classic Muscadet Sèvre et Maine from the Loire Valley's premier Muscadet appellation, crafted by Philippe Guerin. The 'sur lie' designation indicates the wine aged on its lees, contributing texture and complexity to this mineral-driven white wine that exemplifies the freshness and purity of Loire Valley winemaking.
records.region: Muscadet Sèvre et Maine AOC, Loire Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and vibrant aromatics showcasing white pears, white currants, and crisp apple. Bright citrus notes of lemon zest emerge alongside fresh herbs, while a pronounced stony, mineral quality evokes wet stones and sea breeze. The nose is clean and invigorating, with the complexity derived from lees aging adding subtle depth beneath the bright fruit.","finish":"Clean and mineral-driven finish with lingering citrus notes and pronounced stoniness. The saline quality persists through the end, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food. The finish is crisp and energizing, characteristic of well-made Muscadet.","palate":"Deliciously creamy mouthfeel, a hallmark of sur lie aging, full of citrus and apple flavors with stony, mineral notes taking center stage. The wine shows excellent freshness and minerality throughout, with a salty tang that speaks to its coastal terroir. Despite the creamy texture, the wine maintains vibrant acidity that keeps it lively and refreshing. The flavor profile is pristine and focused, emphasizing mineral expression over overt fruit."}
