records.name: Zephaniah Three Captains Red 2019
records.description: A distinguished red blend from South Africa's premium wine regions, likely crafted in the Cape Blend tradition that showcases the country's unique terroir. This wine represents the modern South African emphasis on quality red wine production, reflecting the country's shift toward international-style reds while maintaining distinctive regional character. The 2019 vintage benefits from optimal growing conditions in the Western Cape.
records.varietal: Likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and/or Pinotage blend (Cape Blend style)
records.region: Western Cape, South Africa (likely Stellenbosch or Paarl)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals elegant layers of ripe dark cherry and blackcurrant, intertwined with notes of cigar box cedar and subtle eucalyptus that hint at South African terroir. Complex aromatics of dried violets and graphite emerge, while well-integrated oak contributes hints of vanilla and toasted spice. Background notes of sun-warmed earth and fynbos scrubland add distinctive regional character that sets this wine apart from European counterparts.","finish":"The finish is impressively long and layered, with dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to notes of leather, dried herbs, and fine-grained tannins. A touch of minerality and lingering spice keep the palate engaged, while the wine's well-structured backbone suggests excellent aging potential ahead.","palate":"Rich and structured on the palate, this wine showcases concentrated flavors of black plum, mulberry, and blackberry preserves, supported by firm but refined tannins typical of quality Cape wines. The mid-palate reveals complexity with notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and hints of tobacco leaf, while the wine's excellent balance between ripe fruit and fresh acidity provides elegance. Subtle savory elements of black olive and herbs add depth, and the oak aging is beautifully integrated, contributing structure without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Colle Corviano Montepulciano 2020
records.description: An award-winning expression of Montepulciano d'Abruzzo that earned Double Gold and Diamond Trophy at the 2021 Sakura Awards, plus Gold at the Berlin Wine Trophy and 90 points from Decanter World Wine Awards. This wine showcases the bright, lifted style of modern Abruzzo winemaking with six months aging in large French oak.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Vibrant lifted violet florals leap from the glass, followed by intense aromas of ripe blackberries, dark plums, and fresh dark cherry fruit. The nose reveals wonderful complexity with notes of clove spice, nutmeg, and subtle hints of vanilla from oak aging. Dried herbs and a touch of Mediterranean garrigue add regional character.","finish":"Fresh spiced fruit on the finish with lingering notes of dark cherry and subtle oak influence. A slightly earthy conclusion reveals hints of tobacco leaf and dried herbs, providing classic Italian character. The fresh acidity keeps the palate clean and ready for food.","palate":"A crunchy fruit style wine that emphasizes freshness and vibrancy over weight. Dark cherry fruit dominates the palate with layers of blackberry and plum supported by vibrant acidity that energizes the entire experience. The mid-palate reveals intriguing complexity with clove and nutmeg spice adding dimension. Medium-bodied with smooth tannins and excellent structure, the wine balances intensity with elegance."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Las Seis Alhajas Graciano 2021
records.description: A rare single-varietal Graciano from one of Rioja's most respected producers, showcasing this traditional blending grape in its pure form. Las Seis Alhajas ('The Six Jewels') represents Conde Valdemar's commitment to highlighting indigenous Spanish varietals, capturing Graciano's characteristic deep color, aromatic intensity, and exceptional aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with profound depth characteristic of quality Graciano. The nose bursts with ripe black cherry, wild blackberry, and red plum, accented by distinctive violet and iris flower notes. Layers of sweet spice including cinnamon, clove, and star anise emerge alongside Mediterranean scrub herbs. Subtle nuances of vanilla, cedar, and dark chocolate from oak aging integrate seamlessly, while hints of graphite and iron add mineral intrigue.","finish":"Long and powerful, showcasing Graciano's signature intensity and persistence. Dark fruit flavors linger with remarkable clarity, accompanied by spice, mineral notes, and firm but refined tannins. The finish reveals the variety's exceptional structure and aging capability, leaving a lasting impression of depth and complexity.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with remarkable structure and concentration. The palate delivers intense dark fruit flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis, complemented by savory notes of black olive, dried herbs, and tobacco. Graciano's naturally high acidity provides excellent freshness and tension, balancing the ripe fruit character with vibrant energy. Firm, fine-grained tannins contribute substantial aging potential while remaining elegant and well-integrated. The wine shows impressive depth and persistence across the palate."}

records.name: Crosarola Superiore 2022
records.description: A Valpolicella Superiore from the esteemed Crosarola estate in the Veneto, representing traditional Italian winemaking with extended aging for enhanced complexity. This wine showcases the classic Corvina-based blend with the depth and structure that "Superiore" designation requires.
records.region: Valpolicella Classico Superiore DOC, Veneto, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet displays elegant balsamic notes of incense and violet candies, creating an aromatic and perfumed impression. Layers unfold to reveal blond tobacco, supple leather, and glazed notes, while dried fruit including sultanas and candied orange peel add sweetness. Black pepper and warming spices complete the complex aromatic profile, with hints of black tea, plum, and blueberry adding depth.","finish":"Nice persistence with a velvet-like conclusion that lingers gently. The finish demonstrates impressive length, with the spice notes and dried fruit character echoing long after the wine is swallowed.","palate":"Soft and warm on entry, the wine offers great enveloping impact with velvety texture coating the palate. Despite the richness, freshness remains present throughout, providing balance and preventing the wine from becoming heavy. Concentrated cassis and vanilla flavors emerge from the barrel aging, complemented by the bright fruit of regular Valpolicella. The clayey limestone soils contribute to the wine's mineral backbone and silky tannin structure."}

records.name: Darms Lane Fortune 1621 Chardonnay 2023
records.description: Darms Lane Fortune 1621 Chardonnay 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.

records.name: Conde Valdemar Reserva 2017
records.description: A classic Rioja Reserva from the esteemed Conde Valdemar estate, representing traditional Spanish winemaking at its finest. The 2017 vintage was exceptional in Rioja, producing wines of great balance and aging potential. This wine has undergone extended aging in oak and bottle before release, developing complex tertiary characteristics.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with possible Garnacha, Graciano, and/or Mazuelo
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet displays mature aromas of dried cherry, cranberry, and strawberry preserves, interwoven with complex notes of vanilla, cedar, and cigar box from extended oak aging. Classic Rioja characteristics emerge with scents of leather, tobacco, coconut, and dill. Subtle hints of dried orange peel, baking spices, and earthy mushroom add layers of complexity. The aromatic profile shows the elegant integration that comes from proper bottle age.","finish":"The finish is elegant and persistent, with lingering notes of dried cherry, vanilla, and earthy spice. Fine-grained tannins provide gentle grip, while the acidity leaves the palate refreshed. Hints of cedar, tobacco, and orange peel linger, showcasing classic Rioja Reserva character and excellent aging potential.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky, well-integrated tannins that have softened beautifully with age. Flavors of tart red cherry, pomegranate, and dried fig dominate, complemented by savory notes of leather, earth, and dried herbs. American oak influence is evident but balanced, contributing vanilla, coconut, and sweet spice without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows excellent acidity that keeps it fresh despite its maturity. A touch of orange zest and tea leaf adds brightness and complexity."}

records.name: Galea Mulled Wine NV
records.description: A ready-to-serve mulled wine that captures the warming comfort of traditional European winter beverages. Galea's non-vintage blend combines quality red wine with aromatic spices, offering the convenience of pre-spiced mulled wine without sacrificing the authentic flavor that makes this beverage a cold-weather favorite across cultures.
records.varietal: Red wine base with traditional mulling spices (cinnamon, cloves, star anise, citrus)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inviting aromas of warm baking spices dominate the bouquet—cinnamon bark, whole cloves, star anise, and nutmeg create an immediately comforting impression. The red wine base provides structure with notes of dark cherry and plum, while bright citrus peel (orange and lemon) adds freshness to balance the spice. Hints of vanilla, caramelized sugar, and subtle ginger round out the aromatic profile. The nose evokes cozy winter evenings and holiday celebrations, with complex spice layers that promise warmth and comfort.","finish":"Warm and lingering with persistent spice notes and gentle fruit sweetness. The finish leaves a comforting impression of cinnamon and orange peel, with the wine's warmth carrying through. Clean conclusion with balanced sweetness that invites another warming sip.","palate":"Rich and warming with a perfect balance of fruit, spice, and subtle sweetness. The red wine foundation delivers flavors of dark berries and dried fruit, while the spice blend adds layers of cinnamon, clove, and cardamom. Orange and lemon notes brighten the palate, preventing the wine from becoming heavy or cloying. Medium-bodied with smooth texture and gentle warming from the spice-infused wine. Natural sweetness is well-balanced, neither too dry nor overly sweet. When gently heated, the aromatics intensify and the warming spices create a comforting, soothing experience perfect for cold weather."}

records.name: Fledge and Co Elgin Chardonnay 2017
records.description: From the cool-climate Elgin Valley in South Africa, this Chardonnay showcases the region's ability to produce elegant, mineral-driven white wines. Fledge and Co employs thoughtful winemaking techniques to highlight the terroir while creating a wine with both freshness and complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is refined and complex, opening with citrus blossom, green apple, and ripe pear. Stone fruit notes of white peach and nectarine add richness, while undertones of flint and wet stone provide minerality. Subtle oak influence brings hints of toasted hazelnut, butter, and a whisper of vanilla. Fresh herbs and a touch of honeysuckle add brightness and aromatic lift.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with citrus and stone fruit flavors lingering alongside mineral notes. A subtle creaminess from lees contact provides texture, while bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion. Hints of crushed stone and white flowers emerge on the aftertaste.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent texture and creamy mouthfeel, likely from partial malolactic fermentation and lees stirring. The palate offers layers of lemon curd, Granny Smith apple, and yellow plum, balanced by vibrant acidity that provides structure and length. Subtle oak integration contributes notes of brioche and toasted almonds without overwhelming the fruit. A saline minerality runs through the wine, adding complexity and a sense of place. The texture is rich but not heavy, with a fine balance between fruit concentration and refreshing acidity."}

records.description: Frascole Toscana Rosso Bitornino 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Hendry Block 28 Zinfandel 2019
records.description: This flagship Zinfandel from Hendry Ranch represents the pinnacle of Napa Valley Zinfandel production. Block 28 was planted in 1998 with cuttings from the legendary Brandlin Vineyard on Mount Veeder, and the 2019 vintage showcases the exceptional quality of this outstanding growing season with remarkable concentration and balance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is powerfully aromatic with vivid, jammy blackberry and black raspberry leading the charge. Floral scents of violet and lavender add elegance, while pronounced black pepper, wild sage, and dried herbs contribute a rustic authenticity. Undertones of wood smoke, vanilla, and baking spice from oak aging add layers of complexity without overwhelming the pure fruit expression. The aromatic profile is both intense and refined.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit flavors, black pepper spice, and hints of wood smoke. An underlying acidity ensures freshness throughout, while the tannins provide a pleasant grip that invites food pairing.","palate":"Full-bodied and fruit-forward on the palate, this Zinfandel delivers concentrated flavors of jammy blackberry, black cherry, and ripe plum. The wine's underlying tension and well-structured acidity keep everything lifted and balanced despite the richness, preventing it from becoming heavy or cloying. Notes of black pepper, sage, and smoky oak weave through the fruit, adding rustic complexity and depth. The tannins are firm yet well-integrated, providing excellent structure for aging. Medium to full body with impressive length and persistence."}

records.name: Gondola Pinot Grigio Kosher (MD & DC)
records.description: A kosher-certified Pinot Grigio offering crisp, refreshing character while meeting strict kashrut requirements. This wine provides accessible enjoyment for everyday drinking and religious observance, showcasing the varietal's characteristic freshness and food-friendly nature.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Clean and straightforward, the nose presents bright aromas of green apple, Asian pear, and citrus blossom. Notes of white peach and honeydew melon add subtle sweetness, while hints of lemon zest and crushed stones provide freshness. A delicate floral quality of acacia flower rounds out the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and brisk, with lingering citrus notes and a slight mineral edge. The wine concludes with refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate, making it ideal for pairing with a wide range of kosher cuisine.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with crisp acidity, the palate delivers refreshing flavors of tart green apple, lime, and white grapefruit. A subtle almond note adds interest to the mid-palate, while the wine's clean, uncomplicated fruit expression makes it highly versatile with food. The texture is smooth without being weighty, maintaining freshness and drinkability throughout."}

records.name: Giustini Costiero Rose 2024
records.description: A fresh and vibrant rosé from the Giustini estate, this 2024 vintage captures the essence of Italian coastal winemaking. Costiero (meaning 'coastal') reflects the Mediterranean influence on this wine's bright, refreshing character.
records.varietal: Montepulciano (likely primary grape for Italian rosé)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate and inviting, the nose offers fresh strawberry, wild raspberry, and watermelon alongside rose petals and orange blossom. Subtle herbal notes of fresh basil and mint add complexity, while a hint of sea breeze salinity reflects its coastal origins. White peach and nectarine provide stone fruit accents, creating an aromatic profile that's both refreshing and nuanced.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing, with lingering red berry flavors and bright acidity. A subtle mineral note and hint of citrus provide a crisp, mouth-watering conclusion. The wine leaves the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with crisp, refreshing acidity that energizes the palate. Flavors of red berries—strawberry, raspberry, and cranberry—dominate, complemented by subtle notes of citrus zest and white peach. The texture is clean and bright with a slight mineral quality that adds depth. A delicate saline note enhances the wine's food-friendly nature and reinforces its coastal character. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit, acidity, and subtle savory elements, making it incredibly versatile and easy to drink."}

records.name: Hertelendy Audere 2018
records.description: A premium Hungarian red blend from the Villány region, Audere represents the bold ambition of Hertelendy Estate. This 2018 vintage showcases the potential of Hungary's warmest wine region through a sophisticated blend of international varietals aged in French oak.
records.varietal: Bordeaux-style blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated black cherry and cassis, layered with notes of dark chocolate and espresso. Subtle hints of cedar and vanilla from oak aging mingle with dried Mediterranean herbs and a touch of graphite. As the wine breathes, violet and blackberry preserves emerge, adding complexity and depth to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to cedar, dark chocolate, and a hint of Mediterranean scrub. Firm but polished tannins provide structure for aging while maintaining approachability. The wine concludes with subtle mineral notes and lingering spice.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured, the palate delivers ripe black plum and blackcurrant flavors supported by fine-grained tannins. Mid-palate weight is impressive, with layers of dark fruit complemented by notes of tobacco leaf, black pepper, and toasted oak. The wine shows excellent structure with balanced acidity that provides freshness despite its concentration. Integrated oak brings mocha and spice notes that enhance rather than dominate the fruit."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Barolo Gallinotto 2020
records.description: An exceptional Barolo from the renowned Gallinotto vineyard in La Morra, earning outstanding scores: 94 Wine Advocate, 94 Vinous, 93 Jeb Dunnuck, 92 James Suckling, and 91 Wine Spectator. This wine represents a modern, elegant style focused on freshness and precision rather than power, showcasing the finesse possible in great Barolo.
records.region: Barolo DOCG, Berri vineyard in La Morra, Piedmont, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is fascinating and intriguing with hints of dark berries - particularly pomegranate and wild cherry - intermingled with eucalyptus and menthol notes. Orange peel, rose petals, and sour cherries create a complex bouquet, while subtle balsamic notes add depth. Cinnamon candy and rose bud aromatics speak to the wine's elegance. As the wine evolves, notes of chocolate, hazelnuts, and sweet spice emerge, layered with licorice and subtle wood notes from French oak aging.","finish":"The finish is persistent and full-bodied with a distinctive citrus aftertaste that adds freshness. Fine-grained, chalky tannins provide gentle structure, while the wine's elegant, nutty character lingers beautifully. This is a tasty, refined conclusion that invites contemplation.","palate":"Super-juicy and vibrant on the palate with a clean style focused on freshness and elegance. Crisp acidity provides backbone to the concentrated dark fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and red currant. The wine is creamy and inviting with full body yet maintains lightness through its chalky, fine-grained tannins. Flavors evolve to reveal hazelnut, cocoa, and subtle tobacco, with the citrus notes from the nose translating to a bright, lifted quality on the palate. The texture is silky and refined, showing excellent integration of all components."}

records.name: Oleandri Napa Cabernet Franc 2020
records.description: A sophisticated single-vineyard Cabernet Franc from the prestigious Stagecoach Vineyard in Napa Valley. This wine exemplifies the aromatic elegance and structural finesse that Cabernet Franc achieves in Napa's ideal climate and soils. The 2020 vintage benefited from warm days, cool nights, and early season rain, producing wines with bright acidity, forward tannins, and deep, rich color—conditions that allowed this varietal to express its full potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is aromatic and broad, immediately announcing the wine's quality with lush notes of ripe plum and dark fruits. Fresh herbal character provides varietal typicity—sage, thyme, and subtle green herbs that distinguish Cabernet Franc from its Bordeaux cousins. Spice notes of cocoa and baking spices add complexity and depth, while black cherry aromatics provide classic red fruit appeal. The aromatic profile shows remarkable purity and intensity, with the warm 2020 vintage delivering ripe fruit character balanced by the cool nights that preserved freshness. There's an elegant floral note of violet weaving through the fruit and herb layers, adding to the wine's sophisticated aromatic tapestry.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-tinged, with ripe black fruit flavors extending well beyond the swallow. The forward tannins provide grip and structure, framing the fruit without overwhelming it. Notes of cocoa, herbs, and subtle oak spice emerge in the conclusion, while the bright acidity maintains freshness through the lengthy finish. There's a dusty, mineral quality that speaks to the Stagecoach Vineyard's mountain terroir, adding complexity and depth. The wine's exuberant character continues through the finish, wearing its heart on its sleeve while maintaining sophistication and balance.","palate":"The palate is plush and velvet-textured, delivering lush fruit character with remarkable structural integration. Black cherry and plum flavors dominate, supported by notes of dark raspberry and boysenberry that add layers of complexity. The spice character from the nose continues—cocoa, mocha, and sandalwood provide depth without overwhelming the wine's fundamental fruit purity. Bright acidity from the vintage keeps the wine lively and balanced despite its richness, while the tannins are forward yet refined, providing structure without astringency. The wine shows the mouth-quenching acidity and mineral undertones typical of Rutherford terroir, with hints of graphite and dusty earth adding savory complexity. This is powerfully structured yet precisely balanced, demonstrating why Napa Valley has emerged as an ideal region for Cabernet Franc."}

records.name: Orchard Lane Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: An estate-grown Pinot Noir from Marlborough's cool climate vineyards, crafted to showcase elegance and varietal purity. This wine represents the New Zealand approach to Pinot Noir - fruit-forward yet refined, with balanced structure and accessible charm.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a delicate yet expressive combination of red berry fruits - ripe raspberry, red cherry, and wild strawberry - intermingled with subtle plum notes. Gentle spice accents emerge, including hints of cinnamon and clove, while delicate floral undertones add lift and complexity. The aromatic profile is pure and clean, showcasing classic cool-climate Pinot Noir character without heavy oak influence. As the wine opens, subtle earthy notes and hints of dried herbs appear, adding dimension.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and gentle tannins. The wine concludes with elegance, leaving pleasant acidity and a touch of savory complexity that invites food pairing or another sip.","palate":"Well-balanced and elegant on the palate, with supple, lightly balanced tannins that provide structure without weight. The red berry fruit core continues from the nose - bright cherry, raspberry, and plum dominate with excellent freshness and purity. The wine shows lovely acid balance that keeps everything vibrant and food-friendly, while the tannins are fine-grained and silky rather than grippy. Medium body with surprising depth, the wine delivers complexity through subtle spice layers and a hint of forest floor earthiness. The overall impression is one of refinement and restraint."}

records.name: Vizar Especial Tempranillo/Syrah 2010
records.description: A mature Spanish blend combining the traditional character of Tempranillo with the bold structure of Syrah. The 2010 vintage has had fifteen years of aging, developing complex tertiary characteristics and integrated tannins. This wine represents an interesting fusion of Spanish tradition and international varietals.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals evolved aromas of dried cherry, prune, and fig, complemented by savory notes of leather saddle, tobacco leaf, and forest floor. Syrah contributes lingering hints of black olive, cured meat, and cracked black pepper, while Tempranillo adds dried strawberry and orange peel. Extended bottle age has developed complex tertiary notes of balsamic, dried herbs, mushroom, and cedar. A subtle earthiness and mineral quality add depth, suggesting the wine has aged gracefully.","finish":"The finish is long and contemplative, with lingering notes of dried fruit, tobacco, and earthy spice. Soft tannins and persistent acidity keep the wine balanced, while subtle mineral notes add complexity. The length and integration suggest the wine has reached its drinking window and should be enjoyed soon.","palate":"Medium-bodied with softened, well-integrated tannins that have mellowed beautifully over time. Flavors of dried red fruit, black tea, and balsamic reduction dominate, with underlying notes of leather, earth, and roasted coffee. The Syrah component adds structure and a savory, meaty quality, while Tempranillo provides elegance and bright acidity. Oak influence has integrated completely, contributing subtle vanilla and spice. The wine shows excellent development with a harmonious balance between fruit, tannin, and acid."}

records.name: Prima Pave Rose Mini Dry   200 ml
records.description: A kosher dry rosé wine offered in a convenient 200ml single-serving format, perfect for individual enjoyment or paired meals. Prima produces approachable kosher wines that maintain quality standards while serving the observant Jewish community's needs for certified wines suitable for all occasions.
records.varietal: Unknown blend (likely includes Grenache, Syrah, or other rosé-friendly varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers delicate aromas of fresh strawberry, watermelon, and white peach, typical of dry rosé styling. Light floral notes of rose hip and orange blossom add aromatic lift, while subtle hints of pink grapefruit and raspberry provide citrus-berry complexity. A whisper of fresh herbs, perhaps basil or tarragon, adds an interesting savory dimension.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red berry notes and a crisp, dry close. Subtle citrus zest flavors appear at the end, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food.","palate":"On the palate, this dry rosé presents crisp, refreshing fruit flavors centered on red berries—particularly wild strawberry and cranberry—with supporting notes of pink grapefruit and white cherry. The wine is light-bodied with vibrant acidity that creates a mouthwatering effect, while the dry finish ensures the wine remains food-friendly and not cloying. A subtle minerality runs through the mid-palate, adding texture and interest."}

records.name: Well Crafted Vin de France Organic Rose Keg SAMPLE NV
records.description: An organic French rosé designed for keg service, representing a modern approach to wine distribution and sustainability. The non-vintage designation allows for consistent flavor profiling across multiple harvests. This wine combines traditional French rosé character with contemporary packaging innovation suitable for hospitality venues.
records.varietal: Unknown blend (likely traditional rosé varietals such as Grenache, Cinsault, or Syrah)
records.region: Vin de France (various regions in France)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers delicate aromas of fresh strawberry, raspberry, and white peach, with subtle floral notes of rose petals and orange blossom. Light citrus notes of pink grapefruit and lemon zest add brightness. A hint of wet stone minerality and fresh herbs provides complexity. The aromatic profile is clean and inviting, designed to appeal to a broad range of palates while maintaining authentic rosé character.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering berry fruit and citrus notes. Refreshing acidity leaves the palate crisp and ready for the next sip. A subtle mineral quality extends the finish, while the light body ensures versatility with diverse foods and occasions.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with crisp acidity and a refreshing, clean palate. Flavors of red berries, watermelon, and citrus dominate, with undertones of white peach and melon. The wine shows good balance with bright acidity offsetting the subtle fruit sweetness. A mineral backbone adds structure and interest. The mouthfeel is smooth and accessible, with no rough edges—ideal for by-the-glass service. The organic certification ensures purity of flavor without chemical interference."}

records.name: Collina San Ponzio Nebbiolo D Alba 2018
records.description: A classical expression of Nebbiolo from Alba, crafted by a producer renowned for their exceptional Barolo wines. This wine showcases the elegance and complexity that makes Nebbiolo one of Italy's most treasured varieties, offering layers of red fruit, floral notes, and earthy undertones.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with captivating aromas of rose petal and violet, characteristic hallmarks of Nebbiolo, interwoven with notes of chopped herbs and freshly tilled soil. As the wine breathes, subtle hints of wild mixed berries emerge alongside delicate shiitake mushroom notes, creating an earthy yet floral bouquet that speaks to the terroir of Alba.","finish":"The finish is long and layered, marked by taut tannins and a savory quality that lingers. Subtle notes of tar and dried herbs emerge on the retronasal, a classic signature of well-crafted Nebbiolo that promises excellent aging potential through 2030.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers crushed raspberry and ripe black cherry flavors, accented by star anise and tobacco leaf. The texture is elegantly structured with youthfully austere but polished tannins that provide backbone without overwhelming the fruit. Fresh acidity brings energy and liveliness to the mid-palate, while savory elements of licorice and black pepper add complexity and depth."}

records.name: Rigo Barbera 2017
records.description: A classic Barbera from Piedmont crafted in the exceptional 2017 vintage, known for producing Barberas with incredible exuberance and character. This wine showcases the variety's signature high acidity and low tannins, delivering concentrated dark fruit and the vibrant character that hot vintages bring to this versatile Italian grape.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with intense aromatics of fresh red cherries and blackberries, the hallmark of young Barbera. Ripe dark berry compote mingles with notes of black raspberry and plum, while subtle hints of violet and rose petal add floral complexity. Spicy notes ranging from white pepper to licorice emerge with aeration, characteristic of the hot 2017 vintage. Earthy undertones and a touch of leather add depth.","finish":"The finish is long and vibrant with persistent red and black fruit flavors. Bright acidity keeps the wine lively and food-friendly, while subtle spice notes linger pleasantly.","palate":"Deeply colored and full-bodied, the palate delivers succulent fruit flavors including cherry, raspberry, blackberry and plum. The 2017 vintage's hot, dry growing season has produced exceptional concentration and exuberance. High levels of natural acidity - Barbera's signature characteristic - provide freshness and structure despite the ripe fruit, while low tannins create a smooth, approachable texture. Mid-palate shows layers of dark chocolate and espresso, with continued spicy notes of black pepper and anise. The wine is juicy and fruit-forward with excellent balance."}

records.name: Martino Cabernet Franc 2019
records.description: An elegant Cabernet Franc from the 2019 vintage that showcases the variety's characteristic finesse and aromatic complexity. This wine offers a lighter, more refined alternative to Cabernet Sauvignon with bright red fruit, subtle herbaceous notes, and the smooth tannin structure that defines quality Cabernet Franc.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with vibrant aromas of raspberry and red currant, hallmarks of well-made Cabernet Franc. Blackcurrant and violet notes add depth and floral elegance, while the variety's distinctive herbaceous character emerges with subtle hints of green bell pepper and fresh tobacco leaf. These vegetal notes provide complexity without dominating the fruit expression. Secondary aromas of graphite and cedar suggest quality oak aging, while hints of rose petals and dried herbs add refinement and lift to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately persistent with lingering red fruit and subtle herbal notes. The variety's slightly lighter tannin structure ensures a refined, elegant conclusion. Hints of violet and graphite emerge on the aftertaste, adding complexity and interest.","palate":"Medium-bodied with the smooth, refined tannin structure that distinguishes Cabernet Franc from its Cabernet Sauvignon cousin. The palate reveals bright flavors of raspberry, red cherry, and strawberry with excellent freshness and purity. Subtle blackcurrant notes add depth while maintaining the wine's elegant, fruit-forward character. The characteristic green, vegetal strike is present but balanced—adding interest and complexity without overwhelming the fruit. Integrated oak influence contributes subtle spice and structure. The wine's balanced acidity and moderate alcohol create a harmonious, food-friendly profile."}

records.name: Shabo Reserve Pinot Grigio 2022
records.description: A Ukrainian white wine from the historic Shabo winery in the Odessa region, representing wines of resilience from one of Ukraine's premier producers. This Reserve bottling showcases the potential of Eastern European viticulture with careful fruit selection and modern winemaking.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is delicate yet inviting with prominent notes of ripe white peach and Anjou pear. Bright citrus elements of lemon zest add freshness, while gentle acacia flower tones contribute subtle floral character. A hint of almond and white pepper spice adds complexity, creating a fruit-forward yet nuanced aromatic profile that speaks to the wine's quality Reserve designation.","finish":"The finish is long-lasting and clean, featuring continued citrus and orchard fruit notes. A gentle mineral quality provides structure and interest, while the fresh acidity ensures a crisp, food-friendly conclusion. Subtle hints of white flowers and almond linger delicately.","palate":"Light straw in color, the wine presents a rounded and fresh palate that balances fruit purity with textural interest. Flavors of white peach, pear, and crisp green apple dominate, supported by vibrant acidity that keeps the wine bright and lively. Subtle almond notes add depth without weight, while a touch of minerality reflects the Odessa terroir. The mouthfeel is clean and refreshing with good persistence of fruit flavors."}

records.name: Thelema "Vin de Hel" Muscat Late Harvest 2023  375 ml
records.description: Thelema's signature dessert wine from Stellenbosch, South Africa, crafted from Muscat grapes left to concentrate on the vine. "Vin de Hel" (Wine of Hel, named after the founder's wife) represents one of South Africa's most acclaimed sweet wines, combining old-world techniques with new-world fruit intensity in a half-bottle format perfect for sharing.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic with classic Muscat perfume: fresh rose petals, orange blossom water, and lychee dominate the nose. Tropical notes of passion fruit, ripe mango, and papaya intermingle with candied ginger and Turkish delight. The wine's youth is evident in vibrant floral top notes, while deeper scents of honey, marmalade, and dried apricot hint at its concentrated sweetness. A suggestion of spice—cardamom and white pepper—adds exotic intrigue.","finish":"Long and luxurious with persistent floral notes of rose water and honeysuckle. The sweetness slowly fades to reveal hints of crystallized ginger and orange zest, while bright acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites another taste.","palate":"Rich and unctuous yet lifted by surprising acidity, the palate delivers intense flavors of nectarine, tangerine, and golden raisin bathed in acacia honey. The Muscat's inherent spiciness comes through with ginger, coriander seed, and a hint of saffron, creating complexity beyond simple sweetness. Texture is silky and mouth-coating but never heavy, with the wine's freshness preventing any cloying sensation. Flavors of candied citrus peel, apricot jam, and crème brûlée build toward the finish, supported by elegant sweetness that never overwhelms."}

records.name: Alella Ivori Garnatxa Syrah 2019
records.description: A Mediterranean red blend from Catalonia's coastal DO Alella, combining Grenache and Syrah with Cabernet Sauvignon. Aged fourteen months in French oak, this wine represents outstanding value from one of Spain's smallest and most historic wine regions, located just north of Barcelona.
records.varietal: Grenache (Garnatxa), Syrah, and Cabernet Sauvignon blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated dark fruit aromatics - ripe blackberry, black cherry, and plum - characteristic of warm-climate Grenache and Syrah. Spicy notes emerge with nuances of black pepper, dried herbs, and garrigue reflecting the Mediterranean terroir. The oak aging contributes subtle vanilla, toast, and sweet spice without overwhelming the fruit. Hints of lavender and wild herbs add complexity and sense of place, while a touch of leather and earth provides depth as the wine opens.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit, integrated oak spice, and fine-grained tannins. Hints of Mediterranean herbs and a touch of minerality linger, while the wine's structure suggests moderate aging potential. The conclusion is warm and generous yet refined.","palate":"On the palate, this blend showcases impressive concentration and structure balanced by Mediterranean warmth and generosity. The Grenache provides ripe red berry fruit and soft, approachable tannins, while Syrah adds dark fruit intensity, spicy backbone, and structural grip. Cabernet Sauvignon contributes cassis notes and firm tannic architecture. The wine shows excellent integration of fruit, oak, and tannin, with flavors of blackberry, plum, and dark cherry enriched by notes of cocoa, vanilla, and sweet spice from the barrel aging. Medium to full body with balanced acidity keeps the wine from feeling heavy despite its richness."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Cepas Viejas 2021
records.description: Crafted from old vines planted in the late 1970s in the prestigious parcels of Los Paletones and El Plantizo in Cenicero, this exceptional Tempranillo represents the pinnacle of varietal expression. The vines, growing at 470 meters altitude, produce concentrated fruit that yields a wine of remarkable depth and complexity.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo from vines planted in the late 1970s
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic and dynamic on the nose, opening with powerful aromas of cherries, raspberries, blackberries, and black plum. Floral notes of violet interweave with cacao, smoke, and sandalwood, while clove, graphite, leaf litter, and balsamic notes add layers of complexity. The short time in barrel contributes subtle toffee and spice nuances that integrate beautifully with the fruit.","finish":"Very long spiced and chocolatey retronasal finish with impressive structure and length. The finish lingers with notes of dark chocolate, dried tobacco, and sweet spices, leaving a sophisticated and memorable impression.","palate":"Fresh and fleshy on the palate with excellent volume and an enveloping fruity character. An explosion of cherries, strawberries, blackcurrant, and raspberries dominates the mid-palate, showing the wine's meaty, flavorful structure. The texture is complex and layered, with maximum varietal expression of Tempranillo shining through. Subtle spiced nuances of nutmeg, black pepper, and licorice emerge on the finish."}

records.name: Wonderment Wines Dr. Stans Pinot Noir 2018
records.description: A compelling Pinot Noir from Wonderment's portfolio, this Dr. Stans bottling showcases the varietal's elegant complexity and site-specific character. The wine balances classic Pinot Noir hallmarks—silky texture, aromatic complexity, and bright acidity—with distinctive personality that sets it apart from mass-produced alternatives.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with classic Pinot Noir aromatics of red cherry, cranberry, and wild strawberry, layered with notes of dried rose petals, forest floor, and subtle baking spices. Secondary aromas of sandalwood, black tea, and a touch of truffle add sophistication, while hints of orange peel and cinnamon from oak aging provide warmth. As the wine evolves, earthy notes of mushroom and autumn leaves emerge, adding tertiary complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with persistent red fruit notes supported by fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Lingering flavors of cherry compote, exotic spices, and earthy minerality fade gracefully, while a subtle note of toast and vanilla from oak integration adds complexity. The wine's structure suggests it has developed nicely and will continue to evolve beautifully.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky, refined tannins, the palate delivers elegant red fruit flavors centered on Bing cherry, raspberry, and red currant. The wine shows exceptional balance, with bright acidity providing structure while layers of flavor unfold across the palate. Notes of pomegranate, rhubarb, and cranberry are complemented by savory elements of dried herbs, tea leaf, and subtle umami. Mid-palate richness reveals hints of cola, cardamom, and a distinctive mineral quality that speaks to site character."}

records.name: ZaHa Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
records.description: A distinctive Cabernet Sauvignon from the 2018 vintage, ZaHa showcases the modern California approach to this noble varietal. This wine balances power with elegance, offering layered complexity that rewards both immediate enjoyment and careful cellaring.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated blackcurrant and ripe blackberry, interwoven with notes of crushed violets and graphite. As the wine breathes, secondary aromas of toasted cedar, vanilla bean, and dark chocolate emerge from quality oak aging. Subtle hints of dried sage and black olive add Mediterranean complexity to the bouquet.","finish":"The finish is persistent and elegant, stretching beyond 45 seconds with lingering notes of dark fruit, mocha, and subtle tobacco leaf. Polished tannins provide structure while allowing the fruit to shine through, suggesting excellent aging potential over the next 8-12 years.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured, the palate delivers intense dark fruit flavors of cassis, black plum, and boysenberry. The mid-palate shows excellent density with fine-grained tannins providing framework without heaviness. Integrated oak contributes notes of espresso, cocoa nibs, and sweet baking spices. The wine maintains remarkable balance with its alcohol, fruit concentration, and acidity working in harmony."}

records.name: Alella Marfil Sec 2017
records.description: A distinctive white wine from the historic Alella DO cooperative near Barcelona, carrying the iconic Marfil (Ivory) brand name that has captivated Catalonia since the 1920s. Founded in 1906, Alella Vinícola produces this wine from Pansa Blanca (the local name for Xarel-lo), showcasing the unique terroir of this small Mediterranean coastal wine region just north of Barcelona.
records.region: Alella DO, Catalonia, Spain (Mediterranean coast north of Barcelona)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate and aromatic with notes of white flowers—acacia and orange blossom—characteristic of Pansa Blanca/Xarel-lo. The nose reveals fresh citrus notes of lemon zest and grapefruit, supported by green apple and white peach. Subtle mineral undertones reflect the Mediterranean coastal terroir, while hints of almond and fennel add complexity. The aromatic profile shows freshness despite the wine's age, with a slight oxidative note of blanched almond that adds interest without detracting from the wine's vitality.","finish":"Medium-length finish with lingering citrus notes and a characteristic salty minerality that calls for seafood. The wine concludes with refreshing acidity and subtle almond notes, leaving a clean, dry impression. The Mediterranean influence persists through the finish with that distinctive saline quality and hint of sea breeze.","palate":"Medium-bodied with crisp acidity that defines Alella whites, though the 2017 vintage shows more texture and depth than younger examples. The palate delivers flavors of citrus—lemon and grapefruit—alongside white orchard fruits and a distinctive saline quality that speaks to the wine's proximity to the Mediterranean Sea. The wine shows characteristic unctuous texture with floral and white fruit flavors, maintaining freshness through good acidity. A note of pleasant bitterness on the mid-palate, typical of Xarel-lo, adds complexity and food-friendliness. The style is notably dry (Sec) with minimal residual sugar, allowing the variety's natural characteristics to express themselves fully."}

records.name: Alella Mayla 2022
records.description: Alella Vinícola's Mayla is a distinctive sparkling rosé crafted using the ancestral method (méthode ancestrale) from Syrah grapes grown in the small, coastal D.O. Alella region near Barcelona. This organic wine represents a modern interpretation of traditional winemaking, where fermentation continues naturally in the bottle without added yeasts or sugars, creating gentle effervescence and authentic fruit expression.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays a vibrant pink hue with fine, persistent bubbles. The nose opens with fresh red berry aromatics, featuring wild strawberry and raspberry. Delicate floral notes of rose petals emerge, characteristic of Syrah's aromatic profile. Subtle herbal hints and a touch of minerality from the coastal terroir add complexity. The ancestral method preserves the wine's natural fruit purity, creating an honest, unmanipulated aromatic expression.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit notes and a hint of pleasant bitterness that adds complexity. The gentle bubbles persist through the finish, leaving the palate invigorated. A subtle mineral quality emerges at the end, reflecting the gravelly soils and coastal influence of the Alella region.","palate":"Fresh and very tasty with a natural sparkling point that creates gentle effervescence rather than aggressive bubbles. The palate showcases bright red fruit flavors of strawberry, cherry, and cranberry with excellent natural acidity that keeps the wine lively and refreshing. A subtle yeasty character from aging on fine lees adds texture and depth without heaviness. The organic viticulture shines through in the wine's pure, clean fruit expression. Light-bodied and energetic, the wine maintains balance between fruit sweetness and crisp acidity."}

records.name: Dolce Vita Mojito
records.description: An innovative alcohol-free sparkling beverage that captures the essence of a classic Mojito cocktail. Part of the Dolce Vita Equivocado line, this drink is named 'Equivocado' (Spanish for 'mistaken') because they 'forgot' the alcohol, yet it delivers the rich, refreshing taste of a real cocktail crafted according to recipes by an Italian barman.
records.varietal: Grape-based non-alcoholic beverage with natural lime and mint flavoring
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is dominated by fresh, vibrant aromatics of lime zest and fresh mint leaves, reminiscent of a perfectly muddled Mojito. Subtle rum-like aromas add depth and authenticity, while underlying grape fruitiness provides a foundation that distinguishes this from a standard cocktail. The bouquet is invigorating and immediately transports you to a sun-drenched terrace.","finish":"The finish is refreshing and clean, leaving pleasant mint and citrus notes that linger gently. Unlike alcoholic cocktails, there's no burn or heat, just a satisfying, thirst-quenching conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"Harmonious and refreshing on the palate, the wine displays a balanced interplay between bright lime acidity and cooling mint freshness. The grape base adds body and texture, creating a more complex mouthfeel than traditional cocktails. The flavor profile is crisp and clean, with the lime and mint components complementing rather than overwhelming the subtle fruit character beneath."}

records.name: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2009
records.description: A mature expression of Napa Valley's powerhouse varietal, this 2009 Petite Sirah has developed beautiful complexity with over a decade of aging. Aratas sources from premium Napa vineyards to craft concentrated, age-worthy wines that showcase the variety's intensity and structure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The evolved bouquet reveals layers of dried black plum, fig, and blackberry leather, testament to the wine's maturity. Secondary aromas of cedar cigar box, forest floor, and dried herbs intermingle with hints of dark chocolate and espresso. Subtle notes of balsamic, dried rose petals, and graphite add further complexity to this multifaceted aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is remarkably persistent for a wine of this age, with layers of dark fruit, leather, and tobacco slowly fading into notes of dried sage and charred oak. The tannins, though still present, are fully integrated, creating a smooth, satisfying conclusion that lingers for minutes.","palate":"Still remarkably dense and powerful, the palate shows concentrated flavors of black cherry compote, blackberry reduction, and prune, softened by age into a seamless texture. The wine's signature robust tannins have mellowed into a supple, velvety structure that coats the mouth. Savory elements of black olive tapenade, roasted coffee bean, and dark cocoa powder provide depth, while sustained acidity maintains freshness despite the wine's age."}

records.name: Armstrong Family Winery Syrah 2019
records.description: Armstrong Family Winery, based in Walla Walla, Washington, crafts exceptional Syrah that showcases the distinctive terroir of Washington State's premier wine regions. Drawing on fruit from select vineyards, their Syrah demonstrates the variety's ability to produce wines of elegance and complexity in Washington's continental climate, balancing power with finesse.
records.region: Washington State (likely Walla Walla Valley or Horse Heaven Hills)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine opens with enticing aromatics of dark berry fruits, featuring prominent boysenberry, blueberry, and ripe raspberry. Warm baking spices emerge, including cinnamon, clove, and black pepper, adding complexity and intrigue. A distinctive hint of Mediterranean olive provides savory depth, while subtle notes of cured meat and smoked bacon from oak aging create additional layers. Floral hints of violet appear delicately in the background, characteristic of quality Syrah.","finish":"The finish reveals subtle, rich cherry notes that pick up warm baking spice and a hint of menthol, creating a refreshing lift. Cedar and tobacco flavors persist, adding sophistication to the conclusion. The tannins are present but refined, suggesting good aging potential while remaining approachable now. The wine's length is impressive, with flavors evolving and extending well beyond the swallow.","palate":"On the palate, the wine delivers rich, concentrated dark fruit flavors with boysenberry and blackberry at the core. Black cherry and black currant add depth, while the baking spice character from the nose carries through beautifully. Notes of cedar and tobacco emerge mid-palate, evidence of careful oak integration. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit concentration and savory elements, with the olive and herb notes adding complexity. Medium to full-bodied, the texture is smooth and refined with well-integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness."}

records.name: Adir Marselan
records.description: A distinctive wine from Adir Winery in Israel's Upper Galilee, crafted from the Marselan grape variety. This family-owned winery combines five decades of agricultural experience with grapes grown in the prestigious Kerem Ben Zimra vineyards, creating wines that reflect the unique terroir of the Galilee region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with vibrant aromas of fresh strawberries and ripe raspberries, accompanied by delicate rose petals and dried rose leaves that add a floral complexity. Bright red grapefruit and citrus notes emerge, along with subtle hints of lavender and orange zest that provide aromatic lift and Mediterranean character.","finish":"The finish is long and refreshing with persistent berry fruit and citrus notes. The wine's bright acidity lingers, leaving a clean impression with subtle floral and herb nuances.","palate":"The palate is refreshing and lively, showcasing strawberry and raspberry fruit flavors alongside peach and green apple notes. A distinctive grassy, vegetal quality adds complexity without overwhelming the fruit, while orange and citrus flavors provide brightness. The wine's notable acidity creates a crisp, clean mouthfeel that carries the flavors with energy and precision."}

records.name: Natte Valleij Coastal Cinsault 2023
records.description: A distinctive South African Cinsault from the Western Cape's coastal regions. This 2023 vintage showcases the variety's characteristic softness and aromatic bouquet, offering a refreshing alternative to heavier red wines with its elegant, medium-bodied profile and bright fruit character.
records.region: South Africa - Western Cape Coastal Region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents delicate aromas of fresh red berries—strawberry and raspberry—with floral undertones that add elegance and lift. The wine's aromatic bouquet, a hallmark of quality Cinsault, shows subtle notes of rose petals and red cherry. Hints of white pepper and Mediterranean herbs provide complexity and interest. The coastal influence brings a fresh, mineral-driven quality to the aromatics, suggesting proximity to the ocean and cool growing conditions.","finish":"The finish is clean and bright with lingering red fruit notes and gentle tannins. A subtle mineral quality persists, along with hints of spice and herbs. The wine's refreshing acidity leaves the palate cleansed and ready for food.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with soft, approachable tannins that define Cinsault's characteristic texture. The palate reveals bright flavors of red cherry, cranberry, and wild strawberry with excellent freshness from the 2023 vintage. The wine's natural acidity provides structure and energy without heaviness, making it exceptionally food-friendly. Subtle earthy notes add depth while maintaining the wine's primary focus on pure, expressive fruit. The coastal terroir contributes a saline minerality that enhances the wine's refreshing quality."}

records.name: Natte Valleij NAT Pinotage 2023

records.name: Aratas Sauvignon Blanc 2023
records.description: Aratas crafts this distinctive Sauvignon Blanc with focus on purity and terroir expression. The 2023 vintage balances aromatic intensity with mineral-driven freshness and elegant structure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents vibrant aromas of meyer lemon, white grapefruit, and lime blossom. Delicate notes of elderflower and honeysuckle add floral elegance, while hints of flint and chalk provide mineral complexity. Subtle green notes of fresh basil and bell pepper add varietal character.","finish":"The finish is precise and lengthy, with citrus pith and mineral notes persisting. Racy acidity cleanses the palate while maintaining fruit presence.","palate":"Crisp and focused on the palate, the wine shows layers of citrus and stone fruit, with flavors of nectarine, green apple, and pink grapefruit. Bright acidity provides structure and energy, complemented by a stony minerality that adds depth and complexity. The wine maintains tension between ripe fruit and saline freshness."}

records.description: From the heart of Treviso in the Veneto region, this fresh vintage Prosecco showcases the family estate's commitment to quality sparkling wine production. The 2024 vintage captures the essence of Glera grapes with modern winemaking techniques, resulting in an elegant and approachable sparkler with refined character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is airy and inviting with pronounced notes of green apple, ripe pear, and white peach. Delicate floral accents of white flowers and hints of brioche add elegance, while subtle notes of coriander and bitter almond provide an intriguing herbal complexity. The aromatic profile is fresh and well-defined, showcasing the wine's youth and vitality.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent with lingering notes of apple and citrus. A pleasant hint of bitter almond emerges at the end, adding a sophisticated touch and leaving the palate refreshed.","palate":"Supple and lively on the palate, this Prosecco delivers crisp flavors of green apple and pear, accented by hints of citrus and honeydew melon. The wine's soft, persistent bubbles create a pleasant mousse texture, while balanced acidity maintains freshness throughout. Subtle undertones of brioche and almond add depth, creating a more complex profile than typical entry-level Prosecco. The body is light to medium, with excellent integration of fruit, acidity, and effervescence."}

records.name: Natte Valleij P.O.W. 2021
records.description: Natte Valleij P.O.W. 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Domaine Borgeot Puligny Montrachet Les Grands Champs 2023
records.description: An elegant expression of Puligny-Montrachet from the esteemed Domaine Borgeot, this wine comes from the Les Grands Champs vineyard located close to Meursault. Aged for 11 months in French oak barrels with 25% new oak, it represents classic white Burgundy craftsmanship with richness balanced by characteristic minerality.
records.region: Puligny-Montrachet, Côte de Beaune, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with beautiful floral aromas of white acacia and orange blossom, elegantly married with vibrant notes of tropical pineapple and bright tangerine. Subtle hints of toasted hazelnut and buttered brioche emerge from the oak aging, adding complexity without overwhelming the delicate fruit and floral character that defines this premier Burgundian terroir.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven, with a distinctive saltiness and flinty character that speaks to the limestone-rich terroir. The acidity remains bright and persistent, ensuring the wine finishes clean and fresh despite its generous fruit weight, with subtle oak spice lingering pleasantly.","palate":"Rich and rounded on the palate, this Chardonnay displays impressive intensity while maintaining the elegance expected from Puligny-Montrachet. Pretty tropical fruit flavors of ripe pineapple and hints of tangerine dominate the mid-palate, supported by a creamy texture from lees aging. The wine shows excellent balance between richness and freshness, with mouth-watering acidity cutting through the fruit weight and providing energy and lift."}

records.name: Alfaro Family Vineyards A Estate Syrah 2021
records.description: Alfaro Family Vineyards A Estate Syrah 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Armstrong Family Winery Four Birds 2018
records.description: A well-crafted Bordeaux-style blend from Armstrong Family Winery in Walla Walla, Washington, earning a critic score of 91/100. This Columbia Valley wine blends Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, and Petit Verdot, showcasing the quality and concentration that Washington State can achieve with classic Bordeaux varieties.
records.varietal: Blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, and Petit Verdot
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents ripe dark berries with excellent concentration and definition. Aromas of blackberry, cassis, and dark cherry lead the way, complemented by subtle notes of cedar, tobacco, and dried herbs. Hints of vanilla and sweet oak from barrel aging add complexity, while earthy undertones and graphite notes provide depth. As the wine opens, floral notes of violet emerge along with hints of dark chocolate and espresso.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit and subtle oak spice. Well-balanced tannins provide structure while the wine's concentration ensures lasting flavor. A hint of graphite and earth adds complexity to the conclusion.","palate":"Juicy and fruit-forward on the palate with a well-defined structure that speaks to quality winemaking. The wine shows lots of concentration and grip while remaining balanced and approachable. Dark fruit flavors - blackberry, black cherry, and plum - dominate, supported by integrated oak notes of vanilla and toast. The Merlot component (often 76% in this blend) provides a plush, velvety texture, while Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc add structure and complexity. Tannins are ripe and well-integrated, providing framework without harshness."}

records.name: Aresca Cortese 2021
records.description: A crisp and elegant white wine from Piedmont, Italy, showcasing the Cortese grape's natural affinity for fresh, mineral-driven expressions. While Cortese is most famous for Gavi DOCG, this Piemonte DOC bottling from Aresca offers excellent value while maintaining the varietal's characteristic purity and finesse.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is clean, bright, and inviting, opening with vivid aromas of green apple and fresh grapefruit that showcase Cortese's natural crispness. Citrus notes of lemon zest and lime blossom provide brightness, while subtle hints of white flowers—particularly acacia and elderflower—add delicate complexity. As the wine opens, gentle mineral nuances emerge, reminiscent of wet stone and chalk, reflecting the terroir. Light herbal touches of fresh basil and cut grass contribute to the wine's overall freshness, while a subtle almond note adds a layer of interest without detracting from the wine's pristine fruit character.","finish":"The finish is clean, crisp, and moderately long, with lingering citrus and mineral notes. A slight bitter almond quality emerges at the close—characteristic of well-made Cortese—adding complexity without harshness. The wine's bright acidity persists through the finish, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food or another sip.","palate":"Zesty and refreshing on the palate, this Cortese delivers bright acidity that immediately enlivens the senses. The entry is clean and precise, with flavors of crisp green apple, pink grapefruit, and ripe citrus fruits dominating the taste profile. The wine's light to medium body carries these flavors with elegance and purity, never feeling thin or insubstantial. Mineral hints provide structure and depth, adding a saline quality that enhances the wine's food-friendliness. Subtle notes of honey and lemon appear in the mid-palate, while the wine maintains its fresh, linear character throughout. The texture is smooth yet vibrant, with the acidity providing backbone and ensuring the wine remains lively and engaging."}

records.name: Ngeringa Estate Pinot Noir 2022
records.description: An exceptional cool-climate Pinot Noir from Ngeringa Estate in the Adelaide Hills, this wine represents some of Australia's finest expression of this noble variety. Crafted from biodynamically farmed vineyards at high elevation, Ngeringa's Pinot Noir combines elegance, complexity, and a distinctive sense of place that rivals top Burgundian examples.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is complex and beguiling, revealing layers of red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry, interwoven with earthy notes of forest floor, mushroom, and dried leaves. Floral hints of rose petal and violet add elegance, while subtle spice notes of clove, cinnamon, and white pepper provide intrigue. With aeration, nuances of black tea, sandalwood, and a distinctive herbal quality emerge, speaking to the wine's biodynamic origins and cool-climate terroir. A subtle smokiness and mineral edge add further dimension.","finish":"The finish is long, precise, and beautifully integrated, with persistent red fruit and earthy notes. Hints of tea, spice, and mineral linger alongside fine tannins, while the wine's excellent acidity ensures a clean, appetizing conclusion that demonstrates both immediate appeal and aging potential.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a silky, refined texture, this Pinot Noir showcases the variety's hallmark elegance and complexity. Flavors of bright red cherry and raspberry dominate the entry, supported by notes of wild strawberry, pomegranate, and hints of rhubarb. Earthy, savory elements including forest floor, dried herbs, and subtle game add complexity and balance the fruit. The wine's fine-grained tannins provide structure without weight, while vibrant acidity keeps the wine fresh and energetic. Notes of tea leaf, mushroom, and warm spice add layers of interest, creating a wine of considerable depth and refinement."}

records.name: Barrel Oak Farm Taphouse Tripel   19550 ml
records.description: NOTE: This is a BEER, not wine - a Belgian Dubbel-style ale from Barrel Oak Farm Taphouse in Delaplane, Virginia. This 100% vegan-friendly Belgian ale showcases the classic Dubbel style with 6.3% ABV, earning 3.5/5 stars from 541 reviews on Untappd as a house favorite.
records.varietal: N/A - Belgian-style ale (malted barley, Belgian yeast, hops)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents classic Belgian Dubbel aromatics with dark fruit esters—ripe plum, dark cherry, and fig—complemented by caramel malt sweetness and subtle banana notes from Belgian yeast. Hints of dark bread crust, toffee, and gentle spice (clove and subtle pepper) add complexity, while a whisper of chocolate and toasted nuts emerges in the background. The yeast character is present but restrained, allowing malt complexity to shine.","finish":"Gentle fruit and malt flavors persist on the moderately dry finish, with subtle spice notes and a hint of warming alcohol that never becomes hot or harsh. The 6.3% ABV is perfectly integrated.","palate":"Balanced and subtle, the palate delivers malt-forward sweetness with ripe dark fruit flavors—think dried plum, raisin, and black cherry—harmoniously integrated with caramel and toffee notes. The Belgian yeast contributes gentle fruity esters without overwhelming phenolic spice, creating a smooth, approachable drinking experience. Medium body with moderate carbonation provides pleasant texture, while subtle hop bitterness balances the malt sweetness. The beer drinks clean and smooth, making it very enjoyable and a house favorite for good reason."}

records.name: Ngeringa Summit Estate Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: From the cool-climate Adelaide Hills region of South Australia, Ngeringa's Summit Estate Pinot Noir represents a unique expression of terroir-driven winemaking. Produced with biodynamic farming principles and minimal intervention, this wine includes 10% whole bunch fermentation and gentle hand-plunging to create a Pinot Noir with distinctive earthy complexity and authentic character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a murky, blood-red color that speaks to its unfiltered, natural production. The nose offers an intoxicating mix of bright raspberry and glacé red fruits, layered with a mulchy dark earth note that adds depth and intrigue. Subtle floral hints emerge alongside a slight volatile lift that adds energy and complexity. The aromatic profile suggests both fruit purity and earthy authenticity, creating a distinctly Australian Pinot expression.","finish":"A chewy edge provides momentum through the finish, carrying the wine's complex flavors forward. The conclusion is surprisingly lengthy for such a delicate wine, with earthy minerality and red fruit notes persisting. The wine's natural acidity keeps the finish fresh and lifted, while subtle tannins provide gentle structure. This is a finish that rewards contemplation, revealing new nuances with each sip.","palate":"This is a wonderfully expressive Pinot with a sense of realness that sets it apart. The palate layers blood and bone elements with tomato juice acidity, rhubarb tartness, and pure raspberry fruit. Sweet-sour fruit flavors create dynamic tension, while keen floral overtones add elegance. Garden herb notes and earthy, beetroot-like characters contribute savory complexity. Though light to medium-bodied, the wine has impressive length and spread, with flavors expanding across the palate. The texture shows excellent refinement despite the wine's natural, unfiltered character."}

records.name: Boplaas Fledge & Co. Vagabond White Blend 2022
records.description: The Fledge & Co. is the nomadic winemaking project from Margaux Nel, daughter of Boplaas winery, and her husband Leon Coetzee. Vagabond embodies their philosophy of sourcing exceptional fruit from diverse sites across South Africa's Western Cape, creating wines of remarkable complexity and character without owning vineyards themselves.
records.varietal: 32% Chenin Blanc, 18% Roussanne, 15% Verdelho, 10% Colombard, 8% Grenache Blanc, 5% Viognier, 5% Riesling, 3% Chardonnay, 2% Macabeo
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright and exuberant with layers of citrus, tropical fruit, and floral aromatics. Grapefruit zest and fresh pineapple dominate initially, followed by delicate rose petal, honeysuckle, and hints of white peach. There's an appealing complexity showing subtle notes of honey-infused cream, wet stone minerality, and a whisper of fresh herbs. The diverse blend creates an aromatic tapestry that's both immediately appealing and intellectually engaging.","finish":"The finish is refreshing and lengthy with persistent citrus and mineral notes. High acidity keeps the palate vibrant and cleansed, while subtle honeyed richness lingers pleasantly. The wine's complexity continues to reveal itself through the extended finish.","palate":"The palate is vibrant and multi-dimensional, showcasing the complexity of the 8-grape blend. Bright acidity provides the backbone for flavors ranging from citrus (grapefruit, lemon) to tropical fruits (pineapple, passion fruit) and stone fruits (white peach, apricot). The Chenin Blanc contributes texture and body, Roussanne adds richness and honeyed notes, while Verdelho and Colombard provide tropical fruit character. Grenache Blanc, Viognier, and Riesling add aromatic complexity and floral notes, with Chardonnay and Macabeo rounding out the blend with structure and minerality. At 13% alcohol, the wine remains fresh and balanced."}

records.name: Rock Ferry Brut Rose 2016
records.description: An exquisite organic sparkling rosé from New Zealand's Bendigo region, the Rock Ferry Brut Rose 2016 represents the pinnacle of méthode traditionnelle craftsmanship. Estate-grown in the Trig Hill Vineyard and matured for three and a half years on lees before disgorgement, this wine earned exceptional critical acclaim including 95 points from Sam Kim and 4.5 stars from Michael Cooper, establishing it as one of New Zealand's finest sparkling wines.
records.varietal: Pinot Noir (exact blend not disclosed for rosé)
records.region: Bendigo, Central Otago, New Zealand (Trig Hill Vineyard, estate-grown, certified organic)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exquisitely delicate yet powerful and persistent, the nose offers a complex array of wild berry aromas—particularly strawberry—mingling with apricot, Gala apple, and white acacia flower. Intriguing tertiary notes of smoke, biscuit, five spices, and cinnamon emerge from the extended lees aging, while subtle yeasty notes add depth and complexity, creating an aromatic profile of remarkable sophistication.","finish":"The finish is impressively long and attractive, notably dry with only 3.5 grams per liter of residual sugar, creating a crisp, refreshing conclusion. The strawberry and peach notes persist alongside the toasty, yeasty complexity from lees aging, while the vibrant acidity ensures the wine finishes clean and inviting.","palate":"Lively and beautifully structured, the palate delivers strong strawberry flavors complemented by hints of fresh peaches and exotic spices. The wine shows excellent fruit weight and complexity, with red berry and toast flavors beautifully integrated from the lees contact. The mouthfeel is refined and elegant, with persistent fine bubbles creating a creamy texture. Juicy, mouth-watering acidity provides energy and lift, cutting through the fruit richness and ensuring balance."}

records.name: Banner Day Carmenere 2023
records.description: A vibrant expression of Carmenere, the signature grape of Chile that was long confused with Merlot. This young vintage showcases the variety's distinctive spicy, herbaceous character alongside ripe fruit, offering an accessible introduction to one of South America's most compelling red varieties with bright, fruit-forward appeal.
records.region: Premium Carmenere region (likely Central Valley, Chile or Columbia Valley, Washington)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with fresh blackberry, Bing cherry, and ripe plum, characteristic of Carmenere's exuberant fruit profile. Distinctive green notes emerge—green peppercorn, bell pepper, and fresh herbs—adding complexity without dominating. Subtle hints of cocoa powder, coffee bean, and caramel suggest light oak contact, while underlying spice notes of cinnamon and clove provide warmth. A telltale Carmenere signature of soy sauce and umami adds savory intrigue to the fruit-forward bouquet.","finish":"Medium-length finish with persistent berry fruit gradually revealing the variety's characteristic spice and subtle green notes. A whisper of dark chocolate and espresso lingers alongside soft tannins, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food.","palate":"Medium-bodied with soft, approachable tannins and juicy acidity that highlight the 2023 vintage's youthful vibrancy. Flavors of black cherry, raspberry, and blackberry jam are accented by Carmenere's unique spice profile: black pepper, paprika, and a hint of chili chocolate. The wine shows balanced extraction with gentle tannins that provide structure without astringency. Mid-palate notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and vanilla blend seamlessly with fruit, while subtle herbal qualities (thyme, eucalyptus) add freshness and food-compatibility."}
