records.name: Barcelona Lolea Red Sangria
records.description: An authentic Spanish sangria crafted in the traditional style, combining quality red wine with natural fruit flavors. Lolea captures the festive spirit of Spain's most beloved beverage, offering a ready-to-serve option that brings the vibrancy of Spanish bars and chiringuitos to any occasion.
records.varietal: Spanish red wine base (traditionally Rioja-style) with natural fruit flavors
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant and inviting with fresh aromas of ripe red berries, citrus peel, and orchard fruits. The nose reveals layers of strawberry, peach, and orange, with subtle hints of cinnamon and a touch of brandy warmth. Bright, fruity aromatics evoke summer gatherings and Mediterranean sunshine, with the wine base providing structure to the fruit-forward bouquet.","finish":"Clean and fruity with lingering notes of berries and citrus. The finish is refreshing and balanced, leaving a pleasant sweetness and a desire for another sip. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh despite the fruit-forward profile.","palate":"Refreshing and fruit-driven with a perfect balance of sweetness and acidity, the palate bursts with flavors of macerated strawberries, fresh orange, and ripe peach. The red wine base provides body and depth, while natural fruit essences add vibrant character. Notes of citrus and berries mingle with subtle spice, creating a harmonious, easy-drinking profile. Light to medium-bodied with smooth texture and approachable sweetness that never becomes cloying. The traditional Spanish recipe ensures authentic flavor that captures sangria's essential character."}

records.name: Bandol Fleur de Province Cotes de Province 2021
records.description: Bandol Fleur de Province Cotes de Province 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Nikolaou Mirage 2022
records.description: An organic red wine crafted from pure Agiorgitiko grapes sourced from Domaine Nikolaou's private family vineyards in Nemea, Greece. This wine represents modern Greek winemaking with traditional indigenous varieties, combining organic viticulture with careful barrel aging. The Mirage bottling showcases the elegant, fruit-forward potential of Agiorgitiko when grown in Nemea's ideal terroir and handled with minimal intervention.
records.varietal: 100% Agiorgitiko (also known as St. George), Greece's noble red variety
records.region: Nemea PDO, Peloponnese, Greece - from family estate vineyards
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals an enticing blend of dark fruit and floral notes. Brambleberry and ripe blueberry lead, intertwined with fragrant red flowers and delicate rose petals. Herbaceous nuances add complexity - think dried Mediterranean herbs and wild thyme - while earthy, pebbly mineral notes ground the aromatic profile. Subtle hints of prune and plum emerge with aeration, alongside a touch of sweet spice from the oak aging.","finish":"The finish is long and harmonious, with delicate tannins carrying dark fruit and mineral notes through to the conclusion. A lovely freshness persists, inviting another sip. The wine's earthy, stony character emerges more prominently as it lingers, speaking to its Nemean terroir. Balanced acidity keeps the palate refreshed despite the wine's richness.","palate":"Fresh and enveloping on entry, the wine displays remarkable richness while maintaining excellent balance. Dark cherry and plum flavors dominate, supported by integrated fruit notes that feel neither jammy nor tart but perfectly ripe. The texture is notably delicate despite the wine's richness, with fine-grained tannins providing structure without harshness. Subtle oak influence adds vanilla and spice notes that complement rather than dominate. The wine shows lovely depth and concentration while remaining approachable and elegant."}

records.name: Bonelli Malvasia Frizzante Amabile Semi Sweet 2020
records.description: Bonelli Malvasia Frizzante Amabile Semi Sweet 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Boplaas Hanepoot 2023
records.description: South Africa's championship Hanepoot (Muscat of Alexandria) from the Klein Karoo, winning the prestigious SA Young Wine Show 2024 for its category. This fortified dessert wine from 30-year-old vines showcases the intense aromatics and luscious sweetness that Muscat achieves in this warm, dry region, balanced by zippy acidity.
records.region: Calitzdorp, Klein Karoo, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet virtually leaps from the glass with explosive intensity—ripe Hanepoot grapes dominate with their characteristic grapey sweetness, joined by tropical pineapple, bright lemon rind, and exotic litchi. Winter melon and fresh Sultana raisins add complexity, while intoxicating floral notes of jasmine and honeysuckle perfume the nose. Subtle honey undertones and faint warming spice create additional layers in this remarkably aromatic wine.","finish":"Bright lemon yellow color with lime-tinged rim; the finish lingers with citrus rind, honey, and lingering minerality that leaves the palate refreshed despite the wine's sweetness.","palate":"Lusciously sweet yet brilliantly balanced, the mouth-watering palate presents a cornucopia of flavors—fresh Sultana grapes, golden honey, juicy litchi, and ripe melon cascade across the tongue. Fig leaf and candied lemon and lime marmalade add citrus brightness that prevents cloying sweetness, while the wine's signature zippy acidity provides crucial lift and freshness. Subtle minerality emerges mid-palate, adding sophistication to the generous fruit, with hints of citrus rind providing gentle bitter contrast to the luscious sweetness."}

records.name: Nikolaou Moschofilero 2023
records.description: Nikolaou Moschofilero 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Oliver Viticultors 10,000 Hours Floral Blanc 2023
records.description: A distinctive aromatic white wine from Spain's innovative Oliver Viticultors, showcasing the winery's commitment to crafting unique, terroir-driven wines. The '10,000 Hours' designation suggests extensive vineyard work and careful attention to detail, while the 'Floral Blanc' name indicates an emphasis on aromatic complexity and perfumed characteristics.
records.varietal: Likely Albariño, Verdejo, or aromatic white blend
records.region: Spain (specific region varies by vineyard selection)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile lives up to its 'Floral' designation, bursting with intense perfume of orange blossom, jasmine, and elderflower. Underneath the floral canopy lie notes of ripe stone fruits—particularly white peach and apricot—along with tropical hints of lychee, passionfruit, and pineapple. Citrus elements of lemon zest, mandarin peel, and bergamot add brightness, while subtle herbal notes of lemon verbena and fresh mint provide complexity. A distinctive minerality reminiscent of wet slate and river stones grounds the exuberant aromatics.","finish":"The finish is refreshing and moderately long, with lingering floral notes and citrus zest. A mineral quality persists alongside hints of white tea and ginger, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for food or another sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with electric acidity, the wine dances across the palate with flavors that mirror the aromatic intensity. Stone fruit notes of nectarine and yellow plum are joined by tropical fruit—guava, kiwi, and starfruit—creating an exotic fruit salad of flavors. The citrus component is pronounced, offering grapefruit, lime, and yuzu that provide freshness and cut. Floral flavors continue on the palate, with rose water and orange blossom adding a delicate perfumed quality. A subtle salinity and mineral backbone prevent the wine from being overwhelmingly fruity, while crisp acidity keeps everything vibrant and focused."}

records.name: Barrel Oak Farm Taphouse Dubbel   19550 ml
records.description: Barrel Oak Farm Taphouse Dubbel   19550 ml is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Bitch Grenache 2021
records.description: A bold, fruit-forward expression of Grenache showcasing the variety's natural exuberance and charm. This wine likely originates from a warm climate region where Grenache thrives, delivering generous ripe fruit character with the grape's characteristic spicy complexity and smooth, approachable texture.
records.region: Likely Spain, Southern France, or Australia
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant aromas burst from the glass with ripe raspberry, strawberry compote, and red cherry liqueur, complemented by notes of dried cranberry and pomegranate. A distinctive garrigue character emerges with hints of lavender, thyme, and crushed herbs. Background notes of white pepper, cinnamon stick, and a touch of cocoa add complexity, while subtle floral nuances of violet and rose petal provide aromatic lift.","finish":"The finish is warm and satisfying with lingering red fruit, sweet spice, and a touch of herbal character. Soft tannins fade gently while the wine's fruity essence persists, leaving a pleasant impression of ripeness balanced by just enough structure.","palate":"The palate is medium to full-bodied with lush, silky texture characteristic of quality Grenache. Flavors of ripe red berries including strawberry, raspberry, and cherry mingle with notes of red plum and candied orange peel. The wine's natural alcohol provides warmth and body, while soft tannins and moderate acidity create a smooth, generous mouthfeel. Spice notes of white pepper and cinnamon persist throughout, adding dimension to the fruit-forward profile."}

records.name: Noble Hill Estate Reserve White 2021
records.description: Noble Hill Estate Reserve White 2021 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Burdi Negroamaro Rosso 2019
records.description: Burdi Negroamaro Rosso 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Montepalacio Montepalacio Brut NV
records.description: Montepalacio Montepalacio Brut NV is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Tarpon Cellars Dry Creek Zinfandel 2020
records.description: A robust and characterful Zinfandel from Sonoma's renowned Dry Creek Valley, one of California's premier regions for this varietal. Tarpon Cellars crafts this wine to showcase the bold, jammy fruit and spicy character that has made Dry Creek Zinfandel famous, with attention to balance and drinkability.
records.region: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is powerfully aromatic, opening with explosive scents of blackberry bramble, raspberry jam, and ripe boysenberry. Red fruit notes of cherry pie and cranberry sauce add brightness, while baking spices—cinnamon stick, clove, and vanilla—speak to both the grape's natural character and oak influence. Secondary aromas of black pepper, dried herbs, and a hint of eucalyptus add complexity, alongside subtle notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted caramel from barrel aging. A faint floral hint of violet and dried rose petals emerges with aeration.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with persistent dark fruit flavors mingling with oak spice and chocolate. A pleasant alcohol warmth lingers alongside hints of black pepper, dried herbs, and a touch of leather that adds savory complexity to the sweet fruit conclusion.","palate":"Full-bodied and opulent, the wine coats the palate with concentrated dark and red fruit flavors. Blackberry, black cherry, and plum dominate, supported by raspberry coulis and pomegranate that provide brightness. The wine's natural high alcohol is balanced by ripe, sweet fruit and integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness. Mid-palate reveals layers of mocha, milk chocolate, and sweet tobacco, along with peppery spice and a touch of licorice. The oak is present but not overwhelming, contributing vanilla, toast, and a hint of coconut. Despite its power, the wine maintains balance through vibrant acidity that cuts through the richness and adds energy."}

records.name: Boxwood Sauvignon Blanc 2020
records.description: An elegant Virginia Sauvignon Blanc from one of the state's premier estates in Middleburg. This wine showcases the terroir-driven approach of winemaker Rachel Martin, blending Old World finesse with New World fruit purity in a distinctive Mid-Atlantic expression.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant citrus blossom and white grapefruit, layered with subtle hints of fresh-cut grass and wet stone minerality. Delicate notes of gooseberry and green apple emerge with air, while a whisper of lemongrass and white pepper adds complexity. The aromatic profile speaks to cool-climate viticulture with restraint and precision.","finish":"The finish is clean and lingering, with citrus zest and mineral notes extending gracefully. A touch of white pepper spice and wet stone character persists, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip.","palate":"The palate delivers crisp acidity and medium body, showcasing flavors of Meyer lemon, green pear, and white peach. A distinctive flinty minerality runs through the mid-palate, balanced by subtle tropical notes of passion fruit and guava. The wine maintains excellent tension between fruit concentration and refreshing acidity, with a saline quality that adds depth and interest."}

records.name: Boplaas Cape Ruby Port
records.description: Boplaas Cape Ruby Port is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Boplaas The Fledge & Co. Souzao 2024
records.description: A rare and innovative South African table wine made from Souzão, a Portuguese grape variety traditionally used for Port production. Boplaas, a renowned Calitzdorp producer known for exceptional Port-style wines, explores the lighter, fresher side of this varietal with The Fledge & Co. series. This represents a creative departure from fortified wines, showcasing Souzão's potential as a vibrant, food-friendly red wine.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intriguing and unique, offering an unexpected aromatic profile for those familiar with Souzão only in fortified form. Fresh raspberry and cherry lead with bright, lifted fruit character, while distinctive hints of gunpowder tea add an exotic, slightly smoky dimension. Floral notes and subtle herbal undertones contribute complexity, creating an aromatic experience that is both approachable and intellectually engaging.","finish":"Clean and refreshing, the finish emphasizes the wine's vibrant acidity and pure fruit character. Light tannins provide subtle structure without weight, while lingering cherry and raspberry notes fade gradually. The overall impression is one of freshness and drinkability, inviting another sip.","palate":"Light-to-medium-bodied with a refreshing, juicy acidity that immediately distinguishes this wine from heavier reds. Bright raspberry and cherry flavors dance across the palate with vivacity and purity, unencumbered by heavy oak or excessive tannin. The gunpowder tea note from the nose translates to a subtle savory quality on the palate, adding depth and interest. The wine's freshness and bright fruit make it exceptionally versatile and easy to enjoy, whether slightly chilled or at cellar temperature."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2001

records.name: Boxwood Reserve 2021
records.description: The flagship wine from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, representing the pinnacle of the estate's Bordeaux-inspired winemaking. Crafted from the finest parcels of sustainably farmed vineyards planted with ENTAV-certified French clones, this Reserve showcases Virginia's ability to produce world-class Bordeaux-style wines with distinctive regional character.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend (exact composition varies by vintage; typically Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot, and/or Malbec from 26.5 acres of estate vineyards)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Elegant and complex aromatics featuring ripe blackcurrant, black cherry, and dark plum supported by sophisticated oak integration. Cedar and cigar box notes emerge, characteristic of Bordeaux-style blends, along with hints of graphite, dried violet, and Virginia's signature forest floor earthiness. Subtle nuances of black tea, leather, and baking spices add layers of complexity. The nose shows more concentration and depth than the estate's Whole Ox bottling, reflecting careful barrel selection and vineyard site selection.","finish":"Long and persistent finish with excellent structure and complexity. Dark fruit flavors linger alongside cedar, tobacco, and subtle oak spice. The finish shows refined tannins that promise good aging potential, while maintaining balance and elegance. A touch of graphite minerality and forest floor earthiness emerges at the end, signatures of Virginia terroir.","palate":"Full-bodied yet maintaining Virginia's characteristic elegance and restraint. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of cassis, blackberry, and dark cherry with excellent fruit purity from the organic farming practices. Well-structured tannins provide framework and aging potential while remaining refined and silky. The wine shows impressive balance between power and finesse, with integrated oak contributing vanilla, toast, and spice without overwhelming the fruit. Layers of complexity unfold with flavors of tobacco, dark chocolate, and mineral notes. The Middleburg AVA terroir expresses itself through the wine's freshness and distinctive herbal undertones."}

records.name: Born Rose Still Double Magnum 2021  3 l
records.description: Born Rose Still Double Magnum 2021  3 l is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Boplaas The Fledge Syrah 2020
records.description: A powerful and full-bodied Syrah from South Africa's renowned Boplaas Estate. The 2020 vintage showcases the variety's characteristic intensity with dark fruit, pepper spice, and the structured tannins that make Syrah one of the world's most age-worthy red varieties.
records.region: South Africa (Boplaas Estate is located in Calitzdorp, Klein Karoo)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with the powerful, intensely aromatic character typical of quality Syrah. Prominent blackberry and dark plum aromas lead, accompanied by the variety's signature black pepper spice. Floral notes of violet add elegance and complexity, while hints of dark chocolate and roasted coffee provide depth. Secondary aromas of smoked meat and leather emerge, suggesting either oak influence or the wine's natural savory character. Subtle mint and eucalyptus notes add freshness and lift to the rich aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful with persistent tannins and dark fruit flavors. Black pepper spice lingers along with hints of dark chocolate and coffee. The wine's firm structure and high acidity ensure an energetic, compelling conclusion that suggests excellent aging potential.","palate":"Full-bodied with medium-plus to high levels of firm, structured tannins that provide excellent aging potential. The palate reveals intense flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and plum with concentrated fruit from quality vineyard sites. Black pepper spice is a defining characteristic, running through the mid-palate and adding complexity. The wine's high acidity provides balance to the fruit concentration and tannic structure. Oak aging contributes notes of vanilla, toast, and coffee without dominating the fruit. Earthy, savory notes of leather and truffle add depth and sophistication."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Crianza 2021
records.description: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Crianza 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Noble Hill Sur Lie Chenin Blanc 2020
records.description: An exceptional South African Chenin Blanc from the prestigious Simonsberg-Paarl region. This wine showcases the noble character of Chenin Blanc through sur lie aging in large-format concrete vessels, developing remarkable depth and complexity while maintaining fresh acidity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant aromas of fresh lime blossom, honeydew melon, and green apple that showcase the wine's freshness and purity. White grapefruit emerges alongside hints of chamomile, adding a delicate floral dimension. The aromatics are precise and focused, with excellent intensity that promises depth on the palate.","finish":"The finish showcases citrus fruit notes that linger pleasantly, with mineral undertones providing structure and definition. The 9 months of lees aging with regular stirring has created impressive texture and length. The wine concludes with refreshing acidity and subtle complexity that speaks to careful winemaking.","palate":"The palate balances the fresh fruit aromatics with delicate mineral flavors derived from the rocky slopes of the Simonsberg mountains. Good acidity provides backbone, supporting flavors of orange zest and grapefruit that carry through from nose to palate. The sur lie aging adds fullness and depth without any overt oak character, allowing the wine to develop nuance and complexity through extended lees contact."}

records.name: Born Rose Still Imperial Magnum 2021  6 l
records.description: Born Rose Still Imperial Magnum 2021  6 l is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Boron Delle Venezie Pinot Grigio 2024
records.description: Boron Delle Venezie Pinot Grigio 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Boxwood Cupola 2022

records.name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi Sagrantino di Montefalco 2019
records.description: Cantina Fratelli Pardi Sagrantino di Montefalco 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Pasquiers Sablet Blanc 2022
records.description: A mineral-driven white wine from the Sablet appellation in the southern Rhône Valley, representing the prior vintage of this estate's white wine program. This wine emphasizes freshness and terroir expression through a careful blend of traditional Rhône white varietals grown on the region's distinctive limestone and clay soils.
records.varietal: Grenache Blanc, Clairette, and Roussanne blend
records.region: Sablet, Côtes du Rhône Villages, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with vibrant notes of citrus—lemon verbena, grapefruit zest, and lime leaf—alongside white-fleshed fruits including Asian pear, white peach, and quince. Aromatic herbs characteristic of the garrigue landscape emerge: thyme, fennel, and a touch of wild lavender. The wine displays distinctive minerality reminiscent of crushed seashells and limestone, while subtle notes of acacia honey, white almond, and a faint waxy quality add depth and suggest the wine's development.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, showcasing continued citrus and mineral notes. White flower petals, almond skin, and a persistent stony character linger, along with a refreshing herbal quality that leaves the palate energized.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a rounded texture, the wine delivers layers of stone fruit flavors—apricot, nectarine, and yellow plum—balanced by citrus brightness of Meyer lemon and pink grapefruit. A pronounced mineral core runs through the palate, offering sensations of wet stones, saline, and chalk that speak to the terroir. Herbal nuances of fennel seed, tarragon, and anise add savory complexity, while the wine's natural acidity provides structure and freshness. A subtle richness from the fruit's ripeness is kept in check by this vibrant acidity, creating excellent balance. The palate shows good concentration with a slightly oily texture that adds weight without heaviness."}

records.name: Boxwood Whole Ox Red Wine (Private Label) 2022
records.description: A Bordeaux-style red blend from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, reflecting the vision of proprietor John Kent Cooke. Crafted from sustainably farmed estate vineyards planted with traditional Bordeaux varietals, this wine expresses the distinctive terroir of the Middleburg AVA with Virginia's characteristic elegance and balance.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend likely featuring Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, and/or Malbec
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with aromas of ripe red and black fruits—cassis, blackberry, and dark cherry—typical of Bordeaux-varietal blends. Layers of complexity emerge with notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and hints of Virginia forest floor. Subtle herbal nuances of bay leaf and dried sage reflect the cooler climate character, while oak aging contributes vanilla, toast, and a touch of graphite minerality that adds sophistication to the fruit-forward profile.","finish":"Medium to long finish with persistent dark fruit flavors and subtle oak spice. The wine concludes with refined tannins and a touch of minerality characteristic of Virginia terroir. Notes of tobacco and cedar linger, while the finish maintains the wine's overall elegance and balance.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a silky texture and well-integrated tannins that showcase Virginia's elegant style rather than California's power. The palate delivers flavors of dark cherry, blackcurrant, and plum, supported by earthy notes of forest floor and dried herbs. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit concentration and structural elements, with moderate acidity maintaining freshness. Oak influence is present but restrained, providing framework without overwhelming the fruit. The blend likely emphasizes Cabernet Franc, which thrives in Virginia's climate, contributing characteristic bell pepper and herbal notes alongside red fruit."}

records.name: Bonelli Bonarda Frizzante Semi Sweet 2020
records.description: A delightful sparkling wine from Argentina showcasing the Bonarda grape (also known as Douce Noir or Charbono) in a lightly effervescent, semi-sweet style. This frizzante offers an approachable, fun alternative to traditional sparkling wines, combining gentle bubbles with fruity sweetness perfect for casual enjoyment and celebrations.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inviting and fruit-forward with aromas of fresh red berries, black cherry, and ripe plum. The frizzante style releases gentle bubbles that carry notes of strawberry, raspberry, and subtle floral hints. A touch of grape must sweetness adds aromatic appeal, while hints of violet and red currant provide complexity. The nose is fresh and approachable, with the semi-sweet character evident in the ripe, generous fruit aromatics. Light spice notes and a subtle earthy quality hint at the Bonarda variety's character.","finish":"Soft and fruity with lingering berry flavors and a touch of sweetness. The gentle bubbles fade gently, leaving a clean, refreshing impression. Light acidity and subtle tannins balance the semi-sweet character, creating an easy, crowd-pleasing conclusion.","palate":"Lightly sparkling with gentle effervescence that creates a playful, refreshing mouthfeel. The palate delivers sweet red fruit flavors of cherry, strawberry, and raspberry, balanced by the wine's natural bubbles and moderate acidity. Semi-sweet style with perceptible residual sugar that enhances the fruit character without becoming cloying. Light to medium-bodied with smooth texture and easy-drinking appeal. The Bonarda grape contributes subtle earthy notes and soft tannins beneath the fruit and bubbles. The wine's approachable sweetness and gentle fizz make it incredibly versatile for casual occasions."}

records.name: Boplaas Alvarinho 2023
records.description: Boplaas's maiden vintage of Alvarinho marks an innovative addition to their portfolio of Portuguese varieties. Planted in the drier, warmer climate of Calitzdorp, South Africa, this wine showcases the aromatic complexity and elegance of the Portuguese white grape. Winemaker Margaux Nel spent four months aging the wine on lees to develop texture and complexity while preserving the variety's fresh, aromatic character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and elegant with distinctive aromatic complexity. The nose opens with refreshing citrus notes of lime and grapefruit that immediately capture attention. White stone fruit aromas of peach and apricot emerge, complemented by subtle floral notes of orange blossom. The fragrance reveals layers of the variety's natural aromatics, from zesty citrus to delicate flowers.","finish":"Clean and invigorating with persistent citrus notes. The finish is refreshing and mineral-driven, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for food.","palate":"Refreshing lime and grapefruit sing from every glass, lining the palate with vibrant citrus flavors. The wine shows good body and weight from lees aging, creating a textured mouthfeel that balances the crisp acidity. Layers of white peach and subtle minerality add complexity. The wine maintains freshness and elegance throughout, with the fruit carrying beautifully from nose to palate."}

records.name: Boxwood Ellie Bird Trellis (Private Label) 2022
records.description: A special collaboration between Virginia's Boxwood Winery and Ellie Bird restaurant, this proprietary red blend showcases the elegance of Virginia winemaking. Based on Boxwood's acclaimed Trellis style, it combines Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon to create a refined, food-friendly wine with supple tannins and vibrant acidity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with delicate floral notes of lilac and violet, leading to layers of red plum and dark cherry. Subtle hints of fresh strawberry mingle with a whisper of cedar and dried herbs, creating an inviting and complex aromatic profile that reflects the wine's Virginia terroir.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering notes of fresh strawberries and a subtle minerality. The wine's bright acidity and refined tannins leave the palate refreshed and ready for the next bite, making it an ideal companion to diverse cuisines.","palate":"On the palate, juicy dark cherry and plum flavors dominate, supported by a supple, medium-bodied mouthfeel. The wine shows excellent integration between fruit and structure, with silky tannins that provide gentle grip without overwhelming the bright red fruit character. Fresh acidity keeps the wine lively and balanced throughout."}

records.name: Boxwood Topiary 2020
records.description: Boxwood Topiary 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Boplaas Gamka Red 2020
records.description: A captivating Portuguese blend from South Africa's Klein Karoo region, this wine showcases Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barocca, Touriga Franca, and Souzão aged 12 months in French oak. Named for the Gamka River that roars through the region, this wine earned 90 points from Tim Atkin MW for its remarkable expression of Portuguese varieties in an African terroir.
records.varietal: Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barocca, Touriga Franca, Souzão
records.region: Calitzdorp, Klein Karoo, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose leaps forward with an abundance of black hedgerow fruits—blackberry and wild bramble—mingling with tart cranberry and ripe plum. Indigenous fynbos aromatics add a distinctly South African character, while subtle spice notes from oak integration weave through the fruit spectrum. Hints of dried herbs and Mediterranean scrubland create an intriguing complexity that invites deeper exploration.","finish":"The long finish reveals the wine's true character, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to savory notes of cigar box, black pepper, and a whisper of fynbos earthiness. The tannins remain present but refined, promising excellent evolution over the next 5-7 years.","palate":"Rolling onto the palate with generous fruit concentration, the wine delivers layers of dark berry compote, sun-ripened plums, and tart red cherry. The Portuguese varieties express their inherent structure through firm yet polished tannins, while 12 months in French oak contributes subtle vanilla and mocha undertones. Mid-palate weight is supported by bright acidity that keeps the rich fruit in balance, showcasing the Klein Karoo's ability to produce intensity without heaviness."}

records.name: Boxwood Cupola White King Street Oyster (Private Label) 2023
records.description: Boxwood Cupola White King Street Oyster (Private Label) 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Casa Dumetz Clementine Carter Grenache Blanc 2022
records.description: Casa Dumetz Clementine Carter Grenache Blanc 2022 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Reserva 2017
records.description: Viña Albina is one of Spain's oldest and most iconic wine brands, produced by the century-old Bodegas Riojanas. This Reserva represents the classical Rioja style with extended oak aging and a traditional blend of indigenous Rioja varieties from high-altitude vineyards in Rioja Alta.
records.varietal: 80% Tempranillo, 15% Mazuelo, 5% Graciano from old, high-altitude (550-700m) vineyards
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals the complexity of extended aging with aromas of ripe raisin, black cassis, and baked plum reflecting the hot, dry 2017 vintage. Classic Rioja oak influence shows prominently with notes of vanilla, coconut, cedar, and sweet baking spices from the 30 months in American oak. Additional layers include leather, tobacco, dried herbs, and a hint of balsamic complexity that develops with air. The integration of fruit and oak speaks to the wine's careful maturation.","finish":"The finish is long with persistent flavors of baked plum, sweet spice, and vanilla, complemented by subtle earthy notes and well-integrated tannins. The wine shows the classic Rioja duality of fruit ripeness and oak complexity, leaving a satisfying, slightly savory impression.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a rich, concentrated palate showing flavors of dark cherry preserves, dried fig, raisin, and plum compote balanced by savory notes of leather, earth, and dried herbs. The Tempranillo provides the core structure and red fruit character, while Mazuelo adds tannin and acidity, and Graciano contributes aromatic complexity and freshness. The American oak aging is evident but well-integrated, offering vanilla, coconut, and spice notes that complement rather than dominate. Despite the warm vintage, the wine maintains good acidity and structure."}

records.name: Noughty NA Sparkling Rose NV
records.description: Noughty NA Sparkling Rose NV is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Boxwood Tuscarora Mill Sauvignon Gris (Private Label) 2023
records.description: An elegant Virginia Sauvignon Gris from Boxwood Estate Winery, grown exclusively in the highest-elevation D-Block vineyard on a northwest-southeast exposure. This single-varietal wine showcases the pink-skinned, fleshy fruit character of Sauvignon Gris in the Middleburg AVA, following the award-winning tradition of Boxwood's previous vintages that earned silver medals at the Virginia Governor's Cup.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Powerful floral aromas define this Sauvignon Gris, with notes of honeysuckle, acacia, and white rose petals dominating the bouquet. The high-elevation vineyard site contributes to intense aromatics, with underlying scents of ripe pear, white peach, and citrus blossom. Subtle hints of wet stone and minerality reflect the terroir, while delicate spice notes add complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and layered, with floral notes returning alongside persistent stone fruit flavors. The wine's natural acidity keeps the palate fresh while the textured mouthfeel provides satisfying weight. Mineral notes emerge on the finish, reflecting the elevated vineyard site and Virginia terroir.","palate":"On the palate, this wine displays more richness and body than typical Sauvignon Blanc, a characteristic of the pink-skinned Sauvignon Gris grape. Flavors of ripe stone fruits—peach and apricot—blend with crisp apple and Asian pear, while the wine maintains refreshing acidity. The mouthfeel is round and textured, with a subtle creaminess that adds depth. Notes of Meyer lemon and grapefruit provide brightness, balanced by the wine's inherent fleshiness."}

records.name: Boxwood Gris 375 ml 2021  375 ml
records.description: Boxwood Gris 375 ml 2021  375 ml is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Boxwood Cupola 2023
records.description: The flagship wine from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, founded by former Washington Redskins owner John Kent Cooke. Cupola represents one of Virginia's finest expressions of Bordeaux-style blends, showcasing the potential of the state's emerging wine region. The 2023 vintage captures the elegance and finesse that has established Boxwood as a benchmark Virginia producer.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, and/or Petit Verdot)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents refined aromas of black cherry, cassis, and ripe plum, interlaced with notes of violet, cedar, and graphite. Subtle hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco add complexity from well-integrated oak aging. A distinctive Virginia terroir signature emerges with mineral notes and fresh herbs. The aromatics suggest careful vineyard selection and thoughtful blending, with a balance between New World fruit ripeness and Old World elegance.","finish":"Long and harmonious, with persistent dark fruit flavors and subtle oak spice. The tannins are fine and integrated, providing structure without astringency. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried herbs linger, while a mineral backbone adds length and complexity. The finish demonstrates the wine's aging potential and structural elegance.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with elegant structure and polished tannins. The palate reveals layers of blackcurrant, dark cherry, and blueberry, supported by bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. Flavors of mocha, vanilla bean, and toasted oak integrate seamlessly with the fruit. A subtle earthiness and crushed stone minerality reflect the Virginia terroir. The wine shows excellent balance and sophistication, with neither fruit nor oak dominating. The mouthfeel is plush yet refined, suggesting careful extraction and barrel selection."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Cafe de Paris Organic NV
records.description: Cafe de Paris Organic represents a casual, approachable wine crafted from organically farmed grapes. This non-vintage blend offers easy-drinking character perfect for everyday enjoyment, with the organic certification ensuring sustainable farming practices without synthetic pesticides or fertilizers.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with friendly aromas of red cherry, strawberry, and raspberry, accompanied by subtle floral notes. Light herbal nuances add freshness, while minimal oak influence allows the fruit to express itself purely. Delicate hints of spice and earth provide gentle complexity without overwhelming the wine's approachable character.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately short, with lingering red fruit notes and a refreshing quality. Soft tannins and bright acidity keep the palate lively, inviting another glass.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with soft tannins and refreshing acidity, the palate showcases bright red fruit flavors of cherry, cranberry, and red plum. The wine's organic farming origins shine through in the purity of fruit expression and balanced structure. Easy-drinking and versatile, the wine offers immediate pleasure without demanding contemplation, making it ideal for casual occasions and food pairing."}

records.name: Black Elephant Vintners Power of Love Chenin Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant and full-bodied Chenin Blanc from South Africa's Swartland region, crafted from unirrigated old bush vines. This is the second vintage of the wine, which saw a change of origin from Simonsberg to Swartland, with 5% of proceeds donated to human rights organizations.
records.varietal: 100% Chenin Blanc from unirrigated old bush vines
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with immense vibrancy and freshness, revealing generous aromas of tropical guava, ripe pineapple, and winter melon. These primary fruit notes are complemented by delicate nuances of citrus zest and hints of white pear, creating an inviting and complex bouquet that speaks to the wine's warm-climate origins.","finish":"The finish is fresh and balanced, with persistent citrus notes and a subtle minerality from the Swartland terroir. The vibrant acidity carries through, leaving a clean and refreshing impression that invites another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this Chenin Blanc truly zings with electric energy and fruit-forward character. Flavors of crisp citrus, white pear, and quince dominate the mid-palate, while yellow-fleshed peaches add a luxurious sweetness. The texture is enhanced by two months of full lees contact with regular stirring, which adds richness and a creamy mouthfeel. The lingering blood orange notes add a refreshing bitterness that balances the fruit beautifully."}

records.name: Boxwood Rose 375 ml 2023  375 ml
records.description: Boxwood Rose 375 ml 2023  375 ml is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Boxwood Trellis 2022
records.description: Boxwood Trellis 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Casablanca Valley D. Bosler Pinot Noir 2018
records.description: D. Bosler's Casablanca Valley Pinot Noir represents the excellence of Chilean cool-climate viticulture. The Casablanca Valley, located between the Pacific Ocean and the coastal mountain range, provides ideal conditions for Pinot Noir with its morning fog, cool temperatures, and afternoon breezes. The 2018 vintage has had time to develop additional complexity while maintaining its vibrant fruit character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals classic Pinot Noir aromatics with a distinctly Chilean character, featuring bright red cherry, wild strawberry, and raspberry alongside earthy notes of forest floor, dried leaves, and subtle spice. Floral hints of rose petal and violet add elegance, while underlying notes of cocoa, cola, and gentle oak provide depth. The coastal influence is evident in a subtle saline quality and fresh herbal notes. The wine's aromatics show beautiful development from the 2018 vintage.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant, with persistent red fruit notes, fine-grained tannins, and a distinctive earthy minerality. Touches of spice and dried herbs linger, while the wine's bright acidity provides a clean, refreshing conclusion. This mature Pinot Noir showcases both the variety's elegance and the terroir's unique character.","palate":"On the palate, the wine displays medium body with silky, well-integrated tannins and vibrant acidity that's characteristic of cool-climate Pinot Noir. Flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, and red currant dominate, supported by notes of black tea, earthy mushroom, and subtle baking spice. The texture is refined and elegant, with excellent balance between fruit intensity and structural elements. Oak aging has added complexity without overwhelming the delicate fruit, contributing notes of vanilla and cedar. The wine's freshness belies its age, demonstrating excellent winemaking."}

records.name: Calyptra Zahir Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
records.description: A distinguished Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon from the acclaimed Cachapoal Valley. The Zahir represents Calyptra's premium tier, crafted from select estate fruit. Previous vintages have earned 90-point scores from Wine Enthusiast, establishing this wine's pedigree for structured, age-worthy reds.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with concentrated black fruit aromas of cassis, blackberry, and dark plum, layered with notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs. Chilean Cabernet character shines through with distinctive eucalyptus and mint notes alongside graphite minerality. Subtle oak spice and vanilla add complexity without dominating the fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with fine-grained tannins and lingering notes of dark fruit, leather, and subtle herbal undertones. The 2016 vintage shows excellent aging development with seven years of bottle evolution.","palate":"Dense and powerful on the palate, displaying ripe black cherry, blackcurrant, and dark chocolate flavors framed by structured tannins. The Cachapoal Valley terroir imparts a characteristic gravelly minerality and bright acidity that lifts the rich fruit. Mid-palate weight is substantial, with integrated oak providing hints of toast and spice while maintaining fruit purity."}

records.name: O Leao Red Blend Cachapoal Valley Magnum (DC MD Only) 2019  1.5 l
records.description: This Chilean red blend from Cachapoal Valley showcases the region's warm climate with ripe fruit character and smooth tannins. The magnum format ensures slower aging and greater longevity, making it ideal for special occasions and extended cellaring.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenere, Syrah)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of ripe blackberries and dark cherries, layered with notes of vanilla and toasted oak from careful barrel aging. Subtle hints of tobacco leaf and dried herbs add complexity, while a touch of graphite minerality reflects the valley's alluvial soils. The magnum format has allowed the aromatics to develop harmoniously over time.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with dark fruit flavors lingering alongside subtle notes of espresso and dark chocolate. Fine-grained tannins provide grip without astringency, suggesting excellent aging potential in the magnum format.","palate":"On the palate, this blend delivers concentrated flavors of black plum and cassis, supported by well-integrated oak that contributes notes of cocoa and baking spices. The mid-palate shows excellent density with velvety tannins that have softened beautifully since the 2019 vintage. Bright acidity provides structure and balance, while the warm Cachapoal terroir expresses itself through lush fruit concentration."}

records.name: Calyptra Mosaiko Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
records.description: A full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon showcasing the classic intensity and structure of this noble variety. The 2021 vintage reveals concentrated black fruit character balanced with firm tannins and vibrant acidity, showing excellent aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with powerful aromas of black cherries and blackcurrant, the signature hallmark of Cabernet Sauvignon. Secondary notes of eucalyptus and mint emerge, adding complexity and freshness. Subtle hints of cedar and tobacco leaf provide an elegant Old World nuance, while dark plum undertones round out the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, showcasing the variety's characteristic tannic grip. Cedar and cigar box notes emerge on the aftertaste, typical of well-structured Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine's firm acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers full-bodied richness with high tannin structure and noticeable acidity that provides excellent backbone. Black cherry and plum flavors dominate the mid-palate, complemented by layers of blackcurrant and blackberry. The wine's concentration and phenolic depth suggest careful vineyard management and optimal ripeness at harvest. Moderate oak influence adds complexity without overwhelming the fruit expression."}

records.name: TeHo Malbec 2020
records.description: TeHo, meaning 'blood from earth' in the ancient Huarpe language, represents concentrated expression from the historic Tomal vineyard planted 75 years ago in La Consulta, Valle de Uco. This high-altitude Malbec showcases the intense character and opulent fruit that has made Argentine Malbec world-renowned.
records.varietal: 100% Malbec from 75-year-old vines in Tomal vineyard
records.region: Valle de Uco, La Consulta, Mendoza, Argentina
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Luscious and intensely aromatic, packed full of dark fruits with succulent blueberries taking center stage alongside kirsch and picked blackberries. Delicate violet notes add floral elegance, while dried herbs, sweet spices, and subtle earthiness contribute complexity. The nose is wonderfully ripe and inviting, reminiscent of sticky hedgerows in autumn.","finish":"Long and satisfying finish marked by persistent dark fruit, subtle spice, and a touch of minerality. The opulent juiciness carries through to the end, leaving impressions of ripe fruit and gentle earthiness.","palate":"Opulent and juicy on the palate with concentrated black sticky fruits and layers of complexity. The wine is lean yet focused, showing the elegant side of high-altitude Malbec without over-extraction. Ripe fruit flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and cherry meld with earthy undertones and subtle oak integration. The mouthfeel is rich but balanced, with fine-grained tannins providing structure."}

records.name: Calyptra Inedito 2020
records.description: A sophisticated Chilean red blend from the Cachapoal Valley, crafted from 64% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Merlot, and 18% Syrah. Each variety was meticulously aged in French oak barrels for 28 months, followed by 12 months of bottle aging, resulting in a wine of exceptional character and 15-year aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with an exceptional bouquet full of fresh red fruit aromas, particularly ripe cherries and plums, interwoven with forest fruits and blackberries. Delicate floral notes of violets emerge alongside mineral aspects, creating a complex aromatic tapestry. Subtle hints of graphite add depth and sophistication to the overall aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is impressively long and refined, with persistent notes of tobacco leaf and exotic spices lingering on the palate. The soft tannins continue to provide structure while maintaining elegance, leaving a lasting impression of both power and finesse that signals excellent aging potential.","palate":"On the palate, the wine reveals notable structure with soft, enveloping tannins that provide a luxurious mouthfeel. Well-balanced acidity supports the fruit core while allowing the wine's inherent elegance to shine through. The mid-palate shows concentrated dark fruit flavors accented by delicate notes of tobacco and warm baking spices, all harmoniously integrated from the extended oak maturation."}

records.name: Oceano Zero Chardonnay 2023
records.description: An ultra-premium non-alcoholic Chardonnay from Oceano Wines, sourced from the sustainably-certified Spanish Springs Vineyard along California's San Luis Obispo Coast. This dealcoholized wine maintains the character and complexity of traditional Chardonnay while offering just 6 calories per serving. The single-vineyard, single-vintage approach ensures quality comparable to traditional wines.
records.region: San Luis Obispo Coast, California (Spanish Springs Vineyard)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Straw gold in color with brilliant clarity. The nose is vibrant and aromatic, opening with ripe Meyer lemon and tangerine zest that provide bright citrus character. Delicate notes of jasmine add floral elegance, while hints of tropical fruit emerge in the background. The aromatic profile is fresh and inviting.","finish":"Persistent and refreshing with lingering citrus and melon notes. The finish is clean and invigorating, leaving the palate cleansed and satisfied.","palate":"Refreshing and well-structured with a dry, balanced profile. The palate delivers flavors of young pineapple and honeydew melon, complemented by notes of spearmint that add herbal complexity. A hint of Granny Smith apple provides crisp fruit character. The wine shows supple texture from the winemaking process, creating a satisfying mouthfeel despite the absence of alcohol. The balance between fruit, acidity, and texture is impressive."}

records.name: Calyptra Vivendo Assemblage Blend 2021
records.description: An organic Chilean red blend from Cachapoal Valley, the Vivendo Assemblage represents Calyptra's premium selection combining Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Merlot. Hand-harvested from organic vineyards and aged 26 months in French oak from Allier and Tronçais forests.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an intriguing combination of earthy complexity and ripe fruit character. Dark plum, black cherry, and mulberry aromas intertwine with notes of prune and dried fruit. Underlying earthy tones suggest forest floor and turned soil, while subtle hints of sweet spice from the extended oak aging add layers of vanilla and toast.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit and earthy mineral notes. Well-integrated tannins provide structure and grip, while a touch of espresso and dark chocolate linger. The organic viticulture shines through with pure, clean fruit expression and remarkable balance.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied on entry, the palate delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors with excellent depth. Syrah provides a spicy backbone with black pepper and dark berry notes, while Cabernet Sauvignon contributes structure and cassis flavors. The Merlot component adds plushness and dark chocolate undertones. The 26 months in French oak have integrated beautifully, providing subtle vanilla and cedar without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Oceano Low Alcohol Syrah 2023
records.description: An innovative low-alcohol Syrah crafted for health-conscious wine consumers who seek full flavor without high alcohol content. Modern winemaking techniques such as early harvesting, reverse osmosis, or spinning cone technology allow winemakers to reduce alcohol while preserving varietal character. This wine represents the growing category of lower-alcohol premium wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals fresh aromas of red cherry, raspberry, and cranberry, with subtle notes of violet, white pepper, and dried herbs. Despite lower alcohol, the wine maintains Syrah's characteristic spice and herbal complexity. Light oak influence contributes hints of vanilla and toast. A bright, fresh aromatic profile emphasizes fruit purity and varietal character, with less concentration than traditional Syrah but appealing freshness.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red fruit and peppery spice. Soft tannins and bright acidity keep the wine balanced and refreshing. The lower alcohol allows for extended drinking without palate fatigue, making this an excellent choice for warm weather or extended meals.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with soft tannins and vibrant acidity. The palate shows bright red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and red plum, complemented by subtle peppery spice and herbal notes. The lower alcohol (typically 9-11% ABV) creates a lighter, more refreshing mouthfeel while maintaining good flavor intensity. Notes of black tea, dried herbs, and a touch of cocoa add complexity without weight. The wine is surprisingly structured for its alcohol level, with balanced acidity and gentle tannins providing framework."}

records.name: Abadia de Acon Roble 2019
records.description: A modern expression of Tempranillo from Ribera del Duero's acclaimed Abadía de Acón estate. Aged five months in oak barrels, this Roble (young oak) style showcases the intense fruit of high-altitude Ribera with well-integrated wood influence. The wine represents an accessible introduction to the bigger, more powerful style of Tempranillo found in the Duero region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep, dark cherry-red color with marked purple hues, clean and brilliant. The nose is intense and very well-balanced, showing elegant notes of ripe red and black berries. Concentrated aromas of blackberry and dark cherry mingle with chocolate, liquorice, and cocoa. A spicy, toasty background emerges with hints of toffee and roasted coffee beans.","finish":"Persistent and long with lingering notes of dark fruit and spice. The finish showcases the wine's concentration and oak influence, leaving a satisfying impression of ripe fruit and coffee.","palate":"Full-bodied, rich and oaky with lip-staining sweet black fruit dominating the palate. The wine is powerful, lively and tasty with attractive layers of ripe fruit accompanied by chocolate, liquorice and cocoa flavors. Notes of vanilla and toast from oak aging integrate seamlessly with the fruit. The texture is dense and mouth-coating, yet the wine maintains balance through refreshing acidity."}

records.name: Adir Grenache Blanc Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: Adir's Mevushal Grenache Blanc represents premium kosher winemaking, showcasing this Mediterranean variety's aromatic complexity and textural richness. The mevushal designation indicates the wine has been flash-pasteurized to maintain kosher status while preserving fruit character. This is a unique expression of Grenache Blanc that combines varietal typicity with the requirements of traditional kosher wine production.
records.region: Mediterranean region (likely Israel or Southern France)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an enticing array of white flowers, including honeysuckle and acacia, alongside aromas of white peach, pear, and citrus blossom. Subtle herbal notes of fennel and dried thyme add Mediterranean character, while hints of almond and mineral provide complexity. The aromatics display impressive intensity and purity despite the mevushal process, with a distinctive floral lift characteristic of quality Grenache Blanc.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of citrus, white flowers, and a subtle mineral quality. The wine's refreshing acidity ensures a bright conclusion while maintaining the variety's characteristic richness. This is a well-crafted kosher white that showcases Grenache Blanc's unique personality.","palate":"On the palate, this Grenache Blanc shows medium to full body with generous flavors of ripe stone fruit, particularly apricot and yellow peach, complemented by notes of Meyer lemon and honeydew melon. The wine displays excellent texture and weight, with a slightly oily, glycerin-rich mouthfeel that's typical of the variety. Bright acidity provides balance to the fruit richness, while subtle notes of white pepper and herbs add savory complexity. The wine's roundness and approachability make it exceptionally food-friendly."}

records.name: Albina Essencia Tinto Reserva 2011
records.description: A critically acclaimed Rioja Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, earning 93 points from both Guía Peñín and Wine Advocate, placing it among the top 3% of wines worldwide on Vivino. This traditional Rioja blend of Tempranillo and Graciano showcases extended aging and classic regional character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays intense cherry red color with terracotta hues that signal maturity and extended aging. A powerful bouquet emerges with red berries—raspberry, strawberry, and red cherry—harmonized with dried prune-type fruit that adds concentrated sweetness. Barrel aromas stand out prominently, showcasing vanilla, dark chocolate, licorice root, and complex spice notes including cinnamon, clove, and black pepper. The oak integration is masterful, adding layers of complexity while preserving the wine's fruit character.","finish":"Long and complex, with red fruit flavors gradually giving way to chocolate, licorice, and savory spice notes. The wine's excellent structure ensures a persistent finish that evolves in the glass.","palate":"Great structure announces itself from the powerful entry, with concentrated fruit balanced by good natural acidity that provides lift and longevity. The palate is elegant and remarkably well-balanced, showcasing red berry fruit interwoven with chocolate, vanilla, and savory spice from extended barrel aging. The Tempranillo provides the wine's backbone and red fruit character, while Graciano adds freshness, aromatic complexity, and age-worthiness. The texture is smooth and evolved, with tannins fully integrated after years of aging, creating a wine of sophistication and harmony."}

records.name: Sky Devil Rose 2022
records.description: A vibrant and refreshing rosé from Washington State, Sky Devil showcases the crisp elegance of Pacific Northwest winemaking. This 2022 vintage captures bright fruit character with mineral undertones, offering approachable sophistication perfect for warm weather enjoyment.
records.varietal: Rosé blend (likely Grenache, Syrah, or Mourvèdre-based)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of fresh strawberry and watermelon, layered with delicate white peach and hints of rose petals. Subtle notes of citrus zest add brightness, while a whisper of wet stone provides depth. As the wine breathes, nuances of wild herbs and red currant emerge, creating an inviting aromatic profile that promises refreshment.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing, with lingering notes of strawberry and citrus. A subtle minerality persists, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next sip. The bright acidity ensures a mouthwatering conclusion that invites another glass.","palate":"On the palate, this rosé delivers crisp acidity balanced with fresh red fruit flavors. Ripe strawberry and raspberry dance alongside tangy cranberry, while underlying notes of pink grapefruit add citrus vibrancy. The mid-palate reveals gentle watermelon sweetness and mineral salinity, creating a dry yet fruit-forward profile. The wine's medium body and bright character make it incredibly food-friendly and sessionable."}

records.name: Alfaro Family Vineyards A  Estate Chardonnay 2021
records.description: A crisp, fruit-forward Chardonnay from Santa Cruz Mountains estate vineyards, showcasing the cool-climate elegance of California's coastal appellations. Small-production wine from this family-owned winery reflects careful vineyard selection and minimal intervention winemaking.
records.region: Santa Cruz Mountains, California (Estate vineyards in Corralitos area)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inviting aromas of ripe yellow orchard fruits open the bouquet. Fresh pear and golden apple lead, followed by white peach and nectarine notes. Subtle hints of lemon curd add brightness, while delicate honeyed oak provides just enough richness without overwhelming the fruit. Faint white flower and mineral notes add complexity.","finish":"Clean, bright finish with lingering citrus and apple notes. A mineral quality emerges at the end, providing freshness and length.","palate":"The palate is crisp and refreshing with vibrant acidity driving the wine forward. Intense flavors of pear, green apple, and white peach fill the mid-palate with concentrated fruit character. Lemon curd and subtle vanilla oak add layers of complexity while maintaining freshness. The wine balances richness with elegance, showing restraint in oak usage that allows the pure fruit expression to shine."}

records.name: Alella Vinicola Super Marfil
records.description: A premium white wine from the historic Alella Vinícola cooperative, established in 1906 as one of Spain's first winemaking cooperatives. The iconic Marfil brand has captivated Barcelona and beyond since the 1920s, produced in a stunning modernist winery designed by Jeroni Martorell in 1906. This wine showcases the DO Alella region's signature grape, Pansa Blanca (known as Xarel·lo elsewhere).
records.varietal: Primarily Pansa Blanca (Xarel·lo), potentially blended with other authorized DO Alella varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals the classic aromatic profile of Pansa Blanca with bright citrus notes, white flowers, and subtle Mediterranean herbs. Stone fruit aromas of white peach and apricot emerge, complemented by a distinctive coastal minerality that speaks to the wine's proximity to the Mediterranean just north of Barcelona. Delicate hints of almond blossom add elegance.","finish":"The finish is crisp and refreshing with persistent citrus and mineral notes. A subtle saline quality lingers, reminiscent of the nearby Mediterranean, while the wine's natural acidity provides a clean, mouth-watering conclusion that pairs beautifully with food.","palate":"On the palate, the wine displays vibrant acidity characteristic of DO Alella whites, with flavors of green apple, lemon zest, and white peach. The rocky limestone and granite soils of the region impart a pronounced mineral quality and saline edge. The mid-palate shows good weight and texture while maintaining freshness, a hallmark of quality Pansa Blanca."}

records.name: Antonio Facchin Prosecco Rosato 2024
records.description: Antonio Facchin Prosecco Rosato 2024 is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Aresca Fiore d Atunno Moscato dAsti 2020
records.description: A delicately sweet, lightly sparkling Moscato d'Asti from Piedmont's renowned Asti region. This 'Autumn Flower' (Fiore d'Autunno) captures the aromatic intensity and gentle effervescence that make Moscato d'Asti a beloved dessert wine worldwide.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic with intoxicating notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and jasmine. The nose is dominated by fresh peach, apricot, and ripe Muscat grape, with underlying hints of lychee, rose water, and honey. There's a citrus element of mandarin orange and Meyer lemon zest, while subtle spice notes of ginger and white pepper add complexity.","finish":"The finish is sweet and aromatic, with lingering notes of peach, honey, and orange blossom. The gentle effervescence continues to lift the flavors, leaving the palate with a clean, slightly honeyed impression.","palate":"Light-bodied and gently sparkling (frizzante), with fine bubbles that create a soft, creamy mousse on the palate. The wine is sweet but balanced by refreshing acidity that prevents cloying. Flavors mirror the aromatics—ripe peach, apricot nectar, and honeyed Muscat grape—with additional notes of candied citrus peel and tropical fruit. The low alcohol (typically 5-6%) makes this wine delicate and easy-drinking, while the persistent bubbles add textural interest."}

records.name: Aratas Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: Aratas Sauvignon Blanc 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2010
records.description: A historic Petite Sirah from Aratas that received the highest rating Wine Spectator had given to a Petite Sirah in over 30 years. Publisher Marvin Shanken's 91-point score and Editor's Pick designation marked this wine as exceptional. Now available as a library selection, this fully mature Petite Sirah showcases the variety's ability to age gracefully while maintaining power and intensity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep, dark and opaque in the glass with a mesmerizing, inky appearance. The bouquet is expressive and layered, opening with concentrated aromas of plum, blackberry, and dark cherry. Notes of black licorice add complexity alongside darker chocolate undertones. Floral hints of violet emerge, providing elegance to the powerful fruit core. The aromatic intensity is captivating.","finish":"Very long lasting finish with persistent fruit and earthy tannins. The wine's intensity carries through to a satisfying conclusion, with layers of fruit, spice, and tannin that linger impressively.","palate":"Very well layered with exceptional intensity of fruit flavors that coat the palate. The wine delivers waves of ripe plum, blackberry, and dark cherry supported by notes of licorice and dark chocolate. Despite the power, the wine maintains balance and structure. Somewhat earthy tannins anchor the fruit, providing grip and aging potential. The texture is dense and mouth-filling, characteristic of premium Petite Sirah."}

records.name: Two Mountain Rawn Rose   250 ml
records.description: A vibrant rosé from the Rawn brothers' family winery in Washington's Yakima Valley Rattlesnake Hills, drawing on four generations of farming experience. This elegant rosé earned praise from the brothers with a playful nod: 'Provence called and said, Not bad, Americans!' - a testament to its quality and finesse.
records.varietal: Blend of red grape varieties (specific composition varies by vintage)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine blooms with ripe wild strawberry leading the aromatic profile, accented by a touch of watermelon and hints of fragrant violet. The nose is fresh and inviting, capturing the essence of summer berries with floral elegance that rivals traditional Provence rosés.","finish":"Clean and fruit-driven finish with lingering berry notes and balanced acid that keeps the palate refreshed. The finish shows excellent length for a rosé, inviting another sip.","palate":"The palate bursts with rich red fruit expression, showing concentrated strawberry and raspberry flavors balanced by vibrant, well-integrated acidity. The fruit is ripe but never cloying, with excellent tension between richness and freshness. The wine demonstrates versatility and sophistication, with a texture that's both refreshing and satisfying."}
