records.name: Hertelendy Chardonnay 2015
records.description: A mature Hungarian Chardonnay from the Hertelendy estate, showcasing the potential of Central European Chardonnay with nearly a decade of aging. The 2015 vintage has developed complex tertiary characteristics while maintaining the bright acidity typical of cool-climate Hungarian wines. This wine represents an interesting alternative to more familiar Chardonnay regions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents evolved aromas of baked apple, poached pear, and honeyed apricot, layered with notes of toasted hazelnut, butterscotch, and crème brûlée from oak aging. Tertiary development brings hints of dried flowers, chamomile, and beeswax. A subtle mineral quality and wet stone character add complexity, while restrained oxidative notes suggest careful cellaring. The aromatic profile shows the wine's maturity while maintaining freshness and elegance.","finish":"Long and contemplative, with lingering flavors of toasted nuts, honeyed fruit, and subtle oak. The acidity provides lift and structure, while a mineral quality and gentle phenolic grip add complexity. The finish shows the wine's maturity and integration, with all elements in harmony.","palate":"Medium-bodied with creamy texture and well-integrated acidity. Flavors of baked orchard fruit, lemon curd, and toasted almond dominate, complemented by notes of vanilla, caramel, and subtle oak spice. The wine shows excellent development with oxidative characteristics adding complexity—think white mushroom, salted butter, and brioche. Hungarian Chardonnays typically retain higher acidity than warmer climate examples, and this wine's bright acid backbone keeps it balanced despite its age. A distinctive mineral quality and saline finish reflect the terroir."}

records.name: Chateau Puy Laborde Bordeaux Superieur 2019
records.description: A balanced and approachable Bordeaux Supérieur representing excellent value from this classic French region. This blend showcases traditional Bordeaux varieties with smooth fruit, integrated oak, and versatile food-pairing capabilities.
records.varietal: Blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents an intense purple color, introducing a nose packed with elegant fruit and floral aromas. Red and dark fruits dominate, with blackberry leading alongside touches of dark cherry and plum. A little leather adds complexity and Old World character, while the floral elements provide lift and aromatic interest. The oak integration is subtle, contributing vanilla smoothness without overwhelming the fruit expression. The overall impression is one of elegance and balance rather than power.","finish":"Medium finish with balanced fruit and subtle oak influence. The tannins are soft and integrated, while the acidity provides a clean, refreshing conclusion. Notes of dark fruit and subtle spice linger pleasantly.","palate":"Generous and well-rounded on the palate, the wine shows supple and melted tannins that provide structure without astringency. Blackberry fruits touched by vanilla smoothness create a harmonious mid-palate, while the acidity and spice work together to provide balance and vibrancy. The texture is medium-bodied with good depth, showing the characteristic roundness of a successful Bordeaux blend. The fruit remains present throughout, supported by moderate tannins and medium-plus acidity that keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly."}

records.name: Black Elephant Vintners Cap Classique Brut
records.description: Black Elephant Vintners Cap Classique Brut is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Bernard Gaucher Champagne NV
records.description: A distinguished grower Champagne showcasing 90% Pinot Noir with 10% Chardonnay, earning gold medals at the prestigious Concours Mondial de Bruxelles in both 2014 and 2015. This Brut Réserve expression demonstrates the power and richness possible from Pinot Noir-dominant Champagne, offering exceptional value from an underrated producer.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bold and immediately engaging, opening with strong mineral accents and honeysuckle aromatics that signal quality. Brioche and toasted hazelnut notes from extended lees aging intertwine with fresh citrus—particularly lemon and lime—while a subtle sweet earthiness adds depth. Ripe fruit aromas of baked apple and ripe pear emerge with air, complemented by delicate floral notes and a distinctive stony, petrol-like minerality that speaks to terroir.","finish":"Great persistence through the long finish, with citrus and mineral notes gradually giving way to subtle brioche and almond. A slight pleasant bitterness on the tail adds sophistication and cleansing freshness.","palate":"Fruit-driven and mouth-filling, the palate showcases the Pinot Noir dominance through rich, round flavors balanced by wonderful acidity. Layers of crisp apple and bright grapefruit provide freshness, while lychee and pear add exotic fruit complexity. The texture is elegant yet substantial, with fine persistent bubbles creating a creamy mouthfeel. Yeasty autolytic character adds savory depth, while the mineral backbone keeps everything lifted and vibrant. The balance between richness and refreshing acidity creates a Champagne of impressive versatility."}

records.name: Chateau Josephine Chardonnay Macabeo Blend Mevushal (MD & DC) 2024
records.description: Chateau Josephine Chardonnay Macabeo Blend Mevushal (MD & DC) 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Beefsteak Malbec 2019
records.description: An award-winning Malbec from high-altitude Mendoza vineyards, inspired by 18th-century dining clubs that celebrated the beefsteak as a symbol of liberty and prosperity. This wine showcases the bright, smooth character of classic high-altitude Argentine Malbec with careful oak aging for richness and complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is attractive and expressive with aromas of bramble, elderberry, and ripe black cherry, complemented by violet and rose petal top notes that are characteristic of quality Malbec. A little pepper adds spice, while oak aging contributes lush vanilla and gently spiced aromatics including cinnamon and clove that balance the wine's dark fruit character.","finish":"The finish is long and smooth with persistent dark fruit flavors, vanilla, and gentle spice notes. The soft tannins carry through to the end, leaving a warm, satisfying impression.","palate":"The palate is bright, smooth, and approachable, showcasing succulent dark berry fruit including blackberry, plum, and black cherry. The wine has a rich and layered mouthfeel with a creamy texture and soft tannins that provide structure without harshness. Juicy ripe black-fruit notes are balanced by delicious freshness and acidity that keeps the wine lively and food-friendly."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Blanco Barrel Fermented 2023

records.name: Terra Nostra Corse 2021
records.description: A distinctive Corsican red wine showcasing the island's indigenous varieties. Corsica's warm Mediterranean climate with 2,750 annual sunshine hours and diverse soils create wines with concentrated flavors and distinctive regional character. This vintage benefits from the island's dry harvest conditions and emphasis on quality-focused, temperature-controlled winemaking.
records.varietal: Likely Nielluccio and/or Sciacarello (Corsican indigenous varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with pronounced notes of wild Mediterranean herbs and garrigue, characteristic of Corsica's spice wines. Dried red berries intermingle with savory elements of black pepper and juniper, while subtle hints of scrubland vegetation and sun-warmed stones add complexity. The aromatic profile reflects the island's unique terroir with a distinctive spicy character that has earned Nielluccio recognition as the 'spice wine of France.'","finish":"The finish is moderately long with lingering spice notes and a touch of minerality that reflects the diverse Corsican terroir. Red fruit echoes persist alongside dried herb and white pepper accents, leaving a clean, refreshing impression typical of the island's youthful red wines.","palate":"On the palate, this medium-bodied red delivers bright red cherry and wild strawberry flavors supported by earthy undertones of mushroom and dried herbs. The wine's structure shows good acidity balanced with gentle tannins, typical of wines from Corsica's schist and granite soils. Savory notes of cured meat and Mediterranean scrub provide depth, while the natural fruit concentration from the dry, sunny growing season gives the wine approachable richness without heaviness."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2018
records.description: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Castoro Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon 375ml 2020  375 ml
records.description: A half-bottle (375ml) of Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon from the esteemed Whale Rock Vineyard. This broad-shouldered wine showcases the power and richness that Paso Robles Cabernet can achieve, with formidable aging potential despite its approachable nature.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from estate Whale Rock Vineyard
records.region: Paso Robles, Whale Rock Vineyard, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is rich and inviting with aromas of black currant, blackberry, and plum creating a dark fruit core. Mocha, cocoa, and woodsmoke notes from aging in American and French oak add complexity, while subtle hints of cassis and dark berry provide additional depth.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit, chocolate, and oak spice notes. The tannins are well-integrated, carrying through with excellent balance.","palate":"The palate is packed with black fruit and raspberry flavors framed by mocha nuances from oak aging. Flavors of boysenberry, plum, and dark chocolate create richness, while integrated oak adds vanilla and toasted notes. The wine's structure is broad-shouldered with ripe tannins that provide backbone without harshness, creating a mouthfeel that is both powerful and refined."}

records.name: Sutherland Rose 2023
records.description: A refreshing rosé likely from South Africa's cool-climate Sutherland region, one of the highest and coldest wine-growing areas in the country. This wine captures the crisp acidity and bright fruit character that defines cool-climate rosé production.
records.varietal: Undetermined (possibly Cinsault, Pinotage, or Pinot Noir-based)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate aromatics of fresh strawberry and raspberry dominate, complemented by notes of watermelon and pink grapefruit. Floral hints of rose petal and orange blossom add elegance, while a subtle herbal character—fresh mint and basil—provides complexity. There's a mineral undertone suggesting the unique terroir of high-altitude viticulture.","finish":"The finish is fresh and lively, with lingering berry fruit and citrus notes. A subtle bitter almond character on the tail adds complexity, while the wine's natural acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with vibrant acidity that makes this wine refreshing and food-friendly. The palate shows bright red berry flavors—wild strawberry, cranberry, and red currant—with a citrus edge of pink grapefruit and blood orange. The wine is dry with just a hint of residual sweetness that balances the acidity. A subtle salinity and mineral quality add interest, while the texture is crisp and clean."}

records.name: Cobden Wini Rose Paddys Blend 2024
records.description: A vibrant Australian rosé from Victoria's cool-climate wine regions, showcasing the fresh, fruit-forward style that characterizes modern Australian rosé production. This 2024 vintage captures the essence of a recent harvest, offering immediate drinkability and bright, approachable character. The Paddy's Blend name suggests a unique proprietary blend that reflects the producer's distinctive winemaking vision.
records.varietal: Proprietary blend (likely Grenache, Pinot Noir, or regional varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and expressive aromatics jump from the glass with intense notes of fresh watermelon, ripe strawberries, and ruby red grapefruit. The nose shows youthful exuberance with hints of rose hip and cranberry, while subtle undertones of white pepper and fresh-cut grass add complexity. A delicate floral note reminiscent of hibiscus and a touch of minerality round out this inviting aromatic profile that speaks to the wine's cool-climate origins.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of citrus zest and red berries. Bright acidity leaves the palate cleansed and energized, perfect for another sip or pairing with food.","palate":"Crisp and lively on the palate, this rosé bursts with juicy flavors of fresh strawberry, watermelon candy, and blood orange, supported by mouthwatering acidity that provides excellent structure. The wine's light to medium body carries vibrant fruit flavors without heaviness, while notes of pomegranate and tart cherry add depth. A subtle saline quality and hint of crushed herbs provide savory balance to the bright fruit, creating a refreshing, food-friendly profile typical of quality Australian rosés designed for immediate enjoyment."}

records.description: Bonelli La Madre Terra Brut Rose is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Boplaas Gamka Red 2021
records.description: This Double Gold award-winning red blend from South Africa's Klein Karoo region represents Boplaas Family Vineyards' Portuguese-led flagship. Crafted from low-yield, old vines and aged in French oak, the Gamka Red combines power with elegance. The 2021 vintage earned Double Gold at the 2023 National Wine Challenge, cementing its status as one of South Africa's premier Portuguese-variety blends.
records.region: Klein Karoo, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is expressive and layered, revealing concentrated aromas of black hedgerow fruits, wild blackberry, and dark plum. Tart cranberry notes add brightness, while exotic spice elements—cinnamon, clove, and white pepper—contribute complexity. Subtle undertones of violet, dark chocolate, and toasted oak complete the aromatic bouquet.","finish":"The finish is long and savoury, with persistent notes of dark fruit, exotic spices, and fine-grained tannins. Oak influence is present but well-integrated, adding structure and complexity. The wine's intensity and depth suggest excellent aging potential while remaining approachable now.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured, with intense dark fruit flavors anchored by fine oak tannins. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barocca, and Shiraz creates a savory, complex palate with layers of blackberry, plum, and black cherry. Traditional vinification methods and 16 months in new French oak have produced integrated tannins that provide grip without harshness. The wine shows excellent concentration from old vines while maintaining balance and elegance."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Bonelli Bonarda Amabile (Frizzante, Semi Sweet) 2023
records.description: A delightful semi-sweet, lightly sparkling red wine from Emilia-Romagna's Colli Piacentini DOC. Made from 100% Croatina grapes (locally called Bonarda) using the Charmat method, this wine offers a unique, approachable style perfect as an aperitif or with fruit-based desserts.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense ruby red color with violet highlights catches the eye immediately. The nose releases delicate and pleasant aromas dominated by characteristic violet florals and fresh red cherry. Sweet berry notes of strawberry and raspberry add fruitiness, while subtle hints of rose petal provide additional floral complexity. The gentle effervescence carries the aromatics beautifully.","finish":"Soft, fruity finish with lingering violet and cherry notes. The gentle sparkle refreshes the palate, inviting the next sip.","palate":"Pleasantly sweet and full-bodied with persistent flavor. The slight sparkle (frizzante) adds lively freshness and prevents the sweetness from becoming cloying. Red cherry and berry fruits dominate the palate with genuine, unadulterated fruit character. The medium body and gentle bubbles create a smooth, velvety texture that's immediately appealing. Low tannins and moderate acidity balance the residual sugar perfectly."}

records.name: Boxwood Ellie Bird Rose (Private Label) 2023
records.description: Boxwood Ellie Bird Rose (Private Label) 2023 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi Sacrantino 2019
records.description: A powerful expression of Sagrantino di Montefalco, one of Italy's most structured and age-worthy red wines. This wine from Cantina Fratelli Pardi showcases the intense tannins and concentrated fruit that make Sagrantino legendary among collectors and enthusiasts.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense and complex, the nose reveals concentrated dark fruit—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—alongside notes of black tea, dried violets, and dark chocolate. There's a distinctive earthy quality with truffle, leather, and tobacco leaf emerging. Oak aging contributes vanilla, toasted oak, and sweet baking spices. Hints of tar, licorice, and dried herbs add further complexity.","finish":"Exceptionally long and persistent, the finish showcases the wine's structure with firm but fine-grained tannins that linger for minutes. Dark fruit, bitter chocolate, and a hint of iron or blood orange remain, along with the characteristic astringency that defines young Sagrantino.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerfully structured, this wine showcases Sagrantino's legendary tannins, which are firm and gripping yet refined from aging. The palate is dense with flavors of blackberry jam, cassis, and preserved plum, supported by notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and balsamic. Despite the intensity, there's balance from bright acidity and underlying minerality. The wine's concentration is remarkable, with layers of fruit, earth, and spice unfolding with each sip."}

records.name: Boxwood Gris 375 ml 2023  375 ml
records.description: An expressive Sauvignon Gris from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, crafted from 100% estate-grown grapes. This pink-skinned varietal creates a voluptuous, single-varietal wine with powerful floral aromatics and excellent structure. Recent vintages have earned critical acclaim, including 91 points from James Suckling and a silver medal at the 2022 Best of Loudoun wine competition.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is aromatic and distinctive, revealing a characteristic slate or 'wet rock' minerality that defines this wine. Vibrant citrus notes of fresh orange and lemon zest mingle with delicate spring-time flowers and white blossoms. Layers of ripe pear, almond, and a touch of honey add richness, while the wine's powerful floral character—hallmark of the pink-skinned Sauvignon Gris varietal—provides elegance and lift.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus zest, pear, and wet stone minerality. The wine's crisp acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated.","palate":"The palate exhibits good weight and a voluptuous texture, supported by crisp-apple acidity that provides structure and balance. Flavors of ripe pear, citrus, and almond dominate, while the wine's mineral core—wet stones and crushed gravel—adds textural interest and reinforces the terroir's influence. The balanced structure ensures that richness and freshness coexist in perfect harmony, creating a wine that is both generous and refined."}

records.name: Chateau de Cor Bugeaud Rose
records.description: Chateau de Cor Bugeaud Rose is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Boxwood Sauvignon Blanc 375 ml 2023  375 ml
records.description: An elegant Virginia Sauvignon Blanc from Boxwood Estate in the Middleburg AVA, this half-bottle showcases the potential for world-class wine production in Virginia's emerging wine country. Boxwood's meticulous viticulture and winemaking creates a vibrant, terroir-driven expression that competes with top Sauvignon Blancs from established regions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is vibrant and expressive, opening with intense aromas of fresh grapefruit, lime zest, and gooseberry. Notes of passion fruit and white peach add tropical dimension, while herbaceous hints of freshly cut grass, tomato leaf, and elderflower provide classic Sauvignon Blanc character. A distinctive mineral quality reminiscent of crushed stone and wet slate adds complexity, reflecting Virginia's unique terroir.","finish":"The finish is crisp, clean, and remarkably long, with persistent citrus and mineral notes. Hints of grapefruit pith and fresh herbs linger, while the wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for food or another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with electric acidity, this Sauvignon Blanc is both refreshing and sophisticated. The palate bursts with citrus flavors of grapefruit and lemon, complemented by tropical notes of guava and green melon. Herbaceous elements of fresh herbs and green bell pepper add complexity without overwhelming the fruit. A pronounced mineral streak runs through the core, providing structure and length, while the wine's crisp acidity keeps everything focused and lively. The texture is lean yet not austere, with subtle weight that comes from quality fruit rather than manipulation."}

records.name: Castoro Cellars Charbono 2022
records.description: A unique and treat-worthy wine from Castoro Cellars' CCOF certified organic Whale Rock Vineyard in the Templeton Gap of Paso Robles. Charbono is a rare variety, making this wine a distinctive addition to any cellar. The winery has earned acclaim for its Charbono, with the 2020 Whale Rock Reserve earning 92 points and Editors' Choice from Wine Enthusiast.
records.region: Whale Rock Vineyard, Templeton Gap, Paso Robles, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays intense aromatics of black cherry, spice, and plum, complemented by notes of toasted oak from barrel aging. Blueberry and blackberry add dark fruit complexity, while subtle hints of vanilla, cedar, and sweet tobacco from oak contribute depth. Earthy undertones and dried herb notes speak to the organic viticulture, while a touch of graphite and mineral adds refinement.","finish":"The finish is lengthy and satisfying with persistent dark fruit flavors and subtle oak spice. Soft tannins provide gentle structure, while the wine's richness and complexity linger beautifully. This is a memorable conclusion that showcases why Charbono is worth seeking out.","palate":"On the palate, the wine delivers rich flavors of blueberry, plum, and black cherry as the core fruit profile. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak add complexity without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows good concentration and weight from the organic Whale Rock fruit, with a silky texture and soft, well-integrated tannins. Despite its richness, the wine maintains balance and elegance, showing the refined character that earned critical acclaim for Castoro's Charbono program."}

records.name: Colle Corviano Cerasuolo Rose 2024
records.description: An authentic Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo rosé from Italy's Abruzzo region, crafted entirely from Montepulciano grapes. This wine exemplifies the distinctive cherry-red color and robust character that sets Cerasuolo apart from lighter rosés, earning its own DOC designation in 2010. The 2024 vintage captures the wine's signature combination of depth and freshness that makes this style a favorite among rosé enthusiasts seeking more substantial flavor profiles.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals characteristically intense aromatics of ripe strawberry and dried cherry, layered with distinctive notes of orange peel and cinnamon that define quality Cerasuolo. The wine's deeper color from Montepulciano's highly pigmented skins contributes to more concentrated aromatics than typical rosés, with hints of raspberry leaf and crushed red berries. Subtle floral notes of wild rose and a whisper of Mediterranean herbs add complexity to this aromatic, inviting profile.","finish":"The finish is substantial and lingering, with persistent notes of dried cherry, orange peel, and spice. Unlike lighter rosés that fade quickly, this Cerasuolo maintains presence on the palate with its structured tannins and bright acidity, leaving a satisfying, food-friendly impression.","palate":"Medium-bodied and notably heartier than most rosés, this Cerasuolo delivers robust flavors of strawberry, dried cherry, and red currant, supported by the structure and tannin presence that comes from the Montepulciano grape's thick skins. Distinctive notes of orange zest, cinnamon spice, and hints of pomegranate create the complex flavor profile praised by experts like Joe Bastianich. The wine maintains excellent acidity to balance its fruit intensity, with savory undertones of dried herbs and a mineral edge that reflects the Abruzzo terroir, particularly from the mountainous L'Aquila province."}

records.name: Castoro Cellars Zinfandel 2021
records.description: Castoro Cellars Zinfandel 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Castoro Cellars White Wine Can   250 ml
records.description: A refreshing canned white wine from Paso Robles' pioneering Castoro Cellars, crafted from organically grown grapes. This portable format preserves the wine's freshness and vibrancy, making it perfect for outdoor adventures, picnics, or casual enjoyment where convenience meets quality.
records.varietal: White blend, likely including Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier, and other aromatic white varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and inviting aromas of key lime and tangerine leap from the glass, accompanied by white peach and hints of freshly cut grass. The bouquet carries notes of kiwi and rainy concrete minerality, giving the wine a crisp, refreshing quality that awakens the senses.","finish":"Clean and energetic finish with lingering citrus notes and a refreshing mineral quality. The finish is brisk and leaves the palate feeling invigorated, making you reach for the next sip.","palate":"The palate is dry yet fruit-forward, bursting with zesty citrus flavors centered around lime peel and juicy stone fruit. A stony mineral grip provides structure and definition, while lively acidity powers through the mid-palate, creating a mouthwatering sensation. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit expression and crisp freshness."}

records.name: Chateau de Cor Bugeaud White Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: Chateau de Cor Bugeaud White Mevushal (MD & DC) is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Knuttel Family Wines Tentadora Malbec 2017
records.description: A distinguished Argentine Malbec showcasing the deep color, intense fruity flavors, and velvety texture that characterize premium wines from this region. The 2017 vintage offers additional complexity from bottle age, with the wine developing secondary characteristics while maintaining the juicy fruit notes and violet aromas typical of quality Malbec. This wine represents the aging potential that has made Argentine Malbec rival its French counterparts in critical acclaim.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with intense aromas of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and plum, layered with the distinctive violet and floral notes that define quality Argentine Malbec. As the wine has aged, secondary aromas of leather, tobacco leaf, and dark chocolate have emerged, adding complexity to the youthful fruit. Hints of vanilla and sweet spice from oak aging integrate beautifully, while subtle notes of dried herbs and graphite provide depth. The wine's deep, inky color is reflected in the intensity and concentration of its aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is impressively long and layered, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually revealing notes of leather, cocoa, and sweet spice. Soft, integrated tannins provide structure while the wine's velvety texture lingers, demonstrating the aging potential that has earned high-altitude Argentine Malbecs scores above 95 points from major critics.","palate":"Rich and plush on the palate, this Malbec delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry compote, dark plum, and black cherry, supported by the soft, velvety tannins that characterize premium Argentine production. The wine's full body is balanced by fresh acidity that maintains structure and prevents heaviness, while the mid-palate reveals complexity with notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and hints of blueberry. Oak aging contributes layers of vanilla, cinnamon, and toasted spice, while the wine's natural fruit concentration creates a juicy, fruit-forward profile with savory undertones of black olive and dried herbs."}

records.name: Central Valley Banner Day Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: Central Valley Banner Day Sauvignon Blanc 2022 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Frascole Chianti Rufina Riserva 2017
records.description: An elegant Chianti Rufina Riserva from the esteemed Frascole estate, representing one of Chianti's most refined sub-zones. Rufina is known for producing Chianti with exceptional aging potential and distinctive character from its high-altitude vineyards northeast of Florence.
records.varietal: Primarily Sangiovese with possible small additions of Canaiolo, Colorino
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic Chianti aromatics of red cherry and violet are complemented by more complex notes developed from Riserva aging. The bouquet shows layers of dried cherry, plum, and cranberry alongside earthy elements of leather, tobacco, and forest floor. Oak influence is subtle and integrated, contributing vanilla, cedar, and sweet spice. Herbal notes of sage and dried oregano add a Tuscan character, while hints of balsamic and tea leaf provide depth.","finish":"Long and sophisticated, with the fruit and earth elements in beautiful harmony. Red cherry and dried herb notes persist, accompanied by fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. A subtle note of orange peel and anise emerges at the very end.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with the structured elegance that defines Rufina. The palate reveals bright red fruit—cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate—balanced by savory notes of dried herbs, mushroom, and cured meat. The acidity is vibrant and mouthwatering, typical of the cooler Rufina climate, while the tannins are firm but refined from extended aging. Underlying minerality and a hint of iron add complexity, while the oak is well-integrated, providing support without dominating."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Central Valley Banner Day Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: A robust California Cabernet Sauvignon from the Central Valley, this wine delivers approachable fruit-forward character with smooth tannins. The warm Central Valley climate produces ripe, concentrated fruit that makes for an immediately enjoyable red wine with classic varietal character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bold aromas of blackcurrant and ripe blackberry leap from the glass, immediately announcing this wine's generous fruit character. Underlying notes of dark cherry and plum add depth, while hints of cedar, tobacco leaf, and sweet vanilla from oak aging provide complexity. A subtle suggestion of dried herbs and dark chocolate rounds out the aromatic profile, creating an inviting and layered bouquet.","finish":"The finish is warm and lingering, with persistent dark fruit flavors accompanied by notes of vanilla and subtle spice. Soft tannins carry through to the end, leaving a smooth, satisfying conclusion that showcases the wine's approachable nature.","palate":"The palate is full-bodied and richly textured, opening with concentrated flavors of black fruit compote and cassis. Mid-palate notes of blackberry jam, dark cherry, and hints of mocha create a plush, velvety mouthfeel. Well-integrated tannins provide structure without harshness, while the wine's moderate acidity keeps it balanced and prevents it from feeling heavy. Touches of vanilla, toasted oak, and baking spices add dimension throughout."}

records.name: Champagne Bauget-Jouette Blanc de Blancs 2016
records.description: An elegant vintage Champagne crafted entirely from Chardonnay grapes, Bauget-Jouette's Blanc de Blancs 2016 exemplifies the finesse and precision of this prestigious style. With extended aging on lees, this wine has developed complexity and refinement while maintaining the vibrant freshness that makes great Champagne so captivating.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with refined aromas of green apple, white peach, and citrus zest, elevated by the wine's fine, persistent mousse. With aeration, layers of brioche, toasted almond, and fresh-baked pastry emerge, testament to its extended lees aging. Delicate notes of white flowers, particularly acacia and hawthorn, add elegance, while subtle hints of chalky minerality and sea spray speak to the terroir. A whisper of honey and lemon curd adds richness without heaviness.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and precise, with lingering citrus, mineral, and toasted bread notes. The wine's remarkable balance leaves a lasting impression of elegance and complexity, with a subtle nuttiness and vibrant freshness persisting well after the glass is empty.","palate":"On the palate, this Blanc de Blancs is beautifully structured with racy acidity and an ultra-fine bead of bubbles that creates an elegant, creamy mousse. Flavors of crisp apple, Meyer lemon, and white grapefruit provide the foundation, enhanced by notes of blanched almond, brioche, and subtle butterscotch from autolytic aging. The wine's mineral backbone is pronounced, lending precision and focus to the rich, developed flavors. A saline quality adds tension and freshness, while the integration of fruit, aging characters, and acidity is seamless and sophisticated."}

records.name: Oleandri Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: A prestigious Cabernet Sauvignon from Rutherford AVA, one of Napa Valley's most celebrated appellations. The 2019 vintage captures the essence of Rutherford's unique terroir, featuring the district's famous gravelly loam soils that impart a distinctive dusty tannin quality alongside concentrated dark fruit character.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon (likely with small amounts of traditional Bordeaux blending varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of cassis and blackberry, layered with notes of graphite, cedar, and cigar box. Classic Rutherford characteristics emerge in the form of dried sage, pencil lead, and the subtle dusty quality that defines the appellation. Hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco add complexity, while a touch of violet and eucalyptus provides aromatic lift. The integration of French oak is evident in subtle vanilla and baking spice notes.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful, with persistent dark fruit flavors and integrated oak spice. The dusty tannins characteristic of Rutherford provide texture and grip, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures freshness. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee linger alongside fruit, promising excellent evolution over the coming decade.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of black currant, blackberry, and black cherry, framed by firm but refined tannins. The famous 'Rutherford dust' character manifests as a fine, powdery tannin structure that coats the palate with elegant grip. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak provide depth, while hints of mint, anise, and black pepper add savory complexity. The wine's structure suggests excellent aging potential while remaining approachable in its youth."}

records.name: Libertine "You Are Still Alive" Pet-Nat 2022
records.description: A vibrant pétillant naturel from Oregon's Willamette Valley, crafted using the ancestral method with native vineyard yeasts and minimal intervention. This natural sparkling wine showcases the pure expression of its terroir through fermentation in neutral oak barrels with no additives except a minimal amount of sulfite.
records.varietal: Blend of white varietals fermented with native vineyard yeast
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with lively effervescence releasing fresh orchard fruits—green apple and Asian pear—intermingled with white flowers and a subtle bread dough character from extended lees contact. Delicate notes of citrus zest and raw almonds add complexity, while a mineral undertone hints at the volcanic soils of the Willamette Valley. The aromatic profile is clean yet expressive, balancing wild fermentation character with bright fruit purity.","finish":"The finish is refreshingly crisp with lingering citrus notes and a clean mineral edge. A gentle effervescence persists, leaving the palate energized and ready for another sip. The conclusion is dry yet fruit-forward, with subtle phenolic grip providing structure to this fun, unconventional sparkling wine.","palate":"On the palate, fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy mousse that carries flavors of crisp green apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach. The wine shows remarkable tension between its fruity sweetness and zippy acidity, with a slightly saline quality adding depth. Mid-palate weight comes from extended lees aging, offering a subtle yeasty richness without heaviness. The neutral oak barrel fermentation provides texture rather than oak flavor, allowing the fruit and natural wine character to shine through."}

records.name: Chateau Josephine Cabernet Sauvignon Semi Sweet   (MD & DC) 2023
records.description: This semi-sweet kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Yecla, Spain offers an approachable style with bright fruit flavors and gentle sweetness. Perfect for those preferring a softer wine profile, it balances ripe fruit character with just enough structure to remain food-friendly.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fruity and expressive, the nose bursts with aromas of fresh cherries, black currant, and a distinctive eucalyptus note that adds herbal complexity. The semi-sweet style showcases forward fruit aromatics with hints of vanilla from oak contact. Inviting and approachable, with bright berry fruit leading the way.","finish":"The finish is smooth and fruit-forward with lingering sweet cherry notes and a touch of vanilla. Pleasant sweetness persists without heaviness, making this wine particularly enjoyable for casual sipping.","palate":"Rich flavors of black currant and dark cherries dominate the palate, complemented by creamy vanilla notes and gentle sweetness. The semi-sweet profile provides roundness and immediate accessibility, while moderate acidity prevents cloying. Soft tannins and plush fruit create a crowd-pleasing, easy-drinking experience with noticeable but balanced residual sugar."}

records.name: Shabo Sparkling Grand Reserve 2016
records.description: Shabo's Grand Reserve represents Ukraine's finest sparkling wine production, crafted using traditional methods with extended aging. The 2016 vintage showcases elegance, complexity, and refined character worthy of comparison to premium sparkling wines worldwide.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet displays sophisticated aromas of white flowers, fresh-baked bread, and brioche alongside characteristic mineral notes. Elegant layers of vanilla, cream, and toasted muffin emerge from extended lees aging, while subtle hints of citrus blossom and almond add complexity. A fine, persistent mousse carries the delicate aromatics.","finish":"The finish is clean with a pleasant citrus-forward character and subtle bread crust notes. Fine bubbles persist alongside refreshing acidity, creating an elegant conclusion with a touch of mineral bitterness that adds complexity.","palate":"The palate shows harmonious balance with light fruity-floral character and fine mineral structure. Flavors of green apple, lemon zest, and white peach are complemented by elegant oaky notes of brioche and hazelnut. The wine maintains freshness with bright acidity, while creamy texture from lees aging provides depth and sophistication."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Brama 2018
records.description: An exceptional biodynamic white wine from Languedoc's Château Maris, Europe's first B Corp certified winery. Made from 100% Grenache Gris and aged in new French oak barrels followed by concrete eggs, this wine received a Master Medal at the Drinks Business Global Organic Masters. The wine represents the estate's commitment to sustainable, innovative winemaking while showcasing the unique character of Grenache Gris.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is fresh and focused, opening with vibrant tropical fruits including pineapple and mango. Delicate honeysuckle and white flowers add elegance, while notes of lemon rind provide citrus brightness. A distinctive note of buttered almonds from oak aging adds richness and complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"Clean and persistent with lingering tropical fruit and subtle oak notes. The acidity carries through to a refreshing conclusion that showcases the wine's purity and elegance.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a lovely, elegant texture that's beautifully lifted by the wine's natural acidity. The wine is racy and pure, delivering concentrated tropical fruit flavors alongside citrus and stone fruit. The oak influence is seamlessly integrated, adding depth without overwhelming the fruit. Notes of toasted almond and subtle vanilla complement the fruit core. The texture is refined and sophisticated."}

records.name: Chateau Jupille Carillon Saint Emilion 2015
records.description: The 2015 vintage from Château Jupille Carillon represents a powerful expression from one of Saint-Émilion's quality-focused estates. Wine Enthusiast praised this Cuvée Prestige for its firm structure and serious wood aging, noting the wine's richness and development potential. Crafted from 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Franc from 67-year-old vines, this wine captures the intensity and complexity of a stellar Bordeaux vintage.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense and complex nose revealing layers of ripe fruits including blackberry, dark cherry, and plum. Notes of licorice emerge alongside light woody and spicy character that's well integrated. The aromatics show both power and elegance, with hints of graphite, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs adding complexity. The oak influence is present but harmonious.","finish":"Long and structured with firm, dry tannins that will soften with age. The finish shows the wine's potential for development, with layers of fruit, spice, and oak that will integrate further over time.","palate":"Both fresh and powerful on the palate, showing excellent balance between fruit ripeness and structural elements. Hints of blackberry dominate the fruit core, supported by dark cherry and cassis. The wine displays good sweetness from ripe fruit, with character and depth that reveal the quality of the vintage. Elegant tannins provide structure and aging potential while remaining refined. The acidity lifts the fruit and extends the flavor profile."}

records.name: Clos d'Audhuy Les Polissons 2022
records.description: A joyful, approachable Malbec from Cahors in Southwest France, crafted by Benoît Aymard at Clos d'Audhuy. Made from 30-year-old Malbec vines using organic farming practices (certified 2018) and minimal intervention winemaking, this wine exemplifies the modern, fruit-forward approach to Cahors that prioritizes drinkability and pleasure over power and extraction.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with exuberant dark fruit aromas—blackcurrant, blueberry, and black cherry—that showcase Malbec's inherent fruitiness when handled gently. Rich coffee and espresso notes add depth and roasted complexity, while subtle hints of cocoa and dark chocolate suggest the variety's natural richness. Delicate floral notes of violet emerge with aeration, adding refinement. The aromatic profile is clean, pure, and intensely fruity, reflecting the short maceration and tank vinification that preserve fresh fruit character over extracted tannins.","finish":"The finish is smooth, fruity, and satisfying, with lingering dark berry fruit, subtle coffee notes, and soft tannins. The conclusion is clean and refreshing rather than heavy or extracted, making this a wine that invites another pour. The organic, low-intervention approach shines through in the wine's purity and drinkability.","palate":"On the palate, Les Polissons lives up to its name (which translates to 'rascals' or 'scamps') with juicy, playful fruit that prioritizes immediate pleasure. Flavors of ripe blackberry, plum, and dark cherry dominate, accompanied by coffee, mocha, and subtle spice notes. The wine is round and silky with approachable tannins that provide structure without astringency—a result of the gentle short maceration technique. Medium body and fresh acidity keep the wine lively and food-friendly, while avoiding the heavy, tannic character of traditional Cahors. The minimal use of sulfites (40-60 mg/l total) and natural winemaking approach preserve the wine's vibrant fruit purity and make it incredibly drinkable."}

records.description: Chateau Maris Nymphe De Emue Rose 2024 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Noughty NA Red Wine NV
records.description: A sophisticated dealcoholized Syrah from South Africa's renowned wine regions, expertly crafted to retain the structure, tannins, and complexity of traditional red wine while removing the alcohol to less than 0.5% ABV. This organic, vegan-friendly wine offers an authentic red wine experience without the intoxicating effects.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a deep burgundy color with warm, inviting aromas of ripe red fruits—cherries, pomegranate, and strawberries—layered with dried rose petals and a hint of crushed black pepper. Subtle vanilla and oak notes emerge from French oak integration, adding depth without overwhelming the fruit character. Delicate floral jasmine notes provide elegance, while a whisper of candied cherry and blackcurrant adds complexity to this remarkably expressive non-alcoholic wine.","finish":"The finish shows surprising length and persistence for a dealcoholized wine, with lingering cherry and subtle oak spice notes. Soft tannins provide a gentle, pleasing astringency that cleanses the palate, while the overall impression remains fresh and vibrant rather than medicinal or overly sweet.","palate":"On the palate, Noughty Rouge defies expectations with a medium-bodied structure and smooth, velvety mouthfeel that avoids the thin, stripped character common in many non-alcoholic wines. The wine retains impressive soft tannins that provide gentle grip and structure, beautifully balanced with bright red fruit flavors. Crushed black pepper and subtle coffee notes add savory complexity, while French oak tannins integrate seamlessly to create depth and roundness. The wine maintains excellent balance between fruit sweetness and acidity, delivering a genuinely satisfying red wine experience."}

records.name: Knuttel Family Dry Creek Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Sebastian's Infinite Limits 2021
records.description: A full-bodied Dry Creek Valley Cabernet Sauvignon that exemplifies the robust character of this renowned Sonoma region. Crafted from the 2021 vintage which experienced earlier-than-normal harvest and dry conditions that concentrated flavors while reducing yields, resulting in exceptional depth and intensity.
records.varietal: 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot, 4% Cabernet Franc, 4% Merlot
records.region: Dry Creek Valley AVA, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with lush aromas of ripe blackberry and dark cherry, interwoven with plum and cranberry notes that add brightness. Classic Dry Creek Valley herbal nuances emerge—bay leaf, dried sage, and white pepper—complemented by hints of nutmeg and cedar from oak aging. Underlying floral notes of violet add elegance, while earthy undertones of mushroom and fine leather provide complexity and suggest the wine's serious pedigree.","finish":"The finish is long and layered, with persistent dark fruit flavors, subtle oak spice, and a minerality that adds elegance. Fine-grained tannins and balanced acidity ensure a clean, satisfying conclusion that invites another sip. The wine's plush texture and well-integrated components suggest it will develop beautifully with proper cellaring.","palate":"This full-bodied Cabernet reveals concentrated flavors of black currant, black cherry, and cranberry on a plush, well-rounded palate. The wine shows excellent fruit intensity balanced by savory elements of herbes de Provence, mocha, and espresso. Fine leather and mineral notes bolster the wine's richness, while hints of dried herbs add complexity. Firm yet supple tannins provide excellent structure without being aggressive, making this Cabernet approachable in its youth while promising excellent aging potential. The wine's concentrated fruit character reflects the outstanding flavor development from the 2021 vintage's reduced yields."}

records.name: Korde Pinea Blanco 2022-2023
records.description: An innovative white wine from Ribera del Duero's Pinea winery, showcasing the region's native white grape varieties. This unique cuvée represents a dialogue between two consecutive vintages—2022 and 2023—blended to achieve both depth and freshness in a single wine, demonstrating the winemaker's creative approach to expressing indigenous varietals.
records.varietal: Albillo Mayor with native varieties including Malvasía Castellana, Pirulé, and Viura
records.region: DO Ribera del Duero, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose unfolds with restrained elegance, revealing delicate white flowers—acacia and orange blossom—interwoven with ripe citrus notes of Meyer lemon and grapefruit zest. A distinctive saline, mineral touch adds complexity, evoking limestone soils and cool cellars. Subtle hints of stone fruit (white peach and apricot) emerge with aeration, while a creamy, lees-derived note suggests texture and richness beneath the wine's elegant aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is remarkably persistent and creamy, with lingering citrus and saline notes providing freshness against the wine's rich texture. The combination of vintages ensures balance between weight and acidity, making the conclusion both satisfying and uplifting. Subtle oak spice and a mineral edge complete this unique white wine experience.","palate":"On the palate, this wine displays tremendous structure and a viscous, almost glycerin-like texture that coats the mouth luxuriously. The dual-vintage vinification creates exceptional complexity—the older vintage providing depth, oak integration, and evolved flavors, while the younger vintage contributes vibrant acidity and fresh fruit character. Abundant aromas of flowers and fruits translate to flavors of citrus, stone fruit, and subtle tropical notes (pineapple, mango). The wine's creamy mouthfeel comes from extended lees aging in French oak barrels, while maintaining refreshing minerality and tension. This is a white wine of substance and character, far from simple or one-dimensional."}

records.name: Clos d'Audhuy Toujours Plus 1L NV  1000 ml
records.description: A vibrant, youthful Malbec from the organic Cahors estate Clos d'Audhuy, crafted through partial carbonic maceration for maximum fruit expression. This liter-format wine emphasizes approachability and fresh berry character over traditional Cahors power.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant aromas of bright red berries leap from the glass, with fresh raspberry and wild strawberry leading the charge. Juicy blackberry notes add depth while maintaining the wine's youthful, energetic character. The partial carbonic maceration contributes a distinctive fresh-picked berry quality with subtle floral hints and a touch of crushed herbs.","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with bright berry fruit that lingers pleasantly. The wine's approachable style shines through to the very end, leaving you wanting another sip rather than contemplating complexity.","palate":"The palate is wonderfully juicy and fresh, showcasing a delightful interplay of raspberry and blackberry flavors. Lively acidity gives the wine tremendous vibrancy and drinkability, making it refreshingly light on its feet despite Malbec's typically robust nature. The fruit-forward style emphasizes youthful charm over structure, with soft tannins that don't interfere with the wine's exuberant berry expression."}

records.name: Natte Valleij Cinsault Stellenbosch 2023
records.description: An exceptional single-varietal Cinsault from one of South Africa's most celebrated producers of this underappreciated grape. Sourced from 46-year-old bush vines planted on decomposed granite soils on the slopes of the Helderberg Mountain, just 7km from False Bay. The maritime influence and ancient vines create a wine of remarkable elegance and purity that has earned critical acclaim (96 points Greg Sherwood, 95 Tim Atkin, 17.5 Jancis Robinson).
records.varietal: 100% Cinsault from 46-year-old bush vines on decomposed granite soils
records.region: Stellenbosch, Helderberg Mountain, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine captivates with an intriguing rosé-ruby color and aromas of vibrant red fruits—wild strawberry, fresh cherry, and pomegranate—that leap from the glass with purity and intensity. Delicate floral notes of jasmine, violet, and rose petal add aromatic complexity and elegance. The cool maritime influence from nearby False Bay contributes a subtle salinity and freshness, while the old bush vines provide depth and concentration. Hints of white pepper, dried herbs, and subtle earthy notes add savory complexity without detracting from the wine's primary fruit character.","finish":"The finish is pure, persistent, and refreshing, with lingering red berry fruit, floral notes, and pronounced minerality. The wine's bright acidity and subtle tannins ensure a clean, lifted conclusion that invites immediate revisitation. At only 11.5% alcohol, the wine finishes with remarkable energy and drinkability, making it dangerously easy to enjoy.","palate":"On the palate, this Cinsault defies expectations with its combination of delicacy and intensity. Bright red fruit flavors—cherry, cranberry, and red currant—dominate, supported by remarkable freshness and energy from the wine's low 11.5% alcohol and vibrant acidity. The decomposed granite soils contribute a distinctive mineral edge and silky texture, while the maritime influence adds subtle saline notes that enhance the wine's complexity. Despite its light body and pale color, the wine shows impressive concentration from the ancient bush vines, with surprising depth and length. The short maceration in vats preserves the wine's juicy, fruit-forward character while maintaining structural elegance."}

records.name: Cobden Wini Old Federal Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
records.description: A contemporary Australian Cabernet Sauvignon that showcases the intensity and fruit-forward character of New World winemaking. This wine balances ripe fruit concentration with structural integrity, offering immediate appeal while maintaining aging potential. An approachable yet serious expression of Cabernet.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays vibrant aromas of ripe blackcurrant, blueberry, and dark cherry with excellent clarity. Notes of eucalyptus and mint add an Australian signature, while cedar, vanilla, and sweet oak spices contribute complexity. Subtle hints of dark chocolate and graphite provide depth, creating an inviting and complex aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long with persistent dark fruit and subtle oak influence. Ripe tannins provide gentle structure, while balanced acidity maintains freshness. Notes of blackcurrant and cedar fade gracefully, leaving a satisfying and harmonious conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with concentrated flavors of blackberry, cassis, and plum. The palate reveals layers of dark chocolate, coffee, and toasted oak, supported by firm yet approachable tannins. Mid-palate richness shows hints of black olive, dried herbs, and a touch of peppery spice. Well-integrated oak adds structure and vanilla notes without dominating the pure fruit expression."}

records.name: Colle Corviano Chardonnay 2022
records.description: An approachable Italian Chardonnay from the Abruzzo region, this wine showcases the fresh, mineral-driven style typical of Central Italian white wines. Colle Corviano crafts balanced expressions that highlight fruit purity while maintaining vibrant acidity and elegant structure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of ripe golden apples and white peaches, layered with subtle notes of citrus blossom and a whisper of toasted almonds. As the wine breathes, delicate hints of fresh herbs and mineral undertones emerge, adding complexity. A touch of vanilla from gentle oak contact provides a sophisticated backdrop without overwhelming the fresh fruit character.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of citrus and almond. A pleasant mineral quality persists, accompanied by a refreshing acidity that invites another sip and makes this wine particularly food-friendly.","palate":"On the palate, this Chardonnay delivers a medium-bodied experience with bright acidity that energizes the taste buds. Flavors of crisp pear and green apple dominate the entry, followed by notes of ripe stone fruit and a hint of lemon zest. The wine's creamy texture balances beautifully with its refreshing citrus elements, while a subtle minerality runs through the mid-palate, lending precision and focus. The integration of fruit and oak is seamless, creating a harmonious whole."}

records.name: Cobden Wini Russian River Valley Pinot Noir 2022
records.description: An elegant Russian River Valley Pinot Noir that exemplifies the region's cool-climate excellence and signature style. The 2022 vintage captures the area's ability to produce wines of remarkable finesse, combining intense aromatics with silky texture and complex fruit character shaped by coastal fog and well-drained soils.
records.region: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Seductive aromas of fresh red cherry and cranberry dominate, accompanied by layers of wild strawberry and rhubarb. Floral notes of violet and rose petal add elegance, while subtle undertones of forest floor, dried tea leaves, and baking spice create intrigue. A delicate hint of oak-derived vanilla and toasted hazelnut weaves through the fruit, never overpowering the wine's inherent elegance.","finish":"Long and graceful finish with persistent red fruit and earthy undertones. The tannins are polished and seamless, while bright acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion. Subtle spice notes linger alongside the fruit, leaving a sophisticated impression.","palate":"Silky and refined on the palate with bright red fruit flavors of Bing cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate taking center stage. The texture is luxurious yet weightless, with fine-grained tannins providing structure without heaviness. Mid-palate complexity reveals earthy notes of mushroom, autumn leaves, and subtle cola spice, while integrated acidity keeps everything vibrant and lifted. The Russian River character shines through with its combination of fruit purity and savory complexity."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Lambert Estate A Thousand Words Chardonnay 2023
records.description: A premium Chardonnay from Australia's Barossa Valley, showcasing the region's capacity for world-class white wine production. This wine combines vibrant fruit expression with sophisticated oak treatment, spending 9 months on lees in 30% new French oak to develop richness and complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Lively and inviting, the wine displays vibrant gold color with aromas of lychee, pineapple, and rock melon (cantaloupe) leading the tropical fruit spectrum. Subtle hints of toasted cashews, butterscotch, and baking spice emerge from the oak aging, creating layers of complexity. Additional notes of lemon zest and nectarine add brightness to the aromatic profile.","finish":"Generous and lengthy finish with lingering tropical fruit, creamy texture, and subtle toasted oak. The hazelnut and butterscotch notes carry through, leaving a sophisticated, satisfying impression.","palate":"Rich and opulent on the palate, featuring complex flavors of lychee, nectarine, and mandarin zest balanced by a creamy, hazelnut-cream texture from lees aging. The butterscotch and melted butter oak notes integrate beautifully beneath the stone fruit surface. Despite the richness, a vibrant acid backbone provides structure and prevents the wine from becoming heavy, creating excellent balance."}

records.name: Colle Corviano Pecorino 2023
records.description: From the Abruzzo region of Italy, this Pecorino showcases one of Italy's most exciting indigenous white varietals. Colle Corviano crafts this fresh, aromatic wine that captures the variety's distinctive character and the terroir of the Adriatic hillsides.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Aromatic and expressive, the nose offers white peach, green apple, and citrus blossom alongside delicate floral notes of acacia and chamomile. Herbal elements of fennel, fresh herbs, and a hint of anise add complexity and Mediterranean character. Subtle mineral notes of flint and wet stone provide depth, while a touch of almond and white pepper adds intrigue. The aromatic profile is fresh, inviting, and distinctly Italian.","finish":"Long and satisfying, the finish features persistent stone fruit and citrus flavors with pronounced minerality. A subtle almond note and herbal character add complexity, while bright acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion. The wine leaves a slightly saline impression that enhances its food-friendly nature.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent structure and a rich, almost oily texture characteristic of Pecorino. The palate delivers flavors of ripe stone fruits—peach, apricot, and nectarine—balanced by bright citrus notes of lemon and grapefruit. Fresh acidity provides energy and lift, while a distinctive saline minerality adds complexity and a sense of place. Subtle nutty notes and hints of fennel seed contribute to the wine's unique personality. The texture is more substantial than many Italian whites, with a slight glycerol richness that doesn't compromise freshness."}

records.name: Collina San Ponzio Barbera D Alba 2024
records.description: Collina San Ponzio Barbera D Alba 2024 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Colle Corviano Trebbiano d'Abruzzo 2024
records.description: A fresh, vibrant expression of Trebbiano d'Abruzzo from a young, family-run winery in the mountainous Tavo Valley. Owners Antonella di Tonno and Rodrigo Redmont tend 30 hectares of vineyards with a strong commitment to sustainability, crafting high-quality, affordable wines that showcase the region's unique terroir. This 2024 vintage delivers exceptional value at an approachable price point.
records.region: Trebbiano d'Abruzzo DOC, Abruzzo, Italy (Tavo Valley, Loreto Aprutino)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright and inviting, revealing intense aromas of ripe apples and peaches, complemented by notes of tangerine and citrus flowers. Delicate floral nuances add elegance, while subtle hints of white pepper and Mediterranean herbs provide complexity. The overall aromatic profile is fresh, racy, and immediately appealing.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, bolstered by good weight and tangy tastiness that lingers pleasantly. The wine's bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with a lovely pithy texture of mineral and delicate extract, the palate showcases refreshing flavors of ripe apple and peach, balanced by tangy citrus notes of tangerine and lemon zest. The wine's bright acidity provides structure and vibrancy, while a gentle, tangy tastiness persists through the mid-palate. Subtle mineral notes—wet stones and saline—add textural interest and reinforce the wine's terroir-driven character."}

records.name: Collina San Ponzio Dolcetto D Alba 2020
records.description: A traditional Dolcetto from a century-old family vineyard in Barolo, representing Piedmont's beloved everyday wine. This approachable red showcases the varietal's characteristic fruit-forward profile with bright acidity and soft tannins, perfect for casual dining and early enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with vibrant red berry aromas - raspberry, red cherry, and wild strawberry - accented by subtle violet florals and baking spice. Hints of blackberry and blueberry add depth, while gentle rose petal notes provide elegance. The aromatic profile is straightforward yet charming, with touches of almond and spice emerging as the wine breathes.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and that telltale bitter almond note that marks quality Dolcetto. The conclusion is refreshing rather than heavy, inviting another glass.","palate":"On the palate, this Dolcetto delivers exactly what Piedmont locals crave - plenty of juicy fruit with minimal tannin interference and refreshing acidity. Raspberry jam dominates the flavor spectrum, joined by red cherry, clove, and orange zest that add complexity and brightness. The wine shows deep fruity flavors balanced by a characteristic almond note on the mid-palate. The tannic texture is soft and approachable rather than grippy, making this supremely food-friendly. Nice acidity provides structure and makes the wine versatile across various dishes."}

records.name: Alella Barbabianco Vermut Blanco
records.description: A distinctive white vermouth from the Alella region near Barcelona, this aromatic fortified wine combines local white grape varieties with a carefully curated blend of Mediterranean botanicals. Barbabianco represents the Spanish tradition of blanc vermouth, offering a sophisticated aperitif experience with layers of herbal and citrus complexity.
records.varietal: White grape base (likely Pansa Blanca/Xarel·lo) fortified and aromatized with botanicals
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Enticing aromatics of fresh citrus peel—lemon zest and bitter orange—mingle with fragrant chamomile flowers and delicate white florals. The botanical bouquet includes notes of cardamom, coriander, and a whisper of Mediterranean herbs like rosemary and marjoram. Subtle sweetness emerges with hints of honey and vanilla, balanced by gentle spice notes of clove and ginger.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering botanical complexity. The finish shows gentle bitterness from quinine and citrus peel, balanced by a touch of sweetness and aromatic herb notes. Cardamom and ginger spice persist on the aftertaste, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for food or another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a luscious, slightly viscous texture that coats the palate. The initial sweetness is immediately balanced by refreshing acidity and gentle bitter notes from the botanical infusion. Flavors of candied citrus, white grape, and stone fruit are interwoven with layers of aromatic spices—juniper, quinine, and warming cinnamon. The fortification provides structure without heaviness, while the herbal components add complexity and depth throughout the mid-palate."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Finca Alta Cantabria White 2023
records.description: Conde Valdemar Finca Alta Cantabria White 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Paloma Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: A distinguished Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from Paloma Vineyards, this 2019 vintage captures the essence of one of California's finest wine regions. Crafted from estate-grown fruit, this wine exemplifies the power, concentration, and elegance that have made Napa Cabernet world-renowned, with the 2019 vintage offering optimal ripeness and structure.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon (likely 85-100%), possibly with small amounts of Merlot or Cabernet Franc
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Opulent and layered nose showcasing ripe black currant, blackberry, and dark cherry alongside notes of crushed graphite, pencil lead, and cigar box. The bouquet reveals classic Napa hallmarks: eucalyptus, mint, and cedar from the region's distinctive terroir, interwoven with rich oak-derived notes of vanilla, sweet tobacco, and baking spices. Subtle violet and dark chocolate nuances add depth and complexity to this compelling aromatic profile.","finish":"Long, persistent finish with layers of dark fruit, oak spice, and subtle mineral notes. The tannins are firm yet refined, with a chalky quality that suggests excellent aging potential. Notes of dark chocolate, tobacco, and mint linger on the aftertaste, inviting contemplation and another sip.","palate":"Full-bodied and concentrated with a plush, velvety texture that exemplifies premium Napa Cabernet. The palate delivers intense flavors of cassis, black cherry, and ripe plum, supported by medium-high tannins that provide structure without harshness. Layers of complexity unfold with notes of dark chocolate, espresso, black pepper, and sweet oak-derived vanilla and toast. The wine shows excellent fruit concentration balanced by bright acidity that prevents any sense of heaviness. Alcohol is well-integrated at 13.5-14.5%, contributing to the wine's full body and richness while maintaining elegance and balance."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Crianza 2019
records.description: A classic Rioja Crianza from Bodegas Valdemar, this wine exemplifies the traditional style of Rioja Alta and Alavesa. Aged 15 months in American oak barrels, it offers a harmonious balance between vibrant fruit and integrated oak influence, showcasing the quality of estate-grown Tempranillo with supporting varietals.
records.region: Rioja DOCa (Alta and Alavesa subregions), Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of black fruits, particularly ripe plum and blackberry, intertwined with well-integrated oak notes. Sweet spice characteristics emerge, including vanilla and cinnamon from the American oak aging, accompanied by subtle hints of licorice and dried herbs that add complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, echoing the black fruit characteristics with lingering notes of sweet spices and licorice. The wine maintains its balance through to the end, leaving a pleasant impression of integrated oak and ripe fruit that invites another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this wine is fleshy and full of flavor, delivering excellent balance between fruit concentration and oak integration. The entry is smooth and pleasant with a fresh quality that maintains vibrancy. Flavors of black fruit dominate, supported by spice notes and touches of tobacco, while the tannin structure remains firm yet approachable, providing framework without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Rose 2023

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Alfaro Family Vineyards Estate Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: A vibrant, coastal-style Pinot Noir from Alfaro Family Vineyards' estate in California's Central Coast region. This young wine showcases the fresh, fruit-forward character and elegance that California's cool-climate regions can achieve with Pinot Noir. The 2023 vintage captures bright fruit purity and the distinctive terroir of the estate's maritime-influenced vineyards.
records.region: Central Coast, California (likely San Luis Obispo County)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and expressive aromatics bursting with fresh red fruit: ripe cherry, red raspberry, and wild strawberry dominate the nose. Delicate floral notes of rose petals and violet add elegance, while subtle hints of crushed herbs, forest floor, and baking spices provide complexity. Light oak influence contributes gentle notes of vanilla and sweet toast. The overall impression is youthful, fresh, and inviting, with the purity of fruit shining through.","finish":"Medium-length finish with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and gentle tannins. The bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed and cleansed, while notes of cherry, rose, and subtle earth persist. The finish is clean and vibrant, inviting another sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with a silky, elegant texture and fine-grained tannins that caress the palate. The wine delivers concentrated red fruit flavors—cherry compote, red raspberry, and cranberry—supported by vibrant acidity that keeps the wine lively and refreshing. Subtle earthy notes of mushroom and tea leaves add depth without overwhelming the bright fruit character. The maritime influence shows in a mineral quality and bright freshness, while light oak aging contributes whispers of vanilla, clove, and Coca-Cola. The mouthfeel is graceful and refined, with 12-13.5% alcohol maintaining balance and elegance."}
