records.name: Costers Del Segre Petit Sios Blanco 2024
records.description: An explosive and aromatic organic white wine from Bodegas Costers del Sió in Catalonia. This fresh young blend of Viognier, Chardonnay, and Muscat showcases the estate's commitment to organic farming, delivering intense aromatics and pleasant texture from vineyards at 310 meters elevation in the Costers del Segre DO.
records.varietal: Blend of Viognier, Chardonnay, and Muscat
records.region: Costers del Segre DO, Catalonia, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosive on the nose with vibrant aromatics that immediately captivate. Pleasant notes of fresh Muscat grapes lead the way, followed by exotic fruits including lychee, mango, and passion fruit. White flower aromatics - orange blossom and honeysuckle - add an elegant floral dimension, all wrapped in a gentle freshness that keeps the wine lifted and inviting. Subtle hints of stone fruit and citrus add complexity.","finish":"The finish is fresh and fruity with lingering exotic fruit flavors and floral notes. A gentle mineral edge adds definition, while the wine's balanced acidity leaves the palate refreshed.","palate":"Intense and flavorful on the palate with a pleasant, almost creamy texture from the Viognier component. The wine is fresh and smooth with balanced acidity that supports rather than dominates. Flavors of ripe white peach, apricot, and tropical fruits are complemented by citrus notes and a subtle minerality. The Chardonnay adds structure and body, while the Muscat provides distinctive grape and floral character. Despite its intensity, the wine remains direct and uncomplicated, making it accessible and enjoyable."}

records.name: Coste Caumartin Haut Cotes de Beaune 2021
records.description: A classic Burgundian Pinot Noir from Domaine Coste-Caumartin, a family estate cultivating vineyards in Pommard since 1793. This wine from the Hautes-Côtes de Beaune appellation reflects over two centuries of winemaking tradition, crafted from sustainably farmed vineyards (HVE certified since 2019) across the family's 13 hectares in Pommard, Saint-Romain, and Beaune.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays classic Burgundian Pinot Noir character with bright red fruit aromas of cherry, raspberry, and cranberry. Subtle earthy notes reminiscent of forest floor and mushroom add complexity, while delicate floral hints of violet and rose petal provide elegance. The cooler climate and higher elevation of the Hautes-Côtes de Beaune contribute to a fresher, more delicate aromatic profile compared to Côte de Beaune village wines, with hints of spice and mineral notes emerging as the wine opens.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent with lingering red fruit flavors and a touch of mineral salinity. The wine's refined tannins and bright acidity ensure a refreshing finish that invites another sip, while subtle earthy notes provide complexity on the aftertaste.","palate":"On the palate, this wine shows the elegance and finesse typical of well-made Burgundy, with silky tannins and vibrant acidity framing flavors of red cherry, strawberry, and pomegranate. The wine has medium body with excellent balance, displaying purity of fruit without excessive oak influence. Subtle savory notes of herbs and earth add depth and complexity, while the natural acidity keeps the palate fresh and lively. The high environmental value (HVE) farming practices contribute to the wine's transparent expression of terroir."}

records.name: Coste Caumartin 1er Cru Rouge Les Chouacheaux 2019
records.description: A distinguished Premier Cru red Burgundy from the esteemed Beaune appellation, produced by Domaine Coste-Caumartin. This historic estate, with roots dating back to the time of the Dukes of Burgundy, is now managed by Jerome and Benoit Sordet who balance traditional Burgundian techniques with modern precision.
records.region: Beaune Premier Cru Les Chouacheux, Côte de Beaune, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with classic Burgundian Pinot Noir aromatics of red cherry, raspberry, and wild strawberry, complemented by delicate floral notes of violet and rose petal. As the wine breathes, earthy notes of forest floor, mushroom, and subtle truffle emerge, along with hints of sweet spice including cinnamon and clove. The aromatic profile reflects the Premier Cru vineyard's limestone-rich terroir.","finish":"The finish is long and graceful with lingering red fruit, earth, and spice notes. The wine's fine tannins and bright acidity carry through to the end, leaving an impression of elegance and terroir expression.","palate":"The palate is elegant and refined, showcasing red fruit flavors of cherry and cranberry supported by fine-grained tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Flavors of earth, dried herbs, and subtle oak spice add complexity, while the wine's bright acidity provides energy and lift. The mouthfeel is silky and persistent, with a mineral quality that speaks to the Beaune terroir."}

records.name: Costers del Segre Petit Sios Tinto 2021
records.description: A vibrant young red from Catalonia's Costers del Segre DO, crafted by Bodegas Costers del Sió. This approachable blend combines classic Spanish varietals with French influence, offering fruit-forward charm with subtle oak integration from four months in used French barrels.
records.region: Costers del Segre DO, Catalonia, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents bright red berry aromas with emphasis on fresh strawberry and red cherry. Subtle undertones of Mediterranean herbs, including thyme and rosemary, emerge alongside gentle spice notes from the oak aging. A touch of violet and crushed rose petal adds floral complexity to the fruit-driven profile.","finish":"A fresh, direct finish with lingering red fruit and a whisper of spice. The wine's youthful energy and balanced acidity create a clean, refreshing conclusion that makes it highly versatile at the table.","palate":"The wine enters with lively acidity and medium body, showcasing the blend's harmonious composition of Tempranillo's structure, Cabernet Sauvignon's depth, and Grenache's red fruit exuberance. Flavors of ripe cherry, raspberry, and hints of blackberry dominate, while background notes of vanilla, cinnamon, and toasted oak provide subtle complexity. The texture is smooth and approachable with soft, integrated tannins."}

records.name: Crosarola Ripasso 2017
records.description: A distinguished Valpolicella Ripasso showcasing the unique 'repassed' winemaking technique that adds depth and complexity to classic Venetian reds. This wine bridges the gap between traditional Valpolicella and powerful Amarone, offering enhanced structure and rich flavors. An excellent introduction to this prestigious style.
records.varietal: Blend of Corvina, Rondinella, and Molinara
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is complex and inviting with aromas of dried cherries, black plum, and raisined fruit from the ripasso process. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco emerge alongside hints of leather and dried herbs. Subtle balsamic and spice notes add complexity, while integrated oak contributes vanilla and cedar nuances.","finish":"The finish is long and evolving with persistent dark fruit and savory notes. Layers of leather, tobacco, and spice linger beautifully, while the wine's tannic grip and slight bitterness (in the best sense) add complexity. The conclusion is rich yet balanced, showcasing the distinctive character that makes Ripasso special.","palate":"Full-bodied with impressive depth and concentration. The palate delivers flavors of sour cherry, blackberry, and fig, enriched by the secondary fermentation on Amarone pomace. Mid-palate richness reveals dark cocoa, dried fruit, and a distinctive tar-like character. Firm yet polished tannins provide excellent structure, while elevated alcohol adds warmth and weight without overwhelming balance."}

records.name: Dogwood & Thistle Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: Dogwood & Thistle crafts elegant, terroir-driven Pinot Noir that showcases the variety's delicate character and regional expression. The 2021 vintage represents modern cool-climate winemaking, balancing fruit purity with structural complexity. This wine demonstrates the producer's commitment to minimal intervention and expressing the unique character of their vineyard sites.
records.region: Likely Oregon Willamette Valley or similar cool-climate region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a captivating array of red fruit aromas, featuring bright cherry, fresh raspberry, and wild strawberry alongside floral notes of rose petal and violet. Subtle earthy elements of mushroom, forest floor, and wet stone add depth and intrigue. Delicate spice notes of cinnamon and white pepper emerge with air, along with hints of cranberry and pomegranate. The aromatics display the purity and precision characteristic of well-made cool-climate Pinot Noir, with beautiful clarity and intensity.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with persistent red fruit notes, fine-grained tannins, and a distinctive mineral quality. Subtle spice and floral notes linger elegantly, while the wine's fresh acidity provides lift and ensures a clean conclusion. This is a beautifully crafted Pinot Noir that captures the variety's essential character with precision and grace.","palate":"On the palate, the wine reveals medium body with silky tannins and vibrant acidity that energizes the fruit. Flavors of tart cherry, red currant, and raspberry are complemented by notes of rhubarb, black tea, and subtle oak-derived spice. The texture is refined and elegant, with a core of minerality that adds tension and complexity. The wine's balance is exemplary, with fruit intensity matched by structural elements that provide both immediate appeal and aging potential. Savory undertones of dried herbs and earth add complexity without overwhelming the delicate fruit character."}

records.name: Dogwood & Thistle Cavalier Cuvee Pinot Noir (Private Label) 2021
records.description: A California Pinot Noir from Dogwood & Thistle, showcasing the producer's expertise with this delicate variety. While the specific "Cavalier Cuvee" designation appears to be a private label selection, Dogwood & Thistle is known for producing elegant, terroir-focused Pinot Noirs from coastal California vineyards.
records.region: California (likely Sonoma Coast or Mendocino Ridge based on producer's portfolio)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright red cherry complemented by warm baking spices including nutmeg and hints of cola. Delicate notes of English rose petals add a floral dimension, while a pleasant wild character pushes the fruit toward herbal aromas that skew towards bay leaf. Both red and black cherries mingle, creating a savory, complex aromatic profile.","finish":"Long, mouth-quenching, and elegant, the finish demonstrates the wine's poise and refinement. The fruit lingers with subtle spice notes and a mineral thread that extends the conclusion gracefully.","palate":"On the palate, concentrated red cherry fruit dominates with accents of wild mountain red berries creating a vibrant, energetic core. Earthier notes of dried mushrooms and crushed stone emerge mid-palate, adding complexity and depth. The texture is creamy yet maintains a dried cranberry crispness that provides structure and definition to the fruit."}

records.name: Oceano Chardonnay 2021
records.description: A vibrant coastal Chardonnay from Spanish Springs Vineyard in the San Luis Obispo Coast AVA, located just 1.5 miles from the Pacific Ocean. Made from clones 809, 17, and 96, this wine was fermented and aged for 9 months in 228L French oak barrels, producing only 537 cases and earning a 92+ rating from Jancisrobinson.com.
records.region: San Luis Obispo Coast AVA, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents enticing aromas of lemon curd and sea air with a hint of grapefruit and jasmine, creating a distinctly maritime character. Additional layers reveal bright gardenias, white peach, lime zest, and quince, complemented by subtle notes of green mango and wildflower honey. The aromatic profile perfectly captures the wine's cool-climate coastal origins.","finish":"The finish features delightful dryness with persistent lemon pith-and-peel notes and a slightly silky texture from the barrel aging. The maritime salinity and mineral edge linger pleasantly, providing a crisp, clean conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"Bright and stony flavors of lemon pith and lemon oil dominate the palate, enhanced by yellow herbs and a fresh nectarine attack. The mid-palate unfolds with juicy notes of apricot, grapefruit, kiwi, and tangerine, all supported by superb acidity that provides structure and refreshment. The rocky limestone terroir expresses itself through pronounced minerality and chalky texture."}

records.name: Domaine Benedetti Biologique Vaucluse 2020
records.description: Domaine Benedetti Biologique Vaucluse 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Domaine Benedetti Biologique Vaucluse 2022
records.description: An organic red wine from Vaucluse in southeastern France, produced by a domain certified in organic agriculture since 2000. This elegant blend of Merlot, Cinsault, and Syrah represents excellent value and showcases the aromatic richness of the southern Rhône terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating cherry red color introduces an aromatic nose of great richness. Fresh blackberry and wild berry fruits dominate, enhanced by classic Provençal garrigue herbs—thyme, lavender, and wild rosemary. Delicate violet florals add elegance, while subtle licorice and sweet spice notes from Syrah contribute complexity. Hints of cocoa and dark chocolate round out the bouquet.","finish":"Medium-length finish with lingering wild berries, violet, and subtle spice. Soft tannins and bright acidity leave the palate refreshed.","palate":"Elegant and approachable with excellent balance between fruit, structure, and freshness. The palate echoes the nose with wild fruits, blackberry, and garrigue herbal notes. Medium body provides satisfying weight without heaviness. The Merlot contributes roundness, Cinsault adds bright red fruit and freshness, while Syrah provides structure and spice. Aromatic richness carries through from start to finish."}

records.name: Thelema Mountain White 2024
records.description: Thelema Mountain White 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Dogwood & Thistle Shenandoah White Blend 2022
records.description: An artisanal white blend from Virginia's Shenandoah Valley that showcases the region's terroir through a harmonious marriage of complementary varietals. This thoughtfully crafted 2022 vintage demonstrates the winery's commitment to creating distinctive wines that reflect both place and winemaking vision.
records.varietal: Proprietary white blend (likely Chardonnay, Viognier, and/or Vidal Blanc)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an elegant tapestry of orchard fruits, with ripe pear and golden apple taking center stage. Delicate floral notes of acacia blossom and honeysuckle weave through the fruit, while subtle hints of toasted almonds and wet stone add depth. A gentle kiss of vanilla suggests judicious oak contact that enhances rather than dominates the aromatic profile.","finish":"Medium-length finish with persistent fruit and a refreshing mineral quality. Subtle hints of baking spice and citrus zest linger, complemented by bright acidity that cleanses the palate beautifully.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows beautiful balance between fruit richness and refreshing acidity. Flavors of Bartlett pear, yellow apple, and white nectarine unfold gracefully, supported by a creamy mid-palate texture. Mineral notes provide structure and lift, while integrated oak lends subtle complexity without heaviness. The blend's components work in seamless harmony, creating a wine greater than the sum of its parts."}

records.name: Dolce Vita Spritz NV
records.description: An Italian-inspired aperitivo-style sparkling wine cocktail that captures the essence of la dolce vita. This ready-to-serve spritz combines aromatic herbs, bitter citrus, and effervescent wine in a perfectly balanced blend that evokes the cafe culture of Venice and Milan.
records.varietal: White wine base with bitter orange, herbs, and botanical extracts
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with bright, zesty citrus notes dominated by pink grapefruit, blood orange, and bitter orange peel. Aromatic herbs including gentian, wormwood, and subtle botanical spices add complexity, while floral hints of chamomile and elderflower provide elegance. The aromatic profile is vibrant and inviting, with a pleasant bitter-sweet balance.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering citrus and herbal notes. The bubbles fade gently, leaving a pleasant bitter-sweet conclusion that stimulates the palate and appetite, true to the aperitivo tradition.","palate":"Lightly carbonated with a refreshing effervescence, the palate delivers crisp citrus flavors of grapefruit, mandarin, and orange zest. The wine base provides body and structure, while the aperitivo blend contributes pleasant bitterness balanced by soft vanilla sweetness. Herbal notes of rhubarb, cinchona bark, and botanical spices weave through the citrus core, creating a sophisticated yet approachable flavor profile with mellow, not aggressive, bitterness."}

records.name: Domaine Benedetti Chateauneuf-du-Pape 2020
records.description: Domaine Benedetti Chateauneuf-du-Pape 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Rose 2023
records.description: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Rose 2023 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Rose 2024
records.description: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Rose 2024 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Domaine Borgeot Bourgogne Chardonnay 2022
records.description: A classic Bourgogne Chardonnay from the village level tier, showcasing the terroir-driven character that Burgundy is renowned for. Crafted from 100% Chardonnay grapes grown in Burgundy's limestone-rich soils, this wine exemplifies the elegant, mineral-focused style of the region with restrained oak influence.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright citrus aromas of lemon zest and green apple, intertwined with delicate white flower notes of acacia and honeysuckle. Subtle hints of wet stone and chalk emerge, reflecting the limestone terroir, while a gentle touch of vanilla and toasted hazelnut adds complexity from carefully measured oak aging. Fresh and inviting, the aromatics speak to the wine's youthful vitality and classic Burgundian restraint.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering citrus acidity and chalky minerality that refresh the palate. A whisper of toasted oak and white pepper appears on the tail, encouraging another sip. This is a food-friendly wine built for near-term enjoyment over the next 2-4 years.","palate":"Medium-bodied with vibrant acidity that drives the palate forward, revealing layers of crisp Granny Smith apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach. The mid-palate shows impressive mineral tension with flinty, saline notes characteristic of Burgundy's chalky soils, balanced by creamy texture from partial malolactic fermentation. Flavors of blanched almond and subtle butter add richness without overwhelming the wine's essential freshness and purity of fruit."}

records.name: Domaine Borgeot Bourgogne Chardonnay 2021
records.description: Domaine Borgeot Bourgogne Chardonnay 2021 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Domaine Benedetti Cotes du Rhone Vielles Vignes 2021
records.description: An organically grown Côtes du Rhône from vines over 45 years old planted on clay-limestone soils. This 2021 vintage earned 91/100 from critics and exemplifies the gourmand intensity and fresh character that Domaine Benedetti achieves from their old vine holdings in this classic Southern Rhône appellation.
records.varietal: Traditional Rhône blend from 45+ year old vines on clay-limestone
records.region: Côtes du Rhône AOC, Southern Rhône, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with a beautiful perfume of summer flowers and sour cherries, immediately inviting and expressive. Dark garnet with purple hues in appearance, the nose reveals sweet plum and red berry aromas intertwined with appealing floral notes. Black fruit characteristics emerge, particularly cherry and cassis, creating a layered aromatic profile that balances freshness with ripeness.","finish":"Velvety and supple with excellent length. The red and black berry flavors persist through a long conclusion, supported by fine tannins and bright, lifting acidity that ensures a clean, elegant finish with staying power.","palate":"Ample medium to full-bodied palate with impressive volume and texture. Crushed red berries dominate the flavor profile, supported by sweet plum and black cherry notes. Fine-grained tannins provide excellent structure and grip, while fresh acidity deftly lifts the wine and maintains energy throughout. Mild herbal spiciness weaves through the fruit, adding complexity without overwhelming. The clay-limestone terroir contributes well-kept freshness and a textured quality that gives the wine personality and distinction."}

records.name: Private Label Installment
records.description: A flexible wine subscription or payment plan offering that provides access to curated selections of quality wines. This installment-based program allows wine enthusiasts to build their collection gradually while enjoying professionally selected bottles suited to their preferences.
records.vintage: Current releases at time of shipment
records.varietal: Mixed selections based on program curation
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The specific aromatic profile varies depending on the wine selection provided in each installment. Subscribers can expect professionally chosen wines that showcase classic varietal characteristics appropriate to the season and occasion.","finish":"Wines in this program are chosen to provide satisfying finishes that encourage food pairing and social enjoyment, making them ideal for regular consumption and entertaining.","palate":"Each installment features wines selected for their quality and food-friendliness, offering balanced flavor profiles that appeal to a range of palates. The program typically includes wines with good structure and approachable tannins or refreshing acidity."}

records.name: Domaine Chevallier Cuvee Prestige 2022
records.description: A distinguished Rhône Valley blend from Domaine Chevallier, the Cuvée Prestige represents the estate's top selection from their finest vineyard parcels. This wine showcases the rich, sun-drenched character of Southern Rhône wines with depth, complexity, and the garrigue-influenced terroir that defines the region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals an opulent bouquet of ripe dark cherry, blackberry, and plum, interwoven with the classic Rhône Valley aromatics of lavender, thyme, and dried herbs de Provence. Notes of black olive, leather, and cracked black pepper add savory complexity, while hints of violet, star anise, and sweet tobacco emerge with aeration. A subtle smokiness and touch of game round out this multifaceted aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit and savory herb notes. Hints of black pepper, licorice, and roasted meat linger, accompanied by fine-grained tannins that promise good aging potential while remaining smooth and integrated.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly concentrated, the palate delivers waves of dark fruit flavors including blackberry, black cherry, and cassis, supported by layers of complexity. Savory elements of roasted meat, tapenade, and dried Mediterranean herbs intermingle with the fruit, creating a compelling interplay. The wine's tannins are firm yet ripe, providing structure for aging while remaining approachable. Notes of garrigue, leather, and sweet spice from oak aging add depth, while the wine maintains balance through moderate acidity and excellent fruit concentration."}

records.name: Les Brebis Willamette Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: A vibrant expression of Oregon's Willamette Valley Pinot Noir from the small, family-run Les Brebis winery ("breu-BEE"), whose name references the Shaffer family's German heritage meaning "shepherd." Produced from sustainably farmed vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA and South Salem Hills, this wine is fermented in small lots with native yeast, aged in French oak barrels without chips, and bottled unfiltered without fining agents.
records.region: Willamette Valley (Eola-Amity Hills AVA and South Salem Hills), Oregon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant ripe red berry aromas, particularly dark cherry and cranberry, characteristic of premium Willamette Valley Pinot Noir. Subtle earthy undertones emerge, along with a touch of forest floor and delicate spice notes that speak to the organic and biodynamic farming practices. Light floral hints add elegance to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with the red fruit flavors continuing alongside subtle earthy notes. The unfiltered, unfined bottling provides natural texture and authenticity, allowing the wine's true character to shine through the final moments.","palate":"On the palate, everything you want from Willamette Pinot is present: juicy dark cherry flavors mingle with bright cranberry and hints of raspberry. A little spice from the oak aging adds complexity without overwhelming the pure fruit expression. The earthiness detected on the nose carries through, providing depth and terroir expression, while maintaining the characteristic silky texture of quality Oregon Pinot Noir."}

records.description: Domaine Chevallier Petit Chablis 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Domaine de Bellene Savigny Les Beaune Blanc 2020
records.description: Domaine de Bellene Savigny Les Beaune Blanc 2020 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Domaine de la Denante Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: A classic Bourgogne Rouge showcasing the approachable side of Burgundian Pinot Noir, with the characteristic richness and earthy complexity that defines the region. This wine offers authentic Burgundian character at an accessible price point, demonstrating balanced fruit expression with subtle terroir influence.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a rich garnet color, revealing appealing aromas of grilled plum, blackberry, and integrated baking spices. Notes of dark cherry emerge alongside subtle hints of bramble fruit, while a gentle earthiness adds complexity. The aromatic profile suggests ripe fruit balanced by classic Burgundian restraint.","finish":"The finish extends gracefully with slightly earthy notes persisting alongside dark fruit flavors. Black plum skin tannins provide grip without astringency, while subtle spice notes linger. The conclusion is balanced and food-friendly, inviting pairing with classic Burgundian cuisine.","palate":"Round and graceful on the palate, the wine delivers concentrated flavors of dark cherry, blueberry, and bramble berries. The texture is smooth and inviting, with black plum skin tannins providing structure without heaviness. Earthy elements characteristic of Burgundy emerge on the mid-palate, adding dimension to the fruit-forward core. The wine shows medium body with well-integrated oak influence."}

records.name: Domaine de la Denante Macon La Roche Vineuse Chardonnay 2023
records.description: Domaine de la Denante Macon La Roche Vineuse Chardonnay 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Reserva 2015
records.description: A traditional Rioja Reserva from one of the region's most respected historic producers, Bodegas Riojanas. This wine embodies classic Rioja characteristics with extended oak aging, showcasing the elegance and complexity that has made Rioja famous worldwide.
records.varietal: Tempranillo with possible small amounts of traditional Rioja blending grapes
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"A solid nose common to Rioja opens with earthy berry fruits, dried leaves, and olives that speak to traditional aging. The aromatic profile includes cherries and leather with a touch of smoke, creating layers of complexity. Spices emerge including pepper, sage, and vanilla from oak influence. Less sour cherry than many Riojas at this price point, with darker, riper fruit character.","finish":"Amazingly complex finish that evolves and develops with each sip. Dark cherry and plum flavors persist alongside spicy oak notes and hints of leather. The acidity provides lift and length, while the smooth tannins ensure a polished, refined conclusion. The wine leaves a lasting impression of classic Rioja character.","palate":"The palate is punchy with screechy acidity that offers flavors of plum and currant touched up by oaky vanilla. Smooth texture is complemented by a bit of chocolate that adds richness and depth. Over time, the wine fleshes out dramatically, becoming downright succulent with air exposure. The integration of fruit, oak, and acidity creates exceptional harmony for the price point."}

records.name: Domaine de la Villaudiere Charme de Loire Sauvignon Blanc 2021
records.description: Domaine de la Villaudiere Charme de Loire Sauvignon Blanc 2021 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.

records.name: Domaine des Perrelles Moulin a Vent 2020
records.description: From the prestigious Moulin-à-Vent cru in Beaujolais, Domaine des Perrelles crafts this exceptional Gamay from 60+ year-old vines. Produced by the Perrachon family, this wine represents the power and structure that Moulin-à-Vent is famous for, earning its nickname as the 'King of Beaujolais' for wines that can age gracefully like fine Burgundy.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a deep ruby color with captivating aromatics of red fruit compote, featuring ripe cherry and wild strawberry. Classic Beaujolais floral notes of iris and faded rose emerge delicately, adding elegance to the fruit-forward profile. Subtle earthy undertones provide depth, while hints of violet and fresh peach create an intoxicating, complex bouquet. The 12 months of oak foudre aging contributes gentle spice notes without overwhelming the wine's natural aromatics.","finish":"The finish reveals discreet, pleasant tannins that provide structure without astringency. Quite complex, the wine lingers with flavors of red fruit, earth, and delicate spice. The refined tannin structure and persistent minerality create a sophisticated, age-worthy conclusion that distinguishes this from lighter Beaujolais styles.","palate":"Round and well-structured on the palate, this wine showcases the power that defines Moulin-à-Vent. Concentrated flavors of succulent stone fruits and ripe cherries form the core, framed by vibrant acidity and earthy minerality. The texture is wonderfully structured with soft, delectable tannins that wrap around the fruit. Licorice and floral notes add complexity, while the old vines contribute depth and concentration. At 13% alcohol, the wine maintains balance and drinkability despite its intensity."}

records.name: Maison Ogier Vacqueyras 2023
records.description: A distinguished Southern Rhône red from Maison Ogier, one of the historic houses of Châteauneuf-du-Pape. This Vacqueyras showcases the power and elegance of wines from this elevated appellation, blending traditional Rhône varieties with precision and finesse.
records.varietal: Traditional Southern Rhône blend of Grenache, Syrah, and Mourvèdre
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a harmonious blend of ripe red and black fruits characteristic of the Southern Rhône. Expect aromas of dark cherries, blackberries, and plums complemented by the classic garrigue notes of the region including wild herbs, lavender, and Mediterranean scrubland. Subtle spicy elements add complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish maintains the wine's balance between power and elegance, with lingering fruit flavors complemented by peppery spice. The tannins are fine-grained and well-integrated, providing structure for aging while remaining approachable in youth. Notes of wild herbs return on the finish, creating a sense of place and terroir.","palate":"Generous and direct on the palate with excellent balance between spicy notes and the freshness of the fruit. Well-structured yet delicate tannins provide framework without overwhelming the wine's inherent elegance. The 2023 vintage shows the youthful vigor expected from a recent release, with vibrant fruit flavors of dark berries and cherries supported by integrated oak influence."}

records.name: Domaine des Perrelles Moulin a Vent 2023
records.description: Domaine des Perrelles Moulin a Vent 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Pomar Junction Sidetrack Red 2023
records.description: A proprietary red blend from Pomar Junction Vineyard & Winery, crafted to highlight the unique El Pomar District of Paso Robles. This family-owned estate practices sustainable farming (SIP Certified) in vineyards blessed with distinctive limestone soils and cooling Templeton Gap breezes. The blend typically features 43% Merlot, 31% Cabernet Sauvignon, and 26% Syrah, though proportions may vary by vintage.
records.varietal: Approximately 43% Merlot, 31% Cabernet Sauvignon, 26% Syrah (blend varies by vintage)
records.region: El Pomar District, Paso Robles, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays a brilliant, deep, rich color and opens with wonderful aromas of ripe plums and blueberries. Dark red roses add a floral complexity, while rich caramel notes suggest careful oak integration. The aromatic profile is immediately inviting and speaks to the wine's generous, approachable style.","finish":"The finish is food-friendly and approachable, with the luscious berry and chocolate notes persisting alongside subtle spice. The limestone terroir contributes a mineral backbone that keeps the wine from being overly heavy, despite its generous fruit profile.","palate":"Luscious berry flavors dominate the palate, showcasing the ripe fruit character of Paso Robles. Dark chocolate notes emerge mid-palate, adding depth and richness to the berry core. Warm baking spices from oak aging provide complexity without overwhelming the fruit, while the perfect amount of oak integration ensures balance and structure throughout."}

records.name: Domaine Du Fossile Rouge 2023
records.description: A fresh, vibrant Loire Valley red from Chinon, made from Cabernet Franc. This wine expresses the terroir of the Loire with its characteristic balance of fruit, earth, and herbaceous complexity. Designed for near-term enjoyment, it captures the essence of young, juicy Loire reds.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with notes of blackberry and raspberry bramble, mingling with the scent of freshly turned soil and savory herbs. Classic Cabernet Franc aromatics emerge with violet and graphite, while subtle green peppercorn and tobacco leaf add complexity. The earthy, herb-driven character speaks to the wine's Loire origins and cool-climate expression.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit and herbal notes. Bright acidity carries the flavors through to a crisp conclusion, leaving the palate ready for another sip or the next bite of food.","palate":"Juicy and vibrant on the palate, the wine showcases bright red fruit supported by supple, silky tannins that provide structure without weight. Red currant and cranberry flavors mingle with earthy undertones of forest floor and dried herbs. The texture is refreshing and energetic, with medium body and fine-grained tannins creating an approachable, food-friendly profile that epitomizes drinkable Loire Cabernet Franc."}

records.name: Zephaniah Cabernet Franc 2020
records.description: Zephaniah's Cabernet Franc showcases this noble varietal's distinctive aromatic complexity and elegant structure. The 2020 vintage benefited from excellent growing conditions, producing wines with concentrated flavors while maintaining the variety's characteristic freshness. This is a wine that demonstrates Cabernet Franc's ability to stand alone as a compelling, terroir-expressive red.
records.region: Napa Valley or similar premium California region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile is classically Cabernet Franc, opening with vibrant notes of crushed raspberries, black currant, and ripe plum. Distinctive herbaceous elements of bell pepper, dried tobacco leaf, and fresh-cut herbs add complexity and varietal character. Nuances of violet, graphite, and subtle oak-derived spice emerge with air. The nose displays the variety's signature elegance and perfume, with beautiful floral lift and underlying minerality.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with persistent red fruit notes, fine-grained tannins, and a subtle herbal complexity. Touches of cocoa powder and mineral character linger, while the wine's acidity provides a clean, mouthwatering conclusion. This is an elegant, food-friendly Cabernet Franc with excellent aging potential.","palate":"On the palate, the wine reveals medium to full body with silky tannins and bright acidity that energizes the fruit. Flavors of red and black cherry, raspberry coulis, and blackberry are accented by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet spice. The wine's savory character shines through with touches of dried herbs, cedar, and forest floor. The texture is refined and polished, with excellent balance between fruit concentration and structural elements. The 2020 vintage's freshness is evident in the wine's vibrant, lifted character."}

records.description: Domaine du Vieux College Bourgogne Aligote Traditionnel 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2017
records.description: A prestigious Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, one of the historic houses that has written the history of Rioja with capital letters. Founded in 1890 in Cenicero by the Artacho family along with Rafael Carreras, this wine represents the culmination of traditional Rioja winemaking with 30 months in American oak barrels and a minimum of two years bottle aging before release. The 2017 vintage earned a Silver Medal at Rioja Masters and a 92/100 critics score.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Elegant on the nose with well-blended aromas that showcase the harmony between extended oak aging and varietal character. Ruby-red fruit notes of cherry and raspberry mingle with hints of vanilla, coconut, and sweet tobacco from the American oak. Subtle leather, dried fig, and earthy undertones add complexity, while a touch of balsamic and forest floor speaks to the wine's maturity.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with the polished tannins continuing to provide elegance. Notes of tobacco, vanilla, and dried red fruit persist, while the excellent balance between fruit, oak, and acidity ensures a harmonious conclusion. This is classic Rioja Gran Reserva at its finest.","palate":"Very fine and well-structured in the mouth, the wine reveals the benefits of late harvest and slight over-ripening of the grapes. Good acidity provides backbone and freshness despite the wine's richness, while polished tannins offer structure without harshness. The blend of 80% Tempranillo, 15% Mazuela, and 5% Graciano creates layers of red fruit, spice, leather, and vanilla that are beautifully integrated and balanced."}

records.name: Domaine du Vieux College Marsannay Blanc "Les Vignes Marie" 2021
records.description: A refined white Burgundy from the Marsannay appellation, showcasing Chardonnay from the specific 'Les Vignes Marie' vineyard parcel. This wine represents the quality renaissance of Marsannay's white wines, offering excellent value for terroir-driven Burgundy with precision and elegance.
records.region: Marsannay AOC, Côte de Nuits, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate and precise aromatics feature white peach, yellow apple, and Bartlett pear, complemented by subtle notes of white flowers, acacia honey, and crushed limestone. The nose reveals classic Burgundian Chardonnay character with hints of hazelnut, brioche, and a touch of lemon zest. Restrained oak influence contributes vanilla bean and light toast notes without overpowering the fruit. The mineral component is pronounced, reflecting the limestone-rich terroir of Marsannay.","finish":"The finish is clean, focused, and moderately long, with citrus zest, white stone fruit, and mineral notes persisting gracefully. A touch of salinity and flinty character lingers, typical of well-made Marsannay blanc, leaving the palate refreshed yet satisfied.","palate":"Medium-bodied with elegant structure and excellent balance. Flavors of ripe pear, white peach, and citrus fruits are supported by vibrant acidity and a distinctive chalky minerality. The wine shows beautiful texture and depth, with creamy notes from lees aging balanced by refreshing citrus and stone fruit flavors. Mid-palate richness is complemented by mineral tension and a saline quality that adds complexity. The oak integration is seamless, contributing texture rather than overt flavor."}

records.name: Baleia Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: A distinctive Sauvignon Blanc from Baleia Wines, established in 2009 by the Joubert family in South Africa's Southern Cape. Despite the Portuguese name meaning 'whale,' this wine hails from the Cape South Coast's rocky limestone soils in a remote and unspoilt corner. The labels are inspired by St. Sebastien Bay, known as the 'Whale Nursery of South Africa,' and the winemaking style draws inspiration from the region's Mediterranean climate.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays a pale, greenish-gold color in the glass. Classic Sauvignon Blanc aromas dominate with elderberry flower and green fig leading the way. The rocky limestone soil imparts distinctive mineral notes, while the proximity to the Indian Ocean contributes subtle maritime nuances. Fresh-cut grass and hints of white pepper add aromatic complexity.","finish":"The finish is vibrant and mineral-driven with the chalky limestone character persisting alongside green fruit and citrus notes. The saline edge from the ocean proximity lingers pleasantly, providing a refreshing conclusion that makes you immediately want another sip. The wine's purity and focus are impressive.","palate":"On the palate, crisp green litchi flavors are the hallmark, accompanied by gooseberry, passion fruit, and lime zest. The pure, solid limestone soil with very high mineral content creates a particular mouthfeel reminiscent of chalky minerality. Maritime salinity from the coastal location adds a unique dimension, providing both freshness and texture that distinguishes this wine from typical Sauvignon Blanc."}

records.name: Domaine Fevre Chablis 2023
records.description: A classic expression of Chablis from the renowned Domaine William Fèvre, one of Burgundy's most respected producers. The 2023 vintage showcases the appellation's signature minerality and crisp acidity, with the sunny vintage adding ripeness and depth to the traditional Chardonnay profile.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with fresh aromas of lemon, green apple, and freshly sliced pear, capturing the essence of Chablis purity. White flowers—particularly apple blossom and acacia—add delicate floral lift. Classic Chablis minerality emerges with notes of wet stones, chalk, and crushed oyster shell. Green almond and fennel provide subtle complexity, while the aromatics remain clean, precise, and inviting. The 2023 vintage shows more ripeness than typical, with hints of green melon adding depth.","finish":"The finish is crisp and mineral-driven, with lingering notes of citrus, green apple, and chalk. Clean and refreshing, the wine concludes with bright acidity and a distinctive flinty character that defines great Chablis.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied and well-balanced, the palate features bright citrus flavors of lemon and lime zest, complemented by crisp green apple and ripe pear. The texture is supple yet creamy, with a milky quality that adds richness without weight. Notable minerality is the hallmark—wet stone and flinty notes run through the wine, providing classic Chablis character and terroir expression. A tang of fresh, crunchy acidity keeps the wine vibrant and food-friendly, with green melon ripeness from the sunny 2023 vintage adding depth. The finish is malic and refreshing, maintaining energy throughout."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Dogwood & Thistle Sauvignon Blanc 2023
records.description: A vibrant Virginia Sauvignon Blanc showcasing the cooler-climate characteristics of American terroir. This 2023 vintage captures the crisp, herbaceous notes typical of quality New World Sauvignon Blanc while maintaining the elegance associated with mid-Atlantic viticulture.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright citrus notes of grapefruit zest and Meyer lemon, layered with characteristic green aromatics of freshly cut grass and subtle bell pepper. Delicate tropical hints of passion fruit emerge alongside white floral notes reminiscent of elderflower. The aromatic profile shows methoxypyrazine influence typical of cooler-climate expressions, balanced with thiol-driven complexity.","finish":"The finish is refreshingly tart with lingering citrus peel and a hint of wet stone minerality. Bright acidity persists, cleansing the palate with crisp green flavors that invite the next sip. Best enjoyed within 1-2 years of vintage to preserve aromatic vibrancy.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers crisp, energetic acidity that frames flavors of lime, green apple, and white peach. The mid-palate reveals herbaceous notes of nettle and fresh basil, complemented by a subtle minerality suggesting limestone influence from Virginia terroir. The texture remains lean and focused, with tropical fruit undertones adding depth without heaviness. Clean varietal character shines through without oak influence, showcasing pure fruit expression."}

records.name: Remhoogte Honeybunch 2024
records.description: A delightful South African wine that lives up to its charming name with approachable sweetness and vibrant fruit character. Remhoogte's Honeybunch 2024 represents the estate's lighter, more playful offering, crafted to deliver immediate pleasure with its fresh, fruity profile and gentle sweetness that appeals to a wide range of palates.
records.varietal: Likely Chenin Blanc, Muscat, or aromatic white blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with exuberant aromas of ripe peach, apricot, and honeyed pear. Tropical notes of lychee and guava add exotic appeal, while delicate floral hints of orange blossom and jasmine provide elegance. A subtle suggestion of honey and candied citrus peel reinforces the wine's sweet character without veering into cloying territory.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately sweet with lingering peach and honey notes. Bright acidity cuts through the sweetness, leaving the palate refreshed rather than cloyed. A gentle persistence of fruit and floral notes invites another sip.","palate":"Off-dry to medium-sweet on the palate, with luscious flavors of stone fruits and tropical fruits in perfect harmony. White peach, nectarine, and mango dominate, supported by a core of honeyed sweetness that feels natural rather than added. Refreshing acidity balances the residual sugar beautifully, preventing heaviness and keeping the wine lively and food-friendly. The mouthfeel is smooth and rounded with a pleasant viscosity."}

records.name: Dominique Portet Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: A Bordeaux-influenced Sauvignon Blanc from Australia's prestigious Yarra Valley, crafted by ninth-generation winemaker Dominique Portet. This was the first wine released under the Dominique Portet label in 2000 and represents a distinctive approach to the variety, employing barrel fermentation with lees stirring to create complexity and texture reminiscent of white Bordeaux. Executive winemaker Ben Portet continues his father's legacy of producing elegant, food-friendly wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a sophisticated blend of citrus and white stone fruits, particularly lemon, lime, and white peach, that provide the aromatic foundation. White blossom and delicate floral notes add elegance and lift, while subtle hints of dry grass and fresh herbs reflect classic Sauvignon Blanc character. What distinguishes this wine is the presence of honeycomb and subtle gunflint notes from barrel fermentation and lees contact, adding layers of complexity beyond typical varietal expression. Light toasty nuances emerge as the wine opens, speaking to the Bordeaux-influenced winemaking approach. The aromatic profile is refined and integrated, balancing fruit purity with textural complexity.","finish":"Long and refined, with persistent citrus notes and a distinctive mineral quality. The creamy texture continues through the finish, with honeycomb and stone fruit flavors lingering gracefully. The wine's bright acidity ensures a fresh, clean conclusion while the barrel influence adds length and sophistication. A subtle flinty quality returns on the tail, adding a final layer of complexity.","palate":"The palate reveals exceptional structure and roundness unusual for Sauvignon Blanc, with the barrel fermentation and lees stirring creating a creamy, delicate mouthfeel that sets this wine apart. Citrus and stone fruit flavors dominate—particularly white peach, lemon, and lime—supported by bright natural acidity that provides framework and energy. The texture is notably creamy and textural, with subtle weight and body that make this wine more substantial than typical Sauvignon Blanc. Honeycomb and light mineral notes add complexity, while the oak influence remains perfectly integrated, enhancing rather than masking the varietal character. This is a wine that emphasizes elegance, balance, and food compatibility over overt fruit or herbaceous character."}

records.name: Trespass Merlot 2021
records.description: A well-crafted Merlot from the excellent 2021 vintage, a year that produced powerful performers across California wine regions. This wine represents the modern renaissance of Merlot, showcasing the variety's ability to deliver both approachability and complexity when thoughtfully vinified.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with lush aromas of ripe black cherry and plum, complemented by notes of dark chocolate and mocha. Subtle hints of cedar and dried herbs add complexity, while a touch of vanilla from oak aging integrates seamlessly. The aromatics are inviting and generous, showing the variety's naturally expressive character.","finish":"Medium to long finish with soft tannins and lingering dark fruit flavors. Subtle notes of chocolate and toasted oak carry through to the end, leaving a pleasant, satisfying impression.","palate":"Smooth and velvety on the palate with supple tannins that provide structure without astringency. Flavors of blackberry, cherry, and plum dominate the mid-palate, supported by notes of cocoa, espresso, and baking spices. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit richness and savory elements, with integrated oak adding depth rather than overwhelming the fruit. The texture is round and mouth-coating, characteristic of well-made Merlot."}

records.name: Echevarria Propuesta 2017
records.description: An elegant Chilean red blend from the Curicó Valley, showcasing the Echeverria family's dedication to Old World winemaking techniques applied to Chile's exceptional terroir. The 2017 vintage benefits from extended barrel aging and represents the winery's special selection tier.
records.varietal: 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petit Verdot, 5% Cabernet Franc
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic Cabernet Sauvignon leads the aromatic profile with notes of ripe blackcurrant, cedar, and tobacco leaf. The blend's Petit Verdot component adds floral violet notes and spice, while Cabernet Franc contributes an herbal complexity. With age, secondary aromas of leather and dried herbs have developed, adding sophistication to the bouquet.","finish":"The finish is smooth and persistent, with ripe fruit flavors extending through a framework of fine-grained tannins. Oak influence from 10-12 months in new French barrels provides subtle vanilla and spice notes that complement rather than dominate the fruit.","palate":"Elegant and balanced, the palate delivers juicy ripe fruit flavors framed by well-integrated French oak. The 85% Cabernet Sauvignon base provides structure and cassis fruit, while 10% Petit Verdot adds density and dark fruit concentration. 5% Cabernet Franc brings aromatic lift and refined tannins. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit ripeness and freshness, avoiding over-extraction despite Chile's intense sunlight."}

records.name: Endhardt Vineyards Golden Turkey Red 2021
records.description: A bold red blend from award-winning Endhardt Vineyards in Purcellville, Virginia's Loudoun County. This proprietary blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Tannat earned a gold medal at the prestigious 2025 Virginia Governor's Cup state-wide wine competition. The winery, opened in Fall 2021 by Hannes and Sarah Endhardt, has quickly established itself as one of Virginia's premier producers.
records.varietal: Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Tannat (exact percentages not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bold and expressive, announcing its multi-varietal complexity from the first swirl. Black cherry and blackberry dominate initially, characteristic of the Cabernet components, while the Merlot contributes plush red fruit and floral notes. Petit Verdot adds violet and lavender aromatics, creating an enticing floral dimension. Hints of graphite, dried herbs, and subtle oak spice from French oak aging add structure and sophistication to the aromatic profile.","finish":"Long and structured, the finish demonstrates the wine's ageability with firm but ripe tannins that will soften with time. Dark fruit lingers alongside cedar, tobacco, and spice notes. The substantial structure ensures this wine will develop additional complexity over the next 5-8 years while remaining approachable now for those who enjoy bold reds.","palate":"This is a powerful, structured wine that showcases Virginia's ability to produce world-class Bordeaux-style blends. Ripe black and red fruit flavors meld seamlessly, with each varietal contributing its signature characteristics while maintaining overall harmony. Cabernet Franc provides herbaceous complexity and bright acidity, Merlot offers mid-palate richness and plush texture, Petit Verdot contributes color and firm tannic structure, Cabernet Sauvignon supplies backbone and cassis fruit, while Tannat adds grip and aging potential. The oak aging is well-integrated, providing vanilla and toast notes without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Endhardt Vineyards Chardonnay 2022
records.description: Endhardt Vineyards, one of Virginia's rising star wineries in Purcellville, crafted this Chardonnay from their second harvest after planting in 2021. This young estate has already earned recognition, with their 2023 vintage securing a silver medal at the Virginia Governor's Cup, marking them as a producer to watch in Loudoun County's burgeoning wine scene.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright orchard fruit aromatics of crisp green apple and Asian pear, layered with subtle notes of Meyer lemon zest and honeysuckle. There's a delicate minerality reminiscent of wet stone, characteristic of Virginia's terroir, alongside hints of vanilla and toasted hazelnut from restrained oak influence. Fresh acidity lifts the aromatics, creating an inviting and elegant bouquet.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of citrus zest and a pleasant mineral quality. There's a refreshing acidity that leaves the palate cleansed and ready for another sip, with just a whisper of oak spice on the very end. The wine's youthful energy shines through, suggesting it will develop additional complexity with 1-2 years of bottle age.","palate":"Medium-bodied with refreshing acidity that drives flavors of ripe Bartlett pear, golden apple, and citrus across the palate. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit expression and structure, with a creamy mid-palate texture that doesn't overwhelm the bright fruit character. Subtle notes of brioche and butter emerge, suggesting partial malolactic fermentation, while maintaining the crisp, clean profile that defines quality Virginia Chardonnay."}

records.name: Finca Buenaventura Aureo Chardonnay 2019
records.description: Finca Buenaventura Aureo Chardonnay 2019 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Finca Buenaventura Aureo Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
records.description: A super-premium Cabernet Sauvignon from Argentina's prestigious Uco Valley, sourced from high-altitude vineyards at 3,680 feet that drink pristine Andes snowmelt and bask under intense mountain sun. The exceptional ripeness and concentration achievable at this elevation create a Cabernet of remarkable intensity and character, aged in a combination of French and American oak.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose showcases the wine's outstanding fruit ripeness with intense aromas of ripe raspberries, fresh cherries, and concentrated dark berry fruit. Layers of vanilla and sweet baking spice from oak aging intertwine with the fruit, while subtle notes of black pepper, cocoa, and violet add complexity. High-altitude character reveals itself through bright, pure fruit expression.","finish":"The flavor ends sweet in the mouth with lingering jam-like fruit character and persistent vanilla notes. The finish is smooth and approachable with well-integrated tannins and good length. Subtle spice and chocolate notes provide complexity through the conclusion, making this an indulgent, crowd-pleasing Cabernet.","palate":"Rich and opulent on the palate with flavors that emphasize the ripeness of the fruit. Red fruit aromas translate to intense raspberry and cherry flavors on the tongue, complemented by notes of blackberry jam and cassis. The wine is full-bodied with smooth, integrated tannins and excellent concentration from the high-altitude fruit. Vanilla and sweet oak notes provide support without overwhelming the pure fruit core."}

records.name: Frascole Chianti Rufina Riserva 2019
records.description: Frascole Chianti Rufina Riserva 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Lueria Terrace  (MD & DC) 2023
records.description: A distinguished kosher red blend from Israel's Upper Galilee, crafted from grapes grown on unique volcanic terraces at 850 meters elevation. This wine showcases the exceptional terroir of the region, combining the structured elegance of Bordeaux varietals with the spiced richness characteristic of Mediterranean viticulture.
records.region: Upper Galilee, Israel (terrace vineyards at 850m elevation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays a deep purple hue in the glass, revealing an aromatic profile of ripe red berries and dark plum. Initial notes of blackcurrant and cherry mingle with subtle spice elements, while the volcanic terroir contributes distinctive mineral undertones. Hints of toasted oak and vanilla from barrel aging add complexity without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish is long and pleasant, characterized by persistent fruit notes and well-integrated tannins from 12 months of French oak aging. The conclusion is warm and satisfying, with lingering spice and dark fruit notes that demonstrate the wine's aging in separate varietals before final blending.","palate":"Full-bodied with notable richness, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of red currant, blackberry, and plum skin, enhanced by integrated spice notes. The volcanic rock, limestone, and Terra Rossa soil composition imparts a distinctive minerality that threads through the wine's structure. The 60% Cabernet Sauvignon provides the backbone, while 25% Shiraz adds peppery spice and 15% Cabernet Franc contributes aromatic lift and finesse."}

records.name: Fledge and Co Sauvignon Blanc 2018

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Frascole Chianti Rufina 2022
records.description: Frascole Chianti Rufina 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Fledge and Co Riesling 2018
records.description: A distinctive dry Riesling from South Africa's Western Cape, crafted by husband-and-wife winemaking team Leon Coetzee and Margaux Nel. Sourced from characterful, lesser-known regions across the Cape, this wine showcases expressive aromatics with razor-sharp acidity despite containing 5 grams of residual sugar.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is immediately striking and unconventional, opening with unusual notes of rubber boots and petrol that are hallmarks of aged Riesling. Bright lemon peel and pink grapefruit provide citrus backbone, while delicate white flowers—jasmine and orange blossom—add elegance. There's an intriguing mineral edge with wet stone and slate characteristics that speak to the terroir.","finish":"The finish is long and vibrant, maintaining that characteristic dry sensation despite the residual sugar. Citrus zest and mineral notes persist, with lingering acidity that cleanses the palate completely. The petrol character reappears subtly, adding complexity to the aftertaste.","palate":"Despite the presence of 5 grams of residual sugar, the wine feels bone dry on the palate thanks to razor-sharp acidity that cuts through with precision. Intense citrus flavors of lemon, lime, and grapefruit dominate, balanced by green apple and subtle tropical hints. The mouthfeel is crisp and focused with electric energy, showing the winemakers' skill in balancing sweetness with acidity. Light to medium body with exceptional purity and tension."}

records.name: Fledge and Co Red NV
records.description: A characterful red blend from The Fledge & Co, based in Calitzdorp in South Africa's Klein Karoo region. This winery specializes in wines from lesser-known, characterful regions, creating blends that showcase personality and terroir. The non-vintage format allows for consistency and blending of multiple harvests for optimal quality.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Portuguese varieties and/or Rhône varieties)
records.region: Klein Karoo / Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a melange of red and black hedgerow fruits including blackberry, raspberry, and wild berries. Meaty undertones add savory complexity, while exotic spice notes - cardamom, black pepper, and coriander - create intrigue. Aromas of fynbos (indigenous South African flora) add a distinctive regional character. Subtle notes of cocoa nibs, leather, and earth provide depth, while hints of dried herbs contribute to the wine's complexity.","finish":"The finish is long with persistent fruit and spice notes. Firm but refined tannins provide structure, while the wine's savory character and bright acidity leave the palate intrigued and ready for food.","palate":"On the palate, the wine delivers bright red and black fruit flavors with excellent concentration. Blackberry, black cherry, raspberry, and plum create a juicy, fruit-forward core. The wine shows good structure with powdery yet firm tannins that provide framework without astringency. A savory twist adds complexity to the fruit, while a lilt of acidity keeps everything fresh and balanced. Mid-palate reveals layers of spice, earth, and subtle oak influence. The texture is medium to full-bodied with good weight and presence."}

records.name: Croix Narrow Gauge Pinot Noir
records.description: A regional expression of Russian River Valley Pinot Noir from select vineyard sites, this wine represents the fuller, broader style of the appellation while maintaining the aromatic complexity and balanced acidity that defines great California Pinot. Consistently scoring 92 points, it offers exceptional value for the quality delivered.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir (blend of select Russian River Valley vineyards)
records.region: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is distinctively earthy, opening with black tea, baking spice, and aromatic potpourri alongside warm black cherry. Layers of cinnamon, peppercorn, dried leaves, and rose water create complexity, while subtle notes of sweet earth, crushed red berries, and allspice add depth. The aromatics showcase classic Russian River Valley Pinot character with expressive intensity.","finish":"The finish demonstrates excellent length with fine tannins and persistent acidity keeping the wine vibrant. Lingering notes of baked cherry, black tea, and subtle spice fade gracefully, with earthy undertones providing a grounded, satisfying conclusion.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a silky, refined texture, the palate delivers focused flavors of crisp rhubarb, red cherry, and pomegranate, complemented by dark notes of black currant and mulberry. The wine shows concentrated fruit balanced by tongue-curling acidity and a stemmy freshness that provides structure. Earthy elements of black earth and hints of smoked cherry intermingle with cardamom and sweet spice, creating a multi-dimensional tasting experience."}

records.name: Frico Lambrusco Cans IGT Emilia (NOVA only)   250 ml
records.description: Frico Lambrusco Cans IGT Emilia (NOVA only)   250 ml is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Frico Rose (NOVA only) 2023
records.description: Scarpetta's Frico Rosato is a light-bodied Italian rosé crafted from indigenous Tuscan grape varieties including Sangiovese, Canaiolo, and Ciliegiolo. This approachable wine showcases the natural high acidity and bright fruit character of these traditional varieties, creating a versatile rosé perfect for casual occasions and warm-weather drinking.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a delicate salmon-pink color with brilliant clarity. The nose opens with vibrant aromas of fresh cherry and wild strawberry, complemented by subtle red currant notes. Herbaceous undertones add complexity, featuring hints of fresh basil, Mediterranean herbs, and a touch of white pepper. The wine's natural aromatic purity reflects minimal intervention winemaking, with no oak influence to obscure the varietals' inherent characteristics.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering tart cherry and herbal notes. The wine's crisp acidity leaves the palate cleansed and ready for food, while subtle mineral notes add interest. Medium-length with no heaviness or sweetness, the conclusion invites another sip with its pure, straightforward character.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on the palate, the wine delivers bright tart cherry flavors at its core, supported by strawberry and cranberry notes. The herbaceous character from the nose carries through, adding savory complexity to the fruit-forward profile. Natural high acidity creates excellent structure and makes this an incredibly food-friendly wine. Light-bodied and clean, the wine shows no residual sweetness, instead offering a bone-dry profile that emphasizes freshness and drinkability. The texture is smooth and uncomplicated, perfect for casual enjoyment."}

records.name: Frico Sangiovese IGT Toscana (NOVA only) 2023
records.description: Frico Sangiovese IGT Toscana (NOVA only) 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Galea White Sangria NV
records.description: Galea White Sangria NV is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
