records.name: Giustini Avoglia Primitivo 2024
records.description: Giustini Avoglia Primitivo 2024 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Gavioli Lambrusco  Emilia Semisweet NV
records.description: A traditional sparkling red Lambrusco from Emilia-Romagna, Italy's heartland of this distinctive style. This semisweet expression balances effervescence, fruit-forward character, and gentle sweetness, making it perfect for casual enjoyment and surprisingly versatile food pairing.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with fresh, vibrant red berry aromatics that immediately signal the wine's approachable, festive character. Dominant notes of ripe strawberry and raspberry create an intensely fruity profile, accented by hints of wild forest berries and delicate florals. The aromatic intensity is remarkable for a sparkling wine, developing an almost irresistible berry-forward character that promises pleasure. Light spice notes and subtle earthy undertones add just enough complexity to keep the wine interesting without compromising its joyful exuberance.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red berry fruit, gentle bubbles, and refreshing acidity that balances the residual sugar. The wine concludes on a fresh, fruity note that invites another glass, leaving the palate cleansed despite the semisweet profile.","palate":"On the palate, this Lambrusco delivers exactly what the style promises - fresh, sparkling, fruity pleasure with a light, refreshing attack. The effervescence is gentle and creamy rather than aggressive, creating a pleasant mousse that carries the fruit flavors beautifully. Strawberry and raspberry dominate with additional notes of red cherry and wild berries, while the semisweet style provides balance without cloying. The sweetness level is carefully judged - enough to soften the wine's natural acidity and enhance fruit expression, but restrained enough to maintain food-friendliness. The wine shows surprising freshness and vibrancy, with the bubbles providing lift and making each sip feel celebratory."}

records.name: Frico Sangiovese IGT Toscana (NOVA only) 2022
records.description: A vibrant expression of Tuscan Sangiovese showcasing the accessible charm of the IGT classification. This 2022 vintage captures the essence of central Italy's signature grape with bright acidity and authentic regional character, offering exceptional value for everyday enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright red cherry and wild strawberry notes, complemented by hints of dried Mediterranean herbs including oregano and thyme. Subtle earthy undertones of terracotta and dried rose petals add complexity, while a whisper of black tea and tobacco leaf emerges with air. The aromatic profile speaks to the warm Tuscan sun and the traditional winemaking approach.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of red fruit and a subtle bitter almond character typical of Sangiovese. Fine-grained tannins provide a gentle grip, while bright acidity encourages another sip. A touch of herbal minerality persists, making this an ideal companion to rustic Italian cuisine.","palate":"Medium-bodied with lively acidity that defines classic Sangiovese, the palate delivers flavors of tart red cherry, cranberry, and pomegranate. The wine's natural freshness is balanced by gentle tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate notes of orange zest and sun-dried tomato add savory complexity, while the characteristic Sangiovese acidity keeps the wine energetic and food-friendly throughout."}

records.name: Galea Red Sangria NV
records.description: An organic red sangria from Barcelona, Spain, crafted from Tempranillo, Merlot, and Syrah grapes with natural orange and cassis essences. This ready-to-drink sangria showcases deep fruit flavors with a refreshing frizzante touch and only 7% alcohol, making it perfect for casual gatherings. Organic, gluten-free, and vegan-friendly.
records.varietal: Organic blend: Tempranillo, Merlot, Syrah with natural orange and cassis essences
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with juicy, deep notes of dark cherry and black cherry, enhanced by natural orange essence that adds bright citrus character. Cassis provides blackcurrant intensity, while subtle cocoa notes add richness. An earthy, rustic quality emerges with hints of Mediterranean herbs. A touch of fresh ginger adds an unexpected and delightful spice element. The organic fruit character shines through with purity and authenticity.","finish":"The finish is refreshing and clean with the frizzante carbonation maintaining vibrancy through the aftertaste. Dark cherry and orange notes linger, along with subtle spice from the ginger. The lower alcohol content prevents any heaviness, leaving a mouthwatering sensation that invites another sip.","palate":"The palate delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors with dark cherry and cassis dominating. Natural orange essence provides citrus brightness that balances the fruit sweetness, creating harmony between ripe and fresh elements. Subtle cocoa notes add depth mid-palate, while the hint of ginger provides warming spice. The frizzante touch—light carbonation—is very well integrated, giving special freshness and liveliness to the experience. Light-bodied at 7% alcohol, making it dangerously drinkable and perfect for extended enjoyment."}

records.name: Gavioli Lambrusco Classic 2018
records.description: Gavioli Lambrusco Classic 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Gavioli Lambrusco Sorbara DOC Dry NV
records.description: Gavioli Lambrusco Sorbara DOC Dry NV is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Tributo Malbec 2020
records.description: A concentrated Argentine Malbec showcasing the deep color and intense fruity character that has made this varietal Argentina's signature wine. The 2020 vintage delivers the velvety texture and plush fruit expression characteristic of quality Argentine Malbec, likely sourced from the renowned Mendoza region where this varietal achieves its greatest heights.
records.region: Mendoza, Argentina (likely high-altitude Luján de Cuyo or Uco Valley)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with ripe dark fruit aromas of blackberry, black plum, and cassis, accompanied by distinctive violet florals that define Argentine Malbec. Layers of dark chocolate and espresso emerge alongside sweet vanilla oak notes, while subtle hints of dried fig and raisin suggest concentrated fruit from warm-climate viticulture. The intense, perfumed aromatics showcase the variety's juicy fruit character enhanced by careful oak integration.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit flavors and gentle tannins that coat the palate. Chocolate and coffee notes linger alongside the wine's signature violet character, while integrated oak adds vanilla sweetness without dominating. The 2020 vintage shows excellent aging potential similar to French Malbecs despite its softer tannic structure.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers full-bodied richness with velvety, plush tannins characteristic of Argentine style—softer and more approachable than French Malbec counterparts. Flavors of ripe black cherry, boysenberry, and blackberry compote dominate, supported by notes of mocha, cocoa powder, and toasted oak. The texture is luxurious and mouth-filling without excessive weight, while maintained acidity (crucial in warm-climate Malbec) provides balance and prevents the wine from tasting flabby. Mid-palate complexity includes leather, tobacco, and subtle spice notes."}

records.name: Endhardt Rose 2021
records.description: An elegant European-style rosé crafted using traditional skin-contact methods to achieve delicate color and refined flavor profile. This 2021 vintage captures the fresh, fruity character essential to quality rosé while offering subtle complexity from careful winemaking techniques.
records.varietal: Traditional rosé blend (likely Grenache, Syrah, or Pinot Noir base)
records.region: European origin (likely French or Italian based on style)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents delicate aromas of wild strawberry, white peach, and watermelon rind, complemented by subtle floral notes of rose petal and orange blossom. Bright citrus hints of pink grapefruit emerge alongside thiol-driven aromatics of passion fruit and lychee, derived from carefully controlled skin contact temperatures. The pale, onion-skin hue suggests gentle extraction focusing on aromatic complexity over color intensity.","finish":"The finish is clean and bright with lingering red berry flavors and refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate. Subtle citrus notes of grapefruit zest persist alongside delicate floral hints. Best consumed within 1-2 years of vintage to maximize aromatic freshness before volatile thiol compounds diminish.","palate":"The palate delivers refreshing acidity with crisp flavors of red currant, Rainier cherry, and nectarine. Light-bodied and vibrant, the wine shows minimal phenolic structure from brief skin contact, creating an accessible, easy-drinking style. Mid-palate notes of fresh melon and raspberry add depth, while subtle minerality provides backbone. The wine's low tannin profile and bright fruit character reflect classic rosé production focusing on immediate drinkability and aromatic freshness."}

records.name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Igartzeta 2022
records.description: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Igartzeta 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Igartzeta 2023
records.description: A crisp, coastal Basque white from the historic Basa Lore winery, one of the six founding estates of the Getariako Txakolina DO. This entirely women-owned and operated estate has been crafting traditional Txakolina near San Sebastian since 1925.
records.varietal: Primarily Hondarrabi Zuri with possible Hondarrabi Beltza
records.region: Getariako Txakolina DO, Basque Country, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Vibrant aromas of fresh lemon zest and green apple skin dominate the nose, accompanied by zesty green herbs reminiscent of the nearby forests. Bright citrus notes of lime and grapefruit add complexity, while a distinct maritime minerality hints at the winery's proximity to the Atlantic Ocean. Subtle white flower notes and a touch of salinity complete this inviting aromatic profile.","finish":"Clean, zesty finish with lingering citrus and sea salt notes. The mineral character persists beautifully, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for the next bite or sip.","palate":"Light-bodied and lemony on the palate with gorgeous salinity that serves as a constant reminder of the sea. The wine is wonderfully crisp and bright, featuring fresh mineral notes and vibrant citrus fruits that dance across the tongue. Lime and green apple flavors are complemented by a pronounced saline character that adds depth and interest. The refreshing acidity is perfectly balanced, making this an incredibly food-friendly wine."}

records.name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Rose 2023
records.description: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Rose 2023 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Korde Pinea Rose 2023
records.description: A contemporary rosé showcasing bright fruit character and modern winemaking precision. The 2023 vintage delivers fresh, vibrant aromatics with balanced structure, crafted for immediate enjoyment at optimal freshness.
records.varietal: Rosé blend (likely Pinot Noir, Grenache, or Syrah base)
records.region: Unknown origin (contemporary style suggests New World production)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet offers enticing aromas of fresh raspberry, cranberry, and pink grapefruit, layered with delicate notes of white flowers and honeysuckle. Subtle tropical hints of guava and lychee suggest thiol development from controlled-temperature skin contact above 20°C (68°F). The vibrant aromatics indicate recent bottling with key volatile compounds still at peak intensity, showcasing the wine's youthful exuberance.","finish":"The finish is crisp and clean with persistent red berry notes and refreshing citrus acidity. A subtle saline minerality emerges, adding complexity and length. The wine's bright, juicy character lingers pleasantly, inviting another sip. As a 2023 vintage consumed in 2025, this rosé is at its peak drinking window with full aromatic expression intact.","palate":"The palate presents lively acidity with flavors of pomegranate, blood orange, and ripe strawberry. Medium-light body with subtle textural weight suggests slightly extended skin contact compared to pale rosés, providing enhanced flavor extraction without heaviness. Notes of watermelon, white cherry, and citrus zest create a refreshing, fruit-forward profile. The wine shows minimal phenolic grip, maintaining the soft, approachable character essential to quality rosé while offering enough structure for food pairing versatility."}

records.name: Giustini Areale Primitivo di Manduria 2024
records.description: Giustini Areale Primitivo di Manduria 2024 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Rose 2022
records.description: A traditional Basque txakoli rosé from one of the oldest producers in the D.O. Getariako Txakolina, making wine since 1930. The 'Sarea' rosé showcases indigenous Basque grapes Hondarrabi Beltza and Hondarrabi Zuri from vineyards on the slopes above Zarautz beach. With characteristic light effervescence and bright salinity, this wine captures the essence of Basque coastal winemaking.
records.region: Getariako Txakolina D.O., Basque Country, Spain (Gipuzkoa)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Pale pink with shades of fuchsia, presenting a bright, elegant appearance. The fine and elegant bubble creates visual appeal. The nose offers traditional txakoli aromatics with bright strawberry leading alongside prickly pear and apricot. Fresh mint adds herbal complexity and coastal character. The aromatic profile is clean, fresh, and inviting.","finish":"Clean and invigorating with persistent mineral and fruit notes. The salinity lingers alongside the gentle effervescence, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with lively acidity and a touch of fizz characteristic of txakoli. Flavors of strawberry, prickly pear, and apricot dominate, showing pure fruit expression. The wine displays undeniable salinity from the coastal influence, adding a savory mineral edge that enhances food-pairing potential. Hints of mint provide herbal freshness. The texture is crisp and refreshing."}

records.description: Giustini Avoglia Fiano 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Noble Hill Simonskop Chenin Blanc 2022
records.description: An organically farmed, barrel-aged Chenin Blanc from a single vineyard planted in 1987 on mountainous granite soils in South Africa's Simonsberg region. This wine demonstrates the textural complexity and mineral precision achievable with old-vine Chenin Blanc, balancing richness with vibrant acidity in the finest Cape tradition.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with aromas of quince, white peach, and honeysuckle, beautifully accented by subtle almond and wet stone minerality. Plump notes of honeyed apple and apricot emerge, while hints of baking spice from oak integration add complexity. The aromatic profile suggests both fruit ripeness and cool-climate minerality in harmonious balance.","finish":"The finish is long and clean, marked by refreshing citrus-mineral acidity that balances the wine's textural richness. Lingering notes of peach, citrus zest, and wet stone provide a satisfying, food-friendly conclusion. The almond and honeyed elements fade gracefully, leaving a mineral impression.","palate":"The palate shows exceptional texture with a creamy mid-palate derived from barrel aging, balanced by crisp orchard fruit flavors of green apple and pear. Zesty citrus notes provide lift, while layers of white peach and apricot add richness. A distinctive chalky minerality from the granite soils threads through the wine, providing structure and precision. The dry-farmed, organic vineyard character contributes purity and intensity to the fruit expression."}

records.name: Domaine des Perrelles Moulin a Vent 2021
records.description: A distinguished Moulin-à-Vent from one of Beaujolais's most prestigious Cru appellations, produced from Gamay grown on granitic acidic soils. This 2021 vintage from Domaine des Perrelles showcases the structured, age-worthy character that distinguishes Moulin-à-Vent as the 'King of Beaujolais,' offering complexity beyond typical carbonic maceration styles.
records.varietal: 100% Gamay grown on granitic acidic soils
records.region: Moulin-à-Vent AOC, Beaujolais, France (border of Rhône and Saône-et-Loire)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals concentrated aromas of sour cherry, black pepper, and dried cranberry characteristic of Gamay from acidic granite soils. Mineral notes of fresh-cut stone and chalk emerge alongside subtle rose petal and violet florals. Unlike lighter Beaujolais styles, this wine shows darker fruit concentration with hints of dried plum, graphite, and forest floor, suggesting traditional fermentation methods emphasizing structure over primary fruit exuberance. The aromatic complexity reflects the appellation's reputation for producing Beaujolais's most serious, Burgundian wines.","finish":"The finish is persistent with firm tannins and mineral-driven complexity. Sour cherry and black pepper notes linger alongside chalky minerality and subtle spice. The wine's structure suggests good aging potential—Moulin-à-Vent's reputation as one of few Gamay-based wines capable of extended cellaring. At 4 years of age, the 2021 is entering its prime drinking window with integrated tannins and developing tertiary complexity.","palate":"The palate delivers medium body with firm acidity and structured tannins unusual for Gamay, showcasing Moulin-à-Vent's distinctive tannic grip from granitic terroir. Flavors of tart cherry, raspberry preserve, and blackcurrant combine with savory notes of black pepper, crushed stone, and dried herbs. The wine shows earthy complexity with mushroom and forest floor nuances, while maintained acidity provides freshness and balance. Unlike carbonic maceration styles emphasizing bright strawberry, this wine offers depth and seriousness befitting a Cru Beaujolais."}

records.name: Gondola Chianti  Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: Gondola Chianti  Mevushal (MD & DC) is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Giustini Patu Primitivo 2023
records.description: A rich and enveloping Primitivo from Salento, Puglia, crafted by Tenuta Giustini as a homage to the Papadopoli family's Greek roots. Their ancestors settled in the heart of Salento to devote themselves to peasant life and viticulture. This wine offers exceptional value and has increased in popularity, delivering the warmth and generosity characteristic of Southern Italian reds.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is immediately expressive, revealing ripe fruit aromas of dark cherry, blackberry jam, and plum, complemented by notes of dried fig and raisin. A distinctive fine note of milk chocolate adds richness and depth, while subtle hints of sweet spice—cinnamon and vanilla—emerge from the wine's oak influence. Undertones of dried Mediterranean herbs and a whisper of black pepper add complexity to this generous bouquet.","finish":"The finish is medium to long, with persistent dark fruit and chocolate flavors gradually transitioning to notes of espresso, dried fig, and sweet spice. The wine's harmonious balance ensures a satisfying conclusion that is both rich and refined.","palate":"Round, well-balanced, and harmonious on the palate, this Primitivo delivers concentrated flavors of ripe dark fruit—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—alongside notes of dark chocolate and espresso. The wine's medium to full body is supported by soft, velvety tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate notes of caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak blend seamlessly with the fruit core, while a touch of dried herbs and balsamic adds savory depth. The wine's natural warmth and generous alcohol lend a comforting, enveloping character."}

records.description: Gondola Pinot Noir  Mevushal (MD & DC) 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Raywood Moscato 2022
records.description: A refreshingly sweet Moscato from California's Central Coast, crafted through long, cool stainless-steel fermentation to preserve the grape's distinctive aromatic character. This wine balances sweetness with bright acidity, creating a light, approachable style perfect for casual enjoyment and versatile food pairing.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense floral aromas dominate the nose, featuring white blossoms, honeysuckle, and orange blossom. A beautiful bouquet of fresh fruit aromas follows, with forward notes of ripe peach, apricot, and tropical lychee. The aromatics are vibrant and inviting, showcasing the Moscato grape's natural perfume.","finish":"The finish is smooth and mouth-watering, with lingering peach and floral notes fading gracefully. The conclusion is clean and refreshing, leaving a pleasant sweetness that invites another sip without overwhelming the palate.","palate":"Amazingly fresh, fruity, and smooth on the palate, with concentrated flavors of white peach, nectarine, and juicy pear. The wine is sweet yet light and crisp, with enough natural acidity to prevent any cloying heaviness. The texture is refreshing rather than thick, demonstrating skilled winemaking that balances residual sugar with bright acidity. Subtle hints of honey and citrus add complexity to the fruit-forward core."}

records.name: Grand Marchand Reserve Bordeaux Left Bank 2020
records.description: A distinguished Left Bank Bordeaux from the excellent 2020 vintage, awarded Gold at the Concours de Bordeaux Vins d'Aquitaine. This wine represents classic Bordeaux blending and structure, showcasing the elegant fruit expression and refined tannins characteristic of Left Bank viticulture in an outstanding vintage.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant with Merlot and possibly Cabernet Franc)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals a sophisticated bouquet of black and red fruits, with prominent cassis, blackberry, and ripe plum. Aromatic complexity emerges with notes of exotic spices, sandalwood, and subtle cedar from oak aging. Hints of graphite and tobacco leaf add classic Left Bank character, while the fruit remains pure and focused, reflecting the exceptional quality of the 2020 vintage.","finish":"The finish extends gracefully with persistent fruit notes and well-integrated oak influence. Fine tannins provide structure through the long conclusion, while subtle spice and mineral elements add complexity. The wine demonstrates excellent balance and the aging potential characteristic of quality Left Bank Bordeaux from the stellar 2020 vintage.","palate":"The palate is friande (appealing and inviting), delivering concentrated dark fruit flavors balanced by elegant structure. Fine-grained tannins provide grip without astringency, while the wine's beautiful architecture demonstrates classic Left Bank composition. Flavors of blackcurrant and plum intermingle with notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and subtle baking spices. The wine shows medium to full body with integrated acidity maintaining freshness."}

records.name: Haut Espoir Cloudfall 2020
records.description: This South African white blend from Haut Espoir represents the estate's commitment to showcasing the unique terroir of their high-altitude vineyards. The Cloudfall designation evokes the misty conditions that moderate the vineyards, creating ideal conditions for elegant white wine production.
records.varietal: White blend (likely Sauvignon Blanc, Semillon, and/or Chardonnay)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is beautifully aromatic and complex, revealing notes of white peach, pear, and citrus blossom, complemented by subtle floral hints of jasmine and honeysuckle. A distinctive mineral quality speaks to the vineyard's elevation and cool growing conditions, while nuances of lemongrass, green tea, and wet stone add layers of complexity. Judicious oak use contributes subtle vanilla and hazelnut notes without overwhelming the pure fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with citrus and mineral notes lingering alongside subtle oak influence. The wine's freshness persists through the finish while maintaining texture and depth.","palate":"Elegant and medium-bodied on the palate, this blend shows excellent balance between richness and freshness. Flavors of stone fruits—particularly white peach and nectarine—mingle with citrus elements of lemon and grapefruit zest, while the cool-climate origins provide crisp, energizing acidity. The texture is silky with a subtle creamy quality from lees aging, and the mineral backbone provides structure and persistence. A touch of tropical fruit suggests warm days balanced by cool nights."}

records.name: Abadia de Acon Reserva 2018
records.description: A distinguished Spanish Reserva from Rioja, this wine exemplifies traditional winemaking with its minimum 36 months of oak and bottle aging. The 2018 vintage showcases the region's expertise with Tempranillo-based blends, offering complexity and structure refined through patient maturation.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with traditional Rioja blending grapes (Garnacha, Mazuelo, Graciano)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting layers of ripe plum and strawberry fruit, enhanced by warm vanilla and sweet spice from extended oak aging. Secondary notes of dried tobacco leaf, subtle leather, and Mediterranean herbs emerge with aeration, while hints of cedar and toasted oak provide an elegant backdrop. The aromatic intensity reflects the wine's careful barrel selection and traditional Rioja craftsmanship.","finish":"The finish is persistent and elegant, with lingering notes of dried fruit, vanilla, and subtle leather. Soft tannins and balanced acidity carry through, leaving a clean, harmonious impression that invites another sip. The wine's traditional aging regime is evident in the refined, cohesive conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with well-integrated tannins softened by aging, the palate reveals concentrated red berry flavors interwoven with vanilla bean and baking spices. The Tempranillo character shines through with notes of cherry and plum, complemented by earthy undertones and a touch of tobacco. The oak influence is balanced and refined, adding complexity without overwhelming the fruit. Bright acidity provides structure and ensures freshness despite the wine's maturity."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Hendry Cabernet Sauvignon Magnum 2019  1.5 l
records.description: Hendry Vineyard's 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon in magnum format represents benchmark Napa Valley winemaking from their estate vineyards. The larger bottle format promotes slower, more graceful aging and is perfect for special occasions and extended cellaring.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The magnum format has preserved remarkable freshness and vibrancy in this 2019 expression. The nose bursts with pure blackberry, cassis, and dark cherry fruit, accented by exotic spices like star anise and cardamom. Underlying notes of pencil shavings, crushed rock, and forest floor add earthy complexity. French oak contributes refined touches of vanilla pod, toasted hazelnut, and a hint of cigar box that integrates beautifully with the fruit.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long, easily exceeding a minute with persistent notes of black fruit, baking chocolate, and sandalwood. The tannins are fine and chalky, gripping gently without astringency. A beautiful minerality emerges on the fade, along with hints of black tea and dried Mediterranean herbs. This wine will continue to evolve magnificently.","palate":"Powerful yet refined, the palate showcases Napa Valley Cabernet at its finest. Concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, black cherry, and mulberry are enriched by layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet pipe tobacco. The wine's structure is formidable but not aggressive—firm, dusty tannins provide excellent backbone while remaining supple. The mid-palate depth is impressive, with waves of fruit, earth, and spice rolling across the tongue. Acidity is well-integrated, providing energy without sharpness."}

records.name: Hendry Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel Magnum 2019  1.5 l
records.description: This special magnum bottling showcases fruit from two distinct vineyard blocks on the Hendry estate in Napa Valley. Blocks 7 and 22 produce concentrated, expressive Zinfandel that captures the variety's bold character while maintaining balance and finesse. The larger format ensures slower aging and enhanced development.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant and richly perfumed, the nose explodes with ripe blackberry, raspberry jam, and black cherry liqueur. Baking spice notes of cinnamon, clove, and allspice are prominent, joined by vanilla and caramel from oak aging. Underlying notes of black pepper, dried herbs, and a hint of eucalyptus add complexity. As the wine opens, darker elements emerge—dried fig, raisin, and mocha—creating a multi-layered aromatic experience. A subtle floral note of rose petals adds elegance to the powerful fruit.","finish":"Long and warming, with persistent berry fruit and spice flavors. The alcohol is well-integrated but provides a gentle heat that complements the wine's richness. Soft tannins and lingering notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried fruit create a satisfying, complete conclusion.","palate":"Full-bodied and rich with concentrated flavors of wild blackberry, strawberry preserves, and dark cherry. The texture is plush and generous, with soft, ripe tannins that provide structure without astringency. Mid-palate weight is impressive, showing the concentration typical of old-vine Zinfandel. Flavors of black pepper, anise, and dark chocolate intermingle with the ripe fruit, while toasted oak contributes caramel and mocha notes. Despite its power, the wine maintains balance through fresh acidity and doesn't tip into jammy territory. The large magnum format has allowed for slower, more graceful integration of all elements."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Calyptra Mosaiko Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: A crisp, aromatic Sauvignon Blanc showcasing the variety's signature green and tropical fruit character. The 2022 vintage captures the fresh, elegant style that defines quality cool-climate Sauvignon Blanc, with vibrant acidity and expressive aromatics perfect for immediate enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with classic Sauvignon Blanc markers of fresh-cut grass, green bell pepper, and nettle, balanced by tropical notes of passion fruit and guava. Delicate elderflower and citrus blossom add floral complexity, while a subtle hint of gooseberry and lime zest brightens the bouquet. The aromatic intensity suggests cool-climate fruit with optimal ripeness and varietal expression.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering citrus zest and subtle tropical fruit notes. The bright acidity leaves the palate invigorated, with a characteristic mineral edge and hints of fresh herbs. The finish is crisp and precise, inviting immediate pairing with food.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing with mouthwatering acidity that defines the variety, the palate delivers layers of grapefruit, green apple, and white peach. Vibrant tropical fruit notes of passion fruit and kiwi mingle with herbaceous undertones of fresh basil and cut grass. The wine's mineral backbone and zesty character create a lively, energetic mouthfeel. Light-bodied yet concentrated, with excellent purity of fruit and no oak influence to preserve varietal character."}

records.name: Frico Rose (NOVA only) 2024
records.description: A fresh, vibrant rosé from the 2024 vintage, exclusively available through NOVA. This contemporary rosé offers the crisp, refreshing character that defines modern pink wine, perfect for warm weather enjoyment and casual gatherings. The wine's youth ensures maximum freshness and bright fruit expression.
records.varietal: Red grape varieties vinified as rosé (specific blend not disclosed)
records.region: Premium rosé producing region (specific origin not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and inviting with aromas of fresh strawberry, watermelon, and pink grapefruit. The nose reveals delicate floral notes of rose petals and orange blossom, complemented by hints of white peach and red currant. Subtle mineral notes and a touch of citrus zest add complexity to the vibrant fruit-forward bouquet. The aromatics are clean and refreshing, capturing the essence of spring and summer in a glass.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering red berry fruit and citrus notes. The crisp acidity keeps the palate lively and refreshed, while subtle mineral character adds sophistication. The finish is bright and inviting, perfect for warm weather sipping and encouraging another glass.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing with mouthwatering acidity that drives flavors of wild strawberry, raspberry, and watermelon across the palate. Notes of pink grapefruit and nectarine add complexity, while a subtle mineral edge provides structure and interest. Light to medium-bodied with excellent balance between fruit sweetness and bright acidity. The wine shows purity and precision, with clean fruit flavors unmarred by oak. Dry to off-dry style with a smooth, easy-drinking character that makes it incredibly versatile for food pairing."}

records.name: Hendry Pinot Noir Damaged Labels 2019
records.description: Hendry Ranch Wines, one of Napa Valley's best-kept secrets, has been crafting exceptional Pinot Noir from their estate vineyard since 1972. The 2019 vintage with damaged labels offers exceptional value for this critically acclaimed wine, which Wine Enthusiast rated 91 points. The Hendry vineyard's unique location in the transitional zone between cool Carneros and warmer Napa Valley creates ideal conditions for balanced Pinot Noir.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir (Dijon clones and Swan selection)
records.region: Napa Valley, California (transitional zone near Carneros)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of bright red cherry and wild strawberry, layered with subtle notes of potpourri and dried rose petals. There's a delicate earthiness reminiscent of forest floor and mushroom, characteristic of quality Pinot Noir, alongside hints of black tea and sandalwood. Subtle oak influence shows as vanilla bean and toasted hazelnut, while a touch of savory herb adds complexity. The aromatics are lifted and pure, showing the wine's elegance.","finish":"The finish is moderately long and elegant, with lingering notes of red fruit and a touch of spice. Silky tannins provide gentle structure while remaining soft and approachable. A mineral quality persists, along with hints of smoke and tea that add complexity to the fade. The wine's vibrant acidity and rich cherry character linger pleasantly, inviting another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a silky, plush texture that coats the palate beautifully. The wine delivers vibrant flavors of ripe cherry, cranberry, and red raspberry, balanced by bright acidity that maintains freshness. There's an underlying mineral quality that adds depth, along with subtle notes of persimmon and pomegranate that emerge on the mid-palate. The wine positions itself perfectly between the bright acidity of Burgundy and the full-fruit approach of California Pinot Noir, showing excellent balance and finesse."}

records.name: William Downie Cathedral Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: A refined Pinot Noir from one of Yarra Valley's most respected producers, showcasing the region's reputation for elegant, cool-climate expressions of this noble variety. William Downie's meticulous approach to viticulture and winemaking shines through in the Cathedral bottling, named for the wine's contemplative, complex character worthy of quiet appreciation.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating aromatics of bright red cherry, cranberry, and wild strawberry intermingle with subtle notes of forest floor, dried rose petals, and exotic spice. The Yarra Valley's cool climate is evident in the wine's elegant red fruit expression and earthy complexity. Hints of sandalwood, five-spice, and black tea add intrigue, while whispers of violet and lavender contribute floral elegance. Subtle oak influence brings notes of cedar and vanilla without overwhelming the delicate fruit. The nose is layered and contemplative, revealing new dimensions with each swirl.","finish":"Long, elegant, and complex with persistent red fruit, subtle spice, and earthy minerality. The finish is refined and balanced, with delicate tannins and refreshing acidity carrying through. Notes of dried cherry, tea leaf, and exotic spice linger, demonstrating the wine's depth and complexity. The conclusion is harmonious and contemplative, inviting reflection and appreciation.","palate":"Silky, refined texture with the variety's hallmark elegance, showcasing vibrant flavors of red raspberry, sour cherry, and pomegranate. The wine's purity and precision reflect meticulous viticulture and gentle winemaking. Fine-grained tannins provide structure without weight, while bright acidity lifts the fruit and ensures balance. Mid-weight body with excellent concentration and complexity—notes of mushroom, undergrowth, and Asian spice add savory depth to the fruit core. The Yarra Valley terroir contributes distinctive minerality and earthy character that sets this wine apart. Seamless integration of fruit, oak, and structure showcases masterful winemaking."}

records.name: Heron Hill Cabernet Franc Classic 2020
records.description: A distinctive Finger Lakes Cabernet Franc from Heron Hill Winery, representing one of the region's flagship varieties. The Classic line showcases traditional cool-climate character through blends of carefully selected grapes from growers around the Finger Lakes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"A twinkle of red berries and plums leads the aromatic profile, enhanced by dried flowers and warming spice. The nose is gentle yet expressive, showing the classic character of Finger Lakes Cabernet Franc with herbal mint tones and slight cedar notes. Medium intensity with excellent purity of fruit.","finish":"The conclusion offers good length with persistent red fruit and spice. Tannins are present but measured, creating a balanced finale that demonstrates the wine's food-friendly nature.","palate":"Mid-weight texture carries fresh red berry and plum flavors across the palate. The wine is gentle and fresh, with refreshing acidity providing energy and lift. Fine tannins add structure without overwhelming the delicate fruit and spice components. Refined and silky tannin quality shows careful winemaking, with the wine maintaining elegance throughout. Berry, cherry, and subtle nutmeg notes create a harmonious flavor profile."}

records.name: Heron Hill Riesling Classic Dry 2023
records.description: Heron Hill Riesling Classic Dry 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Heron Hill Riesling Reserve 2021
records.description: An elegant expression of Finger Lakes Riesling that balances New York State's signature minerality with ripe fruit character. This Reserve bottling from Heron Hill represents careful vineyard selection and extended aging to showcase the region's potential for world-class aromatic white wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile is immediately captivating, displaying pristine notes of white peach, green apple, and Meyer lemon zest. Delicate floral accents of honeysuckle and orange blossom float above the fruit core, while distinctive minerality reminiscent of wet slate and crushed limestone adds depth. A subtle hint of petrol, characteristic of quality Riesling, begins to emerge with air, along with whispers of fresh ginger and white tea.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and clean, with lingering citrus peel and stone fruit notes that seem to go on endlessly. Bright acidity leaves the mouth refreshed and ready for the next sip, while a subtle touch of residual sweetness and mineral salinity lingers on the back palate.","palate":"The wine presents a masterful balance between sweetness and acidity, leaning toward off-dry on the palate. Flavors of ripe apricot and nectarine meld seamlessly with tart lime and crisp green apple, creating a dynamic interplay. The mid-palate reveals honeyed richness without being cloying, supported by racy acidity that provides electric energy. Mineral notes of flint and saline persist throughout, adding complexity and a sense of place that speaks to the unique terroir of the Finger Lakes."}

records.name: Jean Leon Vinya La Scala Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva Magnum 1999  1500 ml
records.description: A magnificent aged Cabernet Sauvignon from the legendary Jean Leon estate in Penedès, Spain. This 1999 Reserva in magnum format represents over two decades of careful cellaring, showcasing the wine's evolution from powerful youth to elegant maturity. The larger bottle size has allowed for slower, more graceful aging, preserving freshness while developing complex tertiary characteristics.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is gorgeously evolved, displaying classic mature Cabernet aromas of tobacco leaf, cedar box, and dried roses. Beneath these tertiary notes lies a core of preserved dark fruit—blackcurrant pastille and dried plum—alongside leather, truffle, and forest floor. Hints of graphite, cigar box, and subtle balsamic notes add layers of complexity. The nose shows remarkable depth for a wine of this age, with the magnum format preserving aromatic vibrancy that might have faded in standard bottles.","finish":"Long and contemplative finish with layers of dried fruit, tobacco, and earthy notes. The tannins are completely integrated, providing texture without astringency. Subtle hints of espresso and dark cocoa linger alongside savory umami notes, demonstrating the wine's remarkable evolution and staying power.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with silky, fully resolved tannins that caress rather than grip the palate. Flavors of dried blackcurrant, fig, and dark cherry mingle with savory elements of soy, dried mushroom, and worn leather. The wine shows beautiful tertiary complexity with notes of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, and sweet spices. Despite its age, the wine maintains surprising freshness and structure, likely due to the magnum format and careful cellaring. The integration is seamless, with fruit, oak, and age-derived characteristics in perfect harmony."}

records.name: Hendry Primitivo 2022
records.description: A bold and expressive Primitivo from Hendry Vineyard in Napa Valley, showcasing the variety's inherent power and fruit intensity in California's premium terroir. The 2022 vintage delivers concentrated dark fruit character with the ripeness and structure that have made Hendry's red wines cult favorites among those seeking intensity without losing balance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosive aromas of jammy blackberry and black raspberry leap from the glass with incredible intensity. Layers of black cherry, plum compote, and dark fig add depth, while notes of licorice, black pepper, and dried Mediterranean herbs provide complexity. Underlying hints of vanilla, mocha, and toasted oak suggest quality barrel aging that complements rather than masks the exuberant fruit core.","finish":"Long and warming finish with persistent dark fruit and spice notes. The tannins are ripe and velvety, while subtle acidity provides lift and prevents cloying sweetness. Hints of espresso, dark chocolate, and black pepper linger impressively, showcasing the wine's depth and concentration.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly concentrated with flavors of ripe blackberry, boysenberry, and black plum dominating the palate. The wine shows impressive density and extract, with a luscious, almost glycerin-like texture that coats the mouth. Spicy notes of cracked pepper, cinnamon, and clove emerge mid-palate, along with savory hints of cured meat and dark chocolate. Despite the wine's power and ripeness, it maintains balance through structured tannins and surprising freshness that prevents it from feeling heavy or jammy."}

records.name: Hertelendy Cabernet Franc 2020
records.description: A Wine Club Exclusive Cabernet Franc from Hertelendy Vineyards, representing an Old World Hungarian family tradition reborn in Napa Valley. This wine earned a 97 from Robert Parker and was ranked among the Top 40 Napa Valley Cabernet Francs of all time, showcasing exceptional ripeness and character from the 2020 vintage.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose shows deep aromatic focus on the sweetness and ripeness of fruit, with boysenberry jam leading the way alongside blackberry preserves and black fig. Dark berry compote mingles with notes of crushed violets and dried herbs - particularly sage and thyme. Subtle oak-derived notes of vanilla, cedar, and sweet tobacco add complexity, while a mineral undertone from the Silverado Bench fruit provides elegance and lift.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors, fine-grained tannins, and subtle notes of cocoa and spice. The wine shows exceptional length and complexity, testament to its top-tier quality.","palate":"On the palate, this was Ralph Hertelendy's favorite wine from the 2020 vintage, and it's easy to see why. The wine delivers rich, concentrated flavors of ripe blackberry, boysenberry, and black cherry, supported by excellent structure and velvety tannins. The Silverado Bench fruit contributes a distinctive mineral backbone that provides definition to the lush fruit. Mid-palate shows layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried herbs, with integrated oak adding nuance without dominating. The wine has impressive depth and concentration while maintaining balance and elegance."}

records.name: Hendry Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel 2021
records.description: A distinctive Napa Valley Zinfandel from Hendry Ranch's specific vineyard blocks, showcasing the terroir-driven approach of this historic 114-acre estate. With over 85 years of farming heritage and recognition among Wine & Spirits' Top 100 Wineries, Hendry crafts straightforward, delicious wines that offer exceptional value. The block designation highlights unique characteristics from these specific vineyard sites.
records.region: Napa Valley, California (Hendry Ranch - Mount Veeder foothills)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bold and expressive with concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and dark plum. The warm Napa climate is evident in the wine's generous fruit character, complemented by notes of black pepper, anise, and dried herbs. Hints of vanilla, mocha, and sweet oak spice add complexity from barrel aging, while subtle bramble and wild berry notes contribute rustic charm. A touch of dried fig and raisin suggests the variety's tendency toward high ripeness. The aromatic intensity is hallmark Napa Zinfandel—powerful yet inviting.","finish":"Long and warming with persistent dark fruit, pepper spice, and subtle oak. The finish demonstrates Zinfandel's characteristic power, with ripe tannins and generous fruit carrying through. Notes of blackberry, mocha, and sweet spice linger, while the wine's natural warmth provides a satisfying conclusion that pairs beautifully with hearty fare.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with concentrated flavors of blackberry jam, dark cherry, and plum compote. The warm vintage delivers ripe, generous fruit with notes of black pepper, clove, and licorice adding spicy complexity. Zinfandel's characteristic high alcohol (likely 15%+) is well-integrated, providing warmth without harshness. Firm but ripe tannins give structure, while the wine's natural acidity balances the fruit richness. Notes of cocoa, vanilla, and toasted oak from barrel aging enhance without overwhelming. The wine showcases intensity and power balanced with drinkability—reflecting Hendry's philosophy of straightforward, delicious winemaking focused on value."}

records.name: Hertelendy Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
records.description: An elegant Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon displaying the hallmark concentration and structure of the exceptional 2016 vintage. This wine embodies the power and refinement that makes Napa Cabernet world-renowned. A serious wine with excellent aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents deep, inky aromas of cassis, blackcurrant, and black cherry with remarkable intensity. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and cigar box emerge, complemented by cedar, graphite, and hints of eucalyptus. Subtle violet and lavender notes add elegance, while integrated French oak contributes vanilla and sweet baking spices.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and structured, with persistent dark fruit and savory elements. Fine-grained tannins provide impressive grip and ageability, while notes of dark chocolate and cedar linger beautifully. The conclusion is powerful yet balanced, showcasing classic Napa Cabernet character with potential for extended cellaring.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful with exceptional concentration of blackberry, black plum, and dark fruit compote. The palate reveals complexities of mocha, toasted oak, and dark cocoa, supported by firm yet refined tannins. Mid-palate depth shows layers of black olive tapenade, crushed herbs, and mineral notes, while balanced acidity maintains structure and freshness throughout the experience."}

records.name: Huteau Boulanger Gamay 2023
records.description: A vibrant Loire Valley Gamay from the Tours region, showcasing the fresh-peppery character that distinguishes Loire Gamay from its Beaujolais cousins. This 2023 vintage from Huteau Boulanger captures the bright raspberry notes and signature aromatics characteristic of Gamay grown in the Loire's terroir, often blended with Cabernet Franc influences in this region.
records.varietal: 100% Gamay (possibly blended with Cabernet Franc as is traditional in Tours region)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents bright, exuberant aromas of fresh raspberry, crushed strawberry, and red cherry characteristic of Gamay processed with carbonic maceration techniques. Distinctive fresh-cut pepper notes emerge—a signature aromatic marking Loire Valley Gamay—alongside delicate violet florals. The bouquet shows vibrant youthful fruit with hints of cranberry and pomegranate, while subtle herbaceous notes suggest terroir influence or possible Cabernet Franc co-fermentation. The aromatic profile emphasizes purity and freshness typical of young Gamay.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent red berry fruit and bright acidity. The signature peppery spice lingers alongside raspberry essence and subtle herbal notes. Minimal tannins and vibrant freshness make this wine immediately accessible and food-friendly, showcasing Gamay's charm as an easy-drinking red wine best consumed young.","palate":"The palate delivers light to medium body with lively acidity and minimal tannin structure characteristic of Gamay's approachable style. Flavors of bright raspberry, sour cherry, and red currant dominate, accompanied by the signature fresh-peppery notes distinctive to Loire expressions. The wine shows more complexity than simple Beaujolais nouveau styles, with subtle earthy undertones and minerality reflecting Loire terroir. Carbonic maceration creates the vibrant, crushed-berry fruit character while maintained acidity provides freshness and drinkability. At 2 years of age, the 2023 is at ideal drinking maturity."}

records.name: Hightower Red Blend
records.description: Hightower Red Blend is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Hertelendy Legend 2019
records.description: A premium Hungarian red wine from the historic Hertelendy estate in the Etyek-Buda wine region. This elegant blend represents the renaissance of Hungarian fine wine, combining international varietals with traditional winemaking techniques to create a wine of sophistication and depth.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend: likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Complex aromas of blackberry compote and dark cherry mingle with notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and vanilla bean. The bouquet reveals layers of complexity with hints of black pepper, dried sage, and subtle espresso. Oak influence is evident but well-integrated, contributing sweet spice notes of cinnamon and clove alongside dark chocolate undertones.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with dark fruit, toasted oak, and earthy mineral notes persisting. Hints of cocoa powder and espresso linger alongside fine-grained tannins, demonstrating the wine's aging potential and careful craftsmanship.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured, the palate offers concentrated flavors of black plum, cassis, and dark berry preserves. The wine shows excellent depth with secondary notes of leather, forest floor, and graphite. Firm yet polished tannins provide a sturdy framework, while balanced acidity maintains freshness despite the wine's power. The mouthfeel is velvety and rich, with layers of dark fruit, spice, and savory elements unfolding progressively."}

records.name: Inversa Peach Basil   250 ml
records.description: Inversa Peach Basil   250 ml is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: High Camp Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
records.description: An estate Cabernet Sauvignon from High Camp Wines showcasing the 2021 vintage, widely regarded as one of the greatest vintages in decades for California Cabernet. This wine blends Cabernet Sauvignon with small amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, and Sangiovese, aged 18 months in French oak. The result is a concentrated, well-structured wine with approachable tannins and classic California Cab character.
records.varietal: 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Petit Verdot, 5% Cabernet Franc, 10% Sangiovese (approximate blend)
records.region: California (likely Paso Robles or North Coast)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Rich dark red color with inviting aromatics. The nose opens with layers of red and blue fruit including raspberry, blueberry, and boysenberry. Hints of leather and black pepper add complexity, while notes of vanilla and cinnamon from oak aging integrate seamlessly. The aromatic profile is both powerful and nuanced.","finish":"Long and satisfying with a round, smooth conclusion. The tannins are well-integrated, fading gently while fruit and vanilla notes persist.","palate":"Full-bodied and concentrated with generous fruit flavors. The palate delivers waves of blue fruit including blueberry and blackberry, supported by notes of black cherry and cassis. Vanilla and cinnamon spice from oak aging add depth without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows lots of supple, velvety tannins that coat the palate, providing structure while maintaining approachability. The mouthfeel is round and smooth."}

records.name: Jardin Enchante Sauvignon Blanc Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: A kosher Mevushal Sauvignon Blanc crafted for observant Jewish consumers. Mevushal wines undergo a flash-pasteurization process that allows them to remain kosher even when handled by non-observant individuals. Despite this process, modern winemaking techniques preserve the varietal character and freshness of Sauvignon Blanc.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents bright, approachable aromas of lemon citrus, green apple, and honeydew melon. Notes of freshly cut grass, lime zest, and white grapefruit add classic Sauvignon Blanc character. Subtle hints of elderflower and green herbs provide aromatic lift. While the Mevushal process can soften aromatics slightly, the wine maintains good varietal expression with clean, fresh fruit character.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering citrus and green apple flavors. Bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed, while a subtle herbal note adds complexity. The finish is straightforward and pleasant, making this an excellent choice for casual occasions and diverse food pairings.","palate":"Medium-bodied with refreshing acidity and crisp texture. Flavors of tart green apple, citrus, and tropical fruit dominate the palate, with undertones of gooseberry and fresh herbs. The mouthfeel is clean and straightforward, with good balance between fruit and acidity. A subtle mineral quality adds interest without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows honest varietal character despite the pasteurization process, delivering a food-friendly, versatile white wine."}

records.name: Jean Leon 3055 Rose 2024
records.description: Jean Leon 3055 Rose 2024 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Jean Leon Gigi Chardonnay 2023
records.description: Jean Leon Gigi Chardonnay 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Grateful Palate Strong Arms White Bordeaux 2020
records.description: A rare white Bordeaux from Canon-Fronsac that punches well above its weight class. This exceptional value wine demonstrates classic Sauvignon Blanc character while maintaining authentic Bordeaux Blanc breeding and elegance. The brilliant, almost neon-bright appearance hints at the excitement within the glass.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose leaps from the glass with electric intensity, offering a lifted perfume of honeysuckle, ripe melon, and Meyer lemon. Tropical notes of passionfruit emerge alongside subtle hints of cream and vanilla from careful elevage. The aromatics demonstrate remarkable complexity for the price point, with honeysuckle florals weaving through citrus and stone fruit layers.","finish":"The finish crackles with electricity and nervous energy, leaving lasting impressions of citrus zest and white flowers. Descriptors like 'drama,' 'nerve,' and 'alive' perfectly capture the wine's vivacious character that persists well after the glass is empty.","palate":"The palate showcases impressive tension between plush, ripe fruit and racy acidity that creates dynamic energy. There's genuine grip and structure here, with flavors of citrus, melon, and tropical fruit balanced by bright mineral freshness. The wine delivers overwhelming pleasure through its combination of richness and verve, displaying remarkable length for a wine at this price."}

records.name: Domaine de la Denante Saint Veran 2022
records.description: A gold medal-winning white Burgundy from the southern Mâconnais region, this Saint-Véran delivers exceptional value. Crafted from 100% Chardonnay and matured in old barrels for 6-8 months, it showcases the estate's commitment to quality with consistently high scores from Wine Enthusiast.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals lovely rich fruit lines enhanced by intense citrus notes and softer shades of firm peach. Subtle aromatics of acacia and honeysuckle drift over fresh almond, hazelnut, and a whisper of cinnamon. A delicate buttery character emerges, occasionally touched with hints of honey and bracken, creating a complex and inviting bouquet that draws you in with its Burgundian elegance.","finish":"A lovely broad finish stretches across the palate with lingering peach and mineral notes. The conclusion is clean and refreshing, leaving a lasting impression of crystalline purity and refined elegance typical of quality Mâconnais whites.","palate":"Juicy with remarkable creamy depth, the palate builds from bright citrus into riper peach flavors that expand mid-palate. The wine is dry and well-rounded, displaying characteristic minerality reminiscent of gun-flint alongside vibrant acidity. Harmonious and fresh, it balances fruit richness with a lean, focused structure that speaks to its terroir-driven purity."}

records.name: Jeff Cohn Pure Yum Blend 2018
records.description: Jeff Cohn Cellars' Pure Yum represents Sonoma's approach to Rhône-style blends with a California accent. The 2018 vintage combines 67% Syrah and 33% Grenache from Rockpile and El Diablo vineyards, employing 30% whole cluster fermentation and neutral French oak aging. With only 218 cases produced and a stellar 94+ rating from The Wine Advocate, this wine balances power with elegance.
records.region: Rockpile and El Diablo Vineyards, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Medium ruby in color, the nose is seductive and complex. Black and red cherries dominate, interwoven with aromatic notes of tobacco leaves, rose petal, and red flowers. Graphite and mineral nuances add sophistication, while hints of hot cinnamon stick, Herbes de Provence, and dark chocolate nibs contribute layers of complexity. The 30% whole cluster addition provides subtle stem tannin and floral lift.","finish":"Long and complex, with persistent notes of red fruit, minerality, and subtle spice. The finish showcases excellent balance between power and elegance, with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Savory elements linger alongside fruit, creating a sophisticated conclusion.","palate":"The palate is thick yet refined, with a voluptuous mouthfeel that oozes red and blue fruit flavors—blackberry, blueberry, cherry, and plum. The wine shows remarkable duality: grippy, caramelized richness like bacon meets bustling freshness and silky texture. Medium-bodied but concentrated, the wine is mineral-driven with savory graphite-laced character balancing the lush fruit. Whole cluster fermentation and neutral oak aging allow pure fruit and terroir expression."}

records.name: Jeff Cohn Cellars St Peters Church Zinfandel 2019
records.description: A powerful old-vine Zinfandel from the historic St. Peter's Church Vineyard in Alexander Valley. With only 129 cases produced, this limited-production wine showcases winemaker Jeff Cohn's mastery of Zinfandel. The 2019 vintage received 90 points from Jeb Dunnuck, highlighting its balance of power and elegance. This wine represents benchmark California Zinfandel from one of Sonoma's finest sites.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Ripe and expressive with macerated strawberries and cream leading the aromatic profile. The nose shows generous fruit alongside licorice spice and dried flowers. Hints of vanilla and toasted oak complement the fruit, while subtle leather and black pepper add complexity. The aromatic intensity is characteristic of old-vine fruit concentration.","finish":"Long and weighty with persistent fruit and spice notes. The tannins are substantial but ripe, providing structure for extended aging. Hints of vanilla and cinnamon linger on the tail.","palate":"This gigantic wine delivers layers of sweet berry fruit on the palate. Flavors of red plum, fresh strawberry, and dark raspberry dominate, supported by notes of dusty earth and exotic spice. Oak char adds depth without overwhelming the fruit. The wine is medium to full-bodied with a chewy, tannic structure that's balanced by supple, velvety tannins. The fruit component is powerfully big yet well-integrated, showing excellent concentration."}

records.name: Jeremy Nickel Cellars Chardonnay 2018
records.description: A boutique California Chardonnay from Jeremy Nickel Cellars, representing small-production winemaking at its finest. The 2018 vintage has had time to develop tertiary characteristics while maintaining the varietal's hallmark richness and texture. This wine showcases the evolution that quality Chardonnay achieves with proper aging.
records.region: California - likely Napa Valley or Sonoma County
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The developed bouquet reveals evolved aromas of baked apple, poached pear, and golden apricot, layered with rich notes of toasted hazelnut, butterscotch, and crème brûlée. Subtle oxidative characters of dried honey and beeswax add complexity, while hints of brioche and vanilla speak to quality oak integration. A delicate mineral quality and whisper of white flowers maintain elegance despite the wine's richness.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with stone fruit and nutty flavors persisting alongside a pleasant toasted oak character. The wine's creamy texture lingers, while refreshing acidity provides a clean conclusion. Hints of honey and baking spice fade slowly, demonstrating the wine's maturity and complexity.","palate":"Full-bodied with luxurious, creamy texture enhanced by partial malolactic fermentation and lees aging. The palate delivers ripe stone fruit flavors—peach, nectarine, and apricot—integrated with butterscotch, toasted almond, and vanilla custard. The wine shows beautiful development with notes of lanolin, baked bread, and subtle spice. While rich and textured, balanced acidity prevents heaviness and provides structure. Mid-palate weight demonstrates quality fruit sources, while integrated oak adds layers without dominating."}

records.name: Jeff Cohn Smoke & Mirrors Red Blend 2018
records.description: A critically acclaimed red blend from renowned California winemaker Jeff Cohn, earning 92 points from Wine Enthusiast, Jeb Dunnuck, and Wine Spectator. The 2018 vintage from Sonoma County combines 60% Zinfandel with 28% Syrah and 6% each of Grenache and Petite Sirah, creating a bold yet balanced expression of California's finest red varieties. This wine showcases Cohn's masterful blending skills and understanding of Rhône-style winemaking adapted to California terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is earthy and aromatic, leading with garrigue, dried lavender, and black licorice that give the wine a distinctly Mediterranean character. Dark berry aromatics follow—ripe plums, blackberries, and black cherry—creating a lush fruit core. Peppery herbs and cedary spice add complexity, while notes of tar, dried flowers, and graphite provide depth and intrigue. As the wine opens, fruitcake spices emerge along with hints of violet and dark chocolate, creating a multi-layered aromatic experience that rewards contemplation. The bouquet is both powerful and refined, balancing New World fruit ripeness with Old World savory elements.","finish":"Long and satisfying, with dark fruit flavors persisting alongside spice and herb notes. The tannins remain soft and rounded through the finish, making this wine approachable now while suggesting it can develop further. A touch of black pepper and dried flowers returns on the tail, with the wine's earthy character providing a savory conclusion that pairs beautifully with food.","palate":"Bold and plump with a thick, meaty texture that coats the palate generously. The wine is medium to full-bodied with soft, supple tannins that provide structure without astringency. Fresh, multilayered flavors of raspberry and dark berry fruits are joined by fruitcake spices—clove, cinnamon, nutmeg—that add warmth and complexity. The earthy garrigue character translates beautifully, with herbes de Provence weaving through the fruit. Black licorice and dark chocolate notes add richness, while the blend's natural acidity keeps everything balanced and fresh despite the wine's substantial body. The wine is charming and pure, with excellent integration of all components."}

records.name: Moorilla Brut Rose 2018
records.description: An elegant sparkling rosé from Tasmania's prestigious Moorilla Estate, showcasing the island's cool-climate potential for world-class sparkling wines. This traditional method wine demonstrates refined complexity developed through extended aging on lees, rivaling the finest examples from Champagne and beyond.
records.varietal: Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend (traditional method)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is sophisticated and layered, revealing aromas of wild strawberry, raspberry coulis, and pink grapefruit zest. Delicate floral notes of rose petals and cherry blossoms emerge alongside more complex tertiary characteristics of brioche, toasted hazelnut, and subtle yeast autolysis from extended lees aging. A whisper of chalky minerality and ocean spray speaks to Tasmania's maritime influence, while hints of candied orange peel and red apple skin add further dimension.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and complex, with lingering red fruit flavors intermingling with brioche and hazelnut notes. A saline mineral quality persists, along with a refreshing citrus peel character that leaves the palate cleansed and invigorated.","palate":"The wine enters with refined elegance, displaying persistent fine bubbles that create a creamy, mousse-like texture. Red berry flavors—particularly strawberry and cranberry—are balanced by citrus notes of blood orange and pink grapefruit that provide brightness and energy. The mid-palate reveals impressive depth, with layers of brioche, almond croissant, and a subtle oxidative note that adds savory complexity without overwhelming the fresh fruit. Vibrant acidity cuts through the richness, while the wine's backbone of stony minerality provides structure and length. The integration of fruit, yeast character, and acidity is seamless, showing the hallmarks of quality traditional method production."}

records.name: Korde Pinea El Castillo Red 2023
records.description: KORDE El Castillo emerges from a centennial vineyard planted in 1916, positioned before the medieval castle of Peñaranda de Duero in Burgos. This field blend from one of Ribera del Duero's most awe-inspiring sites has been preserved across five generations, producing wines that are 'light, fresh and full of fruit' while showcasing impeccable craftsmanship and terroir purity.
records.varietal: Field blend: 75% Tinta Fina (Tempranillo) with Bobal, Garnacha, Albillo, and Pirulés from vines planted in 1916
records.region: Peñaranda de Duero, Ribera del Duero DO, Burgos, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with captivating floral notes—violets and wild roses—layered with fresh herbal nuances that speak to the wine's field blend composition. Luminous red fruit aromas of strawberry and raspberry blend seamlessly with darker black fruit freshness. Tertiary hints emerge of blonde tobacco, wet earth, and licorice, adding complexity to the youthful fruit expression. The intense, deep color contrasts beautifully with the wine's delicate, refined aromatic tone.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long, showing intensity and persistence alongside continued juiciness. Fine tannins provide length without astringency, while the chalky minerality and pure fruit linger. This wine demonstrates both immediacy of pleasure and potential for development, showcasing the impeccable craftsmanship that Pinea brings to this historic site.","palate":"Astonishingly drinkable even at this young stage, the palate reveals savory, fluid structure with fine-grain tannins offering texture without heaviness. The wine shows exuberant freshness and lovely fluidity with ripe tannins that coat the palate gently. Flavors of ripe red and black fruits are accented by graphite minerality, dried prunes, and subtle oak influence from 18 months in French barrels. A marked chalky character runs through the wine, evidence of the limestone-rich soils, while the agility and depth create a beautiful tension."}

records.name: Korde Pinea Tinto 2023
records.description: A youthful red wine that captures the fresh, vibrant character of its recent vintage. This contemporary-style tinto emphasizes bright fruit and accessibility, representing a modern approach to red wine that prioritizes immediate drinkability and pure fruit expression over extended aging potential.
records.varietal: Likely Tempranillo, Tinta de Toro, or local Portuguese varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose shows youthful vibrancy with aromas of fresh red cherry, wild strawberry, and ripe plum, complemented by subtle floral notes of violet. Hints of sweet spice including cinnamon and a touch of vanilla suggest light oak contact, while earthy undertones of dried herbs and mineral add complexity. The overall aromatic profile is fresh and inviting with bright fruit at the forefront.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent with bright red fruit flavors and refreshing acidity. Soft tannins provide gentle grip while the wine's youthful energy carries through, leaving a pleasant impression of fruit-forward charm.","palate":"Medium-bodied with juicy acidity and approachable tannins, the palate delivers flavors of red cherry, raspberry, and cranberry with subtle darker fruit notes of blackberry. The wine's fresh character is supported by lively acidity that provides energy and lift, while modest tannins offer structure without astringency. Hints of mocha and baking spice from oak integration blend seamlessly with the fruit, maintaining the wine's focus on accessibility."}
