records.name: Optima Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
records.description: A distinguished Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from the warm 2015 vintage, sourced from Sonoma County's warmest appellation. This wine showcases the concentrated, powerful character that Knights Valley Cabernet achieves in this protected valley with its extended growing season, warm afternoons, and cooling evening influences that allow for optimal phenolic ripeness.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon (likely with traditional Bordeaux blend components: Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot)
records.region: Knights Valley AVA, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of blackcurrant, dark cherry, and blackberry compote characteristic of ripe Knights Valley Cabernet. Notes of cedar, tobacco, and cigar box emerge alongside vanilla oak and baking spices from careful barrel aging. The bouquet reveals complexity with hints of graphite, dried herbs, and eucalyptus, while concentrated dark fruit suggests the warm 2015 growing season (Region III classification with 3,001-3,500 degree-days). Secondary notes of leather and dark chocolate add depth to this powerfully aromatic wine.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent with firm but integrated tannins coating the palate. Dark fruit flavors linger alongside cedar, tobacco, and subtle baking spices. Oak influence remains present but integrated, contributing vanilla and chocolate notes without dominating. At 10 years of age, the 2015 vintage is entering its prime drinking window with excellent aging potential remaining for well-stored bottles.","palate":"The palate delivers full-bodied richness with structured tannins and concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, black cherry, and cassis. The warm Knights Valley climate produces ripe, generous fruit without excessive heaviness, balanced by maintained acidity. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak complement the wine's core fruit, while mid-palate complexity includes cedar, tobacco, and hints of green olive. The wine shows excellent integration after 10 years of aging, with softened tannins and developed tertiary complexity. Knights Valley's signature power is evident while maintaining elegance and balance."}

records.name: Lambert Estate Chocolatier NV
records.description: Lambert Estate Chocolatier is a unique dessert-style wine crafted to complement chocolate and sweet treats. This non-vintage expression showcases rich, indulgent flavors that mirror the decadence of fine chocolate while maintaining balance and drinkability.
records.varietal: Proprietary blend (likely includes late-harvest or fortified components)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatics are unmistakably dessert-focused, leading with intense notes of dark chocolate, cocoa powder, and chocolate-covered cherries. Underlying the chocolate core are ripe berry fruits—blackberry and black raspberry—along with hints of vanilla cream, mocha, and toasted hazelnut. A subtle sweetness is evident on the nose, inviting and warming. Touches of caramel and butterscotch add richness.","finish":"The finish lingers with notes of dark chocolate, coffee liqueur, and dried cherries. Gentle tannins provide structure while the wine's residual sweetness maintains presence. A pleasant warmth and hints of cocoa nibs and vanilla bean carry through to the very end.","palate":"Rich and luscious on the palate, this wine delivers on its chocolate promise with flavors reminiscent of chocolate truffles, espresso, and dark cocoa. The sweetness is present but well-balanced, never cloying, with enough structure to keep the wine interesting. Black cherry and raspberry compote provide fruity counterpoints to the chocolate intensity. The texture is smooth and almost creamy, coating the palate with velvety richness. Oak influence contributes vanilla, toffee, and sweet baking spices."}

records.name: Lame Delisle Boucard Bourgueil Vieilles Vignes 2018
records.description: Lame Delisle Boucard Bourgueil Vieilles Vignes 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Casa Dumetz Clementine Carter Graciano 2020
records.description: An exceptional single-varietal Graciano from Santa Barbara's prestigious Two Wolves Vineyard in the Santa Ynez Valley. This rare expression showcases winemaker Sonja Magdevski's talent for crafting distinctive wines from unusual varieties, with 100% whole cluster fermentation highlighting the grape's natural elegance and aromatic complexity.
records.region: Two Wolves Vineyard, Santa Ynez Valley, Santa Barbara County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is strikingly aromatic with high-toned notes of crushed violet petals, rose water, and lavender. Sweet red berry fruit—raspberry, red cherry, and wild strawberry—mingles with exotic spice notes of cardamom and white pepper. The wine's organically-farmed origin is evident in pure, precise aromatics that showcase the variety's floral character. Subtle hints of graphite and dried herbs add additional layers of complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and perfumed, with persistent floral and purple fruit notes. The tannins remain refined and well-integrated, providing structure without weight, while a hint of minerality emerges at the very end.","palate":"Velvety and vibrant on the palate, this Graciano delivers vivid purple fruit flavors of black plum, boysenberry, and cassis, lifted by a distinctive lavender and floral note. The whole cluster fermentation contributes a subtle stem tannin structure that's fine-grained and silky rather than aggressive. Bright acidity keeps the wine dancing on the palate, while notes of sweet spice, rose petal, and dried flowers weave throughout. The texture is medium-bodied with an almost ethereal quality, belying the wine's intensity of flavor."}

records.name: Libertine Old Wagon Road Vineyard Chardonnay 2022
records.description: Libertine Old Wagon Road Vineyard Chardonnay 2022 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Backsberg Blueberry Row Pinotage 2020
records.description: From South Africa's renowned Backsberg Estate, this Fifth Generation Pinotage showcases the country's signature grape variety with distinctive fruit-forward character. Named for the blueberry bushes that line the vineyard rows, this wine captures the essence of Paarl terroir with modern winemaking that emphasizes approachability and fruit purity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic with pronounced notes of wild blueberries, black cherry, and ripe plum. Layers of mocha, coffee, and cinnamon create a warm spice profile, while hints of dark chocolate and dried herbs add complexity. The wine exudes inviting aromas that are both fruity and subtly savory, with a pleasant earthy undertone characteristic of well-made Pinotage.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long, with lingering notes of coffee, cherry, and sweet spice. The tannins remain soft and approachable, making this an excellent everyday drinking wine that doesn't require extensive cellaring.","palate":"Juicy and medium-bodied on the palate, this Pinotage delivers ripe cherry, sweet strawberry, and fresh blueberry flavors, complemented by notes of coffee bean and mocha. The wine's supple, sweet tannins create a silky smooth texture that's immediately appealing, while subtle undertones of dried herbs and spice add depth. Balanced acidity maintains freshness throughout, preventing the fruit sweetness from becoming cloying. The mouthfeel is plush and inviting, with excellent integration of fruit, oak, and tannin."}

records.name: Drimia Sahar Red Blend  (MD & DC)
records.description: An intriguing red blend from Israel's emerging wine region, crafted to showcase the unique terroir of the Judean Hills or Golan Heights. This modern Israeli wine combines international varietals with traditional winemaking to create a bold, fruit-driven expression suitable for contemporary wine drinkers.
records.varietal: Red blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Syrah
records.region: Israel (likely Judean Hills or Golan Heights)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an inviting bouquet of ripe dark cherries, blackberry preserves, and plum compote, layered with notes of Mediterranean herbs including rosemary, oregano, and dried lavender. Subtle spice notes of black pepper, cardamom, and star anise add intrigue, while hints of cedar wood, vanilla, and espresso suggest oak influence. A faint mineral quality reminiscent of the region's limestone-rich soils emerges with aeration, along with exotic notes of fig paste and date.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long, with dark fruit flavors gradually fading into notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and dried herbs. A pleasant warmth from the alcohol content lingers, accompanied by subtle oak spice and a hint of graphite minerality.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with velvety texture, the wine delivers concentrated flavors of black cherry, cassis, and mulberry. The fruit is complemented by savory elements of olive tapenade, sun-dried tomato, and leather that speak to Mediterranean character. Well-integrated tannins provide structure without astringency, while judicious oak aging contributes notes of vanilla bean, toasted coconut, and baking chocolate. The wine's acidity is moderate, allowing the ripe fruit to shine while maintaining balance. Layers of warm spice, including cinnamon and nutmeg, add complexity to the mid-palate."}

records.name: Les Brebis Ramato 2023
records.description: Les Brebis Ramato 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Les Brebis Willamette Pinot Noir 2018
records.description: An elegant, terroir-driven Pinot Noir from Oregon's Eola-Amity Hills crafted by a small family winery dedicated to minimal intervention. Fermented with native yeasts and aged in French oak, this wine showcases the light, earthy character that defines quality Willamette Valley Pinot Noir.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir from sustainably grown grapes
records.region: Eola-Amity Hills AVA, Willamette Valley, Oregon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is beautifully expressive with light earthy aromas including forest floor and mushroom, complemented by vibrant red fruit notes of strawberry and cherry. Subtle hints of rose petal and dried herbs add aromatic complexity, while a delicate spicy quality emerges from the native yeast fermentation and French oak aging.","finish":"The finish is graceful with lingering red fruit and earthy notes. The wine's savory character carries through to the end, leaving a complex, satisfying impression.","palate":"The palate is light and elegant, fruit-forward with flavors of juicy strawberry, black cherry, and red cherry that create an inviting core. Savory notes of truffles, game, and leafy greens add complexity and depth, while the wine's silky texture and integrated tannins provide structure without weight. The overall impression is one of balance and finesse."}

records.name: Les Brebis Ramato 2022
records.description: An elegant orange wine in the Ramato style, showcasing extended skin contact with Pinot Grigio grapes to achieve the characteristic copper-orange hue. This wine represents the original expression of Pinot Grigio, offering complexity, texture, and spice that modern white wine versions cannot match.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Grigio with extended skin contact
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals complex aromatics of baking spice, dried fruit, and tropical elements characteristic of well-made Ramato. Honey and brown spices mingle with chamomile and earl grey tea, while dried apricots, pear skin, and tropical citrus add fruity dimension. Subtle herbal notes and white flowers provide aromatic lift, with hints of baked apples and caramel from skin contact adding depth and intrigue.","finish":"The finish is long and structured with pleasant tannins from skin contact. Lingering notes of dried fruit, spice, and tea create a complex conclusion, while the wine's savory character leaves the palate intrigued and ready for food.","palate":"On the palate, the wine delivers dried fruit flavors with stone fruit skins creating a tannic, structured backbone. Peach, apricot, and tropical fruits are complemented by spicy notes - cinnamon, ginger, and white pepper. The extended skin contact provides a grippy texture and savory edge that distinguishes this from conventional white wine. Medium-plus body with balanced acidity creates harmony, while flavors of honey, caramel, and tea add complexity. The wine shows both freshness and depth, with excellent persistence of flavor."}

records.name: Roots Divino NA Rosso Vermouth NV
records.description: A sophisticated non-alcoholic aperitif crafted in Greece by macerating and infusing dealcoholized wine with traditional vermouth botanicals including Greek bitter oranges, gentian, and wormwood. This award-winning zero-proof vermouth captures the complexity and depth of traditional Italian rosso vermouth while offering a mindful drinking alternative.
records.varietal: Dealcoholized wine base infused with Greek bitter oranges, gentian, wormwood, and Mediterranean botanicals
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is complex and inviting with pronounced notes of bitter orange peel and sweet vanilla. Aromas of grape must, dried fruits—particularly raisin and fruitcake—mingle with warming baking spices of cinnamon and clove. Subtle herbal undertones of wormwood and gentian add a traditional vermouth character, while hints of dark chocolate and caramel provide additional depth. The overall impression is one of authentic vermouth complexity.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with lingering bitter-orange notes and gentle spice. The characteristic vermouth bitterness provides a clean, refreshing conclusion that stimulates the appetite and invites another sip or the next course.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a delightful bittersweet character that balances orange sweetness against the bitter notes of gentian root and wormwood. Deep plum and cassis flavors emerge alongside the citrus, while fruitcake spices and vanilla provide warmth and richness. The wine base contributes subtle grape and berry flavors, while a touch of acidity prevents the sweetness from becoming cloying. Over ice, a pleasant tartness emerges that subdues some of the sweetness and highlights the herbal complexity. The texture is round and smooth with excellent balance."}

records.name: Libertine Roam Red 2022
records.description: Libertine Roam Red 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Libertine One Heart Vineyard Albarino
records.description: A vibrant expression of Albariño showcasing the aromatic intensity and crisp character that defines this Spanish varietal. This wine captures the essence of coastal viticulture with its refreshing acidity and mineral-driven profile, offering a sophisticated interpretation of one of Spain's most celebrated white grapes.
records.region: One Heart Vineyard (specific region not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense floral aromatics reminiscent of white blossoms and orange peel, layered with bright citrus notes of Meyer lemon and lime zest. Subtle undertones of stone fruit emerge, particularly white peach and apricot, while a distinctive saline minerality adds complexity and coastal character to the bouquet.","finish":"The finish is persistent and invigorating, leaving lingering notes of citrus pith and white peach. A bright mineral quality extends through the lengthy conclusion, maintaining the wine's refreshing character and inviting another sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with exceptional freshness, the palate delivers crisp flavors of grapefruit, green apple, and nectarine. The wine's hallmark high acidity provides structure and vibrancy, while delicate notes of wet stone and sea spray contribute a distinctive mineral edge. The mouthfeel is clean and refreshing, with a subtle roundness that balances the wine's natural crispness."}

records.description: A Spanish Tempranillo showcasing the noble grape of Rioja and Ribera del Duero. While specific vintage details weren't available, this wine represents classic Spanish red wine character with the structure, fruit intensity, and oak influence typical of quality Tempranillo from Spain's premier regions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with ripe dark cherry and plum, accented by notes of dried tobacco leaf and leather. Vanilla and coconut from oak aging blend seamlessly with the fruit, while hints of dried strawberry and cranberry add brightness. Savory elements of dried herbs, black pepper, and a touch of earthy cedar create complexity typical of well-crafted Spanish Tempranillo.","finish":"The finish is long and warming with lingering dark fruit, spice, and oak flavors. Firm tannins provide grip and structure, suggesting the wine can age gracefully while remaining approachable now. The conclusion is satisfying and complex, characteristic of quality Spanish Tempranillo.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows concentrated dark fruit with firm yet polished tannins. Flavors of black cherry, blackberry, and fig dominate, supported by notes of dark chocolate and espresso. The oak influence provides structure with vanilla and toast flavors integrating into the fruit core. Medium to full-bodied, the wine maintains balance between fruit ripeness and acidity, creating a harmonious profile with depth and dimension."}

records.name: Lolea Mini White   187 ml
records.description: A sparkling white sangria from Spain crafted from Chardonnay and Macabeo grapes, combined with natural Mediterranean fruit and sparkling water. This refreshing frizzante-style beverage comes in a convenient 187ml mini bottle with a pop-top cap, perfect for individual servings and casual enjoyment.
records.varietal: Chardonnay and Macabeo blend with natural fruit
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals hints of jasmine, apricot, and loquat, creating an immediately inviting and aromatic profile. Essential citrus aromas of lemon and orange dominate with freshness and vibrancy. A subtle hint of vanilla blends seamlessly with the fruit, adding depth without sacrificing the wine's essential brightness and Mediterranean character. The delicate floral notes add elegance to this festive beverage.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent citrus and peach notes. The slight fizz continues to the end, leaving a lively, festive impression. Sweet but not cloying, the conclusion invites another sip of this elegant, balanced sangria.","palate":"Slightly fizzy and intensely fruity, the palate explodes with flavors of peach, tangerine, and sweet lemon. The mouth-feel is round and approachable with strong, lasting sweetness balanced by the wine's natural effervescence. Fresh citrus flavors dominate throughout, creating a refreshing, thirst-quenching experience. The balance between acidity and sweetness is carefully calibrated, making the wine more sophisticated and chic than typical sangrias."}

records.name: Moorilla Praxis Sparkling Riesling 2023
records.description: Moorilla Praxis Sparkling Riesling 2023 is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Lueria Gewurztraminer 2020
records.description: An aromatic white wine showcasing the distinctive personality of the Gewürztraminer grape. This wine captures the variety's hallmark floral intensity and exotic fruit character, offering a sensory experience marked by pronounced aromatics and rich texture that sets Gewürztraminer apart from other white wine varieties.
records.region: Origin unclear - possibly Upper Galilee, Israel or European origin
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic with the signature lychee scent that defines quality Gewürztraminer, derived from the aromatic compound linalool. The nose blooms with intense rose petal and orange blossom notes, contributed by terpenes like geraniol. Layers of exotic fruit—lychee, passion fruit, and ripe peach—mingle with ginger spice and honey nuances. The aromatic profile is captivating and complex, with tropical notes of mango and hints of Turkish delight adding to the wine's perfumed character.","finish":"The finish is moderately long and aromatic, leaving lingering impressions of rose petals, lychee, and ginger spice. The wine's richness persists through the finish with honey notes and a touch of sweetness that doesn't cloy due to the variety's natural spiciness. A slightly oily texture remains on the palate, typical of quality Gewürztraminer.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a rich, sometimes viscous texture that coats the palate. The wine shows moderate to low acidity but maintains freshness and balance despite the variety's tendency toward lower acid levels. Flavors mirror the nose with pronounced lychee, rose water, and ginger spice, supported by ripe stone fruit and honey notes. The alcohol content ranges from 13.5-15% ABV, contributing to the wine's full body and slightly warming quality. The style leans toward off-dry, with residual sweetness balanced by the wine's aromatic intensity and spice character."}

records.name: Luis Blanc Pergola Red (Wine Club Only) 2023
records.description: Luis Blanc Pergola Red (Wine Club Only) 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Lueria Unoaked Chardonnay
records.description: A pure, fruit-focused expression of Chardonnay crafted without oak influence to showcase the grape's natural characteristics. This unoaked style emphasizes crisp acidity, clean fruit flavors, and minerality, offering a refreshing alternative to traditional buttery Chardonnays and highlighting the varietal's versatility.
records.region: Likely California or Australia (specific region not available)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and pristine with aromas of green apple, fresh pear, and citrus zest. Notes of white flowers, lemon verbena, and honeydew melon add delicate complexity, while hints of wet stone and chalk provide mineral interest. Without oak influence, the aromatics are crisp and focused, showcasing pure varietal character with touches of grapefruit and subtle tropical fruit nuances.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with persistent citrus and green apple flavors. Bright acidity carries through the moderately long finish, leaving a crisp, mineral-tinged impression that's wonderfully food-friendly and inviting.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with vibrant, refreshing acidity and clean fruit expression. The palate delivers flavors of Granny Smith apple, Asian pear, and white peach, complemented by bright citrus notes of lime and lemon. A pronounced mineral quality adds texture and complexity, while the absence of oak allows the fruit and natural acidity to shine. The wine's crisp, unadulterated character provides excellent drinkability with a fresh, mouth-watering quality throughout."}

records.name: Macauley Cabernet Sauvignon Stagecoach 2021
records.description: Macauley Cabernet Sauvignon Stagecoach 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Macauley Bacigalupi Chardonnay 2023
records.description: An elegant Russian River Valley Chardonnay from the legendary Bacigalupi vineyard, the same site that contributed 40% of the grapes to Chateau Montelena's historic 1973 Chardonnay that won the Judgment of Paris. This wine captures the essence of its esteemed Russian River terroir with precision and refinement.
records.varietal: 100% Chardonnay from Bacigalupi Vineyard heritage clones
records.region: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright, crisp, and refreshing, showcasing gorgeous floral notes alongside citrus blossom and white flowers. Aromas of Meyer lemon, lime zest, and tropical fruit including pineapple and mango emerge, complemented by subtle hints of vanilla and toasted oak. The wine's aromatic profile reflects the vineyard's heritage clones from the 1970s.","finish":"The finish is long and refreshing with persistent citrus and mineral notes. The wine's bright acidity carries through to the end, leaving a clean, vibrant impression with subtle hints of toasted almond and vanilla.","palate":"The palate is marked by amazing acidity that provides structure and energy to the wine. Lovely citrus flavors of lemon and grapefruit lead, followed by layers of tropical fruit including pineapple and stone fruit notes of white peach and nectarine. The wine shows beautiful balance between fruit intensity and elegant restraint, with a creamy texture from lees contact that adds richness without heaviness."}

records.name: Manchuela Bodegas Ponce Buena Pinta 2014
records.description: Manchuela Bodegas Ponce Buena Pinta 2014 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Ontanon Clarete Rose 2021
records.description: Ontanon Clarete Rose 2021 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Macauley Cabernet Sauvignon To Kalon 2021
records.description: An exceptional single-vineyard Cabernet from Napa's legendary Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard in Oakville. With 97-98 points from top critics and limited production of 2,600 cases, this wine represents the pinnacle of California Cabernet. Winemaker Kirk Venge employs meticulous fermentation in small French oak barrels to craft a wine of extraordinary purity and balance from one of the world's most prestigious vineyard sites.
records.region: To Kalon Vineyard, Oakville, Napa Valley
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inky, deep purple hue indicating exceptional concentration. The nose is captivating with layers of blueberries, black raspberries, and cassis creating a dense fruit core. Flowery incense adds elegance alongside exotic spice notes. The aromatic complexity is remarkable, showing both power and refinement. Subtle notes of graphite and cedar emerge with air.","finish":"Long and persistent with remarkable concentration. The tannins are fine-grained and substantial, providing excellent aging potential. The finish showcases the wine's balance and class, with fruit, structure, and complexity all in harmony.","palate":"The wine offers wonderful purity with building tannins that provide structure without harshness. Concentrated flavors of dark blue and black fruits dominate, supported by notes of cassis and black raspberry. The wine is full-bodied yet balanced, showing remarkable integration of fruit, tannin, and oak. The overall profile is concentrated yet elegant, powerful yet refined. Layers of flavor unfold across the palate, revealing the vineyard's extraordinary terroir."}

records.name: Maison Ogier Cotes du Rhone Blanc 2024
records.description: Maison Ogier Cotes du Rhone Blanc 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Manchuela Bodegas Ponce La Casilla
records.description: Manchuela Bodegas Ponce La Casilla is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Maison Roche de Bellene Meursault VV 2020
records.description: Nicolas Potel's Maison Roche de Bellene crafts this exceptional Meursault from vieilles vignes (old vines), offering remarkable depth and complexity. The 2020 vintage delivered excellent balance in Burgundy, and this wine exemplifies Meursault's rich yet refined character from mature vineyard parcels.
records.region: Meursault, Côte de Beaune, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with seductive aromas of ripe yellow apple, poached pear, and white peach, layered with hazelnut, toasted brioche, and butterscotch from careful oak treatment. Mineral notes of wet stone and chalk speak to Meursault's limestone terroir, while delicate white flower and acacia honey nuances add elegance. The old vines contribute concentrated aromatic intensity without heaviness.","finish":"The finish is long and luxurious, with flavors of baked apple and honeyed nuts gradually yielding to a clean, mineral-driven conclusion. The wine's impressive length and persistent citrus-mineral tension suggest excellent aging potential.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied yet impeccably balanced, the palate showcases concentrated flavors of orchard fruits including Golden Delicious apple, Asian pear, and quince. Creamy texture from lees aging mingles with bright citrus acidity that prevents any cloying richness. Notes of roasted almond, vanilla bean, and subtle spice from oak maturation integrate seamlessly with the fruit. The wine's stony minerality provides a backbone that carries the generous fruit expression with precision and focus."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Marie 2023
records.description: A vibrant and refreshing white wine from the Languedoc region that showcases the crisp character of Colombard and Rolle. This IGP Pays d'Oc white offers explosive citrus notes and remarkable freshness, perfect for sunny occasions and casual gatherings.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright and delicate, opening with pronounced lemon and stone fruit aromatics complemented by subtle hints of pear and white flowers. As the wine breathes, notes of fresh pineapple and grapefruit emerge, adding tropical complexity, while a gentle whisper of honey provides roundness to the otherwise vibrant aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and lingering with persistent citrus zest notes. The wine's fresh acidity carries through to the end, leaving a clean, refreshing impression that invites another sip.","palate":"Super juicy and clean on entry, the wine broadens beautifully across the mid-palate with flavors of lemon, citrus zest, and ripe apricot dancing alongside warm stone fruit notes. The fresh, dynamic mouthfeel is marked by a tangy, thirst-quenching citrus and floral profile that showcases the wine's explosive character and notable acidity."}

records.name: Two Mountain Merlot Bad Label 2020
records.description: A certified sustainable Merlot from Yakima Valley, Washington's premier wine region. Two Mountain Winery achieved sustainable certification beginning with the 2020 vintage, making this "Bad Label" bottling both environmentally conscious and representative of Washington's distinctive terroir. The playful name belies a serious, well-crafted wine.
records.region: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington State
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents beautiful oak integration with a little cocoa dust and a healthy dose of raw fig. A dash of briny, salty intrigue adds complexity and distinctiveness. The aromatics reveal layers of strawberry and raspberry alongside hints of dried herbs, creating a unique profile that's both forward and leafy with unexpected savory elements.","finish":"A long, supple finish carries the wine's signature combination of fruit sweetness and savory spice. The conclusion is smooth and satisfying, perfect for near-term enjoyment with its approachable, crowd-pleasing style.","palate":"The palate performs an elegant ballet between lilac and bay leaf, cherry candy and roasted beets, black pepper and cumin, all dancing on a beautifully soft mid-palate that stretches for miles. Despite notable alcohol, the wine maintains a delicate, refined character that emphasizes fruit and spice balance over power. The texture is plush and inviting, more nuanced than its structure might suggest."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Pierre 2021
records.description: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Pierre 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.description: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Pierre 2024 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Manchuela Bodegas Ponce Reto 2014
records.description: Manchuela Bodegas Ponce Reto 2014 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Pierre 2023
records.description: A powerful and structured Cabernet Sauvignon named after Pierre, the winemaker's grandfather, honoring a man of integrity and uprightness. This wine represents the estate's commitment to producing noble, age-worthy reds from the unique Cabardès terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is dominated by blackcurrant buds followed by ripe bell pepper, showing the varietal character of Cabernet Sauvignon. Additional layers reveal themselves with aeration, including subtle vegetal notes that add complexity rather than detract. There's a fresh, vibrant quality to the aromatics that speaks to the wine's youth and purity.","finish":"The finish is fresh and spicy, with the Cabernet's natural acidity providing lift and balance. Peppery notes emerge alongside lingering blackcurrant flavors, while subtle toasted elements from micro-oxygenation add dimension. The tannins are ripe and well-integrated, promising good aging potential despite the wine's current approachability.","palate":"Round and ample on the palate with powerful structure and fine tannins that provide excellent framework. The flavor profile features small grilled notes that bring crispness and definition to the rich fruit core. Juicy length carries flavors of dark berries and cassis through the mid-palate, with the wine showing impressive depth and concentration for a young vintage."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Stephanie 2020
records.description: A classic Languedoc red blend showcasing the sun-drenched character and Mediterranean charm of southern France. This cuvée demonstrates the region's mastery of traditional Rhône varietals with balanced fruit, savory complexity, and remarkable value. An authentic expression of Languedoc terroir.
records.varietal: Blend of Grenache, Syrah, Carignan, and possibly Mourvèdre
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers enticing aromas of ripe red cherries, wild strawberries, and black raspberries with lovely freshness. Herbes de Provence—thyme, rosemary, lavender—add a distinctive Mediterranean character, while subtle notes of black pepper, cured meat, and garrigue (wild scrubland) contribute savory complexity. Light touches of vanilla and spice hint at oak influence.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long with lingering red fruit and herb notes. Gentle tannins and refreshing acidity create an elegant conclusion, while subtle spice and earthy elements fade pleasantly. An approachable, food-friendly finish that exemplifies the Languedoc style.","palate":"Medium-bodied with vibrant red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and cranberry dominating the palate. The mid-palate reveals earthy complexity with notes of dried herbs, black olive, and subtle leather. Soft tannins provide gentle structure without heaviness, while bright acidity maintains freshness and balance. The wine's savory character perfectly complements its fruit-driven core."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac L'intrus 2022
records.description: A pure expression of Cabernet Franc from Languedoc, crafted in a Loire-inspired style. This organic wine from Maison Ventenac is fermented and aged in concrete, then bottled with no added sulfur, showcasing the producer's natural winemaking philosophy and dedication to terroir expression in France's sunny south.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is floral and inviting, evoking peppery rose and sweet spices alongside ripe plum and cassis. A touch of licorice adds intrigue, while Cabernet Franc's distinctive graphite character provides minerality. The aromatics are fresh and vibrant, showing the wine's natural winemaking and concrete aging with pristine fruit purity.","finish":"Fresh and stylish with a halo of fine tannins, the finish is the perfect archetype of a thirst-quenching wine. Black fruits and graphite notes persist, leaving a clean, energetic conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"Juicy and clean with medium body and impressive grip, the palate immediately seduces with dynamic texture and Mediterranean flavors. Intense fruit and freshness dominate, with the wine showing spicy, joyful character throughout. Hints of smoke and loamy earth add complexity to the core of ripe dark fruit, while Cabernet Franc's signature graphite minerality provides structure. The texture is round and supple, topped with delicate tannins."}

records.name: Noble Hill Mourvèdre Rosé 2024
records.description: Noble Hill's 2024 Mourvèdre Rosé represents South African elegance at its finest, crafted from two distinct estate vineyards in Simonsberg-Paarl. This fresh and expressive rosé showcases the delicate balance achieved between goblet-pruned vines providing concentration and box-pruned vines delivering aromatic lightness. A cool, wet spring yielded particularly refined aromatics and excellent color in this vintage.
records.varietal: 100% Mourvèdre from two estate vineyards (goblet-pruned and box-pruned)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant strawberry and watermelon notes, accented by delicate white flower aromatics that lift the fruit character. A subtle mineral freshness emerges on the mid-palate, reflecting the unique terroir of the Simonsberg region. The cool 2024 vintage has enhanced the wine's refined aromatic profile, creating layers of complexity unusual for rosé at this price point.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering minerality that extends the fruit flavors. The wine's structure allows it to finish dry yet fruity, with subtle saline notes adding complexity. This is a rosé with genuine aging potential, though equally delightful when enjoyed young and fresh.","palate":"On the palate, lively acidity drives the wine forward while an elegant, slightly creamy texture provides body and structure. Fresh red berry flavors dominate, with the goblet-pruned vineyard contributing depth and concentration balanced by the lighter, more aromatic character from the box-pruned blocks. The wine shows remarkable precision with each element perfectly integrated, displaying a sophistication that elevates it beyond typical rosé."}

records.name: Mallorca Gallinas & Focas Red 2014
records.description: Mallorca Gallinas & Focas Red 2014 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Martellotto M Grenache (Wine Club) 2020
records.description: Martellotto M Grenache (Wine Club) 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Martellotto Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: A powerful Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon from one of the finest vintages on record. The 2019 harvest featured extended hang time and near-perfect conditions, allowing grapes to develop exceptional color concentration and complex flavor development. Crafted by Greg Martellotto, whose family has made wine for generations in the Italian tradition.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated black fruit aromas of blackberry and cassis, layered with subtle notes of cedar and vanilla from oak aging. Hints of dark chocolate and espresso emerge as the wine breathes, while underlying notes of dried herbs and tobacco leaf add complexity. The aromatic intensity reflects the exceptional 2019 vintage, with ripe fruit character balanced by savory elements.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with the structured tannins providing framework for continued aging. Dark fruit flavors linger alongside notes of toasted oak and a touch of minerality, while the wine's natural acidity keeps the palate fresh and vibrant through the extended finish.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied on the palate, this Cabernet delivers waves of ripe black cherry and plum flavors supported by firm, well-structured tannins. The extended hang time of the 2019 vintage is evident in the wine's depth and concentration, with layers of dark fruit, cocoa, and subtle baking spices. Mid-palate weight is impressive, showing the power typical of Paso Robles while maintaining elegance and balance."}

records.name: Martellotto M Chardonnay (Wine Club) 2021
records.description: From Santa Barbara County, the M by Martellotto Chardonnay represents winemaker Greg Martellotto's approach to elegant, terroir-driven white wine. Organically farmed and naturally produced, this wine appeals to lovers of Chablis-style Chardonnay—dry, nuanced, and mineral-focused. The wine is beautifully balanced and particularly food-friendly, especially with dishes featuring butter.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Light and delicate on the nose, with subtle aromas of green apple, white peach, and citrus blossom. The wine shows restraint and elegance, with minimal oak influence allowing fruit and terroir to shine. Hints of wet stone, lemon zest, and fresh almonds add complexity, while a characteristic minerality reflects the cool Santa Barbara County climate.","finish":"Clean and persistent, with lingering citrus and mineral notes. The finish showcases the wine's dry, nuanced character with bright acidity providing lift. The wine's elegance and restraint make it exceptionally versatile with food.","palate":"The palate is crisp, focused, and mineral-driven, showcasing the producer's emphasis on freshness over richness. Green apple and citrus flavors dominate, supported by bright acidity and a distinctive chalky minerality. The wine is light to medium-bodied with excellent texture and balance. Natural production methods and organic farming contribute to the wine's purity and sense of place. The style is refreshing and eminently drinkable."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Gran Reserva 2001
records.description: A traditional and age-worthy Gran Reserva from one of Rioja's most respected historic bodegas, representing the pinnacle of classical Rioja winemaking. This wine has undergone extensive aging in both barrel and bottle, developing the complex tertiary characteristics that define great Spanish wine and showcasing how Tempranillo evolves with time.
records.varietal: Predominantly Tempranillo with Mazuelo and Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile is a testament to maturity and careful cellaring, revealing evolved notes of dried cherry, fig, and prune alongside savory leather, tobacco leaf, and aged cedar. Classic Rioja characteristics emerge prominently: vanilla from American oak, coconut, and sweet baking spices including cinnamon and nutmeg. Tertiary notes of forest floor, dried mushroom, and autumn leaves add earthy complexity, while hints of balsamic reduction, truffle, and dark chocolate speak to the wine's advanced age. Delicate floral notes of dried rose petals persist, along with a faint oxidative quality that adds depth without indicating decline.","finish":"The finish is long and graceful, with lingering notes of dried fruit, oak spice, and leather. A gentle tannic grip remains, along with flavors of dark chocolate, coffee grounds, and a hint of orange peel that fade slowly and elegantly.","palate":"The wine has softened beautifully with age, presenting a medium-bodied, silky texture with fully resolved tannins that feel like velvet on the palate. Flavors of dried red fruits—cherry, cranberry, and pomegranate—mingle with savory notes of cured meat, black olive, and soy sauce. The extensive oak aging is evident but not overwhelming, contributing layers of vanilla custard, toasted coconut, and cigar box that integrate seamlessly with the fruit. Bright acidity has been preserved remarkably well, providing lift and preventing the wine from feeling tired or flat. The mid-palate reveals complexity: leather, espresso, dark tea leaves, and a subtle minerality of wet stone."}

records.name: Martino Pedro Ximenez 2020
records.description: Martino Pedro Ximenez 2020 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Thelema Chardonnay 2020
records.description: Thelema Mountain Vineyards' 2020 Chardonnay exemplifies world-class South African winemaking, earning 95 points from the International Wine Challenge Gold award and 94 points from renowned critic Tim Atkin. Aged for 10 months on lees in French oak barrels (35% new), this wine showcases the exceptional quality that Thelema consistently achieves from their Stellenbosch mountain vineyards. Limited production of 20,000 bottles makes this a sought-after expression of cool-climate Chardonnay.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents layers of ripe peach and grapefruit marmalade, interwoven with delicate white blossom notes. Complex yeasty character from extended lees aging complements toasty oak nuances, while wet stone minerality adds depth and focus. Tim Atkin notes the wine's \"wonderfully fresh and focused\" aromatic profile, with subtle reductive qualities that enhance complexity without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish is long, textured and spicy, with the 10 months on lees providing weight and persistence. Great acidity keeps the finish refreshing despite the wine's richness, with toasted oak and mineral notes extending the experience. The lovely texture carries through to the end, leaving subtle notes of citrus zest and blanched almonds.","palate":"At 13% alcohol, the palate shows remarkable balance with flavors of yellow apples and toasted almonds at the core, accented by lemon and green apple undertones. A dollop of cream from partial malolactic fermentation provides richness while maintaining the wine's clean, vibrant character. Medium-bodied with great natural acidity, the texture is succulent and fresh with understated concentration that speaks to terroir rather than oak. Nutty and waxy nuances add complexity throughout the mid-palate."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Mate Mantus Merlot IGT Toscana 2021
records.description: Mate Mantus Merlot IGT Toscana 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Mate Brunello di Montalcino 2019
records.description: An exceptional Brunello di Montalcino from the outstanding 2019 vintage, earning 93 points from both Wine Spectator and Decanter. The Máté family estate, a Roman vineyard 2,000 years ago, produces this wine from 7 hectares of varied terroir surrounded by Mediterranean woods, herbs, and wild fruit on the sea-breeze ventilated side of Montalcino.
records.region: Brunello di Montalcino DOCG, Tuscany, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Extroverted in the glass with complex aromatics. The nose reveals exotic spices and cedar shavings complementing medicinal cherry and sweet rose. Plum, loam, leather, and mineral notes create depth and intrigue, while a hint of vanilla from oak aging adds subtle richness. Coffee, vanilla, and mint lend a sweet glossiness to the red cherry core, while racy acidity keeps everything lifted and vibrant.","finish":"The finish is long and refined with lingering cherry fruit, mineral notes, and subtle vanilla. Fine tannins provide gentle grip while the wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed. The conclusion is elegant and persistent, inviting contemplation.","palate":"Richly fruited and concentrated on the palate, this Brunello absorbs its oak overcoat with ease. Coffee, vanilla, and mint create sweet, glossy layers over vibrant red cherry fruit. The wine is gentle yet focused, with plum, leather, and mineral flavors framed by refined tannins. Racy acidity provides backbone and keeps the wine fresh despite its concentration. The texture is silky and well-formed, showing mature tannins that give frame to this stylishly rendered wine. Mid-palate shows excellent balance between fruit richness and structural elements."}

records.name: Mendoza Finca Abril Rapsodia 2017
records.description: A sophisticated Bordeaux-style blend from Mendoza's prestigious Valle de Uco region, crafted by winemaker Adrian Toledo. This reserve-level wine combines traditional French varieties in a harmonious composition, aged for 24 months in French oak barrels with extended maceration of 25-40 days to extract optimal complexity and structure from grapes grown in Perdriel, Lujan de Cuyo.
records.region: Perdriel, Lujan de Cuyo and Valle de Uco, Mendoza, Argentina
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals deep complexity with aromas of ripe blackberry, cassis, and dark plum intermingled with notes of chocolate, gingerbread, and chai spices from the extensive barrel aging. Underlying the rich fruit are scents of cedar, tobacco, and graphite, typical of well-aged Bordeaux blends. Hints of vanilla and toasted oak add a sophisticated dimension, while subtle floral notes of violet provide elegance.","finish":"The finish is long and luxurious, with persistent dark fruit flavors complemented by chocolate, spice, and oak notes. The wine's structure becomes evident on the finish, with fine-grained tannins and balanced acidity ensuring aging potential. Subtle warmth from the alcohol is well-integrated, and the complex spice notes linger impressively.","palate":"Deep in body and powerfully structured, this wine showcases the concentrated fruit character of high-altitude Mendoza vineyards. The palate delivers rich flavors of black cherry, blackcurrant, and plum, accentuated by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet baking spices including gingerbread and cinnamon. The 24-month barrel aging contributes layers of complexity with toasted oak, vanilla, and subtle leather notes. Tannins are firm yet refined, providing structure for extended aging while supporting the wine's considerable fruit intensity."}

records.name: Mike and Molly Hendry Zinfandel 2018
records.description: From Hendry Ranch's 114-acre estate vineyard in Napa Valley, this Zinfandel exemplifies the winery's straightforward, quality-driven approach to winemaking. Named for family members, this wine represents the unpretentious excellence that earned Hendry recognition in Wine Spectator's 2025 roundup of California Zinfandels.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with classic California Zinfandel character: jammy blackberry, boysenberry, and dark cherry leap from the glass. Underneath, aromatic layers of black pepper, dried sage, and crushed rosemary emerge, along with hints of cola, licorice, and sweet vanilla from American oak aging. A touch of brambly, wild berry character adds rustic charm.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with persistent spice notes and dark fruit flavors that evolve into hints of tobacco and toasted oak. A slight peppery kick emerges at the very end, characteristic of well-made Zinfandel, inviting another sip.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied, the wine delivers concentrated flavors of ripe black raspberry and cherry preserves, balanced by bright acidity that prevents cloying sweetness. The mid-palate shows excellent density with notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and warm baking spices. Despite its power, the wine maintains elegance and balance, with alcohol well-integrated. Velvety tannins provide structure without astringency."}

records.name: Mike and Molly Hendry Zinfandel 2019
records.description: A powerhouse Napa Zinfandel from Hendry Vineyard, known for exceptional old-vine fruit and meticulous farming. This bottling exemplifies the plummy intensity and spice-driven complexity that defines premium California Zinfandel. Bold, structured, and thoroughly satisfying.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with exuberant aromas of wild blackberry, boysenberry jam, and crushed red berries. Cedar and vanilla notes from oak aging interweave with black pepper, cinnamon, and dried herbs. Underlying hints of bramble, cocoa powder, and sweet tobacco add layers of complexity to this captivating bouquet.","finish":"The finish is long and warming with persistent dark fruit and sweet spice. Layers of vanilla, cedar, and black pepper linger beautifully, while integrated tannins provide a satisfying grip. The conclusion is bold yet balanced, showcasing Zinfandel's ability to combine power with finesse.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied with concentrated flavors of ripe plum, dark cherry, and blackberry preserves. The mid-palate reveals warm baking spices—clove, nutmeg, and allspice—alongside vanilla bean and toasted oak. Firm yet ripe tannins provide excellent structure, while the wine's natural fruit sweetness is balanced by vibrant acidity and a touch of peppery spice."}

records.name: Mendoza Punta Pays Cruz de Piedra Malbec 2019
records.description: From the renowned Cruz de Piedra subregion of Maipú in Mendoza, this Malbec embodies Argentine winemaking at its finest. The 2019 vintage benefits from excellent growing conditions, producing concentrated fruit with balanced structure that showcases why Mendoza Malbec has captivated wine lovers worldwide.
records.region: Cruz de Piedra, Maipú, Mendoza, Argentina
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is powerfully expressive with layers of dark fruit: blackberry, blueberry compote, and black plum leap forward. Floral violet notes provide classic Malbec character, while background hints of vanilla, cedar, and sweet tobacco suggest careful oak integration. As the wine opens, notes of dried fig, cocoa nibs, and graphite emerge, adding complexity and sophistication to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful, with dark fruit and oak-derived spices lingering impressively. Firm but ripe tannins provide structure for aging, while the wine's fruit concentration ensures balance. Notes of mocha and dark berries echo on the palate, ending with a satisfying warmth.","palate":"Rich and velvety on the palate, this Malbec delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors wrapped in plush tannins. Ripe blackberry and cassis dominate the entry, followed by black cherry, plum, and hints of boysenberry. The wine's full body is balanced by vibrant acidity that provides freshness despite the intense fruit concentration. Mid-palate reveals layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet baking spices from oak aging, while underlying minerality from the rocky Cruz de Piedra soils adds tension and complexity."}

records.name: Lanzarote Vino Blanco 2021
records.description: This Lanzarote white wine showcases the unique Malvasía Volcánica grape, a variety officially recognized by the International Organisation of Vine and Wine that exists only on this volcanic island. Representing 70% of Lanzarote's grape production, Malvasía Volcánica is a natural cross between Malvasia and the indigenous Marmajuelo variety. Grown just 125 km from the African coast in extreme conditions, the vines are planted in small volcanic holes (hoyos) and protected by stone walls against fierce Saharan and Atlantic winds.
records.varietal: 100% Malvasía Volcánica (a natural cross of Malvasia x Marmajuelo unique to Lanzarote)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with enticing tropical fruit aromas of pineapple and apricot, characteristic of the Malvasía Volcánica variety. Beneath the fruit, a distinct volcanic minerality emerges - a signature of Lanzarote's porous black volcanic soils. Subtle floral notes of white blossoms add elegance, while the extreme growing conditions contribute unique saline and smoky nuances that distinguish this wine from mainland Spanish whites.","finish":"The finish showcases the wine's signature minerality, with saline notes reminiscent of sea spray and volcanic ash. Citrus zest and tropical fruit linger alongside the persistent stony character. The crisp acidity keeps the palate fresh and vibrant, making you reach for another sip. This is a wine that truly tastes of its unique place on earth.","palate":"On the palate, the wine is crisp, bright and positively exploding with citrus and mineral flavors. The porous volcanic soil's extreme drainage creates concentrated flavors despite the challenging conditions, with tropical fruit notes of pineapple dancing alongside lemon and grapefruit. A refreshing, almost electric acidity cuts through the richness, enhanced by the maritime influence. The volcanic terroir contributes a distinctive chalky, mineral backbone that runs through the entire palate, creating remarkable complexity for a wine from such harsh conditions."}

records.name: Misty Cliffs NA Sauvignon Blanc NV
records.description: A dealcoholized Sauvignon Blanc from South Africa's coastal region that delivers authentic varietal character without alcohol. This innovative wine preserves the crisp, vibrant nature of Sauvignon Blanc while offering a guilt-free alternative at just 15 calories per serving.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting aromas of white peach and green pineapple, creating a tropical-meets-temperate aromatic profile. Subtle hints of bell pepper emerge, a classic Sauvignon Blanc marker that confirms the wine's varietal authenticity. The bouquet remains fresh and bright, avoiding the cooked or flat characteristics often found in non-alcoholic alternatives.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering citrus zest and a nose-tingling hint of green bell pepper. The acidity persists pleasantly, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next sip or bite of food.","palate":"On the palate, classic Sauvignon Blanc acidity takes center stage with zesty grapefruit and lime flavors dominating. Crisp citrus mingles with delicate pear and stone fruit notes, while a subtle minerality adds depth and complexity. The mouthfeel is surprisingly similar to traditional wine, with refreshing tartness balanced by just enough natural sweetness to avoid juice-like qualities. The wine maintains impressive balance throughout, never veering into cloying territory."}

records.name: Misty Cliffs NA Cabernet Sauvignon &  Merlot NV
records.description: This non-alcoholic wine from South Africa's Misty Cliffs range offers the character of traditional Bordeaux varietals without the alcohol. Using advanced dealcoholization techniques, this blend maintains the flavor profile of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot while providing a sophisticated non-alcoholic option.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents red currant, black cherry, and plum alongside subtle oak notes of vanilla and cedar. Herbal hints of eucalyptus and dried herbs add complexity, while a touch of bell pepper reflects the Cabernet character. The aromatic profile, while lighter than traditional wine, maintains recognizable varietal characteristics.","finish":"The finish is moderate in length with lingering fruit flavors and subtle oak notes. Soft tannins provide a gentle grip, while the wine concludes cleanly without the warming sensation of alcohol. A slight herbal note adds interest to the aftertaste.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with flavors reminiscent of red and black fruits—cherry, blackberry, and cassis. The dealcoholization process maintains fruit character while creating a lighter texture than traditional wine. Subtle oak influence provides notes of vanilla and spice, while soft tannins add structure. The wine shows pleasant balance between fruit sweetness and acidity, with herbal undertones adding complexity. While it lacks the weight and depth of alcoholic wine, it successfully captures the essential character of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot."}

records.description: Monte Real Cepas Viejas 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 1975
records.description: A legendary vintage from Bodegas Riojanas, this 50-year-old Gran Reserva represents old-school Rioja at its finest. Remarkably well-preserved and singing with vitality, this wine showcases the extraordinary aging potential of traditional Rioja and the exceptional quality of the 1975 vintage.
records.varietal: Tempranillo-based blend with Garnacha and possibly Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The mature nose reveals the wine's impressive age with grace and elegance. Aromas of mature red fruit—cranberry, dried cherry, and aged strawberry—combine with forest floor, dried autumn leaves, and turned earth. An orange peel hint adds brightness, while subtle notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and wood box emerge with air. The aromatic complexity is stunning, showing classic old-school Rioja character without any mustiness or over-oxidation.","finish":"The finish is lengthy and contemplative, revealing layer after layer of earthy, mineral, and roasted earth aromas. A firm yet refined tannic structure provides backbone, while the integrated acidity ensures freshness. Subtle notes of dried fruit, leather, and mineral linger beautifully, inviting quiet reflection on this masterpiece of traditional winemaking. At 50 years, this wine is on a gentle plateau of maturity with drinking window extending well into the future.","palate":"Despite its age, the wine remains remarkably alive and vibrant on the palate. Fresh flavors of tart red fruits and ripe cranberry dance with integrated, spot-on acidity that provides lift and energy. The tannins have resolved completely into silky smoothness, while earthy mineral notes add dimension and terroir character. Flavors of dried cherry, leather, tobacco, and a touch of vanilla from long oak aging create a tapestry of evolved complexity. The wine shows elegant restraint and perfect balance."}

records.name: Lambert Estate Thoroughbred Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: Lambert Estate Thoroughbred Cabernet Sauvignon embodies the bold spirit and elite character of Barossa Valley winemaking. Crafted by winemaker Kirk Lambert from meticulous vineyard selection with elite vine stock and specific clonal traits, this wine represents the performance and finesse of a true thoroughbred.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with concentrated aromas of blackcurrant, cassis, and ripe dark plums, interwoven with hints of cedar, tobacco leaf, and dark chocolate. There's an underlying complexity of sweet baking spices including vanilla and cinnamon from quality oak aging, while subtle eucalyptus notes add a distinctly Australian character. The intensity and concentration speak to the warm Barossa climate and low-yielding vines.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with lingering dark fruit flavors, subtle oak spice, and a hint of graphite minerality. Fine-grained tannins provide backbone and aging potential, while the wine's natural acidity keeps everything balanced and fresh through the extended finish.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful, the palate delivers rich flavors of black cherry, blackberry compote, and dark chocolate, supported by firm yet silky tannins that provide excellent structure. The wine shows remarkable depth and concentration with layers of mocha, roasted coffee beans, and dark fruit preserves. The integration of French and American oak is seamless, contributing complexity without overwhelming the fruit. There's a wonderful tension between power and elegance that defines quality Barossa Cabernet."}

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2017
records.description: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2017 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2005 2036046
records.description: An exceptional Gran Reserva from Rioja's prestigious Monte Real estate, showcasing the elegance and complexity that comes with nearly two decades of aging. The 2005 vintage was outstanding in Rioja, producing wines of remarkable balance and longevity. This wine represents traditional Rioja winemaking at its finest, with extended oak aging and bottle maturation creating layers of tertiary complexity.
records.varietal: Tempranillo-based blend with Graciano and Mazuelo
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Evolving garnet color with brick-red edges indicating full maturity. The nose is complex and tertiary, opening with aromas of dried cherry, fig, and prune alongside savory notes of leather, tobacco, and forest floor. Hints of cedar, vanilla, and baking spices reflect the extended oak aging. The bouquet shows beautiful integration of fruit, oak, and age-derived character.","finish":"Long and elegant with integrated tannins and lingering notes of spice, dried fruit, and earth. The finish showcases the wine's sophistication and full maturity.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky, fully integrated tannins from aging. The palate delivers flavors of dried red fruit, black tea, and mushroom alongside notes of leather and spice. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit, acidity, and tannin, with a refined texture achieved through extended cellaring. Layers of complexity unfold, revealing the wine's pedigree and maturity."}

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2009
records.description: Monte Real's Gran Reserva represents the pinnacle of traditional Rioja winemaking, with extended aging creating wines of extraordinary complexity and elegance. This 2009 vintage has benefited from years of barrel and bottle maturation, transforming into a sophisticated wine that showcases Rioja's ability to produce world-class age-worthy reds.
records.varietal: Tempranillo-dominant blend (likely with Graciano, Mazuelo, and/or Garnacha)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is a masterclass in aged Rioja character: tertiary aromas dominate with leather, tobacco leaf, dried mushroom, and forest floor creating an earthy, savory foundation. Evolved fruit shows as dried cherry, fig, and prune, while background notes of vanilla, cedar, and cigar box reveal extensive oak aging. Subtle hints of balsamic, truffle, and autumn leaves add depth, and delicate floral notes of dried rose petal provide unexpected lift. The aromatics are complex, integrated, and distinctly Old World in style.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and refined, with dried fruit, spice, and earthy notes persisting elegantly. Soft tannins provide gentle structure, while bright acidity keeps the wine fresh despite its age. Lingering notes of tobacco, leather, and dried cherry fade slowly, leaving a satisfying, contemplative conclusion.","palate":"The palate delivers silky elegance with perfectly integrated components. Red fruit has evolved into dried cherry, cranberry, and red currant character, accented by notes of orange peel and pomegranate. The wine's medium body feels weightless yet substantial, supported by fine-grained tannins that have mellowed to velvet softness. Savory elements dominate the flavor profile: leather, tobacco, earth, and umami-rich mushroom notes create complexity, while extended oak aging manifests as vanilla, coconut, and subtle smoke. The balance between fruit, acidity, and tertiary development is exquisite."}

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2018
records.description: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Monte Real Reserva de Familia 2020
records.description: A distinguished Rioja Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas representing the estate's flagship family reserve bottling. This wine exemplifies traditional Rioja winemaking with extended oak aging, showcasing the elegance and complexity that comes from both careful viticulture and patient cellar work in one of Spain's most celebrated wine regions.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with likely additions of Graciano and/or Mazuelo
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals classic Rioja Reserva character with aromas of red cherry and strawberry preserved in brandy, interwoven with notes of vanilla bean, cedar, and sweet tobacco from American oak aging. Subtle hints of leather, dried rose petals, and earthy mushroom add complexity, while a touch of balsamic and spice box suggests proper bottle age. The overall impression is refined and elegant rather than overtly fruity.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with lingering notes of spiced cherry, cedar, and a subtle earthy minerality. Fine-grained tannins provide gentle grip while the wine's acidity keeps the conclusion fresh and food-friendly, with echoes of vanilla and dried herbs persisting.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with silky tannins that speak to quality aging, the palate offers flavors of red cherry, cranberry, and dried fig complemented by savory notes of roasted red pepper and tomato leaf. The oak influence shows as vanilla, coconut, and sweet spice that integrate harmoniously with the fruit. Bright acidity provides structure and lift, carrying the complex flavors across the palate with elegance and balance."}

records.name: Moorilla Extra Brut 2018
records.description: A sophisticated Tasmanian sparkling wine from the acclaimed Moorilla estate, showcasing the region's exceptional potential for premium sparkling wine production. This Extra Brut cuvée demonstrates minimal dosage, allowing the wine's natural acidity and fruit purity to shine through with remarkable clarity and elegance.
records.varietal: Likely Chardonnay and/or Pinot Noir (traditional method blend)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with precise aromas of green apple, lemon zest, and white peach, complemented by notes of brioche and toasted almond from extended lees aging. Delicate floral hints of white flowers and honeysuckle add elegance, while subtle mineral notes of chalk and flint speak to the wine's cool-climate origins. A whisper of fresh ginger and citrus blossom provides aromatic lift.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and dry with lingering citrus and mineral notes. The wine's crisp acidity persists, cleansing the palate completely, while subtle nutty and yeasty undertones add depth and length to the conclusion.","palate":"The palate is vibrant and focused with fine, persistent bubbles that carry flavors of citrus, green apple, and nectarine. The Extra Brut dosage (very low sugar) allows the wine's bright acidity to dominate, creating a taut, refreshing structure that highlights purity and precision. Creamy autolytic character from lees aging adds complexity with hints of brioche, hazelnut, and cultured butter, while the wine's mineral backbone provides a distinctive sense of place."}
