records.name: Mountain Brook Chardonnay 2023
records.description: A North Carolina Chardonnay from Mountain Brook Vineyards in Tryon, an estate recognized for producing award-winning wines from the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Mountain Brook's Chardonnay program has earned recognition from the North Carolina Fine Wines Society, with previous vintages showcasing their ability to craft elegant, balanced wines with both bright fruit and rich texture.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright citrus notes of lemon and lime alongside stone fruit aromas of white peach and green apple. Rich cream and subtle vanilla hints from oak influence add complexity without overwhelming the fruit. Floral notes and mineral undertones contribute to aromatic depth, reflecting the mountain vineyard's terroir and elevation.","finish":"Clean and refreshing finish with lingering citrus and subtle cream notes. The mountain terroir contributes mineral freshness that persists alongside fruit character, creating a satisfying conclusion that invites the next sip.","palate":"The palate balances vibrant acidity with creamy texture, showing Mountain Brook's house style of bright citrus fruit complemented by rich, lees-influenced weight. Flavors of crisp apple, citrus zest, and stone fruit are enhanced by subtle oak notes that add vanilla and toast without dominating. The wine demonstrates excellent integration between fruit purity and winemaking technique, with refreshing acidity providing structure and lift."}

records.name: Coste Caumartin Chardonnay 2020
records.description: Domaine Coste-Caumartin's legacy traces back nearly a thousand years to the era of the Dukes of Burgundy, making it one of the region's most historically significant estates. This family-owned domaine in the Côte de Beaune produces approximately 65,000 bottles annually, with 25% dedicated to elegant Chardonnay-based white wines. Their 2020 Chardonnay likely comes from their Saint-Romain parcels, where the cooler climate and limestone soils produce wines of remarkable finesse and minerality.
records.region: Côte de Beaune, Burgundy, France (likely Saint-Romain or Bourgogne Côte d'Or)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents classic Burgundian Chardonnay character with ripe orchard fruit - green apple, pear, and hints of white peach. Subtle floral notes of acacia and hawthorn blossom add elegance, while well-integrated oak contributes gentle vanilla and hazelnut nuances. The limestone terroir of the Côte de Beaune expresses itself through pronounced wet stone minerality and a flinty, chalky quality that lifts the fruit aromatics. Delicate toasted brioche and butter notes from lees aging add depth without overwhelming the wine's inherent freshness.","finish":"The finish is long and precise with persistent minerality that seems to echo through the palate. Citrus zest and wet stone notes linger, accompanied by a subtle saline quality characteristic of fine Burgundy whites. The wine's natural acidity ensures a clean, refreshing close that invites another sip. This is Chardonnay that speaks eloquently of place, showing restraint and elegance over power.","palate":"Medium-bodied and beautifully balanced, the palate shows the precision typical of cooler-climate Burgundy Chardonnay. Crisp green apple and citrus zest flavors form the core, complemented by richer notes of blanched almond and lemon curd. The 2020 vintage's natural acidity provides a vibrant spine, keeping the wine fresh and focused despite its textural richness. There's a lovely tension between the wine's creamy mouthfeel - enhanced by partial malolactic fermentation - and its bright, mineral-driven energy. Subtle oak influence integrates seamlessly, adding structure rather than overt flavor."}

records.name: Mountain Brook The Belle 2024
records.description: A charming and expressive wine from Mountain Brook that captures the essence of Virginia winemaking with elegance and approachability. The Belle 2024 represents a fresh vintage that emphasizes fruit purity and terroir expression, crafted for immediate enjoyment while maintaining refinement.
records.varietal: Likely Rosé or light red blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fragrant and inviting with notes of fresh strawberry, wild raspberry, and rose petal dancing from the glass. Subtle hints of cherry blossom and watermelon rind add a delicate complexity, while a whisper of white pepper provides intrigue. The aromatic profile suggests bright fruit character with elegant floral undertones that promise a refined drinking experience.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit and subtle herbal notes. The finish is medium in length with bright acidity that leaves the palate energized and ready for food or another sip.","palate":"The palate is light to medium-bodied with vibrant red berry flavors of cranberry, strawberry, and pomegranate. Crisp acidity provides structure and lift, while subtle earthy notes add dimension to the fruit-forward core. A silky texture carries the flavors gracefully, with minimal tannins ensuring smooth drinkability. The wine shows excellent balance between freshness and fruit concentration."}

records.name: Muller Gruver Vetliner NV
records.description: An Austrian-style Grüner Veltliner offering bright acidity and distinctive white pepper aromatics. This versatile white wine balances mineral-driven structure with fresh fruit character, making it an excellent food companion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant citrus blossom and green apple, followed by the grape's signature white pepper spice. Subtle mineral notes reminiscent of wet stone emerge, along with hints of fresh herbs including cilantro and lemongrass. The aromatic profile suggests crisp, refreshing character with herbal complexity.","finish":"The finish is clean and mineral-driven with lingering citrus and pepper spice. The refreshing acidity persists, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next bite, with a subtle chalky minerality that speaks to classic Grüner Veltliner character.","palate":"The palate delivers precise, focused flavors of lime zest, green pear, and unripe peach. The wine's medium body carries bright acidity that provides excellent structure and lift. A distinctive savory quality with white pepper spice weaves through the fruit, while subtle stone fruit notes add depth without weighing down the wine's energetic character."}

records.name: Ontanon Reserva 2010
records.description: A stellar Rioja Reserva from an excellent vintage, produced by Bodegas Onta��n using traditional Tempranillo with Graciano. This wine earned 92 points from Wine Enthusiast, showcasing classic Rioja aging character with perfect balance between fruit, oak, and time. The 2010 vintage is recognized as outstanding for Rioja, and this wine demonstrates why with remarkable grace and aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic Rioja aromas play beautifully together, featuring cured meat, dried cherry, wood spice, tobacco, and vanilla in harmonious complexity. The bouquet reveals mixed berry compote alongside chocolate, toast, and smoke from extended oak aging. Layers of dried fruit, leather, and earthy notes demonstrate the wine's maturity and traditional winemaking approach.","finish":"Powerful finish indicating continued aging potential, with persistent notes of dark fruit, vanilla, and spice. The wine remains balanced and graceful, showing the hallmarks of a Reserva that will continue to develop through 2028 and potentially beyond.","palate":"Sleek and polished on the palate with plush texture that's full without being heavy. Flavors of plum, berry fruits, vanilla, and oak are perfectly balanced with fine tannins and bright acidity. The wine shows good ripeness balanced with mineral finish, demonstrating excellent integration of primary fruit with secondary and tertiary development from barrel and bottle aging. The combination of fruit concentration and aging complexity creates impressive depth."}

records.name: Optima Alexander Valley Duffy Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve 2014

records.name: Optima Gewurztraminer (Dry) 2017
records.description: A flamboyant and aromatic Gewürztraminer from Dry Creek Valley in Sonoma County, California. This 2017 vintage showcases the explosive aromatics and rich fruit character that Optima Winery is known for, crafted in a dry style that balances the grape's natural exuberance with crisp, refreshing finish.
records.region: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic and captivating, the nose bursts with gooey passionfruit and luscious honeydew melon. Candied ginger provides exotic spice notes while flower nectar and Chinese hibiscus contribute heady floral perfume. Fresh cucumber flesh adds a cooling herbal element, while guava purée and canned peach create layers of tropical and stone fruit. The overall impression is one of succulent, fragrant fruit meeting an impressive blast of floral intensity.","finish":"Finishes just dry with a refreshing conclusion that counters the rich fruit impression. The aromatic intensity persists through the finish, leaving lasting impressions of tropical fruit and floral perfume while crisp acidity provides clean, balanced closure.","palate":"Lively and heavily aromatic on entry, gushing with tropical fruit and floral flavors. Rich, creamy peach dominates alongside lychee and honeydew melon, creating an impression of perceived sweetness despite the dry finish. Mid-palate brings up spice notes of honey, ginger, and a pinch of nutmeg that add complexity. The texture shows a hint of sandy loam minerality, while the crisp structure maintains freshness throughout. Explosive flavors remain vibrant and fruit-forward."}

records.name: Two Mountain Brothers Red Blend 2019
records.description: Two Mountain Winery's 'Brothers' Reserve represents a unique collaboration between brothers Matt and Patrick Rawn, who each select their favorite barrels from their favorite blocks and estate vineyard sites. Only barrels that make both brothers' lists are included, ensuring exceptional quality and consistency. Sourced from their 300 acres of sustainably farmed estate vineyards in Washington's Yakima Valley, this reserve-level blend showcases the best of what their Rattlesnake Hills terroir can produce. The project originated when the winery consisted only of the Rawn brothers, making barrel selection a friendly competition.
records.varietal: Estate-grown red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant with Merlot and other Bordeaux varieties)
records.region: Yakima Valley, Washington State, USA (Rattlesnake Hills AVA)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated dark fruit - blackberry, black cherry, and cassis - layered with notes of dark chocolate and espresso. Well-integrated oak contributes cedar and vanilla nuances without overwhelming the fruit, while hints of tobacco leaf and dried herbs add complexity. The estate-grown character shines through with a distinctive minerality reflecting the volcanic soils of the Rattlesnake Hills AVA. Subtle notes of violet and black pepper emerge as the wine opens, showcasing the careful barrel selection process.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant with persistent dark fruit and subtle oak spice. Fine-grained tannins provide structure for aging while remaining approachable now. The sustainable farming practices and estate fruit quality shine through in the wine's purity and length. Notes of dark chocolate and espresso linger alongside ripe fruit, with the volcanic terroir's minerality adding a distinctive signature at the close.","palate":"On the palate, the wine is rich and structured with ripe black fruit flavors at its core. The Yakima Valley's warm days and cool nights have created wines with excellent concentration balanced by refreshing acidity. Velvety tannins provide structure without harshness, suggesting careful oak management and optimal barrel selection. The wine shows layers of complexity - dark plum and blackberry give way to mocha, vanilla, and sweet baking spices on the mid-palate. Each barrel component seems perfectly integrated, a testament to the brothers' meticulous selection process."}

records.name: Paloma Vineyards Merlot 2016
records.description: This Napa Valley Merlot showcases the region's signature opulence with velvety texture and concentrated dark fruit. The 2016 vintage benefited from ideal growing conditions, producing a wine of exceptional depth and balance. A sophisticated expression that bridges elegance and power.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with lush aromas of ripe black plum and dark cherry, intertwined with notes of cocoa and espresso. Hints of cedar and vanilla emerge from oak aging, while subtle violet florals add complexity. The aromatic profile is rich yet refined, showing the polished character of premium Napa fruit.","finish":"The finish is persistent and elegant, with lingering notes of dark fruit preserves and baking spices. Fine-grained tannins leave a velvety impression, while subtle oak influence adds complexity without overwhelming the fruit. A harmonious conclusion that invites the next sip.","palate":"On the palate, this Merlot delivers luxurious concentration with flavors of blackberry compote, dark chocolate, and mocha. The mid-palate reveals layers of spiced plum, tobacco leaf, and a touch of graphite minerality. Silky tannins provide structure without heaviness, while balanced acidity maintains freshness through the long flavor development."}

records.name: Sun Break Ariane Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: Sun Break's Ariane Pinot Noir represents a distinctive approach to Oregon winemaking, crafted from the estate Cortell-Rose Vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA. This wine showcases 100% whole cluster fermentation, creating a lighter, more ethereal style with pronounced savory and earthy characteristics.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir from Cortell-Rose Vineyard (all six clones/blocks)
records.region: Eola-Amity Hills AVA, Willamette Valley, Oregon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"A phenomenal nose bursts with bright aromatics of Bing cherry, fresh raspberry, and red rose petals, complemented by sweet herbs and vibrant orange zest. The whole cluster fermentation contributes additional complexity with subtle green tea, forest floor, and stem spice notes that add an intriguing herbal dimension. There's a beautiful floral quality reminiscent of violet and peony, while hints of cranberry and pomegranate add brightness and lift to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is medium-length with lingering red fruit and herbal notes, complemented by fine tannins and bright acidity that refreshes the palate. The savory, earthy character persists beautifully, leaving an impression of elegance and terroir-driven complexity.","palate":"The palate shifts toward more savory, earthy territory with flavors of red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry interwoven with forest herbs, mushroom, and damp earth. The whole cluster fermentation creates a silky yet structured texture with fine-grained tannins that provide grip without heaviness. There's an elegant restraint and purity of fruit expression balanced by compelling savory elements including dried herbs, black tea, and a subtle stem spice that adds intrigue. The wine shows remarkable complexity and depth while maintaining a lighter body and ethereal quality."}

records.name: Hendry Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel 2022
records.description: Hendry's Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel showcases fruit from two distinct estate vineyard blocks planted decades apart - Block 7 in 1975 and Block 22 in 1995. Both blocks are planted to Clone 2, a virus-free clone originally sourced from Lodi through the Foundation Plant Services. The 2022 vintage benefits from Napa Valley's excellent growing conditions, producing a wine that wine critic Joe Czerwinski describes as medium to full-bodied, silky-textured and open. Aged for 15 months in French oak barrels (one-third new), this represents exceptional value for single-vineyard Napa Zinfandel.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The 2022 vintage presents an unexpected aromatic profile for Zinfandel, featuring floral notes, tea-like nuances, and even intriguing orange-like aromas alongside bold berry fruit. The nose shows remarkable complexity with layers of wild blackberry, raspberry, and dark cherry lifted by violet and dried rose petal. Only the slightest hint of raisined fruit appears - a testament to optimal picking decisions and the cooler aspects of the 2022 vintage. Subtle French oak contributes notes of vanilla and sweet spice without overwhelming the vibrant fruit character.","finish":"The finish is long and velvety, extending the berry fruit flavors with gentle tannins and persistent spice. Joe Czerwinski notes this is 'a fine Zin for drinking young' with a suggested drinking window through 2030. The wine closes with remarkable freshness for Zinfandel, showing subtle orange zest and tea notes alongside the fruit. At a reasonable price point, this represents some of the best value in single-vineyard Napa Zinfandel.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a silky texture that's both luxurious and approachable, the palate opens beautifully with layers of fresh berry fruit. The wine showcases Zinfandel's inherent exuberance while maintaining elegance and balance - black cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry flavors dance across the palate. The one-third new French oak integration is seamless, adding structure and subtle spice rather than overt wood flavors. There's a lovely tension between the wine's richness and its bright acidity, with the different vine ages from Blocks 7 and 22 contributing complexity and depth."}

records.name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Tempranillo
records.description: An expressive California interpretation of Spain's noble Tempranillo grape, crafted from Pomar Junction's estate vineyard in Paso Robles. The vineyard's soils with high water-holding capacity are ideally suited for Tempranillo, allowing for optimal water stress management that concentrates flavors while maintaining the variety's characteristic elegance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is expressive and inviting with aromas of red cherry, strawberry, and dried red fruit complemented by distinctive leather and tobacco notes. Hints of nutmeg, vanilla, and subtle clay minerality add complexity. As the wine opens, notes of dried herbs, rose petals, and a touch of cedar emerge, showcasing Tempranillo's classic aromatic profile.","finish":"A medium-length finish emphasizes the variety's characteristic leather and tobacco notes alongside persistent red fruit. The fine-grained tannins provide texture through the conclusion, while subtle oak influence adds vanilla and toast. The elegant, food-friendly style makes this highly versatile at the table.","palate":"The palate reveals bright red fruit flavors with dried black cherries taking the lead, supported by strawberry and red currant. Relatively lean and refined with fine-grained tannins that provide elegant structure without heaviness. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit, acidity, and tannin, with flavors of leather, earth, and subtle spice adding dimension. Notes of freshly brewed espresso and dark cocoa appear on the mid-palate."}

records.name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Zinfandel 2015
records.description: From Paso Robles' renowned Zinfandel territory comes this bold expression from Pomar Junction. The 2015 vintage showcases the region's ability to produce concentrated, powerful Zinfandels with layers of ripe fruit and spice, now showing the benefits of bottle maturity and integration.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with classic Paso Zinfandel character: jammy blackberry, raspberry preserves, and black cherry dominate with exuberant intensity. Layers of exotic spice emerge—black pepper, cinnamon, clove, and star anise—creating a warm, inviting profile. Oak aging contributes vanilla, caramel, and toasted oak, while background notes of dried herbs, tobacco, and chocolate add complexity. The wine's maturity shows in subtle dried fruit character and integrated alcohol.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful, with dark fruit and spice persisting impressively. Soft tannins provide gentle structure, while the wine's fruit concentration and oak integration create satisfying complexity. A touch of warmth lingers pleasantly alongside chocolate and coffee notes.","palate":"Bold and full-bodied on the palate, this Zinfandel delivers concentrated fruit wrapped in velvety tannins. Ripe blackberry jam, boysenberry, and black cherry flood the senses with sweet fruit intensity. The wine's generous alcohol (likely 14.5-15.5%) manifests as warmth rather than heat, balanced by surprising acidity that provides freshness. Mid-palate reveals layers of milk chocolate, espresso, sweet vanilla, and baking spices from oak, while hints of dried fig, raisin, and prune add evolved complexity. The texture is rich and mouth-filling."}

records.name: Pasquiers Sablet Blanc 2023
records.description: A distinctive white wine from the Sablet appellation in the southern Rhône Valley, showcasing the region's ability to produce vibrant, mineral-driven whites alongside its famous reds. This wine blends traditional Rhône white varietals to create a refreshing and food-friendly expression of Mediterranean terroir.
records.varietal: Blend of Grenache Blanc, Clairette, and Roussanne
records.region: Sablet, Côtes du Rhône Villages, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile reveals layers of complexity, opening with notes of ripe yellow plum, golden apple, and pear nectar. White flower aromatics including jasmine and chamomile add a delicate perfume, while hints of fennel seed and dried herbs speak to the wine's Provençal character. A distinctive minerality reminiscent of river stones and chalk dust provides a foundation, alongside subtle notes of blanched almonds and beeswax that suggest careful winemaking.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with moderate length, leaving impressions of citrus zest, white flowers, and stony minerality. A pleasant herbal note of fennel and anise persists, along with a subtle nuttiness that adds depth to the conclusion.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent texture, the wine coats the palate with flavors of stone fruit—particularly white peach and nectarine—complemented by citrus notes of grapefruit pith and lemon curd. The Mediterranean influence shows through in savory elements of thyme, rosemary, and a faint salinity that evokes coastal breezes. Well-integrated acidity provides structure and freshness, while a subtle roundness from the fruit ripeness prevents the wine from being overly austere. The palate reveals good concentration without heaviness, maintaining elegance throughout."}

records.name: Patrick Lambert Gourmandise Chinon 2021

records.name: Rivers Edge Barrell Select Pinot Noir 2018
records.description: River's Edge Winery, founded in 1998 in Oregon's Elkton AVA, specializes in exceptional Pinot Noir from their estate vineyards planted in 1972. The Barrel Select represents a careful selection of the finest barrels, showcasing the unique terroir of the Umpqua Valley's southern Oregon wine region.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir from estate vineyards planted in 1972
records.region: Elkton Oregon AVA, Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of black cherry and ripe strawberry, layered with notes of rich espresso, dark cocoa, and a hint of vanilla from quality oak aging. There's an inviting complexity showing dried rose petals, forest floor, and subtle baking spices including cinnamon and nutmeg. The maturity of the 2018 vintage adds additional depth with emerging notes of leather, tobacco, and dried herbs that complement the fruit beautifully.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent cherry and espresso notes, complemented by fine tannins and a subtle earthy quality. The wine's balance ensures it finishes clean and elegant, inviting another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent concentration, the palate delivers flavors of black cherry, espresso, and dark chocolate balanced by bright acidity and silky tannins. The barrel selection is evident in the wine's integration and polish, with seamless oak contributing structure and complexity without overwhelming the fruit. Layers of red and black cherry, raspberry, and plum mingle with savory notes of mushroom, earth, and a subtle smokiness. The wine shows the depth and character of older vines with concentrated flavors and excellent length."}

records.name: Phelps Creek Estate Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: An elegant estate Pinot Noir from Oregon's Columbia Gorge AVA, where cool maritime influences and diverse microclimates create ideal conditions for this noble variety. Phelps Creek's boutique, family-driven approach emphasizes quality over quantity, with 35 years of winemaking experience reflected in every vintage.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Seductive aromatics of ripe red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry lead, followed by subtle notes of forest floor, dried rose petals, and a whisper of violet. The cool-climate character is evident in bright red fruit expression and earthy complexity. Hints of cinnamon stick, clove, and vanilla from judicious oak aging add depth without overwhelming the delicate fruit. A touch of mushroom and wet earth contributes classic Pinot Noir complexity.","finish":"Long and graceful with persistent red fruit, subtle spice, and a gentle earthy minerality. The finish is refined and balanced, with delicate tannins and refreshing acidity that invite another sip. Notes of dried cherry and tea leaf linger, showcasing the wine's complexity and cool-climate pedigree.","palate":"Silky and refined with the variety's characteristic elegance, the palate showcases vibrant red raspberry and Bing cherry flavors interwoven with notes of rhubarb and pomegranate. Columbia Gorge's unique terroir contributes a mineral edge and bright acidity that lifts the fruit. Mid-weight body with fine-grained tannins and excellent balance between fruit concentration and structural finesse. Subtle oak spice and earthy mushroom notes add layers of complexity. The wine's purity and precision reflect estate fruit and careful winemaking."}

records.name: Pomar Junction Pomar Junction Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
records.description: A premium estate Cabernet Sauvignon from the El Pomar District AVA in Paso Robles, California. This limited-production wine showcases fruit from hillside vineyards with limestone shale rock soils, resulting in intense concentration and complexity. With only 164 cases produced, the 2017 vintage earned a prestigious Double Gold medal at the San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition, one of America's most respected wine competitions. Winemaker Jim Shumate crafted this wine with meticulous attention to detail, aging it 21 months with 35% new oak.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from estate hillside vineyards
records.region: El Pomar District AVA, Paso Robles, California - hillside vineyard with limestone shale soils
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is strikingly intense and complex, opening with profound aromas of dark fruit - ripe blackberry, cassis, and black cherry - that speak to the wine's hillside origins and limited yields. Layers of complexity emerge with aeration: dark chocolate, espresso, and mocha from the oak aging, alongside hints of tobacco leaf and cedar. Subtle floral notes of violet add elegance, while background hints of vanilla, baking spices, and a whisper of mint provide additional dimension. The aromatics are powerful yet refined, suggesting both concentration and balance.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and powerful, with dark fruit, chocolate, and oak spice persisting for a minute or more. Substantial tannins provide grip and structure, promising excellent aging potential. The wine's intensity carries through to the conclusion, yet remains balanced and harmonious. A subtle minerality emerges on the finish, reflecting the limestone shale terroir. The wine leaves a lasting impression of concentration, complexity, and careful craftsmanship.","palate":"The palate delivers remarkable intensity and structure befitting a premium Paso Robles Cabernet. Densely packed dark fruit flavors dominate - blackberry, black currant, and dark plum - showing the depth that comes from hillside fruit and restrained yields. The wine is full-bodied with substantial but refined tannins that provide impressive structure without harshness. Oak influence is evident but integrated, contributing notes of dark chocolate, coffee, and sweet vanilla that complement the fruit. The texture is rich and layered, with excellent mid-palate weight. Despite the wine's power, it maintains balance through well-integrated acidity and carefully managed oak."}

records.name: Abadia de Acon Targum 2015
records.description: Targum represents the icon wine from Abadía de Acón, one of the prestigious producers in Spain's Ribera del Duero region. Crafted from ancient Tempranillo vines over 70 years old, this wine embodies the power, elegance, and aging potential that defines world-class Ribera del Duero.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo (Tinta Fina) from 70+ year old vines
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is powerful and complex, revealing concentrated aromas of ripe black cherry, blackberry, and dark plum intermingled with notes of cedar, cigar box, and vanilla from extensive oak aging. The 2015 vintage shows beautiful maturity with emerging tertiary aromas of leather, tobacco, dried herbs, and a hint of truffle. There's an elegant spice character with notes of black pepper, clove, and sweet baking spices, while the old vine fruit contributes remarkable depth and concentration. Subtle floral notes of violet and dried rose petals add finesse.","finish":"The finish is extremely long and persistent with lingering dark fruit, espresso, and spice notes. Firm tannins provide backbone while maintaining elegance, and the wine's natural acidity keeps everything balanced through the extended finish. Hints of tobacco, leather, and dark chocolate linger beautifully, showcasing the wine's maturity and potential for further aging.","palate":"Full-bodied and magnificently structured, the palate showcases the power and elegance of old vine Tempranillo (Tinta Fina). Intense flavors of black cherry, cassis, and dark chocolate are complemented by layers of espresso, vanilla, and sweet oak spice from 18 months in French and American oak. The wine shows exceptional concentration and depth with flavors of blackberry compote, licorice, and dark cocoa, balanced by firm yet refined tannins that provide structure for extended aging. There's a beautiful complexity showing both fruit intensity and savory elements including earth, leather, and dried meat. The integration of fruit, oak, and tannin is seamless after bottle aging."}

records.name: Prima Pave Grand Cuvee NV
records.description: A non-vintage sparkling wine crafted in the traditional method, blending multiple vintages to achieve consistency and complexity. This Grand Cuvée represents the producer's house style, offering elegance, refinement, and the celebratory character that defines quality sparkling wine.
records.varietal: Likely Chardonnay and/or Pinot Noir blend
records.region: Region unknown; likely France or another traditional method region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with delicate notes of green apple, white peach, and citrus blossom, complemented by subtle yeasty complexity from extended lees aging. Hints of brioche, toasted almond, and a whisper of vanilla add depth, while fresh mineral notes reminiscent of chalk and wet stone provide terroir character. Delicate floral nuances of white flowers and honeysuckle appear with air, creating an inviting and sophisticated aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and lengthy, marked by lingering citrus, mineral notes, and a gentle saline quality. Fine bubbles persist, leaving the palate refreshed with echoes of toast and orchard fruit.","palate":"Medium-bodied with vibrant acidity and persistent, fine bubbles that create an elegant mousse. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and lemon zest dominate, balanced by creamy notes of brioche and pastry from autolytic aging. The mid-palate reveals touches of white cherry, almond, and subtle honey, while maintaining refreshing minerality throughout. The texture is simultaneously creamy and energetic, with the wine's dosage perfectly balanced to enhance fruit without adding sweetness."}

records.name: Priorat Trossos Abracadabra 2019
records.description: An exceptional white wine from the legendary Priorat region of Catalonia, crafted by Trossos del Priorat from organically farmed old vines of Grenache and Macabeo. This barrel-fermented white showcases the mineral intensity and complexity that Priorat's unique terroir can bring to white varieties, challenging preconceptions about this predominantly red wine region.
records.varietal: Grenache Blanc and Macabeo from old vines
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays great complexity and elegance with pronounced mineral and ash notes that speak to Priorat's distinctive terroir. Tropical fruit aromas of pineapple and guava mingle with citrus notes of lemon and lime, while ripe pear adds depth. Vanilla from barrel fermentation integrates seamlessly with subtle floral notes, creating a sophisticated aromatic profile.","finish":"Long and persistent with mineral notes, citrus zest, and gentle vanilla lingering elegantly. The finish showcases Priorat's unique character with its combination of intensity and finesse.","palate":"The palate is tasty, fresh, and smooth with impressive volume and texture. Layers of tropical fruit, citrus, and orchard fruits unfold, supported by the wine's distinctive mineral backbone. The barrel fermentation adds richness and complexity without overwhelming the fruit, while four months on lees contributes to the wine's silky mouthfeel. Fresh acidity maintains balance and vibrancy throughout."}

records.name: Shadowbox Carneros Pinot Noir 2014
records.description: Shadowbox Cellars produces small-lot, artisanal Pinot Noir from California's prestigious Carneros AVA, a cool-climate region straddling Napa and Sonoma counties. As a boutique producer with production runs of 150 cases or less, Shadowbox focuses on quality over quantity, sourcing from select vineyards in this fog-influenced region. The 2014 vintage represents a wine with significant bottle age, having developed the tertiary characteristics that make mature Pinot Noir so compelling. The Carneros region's maritime influence and clay-loam soils are ideal for producing elegant, structured Pinot Noir.
records.region: Carneros AVA, California (spanning Napa and Sonoma Counties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"After a decade of aging, the 2014 vintage presents evolved aromatics characteristic of mature Carneros Pinot Noir. The nose opens with complex notes of dried cherry, cranberry, and pomegranate, transitioning from primary fruit to more nuanced secondary and tertiary aromas. Forest floor, dried autumn leaves, and earthy mushroom notes - specifically white truffles and Hen of the Woods - add remarkable depth. Subtle baking spices including cinnamon and clove emerge, alongside hints of black tea and tobacco. The wine's development has integrated any oak influence into a seamless whole.","finish":"The finish is lingering and complex, with the wine's maturity evident in the persistent savory notes that accompany the fruit. Dried cherry and cranberry flavors extend alongside earthy, forest floor characteristics. The soft tannins and balanced acidity ensure a clean, elegant close with no harsh edges. This is a wine that has reached a beautiful drinking window, showing the rewards of patience with quality Carneros Pinot Noir.","palate":"On the palate, the wine is smooth and refined with a perfect medium body that showcases the elegance of both the region and the variety. Soft yet structural tannins provide framework without heaviness, allowing the evolved fruit flavors to shine. Red berry notes of cherry and raspberry persist alongside savory elements - dried herbs, soy, and umami characteristics that developed with age. The texture is silky and well-integrated, with balanced acidity maintaining freshness despite the wine's maturity. Traces of forest floor and earthy mushroom add complexity throughout the mid-palate."}

records.name: Queiron El Arca Single Vineyard 2020
records.description: A distinctive single vineyard expression from Spain's Queiron estate, showcasing terroir-driven winemaking. The 'El Arca' designation suggests a special parcel producing wine with unique character and complexity from focused vineyard management.
records.varietal: Likely Tempranillo or regional red blend
records.region: Spain (specific appellation undetermined, likely Castilla y León or similar)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is complex and layered, opening with ripe dark cherry and blackberry, followed by notes of Mediterranean herbs—rosemary and thyme. There's a distinctive mineral character suggesting slate or schist soils, along with hints of violets and black olive. Oak aging contributes subtle vanilla and sweet spice, while earthy notes of truffle and dried leaves add depth.","finish":"The finish is elegant and persistent, with fruit, earth, and spice notes intermingling. A distinctive saline quality emerges at the end, along with fine-grained tannins that provide subtle grip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with excellent concentration from the single vineyard fruit. The palate reveals flavors of red and black fruit—cherry, plum, and blackberry—alongside savory elements of cured meat, black pepper, and sun-dried tomato. The tannins are firm but well-integrated, providing structure without astringency. Bright acidity keeps the wine fresh and lively, while the mineral backbone adds length and complexity."}

records.name: Queiron Mi Lugar Blanco 2021
records.description: Queiron Mi Lugar Blanco 2021 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Pyren Vineyard Little Ra Ra Rouge 2022
records.description: A light-hearted and joyful expression from Pyren Vineyard in the Pyrenees region of Victoria, Australia. This playful wine sees minimal skin contact resulting in a lighter color, with a small amount of Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris added for aromatic lift. Bottled without fining or filtration, it represents a more experimental, fun approach to Australian Shiraz.
records.varietal: Shiraz with small additions of Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris for aromatics
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and inviting with fruitful aromas of firm nectarine and citrus pith that showcase the white grape additions. The nose is aromatic and lifted, displaying the perfumed quality from Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris influence. Light red fruit notes peek through, creating an unusual and intriguing aromatic profile that defies traditional Shiraz expectations. The overall impression is bright, fresh, and appealing.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with citrus pith and light red fruit persisting. The finish is crisp and lifted, enhanced by the natural acidity from the white grape additions, creating a wine that finishes bright and inviting rather than heavy or extracted.","palate":"Lithe and elegant with gentle red fruit character that reflects the brief skin contact. The palate is refreshing and light-bodied, focusing on freshness rather than extraction or weight. Nectarine and citrus notes from the white grape blend provide lift and aromatic complexity, while subtle Shiraz fruit offers a delicate red berry backbone. A small portion of firmly pressed Cabernet Franc juice adds structural support without heaviness. The wine is both appealing and food-friendly, designed to be served chilled for maximum refreshment."}

records.name: Priorat Trossos Pam de Nas 2019
records.description: A classic Priorat blend from Grenache and Carignan that showcases the region's distinctive mineral terroir. Aged 12 months in French barriques and refined 20 months in bottle, this wine earned 90/100 points for its composed elegance and characteristic schisty minerality.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals great aromatic expressiveness with complex layers of dark berry fruit, balsamic herbs, and Mediterranean spices. Mineral and herbaceous notes evoke the region's characteristic terroir - think thyme, rosemary, and the scent of sun-warmed slate. Subtle oak influence adds toasty undertones without masking the wine's inherent complexity. As it opens, fruity notes intensify while maintaining perfect balance with earthy, mineral elements.","finish":"Long, mineral-laden finish with persistent dark fruit, subtle spice, and a distinctive slate-like character. The tannins are mild and refined, allowing the wine's inherent elegance to shine through. The conclusion is fresh and inviting despite the wine's power and concentration.","palate":"Tight and intense on the palate with well-etched structure and remarkable focus. Dark, schisty black fruits dominate - blackberry, black cherry, and plum - with mineral undertones that speak to Priorat's unique llicorella (slate) soils. The wine is fleshy yet fresh, offering substantial volume and length without heaviness. Velvety tannins provide elegant structure rather than astringency, while balanced acidity keeps everything lifted and precise. Touches of toasted oak, chocolate, and spice add complexity to the mineral-driven fruit core."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 10 Year Port
records.description: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 10 Year Port is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Remhoogte Aspect Merlot 2018
records.description: An elegant expression of Stellenbosch Merlot from the renowned Remhoogte Estate, nestled on the foothills of Simonsberg mountain. The Aspect Merlot reflects the estate's minimalist philosophy of allowing the vineyards to express themselves through natural winemaking practices. With six years of age, this 2018 vintage showcases beautiful tertiary development while maintaining vibrant fruit character.
records.region: Simonsberg-Stellenbosch, South Africa - foothills of Simonsberg mountain with diverse terroir and ancient soils
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Complex and evolved aromatics reveal layers of dried plum, black fig, and cassis alongside intriguing savory elements of leather, forest floor, and cured tobacco. The influence of wild yeast fermentation adds subtle earthy complexity with hints of truffle and dried herbs. Delicate notes of cedarwood and pencil shavings emerge from the French oak aging, while the cool Atlantic winds that sweep through Stellenbosch contribute a distinctive mineral edge reminiscent of wet slate.","finish":"Long and elegant with persistent flavors of dark berries, mocha, and subtle spice. The minimal sulfite approach allows the pure fruit and terroir to shine through on the extended finish, leaving notes of graphite and dried rose petals that linger gracefully.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a silky, refined texture that speaks to the wine's maturity and the estate's gentle hand-sorting process. Flavors of black cherry preserves, blackberry compote, and dark chocolate dominate the front palate, evolving into more nuanced notes of coffee bean, star anise, and subtle baking spices. The ancient soils and steep slopes of Simonsberg impart a distinctive mineral backbone that runs through the wine like a thread. Well-integrated acidity provides freshness despite the wine's age, while the tannins have softened beautifully into a fine-grained, velvety structure."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 100 Year Port   500 ml
records.description: An extraordinary and exceedingly rare Tawny Port that represents a blend of two historic vintages: 1895 and 1927, resulting in a 106-year average age. This São Leonardo bottling by Quinta do Mourão is a masterpiece of Portuguese winemaking, achieving perfect scores from critics and offering an experience comparable to fine Cognac.
records.varietal: Traditional Port varieties from the Douro
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals the profound complexity of extreme age with aged and brewed molasses, buckwheat honey, and supple very old leather. Additional layers include varnish, pipe tobacco, cigar box, and steel-cut oatmeal alongside candied citrus. Polished mahogany aromatics emerge with mushroom, a touch of black tea, and dark chocolate. Coffee candy notes add sweetness to the remarkably preserved aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is extraordinarily long and complex, reminiscent of fine aged Cognac. The acidity fills the palate and provides exceptional balance, while the concentrated flavors of dried fruit, coffee, chocolate, and caramel linger seemingly indefinitely. This is a meditation wine that evolves continuously in the glass, revealing new dimensions with each sip.","palate":"Much of the aromatic complexity echoes on the palate, which has the texture of heated honey—rich, viscous, and coating. For all its aromatic maturity and surprising dark brown color, this Port has tremendous vigor on the palate with crisp acidity bringing exceptional balance and life. Flavors include fig, caramel, spice, dark chocolate, and cooked citrus fruit. The wine remains remarkably fresh despite its century-plus age."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao White 10 Year Port   500 ml
records.description: Quinta do Mourao White 10 Year Port   500 ml is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 30 Year Port
records.description: Quinta do Mourao's 30 Year Tawny Port represents the pinnacle of aged Port production, blending wines that have spent an average of three decades in wooden barrels. This extended barrel aging creates extraordinary complexity through controlled oxidation, resulting in a wine of remarkable depth, elegance, and concentration.
records.vintage: 30 Year Tawny (blend of multiple vintages averaging 30 years in barrel)
records.varietal: Traditional Port blend (Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatics are profoundly complex, revealing the hallmarks of extended barrel aging. The nose opens with intense nutty notes—roasted almonds, toasted hazelnuts, and walnut oil—intertwined with toffee, butterscotch, and crème brûlée. Dried fruit aromatics dominate—think fig, date, dried apricot, and raisins—alongside hints of orange marmalade and candied citrus peel. Subtle spices emerge with air: cinnamon, nutmeg, and a touch of clove. The oxidative character contributes notes of caramel, maple syrup, and aged Cognac.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long, extending well beyond a minute with waves of nutty, caramelized flavors. Toasted almonds, toffee, and dried fruit linger beautifully, accompanied by hints of coffee, dark chocolate, and sweet spices. The wine's acidity maintains freshness through the long fade, preventing any cloying sensation despite the richness. A subtle warmth and notes of aged wood and vanilla bean carry through to the very end.","palate":"Silky and luxurious on the palate, the wine delivers extraordinary richness balanced by surprising freshness. The sweetness is pronounced but never heavy, supported by vibrant acidity that keeps everything in harmony. Flavors mirror the nose with intensity—caramelized nuts, toffee, dried figs, and dates—enhanced by layers of butterscotch, vanilla, and dark honey. The mid-palate shows remarkable depth and complexity, with each sip revealing new nuances. Notes of orange peel, coffee, and dark chocolate add dimension. The texture is smooth and almost creamy, coating the palate with elegant persistence."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao White 20 Year Port   500 ml
records.description: Quinta do Mourao White 20 Year Port   500 ml is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Oliver Viticultors Nature Rose
records.description: A vibrant natural rosé from Oliver Viticultors, one of Spain's progressive wineries embracing minimal intervention winemaking. This Nature Rosé embodies the philosophy of letting the grapes speak for themselves, produced with indigenous yeasts and minimal sulfites. The wine captures the essence of Mediterranean viticulture with bright, pure fruit flavors and a refreshing mineral backbone.
records.varietal: Blend of traditional Spanish rosé varieties (likely Garnacha, Monastrell, or Tempranillo)
records.region: Spain - Mediterranean viticulture region with natural winemaking traditions
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with fresh wild strawberry, raspberry, and watermelon leading the way. The natural winemaking approach reveals additional layers of white peach, pink grapefruit zest, and delicate orange blossom. Subtle herbal notes of fresh basil and a hint of sea spray add complexity, while a mineral quality reminiscent of crushed limestone speaks to the Spanish terroir. There's an appealing purity and vibrancy to the aromatics that sets this apart from more manipulated rosés.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with a medium-length finish that leaves you wanting another sip. Persistent notes of strawberry and citrus fade gracefully, leaving a mineral-driven impression with hints of wet stone and a pleasant, slightly savory character typical of natural wines.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing with a medium-light body that feels lively and energetic on the palate. Bright flavors of red currant, cranberry, and pomegranate are accented by citrus notes of blood orange and Meyer lemon. The natural fermentation brings a subtle textural element and a touch of phenolic grip that adds interest without heaviness. Stone fruit flavors of white nectarine emerge in the mid-palate, along with a distinctive saline minerality. The acidity is vibrant and mouthwatering, perfectly balanced with the wine's delicate fruit concentration."}

records.name: Vieux Chateau Flouquet St Emilion 2019
records.description: A distinguished Saint-Émilion Grand Cru from Vignobles Garzaro, this Bordeaux blend showcases the classic elegance of Right Bank winemaking. Aged 14 months in French oak, it presents a harmonious expression of Merlot-dominant fruit with impressive depth and refinement.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense and expressive aromatics reveal layers of blackberry, blueberry, and ripe plum intertwined with red berry nuances. Cedar and warming spice notes emerge from the oak aging, while subtle hints of tobacco and earthy forest floor add complexity to the bouquet. The nose is bright and inviting, promising a wine of considerable character.","finish":"The conclusion is dry and extended, with lingering spicy hints that echo the aromatic profile. Refined tannins persist through the finish, suggesting good aging potential while remaining approachable in its youth.","palate":"Velvety texture defines the mid-palate, where rounded tannins and soft acidity create an elegant framework. Rich tones of black fruits and dark berries fill the mouth, supported by integrated oak influence that contributes vanilla and cedar undertones. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit concentration and structural elements, with a medium to full body that demonstrates classic Saint-Émilion finesse."}

records.name: Raywood Merlot 2019
records.description: Raywood's Merlot demonstrates the variety's ability to produce wines of depth and elegance when treated with care. This 2019 vintage showcases ripe fruit character balanced with structure, offering an accessible yet sophisticated expression that appeals to both casual drinkers and serious wine enthusiasts.
records.region: Unknown (likely California or Washington based on style)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents classic Merlot aromatics: ripe plum, black cherry, and blackberry form the core, while hints of raspberry add brighter red fruit notes. Oak aging contributes layers of vanilla bean, cedar, and sweet tobacco, while background notes of cocoa, coffee, and dried herbs add complexity. Subtle floral hints of violet and rose petal provide elegance, and a whisper of graphite suggests quality vineyard sourcing.","finish":"The finish is smooth and satisfying, with dark fruit and oak-derived spices lingering pleasantly. Soft, ripe tannins provide gentle structure without astringency, while the wine's fruit concentration ensures balance. Notes of chocolate and coffee echo subtly.","palate":"The palate is plush and inviting, with velvety tannins and generous fruit expression. Black cherry, plum, and boysenberry dominate, supported by hints of raspberry and cranberry that add brightness. The wine's medium to full body is balanced by fresh acidity that prevents heaviness, while integrated oak contributes vanilla, mocha, and toasted oak flavors. Mid-palate reveals layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet baking spices, while subtle earthy notes add savory complexity. The texture is silky and mouth-coating."}

records.name: Raywood Chardonnay 2024
records.description: Raywood Chardonnay 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.

records.name: Casa Dumetz Clementine Carter Mourvedre Santa Rita Hills 2023
records.description: An exceptional single-vineyard Mourvèdre from the cool-climate Santa Rita Hills, crafted by Casa Dumetz's thoughtful winemaking team. Named after Clementine Carter, this wine showcases the unique expression of Mourvèdre grown in one of California's most distinctive coastal appellations. The 2023 vintage captures the variety's characteristic wild, earthy personality while expressing the site's fog-influenced elegance and purity.
records.region: Santa Rita Hills AVA, California - cool-climate coastal appellation with significant marine influence and fog
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating and complex aromatics reveal wild blackberry, boysenberry, and dark red plum intertwined with distinctive savory elements that define great Mourvèdre. The nose shows pronounced game, cured meat, and black olive tapenade alongside aromatic herbs including lavender, dried thyme, and crushed peppercorn. Underlying notes of violets, black tea, and a hint of blood orange zest add nuance. The cool Santa Rita Hills climate contributes bright acidity that keeps the aromatics lifted and precise, with a subtle mineral quality like wet gravel and ocean breeze.","finish":"Long and intriguing with layers that continue to unfold. Savory notes of cured meat and olive tapenade persist alongside dark fruit, while hints of iron, graphite, and white pepper emerge. The finish is dry and refreshing with excellent acidity that cleanses the palate and invites food.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a fascinating tension between ripe fruit and savory complexity. Dark berry flavors of blackberry and black raspberry are complemented by more exotic notes of pomegranate molasses, dried fig, and black cherry. The mid-palate reveals the variety's characteristic meatiness with flavors of smoked bacon, leather, and earthy mushroom, balanced by bright acidity and coastal minerality. Tannins are firm but refined, with a slightly rustic edge that adds character without being aggressive. The cool-climate influence shows in the wine's freshness, precision, and elegant structure rather than overripe power."}

records.name: Raywood Merlot 2022
records.description: A smooth, approachable Merlot that showcases the varietal's classic velvety character and fruit-forward personality. This wine demonstrates Merlot's versatility and appeal, offering plush texture and ripe fruit flavors that make it an excellent choice for both casual enjoyment and food pairing. The 2022 vintage captures fresh, vibrant fruit with well-integrated oak influence.
records.varietal: Merlot (likely 85-100%), possibly with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon
records.region: California or Washington State (specific region not confirmed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inviting nose of ripe black and red fruits: juicy black cherry, plum, blackberry, and mulberry create a lush, fruit-forward bouquet. Subtle notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and vanilla from oak aging add richness and complexity. Hints of dried herbs, cola nut, and sweet tobacco provide additional layers, while a whisper of bay leaf and mint adds aromatic interest. The overall profile is approachable and generous.","finish":"Smooth, medium-length finish with lingering dark fruit, chocolate, and subtle oak spice. The tannins remain soft and integrated, creating a plush, satisfying conclusion. Notes of mocha and sweet vanilla persist on the aftertaste, with a hint of black tea adding final complexity.","palate":"Medium-bodied with the signature velvety, plush texture that Merlot is known for. Soft, supple tannins create an immediately accessible, smooth mouthfeel that coats the palate luxuriously. The wine delivers concentrated flavors of black plum, black cherry, and blackberry jam, complemented by notes of cocoa, coffee bean, and subtle baking spices from oak aging. Moderate acidity provides balance and freshness, preventing the wine from feeling heavy despite its richness. The alcohol is well-integrated, supporting the fruit without dominating. Secondary notes of fennel, leather, and dried oregano add complexity to the mid-palate."}

records.name: Raywood Moscato Keg 2021  20 l
records.description: A sweet and refreshing Moscato from California's Central Coast, produced by Castoro Cellars under the Raywood label. This approachable wine captures the essence of the Moscato grape with bright fruit flavors, floral aromatics, and a slight effervescence, offered in a convenient 20-liter keg format perfect for gatherings and events.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with intensely aromatic floral notes dominated by honeysuckle and orange blossom, immediately announcing the wine's Moscato character. Ripe strawberry and wild berry aromas mingle with fresh peach and lychee fruit, creating a perfumed and inviting bouquet. Hints of rose petals and jasmine add to the floral complexity, while a subtle muskiness characteristic of Muscat grapes provides depth. The aromatics are fresh, bright, and youthful, with a candy-like sweetness that's immediately appealing.","finish":"The finish is clean, mouth-watering, and slightly sweet, with lingering notes of strawberry and honeysuckle. The gentle carbonation provides a refreshing lift, while the wine's natural acidity keeps the palate fresh and ready for the next sip. The close is light and uncomplicated, perfect for easy drinking.","palate":"Bright, sweet, and wonderfully light on the palate, this Moscato delivers exactly what lovers of the style seek. The entry is fresh and fruity, with vibrant strawberry and ripe peach flavors taking center stage. Natural grape sweetness is balanced by enough acidity to prevent the wine from becoming cloying or thick—instead, it feels refreshing and lively. A slight effervescence from retained CO2 creates a gentle spritz on the tongue, lifting the fruit flavors and adding to the wine's overall freshness. The mouthfeel is smooth and easy, with low alcohol (12% ABV) contributing to the wine's highly drinkable character. Flavors of honeydew melon, white grape, and tropical fruit round out the palate."}

records.name: Castoro Cellars Merlot 2022
records.description: A classic Paso Robles Merlot from Castoro Cellars, the region's only 100% certified sustainable winery. Since 1983, this family-operated estate has been crafting exceptional wines from their sustainably farmed vineyards on both sides of the Paso Robles appellation. The 2022 vintage showcases the variety's signature approachability and plush fruit character, enhanced by Paso's warm days and cool nights.
records.varietal: 100% Merlot from certified sustainable estate vineyards
records.region: Paso Robles AVA, California - estate vineyards with sustainable and organic farming practices
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inviting and fruit-forward with ripe black cherry, plum jam, and blackberry preserves taking center stage. The warm Paso Robles climate expresses itself through generous dark fruit aromatics accented by vanilla, mocha, and sweet baking spices from oak aging. Underlying notes of dried sage, eucalyptus, and cocoa powder add complexity. A subtle hint of caramel and toasted hazelnut rounds out the bouquet, while the estate's sustainable farming practices contribute pure, clean fruit expression.","finish":"Smooth and lingering with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to chocolate, coffee, and subtle spice. Soft tannins and a touch of oak sweetness create a crowd-pleasing finish that's both satisfying and easy-drinking.","palate":"Full-bodied and lush with a supple, velvety texture that exemplifies why Merlot is beloved for its approachability. Rich flavors of black plum, cherry cola, and dark berry compote dominate, supported by notes of milk chocolate, espresso, and vanilla bean. The mid-palate shows excellent ripeness with hints of blueberry pie, while subtle savory elements of dried herbs and toasted oak add dimension. Well-integrated tannins provide structure without astringency, and balanced acidity prevents the wine from feeling heavy despite its generous fruit. The sustainable vineyard management shines through in the wine's purity and harmony."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Raywood Sauvignon Blanc Keg 2022  20 l
records.description: A fresh and vibrant Sauvignon Blanc from Raywood, associated with Castoro Cellars' quality winemaking. This keg format wine delivers bright citrus flavors and crisp mineral notes, perfect for high-volume service while maintaining the characteristic freshness of well-made Sauvignon Blanc.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals bright aromatics of wet stone and fresh lemon peel, immediately signaling the wine's mineral character. Subtle herbaceous notes reminiscent of freshly cut grass mingle with green apple and hints of gooseberry. A delicate floral note adds elegance to the bouquet, while the underlying minerality suggests cool-climate fruit.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of lemon zest and wet stone minerality. The wine leaves the palate vibrant and ready for food, with just enough weight to satisfy without heaviness.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows a soft yet structured texture with layers of citrus flesh - lemon, lime, and grapefruit - balanced by crisp green apple flavors. Grassy, herbaceous notes add complexity without overwhelming the fruit, while the wine's mineral backbone provides definition and length. The texture is refreshing and clean, with vibrant acidity that energizes the palate. Subtle tropical hints of passion fruit emerge on the mid-palate, adding dimension to the citrus-forward profile."}

records.name: Rioja Lar de Paula Crianza 2016
records.description: An expressive Rioja Crianza from Lar de Paula, showcasing the Tempranillo grape with traditional barrel aging. The Edición Limitada bottling represents the winery's commitment to quality and received an 89/100 critics score for the 2016 vintage.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark garnet in the glass, the bouquet opens with concentrated aromas of black plum and cassis, accented by a subtle tar undertone. Ripe blackberries mingle with delicious red fruit notes, while well-judged oak aging contributes hints of vanilla and cedar. A compelling nose that balances fruit concentration with classic Rioja complexity, including forest floor earthiness.","finish":"Soft and gentle conclusion where the flavors evaporate gracefully, leaving echoes of spice and fruit. The finish demonstrates the wine's accessibility while hinting at its aging potential.","palate":"Smooth and polished on entry, featuring feathery tannins that provide structure without aggression. The flavor profile unfolds with layers of black currant, purple fig, and toffee, complemented by notes of Valencia orange peel and dried Mediterranean herbs. Grippy tannins add grip mid-palate, while nuanced flavors of maraschino cherry and leather emerge. The wine is balanced, fruity, fresh and intense, showing the hallmarks of quality Tempranillo."}

records.name: Remhoogte Free to be Red Carbonic Syrah 2022
records.description: A vibrant carbonic maceration Syrah from Stellenbosch's Remhoogte Estate, where vineyards cascade down the Simonsberg mountain foothills. This whole-cluster fermented red showcases the playful, fruit-forward style that carbonic maceration brings to Syrah while maintaining the variety's characteristic spice and structure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant aromas of fresh crushed raspberries and wild strawberries leap from the glass, characteristic of the carbonic maceration technique. Beneath the bright red fruit lies a complex layer of violet petals, cracked black pepper, and a hint of graphite minerality from the estate's ancient granite soils. Subtle notes of cured meat and garrigue herbs add savory intrigue.","finish":"The finish is pure and refreshing, with lingering red fruit character and a peppery spice kick that's quintessentially Syrah. The carbonic technique ensures the tannins remain soft and approachable, making this wine immediately enjoyable while the underlying structure suggests it can evolve for 3-5 years.","palate":"The palate is wonderfully juicy and vibrant, with the carbonic process lending a distinctive bubblegum quality alongside ripe cherry and pomegranate flavors. Medium-bodied with silky tannins that provide structure without heaviness, the wine maintains excellent freshness thanks to Stellenbosch's Atlantic Ocean influence. Mid-palate notes of black olive tapenade and dried thyme emerge, balanced by bright acidity that keeps the wine energetic and food-friendly."}

records.name: Remhoogte Sir Thomas Cullinan 2019
records.description: Named after the famous diamond magnate, this South African Bordeaux-style blend from Remhoogte Estate represents the winery's flagship offering. The 2019 vintage showcases the excellent growing conditions of Stellenbosch with concentrated fruit and structured elegance.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is immediately impressive with layers of cassis, blackcurrant, and ripe plum, interwoven with cedar, cigar box, and graphite notes. Nuances of violet and lavender add floral complexity, while hints of dark chocolate and espresso reflect judicious oak integration. The wine shows the hallmark elegance of Stellenbosch's best red blends.","finish":"The finish extends beautifully with persistent dark fruit, savory herbs, and a mineral edge that speaks to the granite soils of Stellenbosch. Fine tannins provide grip and suggest excellent aging potential.","palate":"Rich and structured on the palate, this wine delivers flavors of black cherry, mulberry, and blackberry preserve, framed by well-judged oak that contributes vanilla, mocha, and sweet spice notes. The tannins are firm yet refined, providing excellent structure without overwhelming the concentrated fruit. Bright acidity lifts the wine and ensures balance, while the texture is both powerful and polished."}

records.name: Remhoogte Vantage Pinotage 2021
records.description: Remhoogte Vantage Pinotage 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Ribera del Duero Abadia de Acon Joven 2019
records.description: A vibrant young red wine from the esteemed Abadía de Acón estate in Spain's Ribera del Duero region. This Joven (young) expression showcases pure Tempranillo fruit with minimal oak influence, emphasizing the fresh berry character and natural vibrancy of the 2019 vintage. The wine represents excellent value, offering approachable drinking while maintaining the quality and character expected from this renowned appellation.
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with youthful exuberance, displaying intense aromas of ripe red and black berries, particularly raspberry and blackcurrant. Fresh fruit dominates the aromatic profile, with appealing notes of concentrated ripe fruit accompanied by subtle chocolate and liquorice undertones. Delicate hints of mint and Mediterranean herbs add complexity without overwhelming the primary fruit character. The aromatic intensity is well-balanced, inviting you to explore the wine's layers while maintaining a sense of freshness and accessibility.","finish":"The finish is elegant and medium in length, with the fruit flavors gradually giving way to subtle spice and mineral notes. The tannins are refined and integrated, providing structure without astringency. A slight echo of chocolate and berry fruit lingers pleasantly, encouraging food pairing and making this an excellent choice for casual dining or as an introduction to the Ribera del Duero style.","palate":"Soft and plump on the palate, this Joven delivers plenty of juicy fruit character with harmonious integration. The structure is approachable yet serious, with attractive notes of ripe red and black berries forming the core of the flavor profile. Chocolate and cocoa notes provide depth without dominating, while the delicate vein of acidity keeps the wine lively and balanced. The texture is velvety despite the wine's youth, demonstrating quality winemaking and excellent fruit selection. This is intense and very well-balanced, offering immediate drinking pleasure while hinting at the potential complexity of the estate's aged expressions."}

records.name: Rioja Lar de Paula Rose 2020
records.description: Rioja Lar de Paula Rose 2020 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Remhoogte Vantage Pinotage 2022
records.description: A refined and elegant expression of South Africa's signature grape variety, the Vantage Pinotage comes from 2 hectares of bush vines planted high on a granitic ridge in Stellenbosch. Spending 24 months in oak, this wine demonstrates Remhoogte's mastery of Pinotage, balancing power with delicacy and earning impressive accolades including 93 points from Tim Atkin and 4.5 stars from Platter's Wine Guide.
records.region: Simonsberg-Stellenbosch, South Africa (granitic ridge, high-altitude bush vines)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Ruby red in color, the nose is driven by concentrated flavors and aromas of fresh raspberry and ripe red fruits, elegantly complemented by delicate floral notes of violet that add refinement. A natural earthy depth emerges, speaking to the granitic terroir and high-altitude vineyard site, while subtle oak influence contributes additional complexity without dominating the primary fruit and floral character.","finish":"The finish is long and lightly savory, with the earthy and peppery notes becoming more prominent as the fruit gradually fades. The finish showcases the wine's complexity and terroir expression, with the granitic minerality adding a distinctive final dimension that lingers pleasantly.","palate":"Full-bodied and bold yet remarkably refined, the palate showcases intensely concentrated flavors of black currant, dark cherry, and ripe raspberry. A distinctive note of cracked black pepper adds spice and complexity, while the wine's natural earthiness provides grounding and depth. The 24-month oak aging has contributed to the wine's powerful yet delicate profile, with the tannins beautifully integrated and the structure providing excellent backbone. Despite its intensity, the wine maintains elegance and balance throughout."}
