records.name: Priorat Trossos Lo Petit de la Casa 2023
records.description: An organic red wine from Spain's prestigious Priorat region, crafted by Trossos del Priorat from organically grown grapes certified by the Catalan Council of Ecological Agricultural Production. Grown on distinctive slate soils, this wine undergoes extended maceration and aging in French oak, followed by 10 months bottle aging before release.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Notes of blackberry and raspberry bramble dominate the nose, accompanied by freshly turned soil and savory herbs that speak to the wine's organic farming and earthy terroir. Ripe black fruit mingles with sweet black spices, forest herbs, and a whisper of incense. The aromatic complexity reveals the wine's careful vinification and terroir expression from Priorat's famous licorella soils.","finish":"Juicy and fresh, the finish leaves a lasting impression with lingering berry fruit and herbal notes. The wine concludes with energy and vibrancy, recommended for enjoyment over the next 2-3 years to capture its youthful exuberance.","palate":"The entry is fresh and inviting, leading to a good and intense path filled with juicy fruity notes. The wine shows concentrated dark fruit character with mature, elegant, and fine tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Supple tannins frame the ripe fruit, while the slate soil influence adds a distinctive mineral backbone. The palate balances fruit intensity with earthy complexity and spice."}

records.name: Rioja Alta Ermita de San Felices Reserva 2009
records.description: From Bodegas Santalba in Rioja Alta, this traditional Reserva showcases the elegance and aging potential of Spain's premier wine region. The 2009 vintage benefits from extended aging in American oak barrels followed by bottle maturation, resulting in a wine that balances ripe fruit with complex tertiary notes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals intense bright cherry-red characteristics with evolving tawny hints that signal maturity. Ripe red fruit aromas are beautifully layered with vanilla, toasted oak, and warm baking spices. Subtle notes of dried tobacco leaf and leather add complexity, while hints of toasted bread and sweet spice round out the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and pleasurable, with a powerful backtaste that lingers. Notes of sweet vanilla, cedar, and dried fruit persist, accompanied by fine-grained tannins that provide structure without astringency. The wine's balanced acidity keeps the finish clean and inviting.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with excellent balance between fruit and oak influence. The palate showcases concentrated ripe fruit flavors supported by well-integrated tannins and refreshing acidity. Savory elements emerge mid-palate, adding depth and complexity. The 18 months in American oak barrels have contributed structure without overwhelming the wine's core fruit character."}

records.name: Skylark Red Belly 2018
records.description: A distinctive California red blend from Skylark, showcasing the complexity and character that comes from thoughtful blending of premium varieties. The "Red Belly" name suggests a playful, approachable wine with serious winemaking behind it. With six years of bottle age, this 2018 vintage has developed intriguing tertiary characteristics while maintaining vibrant fruit, offering excellent drinking now.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Rhône or Bordeaux varieties such as Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre, or Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot)
records.region: California - premium wine region with ideal growing conditions for red varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Enticing and evolved aromatics reveal a complex tapestry of red and dark fruits. Primary notes of black cherry, raspberry, and wild strawberry mingle with more developed characteristics of dried cranberry, fig, and black plum. The bouquet shows beautiful evolution with aromas of leather-bound books, cedar cigar box, and dried rose petals alongside hints of vanilla, sweet pipe tobacco, and sandalwood from oak aging. Subtle herbal notes of sage, bay leaf, and dried oregano add complexity, while underlying earthy elements of mushroom and forest floor speak to the wine's maturity.","finish":"Long and satisfying with a harmonious blend of fruit, earth, and spice. The finish shows mature tannins, persistent dark fruit flavors, and lingering notes of chocolate, coffee, and cedar that fade gracefully. A touch of savory umami and dried herb complexity adds interest to the extended conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a silky, well-integrated structure that demonstrates excellent aging. The palate opens with flavors of black cherry preserves, raspberry coulis, and blackberry compote, evolving into more complex notes of dried fruit, dark chocolate, and espresso. Mid-palate development reveals layers of leather, tobacco leaf, and spice box, balanced by supple tannins that have softened beautifully over six years. The wine shows depth and concentration without heaviness, with integrated acidity providing freshness and lift. Subtle notes of cola, vanilla bean, and toasted oak add dimension to the persistent fruit core."}

records.name: Rippa Dorii Crianza 2021
records.description: Rippa Dorii Crianza 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Rioja Lar de Paula Madurado 2020
records.description: An elegant Spanish red from Rioja, this Madurado showcases traditional barrel aging that imparts complexity and finesse. Crafted primarily from Tempranillo, this wine demonstrates the classic Rioja style with extended maturation developing rich, layered flavors and smooth tannins.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with possible Garnacha and Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with a compelling bouquet of ripe black cherry and dried plum, interwoven with notes of vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging. Subtle hints of leather, tobacco leaf, and sweet baking spices add depth and complexity. As the wine breathes, earthy undertones of forest floor and dried herbs emerge, characteristic of well-aged Rioja.","finish":"Long and satisfying, with lingering notes of dark fruit, vanilla, and subtle earthy minerality. The finish is smooth and refined, with gentle tannins and a touch of sweet spice that invites another sip. A hint of tobacco and leather persists on the aftertaste.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with silky, integrated tannins that speak to careful maturation. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of dark cherry, blackberry, and plum preserves, balanced by bright acidity that keeps the wine fresh and lively. Oak influence presents as notes of cocoa, mocha, and sweet spice, while savory elements of dried herbs and mineral undertones add complexity. The wine's structure is elegant rather than heavy, with well-balanced alcohol supporting the fruit."}

records.name: Rippa Dorii Roble 2022
records.description: Rippa Dorii Roble 2022 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Rivers Edge Elkton Cuvee Pinot Noir 2020
records.description: From the distinctive Elkton AVA in Oregon's Umpqua Valley, this Pinot Noir is sourced entirely from Rivers Edge's estate vineyards established in 2000. The winery's commitment to environmental sustainability and hyperlocal production results in wines that authentically express the unique terroir of this cooler Oregon region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Elegant and expressive, the bouquet offers classic Oregon Pinot Noir character with aromas of bright red cherry, raspberry, and strawberry preserves. Floral notes of rose petal and hibiscus add aromatic lift, while underlying earth tones of mushroom, wet forest floor, and subtle cedar provide complexity. Hints of cola, cinnamon stick, and dried cranberry add further intrigue to this multifaceted aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and graceful, with lingering red fruit and earthy notes that slowly fade into hints of orange peel and black tea. Refined tannins and bright acidity maintain freshness through the conclusion, leaving the palate cleansed and satisfied.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky texture, the palate delivers pure red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and red currant, framed by fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. The mid-palate shows excellent balance and depth, with savory elements of black tea, dried herbs, and earthy mushroom complementing the bright fruit core. Subtle oak influence adds structure and spice without masking the wine's transparent expression of terroir. The wine's precision and elegance reflect cool-climate Pinot at its finest."}

records.name: Rock Ferry 3rd Rock Pinot Gris 2021
records.description: From Central Otago, New Zealand's southernmost wine region, this Pinot Gris showcases the area's distinctive cool-climate character and crystalline purity. The 3rd Rock designation reflects the vineyard's unique schist soils and elevated position.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is expressive and pure, offering aromas of ripe pear, white peach, and nectarine, layered with subtle notes of jasmine and honeysuckle. A distinctive mineral quality suggests the schist soils of Central Otago, while hints of ginger and white pepper add intrigue. The cool-climate origins are evident in the wine's bright, focused aromatics.","finish":"The finish is refreshing and persistent, with stone fruit flavors lingering alongside bright acidity and a distinct mineral edge. A subtle phenolic grip adds complexity and food-friendliness.","palate":"On the palate, this Pinot Gris shows excellent concentration with flavors of stone fruits, particularly apricot and yellow plum, balanced by crisp acidity that provides structure and length. The texture is fuller than many Pinot Grigios, with a subtle oily richness typical of quality Pinot Gris. Subtle spice notes of cardamom and white pepper emerge mid-palate, while the mineral character persists throughout."}

records.name: Roebuck Estates Blanc de Noir 2018
records.description: A South African Blanc de Noir showcasing the elegant potential of black grapes vinified as white wine. This sophisticated sparkling or still wine demonstrates restrained fruit character with mineral complexity, reflecting careful winemaking and quality vineyard sources.
records.varietal: Pinot Noir or Pinotage (Blanc de Noir method)
records.region: South Africa (likely Stellenbosch or Western Cape)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate aromas of wild strawberry and raspberry provide a subtle fruit foundation, while floral notes of white rose petals add elegance. The bouquet reveals hints of brioche and almond, suggesting possible lees aging, with underlying mineral notes of crushed stone. A touch of citrus zest brightens the overall aromatic impression.","finish":"The finish is clean and dry with persistent mineral notes and lingering red fruit echoes. Fine acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while subtle nutty undertones from potential aging add complexity that extends the conclusion pleasantly.","palate":"The palate shows refined red berry fruit flavors including strawberry and cranberry, balanced by crisp acidity that provides structure and freshness. Light-bodied yet complex, the wine displays subtle creamy texture with hints of citrus pith and wet stone minerality. The fruit expression remains delicate rather than powerful, emphasizing finesse and elegance over concentration."}

records.name: Rock Ferry Pinot Blanc Brut 2020
records.description: An innovative traditional method sparkling wine from New Zealand's Rock Ferry winery, representing a first for the country. Made from certified organic Pinot Blanc grapes from the Orchard Vineyard in the South Island, this wine combines French Champagne tradition with New Zealand's distinctive terroir and fruit-forward character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Enticing aromas of freshly baked apple tarte tatin dominate the nose, revealing the wine's autolysis complexity from 12 months of lees aging. Poached nashi pear and baked apple notes showcase the generous fruit character, while subtle nutty aromas from yeast contact add savory dimension. Delicate hints of brioche, almond, and citrus blossom contribute to the wine's aromatic elegance. The balance between autolysis complexity and fresh fruit expression creates an inviting and sophisticated aromatic profile.","finish":"Clean and persistent finish with lingering apple and pear flavors complemented by subtle toasty notes. The wine concludes with refreshing acidity and a touch of minerality, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for food or another sip. The fine bubbles persist through the finish, adding to the wine's overall elegance.","palate":"Brightly fruited yet dry, the palate offers excellent balance between freshness and complexity. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and citrus provide the fruit core, while savory, nutty notes from the traditional method production add depth and interest. The wine maintains refreshing acidity that keeps it lively and food-friendly, with fine, persistent bubbles creating a creamy mousse. The mouthfeel is elegant rather than heavy, showcasing the wine's organic farming purity and careful winemaking. Minimal dosage allows the wine's natural character to shine through."}

records.name: Rueda Reina de Castilla Sauvignon Blanc 2015  1.5 l
records.description: This magnum format Sauvignon Blanc from the esteemed Rueda region showcases the unique terroir of Spain's premier white wine appellation. The 2015 vintage, now approaching a decade of age, offers a fascinating perspective on how well-made Rueda Sauvignon Blanc can develop complexity and richness while maintaining its characteristic freshness.
records.varietal: 100% Sauvignon Blanc from the Rueda region's high-altitude, limestone-rich vineyards
records.region: Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents an intriguing evolution from typical young Sauvignon Blanc, showing honeyed white peach, dried apricot, and candied citrus peel alongside more developed notes of lanolin and wet stone. Fresh herbal elements of lemon verbena and white pepper mingle with subtle nutty oxidative notes that add depth without diminishing vitality. The continental climate influence is evident in the wine's aromatic intensity and mineral precision.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with vibrant citrus acidity cutting through the wine's riper fruit character and leaving a refreshing impression of lime zest and crushed chalk. The magnum aging has allowed for slow, graceful development, resulting in a wine that balances maturity with surprising freshness.","palate":"The palate delivers surprising weight and texture for Sauvignon Blanc, with flavors of ripe Anjou pear, yellow apple, and Meyer lemon curd balanced by Rueda's signature chalky minerality and refreshing acidity. The wine shows excellent phenolic maturity with a slightly waxy, lanolin-like texture that speaks to the 2015 vintage's warmth and the extended aging in magnum format. Subtle notes of toasted almond and dried flowers add complexity to the citrus-driven core."}

records.description: Saddleback Vermentino 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Saddleback NV Chardonnay 2018
records.description: Saddleback Cellars, a respected Napa Valley producer, crafts this Chardonnay from estate fruit in the Oak Knoll District. The 2018 vintage represents classic California Chardonnay with restrained oak influence, allowing the pure fruit character to shine. This wine demonstrates the winery's commitment to balance and elegance over power.
records.region: Oak Knoll District, Napa Valley, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a harmonious blend of tropical and stone fruit aromas, featuring ripe pineapple, yellow peach, and Asian pear. Nuanced notes of honeysuckle, vanilla bean, and toasted oak provide complexity without dominating the fruit expression. Subtle hints of lemon zest and wet stone add freshness and minerality. The aromatics suggest both ripeness and restraint, characteristic of well-made Napa Chardonnay.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus, toasted oak, and subtle spice. Bright acidity ensures freshness through the conclusion, while the wine's textural richness provides satisfying length. The 2018 vintage's maturity is evident in the seamless integration of all components.","palate":"The palate reveals generous flavors of ripe Fuji apple, poached pear, and Meyer lemon, supported by creamy texture from partial malolactic fermentation and oak aging. The wine displays medium to full body with well-integrated acidity that provides structure and length. Notes of butterscotch, hazelnut, and light tropical fruit create layers of flavor, while the underlying minerality keeps the wine from feeling heavy. The mouthfeel is silky and refined, with excellent balance between fruit richness and structural elements."}

records.name: Domaine du Joncier L'O de Joncier 2020
records.description: A vibrant, biodynamic Grenache from the esteemed Domaine du Joncier in Côtes du Rhône, crafted by winemaker Marine Roussel. This certified organic expression represents pure, accessible Grenache meant for immediate enjoyment rather than extended cellaring.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Powerful aromatics burst from the glass with concentrated red and black fruits. Cherry and raspberry dominate, enhanced by delicate spice notes and a whisper of minerality. The nose is inviting and fruit-forward, with subtle hints of garrigue herbs that speak to its Southern Rhône origins.","finish":"Lingering flavors of black pepper and minerality extend the conclusion, with the wine's clean, biodynamic character shining through. The finish is pure and refreshing, encouraging another sip.","palate":"A fine and greedy juice unfolds with fruity notes that are delicately spiced throughout. Cherry and raspberry flavors continue from the nose, joined by black pepper and intriguing mineral undertones. The wine is juicy and approachable, treated gently during winemaking for minimal extraction, resulting in reasonable alcohol and spice-tinged fruit. Best served slightly chilled to emphasize its refreshing character."}

records.name: Scarpetta Pinot Grigio DOC Friuli (NOVA only) 2022
records.description: Scarpetta Pinot Grigio DOC Friuli (NOVA only) 2022 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Scarpetta Timido Brut Rose (NOVA only) NV
records.description: Scarpetta's Timido Brut Rosé is an elegant Italian sparkling wine crafted in the traditional Charmat method, showcasing vibrant red berry fruit and delicate floral notes. This non-vintage sparkler offers a refined balance of freshness and complexity, making it an excellent choice for celebrations or as an aperitif. The wine displays the characteristic finesse of quality Italian rosé spumante with a playful, approachable character.
records.varietal: Primarily Glera and Pinot Noir blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of fresh strawberries, wild raspberries, and delicate rose petals. Subtle hints of white peach and citrus blossom add complexity, while a touch of brioche and almond from the lees contact provides depth. The aromatic profile is clean, bright, and inviting, with a distinctive Italian elegance that sets it apart from heavier rosé sparklers.","finish":"The finish is crisp and refreshing, with lingering notes of citrus zest and red berries. A subtle mineral quality and gentle effervescence persist, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next sip. The wine concludes with remarkable purity and length for a sparkling rosé at this price point.","palate":"On the palate, this brut rosé displays vibrant acidity and fine, persistent bubbles that create a creamy mousse texture. Flavors of red currant, cranberry, and pink grapefruit dominate, supported by subtle notes of white cherry and melon. The wine maintains excellent balance between its fruit-forward character and refreshing mineral backbone, with just a hint of sweetness that never overwhelms the crisp, clean profile. The medium body and elegant structure make it exceptionally food-friendly."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Scenic Valley Farms Chardonnay 2024
records.description: A velvety and rich Oregon Chardonnay from Scenic Valley Farms in the Willamette Valley, this wine showcases the estate's commitment to expressing terroir through minimal intervention winemaking. With elegant use of Oregon oak, the wine balances richness with freshness, creating a distinctive Pacific Northwest expression of this classic variety.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is enticing and aromatic, featuring notes of coconut and ripe peach that signal the wine's richness and oak influence. Underlying aromas of fresh pear and green apple add brightness and complexity, while subtle hints of vanilla from the Oregon oak provide warmth without overwhelming the delicate fruit character that defines Willamette Valley Chardonnay.","finish":"The finish is clean and satisfying, with the peach and pear flavors lingering alongside subtle vanilla and toasted oak notes. The wine's soft mouthfeel persists, creating a rounded, generous conclusion that exemplifies the approachable, fruit-forward style of Oregon Chardonnay.","palate":"Velvety and rich in texture, the palate offers a soft, seductive mouthfeel that is both fleshy and succulent. Fresh flavors of ripe peaches and juicy pears dominate, their natural sweetness balanced by the wine's creamy texture from lees contact and malolactic fermentation. A hint of vanilla from the oak aging adds complexity and depth, while the wine maintains excellent balance between richness and freshness, never becoming heavy or over-oaked."}

records.name: Taste Rose Keg NV  20000 ml
records.description: Taste Rosé in keg format offers a practical and sustainable solution for events, restaurants, and gatherings where quality rosé is needed in volume. The keg format maintains freshness through minimized oxygen exposure while providing convenience and reducing packaging waste.
records.varietal: Rosé blend (likely Grenache, Syrah, or similar varietals)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and fruity, the nose presents bright red berry aromatics—raspberry, strawberry, and redcurrant—alongside subtle floral notes of rose and violet. Citrus elements of pink grapefruit and lemon zest add brightness and lift. A clean, crisp character dominates with no off-notes, showing the benefits of the keg format's oxygen protection. Hints of white peach and melon add subtle complexity.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering red berry and citrus notes. The acidity maintains presence through the finish, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip. Subtle mineral and floral notes persist, adding elegance to this crowd-pleasing style.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with a refreshing, crisp texture that makes this rosé highly drinkable and versatile. The fruit flavors are fresh and vibrant—wild strawberry, watermelon, and cherry—supported by bright acidity that keeps everything lively. A touch of citrus—grapefruit and lime—adds zing without creating harshness. The wine shows good balance between fruit, acidity, and a whisper of residual sweetness that doesn't make it sweet but adds roundness. The mouthfeel is clean and slightly mineral, with a delicate structure that works well as an aperitif or with food."}

records.name: Heron Hill Eclipse Red 2021
records.description: A Bordeaux-style blend from Finger Lakes' Heron Hill Winery, the Eclipse Red represents the estate's commitment to crafting elegant, food-friendly reds. This blend showcases the potential of classic Bordeaux varieties in New York's cool-climate conditions.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc (Bordeaux Blend)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Medium to full intensity on the nose with concentrated black and red fruit aromas. Blackberry and cassis lead, supported by bright raspberry notes. Herbal mint tones add complexity and freshness, while slight cedar notes from oak aging provide structure. Berry and dark fruit characteristics dominate, with subtle nutmeg spice adding warmth.","finish":"Extended conclusion with persistent dark fruit and subtle spice. The refined tannins continue through the finish, leaving a polished impression that demonstrates the wine's elegance.","palate":"Medium body with a refreshing acidity that provides energy and lift throughout. The wine features refined, silky tannins that contribute structure without overwhelming the fruit. Black currant, cherry, and jammy berry flavors fill the mid-palate, creating a fruit-forward but balanced impression. The texture is smooth and approachable, with excellent integration between fruit, acid, and tannin components. Great length speaks to the wine's quality and careful blending."}

records.name: Shabo Grande Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
records.description: A flagship expression from Ukraine's historic Shabo estate, representing 200 years of winemaking heritage in the Odessa region. This Grande Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon showcases the potential of Ukraine's Black Sea coastal climate to produce structured, age-worthy wines from international varieties. The 2023 vintage captures the variety's classic character while expressing the unique terroir of the region's continental climate and limestone-rich soils.
records.region: Odessa, Ukraine - Black Sea coastal region with continental climate, warm summers, and limestone-rich soils
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic and compelling aromatics of Cabernet Sauvignon with pronounced blackcurrant, cassis, and black cherry forming the core. The nose reveals additional layers of dark plum, blueberry, and blackberry alongside distinctive varietal notes of green bell pepper (pyrazine), eucalyptus, and mint that add complexity without dominating. The Grande Reserve oak treatment contributes aromas of vanilla bean, cedar chest, and tobacco leaf, while the Odessa terroir adds subtle mineral nuances of graphite and wet gravel. With aeration, notes of violet, dark chocolate, and a hint of coffee bean emerge alongside the Black Sea influence of subtle saline minerality.","finish":"Long and structured with persistent dark fruit flavors, firm tannins, and lingering notes of cedar, graphite, and dark chocolate. The finish shows the wine's youth with grippy tannins that will soften with age, leaving impressions of cassis, espresso, and subtle spice that invite cellaring.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured with firm, youthful tannins that promise excellent aging potential. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, black cherry, and cassis with additional notes of dark plum, mulberry, and boysenberry. Mid-palate depth reveals layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and black olive alongside the variety's characteristic herbal elements of dried sage and tobacco. Well-integrated oak contributes vanilla, cedar, and sweet spice notes of cinnamon and clove without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows excellent balance between ripe fruit concentration, structured tannins, and refreshing acidity that provides lift and aging potential. Subtle mineral notes and a hint of leather add complexity to this young, powerful Cabernet."}

records.name: Shabo Sparkling Primo Secco Semi Sweet White NV
records.description: Shabo Sparkling Primo Secco Semi Sweet White NV is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.

records.name: Serra de Estrela Albarino (DC / MD Only) 2023
records.description: A crisp and aromatic Albariño showcasing the bright, mineral-driven character of Portugal's Vinho Verde region or Spain's Rías Baixas. This wine captures the essence of Atlantic-influenced viticulture with vibrant acidity, citrus-driven flavors, and the refreshing quality that has made Albariño one of the world's most sought-after white varietals.
records.region: Likely Rías Baixas, Spain or Vinho Verde region, Portugal
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and expressive aromatics feature white peach, green apple, and Meyer lemon, complemented by delicate notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and fresh lime zest. The nose reveals characteristic Albariño markers including nectarine, apricot, and a subtle salinity that hints at coastal origins. Underlying mineral notes of wet granite and crushed seashells add complexity and regional typicity. Light herbal accents of lemon verbena and chamomile provide additional aromatic interest.","finish":"The finish is clean, refreshing, and moderately long, with citrus, mineral, and saline notes persisting gracefully. A touch of white pepper and a stony quality linger, leaving the palate invigorated and ready for food.","palate":"The palate is crisp, vibrant, and medium-bodied with exceptional freshness. Flavors of tart green apple, white grapefruit, and stone fruit are enhanced by pronounced acidity that keeps the wine lively and energetic. A distinctive mineral backbone runs through the mid-palate, showing characteristic granite-driven salinity and a slight phenolic grip that adds texture. Citrus zest and peach skin notes contribute subtle bitterness that balances the fruit, while the overall impression is one of purity, brightness, and coastal freshness."}

records.name: Harmino Moscato Rose  Mevushal NV
records.description: A delightful and approachable kosher Moscato Rosé from Harmino, crafted according to Mevushal standards making it suitable for all kosher occasions. This slightly sweet, aromatic wine combines the floral, fruity character of Moscato with the refreshing appeal of rosé, creating a versatile and crowd-pleasing style. Perfect for those seeking a lighter, semi-sweet wine with bright fruit flavors and gentle effervescence.
records.vintage: Non-vintage (NV) - consistent house style across releases
records.varietal: Moscato (Muscat) with rosé production method for pink color and red fruit character
records.region: Kosher wine production region (specific origin not specified)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic and perfumed with pronounced floral notes of rose petal, orange blossom, and honeysuckle that define the Moscato grape. The nose bursts with fresh fruit aromas of strawberry, raspberry, watermelon, and red cherry, characteristic of the rosé style. Additional layers reveal lychee, white peach, and mandarin orange alongside hints of cotton candy and Turkish delight. The aromatic intensity is captivating, with notes of jasmine tea, fresh mint, and a subtle muskiness that's typical of Moscato varieties.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with a medium-length finish that maintains the wine's fruity, floral character. Persistent notes of strawberry, peach, and orange blossom fade gently, leaving a pleasant sweetness balanced by crisp acidity and a hint of effervescence.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with a soft, slightly sweet character balanced by refreshing acidity and gentle effervescence that keeps the wine lively. Flavors of fresh strawberry, raspberry, and watermelon candy dominate the palate, complemented by notes of peach nectar, pink grapefruit, and lychee. The slight residual sugar provides a pleasant sweetness without being cloying, while the wine's natural acidity and subtle fizz create a refreshing balance. Mid-palate shows tropical hints of passion fruit and guava alongside the persistent floral character of rose water and orange blossom. The mouthfeel is soft and approachable with a gentle, almost creamy texture from the slight sweetness."}

records.name: Silverthorn The Genie Cap Classique Brut Rose NV
records.description: A premium South African méthode champenoise sparkling wine from Silverthorn, one of the country's leading Cap Classique producers. Crafted using traditional Champagne methods with extended lees aging, this rosé showcases the elegance and complexity that South African sparkling wines can achieve in cooler climate regions.
records.varietal: Likely Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend, traditional Cap Classique grapes
records.region: Western Cape, South Africa (likely Hemel-en-Aarde or Elgin)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers delicate aromas of wild strawberry, red currant, and white cherry, complemented by subtle notes of brioche and freshly baked bread from extended lees contact. Hints of rose petal and citrus blossom add floral elegance, while underlying notes of almond and cream suggest complexity. A subtle mineral quality and gentle spice note—ginger and white pepper—provide additional layers. The overall impression is refined and inviting.","finish":"The finish is clean, long, and refreshing, with persistent red berry fruit and a gentle yeastiness. The fine bubbles continue to lift the flavors, while the wine's acidity leaves the palate energized and ready for another sip. A subtle almond and mineral note lingers pleasantly.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with fine, persistent bubbles and high acidity that creates remarkable freshness. The palate delivers flavors of fresh strawberry, raspberry, and pink grapefruit, balanced by notes of brioche, toasted almond, and subtle cream from lees aging. The wine's texture is creamy yet vibrant, with the mousse providing elegant structure. A mineral backbone and hint of chalky character add complexity, while the wine remains bone-dry despite its fruit expression. The balance between fruit, acidity, and autolytic character is expertly managed."}

records.name: Jean Leon 3055 Rose 2023
records.description: From the youngest range of the prestigious Jean Leon estate in Penedès, Spain, this rosé embodies the winery's commitment to ecological viticulture and fresh, vibrant winemaking. The 3055 collection represents accessible elegance from this historic bodega founded in 1963.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and inviting, the bouquet bursts with fresh strawberry, wild raspberry, and watermelon rind. Delicate floral notes of rose petal and orange blossom dance above the fruit, while a subtle hint of Mediterranean herbs and wet stone adds complexity. The aromatic profile is clean and precise, reflecting careful vineyard selection.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering notes of citrus zest and red berry fruit. A saline minerality emerges at the end, characteristic of Penedès terroir, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on entry, the wine showcases vibrant flavors of red currant, pink grapefruit, and white peach. The mid-palate reveals excellent tension between ripe fruit sweetness and zesty acidity, with mineral notes providing structure. A subtle creaminess suggests possible lees contact, adding texture without weight. The wine maintains its elegance and precision throughout."}

records.name: Sky Devil Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: Sky Devil Cabernet Sauvignon 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Silverthorn River Dragon Cap Classique Blanc NV
records.description: An exceptional South African Cap Classique crafted from old-vine Colombard, showcasing how traditional méthode champenoise elevates this typically modest variety. Winemaker John Loubser's use of acacia barrel aging brings out the grape's hidden potential, creating a sparkling wine of elegance, complexity, and remarkable drinkability from the Robertson region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is vibrant and captivating, displaying a lovely green hue that hints at freshness. Aromatic white stone fruit leads the way—particularly white peach and nectarine—complemented by fresh apple blossom and delicate floral notes that the acacia aging has lifted beautifully. Scents of chamomile blossom and subtle thatch add earthy complexity, while tropical fruit hints of pineapple and guava provide exotic interest. A mineral undertone of wet stone or chalk adds finesse, and there's an intriguing earthy quality that grounds the wine's aromatic profile without detracting from its overall freshness.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with excellent persistence of flavor. The fine mousse continues to provide lift and texture through the close, while honeyed fruit and almond notes linger. The racy acidity keeps the palate fresh and clean, leading to a slightly salty, mineral-driven conclusion. This is a wine that finishes dry yet with a memory of fruit sweetness, inviting another sip.","palate":"The mousse is the first thing you notice—luxuriously soft yet spirited, delivering a fine bead of gentle bubbles that create an elegant effervescence across the palate. The entry is clean and refined, with flavors of honeyed melon and golden delicious apples taking center stage. Crushed almonds and hazelnut notes from the acacia barrel aging add texture and complexity, creating a creamy quality that enhances the wine's body. Despite Colombard's typically shy character, the palate is surprisingly generous with a perception of fruit sweetness balanced by racy acidity. The wine maintains excellent structure through the mid-palate, with the natural acidity characteristic of the grape providing backbone and ensuring freshness. A subtle salty quality adds to the wine's complexity and food-friendliness."}

records.name: Noble Hill Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
records.description: From the historic Noble Hill Wine Estate in South Africa's Simonsberg-Paarl region, this Cabernet Sauvignon reflects the winery's commitment to premium viticulture in one of the Cape's most prestigious terroirs. The 2021 vintage showcases the elegance and power achievable in South African Cabernet.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents refined aromas of cassis and black cherry, accented by eucalyptus, mint leaf, and a distinctive South African fynbos character. Notes of pencil shavings, cigar box, and subtle green peppercorn add complexity, while hints of dark chocolate and toasted oak provide depth. A cooling minerality reminiscent of granite adds freshness to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with persistent dark fruit flavors evolving into notes of tobacco, leather, and dark coffee. Tannins remain present but refined, suggesting this wine will continue to develop beautifully over the next decade.","palate":"Structured and elegant on the palate, the wine shows concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, blackberry, and dark plum, framed by firm but fine-grained tannins. The mid-palate reveals excellent balance between ripe fruit and savory elements of dried herbs, black olive, and graphite. Oak integration is seamless, contributing subtle vanilla and spice without overwhelming the fruit. Bright acidity provides lift and ensures food-friendliness."}

records.name: Sky Devil Rose 2023
records.description: Sky Devil Rose 2023 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Skylark Alondra Chardonnay 2018
records.description: Skylark Alondra Chardonnay 2018 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Skylark Alondra Chardonnay 2023
records.description: Skylark Alondra Chardonnay 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Mauro Molino Barolo 2021
records.description: From the renowned La Morra commune in Piedmont, Mauro Molino crafts traditional Barolo that reflects authentic terroir expression. This family-run winery's artisanal approach and quality-focused philosophy produces wines that honor Langhe heritage while appealing to contemporary palates. The 2021 vintage has received acclaim from major wine publications.
records.region: Barolo DOCG, La Morra, Piedmont, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic Nebbiolo aromatics define this Barolo: fragrant rose petal, violet, and dried cherry mingle with tar, white truffle, and forest floor. As the wine opens, notes of anise, orange peel, and tobacco leaf emerge, alongside hints of leather, cinnamon, and dried herbs. The aromatic complexity is quintessentially La Morra—elegant and perfumed rather than powerful.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and evolving, with flavors shifting from red fruit to savory notes of dried mushroom, tar, and rose hip tea. Firm tannins persist but show no harshness, instead providing the structural backbone necessary for extended aging typical of fine Barolo.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows remarkable elegance and finesse. Flavors of sour cherry, cranberry, and red plum are lifted by bright acidity and framed by assertive but refined tannins characteristic of young Nebbiolo. Mid-palate depth reveals earthy notes of truffle, tea leaf, and licorice root, while subtle oak contributes structure without masking the wine's transparent fruit expression. Despite its youth, there's a silky texture emerging that promises future development."}

records.name: Armstrong Fronk 2019
records.description: A distinctive red wine from a boutique producer focusing on quality-driven, terroir-expressive wines. This 2019 vintage represents careful vineyard selection and minimal intervention winemaking philosophy, resulting in a wine of character and regional authenticity.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Pinot Noir or Syrah-based)
records.region: California (likely North Coast or Central Coast)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with bright red fruit aromas of raspberry, red cherry, and cranberry, complemented by floral notes of lavender and dried rose petals. Underlying earth tones of mushroom, wet leaves, and subtle spice add complexity. Hints of oak-derived vanilla and clove integrate seamlessly, while a subtle herbal quality of thyme and oregano provides aromatic intrigue.","finish":"The finish shows good length with persistent red fruit character gradually transitioning to earthy, spicy notes. Well-integrated tannins and balanced acidity ensure a clean, satisfying conclusion that invites contemplation and food pairing.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied, the palate delivers concentrated red fruit flavors with excellent depth and dimension. Juicy acidity provides structure and vibrancy, balancing ripe cherry and strawberry notes with savory elements of dried herbs and forest floor. The texture is smooth and supple, with fine-grained tannins that add grip without astringency. A subtle mineral undertone runs through the mid-palate, adding complexity."}

records.name: Skylark Grenache 2014
records.description: A juicy, spicy Grenache from Mendocino County crafted by Boulevard Restaurant wine directors John Lancaster and Robert Perkins. This wine showcases the ripe, fruit-forward character that Skylark has become known for, with forest floor complexity adding depth to bright red fruit aromatics.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with juicy red fruit aromatics, led by red currant and ripe cherry, interwoven with intriguing forest floor notes that add earthy complexity. Subtle hints of dried herbs, particularly thyme and rosemary, mingle with a touch of white pepper spice. As the wine opens, aromas of crushed raspberries and wild strawberries emerge, along with a delicate floral note reminiscent of rose petals.","finish":"The finish is spicy with a slightly hot character from the alcohol, showing persistent red fruit flavors and white pepper spice. The wine benefits from decanting to integrate the warmth and allow the fruit to shine through.","palate":"On the palate, red cherry fruit takes center stage, supported by flavors of ripe strawberry, cranberry, and pomegranate. The wine shows good weight at 14.8% ABV, delivering a slightly warm, spicy character that's typical of ripe Grenache. Ripe cherry fruit is flecked with savory white pepper spice, adding complexity and a Mediterranean character. The texture is rich and slightly glycerin, coating the palate with concentrated fruit, while moderate tannins provide structure. Mid-palate flavors evolve to show hints of dried herbs and earthy undertones."}

records.name: Sky Devil Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc bursting with the signature aromatic intensity and crisp freshness that made the style internationally famous. This wine captures the pure, expressive character of Marlborough fruit with its herbaceous notes and tropical fruit layers. A quintessential expression of New World Sauvignon Blanc.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with vivid aromas of passion fruit, gooseberry, and fresh-cut grass—the hallmark characteristics of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Intense notes of grapefruit, lime zest, and green bell pepper showcase the wine's herbaceous profile, while hints of elderflower, boxwood, and jalapeño add distinctive complexity. The aromatic intensity is remarkable and inviting.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent with lingering citrus and tropical fruit notes. Vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed and energized, while subtle herbaceous and mineral elements fade gracefully. The conclusion is pure and focused, inviting immediate enjoyment.","palate":"Crisp, elegant, and refreshingly fresh with bright acidity driving the palate. Flavors of ripe passion fruit, kiwi, and citrus dominate, balanced by herbaceous notes of asparagus and fresh herbs. The mid-palate reveals layers of green apple, white peach, and mineral undertones. Clean, zesty, and focused with excellent textural precision and a lively, mouth-watering quality that defines the style."}

records.name: Hendry Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve 2021
records.description: The flagship reserve offering from Hendry Ranch's estate vineyard in Napa Valley. This wine represents the finest blocks and barrels from the vintage, showcasing the family's commitment to quality and their deep understanding of their 114-acre property. The reserve tier exemplifies the structured elegance that defines premium Napa Cabernet.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense and layered, the nose reveals profound aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry, and dark cherry, interwoven with notes of violets and crushed graphite. As the wine opens, complex secondary characteristics emerge: cedar, tobacco leaf, dark chocolate, and a hint of dried sage. French oak aging contributes subtle vanilla, toasted almond, and warm baking spices without overwhelming the wine's fruit core.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and complex, with dark fruit flavors slowly evolving into notes of leather, charred oak, and dark roasted coffee. Structured tannins persist through a minute-long finish, indicating excellent aging potential while remaining approachable in youth. A subtle minerality emerges at the very end, adding final dimension.","palate":"Full-bodied and magnificently structured, the palate shows concentrated flavors of cassis, black plum, and boysenberry, supported by firm yet fine-grained tannins that promise longevity. The mid-palate reveals impressive depth with layers of espresso, dark cocoa, black olive, and anise. Despite its power and concentration, the wine maintains elegance and balance, with integrated oak and alcohol. Bright acidity provides lift and ensures the wine doesn't feel heavy despite its substantial presence."}

records.name: Somontano La Moristel 2015
records.description: Somontano La Moristel 2015 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Skylark Pinot Blanc 2022
records.description: A crisp, mineral-driven Pinot Blanc from a heritage vineyard in Mendocino County, originally planted by John Fetzer in the 1970s. Skylark crafts elegant, terroir-focused wines that showcase the purity of California's cooler-climate sites with precision and restraint.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine pours a light straw yellow color, opening with bright aromas of green apple, lemon skin, and tangerine that provide immediate freshness. Subtle notes of white flowers and citrus blossom add aromatic complexity, while a delicate mineral quality hints at the wine's old-vine character and the distinctive terroir of this historic Mendocino vineyard.","finish":"The finish is crisp and mineral-driven with lingering citrus and apple notes. The wine's bright acidity carries through to the end, leaving a clean, mouth-watering impression that speaks to its old-vine heritage.","palate":"The palate is sleek and refined with a pronounced mineral component that lends structure to the fleshy fruits of apple and citrus. Flavors of green apple, Meyer lemon, and white grapefruit dominate, supported by subtle tropical notes that add depth without heaviness. The wine's balanced acidity creates a clean, vibrant mouthfeel that is both refreshing and sophisticated."}

records.name: Sonder Orange (White Field Blend) 2022
records.description: Sonder Orange (White Field Blend) 2022 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Libertine Late Harvest Riesling 2019
records.description: A luscious late harvest Riesling showcasing concentrated fruit and balanced acidity. This dessert-style wine demonstrates the hallmark precision and elegance expected from premium Riesling, with layers of complexity developed through extended hang time on the vine.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromatics of honeyed apricot, candied orange peel, and white peach preserves. Underlying notes of jasmine and orange blossom add floral complexity, while hints of petrichor and wet stone provide mineral intrigue. As the wine breathes, subtle nuances of ginger and beeswax emerge, creating a captivating bouquet that evolves in the glass.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and persistent, with echoes of honey and stone fruit lingering for over a minute. A whisper of almond and minerality appears at the close, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip despite the wine's richness.","palate":"On the palate, concentrated flavors of poached pear, dried apricot, and tropical lychee are perfectly balanced by vibrant acidity that prevents cloying sweetness. The mid-palate reveals layers of honeycomb, quince paste, and candied citrus zest, with a glycerin-rich texture that coats the mouth. The wine's natural acidity cuts through the sweetness, creating a harmonious interplay that showcases the variety's ability to maintain freshness even at higher residual sugar levels."}

records.name: Domaine d'Avrille Anjou Blanc 2022
records.description: A refined expression of Loire Valley white winemaking from Anjou, likely showcasing Chenin Blanc with the region's characteristic mineral-driven style. This wine represents the modern interpretation of Anjou Blanc, balancing fruit purity with terroir expression and notable freshness.
records.varietal: Chenin Blanc (primary component, typical for Anjou Blanc)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents crisp green apple and Asian pear alongside delicate white flowers and acacia honey. Distinctive chalky minerality emerges with aeration, accompanied by hints of chamomile, lemon verbena, and crushed limestone. A subtle waxy character typical of Chenin Blanc adds textural intrigue to the aromatic profile, while whispers of lanolin and wet wool contribute complexity.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent with pronounced salinity and mineral notes that echo the wine's terroir origins. Citrus zest and green apple skin linger alongside chalky tannins, leaving the palate refreshed and energized.","palate":"Medium-bodied with incisive acidity that drives flavors of tart yellow plum, Golden Delicious apple, and white currant across the palate. The wine shows impressive tension between ripe fruit and mineral precision, with notes of saline, flint, and oyster shell providing a distinctive Loire terroir signature. Mid-palate weight comes from phenolic grip rather than oak, creating a textured mouthfeel that's both refreshing and substantial. Hints of Meyer lemon and quince add brightness without sacrificing depth."}

records.name: Spicy Wings Rock the Day Red NV
records.description: Spicy Wings Rock the Day Red NV is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Remhoogte Sir Thomas Cullinan 2020
records.description: The flagship wine of Remhoogte Estate, named after their renowned great grandfather Sir Thomas Cullinan. This Bordeaux-style blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc represents the pinnacle of Stellenbosch winemaking, with grapes hand-harvested from individual vineyard rows and double-sorted in the cellar for exceptional quality.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"An enticing and complex bouquet greets the nose with layers of black currant, ripe mulberries, and succulent plums. These primary fruit aromas are elegantly complemented by savory herbal notes of sage and aromatic cedar wood, creating a sophisticated and inviting aromatic profile that speaks to both fruit intensity and terroir expression.","finish":"The finish is long and layered, with the sweet fruit notes gradually giving way to the wine's savory elements and subtle oak influence. The polished tannins provide a velvety texture that lingers beautifully, while the balanced acidity ensures freshness through to the very end.","palate":"Rich and vibrant on entry, the palate opens with generous sweet fruit flavors of black cherries, dark plums, and concentrated fruitcake notes. Savory complexity emerges mid-palate with intriguing nuances of green olives and cracked black pepper that add depth and sophistication. The wine shows beautiful structural integrity with broad, polished tannins and medium-plus acidity that provides excellent balance and framework, leading seamlessly to an extended, satisfying finish."}

records.name: Stel + Mar Andrew Syrah (DC/MD Only) 2023
records.description: Stel + Mar Andrew Syrah (DC/MD Only) 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Southern Belle Semi Precious 2021
records.description: An opulent and limited-production Syrah from The Grateful Palate's Southern Belle collection. This wine represents the pinnacle of the Southern Belle range, showcasing a silky, velvety style with ripe fruit concentration and generous oak influence, designed for lovers of big, bold New World reds.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic and decadent, revealing layers of dark fruit and oak influence. Ripe blueberry pie leads, surrounded by cassis and blackberry preserves. A prominent spice box character emerges with notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove. Toasty, spicy oak adds vanilla, coconut, and sweet cedar notes. Hints of plum pudding and dark chocolate provide richness and depth to the complex aromatic profile.","finish":"Long and warm finish with persistent notes of spice box and dark fruit. The oak influence extends through the aftertaste with lingering vanilla and toasted wood. Ripe, sweet fruit echoes remain, balanced by gentle tannins. This is a hedonistic, crowd-pleasing finish that leaves a lasting impression.","palate":"Utterly seamless and luscious on the palate, this wine displays remarkable textural elegance despite its power. The mouthfeel is silky, velvety, and opulent, coating the palate with rich dark fruit flavors. Ripe blueberry, blackberry, and plum dominate, enhanced by sweet oak notes of vanilla and toast. The 14.5% alcohol is beautifully integrated, adding warmth without heat. Dark chocolate and espresso notes emerge mid-palate, adding complexity. The tannins are much more suave and composed than expected, providing structure without grittiness."}

records.name: Stel + Mar Pinot Noir (DC, MD, and Southern VA Only) NV
records.description: Stel + Mar Pinot Noir (DC from  MD is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Saddleback Rancher Red 2019
records.description: A bold and flavorful Napa Valley red blend from the esteemed Saddleback Cellars, the Rancher Red captivates the palate with its distinctive character. Including 10% Petit Sirah in the blend, this wine showcases the concentrated flavors and textured tannins that define premium Napa Valley blends, earning accolades from both the San Francisco Chronicle and Texas International Wine Competitions.
records.varietal: Red blend including 10% Petit Sirah (exact blend composition not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is spiced and richly aromatic, offering enticing notes of ripe dark berries—blackberries and blueberries—mingling with dried Mediterranean herbs, black licorice, and mocha. A subtle chocolaty quality adds warmth and depth, while hints of black pepper from the Petit Sirah component provide additional complexity and intrigue.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with the dark fruit flavors persisting alongside the spicy, peppery notes from the Petit Sirah. The firm tannins create a pleasantly drying sensation that invites another sip, while the chocolaty mocha notes linger on the palate.","palate":"Polished and beautifully textured, the palate presents a medium to full-bodied wine with excellent structure. Dark berry flavors dominate—blackberries, blueberries, and black cherries—complemented by layers of spice, licorice, and dark chocolate. The wine shows remarkable balance between fruit concentration and savory elements, with chalky, firm tannins that are slightly chewy yet refined, providing excellent grip and structure without being overpowering."}

records.name: Stel + Mar Sauvignon Blanc (DC, MD, and Southern VA Only) NV
records.description: Stel + Mar Sauvignon Blanc (DC from  MD is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Stel + Mar Red Blend (DC, MD, and Southern VA Only) NV
records.description: Stel + Mar Red Blend is a carefully crafted non-vintage wine designed for everyday enjoyment and versatility. Blending complementary grape varieties creates a harmonious wine that over-delivers on quality while remaining approachable and food-friendly.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is inviting and fruit-forward, featuring ripe red berries—strawberry, raspberry, and red plum—alongside darker notes of blackberry and black cherry. A touch of vanilla and sweet oak spice adds dimension without dominating. Subtle hints of dried herbs, particularly thyme and oregano, provide a savory edge. The wine shows good aromatics intensity with a pleasing freshness.","finish":"The finish is medium in length with lingering red fruit and a touch of cocoa. Soft tannins provide just enough grip without any harsh edges, making this wine very versatile with food. A subtle spiciness and hint of dried fruit carry through to the end.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a soft, approachable texture that makes this blend immediately enjoyable. The fruit flavors are ripe and generous—think cherry cola, mixed berry compote, and plum jam—balanced by gentle tannins and moderate acidity. The blend's components work together seamlessly, with no single variety dominating. Oak aging contributes notes of vanilla, caramel, and a whisper of baking spices. The wine maintains good structure while remaining smooth and easy-drinking."}

records.name: Sun Break Colette Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: Sun Break Colette Pinot Noir 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Southern Belle French Belle 2019
records.description: An elegant Bordeaux-style blend from the acclaimed Southern Belle portfolio, the French Belle combines 80% Merlot with 20% Cabernet Franc to create a sophisticated and approachable wine. From the 2019 vintage—considered one of Southern Belle's most impressive—this wine showcases the harmonious marriage of Merlot's supple texture with Cabernet Franc's aromatic complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a complex bouquet where Merlot's cassis and ripe plum aromas intertwine beautifully with Cabernet Franc's distinctive notes of tobacco leaf and darker fruits. Initial impressions of blackberry and blueberry give way to pleasing complex elements of vanilla and toffee from oak aging, while subtle hints of green pepper and spice add an herbaceous dimension that provides aromatic intrigue.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and persistent, carrying intense ripe fruit and complex flavors that evolve on the palate. The wine's excellent balance ensures that neither fruit, oak, nor tannin dominates, while the Cabernet Franc's spicy notes provide an elegant conclusion.","palate":"Soft yet big, this wine offers an elegant mouthfeel that is both rich and approachable. The full body and impressive density are balanced by superb structure and grip, creating a wine of substantial presence without heaviness. Ripe fruit flavors of blackberry, plum, and red currants dominate, enhanced by the Cabernet Franc's spice and tobacco notes. The oak influence is well-integrated, contributing vanilla and toffee nuances that add complexity without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Tapwines Sparkling Rose Keg   20000 ml
records.description: Tapwines Sparkling Rose Keg   20000 ml is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and refreshing drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, green apple, brioche, almond, delicate floral notes","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering effervescence and citrus","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity, flavors of apple and pear"}

records.name: Boxwood Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: Boxwood Winery in Virginia's Middleburg wine region produces this fresh and expressive Sauvignon Blanc. The 2022 vintage captures the essence of Virginia's terroir while showcasing the varietal's characteristic brightness and aromatic intensity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Vibrant and expressive, the nose bursts with grapefruit zest, lime leaf, and passion fruit. Fresh-cut grass and gooseberry provide classic Sauvignon Blanc markers, while white flowers and elderflower add delicate aromatics. Subtle mineral notes of crushed chalk and river stone emerge, reflecting the wine's terroir. A hint of jalapeño and green bell pepper adds herbaceous complexity without dominating.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering citrus and mineral notes. Crisp acidity leaves the palate refreshed, while subtle tropical fruit flavors fade gracefully. A slight grassy note and hint of lime zest provide a bright, invigorating conclusion.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing with zesty acidity that energizes the palate. Flavors of Meyer lemon, white grapefruit, and green apple are complemented by tropical notes of guava and kiwi. The texture is light to medium-bodied with a clean, mineral-driven core. Bright citrus acidity provides structure and length, while subtle herbaceous notes add dimension. The wine maintains excellent balance between fruit intensity and refreshing crispness, with a slight saline quality that enhances its food-friendly nature."}

records.name: Sutherland Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
records.description: A cool-climate South African Cabernet from Elgin Valley's Sutherland Vineyards, just 9km from the Atlantic Ocean. This wine earned 4.5 stars from Platter's 2025 Guide for its vibrant expression of Cabernet grown at altitude in maritime-influenced soils, showcasing cassis purity and seamless tannin integration.
records.region: Elgin Valley, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays vibrant, lifted aromatics of dark berry fruits with prominent cassis taking center stage - a hallmark of cool-climate Cabernet. Layers of blackberry, black cherry, and mulberry emerge, accented by complex spice notes including cedar, tobacco leaf, and hints of dark chocolate. The maritime influence contributes subtle graphite minerality and herbal nuances - bay leaf and eucalyptus - that add intrigue without overwhelming the pure fruit expression. As the wine opens, violet florals and sweet vanilla oak appear, testament to the 18-month barrel program.","finish":"The finish is long, satisfying, and lingering with persistent cassis, dark fruit, and fine-grained tannins. Subtle spice, graphite minerality, and oak-derived complexity extend the conclusion. The mouthfeel remains seamless and elegant, inviting another sip while demonstrating the wine's aging potential. The wine leaves a lasting impression of both power and refinement.","palate":"On the palate, this Cabernet reveals impressive depth and intensity while maintaining cool-climate elegance and freshness. The cassis and dark berry core continues with additional layers of blackcurrant, plum, and dark cherry, supported by the wine's remarkable fruit intensity. Spice elements - pepper, clove, and cedar - add complexity without dominating. What truly distinguishes this wine is the seamless integration of tannins with fruit - the structure is present and firm enough to support aging, yet refined and silky enough to provide immediate drinking pleasure. The 25% new French oak is perfectly balanced, contributing vanilla, toast, and subtle coffee notes without masking the fruit. Atlantic influence shows in the wine's freshness and mineral backbone."}

records.name: Sutherland Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
records.description: Crafted by renowned winemaker Gyles Webb of Thelema Mountain Vineyards, Sutherland represents a cool-climate expression of Cabernet Sauvignon from South Africa's Elgin Valley. This small-scale project demonstrates how cooler temperatures can create elegant, aromatic Cabernet with exceptional freshness alongside classic varietal character.
records.region: Elgin Valley, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine opens with super-aromatic intensity, displaying a compelling bouquet of dark mulled fruits and pure cassis. Pronounced black currant aromas merge with crushed red currants, creating a vibrant berry spectrum. Subtle notes of cedar and cigar box emerge from the French oak aging, while delicate floral perfume adds an unexpected layer of complexity. The nose suggests both power and refinement, with dark fruit concentration balanced by cool-climate elegance.","finish":"The finish is wiry and high-toned with moderate tartness that keeps the palate engaged. Dark fruit flavors persist alongside notes of tobacco and cedar, extending the wine's length considerably. The resolved tannins provide structure without heaviness, culminating in an elegant, lifted conclusion that speaks to the wine's cool-climate origins.","palate":"Medium-bodied with awesome freshness, this Cabernet delivers super-bright, crystal-clear fruit flavors that showcase the Elgin terroir. The palate opens with refreshing sweet fruit and ripe tannins, offering flavors of dark cherry, blackcurrant, and cassis. Layers of vanilla from oak aging interweave with herbal notes and a subtle tomato leaf character. The wine's moderate alcohol (13.5%) and natural acidity create remarkable balance, while the tannin structure remains refined and integrated despite the wine's youth."}

records.name: Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: From Thelema Mountain Vineyards' cool-climate site in Elgin Valley, this Sauvignon Blanc showcases the purity and elegance achievable in South Africa's premier white wine region. Located just 9km from the Atlantic Ocean at elevations of 140-250m, Sutherland Vineyards produces wines with exceptional balance, depth, and complexity. The 2024 vintage represents the latest expression of this acclaimed terroir.
records.region: Elgin Valley, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays beautiful purity with pronounced notes of fresh lime zest and ripe gooseberry. Tropical nuances—passion fruit, guava—emerge alongside delicate floral elements of white blossoms and elderflower. Subtle herbal notes of fresh-cut grass and lemongrass add complexity, while a distinct mineral quality reflects the cool maritime climate and unique terroir.","finish":"Long, layered, and complex, the finish showcases the wine's cool-climate pedigree. Mineral notes persist alongside citrus and tropical fruit flavors, with bright acidity keeping the palate refreshed. The wine's depth and complexity continue to unfold in the glass.","palate":"Vibrant and mineral-driven on the palate, the wine shows exceptional balance between fruit intensity and structure. Bright citrus flavors of lime and grapefruit are complemented by tropical fruit notes and a characteristic gooseberry tartness. The wine is elegantly balanced, with a delicate profile that belies its intensity and concentration. Cool-climate acidity provides backbone and freshness throughout."}

records.name: Syrahmi Angus Shiraz 2019
records.description: Syrahmi Angus Shiraz 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
