records.name: Tagua Tagua Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
records.description: An accessible Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon from the Central Valley, representing excellent value and easy-drinking appeal. Bodegas Tagua Tagua focuses on expressing the pure fruit character of Chilean terroir with minimal intervention, creating wines that showcase the natural generosity of the region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents an inviting mix of red and dark berries with subtle leafy herbaceous notes. Aromas of red plum, fresh strawberry, and raspberry combine with hints of cassis and wild berries. Delicate notes of wild flowers add a floral dimension, while subtle hints of flint and earth provide grounding complexity. A touch of mint and dried herbs reflects the wine's Chilean character.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with a distinctly green, minty quality and lingering berry fruit notes. The acid-driven structure ensures a crisp conclusion, while soft tannins fade gently. This is an uncomplicated, honest expression of Chilean Cabernet designed for immediate enjoyment and everyday drinking.","palate":"Approachable and fruit-forward on the palate, the wine delivers flavors of tart red plum, cranberry, and red currant with good freshness. The texture is soft and easy-drinking, making it immediately accessible. Flavors of raspberry and strawberry dominate, with hints of soft plum appearing mid-palate. A high-acid backbone keeps the wine lively and food-friendly, while gentle tannins provide just enough structure. Notes of fresh herbs and a touch of green pepper add varietal character without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Sutherland Syrah 2021
records.description: A cool-climate Syrah from the prestigious Elgin Valley, crafted by Gyles Webb of Thelema fame. Situated just 9km from the Atlantic Ocean at 140-250m altitude, Sutherland Vineyards produces elegant, refined Syrah that emphasizes finesse over power.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals a harmonious blend of ripe blackberries and dark plums, lifted by delicate violet florals and classic white pepper spice. Smoky cedar nuances add depth, while subtle graphite minerality speaks to the wine's coastal origins. The aromatics show remarkable purity and definition, characteristic of cool-climate Syrah at its finest.","finish":"The conclusion is enduring and contemplative, with lingering black fruit essence intertwined with white pepper spiciness. The coastal influence manifests in a refreshing salinity that cleanses the palate and invites another sip.","palate":"Vibrant acidity provides the backbone for juicy black cherry fruit that dances across the palate. Intriguing notes of cured meat and slate-like minerality add savory complexity, preventing the wine from becoming one-dimensional. The texture is supple yet structured, with fine-grained tannins that support rather than dominate. Medium body with excellent energy and freshness throughout."}

records.name: Tagua Tagua Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
records.description: A well-crafted Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon from the historic Rapel Valley, produced by Bodegas Tagua Tagua, a fifth-generation family winery with roots dating back to the mid-1800s. This wine showcases the approachable, fruit-forward style that has made Chilean Cabernet internationally renowned.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents light notes of peppercorn and green bell pepper that provide varietal character typical of Chilean Cabernet. The aromatic profile shows restraint and elegance, with subtle vegetal notes adding complexity rather than dominating. Hints of dark berries and cassis emerge with aeration, while delicate herbal undertones speak to the terroir.","finish":"The finish is clean and straightforward, with lingering notes of red fruit and subtle pepper. The light tannins ensure a smooth conclusion, while the gentle acidity provides lift. This is an unpretentious, well-made wine that delivers varietal character and drinking pleasure without unnecessary complexity.","palate":"Stewed fruit flavors blend harmoniously with bell pepper on the palate, creating a balanced, everyday red wine experience. Light tannins provide structure without astringency, making the wine immediately approachable and food-friendly. Gentle acidity maintains freshness and balance throughout the tasting, while flavors of plum and dark cherry carry through the mid-palate."}

records.name: Talpiot Rose
records.description: Talpiot Rose is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Tagua Tagua Gran Reserva Carmenere 2018
records.description: A distinguished Gran Reserva from Chile's Rapel Valley, this wine showcases the unique characteristics of Carmenere while incorporating Carignan and País in the blend. Hailing from the 2018 vintage—described as very low-yielding and colossally concentrated—this wine earned a Gold medal at the Berlin Wine Trophy, demonstrating the quality and character of premium Chilean red wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with distinctive aromatics of aniseed and licorice, classic markers of quality Carmenere, which add an exotic, spicy dimension. Layered beneath are ripe plum and black cherry notes that provide fruit sweetness, while subtle hints of roasted coffee and toasted oak emerge, adding warmth and complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is medium in length with a slightly warm character that speaks to the wine's concentration and moderate alcohol level. The soft tannins and spicy notes linger pleasantly, with the coffee and oak elements providing a satisfying conclusion.","palate":"The palate delivers concentrated flavors of dark plum and black cherry, beautifully integrated with the wine's spicy aniseed character. Notes of freshly brewed coffee and toasted oak add depth and richness, creating a multi-layered tasting experience. The wine shows medium body with soft, approachable tannins that provide structure without astringency, while medium acidity keeps the wine balanced and food-friendly."}

records.name: Tarpon Cellars Cambaro Rose 2022
records.description: A bright and sophisticated California rosé from Tarpon Cellars' Cambaro line, crafted using organically-farmed fruit from Clarksburg with a unique blend of varieties. This natural wine showcases European-inspired techniques applied to California terroir.
records.varietal: Muscat Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc, Tempranillo (also includes Syrah, Grenache, Chenin Blanc, Muscat Canelli)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant green strawberry and playful watermelon candy notes that speak to the wine's fresh, fruit-forward character. Peach pit and citrus nuances add complexity, creating an inviting and aromatic bouquet that promises refreshment.","finish":"Crisp and dry conclusion with lingering citrus and stone fruit notes. The saline quality persists, leaving a refreshing, palate-cleansing finish that makes this wine exceptionally food-friendly.","palate":"Peach pit soda and grapefruit rind flavors dominate the mid-palate, creating a unique flavor profile that balances sweetness and bitterness. The wine is acid-driven, with crisp acidity providing energy and structure throughout. A touch of salinity complements the bright acidity, adding depth and mineral character. Made from an intriguing blend of Muscat Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc, and Tempranillo, the wine shows excellent complexity for a rosé."}

records.name: TeHo Malbec 2019
records.description: TeHo Malbec 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Tenute Orestiadi Nero 2024
records.description: This Sicilian red from Tenute Orestiadi showcases indigenous Nero d'Avola in its fresh, youthful expression. The 2024 vintage captures the warm Mediterranean climate with ripe fruit and vibrant character, offering immediate drinking pleasure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with aromas of ripe black cherry, wild blackberry, and plum, layered with notes of Mediterranean herbs including rosemary, thyme, and bay leaf. Subtle hints of black pepper and licorice add spice, while a touch of cocoa suggests gentle oak influence. The wine's youth is evident in its exuberant fruit-forward character and vibrant aromatic intensity.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent dark fruit and subtle spice notes. Soft tannins and refreshing acidity make the wine immediately approachable and food-friendly.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied on the palate, this Nero d'Avola delivers juicy flavors of dark cherry, blackberry, and pomegranate, supported by moderate tannins that are approachable yet provide structure. The warm Sicilian terroir expresses itself through concentrated fruit and a touch of dried fig sweetness. Bright acidity keeps the wine lively and balanced, preventing it from feeling heavy despite its ripeness. Subtle savory notes and Mediterranean herb qualities add complexity."}

records.name: Valdemar Estates Roussanne 2022
records.description: A distinguished expression of Roussanne from Washington State's Columbia Valley, this wine showcases fruit from the acclaimed Olsen and Gamache Vineyards. Valdemar Estates demonstrates exceptional expertise with this Rhône variety, creating a wine that combines finesse with substance, earning an impressive 92-point rating and recognition as a standout example of Washington Roussanne.
records.region: Columbia Valley, Washington, USA (Olsen and Gamache Vineyards)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers lovely melon tones—honeydew and cantaloupe—alongside distinctive nutty accents that suggest hazelnut and almond paste. Subtle stony, minerally notes evoke wet stones and flint, adding complexity and a sense of place that speaks to the Columbia Valley's unique terroir and volcanic soils.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with the citrus and melon notes lingering alongside the wine's mineral character. The bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that invites the next sip, while subtle nutty tones add a sophisticated final dimension.","palate":"Bright and seamless on the palate, this Roussanne displays remarkable balance between richness and vivacity. The wine is driven by vibrant melon and citrus fruit flavors—honeyed melon, Meyer lemon, and white grapefruit—that are beautifully framed by mouth-watering acidity. The combination of finesse and weight is exceptional, with the wine showing substantial texture and presence without any heaviness, creating an elegant yet substantial drinking experience that is already beautifully approachable."}

records.name: Sunspell Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
records.description: A modern, fruit-forward expression of South Australian Cabernet Sauvignon, Sunspell represents a natural, minimal-intervention approach to winemaking. Produced without oak chips or added coloring, this wine showcases the pure, vibrant character of Australian Cabernet in a medium-bodied, approachable style that emphasizes bright fruit and natural balance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright and aromatic, featuring a distinctive array of red and black fruits including native Australian quandong (similar to red peach), ripe black plum, and tart red currant. Intriguing herbal and savory notes emerge—mint, green pepper, fresh fern, and native river mint—alongside hints of pencil lead and sweet baking spice that add complexity without the presence of oak influence.","finish":"The finish is clean and fruity, with the spicy tannins providing a gentle grip and the bright acidity ensuring freshness. The herbal and minty notes linger pleasantly, creating a refreshing conclusion that showcases the wine's natural, unoaked character.","palate":"Medium-bodied and easygoing, this Cabernet offers plump, juicy flavors of plum, cherry, and raspberry fruit that fill the palate with freshness and vibrancy. The wine shows fullness and roundness despite its lighter body, with the dark fruit character well-balanced by bright acidity. Spicy tannins gently frame the fruit, creating a supple, approachable structure that is softly drying rather than astringent, making this an extremely food-friendly and versatile wine."}

records.name: Thelema Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
records.description: Thelema Mountain Vineyards is one of Stellenbosch's most acclaimed estates, and their Cabernet Sauvignon represents a benchmark for South African expressions of this noble variety. The 2020 vintage benefits from ideal growing conditions in Stellenbosch, producing a wine of concentration, elegance, and distinctive Cape terroir character that rivals fine Bordeaux.
records.region: Stellenbosch, Western Cape, South Africa (specifically from Thelema's mountain vineyards on the Simonsberg)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a sophisticated tapestry of classic Cabernet aromatics with distinctive Cape character: concentrated cassis, blackcurrant leaf, and ripe black plum mingle with eucalyptus, mint, and a distinctive fynbos herbal quality unique to South African terroir. Cedar, cigar box, and graphite minerality add gravitas, while underlying notes of black olive tapenade, espresso, and dark chocolate speak to the wine's complexity and careful oak aging. A lifted violet floral note adds elegance to the powerful fruit core.","finish":"The finish is long and authoritative, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually revealing layers of cedar, tobacco, and sweet spice. Fine-grained tannins provide textural interest through the extended conclusion, while bright acidity and minerality ensure the wine finishes fresh and balanced. This is a wine built for the cellar with all the components for graceful aging.","palate":"The palate is structured and intense, showcasing the concentration the 2020 vintage afforded while maintaining Thelema's signature elegance and balance. Dense flavors of blackcurrant, cassis, and dark cherry are complemented by savory notes of black olive, roasted coffee bean, and dark cocoa powder. Firm yet refined tannins provide excellent architecture, while Stellenbosch's characteristic fresh acidity keeps the wine vibrant despite its power. The mountain origin is evident in the wine's mineral spine and restrained alcohol, with flavors of crushed stone and iron adding complexity to the fruit."}

records.name: Thelema Mountain Red 2021
records.description: A distinguished South African blend from Thelema Mountain Vineyards in Stellenbosch, one of the country's most acclaimed wine estates. This Syrah-led blend showcases multiple varietals in harmony, spending 18 months in seasoned oak to achieve elegance and integration. Multiple awards including 94 points from Tim Atkin.
records.varietal: Syrah-led blend with Grenache, Petit Verdot, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is inviting and expressive with aromas of juicy black fruit taking center stage. Ripe mulberries and dark plums dominate, accompanied by layers of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis. Hints of warm spice—black pepper, cinnamon, and clove—add complexity and speak to the Syrah component. Subtle notes of dried herbs, violet, and a touch of leather from the barrel aging create aromatic depth without overwhelming the vibrant fruit character.","finish":"The finish is long, delicious, and satisfying with persistent dark fruit and spice notes. Well-rounded tannins provide gentle grip while the wine's natural freshness keeps everything lively and balanced. Subtle hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and Mediterranean herbs linger, inviting another sip. This is a wine that over-delivers on quality and drinking pleasure.","palate":"Soft and juicy on entry, the palate delivers generous dark fruit flavors with excellent purity and concentration. The Syrah provides a spicy backbone with black pepper and dark berry notes, while Grenache adds red fruit brightness and aromatic lift. Petit Verdot contributes structure and floral notes, with both Cabernets and Merlot rounding out the blend with classic dark fruit and subtle herbal complexity. The 18 months in second, third, and fourth fill barrels have integrated beautifully, adding texture and subtle spice without oak dominance. The tannins are well-rounded and supple, providing structure while maintaining approachability."}

records.name: Thelema Rabelais 2021
records.description: Thelema Rabelais 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Murdoch Hill Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: Murdoch Hill crafts exceptional cool-climate Pinot Noir from their Adelaide Hills estate vineyards. The 2021 vintage represents the pinnacle of Australian Pinot Noir, combining Old World elegance with New World fruit purity. The wine showcases the Adelaide Hills' ideal terroir for this temperamental variety, with its cool temperatures, elevated sites, and diverse soils.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is quintessentially Pinot Noir, revealing layers of bright red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry alongside more complex notes of rose petal, forest floor, and subtle spice. Hints of cola, dried tea leaves, and sandalwood add aromatic intrigue. With aeration, earthy undertones of mushroom and wet stone emerge, along with delicate oak-derived notes of vanilla and clove. The aromatics display impressive purity and intensity, characteristic of cool-climate Pinot Noir.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant, with persistent red fruit notes, fine tannins, and a distinctive mineral quality. The wine's fresh acidity provides lift and ensures a clean conclusion, while subtle spice notes linger. This is a beautifully crafted Pinot Noir that captures the essence of its cool-climate origins.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows exceptional balance and finesse, with silky tannins and vibrant acidity framing flavors of red cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate. The wine's medium body belies its intensity and concentration, with layers of flavor unfolding to reveal notes of black tea, rhubarb, and savory herbs. Subtle oak influence contributes structure without masking the delicate fruit character. The texture is refined and seamless, with a core of minerality that adds tension and complexity. This is Pinot Noir of remarkable purity and precision."}

records.description: Tibouren Cotes de Provence 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Saddleback Merlot 2016
records.description: Saddleback Cellars' Merlot showcases Napa Valley's exceptional terroir for this noble Bordeaux variety. The 2016 vintage, now beautifully mature, displays the complexity and elegance that develops with age. This wine demonstrates Merlot's potential for serious, age-worthy wines when crafted from premium fruit and given proper cellaring time.
records.varietal: Predominantly Merlot with possible Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blending
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals evolved complexity with aromas of dark plum, black cherry compote, and dried fig alongside developed notes of leather, cedar cigar box, and forest floor. Subtle hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and vanilla bean from oak aging integrate seamlessly with the fruit. Earthy undertones of truffle, dried tobacco, and subtle game add savory intrigue. The 2016 vintage's maturity is evident in the wine's tertiary characteristics, though the core fruit remains vibrant and expressive.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with persistent dark fruit notes, fine-grained tannins, and complex savory elements. Touches of cocoa, cedar, and subtle earth linger elegantly, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean, refined conclusion. The 2016 vintage's maturity shows in the harmonious integration of all components.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows full body with supple, well-integrated tannins that have softened beautifully with age. Flavors of blackberry, dark cherry, and plum preserve are enriched by notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and sweet baking spice. The wine's texture is silky and luxurious, with excellent depth and concentration. Secondary characteristics of dried herbs, leather, and mineral add complexity to the fruit core. The integration of oak, tannin, and acid is seamless, demonstrating the benefits of proper cellaring. This is Napa Merlot at its finest."}

records.name: Trespass Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
records.description: Trespass Cabernet Sauvignon 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Trespass Chardonnay 2023
records.description: Trespass Chardonnay 2023 represents contemporary California Chardonnay at its finest—balancing richness with freshness in a style that appeals to modern palates. This recent vintage showcases the quality and vibrancy of well-crafted Chardonnay from the excellent 2023 growing season.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is expressive and inviting, leading with ripe stone fruit aromatics—white peach, nectarine, and apricot—alongside citrus notes of Meyer lemon and lime zest. A beautiful integration of oak contributes vanilla cream, toasted brioche, and subtle butterscotch without overwhelming the fruit. Floral hints of honeysuckle and jasmine add elegance. With air, subtle notes of roasted almond and hazelnut emerge, along with a whisper of tropical fruit—pineapple and mango.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with lingering notes of stone fruit, vanilla, and toasted oak. A pleasant creaminess persists alongside bright acidity, creating excellent balance. Hints of lemon curd, almond, and subtle spice carry through to the end, leaving the palate refreshed yet satisfied.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a creamy, lush texture that coats the palate beautifully. The fruit flavors are ripe and generous—think baked apple, poached pear, and white peach compote—balanced by bright citrus notes that provide lift and energy. The oak influence is judicious, contributing vanilla, caramel, and toasted oak spice while allowing the fruit to shine. Partial malolactic fermentation likely adds buttery richness and smoothness. The wine's acidity is well-balanced, providing freshness without sharpness and keeping the richness in check. A subtle minerality runs through the mid-palate, adding complexity and terroir expression."}

records.name: Trespass Rendezvous 2018
records.description: Trespass Rendezvous 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Trespass Merlot 2018
records.description: A Napa Valley Merlot from Trespass Vineyard, this wine exemplifies California's ability to produce world-class Merlot with depth, complexity, and elegance. Crafted to showcase varietal character with oak influence, this wine offers both immediate appeal and aging potential typical of quality Napa reds.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers an inviting aroma of ripe blackberries, plums, and dark cherries, beautifully complemented by subtle hints of vanilla and warm baking spices. The deep ruby color in the glass promises richness, while the aromatic profile reveals layers of cocoa, mocha, and a gentle touch of oak that frames the fruit without overwhelming it. Cedar and dried herbs add complexity to the lush fruit core.","finish":"Long and satisfying, the finish leaves a lingering impression of ripe dark fruit and elegant structure. The conclusion showcases the wine's complexity with a touch of cocoa, spice, and fine-grained tannins that persist beautifully. This harmonious combination of fruit, structure, and complexity makes the wine wonderful for both casual enjoyment and special occasions.","palate":"The palate displays a smooth and velvety texture with well-integrated tannins that provide structure and balance without being aggressive. Dark fruit flavors continue to shine—blackberry, black cherry, and plum dominate with additional notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and a touch of vanilla oak. The medium to full body contributes to the wine's richness and depth, creating a luxurious mouthfeel that's both powerful and refined."}

records.name: TVH Block 5 Cabernet Franc 2021
records.description: An exceptional estate Cabernet Franc from the prestigious Hermosa Vineyard's Crabb's Black Burgundy Block 5, located adjacent to Harlan Estate. Crafted by renowned winemakers Philippe Melka and Maayan Koschitzky, this wine represents the pinnacle of California Cabernet Franc, offering extraordinary complexity and aging potential.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Franc from estate Crabb's Black Burgundy Block
records.region: Hermosa Vineyard, Napa Valley, California (Block 5, adjacent to Harlan Estate)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with captivating aromas of red and black currants, intertwined with fresh violet florals and supple leather notes. Beautiful black cherry emerges alongside nuanced hints of dried flowers, new saddle leather, and unsmoked tobacco. Subtle spice elements of white pepper and exotic spices add complexity, while the aromatic intensity suggests concentrated fruit from a exceptional vineyard site.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, demonstrating the exceptional quality of fruit and site. Silky tannins extend gracefully, carrying flavors of dark fruit, leather, and spice through a conclusion that seems almost endless. The wine's impeccable balance suggests significant aging potential over the coming decade.","palate":"Full-bodied with remarkable richness, the palate delivers flawless balance between power and elegance. Concentrated flavors of black cherry, cassis, and currant dominate, supported by silky, refined tannins that coat the palate. Notes of dried violet petals, tobacco leaf, and subtle cedar from oak aging add layers of complexity. The wine shows outstanding structure with integrated acidity providing freshness despite its impressive weight and concentration."}

records.name: TVH Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
records.description: TVH Estate's 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon represents artisanal winemaking with meticulous attention to vineyard expression. This estate-grown wine captures the essence of its terroir while showcasing the exceptional quality of the 2018 vintage.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Aromatic intensity greets the nose with layers of ripe red and black fruits—think cherry compote, blackberry preserves, and crushed blueberries. Elegant floral notes of iris and lavender float above the fruit core. The oak influence is judicious, contributing subtle vanilla, cinnamon stick, and toasted almond without overwhelming the wine's inherent character.","finish":"Long and satisfying, the finish extends with notes of dark chocolate, espresso bean, and sweet tobacco. The tannins remain present but refined, promising graceful evolution with additional bottle age. A whisper of anise and black pepper lingers pleasantly.","palate":"The palate reveals a wine of impressive concentration and refinement. Flavors of black cherry, cassis, and dark plum dominate, supported by undertones of graphite, dried herbs, and black tea. The texture is simultaneously plush and structured, with velvety tannins that coat the palate. A mineral streak runs through the mid-palate, adding complexity and lift. The wine shows excellent balance with bright acidity maintaining freshness despite its richness."}

records.name: Two Mountain Cabernet Franc 2018
records.description: An elegant expression of Cabernet Franc from Washington's Yakima Valley, crafted by the Rawn family's estate-grown, small-production winery. This wine showcases the distinctive character of Cabernet Franc with restraint and balance, avoiding over-extraction and heavy oak in favor of varietal purity and finesse.
records.varietal: 95% Cabernet Franc, 5% Merlot (based on typical blend for their Reserve bottling)
records.region: Yakima Valley, Washington (likely from Copeland Vineyard)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Beautifully aromatic with a nose of rose petal and violet, the classic floral signatures of Cabernet Franc. Integrated oak contributes subtle vanilla notes, while the slightest hint of green pepper makes this definitively Cabernet Franc without crossing into herbaceous territory. The aromatics are elegant and lifted, showing the variety's naturally perfumed character.","finish":"Long and graceful finish marked by persistent floral notes, integrated oak, and lingering ripe fruit. The finish maintains the wine's elegant character through to the end, leaving impressions of rose petals and subtle spice.","palate":"Not over-extracted or over-oaked, the palate emphasizes purity and varietal expression. Flavors of rose and lavender echo the aromatic profile, complemented by ripe red fruit and subtle oak integration. The wine shows excellent balance and focus, with a lean, elegant structure that allows the fruit and floral notes to shine. The texture is refined with fine-grained tannins providing gentle structure."}

records.name: Two Mountain Rose 2024
records.description: Two Mountain Rose 2024 is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Two Mountain Riesling 2023
records.description: Two Mountain Winery, located in Washington's Yakima Valley, crafts exceptional Rieslings that showcase the region's ideal growing conditions. This 2023 vintage balances aromatic intensity with refreshing acidity, demonstrating the versatility and quality of Pacific Northwest Riesling production.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet bursts with classic Riesling aromatics: ripe peach, green apple, and Meyer lemon leap from the glass. Floral notes of white jasmine and honeysuckle add elegance, while hints of wet slate and petrichor provide a mineral backbone. Subtle tropical nuances of lychee and apricot emerge with air, creating a complex and inviting nose that evolves beautifully.","finish":"A lengthy, vibrant finish showcases the wine's excellent balance. Citrus zest and stone fruit linger alongside stony minerality, while bright acidity leaves the palate cleansed and energized. The subtle sweetness at the very end provides harmony without heaviness.","palate":"The palate delivers precise fruit expression with excellent structure. Juicy white peach and crisp Granny Smith apple dominate initially, followed by zesty lime and mandarin orange. The wine's signature acidity cuts through with refreshing precision, balanced by a touch of residual sweetness that never becomes cloying. Mid-palate notes of honeydew melon and nectarine add depth, while mineral tension provides backbone and energy throughout."}

records.description: Two Mountain Sauvignon Blanc 2021 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.

records.name: Jeff Cohn Sweetwater Springs Petite Sirah 2017
records.description: A powerhouse expression from one of California's premier Petite Sirah specialists, this Sweetwater Springs bottling showcases the varietal's signature intensity with remarkable balance. Jeff Cohn's meticulous approach to old-vine fruit delivers a wine of profound depth and structure, built for long-term aging yet approachable in its youth.
records.varietal: 100% Petite Sirah from Sweetwater Springs Vineyard
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose erupts with concentrated blackberry and blueberry compote, layered with notes of crushed violets and dark chocolate. Underlying aromas of espresso bean, sweet pipe tobacco, and graphite add complexity, while hints of vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging provide a sophisticated frame. As the wine opens, subtle notes of black pepper and dried herbs emerge, adding savory dimension.","finish":"The finish is extraordinarily long and persistent, with fine-grained tannins that coat the palate without overwhelming. Dark fruit flavors linger alongside hints of cedar, tobacco leaf, and a touch of exotic spice. The wine's youthful power suggests excellent aging potential over the next 10-15 years, though careful decanting makes it enjoyable now.","palate":"Dense and full-bodied, the palate delivers massive fruit concentration balanced by firm, well-integrated tannins. Flavors of ripe boysenberry, black cherry, and cassis dominate, supported by secondary notes of dark cocoa, licorice, and baking spices. The wine's impressive structure is matched by bright acidity that keeps the experience fresh despite its considerable weight. Mid-palate richness reveals layers of mocha, black tea, and a mineral backbone that speaks to old-vine intensity."}

records.name: Valdemar Estates Columbia Valley Chardonnay 2021
records.description: Valdemar Estates brings European winemaking expertise to Washington's Columbia Valley, crafting Chardonnays that balance New World fruit expression with Old World elegance. The 2021 vintage showcases the region's ability to produce structured, age-worthy whites with both richness and refreshing acidity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with ripe orchard fruits: golden delicious apple, ripe pear, and white peach create an inviting foundation. Subtle citrus notes of Meyer lemon and orange zest add brightness, while oak influence reveals itself through gentle vanilla, toasted hazelnut, and buttered brioche. Underlying minerality suggests quality vineyard sources, and hints of honeysuckle and white flowers provide lift. The aromatic profile balances fruit purity with sophisticated complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with fruit, oak, and acidity in beautiful harmony. Citrus and stone fruit linger alongside creamy vanilla notes, while bright acidity cleanses the palate. A subtle mineral quality persists, providing structure and elegance.","palate":"On the palate, this Chardonnay delivers richness balanced by vibrant acidity. Ripe stone fruit—peach, nectarine, and apricot—mingles with apple and pear, creating generous fruit expression. Carefully integrated oak contributes creamy texture and notes of vanilla, butterscotch, and toasted oak, likely from partial barrel fermentation. The wine's medium to full body is enlivened by fresh acidity that prevents any sense of heaviness. Mid-palate reveals layers of lemon curd, crème brûlée, and subtle tropical notes, while mineral salinity adds tension and food-friendliness."}

records.name: Valdeorite Cava NV
records.description: An aromatic and refreshing Cava from the boutique winery in Almendralejo, one of the few places in Spain outside Catalonia accredited to produce Cava. Crafted by López Morenas with traditional methods, this sparkling wine earned 90 points from Wine Enthusiast and a 4.1 rating on Vivino, showcasing excellent quality at its price point.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents enticing aromas of ripe citrus fruits, particularly lime zest and lemon, intermingled with green apple and delicate floral notes. Subtle hints of verbena and lychee nut add an exotic dimension to the bouquet. As the wine opens, notes of lemongrass and white flowers emerge, creating a complex and inviting aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long, crisp, and refreshing with a minerally edge that leaves the palate cleansed and invigorated. Lingering notes of citrus peel and apple skin persist, inviting another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this Cava delivers a lively mousse with persistent fine bubbles that dance across the tongue. The wine shows clean, fresh flavors of stone fruit - white peach and nectarine - balanced by bright citrus notes of lemon and grapefruit. A creamy texture develops mid-palate, revealing nuances of hazelnut and toasted bread from time spent on lees. The wine maintains refreshing acidity throughout, with a subtle mineral character that adds depth and complexity."}

records.name: Korde Pinea Tinto 2022
records.description: An emerging Spanish red that reflects the modern winemaking movement in the Penedès region, blending traditional Mediterranean varieties with contemporary techniques. This vibrant, fruit-forward wine emphasizes freshness and drinkability while maintaining authentic varietal character and regional typicity.
records.varietal: Blend of indigenous Spanish varieties (likely Garnacha, Tempranillo, and/or Cariñena)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and inviting, the bouquet opens with fresh red cherry and ripe strawberry, complemented by subtle floral notes of lavender and rose petal. Earthy undertones of Mediterranean herbs—thyme, rosemary, and dried sage—add complexity, while a whisper of toasted almond and light oak spice provides depth without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"Clean and refreshing, the finish showcases the wine's Mediterranean character with lingering notes of red berries, a hint of white pepper, and subtle earthy minerality. The wine's youthful energy suggests it's meant for near-term enjoyment while still possessing enough structure for short-term cellaring.","palate":"Medium-bodied with lively acidity, the palate delivers juicy red fruit flavors centered on cherry, cranberry, and red plum. The wine shows excellent balance between its fruit-forward nature and savory elements of dried herbs, leather, and a touch of mineral salinity. Soft, approachable tannins provide structure without gripping, making this an extremely food-friendly wine. Notes of pomegranate and blood orange zest add brightness on the mid-palate."}

records.name: Villa Amandine Rouge  (Wine Club Only)
records.description: A refined Côtes du Rhône Villages expression from Séguret, this elegant red showcases the harmonious marriage of Syrah and Grenache. The wine demonstrates the sophisticated balance possible in Southern Rhône viticulture, offering both immediate appeal and notable structure for medium-term aging.
records.varietal: Syrah and Grenache blend (exact proportions not disclosed)
records.region: Côtes du Rhône Villages Séguret, Southern Rhône Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an expressive bouquet of fresh rose petals and peony, beautifully intertwined with bright red cherry and wild strawberry aromas. Secondary notes of pipe tobacco, fresh bay leaf, and gentle tar provide complexity, while subtle hints of black olive and violet add Mediterranean character. A delicate thread of white pepper and smoke enhances the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, marked by cutting red-cherry acidity and feathery-fine tannins. Lingering notes of blackberry, subtle spice, and chalky minerality provide a rustic yet refined conclusion that is both honest and crunchy, inviting contemplation.","palate":"Medium-bodied with an almost weightless elegance, the palate reveals concentrated flavors of mulberry, black cherry, and underripe plum. The wine shows beautiful refinement with silky tannins and fine-grained structure, supported by classy, perky acidity. A subtle oak influence contributes hints of vanilla and baking spice, while earthy elements of dried herbs and soft licorice add dimension without heaviness."}

records.name: Vina Albina Blanco Reserva 2001 549514
records.description: An exceptionally rare white Rioja Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, one of the region's most historic producers. Dating from 2001, this aged white wine represents a unique expression of white Rioja with extended aging—a rarity in a region better known for its red wines. This bottle offers a glimpse into Rioja's less-explored white wine heritage.
records.varietal: Likely Viura (Macabeo) dominant blend, possibly with Malvasía
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals the hallmarks of aged white Rioja with evolved aromatics of dried apricot, honey, and toasted almonds. Subtle notes of beeswax and lanolin emerge, along with hints of citrus peel preserved in time. The extended aging has developed tertiary aromas of chamomile tea, vanilla, and a distinctive nutty oxidative character that adds complexity without losing elegance.","finish":"Long and layered, the finish showcases oxidative complexity balanced by persistent acidity. Nutty, honeyed notes linger alongside a slight bitter almond character that adds sophistication and length to this rare aged white.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows remarkable preservation with flavors of candied lemon, dried pear, and hazelnut praline. The texture is rich and slightly viscous, with the wine's age lending a creamy, almost unctuous mouthfeel. Bright acidity—remarkable for a wine of this age—keeps the experience fresh and balanced. Notes of butterscotch and toasted oak from extended barrel aging integrate seamlessly with the mature fruit."}

records.name: Endhardt Vineyards Kindred Red 2021
records.description: A thoughtfully crafted red blend from California's emerging wine regions, this Kindred Red represents the artisan approach to winemaking where quality and terroir expression take precedence over commercial appeal. The wine balances approachability with complexity, offering layers of flavor that reward both casual enjoyment and contemplative tasting.
records.varietal: Proprietary red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, and/or Zinfandel)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an elegant array of dark and red fruits, with blackberry, plum, and black cherry leading the way. Secondary aromas of violets, cedar box, and dried rose petals add sophistication, while subtle hints of baking spices, vanilla bean, and a whisper of eucalyptus provide aromatic complexity. With air, notes of cocoa nibs and forest floor emerge, adding an earthy dimension.","finish":"The finish is long and graceful, with persistent dark fruit notes supported by fine-grained tannins and a touch of savory complexity. Lingering flavors of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried herbs fade slowly, leaving a satisfying impression that invites another sip. The wine's structure suggests it will evolve beautifully over the next several years.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a silky texture, the palate unfolds with layers of dark fruit—black plum, boysenberry, and Bing cherry—complemented by notes of mocha, leather, and sweet tobacco. The wine shows excellent integration of oak, with flavors of toasted cedar and baking spices enhancing rather than dominating the fruit. Balanced acidity provides freshness, while supple tannins create a smooth, approachable mouthfeel. The mid-palate reveals subtle hints of graphite and black tea."}

records.name: Libertine Scheurebe 2021
records.description: An adventurous expression from a winemaker known for exploring unusual varietals, this Scheurebe showcases the aromatic intensity and distinctive character of this German-origin grape. Libertine's approach celebrates the varietal's bold personality, creating a wine that's both intellectually intriguing and genuinely delicious for those seeking something beyond the ordinary.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic, the nose offers an exotic bouquet of white grapefruit, passion fruit, and lychee, intertwined with notes of fresh-cut grass and elderflower. The wine's signature character shows through in hints of peach skin, Meyer lemon zest, and a distinctive cassis-like note that's characteristic of well-made Scheurebe. Underlying mineral notes and white pepper add complexity, while a subtle honeyed quality suggests perfectly ripened fruit.","finish":"The finish is long and invigorating, showcasing the varietal's characteristic grapefruit pith note alongside lingering tropical fruit and citrus zest. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh and clean, while subtle herbal and mineral notes add savory complexity. This is a wine that leaves you contemplating another glass.","palate":"Medium-bodied with electric acidity, the palate delivers intense flavors of pink grapefruit, gooseberry, and pineapple, balanced by a core of ripe stone fruit. The wine walks a tightrope between aromatic exuberance and structural precision, with vibrant acidity providing lift and definition. Mid-palate flavors reveal white peach, lime leaf, and hints of tropical fruit, while a distinctive mineral backbone adds depth and complexity. The texture is simultaneously rich and refreshing, with just a touch of phenolic grip adding interest."}

records.name: Vina Aljibes Sauvignon Blanc 2021
records.description: Vina Aljibes Sauvignon Blanc 2021 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.name: Vina Memorias Del Rambam Blanc (MD & DC)
records.description: A kosher Mevushal white blend from Viña Memorias, a family winery located in the Protected Designation of Origin Utiel-Requena with privileged high-altitude terroir 70 km inland from Valencia. Named after Rabbi Moshe ben Maimon (the Rambam), this wine blends 80% Macabeo with 20% Sauvignon Blanc and is certified kosher by OU and Rabbi Padwa.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a straw yellow hue with light green golden reflections. The nose is rich with floral notes dominated by white blossoms and acacia. Bright citrus aromas of lemon and grapefruit emerge alongside tropical fruit notes of pineapple and passion fruit, the latter contributed by the Sauvignon Blanc component. The high-altitude terroir adds freshness and aromatic intensity.","finish":"The finish is clean and mineral-driven with persistent citrus and tropical fruit notes. The balanced acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while subtle floral echoes provide elegance. The wine's dry nature makes for a versatile food pairing companion.","palate":"Dry and crispy in the mouth, the wine showcases balanced acidity that highlights its pronounced minerality and vibrant fruity notes. The Macabeo provides body and stone fruit flavors of white peach, while the Sauvignon Blanc adds citrus zest and tropical brightness. The high-altitude vineyard location contributes to the wine's refreshing character and aromatic purity."}

records.name: Weinrieder Weissburgunder 2020
records.description: A rich and minerally Weissburgunder (Pinot Blanc) from Weinrieder, a specialist white wine producer in Austria's Weinviertel region. Owner Friedrich Rieder has built a reputation for producing high-quality, fruit-driven wines from the best south and southwest-facing sites in Kleinhadersdorf. The estate's focus on long cool fermentations with extended lees contact creates wines of depth and complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate yet layered aromas showcase the refined nature of Austrian Weissburgunder, with white orchard fruits—particularly ripe pear and golden apple—forming the aromatic core. Subtle almond and hazelnut notes hint at extended lees aging, while gentle floral accents add elegance to the bouquet. Unlike the more exuberant styles of New World Pinot Blanc, this wine shows restraint and precision, with mineral undertones that speak to the wine's terroir. Light honeyed notes emerge as the wine warms, along with whispers of white flowers and fresh bread dough that add complexity without heaviness.","finish":"Clean and mineral-driven, with lingering white fruit notes and a refreshing stony quality that keeps the palate engaged. The soft acidity maintains freshness through the finish, while subtle nutty notes from lees aging add a final layer of complexity. The wine closes with poise and balance.","palate":"The palate is medium-bodied with soft yet persistent acidity that provides structure without sharpness. Rich and minerally, the wine shows excellent texture from extended lees contact in stainless steel tanks, creating a creamy mouthfeel that complements the pure fruit flavors. White peach and pear dominate, supported by subtle stone fruit character and a distinctive mineral backbone that adds depth and interest. The wine's restrained style allows the terroir to shine through, with chalky minerality providing length and complexity. This is a sophisticated expression of Weissburgunder that emphasizes elegance over power."}

records.name: Backsberg Chenin Blanc (White and Blue Label) 2024
records.description: Backsberg Chenin Blanc (White and Blue Label) 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, tropical fruit, minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with citrus","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, lemon, stone fruit"}

records.name: Skylark Pink Belly 2020
records.description: A playful yet serious rosé from California's Central Coast, this Pink Belly bottling reflects Skylark's commitment to crafting wines with personality and authenticity. The wine balances refreshing drinkability with genuine complexity, offering more depth than typical rosé while maintaining the category's essential charm and versatility.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet offers bright aromas of fresh strawberry, watermelon, and wild raspberry, accented by delicate notes of rose petal and white peach. Subtle herbal undertones of lavender and crushed mint add complexity, while a hint of citrus zest and wet stone provide lift and freshness. With time in the glass, subtle notes of red apple and pink peppercorn emerge.","finish":"Clean and refreshing, the finish features lingering notes of red berries and citrus, with a pleasant mineral quality and subtle herbal accent. The wine's balanced acidity leaves the palate cleansed and ready for the next bite, while enough complexity remains to reward contemplative sipping. A faint note of almond skin adds interest on the tail.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with crisp, refreshing acidity, the palate delivers vibrant red fruit flavors of cherry, strawberry, and pomegranate. The wine shows excellent balance between its fruit-forward nature and savory elements, with notes of rhubarb, pink grapefruit, and a distinct mineral quality adding dimension. A touch of texture from skin contact provides weight without heaviness, while bright acidity keeps the wine lively and food-friendly. The mid-palate reveals subtle hints of nectarine and sea salt."}

records.name: Vina Torcida Reserva 2015
records.description: A classic Rioja Reserva from Bodegas Valdemar showcasing the elegance of Tempranillo from Spain's renowned wine region. This well-structured wine balances traditional oak aging with vibrant fruit character, offering exceptional complexity for its category.
records.region: Rioja DOCa, La Rioja Alta, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with balsamic aromas layered with rich, ripe fruit and aromatic spices. Black pepper and clove intermingle with vanilla notes from oak aging, while subtle hints of dried leaves and olives add complexity. The integration of fruit and spice creates an inviting, harmonious bouquet that speaks to careful vinification.","finish":"Long and persistent aftertaste that showcases the wine's excellent structure. The finish maintains the spicy character with lingering notes of sage, pepper, and vanilla, while the fruit evolves to show more succulent, fleshy characteristics. The well-integrated oak provides a smooth, satisfying conclusion.","palate":"Rounded and tasty on the palate with well-structured tannins that provide excellent backbone without overwhelming the fruit. The punchy character is balanced by screechy acidity that lifts flavors of plum and currant, touched up by oaky vanilla. Cherry notes emerge prominently, less sour than typical Riojas at this price point, with surprising complexity including a touch of chocolate and smoke."}

records.name: Sonder Rose 2022
records.description: A contemporary California rosé that embodies the modern approach to pink wine—serious, dry, and food-friendly while maintaining the refreshing character that defines the category. This wine speaks to the growing sophistication of American rosé production, offering complexity and character that rivals European benchmarks.
records.varietal: Blend (likely Grenache, Pinot Noir, and/or Syrah)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with vibrant aromas of wild strawberry, red raspberry, and white peach, accented by delicate floral notes of hibiscus and orange blossom. Subtle herbal undertones of fresh thyme and citrus verbena add dimension, while a distinct mineral quality provides elegance. With time, hints of melon rind, pink grapefruit, and a whisper of salinity emerge, adding coastal character.","finish":"The finish is clean, dry, and refreshing, with lingering berry fruit and citrus notes supported by bright acidity and subtle minerality. A hint of red apple skin and white pepper adds interest, while the wine's balanced structure invites another sip. The savory, dry finish makes this an exceptionally versatile food wine.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with crisp, mouthwatering acidity, the palate delivers bright red berry flavors of strawberry, cranberry, and red cherry, balanced by citrus notes of ruby grapefruit and Meyer lemon. The wine shows textural interest from skin contact, with a subtle phenolic grip that adds weight without heaviness. Mid-palate flavors reveal watermelon, white nectarine, and a pronounced mineral quality that adds sophistication. A savory element of herbs and sea salt keeps the wine complex and food-friendly."}

records.description: Weinrieder Riesling Ried Bockgarten Riesling Ried Bockgarten 2019 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.name: Dolce Vita Blackberry Daiquiri
records.description: A fruit-forward wine cocktail that combines the sweetness of ripe blackberries with tropical daiquiri inspiration, designed for casual enjoyment and warm-weather occasions. This ready-to-drink beverage offers an accessible entry point to wine-based cocktails, balancing fruity sweetness with enough acidity to remain refreshing.
records.varietal: Wine-based cocktail with blackberry and fruit flavoring
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with intense aromas of fresh blackberry, ripe raspberry, and black cherry, layered with tropical notes of pineapple and coconut. Hints of lime zest, rum essence, and vanilla add cocktail-inspired complexity, while a subtle floral note of hibiscus provides lift. The aromatic profile is unabashedly fruity and inviting, with a sweet, candy-like quality.","finish":"The finish is sweet and fruity, with lingering notes of blackberry, lime, and tropical fruit. While not complex, the finish is clean and satisfying for the style, with enough acidity to keep the palate from fatigue. A subtle note of berry skin and citrus zest provides a slightly drier conclusion.","palate":"Medium-bodied with noticeable sweetness balanced by bright acidity, the palate delivers bold flavors of blackberry compote, mixed berry puree, and tropical fruit punch. The wine shows clear daiquiri inspiration with notes of lime, coconut cream, and a hint of rum-like character. Mid-palate sweetness is tempered by citrus acidity, preventing the wine from becoming cloying. Flavors of raspberry sorbet, passion fruit, and a touch of vanilla create a dessert-like but refreshing experience."}

records.name: Mendoza Finca Abril Rapsodia 2013
records.description: An elegant Argentine red blend from Mendoza's high-altitude vineyards, this Rapsodia bottling represents the sophisticated evolution of Argentine winemaking beyond single-varietal Malbec. The wine showcases the complexity achievable through careful blending and extended aging, offering a harmonious expression of Mendoza's diverse terroir and winemaking artistry.
records.varietal: Proprietary blend (likely Malbec-based with Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, and/or Bonarda)
records.region: Mendoza, Argentina (likely high-altitude sub-region such as Uco Valley or Luján de Cuyo)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The mature bouquet opens with evolved aromas of dried cherry, plum compote, and blackberry preserves, layered with notes of leather, tobacco leaf, and cedar box. Secondary aromas of vanilla, mocha, and dark chocolate from oak aging are well-integrated, while tertiary notes of dried herbs, eucalyptus, and forest floor add complexity. With air, hints of fig, prune, and a distinctive mineral quality characteristic of high-altitude Mendoza fruit emerge.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with well-integrated tannins supporting persistent flavors of dark fruit, tobacco, and exotic spices. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried herbs fade gracefully, while subtle oak influence adds vanilla and cedar nuances. The wine's mature complexity and elegant structure showcase the rewards of patience with quality Argentine reds.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with softened, integrated tannins that speak to bottle age, the palate delivers flavors of dark cherry, blackberry, and plum complemented by notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and sweet spice. The wine shows excellent evolution, with primary fruit giving way to complex secondary and tertiary flavors of leather, cigar box, dried fruit, and earthy minerality. Balanced acidity provides freshness despite the wine's maturity, while a silky texture reflects gentle aging. Mid-palate richness reveals layers of cocoa, black tea, anise, and a distinctive graphite note."}

records.name: Bonelli Bonarda Secco 2020
records.description: An authentic expression of Bonarda from Italy's Oltrepò Pavese region in Lombardy, where this variety reaches its finest expression. Bonarda Secco represents the dry style of this indigenous grape, offering rustic charm and food-friendly versatility that has made it a staple of northern Italian tables for generations.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting aromas of sun-ripened plums and black cherries, layered with dried violet petals and a subtle earthy undertone. Notes of crushed herbs, particularly oregano and bay leaf, mingle with hints of leather and tobacco from the variety's characteristic savory profile. A whisper of balsamic reduction adds complexity without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish is satisfying and persistent, with dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to savory herbal notes and a pleasantly dry, mouth-cleansing quality. The tannins are well-integrated, leaving a velvety texture and inviting you back for another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a rustic, authentic character that speaks to Bonarda's traditional winemaking. The palate delivers juicy dark cherry and blackberry flavors supported by moderate tannins that provide grip without astringency. The wine's natural acidity cuts through with refreshing precision, while subtle notes of black tea, dried herbs, and a mineral edge add layers of interest. There's an appealing earthiness reminiscent of forest floor and wild mushrooms."}

records.name: William Downie Cathedral Pinot Noir 2024
records.description: An exceptional value Pinot Noir from one of Gippsland's rising stars, William Downie. The 2024 Cathedral earned an impressive 93 points from Jane Faulkner in the Halliday Wine Companion, confirming this wine's status as one of Australia's best-value Pinot Noirs. This multi-regional blend combines fruit from four distinct Victorian regions - approximately 40% Upper Goulburn, 35% King Valley, 15% Alpine Valleys, and 10% Mornington Peninsula - showcasing Downie's expertise gained from Burgundy and work with iconic Australian producers. Bottled unfiltered and unfined, this is Pinot Noir at its most authentic and engaging.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir from four distinct cool-climate Victorian regions
records.region: Multi-regional Victorian blend: 40% Upper Goulburn, 35% King Valley, 15% Alpine Valleys, 10% Mornington Peninsula, Australia
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with bright, vibrant aromatics characteristic of well-made cool-climate Pinot Noir. Intense notes of raspberry and red currant lead, joined by fresh pomegranate and wild strawberry that showcase the wine's purity of fruit. Delicate floral aromas of rose petal and violet add elegance and lift. Subtle earthy notes emerge with aeration - think forest floor and mushroom - alongside a distinctive cherry pit character that adds complexity. The aromatics are fresh, precise, and inviting, showing excellent varietal expression.","finish":"The finish is medium to long with persistent red fruit and earthy notes. Fine-grained tannins provide structure without astringency, a hallmark of quality Pinot Noir. The wine's natural acidity keeps the palate refreshed and engaged, while the unfined/unfiltered approach contributes to a textural richness that lingers. A subtle savory quality emerges on the finish, adding to the wine's food-friendly character and overall complexity.","palate":"The palate is juicy, earthy, and irresistibly engaging, delivering exactly what great Pinot Noir should offer. Bright red fruit flavors dominate - raspberry, red cherry, and cranberry - with a vibrant, almost electric quality from the cool-climate sites. The texture is silky and refined despite being unfiltered and unfined, demonstrating Downie's minimal intervention approach. Earthy undertones add depth and interest, while subtle whole-cluster spice notes contribute complexity. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit purity, earthy complexity, and structural elements. Despite the challenging 2024 vintage conditions, the wine maintains freshness and precision."}

records.name: Wonderment Wines Burton Ranch Zinfandel 2016
records.description: An expressive California Zinfandel from the 2016 vintage, showcasing the concentrated, full-bodied character that defines premium Zinfandel from established vineyard sites. This wine from Burton Ranch demonstrates the jammy, briary qualities and complex spice notes characteristic of older-vine fruit from California's warmer appellations.
records.region: California (likely Sonoma County or Amador County based on style)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of blackberry jam, dark cherry compote, and ripe boysenberry, displaying the concentrated fruit character typical of warmer-climate Zinfandel. Distinctive notes of anise, black pepper, and baking spices emerge alongside sweet vanilla oak and hints of dried fig. The aromatic profile shows cedar, tobacco leaf, and subtle eucalyptus, suggesting complexity from extended oak aging and fruit from mature vineyard sources. Concentrated jammy fruit dominates while maintaining varietal authenticity.","finish":"The finish is long and warming with persistent dark fruit flavors and gentle spice. Notes of black pepper, anise, and cedar linger alongside sweet berry essence and vanilla oak. The wine's alcohol presence adds warmth without harshness, typical of quality Zinfandel's generous character. Integrated tannins and developed complexity suggest the wine is at optimal maturity, showcasing California Zinfandel's aging potential when properly cellared.","palate":"The palate delivers full-bodied richness with flavors of blackberry preserves, plum, and black cherry liqueur characteristic of ripe Zinfandel from warm regions. Notes of anise, white pepper, and sweet baking spices add complexity alongside cedar and vanilla from oak influence. The wine shows robust structure with moderate tannins and balanced acidity preventing the wine from tasting flabby despite concentrated fruit. Mid-palate reveals briary bramble notes, leather, and dark chocolate, while maintained freshness preserves drinkability. At 9 years of age, the 2016 shows developing tertiary complexity."}

records.name: Terra Dives Evia Grillo 2023
records.description: A fresh and vibrant expression of Grillo from Sicily, showcasing the indigenous white grape's transformation from bulk wine variety to quality-focused table wine. Terra Dives captures the Mediterranean essence of this ancient island, where intense sunshine and maritime breezes create wines of remarkable character and brightness.
records.region: Sicily, Italy - likely western Sicily where Grillo thrives
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet bursts with aromas of ripe white peach and honeydew melon, intertwined with bright citrus notes of Meyer lemon and grapefruit zest. Distinctive white flower notes of jasmine and orange blossom add elegance, while subtle hints of dried herbs—particularly fennel and thyme—reference Sicily's aromatic landscape. A saline mineral quality evokes the nearby Mediterranean sea.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with citrus peel and stone fruit flavors persisting alongside that characteristic almond note. A crisp, mineral-driven conclusion leaves the palate refreshed and eager for food, demonstrating Grillo's excellent balance between richness and acidity.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with excellent texture and weight, characteristic of well-made Grillo. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of golden apple, pear, and apricot, balanced by vibrant acidity that keeps the wine fresh and lively. A distinctive almond and hazelnut note emerges mid-palate, adding complexity, while the wine's natural phenolic structure provides a pleasant grip. The maritime influence manifests as a subtle salinity that enhances the wine's food-pairing versatility."}

records.name: Merite Merlot 2015
records.description: A mature Merlot showing the development and complexity that comes with proper aging. This 2015 vintage has evolved beyond primary fruit into tertiary characteristics while maintaining the supple texture and approachable nature that makes Merlot beloved worldwide. The wine demonstrates how quality Merlot rewards patience.
records.region: Origin uncertain - likely European or New World premium region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The developed bouquet showcases evolved aromas of dried cherry, fig, and plum preserves, layered with complex tertiary notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and leather. A subtle earthiness reminiscent of forest floor and dried mushrooms adds depth, while hints of vanilla and baking spices speak to oak aging. Delicate floral notes of dried rose petals provide an elegant counterpoint to the savory elements.","finish":"The finish is long and harmonious, with dark fruit flavors gradually fading into earthy, spicy notes. Hints of mocha and toasted nuts linger pleasantly, while the silky tannins leave a refined, elegant impression that invites contemplation.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a velvety, seamless texture that exemplifies aged Merlot at its finest. The palate reveals flavors of mature black cherry, blackberry compote, and dark plum, integrated with notes of milk chocolate, espresso, and sweet pipe tobacco. The tannins have softened beautifully with age, providing structure without grip. Layers of savory umami characters—soy, dried herbs, and black olive—add complexity, while balanced acidity maintains freshness despite the wine's maturity."}

records.name: Noble Hill Estate Reserve White 2022
records.description: An elegant white blend from Noble Hill Estate, one of Stellenbosch's pioneering organic vineyards on the slopes of the Simonsberg mountains. This Reserve White showcases the estate's commitment to regenerative organic farming and minimal intervention winemaking, producing wines with distinctive mineral character derived from their ancient granite soils.
records.varietal: White blend (likely Chenin Blanc and/or Viognier based on estate portfolio)
records.region: Stellenbosch, South Africa - Simonsberg mountain slopes
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with pristine aromas of white peach, pear, and green apple, lifted by vibrant citrus notes of lime zest and lemon verbena. Delicate white flowers—jasmine and elderflower—add elegance, while subtle hints of wet stone and flinty minerality speak to the granite terroir. Oak influence is restrained, contributing gentle notes of vanilla bean and toasted almond without overwhelming the pure fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven, with citrus and stone fruit flavors persisting alongside the wine's stony core. The acidity remains bright and refreshing, leaving the palate cleansed and eager for food. Subtle oak spice and a saline quality linger, demonstrating the wine's complexity and balance.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent textural depth and a distinctive mineral backbone that defines Noble Hill's wines. The palate delivers flavors of ripe stone fruit—apricot and nectarine—balanced by crisp green apple and Meyer lemon. The wine's natural phenolic structure provides subtle grip and weight, while vibrant acidity maintains freshness and energy. Mid-palate reveals layers of white flowers, crushed herbs, and that characteristic granite-derived minerality. A touch of leesy complexity adds breadth without heaviness."}

records.name: ZaHa Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: ZaHa, meaning 'Heart' in the Huarpe language, produces this expressive Cabernet Sauvignon from Argentina's prestigious Uco Valley in Mendoza. The 2019 vintage showcases the high-altitude terroir with concentrated fruit and elegant structure, reflecting meticulous vineyard management and modern winemaking techniques.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with captivating aromas of ripe blackberry and cassis, layered with notes of blackcurrant leaf and wild herbs. Subtle undertones of tobacco, green coffee bean, and roasted spices add complexity, while hints of dried mushroom and earthy minerality speak to the wine's terroir. The aromatic profile is both rich and nuanced, promising depth on the palate.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors complemented by hints of fresh herbs and subtle oak. The tannins remain refined and well-integrated, leaving a pleasant grip and inviting another sip.","palate":"Fresh and rich on the palate, this Cabernet delivers juicy black cherry flavors alongside concentrated blackberry and fig. Tarry notes and roasted spices weave through the fruit, adding layers of complexity and interest. The wine's fine-grained tannin structure provides elegant support without overwhelming the fruit, while balanced acidity keeps everything lifted and harmonious. Medium to full-bodied with impressive concentration."}

records.description: Zephaniah Merlot 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Wooden Gift Box Abadia de Acon 6 Bottle
records.description: A premium Spanish wine gift box featuring six bottles from the prestigious Abadía de Acón estate in Ribera del Duero. This collection showcases the winery's commitment to traditional winemaking techniques combined with modern viticulture, offering a comprehensive tasting journey through their range of Tempranillo-based wines aged to various specifications.
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"This gift collection represents wines with enchanting aromatic profiles dominated by bright raspberry and blackcurrant notes, intertwined with herbal undertones of mint and Mediterranean herbs. Rich chocolate and vanilla aromatics emerge from barrel aging, complemented by subtle cedar wood nuances. Each bottle in the collection displays the characteristic intensity of ripe red and black berries that define Ribera del Duero Tempranillo, with appealing notes of cocoa and liquorice adding depth and complexity.","finish":"An elegant, lengthy finish characterizes these wines, with the tannins integrating seamlessly into the fruit structure. The finish carries notes of concentrated berries, chocolate, and subtle spice, demonstrating the wines' aging potential. These bottles show remarkable staying power on the palate, with flavors evolving and deepening even on the second day after opening—a hallmark of well-crafted Ribera del Duero wines designed for cellaring.","palate":"The wines in this collection deliver deep, rich palates with velvety tannin structures that provide both power and elegance. Expect concentrated ripe fruit flavors of blackcurrant and cherry, enveloped in milk chocolate and vanilla from oak maturation. The palate is harmonious and well-balanced, with a delicate vein of acidity that keeps the wines fresh and food-friendly. The soft, plump texture belies the serious winemaking behind these bottles, offering juicy fruit character that speaks to the quality of the terroir."}

records.name: ZaHa Cabernet Franc 2019
records.description: ZaHa Cabernet Franc 2019 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
