records.name: ZaHa Cabernet Franc 2021
records.description: An exceptional expression of Cabernet Franc from Argentina's acclaimed Toko Vineyard in Paraje Altamira, Uco Valley. Grown at 4,000 feet elevation on limestone-rich soils, this wine earned 93/100 from critics for its pure, direct fruit expression and distinctive high-altitude character, fermented with 35% whole clusters and aged in cement eggs.
records.region: Paraje Altamira, Uco Valley, Mendoza, Argentina
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic varietal aromatics lead with green bell pepper and fresh plum, complemented by delicate violet and wildflower notes that speak to the high-altitude terroir. Black peppercorn adds a spicy lift, while subtle herbal nuances of dried sage and tobacco leaf emerge with air. The limestone soils contribute a mineral thread that runs through the aromatic profile, adding complexity beyond simple fruit expression.","finish":"Long and mineral-driven, with red fruit flavors persisting alongside herbal and tobacco notes. The limestone terroir signature becomes most apparent here, leaving a chalky, refreshing impression that invites another sip.","palate":"The palate displays Cabernet Franc's very direct and fruity expression, showcasing ripe red fruits—cherry, raspberry, and cranberry—with impressive clarity and precision. Notes of fresh herbs and earthy tobacco weave through the fruit core, while the whole-cluster fermentation adds textural interest and subtle grip. Firm tannins provide structure without heaviness, supported by juicy acidity that reflects the cool nights at altitude. The cement egg aging preserves purity while adding subtle textural roundness."}

records.name: Zephaniah Adeline 2020
records.description: A distinguished red blend showcasing the craftsmanship of small-production winemaking. This wine exemplifies elegant fruit concentration with structured tannins and notable aging potential. The 2020 vintage benefits from favorable growing conditions, producing a wine of depth and complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of blackberry compote and dark cherry, interwoven with hints of crushed violets and wild herbs. As the wine breathes, secondary notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and a subtle minerality emerge, adding layers of complexity. A whisper of vanilla and baking spice from oak aging rounds out the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is lengthy and sophisticated, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to notes of espresso and dried herbs. Tannins remain firm yet refined, suggesting excellent cellaring potential through 2030 and beyond.","palate":"On the palate, the wine reveals concentrated flavors of ripe black plum and cassis, supported by fine-grained tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate richness is balanced by bright acidity that lifts the dark fruit flavors. Notes of black pepper, graphite, and dark chocolate add savory depth, while integrated oak contributes subtle warmth and spice."}

records.name: ZaHa El Corte 2021
records.description: ZaHa El Corte 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.

records.name: Zephaniah Chambourcin 2021
records.description: Zephaniah Farm Vineyard's 2021 Chambourcin earned a Silver Medal at the prestigious 2025 Governor's Cup, showcasing Virginia's growing expertise with French-American hybrid varieties. Handcrafted with skill and passion on a third-generation working farm in Loudoun County, this wine represents one of the finest examples of Chambourcin from Northern Virginia. Zephaniah is consistently ranked among the Top 50 Northern Virginia wineries and has built a reputation for producing some of the best Chambourcin in the state.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with rich, deep aromas of black cherry and plum, enveloped in a distinctive smoky ambience that sets this apart from typical red wines. Layers of baking spice emerge - cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove - adding warmth and complexity. The wine shows surprising elegance for a hybrid variety, with subtle violet and dried herb notes complementing the dark fruit core. There's an earthy, forest floor character that speaks to the terroir of Loudoun County.","finish":"The finish is long and spicy, with baking spice notes of cinnamon and vanilla lingering alongside dark fruit. The smoky character returns on the close, adding complexity and interest. The wine's versatility shines through - it works beautifully at cellar temperature or slightly chilled, and even shows potential as a mulled wine base due to its inherent spice character.","palate":"On the palate, the wine is flavorful and bold yet shows excellent balance. Black cherry and mixed berry flavors dominate, supported by notes of pine and even tree pitch that give the wine a distinctive character. The texture is super mellow with silky tannins, while bright acidity provides structure and lift. There's a pleasant tartness that keeps the wine fresh, with new fruit flavors continuing to emerge as the wine opens. The body is medium to full, with concentration that belies the challenging growing conditions of the 2021 vintage."}

records.name: Zephaniah Chambourcin 2017
records.description: Zephaniah Farm Vineyard in Leesburg, Virginia is recognized as one of the state's Top 100 wineries and has earned particular acclaim for their Chambourcin wines, with the 2021 vintage receiving a silver medal at the Governor's Cup. The 2017 vintage showcases the winery's expertise with this French-American hybrid grape, demonstrating how Virginia producers have mastered this variety to create wines of depth and character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a complex array of dark fruit aromatics, led by black cherry compote and ripe plum, with undertones of blackberry preserves. There's a distinctive smoky quality reminiscent of a wood-fired hearth, alongside notes of black pepper, clove, and dried tobacco leaf. Subtle earthy elements emerge, including forest floor and dried leaves, while a hint of vanilla and oak spice adds complexity from barrel aging.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent notes of dark fruit and warming spice. A subtle smokiness lingers alongside dried herb notes of sage and thyme, while the tannins remain soft and well-integrated. The wine's mature character is evident, showing the benefits of six years of aging with smooth, rounded edges and harmonious integration of all components.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with rich, concentrated dark fruit flavors anchored by black cherry and dark plum. The wine shows good structural backbone with moderate tannins that have softened nicely with age, creating a smooth, approachable mouthfeel. Baking spices including cinnamon and nutmeg appear on the mid-palate, complemented by hints of coffee and dark cocoa. There's a pleasant tartness that provides balance, keeping the wine from becoming overly heavy or jammy."}

records.name: Zephaniah Rose NV
records.description: Zephaniah Rose NV is a delightful rosé capturing summer enjoyment. Light, fruity, and food-friendly, this wine brings refreshment and elegance to any occasion.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh strawberry, watermelon, rose petal, subtle citrus","finish":"Clean, crisp finish with bright fruit character","palate":"Light-bodied with refreshing acidity, flavors of red berries and melon"}

records.name: Zephaniah Steamship White 2018
records.description: Zephaniah Steamship White 2018 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, hints of tropical fruit and minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, flavors of lemon, stone fruit, elegant texture"}

records.description: Zephaniah Three Captains Red 2017 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining experiences.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, hints of tobacco, leather, and dried herbs","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering oak and dark fruit notes","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit flavors, balanced acidity, notes of cocoa and spices"}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2012
records.description: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2012 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Noble Hill Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: A crisp, organic Sauvignon Blanc from Noble Hill's prestigious estate on the Simonsberg mountainside in Franschhoek, South Africa. This small-batch wine reflects the winery's dedication to minimal intervention and organic farming, showcasing the natural character of their mountain vineyards.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant aromatics of citrus and tropical fruit, with notes of grapefruit, lime zest, and passionfruit leading the way. Subtle herbaceous undertones reminiscent of fresh-cut grass and elderflower add complexity. Mineral notes suggesting wet stone and flint provide an elegant backdrop, while hints of green bell pepper speak to the wine's varietal character.","finish":"The finish is bright and persistent with lingering citrus and mineral notes. Crisp acidity leaves the palate refreshed and cleansed, making this an excellent wine for multiple courses.","palate":"Fresh and lively on the palate with crisp acidity that energizes the tasting experience. Flavors of zesty lemon, pink grapefruit, and green apple dominate, supported by tropical notes of guava and passion fruit. The organic farming practices shine through in the wine's pure, unadulterated fruit expression. A subtle mineral backbone adds structure and length, while the wine maintains an elegant, light-bodied profile. The texture is clean and refreshing with good concentration."}

records.name: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2018
records.description: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Backsberg Pumphouse Shiraz 2018
records.description: Backsberg Pumphouse Shiraz 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Backsberg Smuggled Vines Chardonnay 2024
records.description: Backsberg Smuggled Vines Chardonnay 2024 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, tropical fruit, minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with citrus","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, lemon, stone fruit"}

records.name: Backsberg Sydney Back Chardonnay 2021
records.description: The Backsberg Sydney Back Chardonnay represents South Africa's modern approach to this classic varietal, named after the winery's founder. Crafted from premium Paarl fruit, this wine showcases a judicious balance of Old World elegance and New World fruit intensity. The 2021 vintage benefited from ideal growing conditions, producing a wine of exceptional purity and focus.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals complex layers of ripe yellow apple, white peach, and citrus blossom, interwoven with subtle notes of toasted hazelnut and vanilla from oak integration. Hints of butterscotch and crème brûlée emerge with aeration, while underlying minerality suggests limestone-influenced soils. The aromatic intensity is impressive, displaying both varietal purity and thoughtful winemaking intervention.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent notes of citrus zest, toasted almonds, and subtle oak spice. The wine's fresh acidity ensures a clean conclusion while the richness of texture lingers pleasantly. This is a well-crafted Chardonnay that speaks to both fruit quality and winemaking skill.","palate":"On the palate, the wine shows excellent weight and texture, with flavors of baked pear, golden delicious apple, and lemon curd taking center stage. Well-integrated oak contributes notes of toasted brioche and sweet spice without overwhelming the fruit. The wine's creamy mouthfeel, likely from partial malolactic fermentation and lees stirring, is beautifully balanced by vibrant acidity that provides lift and freshness. Mid-palate richness gives way to a more mineral-driven character, showcasing the wine's complexity and structure."}

records.name: Bloem Syrah Mourvèdre 2021
records.description: From the prestigious Simonsberg-Paarl region of South Africa, this Rhône-style blend captures the essence of the Cape Floral Kingdom with distinctive terroir expression. Produced by Noble Hill winery, the 2021 vintage showcases the synergy between Syrah's structure and Mourvèdre's aromatic complexity, with winemaking focused on freshness and purity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers refreshing black currant and cherry fruit aromas balanced with exotic spice notes of cardamom, coriander, and white pepper. Earthy undertones of garrigue, dried lavender, and Mediterranean herbs add complexity, while subtle hints of violet and dark chocolate provide additional layers. The aromatic profile is clean and vibrant, showcasing the wine's focus on fresh fruit expression rather than heavy oak influence.","finish":"The finish is dry and lingering with persistent dark fruit and spice notes. A hint of exotic spice and earthy minerality emerges at the end, leaving the palate refreshed and satisfied.","palate":"Smooth and medium-weight on the palate with supple blackberry, black cherry, and plum flavors. The wine's clean, creamy texture is immediately appealing, enhanced by exotic spice notes that weave throughout. Black pepper, dried herbs, and subtle earthy undertones add depth and complexity without overwhelming the fruit. Balanced acidity maintains freshness and lift, while soft tannins provide gentle structure. The overall impression is one of elegance and restraint, with excellent integration of all elements."}

records.name: Bierzo Pilgrim Godello 2021
records.description: Bierzo Pilgrim Godello 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Bierzo Pilgrim Godello 2023
records.description: Bierzo Pilgrim Godello 2023 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.

records.name: Bloem Chenin Blanc Viognier 2023
records.description: An innovative South African blend that marries Chenin Blanc's versatility with Viognier's aromatic intensity. This wine represents the modern Cape winemaking approach, combining traditional varietals with creative blending.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Expressive aromatics leap from the glass, dominated by Viognier's signature apricot and honeysuckle notes interwoven with Chenin's quince and yellow apple. The bouquet is enhanced by orange blossom, ripe papaya, and a hint of sweet spice reminiscent of cardamom. Underlying all is a subtle lanolin character that adds textural interest.","finish":"The finish is generous and lingering, with the stone fruit flavors persisting alongside a gentle phenolic grip. A touch of white pepper spice emerges at the end, with refreshing citrus acidity providing balance and lift.","palate":"The entry is rich and textured, with Viognier's viscous mouthfeel balanced by Chenin Blanc's vibrant acidity. Flavors of ripe stone fruits—peach and nectarine—mingle with tropical notes of pineapple and mango. A creamy texture develops mid-palate, likely from lees contact, while the Chenin provides freshness and structure. Subtle notes of honey and candied ginger add complexity."}

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, apple, brioche, almond, floral","finish":"Refreshing finish with effervescence","palate":"Light-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity"}

records.name: Chateau Haut Maco Jean Bernard 2018
records.description: Chateau Haut Maco Jean Bernard 2018 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Champagne Bauget-Jouette Carte Blanche (375ml) NV  375 ml
records.description: An elegant French Champagne in convenient half-bottle format, showcasing the traditional méthode champenoise that defines this prestigious region. Carte Blanche typically represents a refined, versatile style with balanced character suitable for various occasions, aged for minimum 15 months to develop classic Champagne complexity.
records.varietal: Traditional Champagne blend (likely Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier, and Chardonnay)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate bubbles carry aromas of green apple, white peach, and citrus blossom, complemented by subtle notes of brioche and almond from lees aging. The bouquet reveals classic Champagne markers of fresh-baked bread, lemon zest, and chalky minerality. Hints of white flowers and a touch of honey add elegance, while the persistent mousse releases delicate yeasty complexity. The nose is refined and inviting, balancing fruit purity with autolytic character from traditional production.","finish":"Clean and refined with lingering citrus, subtle brioche, and mineral notes. The fine bubbles persist through the finish, maintaining freshness and elegance. Balanced acidity and creamy texture leave a harmonious impression, with delicate yeasty complexity and bright fruit carrying through to a crisp conclusion.","palate":"Fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy mousse that carries flavors of crisp apple, pear, and citrus fruit. The traditional method adds layers of complexity with notes of toasted bread, butter croissant, and roasted almonds. Bright acidity provides structure and freshness, balanced by subtle richness from extended lees contact. Mid-weight body with excellent balance between fruit, acidity, and autolytic character. The wine's minerality and clean fruit expression reflect classic Champagne terroir and careful blending of base wines."}

records.name: Vieux Chateau Flouquet Grand Cru 2014
records.description: A mature Bordeaux Grand Cru from the 2014 vintage, now showing the classical development that makes aged Bordeaux so compelling. The 2014 vintage in Bordeaux produced elegant, balanced wines with good acidity and moderate alcohol, wines that have aged gracefully into their second decade. This Saint-Émilion Grand Cru demonstrates the refinement and complexity that proper aging brings.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend - likely Merlot-dominant with Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon
records.region: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru, Bordeaux, France (Right Bank)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The evolved bouquet reveals classic mature Bordeaux characteristics with aromas of dried black cherry, cassis, and plum compote taking center stage. Secondary and tertiary development brings layers of cedar, cigar box, and worn leather, intertwined with notes of dried herbs, particularly thyme and bay leaf. Earthy undertones of truffle, forest floor, and graphite add complexity, while subtle hints of vanilla and tobacco from oak aging are now fully integrated. Delicate floral notes of dried roses provide elegance.","finish":"The finish is long and refined, with dark fruit flavors gradually fading into earthy, cedary notes. The tannins are resolved and velvety, leaving an elegant impression. Hints of graphite minerality and dried herbs linger, while the wine's structure suggests it remains in excellent drinking condition.","palate":"Medium-bodied with the silky, seamless texture that defines well-aged Bordeaux. The tannins have softened beautifully, providing structure without astringency. The palate delivers flavors of mature dark fruit—blackcurrant, black cherry, and plum—layered with savory notes of mushroom, soy, and black olive. Mid-palate reveals tobacco leaf, dark chocolate, and espresso, while the wine's classical acidity maintains freshness and lift. The integration of fruit, tannin, oak, and acidity is harmonious, demonstrating the wine's maturity."}

records.name: Dear Mom White (Dented) NV  187 ml

records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, tropical fruit, minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with citrus","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, lemon, stone fruit"}

records.name: Fernanda Capello Prosecco Brut NV
records.description: A classic Italian sparkling wine from the Veneto region, crafted from Glera grapes in the traditional Prosecco style. This Brut expression offers crisp refreshment with delicate fruit character and lively effervescence, perfect for celebrations or casual aperitifs.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant aromas of green apple and white peach, complemented by subtle floral notes of acacia blossom and honeysuckle. Delicate hints of citrus zest and fresh pear add complexity, while a faint mineral undertone speaks to the wine's terroir. The aromatic profile is clean, bright, and inviting, typical of quality Prosecco production.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering notes of citrus and green apple. A pleasant mineral quality emerges at the end, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip or the next course.","palate":"On the palate, this Brut Prosecco delivers refreshing flavors of crisp green apple, honeydew melon, and citrus, balanced by a gentle sweetness that stays well within the Brut threshold. The wine's fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy mousse that enhances the mouthfeel, while vibrant acidity provides structure and lift. Light notes of almond and bread dough add subtle depth without overwhelming the fresh fruit character."}

records.name: Fledge & Co. Fortitude Vincimus Red Blend 2021
records.description: Fledge & Co. Fortitude Vincimus Red Blend 2021 is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Domaine d'Avrille Anjou Rouge 2023
records.description: A fresh, fruit-forward Loire Valley red from Ch�teau d'Avrill�, a benchmark estate owned by the Biotteau family for four generations. This Anjou Rouge showcases the region's signature Cabernet Franc character with an emphasis on approachable, early-drinking pleasure. The 200-hectare estate in Saint-Jean-des-Mauvrets is known for classic Loire Valley expressions.
records.varietal: Cabernet Franc (potentially with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon or Gamay)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers classic Loire Valley Cabernet Franc aromatics with bright red berry fruits, violet florals, and distinctive herbaceous notes. Fresh strawberry and raspberry lead, complemented by bell pepper and crushed herbs characteristic of the varietal. Subtle earth and mineral notes reflect the cool-climate terroir, while hints of pencil shavings and graphite add complexity.","finish":"The finish is fresh and lively with lingering red fruit and subtle herbal notes. Bright acidity and fine tannins create a thirst-quenching conclusion that makes this an ideal food wine for casual dining.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with vibrant acidity and soft tannins designed for early enjoyment. The emphasis is squarely on fresh fruit, with flavors of red cherry, strawberry, and cranberry supported by herbal undertones and mineral freshness. The wine shows excellent varietal typicity with Cabernet Franc's signature peppery spice and leafy character balanced by ripe, juicy fruit. Clean and refreshing with good energy and lift."}

records.name: Domaine d'Avrille Sauvignon Blanc 2023
records.description: A classic Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc from Domaine d'Avrillé, expressing the pure, mineral-driven character of this celebrated French wine region. This wine showcases the restrained elegance and terroir expression that distinguishes Loire Sauvignon from its New World counterparts.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Precise and focused aromas of citrus blossom, green apple, and white grapefruit lead the way with characteristic Loire refinement. Notes of wet stone, flint, and crushed limestone create a distinct mineral framework, while subtle herbal elements of cut grass, nettle, and white pepper add complexity. A hint of gooseberry and passion fruit provides gentle tropical intrigue without overwhelming the wine's elegant profile.","finish":"Crisp, clean finish with lingering citrus and stony mineral notes. The wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate wonderfully refreshed with a subtle saline persistence.","palate":"Bright, razor-sharp acidity drives the palate with energizing freshness and purity. Flavors of lemon, lime, and green apple dominate with focused intensity, supported by pronounced minerality that speaks to the Loire's limestone-rich soils. The mid-palate remains lean and precise with subtle notes of white flowers and a saline quality that adds dimension. This is Sauvignon Blanc in its most classic, terroir-driven expression."}

records.name: Jean Leon 3055 Chardonnay 2024
records.description: A vibrant, modern-style Chardonnay from the prestigious Jean Leon estate in Penedès, Spain. This certified organic and vegan white wine showcases 30-year-old vines grown in clay-limestone soils, fermented in stainless steel to emphasize purity and freshness.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Brilliant, limpid pale yellow in appearance. The nose possesses exquisite aromatic power with intense tropical fruit notes dominating the profile. White peach and exotic fruits like pineapple and mango create a compelling bouquet, complemented by an intriguing aniseed nuance reminiscent of fennel. The aromatics are clean, pure, and inviting, showcasing the varietal character beautifully.","finish":"The conclusion is long, lingering, and elegant, with the vibrant acidity carrying the tropical fruit notes through to a clean, refreshing finale. Balanced and harmonious finish that leaves the palate refreshed.","palate":"Fresh and vibrant entry with high acidity that adds remarkable freshness to the wine. The tropical fruit character continues across the palate, flowing with elegant acidity that provides energy and lift. White peach flavors are pronounced, supported by the wine's clean, stainless steel-fermented profile. The texture is crisp rather than creamy, emphasizing fruit purity over oak influence. Long and persistent with excellent balance between fruit concentration and refreshing acidity."}

records.name: ZaHa El Corte 2015
records.description: An artisanal Spanish red from the 2015 vintage, now showing the complexity and integration that comes with nearly a decade of aging. Spanish reds from 2015 benefited from excellent growing conditions, producing wines with concentration, balance, and aging potential. This wine represents the character and terroir of Spain's diverse wine regions.
records.varietal: Likely Tempranillo-based blend or possibly Garnacha/Cariñena from Priorat
records.region: Spain - likely Ribera del Duero, Rioja, or Priorat
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The mature bouquet reveals evolved aromas of dark cherry, blackberry, and dried fig, layered with complex notes of leather saddle, tobacco leaf, and cedar. Distinctive Spanish characters emerge with hints of dried Mediterranean herbs—rosemary, thyme, and sage—alongside earthy notes of forest floor and aged balsamic. Subtle spice notes of clove, cinnamon, and black pepper add warmth, while integrated oak contributes vanilla and cocoa without dominating. A mineral edge provides backbone.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with dark fruit and savory flavors persisting alongside well-integrated tannins. The wine's structure remains firm but refined, demonstrating excellent aging potential still ahead. Hints of spice, earth, and dark chocolate linger, leaving a memorable impression that speaks to the wine's quality and maturity.","palate":"Full-bodied with the concentrated, muscular structure typical of premium Spanish reds, now softened and integrated through aging. The palate delivers rich flavors of mature dark fruit—blackberry compote, plum, and black cherry—balanced by savory elements of cured meat, black olive, and umami. The tannins have mellowed beautifully, providing grip and texture without roughness. Mid-palate reveals layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet spice, while the wine maintains surprising freshness thanks to Spain's natural acidity. Notes of licorice and graphite add complexity."}

records.name: Hendry Albarino 2023
records.description: Hendry Vineyard's 2023 Albariño earned impressive accolades including 94 points from FMW and 90 points from Wine Advocate, establishing it as one of California's finest expressions of this Spanish variety. The wine steers clear of oak influence, allowing the varietal's natural floral and citrus character to shine at full intensity. Sourced from Hendry's estate vineyards in Napa Valley's cooler climate blocks, this Albariño showcases what happens when traditional Spanish varieties meet California's exceptional terroir. At approximately $22.95-$28, it represents outstanding value for estate-grown Napa wine.
records.varietal: 100% Albariño (Spanish variety adapted to Napa terroir)
records.region: Napa Valley, California, USA (estate-grown from cooler climate blocks)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose commences with a bright, vibrant bouquet of citrus - lime, lemon zest, and grapefruit - that immediately captures attention. Wonderfully floral aromatics of honeysuckle, white flowers, and jasmine add elegance and lift to the citrus core. Wine Advocate notes the variety's 'floral and lime notes shine at full force' without oak interference. Layers of ripe pear and white peach emerge, while intriguing hints of graphite and slate minerality add complexity. The cooler climate blocks produce aromatics of remarkable intensity and purity.","finish":"The finish is crisp, refreshing and remarkably long for an unoaked white wine. Slate minerality becomes more pronounced, accented by honeysuckle and citrus zest that linger on the palate. The wine's natural acidity keeps everything bright and lively, making it an ideal 'summer sipper' with peachy notes persisting through the close. This is Albariño that honors its Spanish roots while expressing unmistakable Napa character.","palate":"Medium-bodied with exceptional vibrancy, the palate presents pear, melon, lemon, and lime flavors in beautiful harmony. Mineral-driven energy courses through the wine with gorgeous pure white stone fruit at its heart. The texture is silky yet precise, with refreshing acidity providing structure and lift. Hendry's estate fruit quality shines through in the wine's concentration and purity of flavor. Melon and pear notes round out the mid-palate before the wine tightens up, leading to a crisp, invigorating finish. The absence of oak allows every nuance of fruit and terroir to express itself clearly."}

records.name: Hendry Albarino 2020
records.description: A distinctive expression of Spanish Albariño grown in Napa Valley's unique terroir, combining the varietal's characteristic botanical aromatics with California's ripe fruit intensity. Hendry's approach honors the grape's origins while showcasing what premium Napa viticulture can achieve with this Atlantic variety.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Pronounced aromatic intensity featuring distinctive botanical notes of orange blossom, lemon verbena, and white flowers. Ripe apricot and yellow peach aromas dominate, complemented by citrus undertones of lime zest and grapefruit pith. Subtle hints of wet stone minerality and fresh-cut grass add complexity, with a delicate almond note providing textural interest reminiscent of the grape's characteristically thick skins.","finish":"Crisp and refreshing with pronounced acidity carrying through the moderately long finish. Citrus and stone fruit linger with bright clarity, while a subtle hint of pleasant bitterness from the skins adds dimension. The mineral quality persists, leaving a clean, mouth-watering impression.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with vibrant, high acidity that defines the varietal. The palate bursts with citrus flavors of Meyer lemon, pink grapefruit, and tangerine, balanced by stone fruit notes of white peach and nectarine. A subtle textural grip from the grape's natural tannins provides interesting complexity without bitterness. The wine's freshness is exceptional, with crisp mineral notes and a slight saline quality that enhances the pure fruit flavors."}

records.name: Shabo Sparkling Grand Reserve NV
records.description: This Ukrainian sparkling wine from the renowned Shabo winery represents traditional method production with careful blending across vintages. The Grand Reserve designation indicates extended aging on lees for added complexity and refined mousse.
records.varietal: Traditional blend (likely Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and/or local varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals delicate aromas of green apple and white peach, complemented by fresh bread crust and subtle almond notes from extended lees aging. Floral hints of acacia and honeysuckle add elegance, while a touch of citrus zest provides brightness. The bouquet shows the refinement expected from a Grand Reserve designation.","finish":"The finish is clean and mineral-driven, with citrus notes lingering alongside subtle toast and a pleasant chalky texture. The mousse remains delicate and persistent through the finish.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on entry, the palate features flavors of pear, lemon curd, and stone fruits, supported by a creamy mousse and fine, persistent bubbles. The wine shows good depth from its reserve blend, with layers of brioche and hazelnut emerging mid-palate. Well-balanced acidity keeps the wine lively despite its richness, while the extended lees contact adds textural complexity."}

records.name: Crosarola Amarone 2021
records.description: A contemporary Amarone della Valpolicella from the Veneto region, crafted using the traditional appassimento method where grapes are dried for several months before fermentation. The 2021 vintage is relatively young for Amarone, offering concentrated fruit and power while hinting at the complexity that will develop with further aging. This wine showcases the intensity and richness that makes Amarone one of Italy's most prestigious wine styles.
records.varietal: Traditional Amarone blend: Corvina, Rondinella, and Corvinone (possibly with Molinara)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The powerful bouquet displays intense aromas of black cherry, ripe plum, and fig marmalade, amplified by the appassimento drying process. Rich notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and raisin add depth, while distinctive balsamic and dried herb characters—particularly sage and oregano—provide complexity. Layers of vanilla, cinnamon, and sweet tobacco speak to oak aging, while subtle hints of dried flowers and leather emerge. The wine's concentration is immediately apparent, with waves of aroma continuing to unfold.","finish":"The finish is extraordinarily long and powerful, with concentrated dark fruit flavors extending for 30+ seconds. The tannins are present and grippy—this is young Amarone—but they're balanced by the wine's natural sweetness and alcohol warmth. Notes of chocolate, coffee, and spice linger alongside a pleasantly bitter almond character that cleanses the palate and invites another sip.","palate":"Full to very full-bodied with impressive concentration and weight characteristic of Amarone. The palate delivers explosive flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and prune, intensified by the grape-drying process. Rich secondary notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and caramelized sugar add decadence, while the wine maintains balance through moderate acidity and firm, drying tannins. Mid-palate reveals layers of balsamic reduction, dried figs, sweet spice, and a distinctive bitter almond note typical of the style. Despite the wine's power, there's elegance and precision in how the elements integrate."}

records.name: Pasquiers Cotes du Rhone Rouge 2022
records.description: A classic village-level Côtes du Rhône from the renowned cooperative Les Vignerons d'Estézargues. This approachable red blend showcases the sun-drenched terroir of the southern Rhône Valley with ripe fruit character, traditional blending, and exceptional value for the appellation.
records.varietal: Grenache, Syrah, and traditional Rhône varietals blend
records.region: Côtes du Rhône, Southern Rhône Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Generous aromas of ripe red cherry and wild strawberry lead, accompanied by notes of dried lavender and Provençal herbs. Underlying scents of black pepper, garrigue scrubland, and a subtle earthiness add regional authenticity. Light touches of vanilla and toast from brief oak contact complement rather than dominate the fruit-forward profile.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately persistent, with red fruit and spice notes lingering alongside gentle tannins. Herbal accents and a touch of minerality provide a clean, satisfying conclusion typical of well-made Côtes du Rhône.","palate":"The palate is medium-bodied and supple, offering juicy flavors of dark cherry, raspberry, and plum. Traditional Grenache-driven character shows through with notes of kirsch and red currant, while Syrah adds structure and peppery spice. The wine maintains excellent balance with soft tannins and bright acidity that keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly. A savory quality emerges mid-palate with hints of olive tapenade and dried herbs."}

records.name: Knuttel Family Wines Tentadora Malbec 2018
records.description: Tentadora, meaning 'tempting' in Spanish, is Knuttel Family's expression of New World Malbec showcasing concentrated dark fruit and velvety texture. This wine represents the family's exploration beyond their coastal Pinot Noir roots, crafting a bold, food-friendly red with California sunshine and warmth.
records.region: California (specific AVA unknown, likely warm climate region)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosive aromas of ripe blackberry, blueberry compote, and dark plum leap from the glass with impressive intensity. Layers of violet, dark chocolate, and espresso add richness, while hints of vanilla bean, sweet tobacco, and toasted oak from barrel aging provide complexity. A touch of black pepper and leather adds savory intrigue.","finish":"Long, satisfying finish with persistent dark fruit and subtle spice notes. Velvety tannins grip gently while flavors of blackberry and cocoa linger beautifully with a hint of vanilla on the fade.","palate":"Full-bodied and lush on entry with concentrated flavors of black cherry, boysenberry, and cassis coating the palate. The mid-palate reveals wonderful depth with notes of mocha, dark cocoa, and a hint of caramel from oak integration. Firm yet ripe tannins provide structure while maintaining approachability, balanced by juicy acidity that prevents heaviness."}

records.name: Toro Lui Crianza 2020
records.description: An authentic Crianza from Spain's Toro DO, showcasing the power and elegance of old-vine Tinta de Toro. This wine represents exceptional value from one of Spain's most exciting regions, delivering concentrated fruit character balanced by traditional oak aging that defines the Crianza category.
records.region: Toro DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense aromas of blackberry, black cherry, and ripe plum dominate the nose, enhanced by notes of vanilla, coconut, and toasted oak from Crianza aging. Underlying scents of violets, licorice, and dark chocolate add complexity, while hints of leather and tobacco provide additional depth. The aromatic intensity reflects the concentrated nature of old-vine Tinta de Toro fruit.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with dark fruit, spice, and oak flavors extending generously. Soft tannins and a touch of dark chocolate linger, creating a satisfying and complete conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful, the palate delivers waves of dark fruit including blackberry jam, black currant, and fig. The wine shows impressive concentration balanced by vibrant acidity that prevents heaviness. American oak aging contributes notes of sweet vanilla, dill, and baking spices, while integrated tannins provide structure without astringency. Despite the power, there's elegance and balance, with the fruit remaining the star."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Langhe Dolcetto 2022
records.description: An approachable yet sophisticated Dolcetto from one of Piedmont's respected producers, this wine exemplifies the varietal's characteristic fruit-forward charm while showcasing the elegant tannin structure that defines quality Langhe viticulture. Perfect as an everyday wine that never compromises on character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright, expressive aromatics lead with raspberry and fresh red fruit, complemented by beautiful violet florals and subtle almond notes. Gamey undertones add intrigue, while secondary notes of cola, dried autumn leaves, and forest floor provide earthy complexity that elevates this beyond simple fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is smooth and elegant, with soft tannins extending the wine's approachable character. Lingering notes of red cherry and a whisper of almond skin provide a satisfying conclusion that encourages pairing with food.","palate":"The mouthfeel is notably rich, soft, and supple, showcasing Dolcetto's naturally generous texture. Vibrant red fruit flavors dominate—particularly cherry, raspberry, and cranberry—supported by light, fine-grained tannins and medium acidity. Subtle earthy notes of mushroom and smoke intermingle with hints of vanilla, dark chocolate, and tobacco, adding layers of complexity to the fruit-forward core."}

records.name: Poema Moncao Alvarinho Vinho Verde 2015
records.description: A premium Reserva Alvarinho from the prestigious Monção e Melgaço sub-region of Vinho Verde, produced by Quinta do Louridal. This limited and numbered edition showcases the exceptional quality that can be achieved with extended lees aging in this renowned Alvarinho DOC region.
records.region: Monção e Melgaço DOC, Vinho Verde, Portugal
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with pronounced mineral notes that evolve into exotic lychee and ripe orange aromatics, creating a captivating aromatic profile. The wine's microclimate of hot, dry summers with cool nights contributes to the development of fresh and elegant aromas that speak to the terroir's unique character.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven with persistent citrus and lychee notes. The wine's freshness carries through to the end, balanced by the richness imparted by lees aging.","palate":"The palate is dense and rich, showcasing perfectly balanced fruit flavors with a freshness that results from prolonged aging on fine lees. Layers of lychee, citrus, and stone fruit are supported by a mineral backbone that provides structure and complexity. The wine's texture is notably fuller than typical Vinho Verde, with a creamy mouthfeel that adds richness without sacrificing the region's characteristic freshness."}

records.name: Shabo Grande Reserve Cabernet - Merlot 2023
records.description: A harmonious Ukrainian blend from the historic Shabo estate in Odessa, combining the structure of Cabernet with Merlot's plush fruit. This Grande Reserve showcases 200 years of winemaking tradition with modern techniques, resulting in an approachable yet sophisticated wine. The 2023 vintage benefits from the warm continental climate and Black Sea influence of the Odessa region.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot blend (exact percentages proprietary)
records.region: Odessa, Ukraine - Black Sea coastal region with continental climate
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with pronounced aromas of ripe blackberry and plum compote, interwoven with subtle notes of dark cherry and cassis. Secondary aromas reveal hints of vanilla pod, cedar, and dried Mediterranean herbs—evidence of careful oak integration. A touch of graphite minerality emerges with aeration, along with delicate floral notes of violet that add complexity to this Ukrainian terroir-driven blend.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to notes of mocha, toasted oak, and a whisper of black pepper. Soft, rounded tannins leave a pleasant, smooth impression that invites another sip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a velvety texture that coats the palate. The Merlot component brings forward flavors of black plum, mulberry, and chocolate-covered cherries, while the Cabernet adds structure with blackcurrant and subtle tobacco leaf nuances. Well-integrated tannins provide support without overwhelming the fruit. The mid-palate shows excellent balance between ripe fruit, oak spice (cinnamon, clove), and refreshing acidity that keeps the wine lively."}

records.description: Roots Divino NA Blanco Vermouth NV is a sophisticated red wine showcasing rich complexity and excellent structure. This wine offers concentrated dark fruit flavors with elegant tannins, making it perfect for special occasions and elevated dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark cherry, blackberry, vanilla oak, tobacco, leather","finish":"Long elegant finish with oak and dark fruit","palate":"Full-bodied with velvety tannins, concentrated dark fruit, balanced acidity"}

records.name: Poggio Scudieri Chianti DOCG 2023
records.description: A fresh and vibrant Chianti DOCG from Tuscany's 2023 vintage. This Sangiovese-based wine captures the essence of modern Chianti with juicy red fruit, firm tannins, and the characteristic acidity that makes these wines so food-friendly and versatile.
records.varietal: Minimum 75% Sangiovese with permitted Canaiolo and international varieties (Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals youthful, vibrant aromas of bright cherry and red plum, hallmarks of young Chianti. Floral notes of violet add elegance and lift, while subtle hints of raspberry provide additional complexity. Light nutty undertones suggest quality oak aging, though the fruit remains primary and expressive. A whisper of Mediterranean herbs adds regional character.","finish":"The finish showcases Sangiovese's characteristic acidity with a bright, clean conclusion. Red cherry notes linger along with fine-grained tannins that provide texture without astringency. The wine's youthful exuberance suggests it's ideal for current consumption, though it has the structure to develop over the next few years.","palate":"Medium-bodied with the firm tannin structure and medium-high to high acidity characteristic of Sangiovese-dominant wines. Juicy cherry and plum flavors dominate the palate, showing the approachable fruit-forward style of contemporary Chianti DOCG. The wine's freshness and energy reflect the youth of the 2023 vintage. Well-integrated oak aging adds subtle structure without overwhelming the vibrant red fruit core. The balance between fruit, tannin, and acidity creates a harmonious, food-friendly profile."}

records.name: Shabo IFWH Exclusive Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
records.description: The Iukuridze Family Wine Heritage (IFWH) collection represents the pinnacle of Ukrainian winemaking from Shabo, the country's premier wine estate. Launched in December 2021 to celebrate the winery's 18th anniversary, this exclusive collection features wines personally selected by founder Vaja Iukuridze from exceptional harvest years. The 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon is designated AOC (controlled denomination of origin) with only 1,000-4,000 bottles produced, making it exceptionally rare. Crafted from grapes over 20 years old from select microplots of the Shabo terroir near the Black Sea, this wine represents Ukraine's finest viticultural achievement.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from vines 20+ years old, select microplots
records.region: Shabo, Odessa Oblast, Ukraine (Black Sea coastal region) - AOC designation
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents concentrated aromas of blackcurrant, black cherry, and plum, characteristic of the warm Black Sea climate that allows for optimal Cabernet ripeness. Layers of complexity unfold with notes of cedar, graphite, and tobacco leaf, indicating careful oak maturation. The unique maritime influence of the Black Sea region contributes subtle saline notes and a distinct mineral quality. Well-integrated oak adds vanilla, dark chocolate, and coffee bean nuances without overwhelming the ripe fruit. Hints of black olive and Mediterranean herbs reflect the region's proximity to both sea and steppe.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful with persistent black fruit and oak spice. Firm tannins suggest excellent aging potential, while the wine's concentration ensures flavors linger well after the glass is empty. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and cedar extend the experience, with the terroir's unique mineral character providing a distinctive signature. This is a wine built for the cellar, showing the structure and balance for extended aging while remaining approachable now with proper decanting.","palate":"On the palate, the wine is full-bodied and richly textured with the concentration expected from old vines and carefully selected microplots. Ripe black fruit flavors - cassis, blackberry, and black plum - dominate the core, supported by structured yet refined tannins. The 2016 vintage's warm growing season has produced a wine of impressive depth and power while maintaining balance through natural acidity. Oak aging has integrated beautifully, contributing mocha, vanilla, and baking spice notes that enhance rather than mask the fruit. The Black Sea terroir expresses itself through a distinctive minerality and subtle maritime influence."}

records.name: Shabo Original Chardonnay 2023
records.description: Shabo Original Chardonnay 2023 is a crisp, refreshing white wine capturing vibrant fruit character and bright acidity. Perfectly balanced and versatile, this wine pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus blossom, green apple, pear, tropical fruit, minerality","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with citrus","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright acidity, lemon, stone fruit"}

records.name: Shabo Original Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
records.description: A resilient expression of Ukrainian winemaking from the historic Shabo winery, founded in 1822 near Odesa by Swiss emigrants. Made from free-run juice and tank-fermented for immediate enjoyment, this wine represents the 'Victory Vintage' - made under extraordinary circumstances during wartime yet benefiting from excellent climate conditions. With 1200 hectares of vineyards near the Dniester estuary, Shabo produces approachable, food-friendly wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with characteristic Cabernet herbal notes including green pepper and fresh herbs. Aromas of ripe blackberry and dark cherry provide fruit character, while subtle earthy undertones add complexity. The aromatic profile is fresh and vibrant, showing the youth of the vintage.","finish":"Clean and moderate length with lingering fruit and herb notes. The finish is straightforward and food-friendly, making this an accessible Cabernet for everyday enjoyment.","palate":"Delightful and approachable, perfect for weeknight dinners or by-the-glass service. The palate delivers flavors of blackberry and red cherry alongside the herbal green pepper notes from the nose. The wine is medium-bodied with smooth tannins and refreshing acidity. Made from free-run juice and going straight to bottle, the wine maintains freshness and purity of fruit. The texture is soft and easy-drinking."}

records.name: Rigo Dolcetto 2018
records.description: This Dolcetto from Rigo captures the essence of Piedmont's early-drinking red, offering bright fruit and refreshing character. The 2018 vintage has developed some tertiary complexity while maintaining the grape's signature vibrancy and approachability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant aromas of red cherry, wild strawberry, and raspberry, complemented by subtle notes of violet and almond characteristic of Dolcetto. With some bottle age, the wine has developed nuances of dried herbs, black tea, and a hint of truffle. The aromatic profile remains fresh and inviting, showing the wine's youthful charm despite six years of age.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent red fruit and a characteristic bitter-sweet quality that makes Dolcetto so versatile at the table. Soft tannins and refreshing acidity leave the palate clean.","palate":"Juicy and medium-bodied on the palate, this Dolcetto delivers flavors of fresh red berries, sour cherry, and cranberry, balanced by gentle tannins that have softened nicely since bottling. A touch of bitter almond on the mid-palate is typical of the variety and adds character without harshness. Bright acidity keeps the wine lively and food-friendly, while subtle earthy notes add depth."}

records.name: Shabo Reserve Chardonnay 2022
records.description: A refined Ukrainian Chardonnay from the historic Shabo winery in Odesa, showcasing the quality potential of Black Sea viticulture. Aged six months in French barrique, this wine balances Old World elegance with expressive fruit character, representing Ukraine's emerging wine renaissance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Pale lemon in color, the wine opens with layered aromas of magnolia blossom and white flowers, complemented by ripe stone fruits—particularly nectarine, peach, and apricot. Bright citrus notes of lemon and orange zest add lift, while honeysuckle and sea buckthorn bring exotic complexity. Subtle French oak influence provides delicate vanilla and warm spice accents without overwhelming the fruit. Hints of white cherry and grey smoke add intrigue to this aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant, with lingering notes of citrus, white flowers, and subtle oak-derived vanilla. Clean and refreshing, with balanced acidity providing energy through to the conclusion.","palate":"Richly expressive on the palate, showing flavors of yellow stone fruits—ripe D'Anjou pears and crunchy golden apples—alongside citrus flowers and tangible sea buckthorn notes. The texture is creamy and mouth-coating, balanced by firm acidity that keeps the wine fresh and vibrant. Moderate alcohol at 12.4% ABV ensures elegance and drinkability. The six months in French oak adds subtle complexity and roundness without masking the pure fruit expression. Flavors of baked apple and citrus zest build toward the mid-palate."}

records.name: Trespass Mischief 2017
records.description: Trespass Winery's Mischief represents their playful approach to blending, creating wines that challenge conventions while delivering serious quality. This 2017 vintage showcases maturity and integration, offering complex flavors that reward patient cellaring and thoughtful appreciation.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Bordeaux varieties or Rhône blend)
records.region: Unknown (likely Washington State or Oregon based on producer name)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals evolved complexity with layers of dried cherry, fig, and cranberry melding with tertiary notes of leather, tobacco leaf, and forest floor. Subtle baking spices—cinnamon, clove, and nutmeg—add warmth, while hints of dried herbs, black tea, and cedar provide savory depth. The wine's age shows in its integrated oak and developed fruit character, creating an intriguing aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant, with dried fruit and earthy notes persisting beautifully. Soft tannins provide gentle structure, while lingering spice and tobacco add complexity. The conclusion feels complete and satisfying, showing the benefits of proper aging.","palate":"The palate shows beautiful maturity with silky texture and harmonious flavors. Red and black fruit—cherry, raspberry, and blackberry—have evolved into dried fruit character with notes of prune, raisin, and fig. The wine's medium to full body is supported by soft, integrated tannins that have mellowed with age. Savory elements emerge strongly: leather, earth, mushroom, and a hint of game, while background oak manifests as vanilla, toast, and subtle smoke. The balance between fruit, structure, and tertiary complexity indicates quality winemaking."}

records.description: Wine Kitchen Sparkling NV is an elegant sparkling wine bringing celebration to any occasion. With fine bubbles and vibrant character, this wine offers sophistication and drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Citrus zest, apple, brioche, almond, floral","finish":"Refreshing finish with effervescence","palate":"Light-bodied with persistent bubbles, crisp acidity"}

records.name: Shabo Original Merlot 2022
records.description: A 100% Merlot from Ukraine's historic Shabo winery, crafted with guidance from Bordeaux consultant Stephane Derenoncourt. This wine showcases the potential of Ukrainian viticulture from the Odesa region, combining Old World technique with unique terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a medium ruby color introduction, followed by an expressive and elegant bouquet. Delicate floral notes of violets and lilacs dominate initially, interwoven with fresh blackberry, black plum, and subtle reed-like herbaceous touches. The influence of French oak adds layers of vanilla and warm spice, creating a sophisticated aromatic profile that balances fruit purity with oak integration.","finish":"Long and elegant, with soft tannins and mild acidity that leave a lasting impression. The finish echoes with dark fruit and subtle spice, showing the wine's ability to age gracefully while remaining approachable now.","palate":"The palate unfolds with remarkable layers and complexity, revealing nuances of orange blossom that add unexpected floral brightness. Black cherry and red plum flavors form the core, supported by well-integrated oak that contributes structure without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows excellent balance between acidity and tannins, with a sinewy texture that adds gravitas. Flavors of fig and olive emerge in the mid-palate, adding savory depth and Mediterranean character."}

records.name: Sailor Seeks Horse Pinot Noir 2022
records.description: An ethereal and serious Pinot Noir from Tasmania's Huon Valley, crafted with precision and controlled power. This wine represents a masterclass in cool-climate Pinot Noir, balancing wild aromatics with elegant structure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays wild, perfumed edges with complex layers of sweet herbs, game meats, and turned earth. Bright raspberry and bramble notes intertwine with unexpected elements of orange peel, roast chestnuts, and souk-like spices. The aromatic profile includes cherry clafoutis sweetness, mint freshness, and crushed stone minerality, creating a captivating and constantly evolving bouquet that pulses with energy.","finish":"Long and ethereal, with persistent mineral notes and delicate tannins. The finish maintains the wine's elegant energy, leaving impressions of wild berries, subtle spice, and stony minerality.","palate":"The palate showcases savoury and spacious character with fine detail throughout. Sweet-sour cherry flavors combine with raspberry and herbal notes, while game and earthy undertones add complexity. The texture reveals a laciness to the tannin structure, with mineral-like aspects that speak to the volcanic soils of Tasmania. The wine demonstrates both smashability and seriousness, offering immediate pleasure while rewarding contemplation with its layered complexity."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Natural Selection (Red) Syrah-Grenache 2018
records.description: An exceptional organic and biodynamic red blend from one of the world's most environmentally conscious wineries in the Languedoc. This Natural Selection bottling represents Château Maris's commitment to minimal intervention winemaking, allowing the distinctive La Livinière terroir to shine through in a pure, authentic expression.
records.varietal: Syrah and Grenache blend (approximately 60% Syrah, 40% Grenache)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating aromas of wild blackberry, blueberry, and dark cherry lead, intertwined with classic garrigue notes of lavender, thyme, and rosemary. The bouquet reveals layers of complexity with hints of black olive, crushed stone, and subtle white pepper from the Syrah component. Minimal sulfur use and organic viticulture contribute to pristine fruit expression and terroir transparency, with earthy notes of forest floor and wet slate adding depth.","finish":"The finish is long, pure, and focused, with red and black fruit notes extending alongside stony minerality and herbal accents. Soft tannins and lingering spice create a harmonious conclusion that showcases the wine's natural balance and terroir expression.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with exceptional purity and balance. The Grenache contributes bright red fruit flavors of raspberry and strawberry, while Syrah adds structure with notes of blackberry, black pepper, and smoked meat. The wine shows remarkable freshness despite its concentration, with vibrant acidity and fine-grained tannins that are firm yet silky. Biodynamic farming translates to intense minerality and a distinctive saline quality on the mid-palate. The natural winemaking approach results in energetic, transparent flavors."}

records.name: Viore Sobre Lias 2023
records.description: A contemporary Spanish white wine aged 'sobre lías' (on the lees), showcasing modern winemaking techniques applied to indigenous Galician varietals. This wine exemplifies the quality and freshness of Spain's Atlantic-influenced white wines with extended lees contact adding texture and complexity.
records.varietal: Likely Albariño or indigenous Galician white varietals
records.region: Rías Baixas or similar Atlantic-influenced region, Galicia, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Vibrant aromas of green apple, white peach, and citrus blossom lead, complemented by subtle notes of chamomile and fresh herbs. The lees aging contributes delicate notes of brioche, toasted almond, and a hint of cream that adds complexity without heaviness. Bright maritime minerality and a touch of wet stone character reflect the Atlantic coastal influence. Light floral notes of orange blossom and jasmine add elegance to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with citrus and mineral notes extending alongside a subtle savory character from the lees. A refreshing saline quality lingers, inviting another sip and showcasing the wine's coastal origins.","palate":"The palate is crisp and refreshing with medium body enhanced by lees aging, which provides a slightly creamy texture and weight. Flavors of tart green apple, Meyer lemon, and white grapefruit are balanced by ripe stone fruit notes and a distinctive saline minerality. The sur lie aging adds subtle yeasty complexity and a pleasant textural component without diminishing the wine's essential freshness. Vibrant acidity keeps the wine lively and food-friendly, while a touch of phenolic grip adds interest."}

records.name: Backsberg Pumphouse Shiraz 2020
records.description: A premium South African Shiraz from the historic Backsberg estate in Paarl, Western Cape. Named after the estate's iconic 1920s pumphouse, this wine represents the flagship Shiraz offering from one of South Africa's most environmentally conscious wineries, combining old-world elegance with new-world fruit intensity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Generous aromas of ripe blackberry, dark plum, and black cherry are complemented by exotic notes of violet, star anise, and white pepper. The bouquet reveals complexity with hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and cedar from oak aging, alongside subtle notes of leather and game. A distinctive floral quality typical of cooler-climate Shiraz adds elegance, while underlying savory elements of black olive and dried herbs provide depth.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with dark fruit, spice, and savory notes extending gracefully. Polished tannins and a touch of black pepper linger alongside hints of espresso and dark chocolate, demonstrating the wine's quality and aging potential.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry compote, blueberry, and dark cherry. The wine shows excellent balance between ripe fruit sweetness and refreshing acidity, with integrated tannins that are firm yet velvety. Oak influence is present but well-managed, contributing vanilla, mocha, and toasted spice notes without overwhelming the fruit. Mid-palate richness is enhanced by notes of dark chocolate, black pepper, and a distinctive graphite minerality that adds complexity."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Rose 2022
records.description: An elegant rosé from Rioja, Spain, crafted as a blend of Garnacha and Mazuelo grapes. This wine represents the modern Spanish approach to rosé, combining delicate aromatics with refreshing structure and food-friendly versatility.
records.varietal: 70% Garnacha, 30% Viura (or Garnacha-Mazuelo blend depending on vintage)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays a pale pink hue with subtle purple shades, almost salmon in appearance. Fine floral aromas dominate the nose, standing prominently on rose petals and delicate floral notes from the Mazuelo grape. Slight touches of fresh red fruits, particularly raspberry, add a gentle fruitiness. The aromatic profile is wonderfully fresh and inviting, showing restraint and elegance rather than overt fruit character.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with subtle herbal notes and persistent floral character. The finish is light yet satisfying, with balanced acidity leaving the palate ready for the next bite of food.","palate":"Fresh and delicate in the mouth, the palate showcases gentle, subtle fruit character with well-balanced acidity that provides structure and vibrancy. The wine is fruity without being heavy, allowing the Garnacha's elegant herbal character to shine through. Floral notes from the Mazuelo overlay the mid-palate, adding complexity and aromatic lift. The texture is light and refreshing, with a nice acidic backbone that makes it incredibly food-friendly and versatile."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Gran Reserva 2005
records.description: An ultra-classic Rioja Gran Reserva from one of the finest recent vintages, representing the pinnacle of traditional Spanish winemaking. This wine showcases extended aging in American oak and demonstrates the elegance and complexity that comes when a great vintage meets an iconic bottling.
records.varietal: Tempranillo-based blend with traditional Rioja varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is expressive and powerful, offering complex layers of black raspberries and black cherries intermingled with notes of Cuban cigar wrapper and woodsmoke. Fine reductive notes add intrigue, while aromas of spiced meats and a refined base of salty soil tones ground the wine in its terroir. Cloves and brown spices mingle with the characteristic vanilla notes of American oak, creating a dense and captivating aromatic profile. Cedary oak provides an elegant framing to the entire bouquet.","finish":"Long and meaty with structured tannins that have softened beautifully with age. The finish shows classic Rioja characteristics of vanilla oak, dried fruits, and warm spices, with a refined earthiness that lingers gracefully.","palate":"Deep, full-bodied, and immensely complex, the wine is just approaching its apogee of peak drinkability. The palate reveals toasty, spicy character with reductive nuances that add depth and intrigue. Dense mulberry fruit shows full brambly character with a structured, meaty style. The texture is rich and layered, with the extended aging providing silky tannins and remarkable integration. Cherry and garnet notes persist throughout, while the discreet red berry fruit base is enhanced by subtle volatile lift."}

records.name: Patrick Sullivan Chardonnay 2023
records.description: A stunning expression of Chardonnay from one of Australia's most thoughtful viticulturists and winemakers. Crafted from volcanic soils with minimal intervention, this wine transmits its place with precision and complexity, representing Sullivan's focus on terroir-driven winemaking.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Enticing and complex aromas leap from the glass, featuring candied lime and makrut lime leaf that provide exotic citrus character. Ripe apricot adds stone fruit richness, while fresh brioche notes suggest subtle lees influence without heavy oak. Spicy notes weave through the aromatic profile, complemented by white stone fruit and citrus complexity. The nose shows remarkable integration and sophistication, with a touch of flinty sulphides adding mineral intrigue.","finish":"Long and chalky with persistent minerality and citrus notes. The finish shows excellent length and purity, with the flinty, mineral character lingering gracefully alongside subtle fruit and spice.","palate":"Vibrant and complex on the palate, the wine showcases crisp acidity and pronounced minerality that speak to the volcanic soils Sullivan favors. Flavors of lemon zest and nectarine provide citrus and stone fruit backbone, while the texture reveals a neat tug of phenolics ensuring textural interest alongside the bright acidity. The wine is satisfying and superbly integrated, with spicy oak elements that enhance rather than dominate. Every element is in perfect balance, creating a wine that is both intellectually engaging and immediately pleasurable."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Barolo Gallinotto 2021
records.description: A prestigious single-vineyard Barolo from the Gallinotto cru in La Morra, Piedmont. This wine comes from the Molino family's treasure vineyard, located in an area that has regained its past splendor and consistently produces exceptional Nebbiolo with excellent value.
records.region: Barolo DOCG, La Morra, Piedmont, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals classic Nebbiolo aromatics with orange peel, rose petals, and sour cherries forming the core. Balsamic notes add complexity and depth, while the wine evolves in the glass to reveal chocolate and hazelnut undertones from careful aging. Cinnamon candy, rose bud, and pomegranate contribute floral and spice elements, while herbal and peppery notes add savory intrigue. Wild berry, cedar, pipe tobacco, menthol, and dried flowers create layers of complexity that unfold with time.","finish":"Incredibly long finish with soft, refined tannins and mild acidity. The tasty, nutty character lingers alongside persistent red fruit and mineral notes, showcasing the wine's complexity and aging potential.","palate":"The palate is creamy and inviting with full body supported by fine-grained tannins. Super-juicy red cherry fruit dominates, accompanied by strawberry, raspberry, and the distinctive bitterness of orange peel that is quintessentially Nebbiolo. Mineral elements add to the whole picture, with a dustier personality and bigger mineral presence that recalls limestone and crushed rock. The frame shows crisp acidity with a light structure of chalky tannins that provide grip without heaviness. Succulent red fruit is balanced by earthy, gravelly elements that ground the wine in its terroir."}

records.name: Emek Reb Yose Capricorn Merlot Mevushal (MD & DC) 2020
records.description: A premium kosher Merlot from Israel, crafted according to strict Mevushal standards while maintaining the quality and character expected from modern Israeli winemaking. This wine showcases the smooth texture and ripe tannins that have made Israeli Merlot increasingly popular in recent years. The 2020 vintage benefits from Israel's warm Mediterranean climate combined with careful canopy management and night harvesting techniques.
records.region: Israel (likely Galilee, Golan Heights, or Judean Hills)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting aromas of ripe black plum and dark cherry, enhanced by notes of cedar and vanilla from oak aging. Subtle hints of dried herbs, particularly sage and oregano, reflect the Mediterranean terroir, while background notes of cocoa powder and coffee add depth. The wine shows good integration between fruit and oak, with a touch of leather and tobacco leaf providing complexity typical of quality Israeli Merlot.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent dark fruit flavors and gentle tannins that coat the palate. Notes of vanilla and spice linger alongside the fruit, while the wine's smooth texture leaves a pleasant, approachable impression suitable for kosher dining.","palate":"Smooth and velvety on the palate, this Merlot delivers plush flavors of blackberry, black plum, and cassis, supported by the soft, ripe tannins that characterize Israeli Merlot production. The wine's medium to full body is balanced by fresh acidity maintained through careful vineyard management including night harvesting. Notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and baking spices emerge on the mid-palate, while the oak aging contributes structure without overwhelming the fruit. A subtle herbaceous quality and hint of bell pepper add classic Merlot character."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Zulu 2020
records.description: A vibrant organic red wine from the Languedoc region of southern France, produced by the biodynamic pioneer Chateau Maris. This wine reflects the Mediterranean terroir of France's largest wine-producing region, where intense sunshine and minerally soils create powerful, fruit-forward wines. The 2020 vintage captures the warm, dry growing season characteristic of this coastal area.
records.varietal: Likely Grenache, Syrah, and Carignan blend (classic Languedoc varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet bursts with exuberant dark fruit aromas of crushed blackberries and ripe plums, layered with notes of sun-dried garrigue herbs including thyme and lavender. Spicy undertones of cracked black pepper and smoky minerality emerge, while hints of violet and wild Mediterranean scrubland add aromatic complexity. The organic farming practices contribute to pure, expressive aromatics that showcase the Languedoc terroir.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with persistent dark fruit and spice notes that gradually fade into savory hints of olive tapenade and graphite. Gentle tannins provide structure while the wine's natural fruit sweetness lingers, characteristic of warm-climate Languedoc reds designed for both immediate enjoyment and medium-term cellaring.","palate":"Bold and full-bodied on the palate, this wine delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry compote, black cherry, and cassis, supported by the region's classic Grenache-Syrah character. The warm Languedoc climate contributes to ripe, velvety tannins that coat the mouth, while underlying notes of dark chocolate and roasted coffee beans add depth. A core of bright acidity keeps the wine balanced despite its fruit intensity, with secondary flavors of dried figs and licorice root providing complexity."}

records.name: Shipping- Domestic
records.description: This is a shipping service, not a wine product.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Not applicable - shipping service","finish":"Not applicable - shipping service","palate":"Not applicable - shipping service"}

records.name: Skylark Las Aves 2017
records.description: An artisan California red blend from Skylark, a boutique winery known for crafting distinctive wines from premium vineyard sources. The Las Aves bottling represents a carefully composed blend showcasing California's diverse terroir, with the 2017 vintage offering the complexity and integration that comes with several years of bottle age. This wine demonstrates the elegance and balance achievable with thoughtful blending and patient maturation.
records.varietal: Bordeaux-style blend (likely combination of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec)
records.region: California (likely from premium vineyard sources in Sonoma, Napa, or Central Coast)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Evolved and complex aromatics showing the benefits of bottle age: mature dark fruit aromas of black cherry preserves, dried plum, and fig mingle with savory notes of leather, dried tobacco leaf, and forest floor. The bouquet reveals layers of complexity—dark chocolate, espresso, cedar, and sweet baking spices from oak aging have integrated beautifully with the fruit.
