Subtle hints of dried herbs, black olive, and earthy mushroom add intrigue, while a whisper of vanilla and smoke lingers in the background. The overall impression is sophisticated and tertiary, showing graceful evolution.","finish":"Long, elegant finish with lingering notes of mature fruit, leather, and subtle oak. The tannins are smooth and resolved, with a gentle grip that speaks to quality winemaking. Notes of dark chocolate, tobacco, and dried herbs persist, with a mineral quality emerging on the aftertaste. The finish is refined and contemplative, rewarding slow sipping.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a seamless, integrated texture that speaks to careful aging. The tannins have softened and melded beautifully with the fruit, creating a velvety, harmonious mouthfeel. The palate delivers flavors of mature dark fruit—black cherry compote, dried plum, blackberry jam—alongside savory elements of leather, dried herbs, tobacco, and earthy minerality. Notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and toasted oak are fully integrated, adding depth without dominating. The acidity remains bright enough to maintain freshness despite the wine's age, while the alcohol (likely 13.5-14.5%) supports the wine's structure. The blend's components have married completely, showing no rough edges."}

records.name: Cafe de Paris Brut Rose
records.description: An elegant French-style sparkling rosé offering vibrant effervescence and delicate fruit character. Crafted using traditional sparkling wine methods, this brut rosé balances refreshing acidity with subtle berry flavors and fine, persistent bubbles. The wine's pale pink hue and crisp profile make it an ideal aperitif and versatile food companion.
records.varietal: Traditional French sparkling varieties (likely Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier, or regional rosé grapes)
records.region: France (likely Loire Valley or general French production)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate aromas of fresh wild strawberries and red raspberries greet the nose, accompanied by subtle floral notes of white flowers and rose petals. The bouquet shows refined elegance with hints of citrus zest and brioche, while the gentle effervescence carries these aromatics upward. Light mineral undertones and a whisper of almond add complexity to this aromatic, inviting profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing, with lingering red berry notes and a touch of minerality. The fine bubbles persist pleasantly, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next sip, typical of quality sparkling rosés designed for versatility and enjoyment.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on the palate, this brut rosé delivers bright flavors of strawberry, red currant, and pink grapefruit, lifted by fine, persistent bubbles that create a creamy mousse texture. The wine's brut designation ensures a dry finish with minimal residual sugar, allowing the pure fruit flavors and vibrant acidity to shine. Subtle notes of lemon peel and white peach add dimension, while the light body and energetic character make this wine exceptionally food-friendly and easy to enjoy."}

records.name: Somontano G Garnacha 2016
records.description: From the Somontano DO in northern Spain, this Garnacha showcases the high-altitude vineyards' ability to preserve freshness while developing ripe fruit character. The 2016 vintage benefits from the region's continental climate, producing a wine with vibrant red fruit and spicy complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with an enticing bouquet of ripe red cherry and wild strawberry, layered with notes of crushed herbs and a subtle hint of white pepper. As the wine breathes, delicate floral undertones of dried rose petals emerge, complemented by a whisper of Mediterranean scrubland. The aromatic profile suggests both freshness and concentration, characteristic of high-elevation Garnacha.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent red fruit and a gentle spice note. A touch of licorice and fine-grained tannins provide texture, while the wine's natural acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with supple tannins, the palate delivers juicy red fruit flavors of cherry and raspberry, accented by hints of sweet balsamic and dried oregano. The wine's natural acidity provides structure and vibrancy, carrying the fruit flavors through the mid-palate with grace. Notes of cocoa powder and subtle earthy minerality add complexity without overwhelming the wine's fruit-forward character."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao White 40 Year Port   500 ml
records.description: An exceptionally rare aged white port that has undergone four decades of oxidative maturation in oak casks. This wine represents a unique category within Port production, combining the complexity of extended barrel aging with the distinctive character of white Portuguese grape varieties.
records.vintage: 40 year average age (blend of multiple vintages)
records.varietal: Traditional white port grapes including Malvasia Fina, Gouveio, Rabigato, and Viosinho
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Extraordinary complexity greets the nose with aromas of dried apricot, toasted hazelnuts, and honeycomb, layered over notes of orange marmalade and candied lemon peel. The extended barrel aging has imparted rich notes of crème brûlée, butterscotch, and old oak. Subtle hints of dried flowers and delicate spice—cinnamon and nutmeg—weave through the aromatic tapestry. A faint maritime salinity adds intrigue, reminiscent of the wine's coastal Portuguese origins.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and evolving, with waves of nutty, caramelized flavors that seem to persist indefinitely. A gentle warmth from the fortification alcohol integrates seamlessly, while the wine's acidity provides a refreshing lift at the very end. Lingering notes of dried fruit and spice invite contemplation.","palate":"The palate reveals astounding depth and concentration, with flavors of caramelized fig, dates, and golden raisins forming the core. Layers of toasted almond, toffee, and burnt orange create a luxurious mouthfeel that's simultaneously rich and refined. The wine's natural acidity, preserved despite decades of aging, provides remarkable balance to the sweetness and prevents any cloying sensation. Notes of vanilla, old wood, and a hint of iodine add to the wine's extraordinary complexity."}

records.name: Poggio Scudieri Rosso di Montalcino 2019
records.description: Crafted from 100% Sangiovese grown in the prestigious Montalcino appellation, this Rosso offers an accessible expression of the region's terroir. The 2019 vintage showcases bright fruit character with the structure and complexity expected from this renowned Tuscan region, providing excellent value as a younger sibling to Brunello di Montalcino.
records.region: Rosso di Montalcino DOCG, Tuscany, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals fresh red cherry and wild strawberry aromas, complemented by notes of violet, dried herbs, and a touch of leather. Underlying hints of terracotta and dried tobacco leaf add complexity, while subtle notes of balsamic and Mediterranean herbs evoke the Tuscan countryside. A delicate touch of sweet spice—clove and cinnamon—emerges with aeration.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with persistent cherry fruit and a savory herbal note. Fine-grained tannins provide gentle grip, while the wine's bright acidity keeps the palate refreshed. A subtle earthiness lingers alongside fruit, inviting the next sip.","palate":"Medium to medium-full bodied with vibrant acidity and refined tannins that provide structure without heaviness. The palate echoes the nose with flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, and red plum, accented by savory notes of sun-dried tomato and fresh oregano. A mineral backbone provides elegance, while hints of espresso and dark chocolate add depth. The wine's energy and freshness make it immediately appealing while suggesting it will develop gracefully."}

records.name: Sonder Grenache blanc 2023
records.description: A fresh, contemporary expression of Grenache Blanc showcasing the variety's inherent richness and aromatic complexity. This wine represents the modern revival of interest in white Rhône varieties, offering a full-bodied alternative to Chardonnay with distinctive stone fruit character, floral aromatics, and textural depth from the variety's naturally rich phenolic structure.
records.region: Origin undetermined (likely California Central Coast or Rhône Valley, France)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with intoxicating aromas of white peach, apricot, and honeydew melon, layered with notes of white flowers—orange blossom, jasmine, and honeysuckle. Subtle hints of almond paste, marzipan, and honey add richness, while a touch of fresh ginger and white pepper provides spicy lift. The aromatics show impressive purity and intensity, characteristic of well-made Grenache Blanc, with mineral undertones of crushed stone adding complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and mouth-coating, with persistent stone fruit flavors and a hint of sweet spice. Refreshing acidity balances the wine's natural richness, while subtle mineral notes and a touch of salinity add complexity and encourage another sip. This is a food-friendly white wine best enjoyed within 2-3 years to preserve its vibrant fruit character.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a rich, almost viscous texture that coats the palate, balanced by vibrant acidity that provides freshness and definition. Flavors of ripe yellow peach, nectarine, and golden delicious apple dominate, supported by notes of honeycomb, toasted almond, and brioche from possible lees contact. The mid-palate reveals layers of citrus—Meyer lemon and candied orange peel—alongside subtle herbal notes of fennel and anise. The wine's phenolic structure adds grip and length without bitterness."}

records.name: Valencia Aranleon Bles Roble 2016
records.description: An oak-aged red wine from the Valencia region in eastern Spain, this 'Roble' (oak) bottling demonstrates the Mediterranean character of Valencian viticulture. The wine likely features local varieties or international grapes adapted to Spain's warm climate, with oak aging adding structure and complexity to the region's naturally ripe fruit character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents ripe blackberry and plum aromas interwoven with notes of vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging. Hints of Mediterranean scrub herbs—thyme and lavender—add aromatic complexity, while subtle notes of black pepper and dark chocolate provide depth. A touch of sweet spice reminiscent of clove and star anise emerges as the wine opens.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent dark fruit flavors and a gentle oakiness. Soft tannins and notes of vanilla and coffee linger pleasantly, while the wine's warmth reflects the Mediterranean sun.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a smooth, velvety texture enhanced by oak aging. The palate delivers flavors of blackberry jam, dark cherry, and fig, balanced by notes of mocha, cedar, and gentle baking spices. The oak influence is present but integrated, providing structure and a subtle coconut note without overwhelming the fruit. Moderate acidity and soft tannins create an approachable, rounded profile with good concentration."}

records.name: Hendry Unoaked Chardonnay 2020
records.description: A pure expression of Napa Valley Chardonnay showcasing the grape's natural character without oak influence. This wine represents the unoaked Chardonnay movement that emphasizes terroir, bright acidity, and pure fruit flavors over buttery, toasted notes. The 2020 vintage from Hendry's estate vineyards captures the balance between Napa's warmth and the refreshing style achieved through careful winemaking that preserves natural acidity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant aromas of green apple, Asian pear, and citrus blossom, with the crisp, mineral-driven profile that defines unoaked Chardonnay. Fresh notes of white peach and lemon zest emerge, while subtle hints of wet stone and crushed almonds add complexity. The absence of oak allows the wine's natural aromatics to shine, revealing delicate floral notes and a touch of honeydew melon that speaks to the fruit's quality and vineyard expression.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering citrus and green apple notes, supported by vibrant acidity and a distinct mineral quality. The wine leaves the palate cleansed and energized, perfect for food pairing or continued enjoyment.","palate":"Bright and refreshing on the palate, this unoaked Chardonnay emphasizes green apple and unripe pear flavors characteristic of wines aged without oak influence, balanced by notes of white peach and grapefruit. The wine maintains excellent natural acidity that provides structure and energy, creating a crisp, mineral-driven profile reminiscent of quality Chablis. Flavors of Meyer lemon, white nectarine, and subtle hints of flint create complexity, while the wine's medium body and clean texture allow the terroir of Napa's well-drained soils to express itself fully."}

records.name: Trespass Encroachment Pinot Noir 2018
records.description: An artisanal Pinot Noir from a small producer, likely crafted in a cooler climate region optimal for this finicky variety. The 2018 vintage showcases the elegance and complexity that Pinot Noir achieves when grown in ideal conditions, with the wine expressing both varietal character and terroir influence.
records.region: Likely Oregon, California Central Coast, or similar cool-climate region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals classic Pinot Noir aromatics: ripe cherry, cranberry, and red raspberry mingle with notes of rose petal, dried herbs, and forest floor. As the wine opens, more complex notes emerge—hints of mushroom, black tea, and subtle leather add savory intrigue. A delicate touch of vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging integrates seamlessly, while underlying notes of earth and spice provide depth. The aromatic profile suggests both fruit purity and complexity.","finish":"The finish is medium-long with persistent red fruit and subtle earthy notes. Silky tannins provide gentle grip, while the wine's acidity keeps the palate refreshed. Lingering hints of tea, spice, and forest floor invite contemplation.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with silky tannins and vibrant acidity that provides structure and lift. The palate echoes the nose with flavors of red cherry, raspberry, and cranberry, layered with notes of pomegranate and red plum. Savory elements—dried herbs, earthy mushroom, and a hint of truffle—add complexity and intrigue. The oak influence is subtle, contributing gentle vanilla and spice without overwhelming the wine's delicate fruit. A mineral quality provides backbone, while the wine's natural acidity ensures balance and food-friendliness."}

records.name: Scenic Valley Farms Pinot Gris 2021
records.description: A cool-climate Pinot Gris from what appears to be a farm winery or small producer focused on expressing terroir. The 2021 vintage captures the variety's characteristic freshness and fruit purity, likely showcasing a style that balances the crisp acidity of Pinot Grigio with the richer texture associated with Alsatian Pinot Gris.
records.region: Likely Oregon, Washington, or similar cool-climate American region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents inviting aromas of ripe Bosc pear, Golden Delicious apple, and white peach, complemented by notes of honeysuckle and white flowers. Subtle hints of citrus—lemon zest and lime—add brightness, while delicate notes of green almond and wet stone provide complexity. A whisper of ginger and white pepper suggests gentle spice, while the overall impression remains fresh and fruit-focused. The absence of oak allows the variety's natural aromatics to shine.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with persistent fruit flavors and a refreshing mineral quality. The wine's acidity leaves the palate invigorated, while a gentle nuttiness and hint of white pepper linger pleasantly.","palate":"Medium-bodied with crisp acidity and a slightly oily texture characteristic of quality Pinot Gris. The palate delivers flavors of ripe pear, yellow apple, and white peach, accented by notes of cantaloupe and nectarine. A mineral quality reminiscent of crushed gravel provides structure and terroir expression, while hints of lemon zest and white pepper add vibrancy. The wine maintains freshness through its acidity while offering enough weight and texture to pair with richer foods. A subtle almond note adds interest without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Rippa Dorii Los Curas 2022
records.description: A young, vibrant wine from what appears to be a Spanish producer, likely showcasing indigenous or international varieties grown in Spain's diverse wine regions. The 2022 vintage captures fresh, accessible fruit character with the expressive quality expected from modern Spanish winemaking.
records.varietal: Likely Garnacha, Tempranillo, or Mediterranean blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with youthful energy, offering aromas of fresh red berries—raspberry, strawberry, and red currant—alongside notes of bright cherry and pomegranate. Floral hints of violet and rose petal add aromatic charm, while subtle herbal notes of fresh mint and Mediterranean garrigue provide complexity. A whisper of white pepper and stony minerality suggests careful vineyard selection.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing, with bright red fruit and a gentle herbal note. The wine's natural acidity leaves the palate invigorated, while fine tannins provide just enough grip. Perfect for immediate enjoyment.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with lively acidity and silky tannins, the palate delivers vibrant red fruit flavors that echo the nose. Juicy cherry and raspberry dominate, accented by notes of cranberry and blood orange zest. The wine's freshness and energy make it immediately appealing, with a mineral backbone providing structure. A subtle spiciness and hint of dried herbs add interest without detracting from the wine's fruit-forward character."}

records.name: Domaine Fevre Chablis 2021
records.description: A classic Chablis from one of the region's respected producers, showcasing 100% Chardonnay grown in Burgundy's northernmost appellation. The 2021 vintage displays the region's signature minerality and precision, with cool-climate freshness shaped by ancient Kimmeridgian limestone soils that give Chablis its distinctive character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a pristine expression of cool-climate Chardonnay, with aromas of green apple, Asian pear, and fresh citrus—lemon zest and lime. Distinctive mineral notes reminiscent of wet stones, oyster shell, and flint create the classic Chablis signature. Delicate white flowers, particularly acacia, add aromatic elegance, while subtle hints of fresh herbs and a saline quality evoke the region's ancient marine origins. The complete absence of oak allows the terroir to speak clearly.","finish":"The finish is clean, long, and mineral-driven, with a lingering flinty quality and bright citrus notes. The wine's high acidity provides a refreshing, mouth-watering conclusion that calls for food or another sip. A subtle salinity persists, echoing the ancient seabeds beneath the vines.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with racy acidity that defines Chablis, the palate delivers crisp flavors of green apple, white peach, and Meyer lemon. The wine's defining characteristic is its remarkable minerality—a flinty, chalky quality that coats the palate with refreshing precision. Notes of citrus zest and subtle pear provide fruit interest, while a distinct saline quality adds depth and complexity. The texture is lean and precise rather than rich, emphasizing purity and terroir expression."}

records.name: Jump Mountain Mountain Mist Rose 2021
records.description: A distinctive rosé from Virginia's Shenandoah Valley, crafted by Jump Mountain Vineyard, a family-owned estate nestled on the sunny hillsides of Walkers Creek Valley near Lexington. This wine reflects the winery's European-style approach and the unique terroir of Virginia's protected mountain valleys.
records.varietal: Likely Syrah-based rosé (Jump Mountain produces Syrah rosé from nearby vineyards)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant aromas of fresh strawberry, watermelon, and red currant, characteristic of cool-climate rosé production. Delicate floral notes of rose petal and honeysuckle add elegance, while subtle hints of white pepper and crushed herbs provide complexity. A mineral undertone reflects the vineyard's hillside location and sandstone-influenced soils near Jump Mountain. The aromatic profile is clean, bright, and inviting, with a Mediterranean freshness that belies its Virginia origins.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering red berry fruit and a refreshing minerality that cleanses the palate. Bright acidity ensures a crisp conclusion, while subtle phenolic grip from skin contact provides structure. The wine leaves the palate refreshed and invigorated, perfect for warm-weather sipping or versatile food pairing.","palate":"On the palate, this rosé shows impressive depth while maintaining characteristic refreshment. Flavors of ripe strawberry and raspberry dominate, supported by crisp acidity that brings energy and balance. The wine displays medium body with a silky texture, avoiding the thin, watery character of lesser rosés. Subtle citrus notes—pink grapefruit and blood orange—add brightness, while a savory, herbal quality provides food-friendly versatility. At nearly 15% alcohol, the wine shows ripeness and concentration unusual for Virginia, suggesting warm vintage conditions in 2021, yet maintains excellent balance without heat or heaviness."}

records.name: Domaine Borgeot Puligny Montrachet Les Meix 2023
records.description: A distinguished village-level Puligny-Montrachet from the esteemed Domaine Borgeot, a fourth-generation family estate in Burgundy's Côte de Beaune. The 'Les Meix' vineyard is strategically located just below the renowned Premier Cru 'Les Pucelles,' offering exceptional terroir at village classification. This 2023 vintage showcases the precision and elegance that defines great white Burgundy.
records.region: Puligny-Montrachet, Côte de Beaune, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with classic Puligny-Montrachet hallmarks—precise minerality reminiscent of crushed limestone, wet stones, and flint. Ripe citrus aromas dominate: lemon zest, lime blossom, and white grapefruit, complemented by white orchard fruits including green apple and pear. Subtle floral notes of white flowers and acacia add refinement, while hints of hazelnut and toasted almond from oak aging (25% new barrels) provide depth without overwhelming the wine's crystalline purity. The aromatic profile is tight and focused, suggesting youthful energy and excellent aging potential.","finish":"The finish is long, mineral-driven, and incredibly pure, with citrus and stone fruit notes persisting alongside a pronounced chalky, saline quality. Vibrant acidity maintains freshness and energy through the conclusion, while subtle oak spice and nutty complexity add layers. This is a finish that seems to lift and expand, characteristic of high-quality white Burgundy from exceptional terroir.","palate":"On the palate, this Chardonnay reveals the complexity and structure expected from its privileged terroir. Flavors of Meyer lemon, golden apple, and white peach are framed by vibrant acidity and pronounced minerality. The limestone-marl soils impart a distinctive chalky, saline quality that adds depth and tension. Oak aging contributes subtle butter and vanilla notes along with creamy texture from lees contact, but the wine remains primarily fruit and terroir-driven. Medium to full body provides presence and weight, while precise balance ensures the wine never feels heavy. The winemaking approach—using 25% new oak and 75% older barrels—allows the vineyard's voice to speak clearly."}

records.name: Raywood Moscato 2021
records.description: A crowd-pleasing, aromatic Moscato from California's Central Coast, designed to balance sweetness with refreshing acidity and gentle effervescence. Crafted using cold stainless steel fermentation to preserve the grape's distinctive floral and fruity characteristics, this accessible sweet wine offers exceptional value and drinkability.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with intense floral aromatics—honeysuckle, orange blossom, and jasmine—that define the Moscato grape's signature perfume. Fresh fruit aromas of ripe strawberry, white peach, and lychee add sweetness and appeal, while subtle hints of rose petal and elderflower provide elegance. A slight effervescence lifts these aromatics, making them particularly expressive and inviting. The wine's aromatic intensity is remarkable for its price point, offering a sensory experience that rivals far more expensive sweet wines.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing despite the wine's sweetness, with lingering fruit flavors and persistent floral notes. The gentle effervescence and bright acidity ensure the conclusion doesn't feel heavy, while residual sugar provides a pleasant, fruity sweetness that invites another sip. This is a finish designed for easy drinking and broad appeal.","palate":"On the palate, this Moscato delivers a fresh, fruity, and smooth flavor profile that prioritizes balance over cloying sweetness. Flavors of ripe strawberry, honeysuckle, peach, and tropical fruits create an instantly approachable, crowd-pleasing character. The long, cool stainless steel fermentation preserves the wine's natural acidity, which balances residual sugar and prevents the wine from feeling heavy or syrupy. A gentle effervescence—from carbon dioxide retained from fermentation—adds liveliness and lift, making each sip refreshing rather than static. The overall effect is mouth-watering and fun, perfect for casual enjoyment or introducing newcomers to wine."}

records.name: Raywood Merlot Keg 2021  20 l
records.description: A versatile Merlot packaged in a 20-liter keg format, representing the growing trend toward sustainable, draft wine service in restaurants and venues. This wine offers classic Merlot characteristics with soft tannins and approachable fruit character, designed for fresh, by-the-glass service that minimizes waste and maintains freshness through the keg's pressurized system.
records.varietal: Merlot (likely 85-100% with possible small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon or other Bordeaux varieties)
records.region: Origin undetermined (likely California or Australia based on keg packaging trend)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting aromas of ripe plum, black cherry, and red currant, accented by notes of milk chocolate and vanilla from oak influence. Subtle hints of dried herbs—bay leaf and sage—add complexity, while soft floral notes of violet provide aromatic lift. The bouquet shows gentle integration and approachability, with earthy undertones of graphite and forest floor adding depth to the fruit-forward profile.","finish":"The finish is medium-length with lingering dark fruit flavors and soft, resolved tannins that leave a pleasant, smooth impression. Subtle notes of cocoa powder and sweet oak spice persist, while a touch of earthiness adds interest. This is an easy-drinking, versatile Merlot designed for enjoyment over the next 2-3 years in its keg format.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a supple, velvety texture and soft tannins that make this wine immediately accessible and food-friendly. Flavors of dark cherry, blackberry, and plum dominate the palate, supported by notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and subtle toast from oak aging. Mid-palate smoothness is balanced by moderate acidity that provides freshness, while earthy notes of tobacco leaf and leather add complexity. The wine shows classic Merlot charm with its round, generous mouthfeel."}

records.name: Rioja Lar de Paula Madurado 2018
records.description: A modern-style Rioja from Lar de Paula estate, labeled 'Madurado' to indicate extended maturation. This wine represents a contemporary approach to Rioja winemaking while respecting traditional aging practices.
records.varietal: Predominantly Tempranillo with possible Garnacha or Graciano blending
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant dark fruit aromas of blackberry, black cherry, and plum, complemented by subtle oak influence showing vanilla, coconut, and a hint of sweet spice. Fresh herb notes—rosemary and thyme—add Mediterranean complexity, while a touch of violet and graphite provides aromatic depth. The wine shows more fruit-forward character than traditional Gran Reservas, reflecting modern winemaking sensibilities.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent dark fruit and subtle oak spice. Balanced acidity and well-integrated tannins create a harmonious conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with bright, concentrated fruit flavors taking center stage. Black cherry, raspberry, and cassis provide a juicy core, while integrated oak adds structure and complexity without overwhelming the fruit. The wine displays characteristic Rioja acidity that provides freshness and lift, balanced by smooth tannins that suggest careful extraction and aging. A touch of chocolate and coffee from oak complements rather than dominates."}

records.name: Emek Reb Yose Ben Teima Cabernet Sauvignon Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: A kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Israel's prestigious Galilee region, produced under strict religious supervision (Mevushal, Kosher for Passover, OU and Badatz Jerusalem Edah Hachareidis certified). The Mevushal process—heating the wine to specific temperatures—ensures the wine maintains its kosher status while preserving quality and character, allowing it to be handled and served by anyone without compromising religious observance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents classic Cabernet Sauvignon hallmarks with a Mediterranean twist reflective of Galilee's warm climate. Aromas of ripe blackberry, cassis, and black plum dominate, supported by notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs characteristic of the region. Subtle hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and vanilla from oak aging add complexity, while a suggestion of eucalyptus and Mediterranean scrubland brings regional character. The aromatic profile shows the ripeness possible in Israel's sunny climate while maintaining varietal typicity.","finish":"The finish shows good length with persistent dark fruit, oak spice, and moderate tannins. The conclusion is clean and structured, with the wine's acidity and tannins providing framework for food pairing. While the Mevushal process can sometimes soften a wine's structure, careful production maintains this Cabernet's integrity and varietal character.","palate":"On the palate, this Cabernet delivers full-bodied richness with concentrated dark fruit flavors—blackcurrant, black cherry, and plum—that reflect Galilee's warm, sun-drenched growing conditions. The wine shows good structure with firm but ripe tannins that provide grip without harshness, a testament to careful winemaking that maintains quality through the Mevushal heating process. Oak influence contributes notes of vanilla, mocha, and subtle baking spices, while maintaining fruit focus. Medium to high acidity provides balance to the wine's richness, keeping it food-friendly and structured. The Mevushal process, when done carefully, preserves the wine's core character while ensuring religious compliance."}

records.name: Backsberg Patriarch Cabernet Franc 2022
records.description: A refined expression of Cabernet Franc from South Africa's renowned Paarl region, this wine showcases the varietal's signature aromatic complexity and elegant structure. Backsberg's Patriarch line represents their premium tier, demonstrating what modern South African viticulture can achieve with this noble Bordeaux variety in warm-climate conditions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Vibrant and expressive nose featuring bright red fruit—raspberry compote, ripe strawberry, and red currant—alongside intriguing savory notes of roasted red bell pepper and fresh herbs. Subtle hints of green peppercorn and dried oregano add complexity, while gentle oak influence contributes notes of vanilla, cedar, and a touch of tobacco. The aromatic profile balances fruit purity with earthy, herbaceous character typical of well-made Cabernet Franc.","finish":"Medium to long finish with persistent red fruit and a savory, slightly spicy quality. Notes of fresh herbs, black pepper, and subtle oak linger, leaving a clean, refreshing impression. The tannins are soft and integrated, with enough grip to pair well with food.","palate":"Medium-bodied with supple, fine-grained tannins and refreshing acidity that provides structure and vitality. The palate delivers focused flavors of bright cherry, raspberry sauce, and plum, complemented by savory elements of smoky tomato, sweet pepper, and dried herbs. Oak aging adds subtle layers of chocolate, mocha, and baking spices without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows excellent balance between ripe fruit character and the varietal's characteristic herbal, peppery notes, with a silky texture and moderate alcohol integration."}

records.name: Weinrieder Riesling Reid Kugler 2021
records.description: An exceptional single-vineyard Austrian Riesling from the Reid Kugler site, this wine exemplifies the precision and terroir-driven character that Austrian winemaking has become renowned for. Weinrieder crafts dry Rieslings of outstanding quality, showcasing the mineral-rich soils and cool climate influences that distinguish Austrian examples from their German counterparts.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with classic Riesling character: vibrant lime zest, green apple, and white peach lead the nose, followed by delicate white flowers—jasmine and acacia blossom. Distinctive mineral notes suggest wet stones and slate, while subtle hints of beeswax and honeysuckle add depth. A faint whisper of the characteristic 'petrol' note emerges, indicating quality and age-worthiness. The overall impression is pure, crystalline, and precise.","finish":"Long, mineral-driven finish with lingering citrus and stone fruit notes. The high acidity leaves the palate remarkably refreshed and cleansed. A persistent flinty minerality and subtle beeswax note carry through, with the wine's purity and precision evident to the last drop.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with a steely backbone of racy acidity that defines Austrian Riesling. The wine is completely dry, showcasing concentrated flavors of tart green apple, Meyer lemon, white grapefruit, and ripe stone fruit. Pronounced minerality runs through the palate like a vein of quartz, adding tension and energy. Subtle notes of wet stone and saline character reflect the vineyard's terroir, while the clean, crisp acidity keeps the wine vibrant and refreshing. The mouthfeel is precise and focused, with excellent intensity despite the light body."}

records.name: Priorat Galena 2021
records.description: A powerful and distinctive red from Spain's prestigious Priorat region, Galena embodies the unique terroir of this mountainous Catalonian appellation. Crafted from traditional Priorat varieties grown in the region's characteristic llicorella slate soils, this wine demonstrates the concentrated, mineral-driven style that has earned Priorat international acclaim and DOCa status.
records.varietal: Primarily Garnacha (Grenache) and Cariñena (Carignan), possibly with Cabernet Sauvignon or Merlot
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense and complex aromatics revealing dark fruit concentration: black cherry, blackberry jam, and ripe plum, intermingled with distinctive mineral notes of crushed slate and wet gravel. The bouquet shows layers of complexity with licorice, dark chocolate, espresso, and dried Mediterranean herbs—thyme and rosemary. Oak aging contributes subtle notes of vanilla, toast, and sweet tobacco, while a hint of violet and black pepper adds aromatic intrigue. The overall impression is powerful yet sophisticated.","finish":"Long, powerful finish with persistent dark fruit, crushed gravel minerality, and gripping tannins. Notes of licorice, dark chocolate, and dried herbs linger, with the characteristic dusty, mineral quality that defines great Priorat. The finish is structured and age-worthy, with layers of complexity that continue to unfold.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a dense, concentrated core of dark fruit flavors. The palate delivers black cherry, plum compote, and blackberry preserves, supported by high, firm tannins that provide serious structure and aging potential. The hallmark dusty minerality of Priorat runs throughout, adding tension and complexity to the ripe fruit. Layers of dark chocolate, mocha, and baking spices from oak aging integrate beautifully with the fruit, while medium-high acidity balances the wine's richness. The alcohol (typically 13.5-15% ABV) is well-integrated, contributing to the wine's full body and warming finish without overwhelming the terroir-driven character."}

records.name: Famille Henry Isle Saint Pierre Rose 2022
records.description: A delicate Loire Valley rosé from the Isle Saint Pierre region, crafted in the elegant Anjou style. This refreshing expression showcases the region's characteristic crisp acidity and bright fruit character.
records.varietal: Blend of Grolleau and Cabernet Franc (traditional Anjou rosé grapes)
records.region: Isle Saint Pierre, Loire Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Enticing aromas of fresh strawberry and wild raspberry greet the nose, intertwined with delicate floral hints of rose petals and white flowers. Subtle notes of citrus zest and a whisper of crushed herbs add complexity to the bouquet. The aromatic profile reflects the Loire's cool-climate finesse, offering an inviting introduction to this crisp rosé.","finish":"The finish is clean and crisp with lingering notes of red berries and citrus. A refreshing acidity persists, leaving the palate cleansed and eager for the next sip, making this an ideal wine for warm weather enjoyment.","palate":"On the palate, vibrant red berry flavors dance across the tongue—ripe strawberry, cranberry, and hints of watermelon create a juicy, refreshing core. The wine's characteristic Loire acidity provides excellent structure and lift, while maintaining a light, elegant body. A subtle minerality emerges mid-palate, adding depth and sophistication to the fresh fruit character."}

records.name: Natte Valleij Axle Chenin Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant South African Chenin Blanc from Natte Valleij estate, representing the country's signature white grape variety. This wine exemplifies the fresh, versatile style that has made South African Chenin Blanc globally renowned.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with expressive aromas of ripe pear and quince, accented by tropical notes of guava and passion fruit. Hints of chamomile and white blossoms add a delicate floral dimension, while subtle ginger spice provides aromatic complexity. A touch of honeycomb sweetness rounds out the inviting bouquet, characteristic of quality South African Chenin.","finish":"The finish is bright and persistent with lingering citrus and stone fruit notes. The high acidity leaves a refreshing, clean impression that makes this wine exceptionally food-friendly and versatile.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a lively texture, the palate reveals layers of tart green apple, Asian pear, and fresh citrus. The wine's natural high acidity provides excellent structure and vibrancy, balanced by ripe stone fruit flavors and a hint of jasmine. A subtle creamy texture from lees contact adds depth while maintaining the wine's fresh, crisp character."}

records.name: Anko Torrontes 2023
records.description: An aromatic Argentine white wine showcasing the Torrontés Riojano grape, Argentina's signature white variety. This wine captures the distinctive floral and fruity character that has made Torrontés a favorite among lovers of aromatic wines.
records.region: Salta, Argentina (likely from high-altitude Calchaquíes Valleys)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with captivating perfumes of white flowers, jasmine, and rose petals dominating the nose. Fresh peach and ripe apricot provide lush fruit character, while subtle notes of lychee and orange blossom add exotic complexity. Reminiscent of Gewürztraminer and Muscat, the bouquet is instantly appealing and distinctively Argentine.","finish":"The finish is medium in length with persistent floral and stone fruit notes. A touch of spice lingers pleasantly, while the moderate acidity keeps the wine fresh and approachable.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a smooth, silky texture that belies its aromatic intensity. Flavors of white peach, apricot, and tropical fruits fill the palate, supported by moderate acidity that provides balance. Delicate spice notes—reminiscent of white pepper and ginger—weave through the fruit, while the wine maintains freshness despite its aromatic richness."}

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2010
records.description: A prestigious Rioja Gran Reserva with extended aging, representing the pinnacle of traditional Spanish winemaking. This wine has undergone minimum 24 months in oak and 36 months in bottle, resulting in a complex, mature expression of Tempranillo.
records.varietal: Predominantly Tempranillo (87%+) with possible small amounts of Garnacha and Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals the complexity of extended aging with layers of dried cherry, blackberry compote, and plum interwoven with pronounced vanilla and cedar from oak maturation. Secondary aromas of leather, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs emerge, along with subtle notes of balsamic, cocoa, and earthy forest floor. The bouquet is elegant and sophisticated, showing beautiful evolution from the 2010 vintage.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant with persistent notes of dried fruit, vanilla, and subtle tobacco. Well-integrated tannins and balanced acidity provide structure without weight, leaving a sophisticated, memorable impression that speaks to the wine's quality aging.","palate":"Full-bodied yet refined, the palate shows mature red fruit flavors—cherry, plum, and cassis—seamlessly integrated with oak-derived notes of vanilla, coconut, and sweet spice. The wine's characteristic Rioja Alta brightness shines through with lifted acidity that provides structure and length. Silky tannins have softened beautifully with age, creating a velvety texture that carries flavors effortlessly across the palate."}

records.name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi Spoleto Trebbiano Spoletino
records.description: An authentic expression of Trebbiano Spoletino from the historic Spoleto region in Umbria, Italy. This wine showcases a distinctive local clone of the Trebbiano family, offering more character and complexity than generic Trebbiano expressions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals fresh, clean aromas of green apple, citrus, and white flowers with characteristic high-toned acidity. Hints of Mediterranean herbs—basil and fennel—add aromatic interest, while a subtle mineral quality suggests the wine's Umbrian origins. Unlike generic Trebbiano, this Spoletino clone shows more aromatic definition and complexity.","finish":"The finish is bright and lively with persistent acidity and citrus notes. A mineral edge lingers, along with subtle herbal nuances that make this wine particularly food-friendly and versatile.","palate":"Medium-light bodied with pronounced acidity that defines the wine's structure and character. Flavors of crisp green apple, lemon, and grapefruit dominate, supported by the grape's naturally high acid backbone. The wine is fresh and fruity with a clean, mineral-driven mid-palate that adds depth and interest. A subtle herbal quality and hint of white pepper provide savory complexity."}

records.name: Napa Valley Burly Cabernet Sauvignon (Simpkins) 2021
records.description: A bold, fruit-forward Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from the Simpkins family, living up to its 'Burly' designation with powerful flavors and structure. This wine showcases the ripe, concentrated style that has made Napa Cabernet world-famous since the 1976 Judgment of Paris.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon or predominantly Cabernet with minor Bordeaux varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Powerful aromas of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and cassis leap from the glass, characteristic of Napa's warm climate ripeness. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and vanilla from oak aging add depth, while hints of tobacco, cedar, and graphite provide complexity. A subtle eucalyptus note and touch of black olive speak to Napa's terroir, creating a bold, inviting bouquet.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful with persistent black fruit, oak spice, and firm tannins. The wine's structure suggests excellent aging potential, while its fruit concentration and warmth leave a bold, memorable impression.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with intense flavors of black fruit—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—dominating the palate. The wine shows the characteristic 'Burly' power with concentrated fruit supported by firm, structured tannins and well-integrated oak. Flavors of mocha, dark chocolate, and sweet baking spices emerge mid-palate, while higher alcohol (likely 14%+) adds warmth and weight. Despite its power, the wine maintains balance with sufficient acidity to carry the concentrated flavors."}

records.name: Monte Real Barrel Fermented 2023
records.description: A premium barrel-fermented white wine from one of Rioja's most historic bodegas, Monte Real. This wine represents the modern evolution of white Rioja, combining indigenous varietals with sophisticated barrel fermentation techniques to create a wine of depth, complexity, and exceptional aging potential.
records.varietal: Likely Viura (Macabeo) with possible blending of Malvasía and/or Garnacha Blanca
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Complex aromatics showcase ripe stone fruit including white peach, apricot, and nectarine, layered with barrel fermentation notes of vanilla bean, toasted hazelnut, and brioche. The nose reveals elegant oak integration with hints of crème brûlée, butter, and light toast complementing rather than dominating the fruit. Underlying notes of citrus blossom, chamomile, and wet stone add freshness and minerality. A subtle oxidative character typical of barrel-fermented whites contributes complexity with hints of baked apple and honey.","finish":"The finish is long, complex, and satisfying, with oak spice, stone fruit, and mineral notes extending gracefully. Hints of toasted almond, vanilla, and a subtle oxidative character linger alongside refreshing acidity, creating a complete and sophisticated conclusion.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with creamy lees influence and barrel fermentation adding weight and complexity. The palate delivers flavors of ripe golden apple, poached pear, and tropical notes of mango and pineapple, balanced by vibrant acidity that prevents heaviness. Oak influence is pronounced but harmonious, contributing vanilla, butterscotch, and sweet spice notes alongside a subtle smoky quality. The wine shows excellent structure with a slightly phenolic grip and mineral backbone that adds dimension. Lees aging provides a silky, almost glycerin-like texture."}

records.name: Raywood Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
records.description: A vibrant California Cabernet Sauvignon showcasing the youthful exuberance of the 2023 vintage. This wine delivers approachable fruit-forward character with well-integrated tannins, making it an excellent choice for everyday enjoyment while maintaining varietal integrity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting aromas of ripe blackcurrant and dark cherry, complemented by subtle hints of cedar and vanilla from oak aging. Secondary notes of fresh bay leaf and a whisper of dark chocolate add complexity, while underlying violet florals provide an elegant aromatic lift. The overall impression is one of generous fruit expression balanced by restrained herbal nuances.","finish":"The finish is medium in length with lingering dark fruit and a pleasant savory quality. Subtle spice notes emerge on the close, with soft tannins leaving a satisfying, slightly chalky texture that invites another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this Cabernet shows excellent mid-weight structure with flavors of black plum and cassis taking center stage. The wine's fruit core is supported by fine-grained tannins that provide grip without astringency, while integrated acidity keeps the palate fresh and lively. Subtle notes of toasted oak, espresso, and dried sage weave through the fruit, adding depth and dimension to the experience."}

records.name: Galea Mimosa Sangria NV
records.description: A ready-to-drink Spanish sangria with a mimosa twist, combining traditional wine punch elements with sparkling wine and citrus. This festive beverage offers a convenient, celebratory option perfect for gatherings and warm weather enjoyment.
records.varietal: Blend of red wine base with sparkling wine, orange juice, and mixed fruits
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright, festive aromas of fresh orange juice and sparkling wine immediately evoke celebrations and sunshine. Notes of mixed berries—strawberry, raspberry, and blackberry—mingle with citrus zest, while hints of peach, pineapple, and apple add complexity. A subtle sweetness from the fruit and a whisper of brandy create an inviting, party-ready bouquet.","finish":"The finish is refreshing and fruity with lingering notes of citrus and mixed berries. The effervescence carries through to the end, leaving a clean, lively impression that encourages another sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with lively bubbles that dance across the palate, providing refreshing effervescence. The wine base shows red fruit character—cherry and berry—enhanced by fresh orange juice and mixed fruit flavors. A pleasant sweetness is balanced by natural citrus acidity, while carbonation adds lift and vivacity. The overall impression is festive, fruity, and immediately enjoyable."}

records.name: Frico Bianco IGT Venezie (NOVA only) 2024
records.description: A fresh, accessible white wine from the Venezie IGT designation in northeastern Italy. This light, crisp expression showcases the Veneto region's talent for producing delicate, aromatic white wines perfect for everyday enjoyment.
records.varietal: Likely blend of local white grapes such as Garganega, Pinot Grigio, or Glera
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with delicate aromas of white flowers, green apple, and citrus blossom. Hints of lemon zest and fresh pear add brightness, while subtle almond notes provide depth characteristic of Veneto white wines. A mineral edge suggests Alpine influence, creating a clean, refined aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and crisp with lingering citrus and almond notes. Refreshing acidity leaves the palate cleansed and ready for food, making this an ideal wine for casual dining.","palate":"Light-bodied and refreshing with flavors of crisp green apple, lemon, and white peach dancing across the palate. The wine's natural acidity provides excellent structure and vibrancy, while maintaining an approachable, easy-drinking character. A fine, almost delicate texture carries the flavors gracefully, with subtle almond and mineral notes emerging mid-palate to add complexity."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 40 Year Port
records.description: An exceptional aged tawny Port from the prestigious Quinta do Mourão, a small estate located on the bank of the Douro opposite Régua. Producer Miguel Braga calls this his 'contemplation wine,' beginning with the 1948 vintage and representing the pinnacle of the estate's aged tawny production, showcasing decades of patient barrel aging and masterful blending of rare colheita lots.
records.varietal: Traditional Port varieties including lots from 1948 vintage
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The complex bouquet reveals extraordinary depth with aromas of candied dried apricots, toasted brown sugar, and deep toffee. Bourbon vanilla emerges alongside Meyer lemon peel and candied blood orange, creating a symphony of aged port aromatics. The nose displays remarkable integration of sugars and acidity developed over four decades in wood, with notes of caramel, roasted nuts, and dried figs adding further layers.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and contemplative, with waves of candied fruit, toffee, and gentle spice lingering on the palate. Beautifully balanced acidity prevents any cloying sweetness, leaving a refined, elegant conclusion befitting this exceptional aged tawny.","palate":"The palate showcases beautifully integrated sugars and acidity in perfect harmony. Rich flavors of Meyer lemon, candied blood orange, and toasted brown sugar dominate, intertwined with deep toffee and bourbon vanilla. The texture is silky and luxurious, with layers of dried apricot, fig compote, and butterscotch revealing themselves gradually. The wine's complexity is extraordinary, reflecting its four decades of evolution."}

records.name: Barone Di Bernaj Cabernet Sauvignon Terre Siciliane 2021
records.description: A lighter, more food-friendly expression of Cabernet Sauvignon from Sicily, crafted by Cantine Madaudo. This wine showcases the bright, fruit-forward style typical of Sicilian reds with pronounced acidity and approachable character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a deep ruby color in the glass, releasing an intense bouquet of pomegranate and dark cherry. The aromatic profile is pure and fruit-focused, with the bright red fruit taking center stage. Subtle earthy undertones and delicate herbal whispers provide complexity without overshadowing the primary fruit expression. The nose shows more elegance than power, suggesting a Mediterranean approach to this traditionally bold variety.","finish":"Medium-length finish with persistent red fruit and subtle earthy notes. The pronounced acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while gentle tannins provide structure without heaviness.","palate":"Very fruit-forward on the palate with vibrant cherry leading, followed by tart cranberry and juicy blueberry notes. The wine is lighter than expected for Cabernet Sauvignon, with bright acidity making it wonderfully food-friendly. Complex touches of fresh herbs, cooling mint, and hibiscus-like florals add interest to the mid-palate. Lingering notes of leather and earthy nuances emerge towards the finish, adding depth while maintaining the wine's approachable character."}

records.name: Sutherland Syrah 2015
records.description: A mature expression of cool-climate Syrah that has evolved beautifully over nearly a decade. This wine demonstrates the remarkable aging potential of quality Syrah, displaying tertiary complexity while retaining core fruit character and structural integrity.
records.region: Unknown (likely cool-climate region based on producer style)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals the wine's maturity with evolved aromas of dried blackberry, cured meat, and leather intermingling with savory olive tapenade and cracked black pepper. Beneath these developed characteristics lie subtle notes of smoked bacon, wild herbs, and a distinctive earthy minerality reminiscent of wet stone. Hints of aged tobacco and sandalwood add an exotic dimension to the complex aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and contemplative, with savory elements dominating over fruit. Notes of black olive, charred meat, and fine leather persist, while a mineral edge keeps the palate refreshed and engaged well after the wine is swallowed.","palate":"The palate showcases a beautiful evolution, with primary fruit giving way to secondary and tertiary flavors of dark cherry compote, fig paste, and blackberry reduction. The wine maintains impressive structure with resolved tannins that feel silky and integrated, while bright acidity provides freshness despite the wine's age. Layers of game, graphite, roasted coffee bean, and Mediterranean herbs create a sophisticated flavor tapestry, with subtle umami notes adding intrigue."}

records.name: Dominio de la Abadesa Verdejo 2018
records.description: An aromatic Verdejo from Spain's Rueda region, barrel-fermented in French oak and aged on its lees for 3 months with weekly bâtonnage. This adds complexity and texture to the typically crisp Verdejo grape, creating a more sophisticated expression.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with a compelling blend of tropical and mineral notes. Clean and very intense, the nose reveals smoky, spicy nuances from the oak influence, with hints of fennel, fresh herbs, and a distinctive touch of anise. Ripe fruits emerge alongside the herbal complexity.","finish":"Persistent and complex with an intense aftertaste. The finish is both elegant and lingering, leaving impressions of ripe fruit, fennel, and subtle oak spice.","palate":"Fresh and refreshing yet simultaneously unctuous and sweet, creating an elegant duality. The wine maintains its varietal freshness while the oak and lees contact add weight and complexity. Straw yellow with golden tones and greenish iridescence in the glass."}

records.name: Orchard Lane Sauvignon Blanc 2023
records.description: A vibrant expression of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand's premier wine region. Sourced from two special vineyards in the heart of Marlborough's Sauvignon Blanc country and fermented separately by block before blending, this wine preserves the crisp tropical fruit flavors and aromatics that have made the region famous, offering exceptional value and typicity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Youthfully expressed and inviting, the bouquet bursts with ripe tropical aromas of passionfruit and mango, layered with green apple, apricot, and kiwifruit. Jasmine florals add elegance and lift to the aromatic profile, while subtle hints of citrus zest and fresh herbs provide complexity. The nose is vibrant, pure, and expressive of classic Marlborough character.","finish":"Bright and fresh with plenty of tasty tropical and citrus flavors persisting through the finish. The conclusion is clean and zesty, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food.","palate":"The palate is lively, succulent, and flavoursome, packed with ripe tropical fruit that mirrors the aromatic promise. Rich and rounded in texture with flavors of passionfruit, mango, and ripe citrus fruits, yet maintained by crisp hints of lime and grapefruit that provide freshness and balance. The wine's stainless steel fermentation preserves the varietal purity and bright fruit character."}

records.name: Soco Vinicola Soco Blanco Lanzarote 2023
records.description: An exotic white wine from the volcanic island of Lanzarote in Spain's Canary Islands, where vines are grown in distinctive black volcanic pits called 'hoyos' to protect them from fierce winds. This wine captures the unique terroir of volcanic soils and Atlantic influence, offering a distinctive expression unlike any mainland Spanish white.
records.varietal: Likely Malvasía Volcánica and/or Listán Blanco (indigenous Canary Island varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose immediately announces its volcanic origins with striking mineral notes of flint, crushed oyster shell, and wet volcanic rock. These are beautifully interwoven with aromas of green apple, white peach, and citrus blossom, while saline and iodine hints evoke the nearby Atlantic Ocean. Subtle tropical notes of pineapple and passion fruit add exotic intrigue, alongside fresh fennel and white pepper that speak to the wine's aromatic complexity.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and mineral-driven, with sea salt, lemon zest, and stony minerality lingering on the palate. A subtle bitter almond note appears at the close, adding complexity and making this a wonderfully food-friendly wine.","palate":"On the palate, the wine delivers electric acidity and intense minerality that frame flavors of Meyer lemon, Granny Smith apple, and white grapefruit. The volcanic terroir imparts a distinctive chalky texture and a saline quality that gives the wine incredible freshness and energy. Mid-palate weight is moderate, with flavors of green melon, nectarine, and a whisper of almond adding dimension, while the wine's briny character keeps everything lifted and precise."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Garnacha 2020
records.description: A premium expression of old-vine Garnacha from one of Rioja's most historic bodegas, founded in 1890. Monte Real represents the estate's commitment to showcasing single-varietal wines that express the unique character of Garnacha grown in select Rioja vineyards, offering a modern interpretation of this traditional Spanish grape.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose delivers the hallmark generosity of Garnacha with exuberant red fruit aromas of ripe strawberry, raspberry, and red cherry dominating the bouquet. These primary fruit notes are complemented by intriguing layers of crushed flowers, particularly violet and rose petal, alongside subtle hints of white pepper, dried herbs, and a touch of sweet baking spice from oak influence. Underlying earthy notes of red clay and garrigue add complexity and sense of place.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant with persistent red fruit and spice notes. A subtle mineral edge emerges, along with hints of dried rose petals and fine-grained tannins that leave a refined, velvety impression.","palate":"The palate is medium to full-bodied with a silky, supple texture that is quintessentially Garnacha. Flavors mirror the aromatics with bright red fruit—particularly strawberry and cherry—taking center stage, supported by notes of pomegranate, cranberry, and a hint of blood orange. The wine shows beautiful balance with soft, ripe tannins providing structure without heaviness, while fresh acidity keeps everything vibrant. Oak integration is seamless, contributing subtle vanilla, cinnamon, and a whisper of cocoa without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Alfaro Family Vineyards A Estate Syrah 2023
records.description: An estate-grown Syrah from Alfaro Family Vineyards, representing the family's commitment to sustainable farming and handcrafted winemaking. The 2023 vintage showcases youthful Syrah character with vibrant fruit and spice, reflecting the terroir of their estate vineyards and the fresh, exuberant nature of this recent harvest.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet bursts with youthful Syrah character, displaying intense aromas of fresh blackberry, blueberry, and dark plum. Classic Syrah hallmarks emerge with pronounced black pepper, cured meat, and violet florals adding complexity and intrigue. Secondary notes of graphite, espresso bean, and a hint of smoked bacon provide savory depth, while subtle olive tapenade and dried herbs contribute a Mediterranean dimension to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and structured with lingering dark fruit and pronounced spice. Black pepper and smoked meat notes persist, while firm tannins provide a satisfying grip that will soften with age or pair beautifully with rich foods.","palate":"The palate is medium to full-bodied with a core of concentrated dark fruit—think blackberry compote, boysenberry, and black cherry—supported by excellent structural elements. Firm yet fine-grained tannins provide grip and ageability, while fresh acidity keeps the wine balanced and lively despite its youth. Flavors of cracked black pepper, dark cocoa, roasted coffee, and smoky bacon weave through the fruit, creating a complex flavor profile that is both hedonistic and intellectual. A subtle gamey note adds interest without overwhelming."}

records.name: Calyptra Petit Inedito 2018
records.description: A sophisticated Chilean red blend from the prestigious Alto Cachapoal Valley, representing Calyptra's second wine or 'little brother' to their flagship Inédito Limited Edition. This meticulously crafted assemblage showcases the estate's mastery of blending Bordeaux varieties with Rhône's Syrah, aged partially in oak to create a wine that has earned 94 points from Descorchados for its exceptional price-quality ratio.
records.region: Alto Cachapoal Valley, Cachapoal Valley DO, Chile
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The expressive nose captivates with vivid aromas of fresh cherry and ripe plum, complemented by enticing fruits of the forest. A delicate floral bouquet interweaves with subtle spice accents, while herbal mountain wine characteristics add depth and complexity. The aromatic profile reveals the wine's careful barrel selection and estate vineyard origins.","finish":"A silky and fresh finish showcases notes of cassis and black plum that linger elegantly. The conclusion is refined and persistent, displaying the hallmarks of premium Alto Cachapoal terroir.","palate":"The mouth entry is juicy and inviting, with firm yet impeccably balanced tannins creating a silky texture. Medium acidity provides structure while maintaining freshness throughout. The palate delivers an abundance of fruity flavors, particularly cassis and black plum, with the wine's 75% barrel aging contributing seamless integration without overpowering the fruit expression."}

records.name: Raywood White Zinfandel 2021
records.description: A vibrant off-dry rosé from Raywood, the value-driven label of Castoro Cellars in California's Central Coast. This White Zinfandel offers a fresh take on the classic California style, balancing red fruit character with measured sweetness and crisp acidity, making it an approachable and food-friendly wine for diverse occasions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with bright aromas of fresh strawberry and watermelon, complemented by notes of raspberry and red cherry. Subtle floral hints of rose petal add elegance, while a touch of citrus zest provides lift. The aromatic profile is clean, fresh, and immediately appealing with its vibrant fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is clean and brisk with lingering red berry notes and a refreshing quality. The wine's measured sweetness and bright acidity combine to create a satisfying, balanced conclusion that cleanses the palate.","palate":"Full of red fruit flavors, the palate delivers fresh strawberry, cherry, and cranberry notes balanced with a bit of sweetness that never becomes cloying. The wine's crisp acidity provides excellent structure, creating a harmonious off-dry style that feels refreshing rather than heavy. Clean and brisk on the mid-palate with a light, juicy texture."}

records.name: Bodegas Tandem Inmune Garnacha 2021
records.description: A modern Spanish Garnacha from Bodegas Tandem, a project focused on showcasing the versatility and quality potential of Spanish indigenous varieties. The 'Inmune' designation suggests wines made with minimal intervention, allowing the pure expression of Garnacha and terroir to shine through with authenticity and vibrancy.
records.region: Spain (specific region unknown, likely Aragón, Navarra, or similar Garnacha-producing area)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an inviting bouquet of fresh red and dark fruit with ripe cherry, raspberry, and blackberry leading the aromatic charge. Floral notes of lavender and rose add elegance, while Mediterranean herbs—think thyme, rosemary, and wild sage—contribute a garrigue-like character that speaks to the wine's Spanish origins. Subtle spice elements of cinnamon, clove, and a hint of licorice add complexity, with underlying earthy notes of sun-baked clay and scrubland.","finish":"The finish is medium in length with persistent red fruit and herbal notes. A subtle mineral edge and fine tannins provide structure, while the wine's natural freshness keeps the close clean and vibrant.","palate":"On the palate, this Garnacha shows beautiful purity of fruit with flavors of ripe strawberry, cherry, and pomegranate taking center stage. The wine displays medium body with a juicy, approachable texture that is immediately pleasurable, while maintaining enough structure and complexity to remain interesting. Fresh acidity provides lift and balance, while soft, rounded tannins ensure smooth drinking. Minimal intervention winemaking allows the fruit to speak clearly, with subtle hints of dried herbs, red tea, and sweet spice adding nuance without oak heaviness."}

records.name: Angoris Schioppettino 2020
records.description: An outstanding expression of Schioppettino, one of Friuli-Venezia Giulia's most distinctive indigenous red grape varieties. Angoris, a historic estate in the Collio region, showcases this rare varietal's unique spicy, peppery character and remarkable ability to express the region's terroir with precision and authenticity.
records.region: Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy (likely DOC Collio or DOC Friuli Colli Orientali)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose immediately announces Schioppettino's distinctive character with pronounced aromas of black pepper, crushed violets, and dark berries. Blackberry, wild blueberry, and sour cherry mingle with striking spice notes of white pepper, cracked black peppercorn, and exotic spices reminiscent of Szechuan pepper. Herbal elements of dried oregano, bay leaf, and wild fennel add complexity, while subtle hints of graphite, iron, and forest floor contribute an earthy, mineral dimension unique to this variety.","finish":"The finish is long and compelling with persistent spice, dark fruit, and mineral notes. Schioppettino's characteristic peppery edge lingers prominently, while fine tannins and bright acidity leave the palate refreshed and engaged, demanding food or contemplation.","palate":"The palate reveals a wine of medium to full body with vibrant acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins that provide excellent structure. Dark fruit flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis are interwoven with the grape's signature peppery spice, creating a fascinating interplay between fruit and savory elements. The wine shows remarkable freshness and energy with bright acidity cutting through the concentrated fruit, while flavors of black tea, tobacco leaf, licorice, and dark chocolate add layers of complexity. A distinctive mineral quality runs through the mid-palate, reflecting the limestone-rich soils of Friuli."}

records.name: Coelheira Red (WINE CLUB) 2019
records.description: A Portuguese red wine from a wine club selection. Based on the name 'Coelheira' (Portuguese), this is likely a blend from a Portuguese wine region showcasing traditional varieties and winemaking techniques.
records.varietal: Portuguese red blend (specific varieties not identified)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents traditional Portuguese red wine aromatics with ripe dark fruits including blackberry and plum, complemented by earthy notes and hints of Mediterranean herbs. Subtle spice and oak influence add complexity.","finish":"The finish is medium to long with lingering dark fruit and spice notes. The wine's balanced structure carries through to the end.","palate":"The palate showcases rich dark fruit flavors supported by moderate tannins and balanced acidity. The wine's structure suggests traditional Portuguese winemaking with good concentration and depth."}

records.name: Remhoogte Free to be Riesling 2024
records.description: A captivating South African Riesling from Remhoogte Estate's 'Free to Be' range, sourced from a small mountain vineyard at 350 meters elevation on exposed shale ridges in Stellenbosch's Simonsberg region. Fermented with wild indigenous yeasts, this wine showcases the mineral intensity and fresh character that South African terroir can bring to this noble German variety.
records.region: Simonsberg, Stellenbosch, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile is fresh, mineral, and inviting with pronounced lemon zest and citrus blossom. Aromatic orchard fruit notes of nectarine and honey-crisp apple add complexity, while the wine's mountain origin contributes distinctive mineral and saline qualities. The nose is pure and expressive, showcasing the terroir's unique character.","finish":"The finish is fresh and mineral-driven with lingering citrus and stone fruit notes. The wine's natural acidity extends the conclusion, leaving a clean, refreshing impression that invites food pairing.","palate":"A fresh, zesty entry leads to sweet fruit flavors balanced by a gentle waxy texture on the mid-palate. The wine offers a mineral and saline journey with layers of lemon zest, nectarine, and crisp apple flavors. Limey acidity brings freshness and length, while the wild yeast fermentation adds textural interest and complexity. The combination of fruit purity and mineral backbone creates exceptional balance."}

records.name: Domaine de la Denante Saint Veran 2023
records.description: An exceptional white Burgundy from the Mâconnais region, representing outstanding value in Chardonnay. This Gold medal winner at the Concours des Grands Vins de France Mâcon showcases producer Damien Martin's expertise, with the 2023 vintage scoring 90 points from Wine Enthusiast and earning praise for its combination of classic Burgundian character and approachable pricing at $23.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Gorgeous floral notes dominate the nose with aromas of acacia and honeysuckle intertwining with citrusy orchard fruit. Ripe peach (pêche) and pear (poire) provide the aromatic foundation, while a hint of classic Burgundy petrol adds complexity and authenticity. The bouquet is elegant and inviting, showcasing the purity of Chardonnay from this esteemed appellation.","finish":"A beautifully dry, youthfully austere finish with lingering orchard fruit and mineral notes. The wine's natural acidity extends the conclusion elegantly, leaving a refined impression of classic white Burgundy character.","palate":"The palate is succulent and medium-weight with beautiful texture (onctueuse) developed through eight months aging on fine lees. Flavors of white peach, pear, and citrus fruit dominate, balanced by belle acidité that provides structure and freshness. The wine's half-stainless, half-barrel aging creates seamless integration, adding depth without overwhelming the fruit's purity."}

records.name: Well Crafted Vin de France Organic Red Keg NV  2000 ml
records.description: An approachable organic red from France's flexible Vin de France designation, crafted for casual enjoyment. This eco-friendly keg format delivers fresh, fruit-forward flavors perfect for gatherings and everyday drinking.
records.varietal: Organic red blend (likely Grenache, Carignan, or Merlot)
records.region: Vin de France (likely Languedoc or Southern France)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents bright red berry aromas with notes of fresh strawberry and raspberry, complemented by subtle earthy undertones. Light herbal hints of thyme and dried flowers add complexity, while a touch of peppery spice provides lift. The organic farming practices contribute to a clean, pure fruit expression that's immediately inviting.","finish":"Clean and refreshing finish with lingering red fruit notes and a hint of dried herbs. The organic character shines through with pure, unadulterated flavors that fade gracefully, leaving the palate ready for another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with juicy acidity that keeps the wine fresh and lively on the palate. Red cherry and cranberry flavors dominate, supported by gentle tannins that provide structure without heaviness. A subtle earthiness reminiscent of forest floor adds depth, while the fruit-forward character remains the star. The keg format preserves the wine's vibrancy beautifully."}

records.name: Pasquiers Plan de Dieu 2019
records.description: A powerful organic Côtes du Rhône Villages from the prestigious Plan de Dieu sub-appellation, showcasing Domaine des Pasquiers' commitment to sustainable viticulture. This Wine Advocate 91-point wine delivers exceptional concentration and southern Rhône character.
records.region: Côtes du Rhône Villages Plan de Dieu, Southern Rhône Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with heady aromas of black cherries and ripe plums, layered with warm notes of candied fruit. A welcome menthol freshness cuts through the richness, while sweet spices of clove and licorice add complexity. The organic farming practices contribute to an intensely pure fruit expression with notable concentration and power.","finish":"Long and softly dusty finish with persistent dark fruit and spice notes. The chocolatey character lingers beautifully alongside the fine, well-integrated tannins, creating an elegant conclusion to this powerful wine.","palate":"Full-bodied and chunky with raw power and impressive concentration of dark fruit flavors. Black cherry and plum dominate, surrounded by beautiful cedar notes and dark chocolate undertones. The fleshy, round style showcases excellent Grenache character with volume in the mouth. Well-integrated tannins provide structure while licorice and sweet spice notes add layers of complexity throughout."}

records.name: Noble Hill Field Atlas 2021
records.description: An intriguing field blend from South Africa's Noble Hill estate in the Simonsberg-Paarl region, where multiple grape varieties are co-planted and harvested together in the traditional 'field blend' style. This approach, reminiscent of old-world winemaking, creates wines of unique complexity and balance that cannot be replicated through blending separately vinified lots.
records.varietal: Field blend (likely includes Syrah, Mourvèdre, Grenache, and possibly Carignan or other Rhône/Mediterranean varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a captivating aromatic mosaic that reflects the wine's field blend nature, with no single variety dominating. Red and dark fruit aromas of raspberry, blackberry, and plum interweave with violet florals and subtle herbal notes of fynbos and dried sage. Spice elements of white pepper, cardamom, and a hint of clove add intrigue, while underlying notes of graphite, cedar, and earthy minerals speak to the wine's complexity and terroir expression. A whisper of game and leather suggests early development.","finish":"The finish is long and layered with persistent dark fruit, spice, and earthy notes. The wine's complexity reveals itself fully on the finish, with each sip uncovering new nuances of fruit, herb, mineral, and spice that linger impressively.","palate":"On the palate, this field blend delivers remarkable complexity and harmony, with the co-fermented varieties creating a seamless, integrated whole. Medium to full-bodied, the wine shows layers of red and black fruit—cherry, blackcurrant, and wild strawberry—supported by excellent structural elements. Firm but refined tannins provide backbone, while fresh acidity keeps everything balanced and lively.
