The diversity of varieties contributes a fascinating array of flavors: dark chocolate, espresso, dried herbs, black olive, and a distinctive savory quality that makes the wine incredibly food-friendly. A subtle mineral thread runs through the palate, adding texture and length."}

records.name: Simply Syrah 2015
records.description: A mature Syrah showcasing the development and complexity that comes with nearly a decade of bottle age. This wine represents the classic New World Syrah style with ripe fruit character mellowed by time, offering drinking pleasure now with layered tertiary aromatics and a softened tannic structure.
records.region: Origin undetermined (likely California or Australia based on naming convention)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals evolved aromas of dark plum compote, blackberry preserves, and dried Mission fig, with tertiary notes of leather, tobacco leaf, and cedar box emerging from extended bottle age. Warm spice notes of black pepper, clove, and star anise add complexity, while hints of dried herbs—thyme and sage—provide savory intrigue. The aromatic profile shows beautiful integration and sophistication from its nine years of evolution.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with lingering notes of dark fruit, roasted coffee, and sweet spice. Soft, integrated tannins provide gentle grip, while a subtle smokiness and hint of leather persist on the tail. This wine is in its drinking window now, offering immediate pleasure with no further aging required.","palate":"Full-bodied with a velvety texture, the palate displays mature flavors of black cherry, dark chocolate, and espresso bean, complemented by earthy notes of truffle and forest floor. The tannins have softened considerably, creating a smooth, supple mouthfeel that's immediately approachable. Mid-palate richness is balanced by moderate acidity, while flavors of dried meat, kalamata olive, and smoky bacon add savory depth characteristic of aged Syrah."}

records.name: Costers del Segre Petit Sios Tinto 2022
records.description: A vibrant red blend from Catalonia's Costers del Segre region, where continental climate and limestone-rich soils at 250-700 meters elevation produce wines of concentration and character. The blend likely features local Spanish varieties such as Garnatxa Negra and Tempranillo alongside international grapes, reflecting the region's diverse plantings and modern winemaking approach.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Garnatxa Negra, Tempranillo, with possible Cabernet Sauvignon or Merlot)
records.region: Costers del Segre DO, Catalonia, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with fresh red fruit aromas of ripe cherry, wild strawberry, and red currant, accented by Mediterranean herbs—rosemary, lavender, and dried thyme. Subtle notes of violet and rose petal add floral lift, while hints of sweet spice—cinnamon and nutmeg—emerge from oak aging. The continental climate's extreme temperature swings are evident in the wine's concentration and aromatic intensity, with a touch of graphite and mineral undertones reflecting the region's limestone soils.","finish":"The finish is medium-long with persistent red fruit character and refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate. A subtle herbaceous quality lingers alongside soft tannins, while hints of spice and mineral add complexity. This is a versatile, food-friendly wine built for enjoyment over the next 3-5 years.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with juicy acidity that brings freshness and vibrancy to the palate. Flavors of bright cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate dominate, supported by subtle earthy notes of dried herbs and black olive tapenade. The mid-palate reveals fine-grained tannins and a touch of vanilla and toast from oak influence, while the wine's mineral backbone provides structure and length. The blend's components show excellent integration, creating a harmonious and balanced wine."}

records.name: Collina San Ponzio Barbera D Alba 2022
records.description: A fresh, vibrant Barbera d'Alba from the esteemed Piedmont estate Collina San Ponzio. This wine showcases Barbera's hallmark bright acidity and juicy fruit character, crafted from the historic Langhe region where the estate has been producing wine since 1878.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and fruity aromas burst from the glass, led by ripe black cherry and blackberry notes. The nose offers additional complexity through white pepper spice and aromatic clove, creating an inviting and energetic aromatic profile. Subtle hints of violet and red plum add elegance, while the wine's youthful character ensures the fruit remains the focal point.","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish where the racy acidity leaves the palate invigorated. Lingering notes of red and black fruit are accompanied by subtle spice, creating a satisfying conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"Simple yet utterly charming on the palate, this easy-drinking red showcases Barbera's signature racy acidity that brightens the juicy fruit flavors. Black cherry and blackberry dominate, enhanced by white pepper and sweet spice notes that provide interest without heaviness. The wine maintains Barbera's characteristic low tannin structure, making it incredibly approachable and food-friendly. A touch of earthiness adds depth to the vibrant fruit core."}

records.name: Lanzarote Vino Rosado 2021
records.description: An earthy, mineral-driven rosé from the volcanic island of Lanzarote in the Canary Islands. Crafted from Listán Negro grapes grown in unique volcanic hoyo pits surrounded by protective stone walls, this wine captures the dramatic terroir of one of the world's most extreme vineyard landscapes.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose immediately reveals the wine's volcanic origins with distinctive smoky minerality and earthy notes reminiscent of wet stones. Tangy red fruit aromas of raspberry and strawberry emerge alongside the mineral character, while subtle herbal hints add complexity. The unique growing conditions impart a saline quality that's evident even on the nose, creating an intriguing aromatic profile unlike any other rosé.","finish":"Clean, mineral-driven finish with lingering smoky notes and bright acidity. The volcanic terroir continues to express itself through the finish, leaving an impression of place that's both memorable and distinctive.","palate":"Dry with high acidity that makes this rosé extremely refreshing and thirst-quenching. The volcanic soil's influence is unmistakable, providing an expression of smoke and tangy red fruit that defines the wine's character. Black volcanic earth contributes earthy depth to the bright berry flavors, while pronounced minerality and salinity add layers of complexity. The wine is deliciously earthy with Listán Negro providing elegant structure and a unique flavor profile."}

records.name: Shabo Reserve Merlot 2022
records.description: A fruit-forward Merlot from Ukraine's historic Shabo winery in the Odessa region. This approachable Reserve showcases ripe berry character enhanced by over six months of oak aging, representing Ukrainian winemaking resilience and quality.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Full of ripe berry aromas that burst from the glass, including blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, and cherries. The nose reveals a medium ruby color's worth of expressive aromatics, with violets and lilacs adding floral elegance. Fresh black plum and subtle vanilla notes from oak aging provide additional complexity, while hints of French oak contribute refined spice without dominating the fruit expression.","finish":"Rounded, smooth finish with persistent berry fruit and subtle oak spice. The soft tannins provide gentle grip while the wine's approachable nature shines through to the end.","palate":"Medium-bodied and bursting with dark and red berry flavors that define this easy-drinking Merlot. The palate unfolds with layers of orange blossom, black cherry, and red plum, creating a complex yet approachable flavor profile. Oak aging provides stability through soft, rounded tannins that frame the fruit beautifully without adding heaviness. The wine is balanced and smooth throughout, making it very food-friendly while maintaining enough structure to stand up to richer dishes."}

records.name: Domaine de la Denante Bourgogne Chardonnay 2022
records.description: An elegant Bourgogne Chardonnay representing the entry to village-level Burgundy, where terroir expression takes precedence over winemaking manipulation. Sourced from vineyards in Burgundy's limestone-rich landscape, this wine embodies the region's hallmark minerality and precise fruit character with minimal oak intervention to showcase the purity of Chardonnay.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Crystalline aromas of white peach, Asian pear, and citrus blossom open the bouquet, accompanied by delicate notes of white flowers and fresh-cut herbs. Mineral notes of wet stone and sea shell emerge prominently, characteristic of Burgundy's Kimmeridgian limestone soils, while subtle hints of brioche and hazelnut suggest gentle lees contact. The nose is refined and nuanced, showing classic restraint and elegance rather than overt power.","finish":"The finish is crisp and exceptionally clean, with persistent citrus and mineral notes that invigorate the palate. A subtle flintiness and hint of white pepper linger, encouraging food pairing. This wine's high acidity and mineral drive make it ideal for consumption within 3-5 years while maintaining its vibrant character.","palate":"Medium-bodied with razor-sharp acidity that defines the wine's architecture, delivering flavors of tart green apple, lemon curd, and white grapefruit. The palate shows impressive mineral tension with saline, chalky notes that provide structure and length, balanced by a creamy texture from batonnage. Flavors of almond skin and subtle butterscotch add depth without obscuring the wine's essential purity and focus on terroir expression."}

records.name: Coste Caumartin 1er Cru Clos de Boucherottes 2019
records.description: A distinguished Premier Cru Burgundy from the Pommard appellation, representing one of Burgundy's most sought-after terroirs. This monopole vineyard produces wines of remarkable depth and elegance, expressing the iron-rich soils and precise winemaking heritage of the Côte de Beaune.
records.region: Pommard Premier Cru, Côte de Beaune, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Profoundly complex aromatics reveal layers of dark cherry, wild raspberry, and crushed rose petals. Earthy notes of forest floor, truffle, and damp autumn leaves emerge alongside subtle hints of sandalwood and Ceylon tea. With air, nuances of sous-bois, leather, and a delicate smokiness from well-integrated oak appear. The aromatic intensity suggests excellent vineyard expression and meticulous cellaring potential.","finish":"Long and noble, the finish extends with persistent dark fruit, mineral complexity, and a saline edge. Firm but resolved tannins grip gently, while the wine's terroir-driven character resonates with echoes of earth, stone, and spice. The conclusion is decidedly Burgundian—elegant, complex, and utterly compelling.","palate":"Concentrated yet refined, displaying the classic Pommard structure with muscular tannins wrapped in velvety fruit. Flavors of black cherry, cassis, and blood orange dominate, supported by earthy minerality and hints of iron and wet stone. The mid-palate shows remarkable depth with layers of baking spices—clove, star anise, and white pepper—complemented by subtle oak-derived vanilla and tobacco leaf. The texture is simultaneously powerful and graceful, with brilliant acidity maintaining precision throughout."}

records.name: Phelps Creek Pinot Gris 2022
records.description: An exceptional expression of Pinot Gris from Oregon's Columbia Gorge AVA, where dramatic elevation changes and unique microclimates create wines of uncommon character. Phelps Creek's sustainable farming and cool-climate viticulture produce Pinot Gris with European sensibility and Pacific Northwest freshness.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a captivating bouquet of ripe Bartlett pear, golden apple, and white peach, accented by honeysuckle and acacia blossoms. Subtle mineral notes reminiscent of wet river stones reflect the Columbia River Gorge terroir, while hints of lemon zest and ginger add aromatic lift. A delicate suggestion of almond skin and faint baking spices contribute texture and complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is crisp and refreshing with excellent length, marked by persistent stone fruit and citrus notes. A minerally backbone carries through, leaving a clean, mouth-watering impression with echoes of orchard fruit and subtle spice.","palate":"Medium-bodied with vibrant acidity that energizes the palate. Flavors of Asian pear and Fuji apple lead, followed by notes of nectarine, citrus confit, and a whisper of vanilla bean. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit richness and mineral-driven precision, with a subtle creaminess that suggests brief lees contact. Hints of toasted hazelnut and meyer lemon appear mid-palate, adding dimension without overwhelming the wine's essential freshness."}

records.name: Anko Malbec Flor de Cardon 2022
records.description: A high-altitude Argentine Malbec from the renowned Uco Valley region, where extreme elevation and dramatic temperature swings produce wines of exceptional concentration and purity. The 'Flor de Cardón' designation references the iconic cactus flower of the Andes, symbolizing the wine's mountain origin and resilient character.
records.region: Uco Valley, Mendoza, Argentina (elevation approximately 3,500-5,000 feet)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic with intense black fruit—blackberry, blueberry, and black cherry—interlaced with violet and lavender floral notes. The high-altitude terroir expresses itself through pronounced minerality, with hints of graphite and crushed stone. Additional layers reveal dark chocolate, espresso, and a subtle smokiness, while hints of Mediterranean herbs like oregano and black olive add savory complexity. The aromatic intensity is remarkable, suggesting excellent fruit concentration from low-yielding mountain vines.","finish":"The finish is long and bold, extending with persistent dark fruit, espresso, and mineral notes. Firm tannins provide grip and structure, while the wine's inherent freshness prevents any sense of heaviness. The conclusion is marked by lingering chocolate, spice, and a distinctive rocky minerality.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerfully structured, showcasing the characteristic density of high-altitude Malbec. Flavors of ripe blackberry, cassis, and dark plum dominate, supported by notes of mocha, vanilla, and sweet tobacco from judicious oak aging. The mid-palate reveals extraordinary depth with hints of black pepper, anise, and a distinctive mineral core that reflects the Andean terroir. Velvety tannins provide substantial structure while remaining supple and integrated. The wine's natural acidity—enhanced by high-altitude growing conditions—maintains freshness despite the wine's power and concentration."}

records.name: Inversa Bergamot Lemon   250 ml
records.description: A innovative sparkling beverage infused with bergamot and lemon, offering a sophisticated non-wine alternative with complex citrus aromatics. This Italian-inspired creation captures the essence of Mediterranean citrus culture in a refreshing, versatile format ideal for aperitivo or creative cocktails.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Vibrant and uplifting aromatics dominated by bright bergamot oil, reminiscent of Earl Grey tea, alongside fresh lemon zest and subtle orange blossom. Delicate herbal notes of lemon verbena and hints of honeysuckle add complexity, while a faint mineral quality provides depth. The nose is intensely citrus-forward yet nuanced and refined.","finish":"Clean and invigorating, the finish features lingering bergamot oils and lemon essence with a gentle bitter edge that cleanses the palate. The carbonation dissipates gradually, leaving a refreshing citrus impression.","palate":"Crisp and effervescent with lively carbonation that dances on the palate. The flavor profile is anchored by pronounced bergamot—both sweet and slightly bitter—balanced by bright lemon acidity. Mid-palate reveals subtle sweetness that enhances the citrus without becoming cloying, alongside hints of white tea and faint floral notes. The carbonation is fine and persistent, providing textural interest and refreshment."}

records.name: Noughty NA Sparkling Chardonnay NV
records.description: A pioneering non-alcoholic sparkling wine crafted from Chardonnay grapes, utilizing innovative dealcoholization technology while preserving the wine's essential character. Noughty represents the new generation of sophisticated alcohol-free alternatives, offering the celebratory experience of sparkling wine without the alcohol content.
records.region: Sourced from quality Chardonnay vineyards (specific region unknown)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Surprisingly complex aromatics featuring green apple, white peach, and citrus notes reminiscent of traditional sparkling wine. Delicate floral hints of elderflower and acacia emerge, alongside subtle notes of fresh bread and a light mineral quality. The nose is clean and inviting, without the cloying sweetness sometimes associated with non-alcoholic wines.","finish":"Clean and moderately long, with lingering apple and citrus notes. The carbonation dissipates gracefully, leaving a refreshing conclusion without residual heaviness or artificial aftertaste.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with lively carbonation that mimics traditional sparkling wine texture. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and lemon dominate, with subtle tropical fruit notes adding dimension. The wine maintains good acidity that provides structure and prevents sweetness from overwhelming the palate. A gentle creaminess appears mid-palate, suggesting contact with lees or similar winemaking techniques. The overall impression is refreshing and wine-like, achieving remarkable similarity to alcoholic sparkling wine."}

records.name: Hendry Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve 2019
records.description: A premium estate Cabernet Sauvignon from Hendry's 114-acre vineyard near Mt. Veeder in Napa Valley, where the family has been farming since 1939. The Reserve designation represents the finest barrels selected from blocks planted on the property's diverse soils, showcasing the marine-influenced terroir and over 85 years of viticultural expertise with concentrated, age-worthy fruit.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon (likely 85-100% with possible small percentages of traditional Bordeaux varieties)
records.region: Napa Valley, California (estate vineyard near Mt. Veeder)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with profound aromas of cassis, black cherry, and dark plum, layered with notes of blackberry compote and boysenberry. Complex secondary aromas of graphite, cigar box, and crushed violets emerge, while tertiary notes of vanilla bean, toasted oak, and baking spices—cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove—add dimension from careful barrel selection. Hints of bay laurel, sage, and eucalyptus reflect the wine's Napa Valley mountain influence and proximity to Mt. Veeder's elevation.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with lingering dark fruit, sweet spice, and fine tannins that grip the palate without harshness. Notes of cocoa powder, toasted oak, and a subtle minerality extend the conclusion, while integrated alcohol provides warmth. This is an age-worthy Reserve Cabernet that will develop beautifully over the next 10-15 years.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured with firm, fine-grained tannins that provide both power and elegance. The palate displays concentrated flavors of ripe blackcurrant, dark cherry, and black plum, supported by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and mocha from premium French oak aging. Mid-palate richness is balanced by bright acidity that lifts the fruit and provides freshness, while earthy undertones of graphite, leather, and forest floor add complexity. The wine shows excellent concentration and depth characteristic of Hendry's estate-grown fruit."}

records.name: Finca Buenaventura Bunbury Red Blend 2018
records.description: A crafted red blend from Spain showcasing the art of assemblage, where complementary grape varieties are brought together to create complexity and balance. This wine reflects a modern approach to Spanish winemaking, blending traditional varieties with international grapes to produce a structured, age-worthy wine with six years of bottle maturation adding depth and integration.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely combination of Tempranillo, Garnacha, and international varieties such as Cabernet Sauvignon or Merlot)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals evolved aromas of dark cherry, blackberry, and plum preserves, interwoven with notes of dried fig and raisin from bottle age. Tertiary aromas of leather, tobacco, and cedar emerge prominently, while hints of vanilla, cocoa, and sweet spice—cinnamon and allspice—add complexity from oak aging. Subtle earthy notes of mushroom and forest floor speak to the wine's maturity, with dried Mediterranean herbs—oregano and marjoram—providing aromatic lift.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of dark fruit, leather, and sweet oak spice. Soft, resolved tannins provide gentle grip while maintaining elegance, and a subtle smokiness with hints of balsamic reduction persist on the tail. This wine is drinking beautifully now and over the next 3-5 years.","palate":"Full-bodied with a velvety texture and well-integrated tannins softened by bottle age. The palate displays mature flavors of black cherry compote, dark plum, and blackcurrant, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and roasted coffee beans. Mid-palate depth reveals earthy complexity with truffle, graphite, and dried meat character, while the wine's balanced acidity provides structure and freshness. The blend's components show seamless integration after six years of evolution."}

records.name: Rueda Reina De Castilla Oak Aged Verdejo 2022
records.description: An elevated expression of Verdejo from Spain's premier white wine region, Rueda. This oak-aged interpretation balances the grape's natural citrus vibrancy with subtle vanilla complexity from barrel fermentation, creating a sophisticated white wine that transcends the typical fresh, unoaked style.
records.varietal: 100% Verdejo with partial oak fermentation and aging
records.region: Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals layers of ripe white peach and golden apple intertwined with delicate vanilla and toasted almond from oak aging. Fresh fennel and white flower notes add aromatic lift, while hints of lemon verbena and wet stone provide mineral complexity. A subtle beeswax quality emerges, indicative of careful oak integration that enhances rather than overwhelms the fruit.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of citrus zest and toasted oak harmonizing beautifully. A pleasant butterscotch quality from lees contact adds richness, while crisp acidity ensures the wine doesn't feel heavy. The mineral backbone typical of Rueda's high-altitude vineyards provides a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites the next sip.","palate":"Rich and textured on the palate, this Verdejo displays flavors of ripe pear, white nectarine, and Meyer lemon, supported by creamy oak influence that adds weight and complexity. The wine's natural acidity remains vibrant despite oak treatment, providing balance to the fuller body. Mid-palate notes of hazelnut, butter, and a touch of spice from barrel fermentation create depth, while maintaining the variety's characteristic freshness and mineral edge."}

records.name: Crimson Clover RED Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: A bold California Cabernet Sauvignon that delivers classic varietal character with ripe fruit concentration and structured tannins. The 2019 vintage captures the warmth and generosity of the growing season, producing a wine with immediate appeal while maintaining enough structure for medium-term cellaring.
records.varietal: Predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon with possible small amounts of blending grapes
records.region: California (likely Central Valley or Central Coast based on name)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry, cassis, and black cherry lead the bouquet, complemented by dark chocolate, cedar, and sweet tobacco. Hints of eucalyptus and dried sage add herbaceous complexity, while vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging provide depth. A subtle violet and graphite note emerges, along with warm baking spices of clove and nutmeg that suggest quality oak integration.","finish":"The finish is long and powerful, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to oak-derived notes of smoke, char, and sweet spice. Firm tannins provide a gripping structure that will soften with time, while the fruit concentration ensures the wine doesn't feel austere. Hints of black licorice and dark chocolate linger, with a warming alcohol presence that speaks to the wine's generosity.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured, the palate offers intense flavors of blackcurrant, dark plum, and boysenberry, supported by firm yet ripe tannins that provide excellent structure. The oak influence is evident through notes of mocha, espresso, and vanilla, integrated seamlessly with the concentrated fruit. Mid-palate richness reveals layers of black olive, dark cocoa, and a touch of mint, while maintaining balance through moderate acidity. The wine's density and extract suggest careful vineyard management and optimal ripeness."}

records.name: Gendraud Patrice Petit Chablis Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: A kosher Mevushal Petit Chablis that maintains the essential character of Burgundy's northernmost appellation while adhering to strict religious winemaking protocols. This wine offers the classic Chablis profile of crisp minerality and citrus precision, produced in a format suitable for kosher observance.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose expresses classic Chablis character with bright green apple, fresh lemon, and limestone minerality taking center stage. Delicate white flower notes of acacia and chamomile add aromatic lift, while subtle hints of oyster shell and wet flint provide the distinctive mineral signature of the region. A whisper of green almond and fresh herbs adds complexity without overwhelming the wine's essential purity and freshness.","finish":"The finish is clean, refreshing, and intensely mineral, with lingering citrus notes and a distinctive saline quality. A subtle green herb note and continued stony minerality provide persistence, while the bright acidity ensures a mouthwatering conclusion. The wine's unoaked profile allows the terroir to speak clearly through to the very end.","palate":"Lean and crystalline on the palate, this Petit Chablis showcases vibrant acidity and penetrating mineral flavors that define the appellation. Citrus notes of lemon zest, lime, and green apple dominate, supported by a chalky, saline quality that speaks to Kimmeridgian limestone soils. The wine remains unoaked, allowing the pure expression of Chardonnay and terroir to shine through. Light-bodied with excellent tension and energy, the palate displays remarkable clarity and focus."}

records.name: Adir Orange Chardonnay Mevushal (MD & DC) 2024
records.description: This innovative kosher orange wine represents a modern interpretation of ancient winemaking techniques, with Chardonnay grapes undergoing extended skin contact. The Mevushal designation ensures the wine meets strict kosher standards while the orange wine style delivers unique textural complexity and bold flavors.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals an intriguing bouquet of ripe red grapefruit and citrus zest, complemented by delicate honey and beeswax notes. Extended skin contact contributes subtle tannic grip and aromatic complexity, with hints of dried apricot, chamomile tea, and orange peel. The wine shows an earthy minerality alongside fresh stone fruit aromas, creating a compelling combination of richness and freshness.","finish":"The finish is distinctive and persistent, with the tannic structure providing length alongside citrus and honey notes. A pleasant phenolic bitterness characteristic of orange wines adds complexity without harshness, while the deep golden hue reflects the wine's unique production method.","palate":"Medium-bodied on the palate with bold structure balanced by refreshing acidity that keeps the wine lively despite its textural weight. Flavors of ripe stone fruits blend with citrus elements, particularly pink grapefruit and mandarin orange, while honey and licorice add sweetness and depth. The skin contact contributes both bitter and smooth tannins that provide grip and complexity, along with subtle notes of toasted nuts and spice. The earthy minerality persists through the mid-palate, grounding the fruit expression."}

records.name: Priorat Trossos Abracadabra 2022
records.description: An expressive red wine from Spain's legendary Priorat region, where ancient vines grow in dramatic slate and quartzite llicorella soils. Trossos represents a modern interpretation of Priorat's traditional blends, balancing power with elegance and showcasing the unique minerality that makes this region one of Spain's most prestigious appellations.
records.varietal: Traditional Priorat blend likely including Garnacha, Cariñena, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Syrah
records.region: Priorat DOCa, Catalonia, Spain - llicorella slate soils
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with layers of ripe blackberry, black plum, and dark cherry, interwoven with garrigue herbs including lavender, rosemary, and wild thyme. The distinctive mineral character of llicorella slate emerges as graphite and crushed stone, while notes of violet, licorice, and dark cocoa add complexity. Subtle oak influence provides hints of vanilla, cedar, and sweet tobacco, integrated seamlessly with the concentrated fruit. The aromatic profile speaks to the region's unique terroir and Mediterranean climate.","finish":"The finish is long, powerful, and intensely mineral, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to slate, graphite, and earthy notes. Fine tannins provide structure that suggests excellent aging potential, while the mineral backbone ensures the wine doesn't feel heavy despite its concentration. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried herbs provide complexity, ending with the distinctive salty-mineral quality that defines great Priorat.","palate":"Full-bodied and concentrated with remarkable depth and structure, the palate delivers intense flavors of blackberry compote, cassis, and dark plum, supported by fine-grained tannins and balanced acidity. The llicorella soils impart a distinctive mineral quality that runs through the wine like a backbone, adding precision to the generous fruit. Mid-palate complexity reveals layers of black olive, dried fig, espresso, and bitter chocolate, while Mediterranean herb notes of oregano and sage add savory dimension. Despite the wine's power, it maintains remarkable elegance and balance."}

records.name: Nagelsforst Bergliebe Riesling 2022
records.description: A crisp German Riesling showcasing the mineral-driven elegance of the Nagelsforst estate. This 2022 vintage balances vibrant acidity with delicate fruit expression, offering the transparency of flavor that defines quality German Riesling.
records.region: Germany (Rheinhessen or Pfalz region likely based on producer)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with pristine apple and white peach aromas, layered with delicate jasmine florals and wet stone minerality. Subtle hints of citrus zest and green pear emerge as the wine breathes, revealing the characteristic precision of cool-climate German Riesling. A whisper of honeysuckle adds aromatic complexity without overwhelming the wine's elegant restraint.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of citrus pith and slate minerality. The wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate cleansed and eager for the next sip, making it exceptionally food-friendly.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers crisp Granny Smith apple and Meyer lemon flavors supported by racy acidity that energizes the entire experience. The mid-palate shows lovely tree fruit concentration with touches of white peach and nectarine, while the wine's mineral backbone provides tension and drive. A trace of residual sweetness balances the high acidity, creating harmony rather than cloying sweetness."}

records.name: Skylark Pinot Blanc 2018
records.description: An expressive Pinot Blanc showcasing the variety's versatility and food-friendly character. This 2018 vintage demonstrates how careful winemaking can coax complexity and depth from this sometimes understated grape, delivering both freshness and substance.
records.region: California (specific region not specified, possibly Mendocino or Santa Barbara County)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals bright aromas of green apple, Asian pear, and citrus fruits, layered with delicate white flowers and subtle mineral notes. Hints of honeysuckle and acacia blossom add aromatic lift, while the wine shows stronger floral characteristics typical of varietally pure Pinot Blanc. With aeration, nuances of stone fruit—white peach and apricot—emerge alongside a gentle honeyed quality that speaks to the wine's maturity. A whisper of toasted almond suggests possible lees contact or oak influence.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering apple and citrus notes accompanied by subtle minerality. The wine's bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed while gentle creaminess provides satisfaction, creating a harmonious conclusion that invites food pairing.","palate":"Full-bodied for a white wine, the palate balances richness with refreshing acidity that keeps the wine lively and bright. Flavors of crisp apple and citrus fruit dominate, supported by notes of ripe pear and subtle stone fruit complexity. The wine's relatively high acidity provides structure and ensures food compatibility, while a creamy mid-palate texture suggests sur lie aging or partial barrel fermentation. The overall impression is one of balance between fruit purity, textural interest, and crisp freshness that makes Pinot Blanc so versatile at the table."}

records.name: Vina Albina Gran Reserva 1975
records.description: This historic Gran Reserva from Viña Albina represents nearly five decades of evolution in the bottle, showcasing Rioja's remarkable aging potential. The 1975 vintage has developed extraordinary tertiary complexity and offers a window into traditional Riojan winemaking at its finest.
records.varietal: Tempranillo dominant blend (likely with Garnacha, Graciano)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is profoundly evolved, revealing complex aromas of dried cherry, fig, and prune, layered with leather, tobacco, and forest floor. Extended bottle age has developed nuances of balsamic, cedar cigar box, and dried herbs, while subtle notes of vanilla and coconut from American oak have fully integrated. The wine shows classic oxidative notes of walnut and toffee, alongside ethereal hints of rose petal and dried orange peel.","finish":"The finish is long and contemplative, with dried fruit, spice, and earthy notes lingering gently. The wine's delicate nature at this age requires careful handling, but rewards patience with extraordinary complexity.","palate":"Elegant and silky on the palate, the wine has shed its youthful tannins to reveal a seamless, velvety texture. Flavors of dried red fruits, dates, and figs dominate, supported by notes of leather, spice box, and aged balsamic. The oak influence is fully harmonious, contributing warmth and complexity without dominating. Despite nearly 50 years of age, the wine maintains refreshing acidity that provides structure and lift, though the overall impression is one of graceful maturity."}

records.name: Ontanon Gran Reserva 2011
records.description: A distinguished Rioja Gran Reserva representing over five years of careful aging in oak and bottle. This 2011 vintage exemplifies the classic Rioja style with its harmonious integration of fruit, oak, and tertiary complexity that only extended maturation can achieve.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with Garnacha, Mazuelo, and/or Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals evolved complexity with dried cherry, leather, and tobacco leaf aromas layered over the signature Rioja vanilla and coconut from extended oak aging. Secondary notes of dried fig, mushroom, and forest floor add earthy depth, while hints of balsamic and cedar provide additional dimension. The wine's bouquet shows the elegant maturity achieved through minimum 60 months of aging, with fruit and oak now seamlessly married.","finish":"The finish is long and complex, with lingering notes of dried cherry, tobacco, and vanilla spice. The wine's evolved character shows throughout, with savory elements and oak seamlessly integrated into a harmonious conclusion that invites contemplation.","palate":"On the palate, this Gran Reserva delivers mature red fruit flavors of cranberry and dried strawberry complemented by savory notes of cured meat, leather, and sweet spice. The oak influence is pronounced but integrated, contributing vanilla, nutmeg, and a silky texture rather than raw wood flavors. Tempranillo's characteristic medium body is enhanced by supporting varieties, while moderate tannins softened by age provide gentle structure. The wine's acidity remains vibrant despite its maturity, ensuring balance and freshness."}

records.name: Dolce Vita Strawberry Margarita
records.description: A ready-to-drink wine cocktail combining the refreshing appeal of margarita flavors with wine-based spirits. This convenient libation delivers strawberry sweetness and citrus tang in a pre-mixed format perfect for casual entertaining.
records.region: Wine cocktail product (region of production not specified)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright aromas of fresh strawberries dominate, accented by lime zest and a hint of agave sweetness. The nose shows candied fruit character with tropical undertones and a subtle alcoholic lift. Light citrus and berry notes create an inviting, approachable bouquet reminiscent of summer fruit cocktails.","finish":"The finish is brief and refreshing with lingering strawberry and lime notes. A touch of sweetness remains, along with subtle alcoholic warmth that signals this is a cocktail beverage rather than traditional wine.","palate":"The palate delivers sweet strawberry flavor balanced by tart lime acidity, creating the classic margarita profile in a wine-based format. The texture is light and refreshing with moderate sweetness, while citrus brightness prevents cloying. The wine base provides body and subtle complexity beneath the dominant fruit and cocktail flavors, making this an easy-drinking sipper for warm weather enjoyment."}

records.name: Ontanon Reserva Magnum 2011  1500 ml
records.description: A classic Rioja Reserva presented in magnum format, allowing for slower, more graceful aging. This 2011 vintage has benefited from minimum three years of maturation, with the larger bottle size providing enhanced development and longevity compared to standard 750ml bottles.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with Garnacha and possibly Mazuelo or Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The magnum format has preserved freshness while allowing elegant evolution, presenting red cherry and plum aromas with pronounced vanilla and coconut from oak aging. Notes of dried herbs, leather, and subtle balsamic add complexity, while the wine retains more primary fruit character than Gran Reserva due to its shorter aging requirement. Hints of cocoa powder and sweet spice round out the aromatic profile, showing the hallmark Rioja oak signature without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish shows moderate length with lingering cherry fruit, vanilla spice, and subtle earthy notes. The wine's balanced nature and magnum aging suggest graceful development ahead, with tannins remaining refined and integrated.","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright red fruit flavors of cherry and raspberry, supported by silky tannins softened through aging. The oak influence is clear but balanced, contributing vanilla, cinnamon, and a creamy texture that enhances the wine's natural fruit character. The magnum format has allowed slower oxygen integration, resulting in fresher fruit expression and more vibrant acidity compared to standard bottles. Supporting grape varieties add structure and complexity to the Tempranillo base, creating layers of flavor and interest."}

records.name: Backsberg John Martin Red Blend 2018
records.description: A distinguished South African red blend named after the Backsberg estate's founder, John Martin Back. This 2018 vintage represents the estate's premium tier, showcasing the potential of carefully selected Bordeaux varieties grown in the Cape's diverse terroir.
records.varietal: Bordeaux-style blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon dominant with Merlot, Cabernet Franc, and/or Petit Verdot)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with concentrated dark fruit aromas of blackberry, cassis, and plum, complemented by notes of cigar box, eucalyptus, and graphite. Oak aging contributes vanilla, dark chocolate, and subtle coffee bean notes without overwhelming the fruit. Hints of dried herbs, black olive, and a characteristic Cape fynbos character add regional identity and complexity. With aeration, violet florals and sweet spice emerge, revealing the wine's layered nature.","finish":"The finish is long and authoritative with persistent dark fruit and oak-derived spice. Firm tannins provide structure while remaining approachable, suggesting both immediate enjoyment and cellaring potential. Notes of dark chocolate and espresso linger alongside fruit, creating a satisfying conclusion.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured, the palate showcases ripe black fruit flavors underpinned by firm but polished tannins characteristic of Cabernet-based blends. The wine shows excellent concentration with dark cherry, blackcurrant, and black plum at the core, supported by well-integrated oak that provides vanilla spice and a creamy mid-palate texture. Supporting varieties likely add softness and aromatic complexity to the Cabernet base, creating a harmonious ensemble. Balanced acidity maintains freshness despite the wine's power and richness."}

records.name: Cienega Valley Cienega Valley Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: A fresh expression of California Pinot Noir from the distinctive Cienega Valley AVA in San Benito County. This 2023 vintage captures the region's unique terroir, where limestone soils and cooling maritime influences create ideal conditions for elegant Pinot Noir.
records.region: Cienega Valley AVA, San Benito County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with vibrant red fruit aromatics of fresh cherry, raspberry, and strawberry characteristic of youthful Pinot Noir. Floral notes of violet and rose petal add elegance, while subtle earthy undertones of mushroom and forest floor hint at complexity to come. Light touches of vanilla and baking spice suggest judicious oak influence, while the wine retains the bright, pure fruit character that defines quality California Pinot. A whisper of cola and crushed herbs adds intrigue.","finish":"The finish is medium in length with persistent red fruit and a touch of earthy complexity. Bright acidity carries through, leaving the palate refreshed and the wine showing excellent food-pairing versatility. Subtle spice and herb notes linger, inviting the next sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with silky texture and bright acidity, the palate delivers intense red cherry and cranberry flavors accented by hints of pomegranate and red currant. The wine shows the fruit-forward style emerging in modern California Pinot, with ripe fruit flavors balanced by refreshing acidity and delicate tannins. Oak influence is restrained, allowing the variety's inherent elegance and the region's terroir to shine. Mid-palate depth reveals layers of strawberry, earth, and subtle spice, while the wine's light tannin structure ensures approachability."}

records.name: Hendry HRW Zinfandel 2020
records.description: A distinctive Zinfandel from Hendry's estate vineyard in Napa Valley, the HRW designation represents a special selection showcasing the variety's bold character and the family's 85+ years of viticultural expertise. Sourced from specific blocks on the 114-acre property near Mt. Veeder, this wine benefits from marine influence and diverse soil types to produce concentrated, balanced Zinfandel with Hendry's signature approachable style.
records.varietal: Zinfandel (likely 90-100% with possible small percentages of Petite Sirah or other field blend varieties)
records.region: Napa Valley, California (estate vineyard near Mt. Veeder)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry, boysenberry, and black raspberry, accented by notes of black cherry preserves and wild strawberry. Warm spice aromas of black pepper, cinnamon, and clove are prominent, characteristic of classic Zinfandel, while hints of vanilla, mocha, and toasted oak add dimension from barrel aging. Subtle notes of dried herbs—thyme and oregano—emerge alongside hints of bramble and earth, reflecting the vineyard's terroir.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with persistent dark fruit flavors and spicy notes of black pepper and cinnamon. Soft tannins provide gentle grip, while hints of vanilla and toasted oak linger alongside the fruit. A subtle smokiness and touch of chocolate appear on the tail, making this a hedonistic yet balanced Zinfandel perfect for immediate enjoyment.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with moderate tannins that provide structure without overwhelming the wine's fruit-forward character. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of jammy blackberry, blueberry compote, and dark cherry, supported by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco. Mid-palate richness is balanced by bright acidity that lifts the fruit and prevents heaviness, while subtle earthy undertones of leather and dried herb add complexity. The wine shows Hendry's hallmark balance between power and elegance."}

records.name: Raised By Wolves Cabernet Sauvignon (Damaged Labels) 2017
records.description: A bold South African Cabernet Sauvignon from the Coastal Region, crafted by winemaker Adam Mason under his artisanal Raised by Wolves label. Sourced from 1980s-era vines and produced in limited quantities of just 300 cases, this wine showcases classical Cape winemaking with remarkable concentration and purity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is rich and expressive, opening with concentrated aromas of ripe mulberry, cassis, and blackberry compote. Layers of complexity emerge with mocha, dark chocolate, and oak spice, while subtle savory notes of cedar and graphite add depth. The aromatic intensity suggests exceptional fruit quality from old vines.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with berry freshness balancing the wine's concentration. Firm but refined tannins provide backbone, while mocha and dark fruit linger impressively. The structure suggests considerable aging potential ahead.","palate":"Power and concentration define the palate, which delivers classical grip and structure wrapped in lush dark fruit. The wine shows fabulous purity with waves of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis flavors supported by fine-grained tannins. Espresso, dark cocoa, and vanilla from oak aging integrate seamlessly with the fruit core. The texture is simultaneously powerful and elegant, with lovely focus and balance that speaks to careful winemaking."}

records.name: Prima Pave Bianca d'Or (Still White) NV
records.description: This award-winning non-alcoholic white wine from Northern Italy is a sophisticated blend of Gewürztraminer and Pinot Grigio sourced from sustainably farmed vineyards in Friuli. With two gold medals from the San Francisco International Wine Competition, this elegant still white delivers complexity and refinement at 0.0% ABV with only 11 calories per 100ml.
records.varietal: Blend of Gewürztraminer and Pinot Grigio
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating aromatics showcase vibrant notes of lychee, white peach, and delicate flower blossoms that dance from the glass. Stone fruit nuances mingle with elderflower and green apple, creating an inviting bouquet reminiscent of a spring garden. The Gewürztraminer contributes exotic perfume while Pinot Grigio adds crisp mineral undertones.","finish":"A dry, crisp finish with zippy acidity leaves the palate refreshed and invigorated. The silky texture lingers with gentle fruit echoes and mineral persistence, making this an ideal wine for extended sipping without the alcohol.","palate":"The palate bursts with mouthwatering acidity and silky texture, featuring layers of honeydew melon, kiwi, and ripe stone fruits. Lively and juicy with elegant minerality, the wine maintains excellent balance between fruit expression and structure. White peach and green apple flavors are complemented by subtle citrus notes that provide refreshing lift."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Gran Reserva 2014
records.description: A distinguished Gran Reserva from one of Rioja's historic bodegas, founded in 1890. This wine represents classic Spanish winemaking at its finest, with extended barrel aging creating layers of complexity while maintaining freshness and elegance. The 2014 vintage earned widespread critical acclaim with scores in the low 90s from multiple publications.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with traditional Rioja blend components (Graciano, Mazuelo)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a sophisticated tapestry of aromatics, beginning with intense cherry-red fruit aromas of black plum and cranberry, interwoven with roasted tomato and savory bacon notes. Secondary development brings forward earthy truffle, leather, and subtle balsamic touches, while oak influence contributes vanilla, chocolate, and warming spice notes of black pepper and clove. Delicate orange peel adds brightness to the complex bouquet.","finish":"The finish is long and graceful, with velvety tannins and persistent dark fruit flavors. Classic savory elements of leather and earth linger alongside hints of cocoa and spice, demonstrating the wine's maturity and complexity. The elegant conclusion invites contemplation.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with impeccable balance, the palate reveals flavors of cherry compote, pomegranate, and dark berries enlivened by subtle tangy orange peel acidity. Mocha, butterscotch, and salted almond add sweetness and depth, while earthy notes of dried dill and leather provide classic Rioja character. The texture is silky and refined, with round, polished tannins that build slowly then drift away, creating an elegant mouthfeel."}

records.name: Castoro Cellars Sparkling Rose Wine Can   250 ml
records.description: An innovative portable sparkling rosé from Paso Robles' first 100% certified sustainable winery. Packaged in eco-friendly 250ml cans that are 400 times lighter than glass and reduce carbon emissions by up to 80%, this wine maintains exceptional freshness and vibrancy while offering the perfect single-serving format for outdoor adventures.
records.varietal: Estate-grown rosé blend (specific varietals not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers delicate and inviting aromatics of fresh strawberry, wild raspberry, and watermelon rind. Subtle floral notes of rose petal and orange blossom add elegance, while hints of citrus zest and white peach provide brightness. The sparkling wine's mousse carries these delicate aromas with precision.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering berry fruit and citrus notes. The bubbles persist, leaving a vibrant, thirst-quenching conclusion perfect for warm weather enjoyment.","palate":"Bright and effervescent on the palate, with fine, persistent bubbles creating a creamy texture. Flavors of ripe strawberry, pink grapefruit, and mandarin peel dominate, balanced by crisp acidity that keeps the wine refreshing and lively. A touch of mineral character adds complexity to the fruit-forward profile, while the wine's off-dry balance makes it approachable and food-friendly."}

records.name: Talpiot White
records.description: A distinctive Israeli white wine from La Foret Blanche, showcasing the unique terroir and modern winemaking of Israel's burgeoning wine industry. This white blend combines mineral precision with tropical fruit richness, offering a Mediterranean character that bridges Old and New World styles.
records.varietal: White blend (specific varieties not disclosed, likely includes Mediterranean varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an intriguing combination of mineral notes reminiscent of wet stone and flint, layered with ripe tropical fruit aromas of banana, yellow peach, and pineapple. Warm baking spices including cinnamon and nutmeg add complexity, while delicate floral hints of acacia and orange blossom provide lift. A subtle honeyed sweetness rounds out the aromatic profile without heaviness.","finish":"The finish is clean and mineral-driven with persistent stone fruit flavors. Bright acidity carries through, leaving a refreshing, mouth-watering conclusion with hints of honey and spice.","palate":"Medium-bodied with bright, refreshing acidity that balances the wine's fruit richness. Flavors of yellow peach, pineapple, and ripe pear dominate the palate, complemented by citrus notes of mandarin and grapefruit zest. The mineral backbone provides structure and length, while hints of toasted almond and subtle oak influence add textural complexity. The wine's vibrant acidity keeps the fruit focused and fresh."}

records.name: Fledge & Co. Grenache 2024
records.description: A bold and experimental South African red from the Klein Karoo's innovative Fledge & Co. winery. Crafted by winemakers Leon Coetzee and Margaux Nel, this wine represents their commitment to expressing terroir through old-school techniques and environmentally conscious modern winemaking across the Cape's diverse vineyard sites.
records.region: Western Cape, South Africa (likely Klein Karoo or broader Western Cape sourcing)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with vibrant red fruit aromatics characteristic of Grenache, featuring ripe strawberry, red cherry, and raspberry liqueur. Floral notes of rose petal and violet add elegance, while hints of white pepper, dried herbs, and a touch of garrigue speak to Mediterranean influence. Subtle spice from whole-cluster fermentation and brief oak contact provides gentle complexity without overwhelming the pure fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is long and succulent with persistent red fruit and spice notes. Gentle tannins and bright acidity create a refreshing conclusion that invites another glass, while subtle herbal and mineral notes add complexity to the fade.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a silky, generous texture that showcases Grenache's natural charm. The palate delivers waves of red berry fruit—strawberry, cranberry, and pomegranate—alongside darker notes of plum and black cherry. Savory elements of dried thyme, black pepper, and earth add depth and interest. The wine shows beautiful balance between fruit ripeness and fresh acidity, with soft, supple tannins that provide structure without weight."}

records.name: Casa Dumetz Clementine Carter Roussanne 2023
records.description: An exceptional single-vineyard Roussanne from Casa Dumetz, showcasing this Rhône variety's remarkable ability to produce complex, age-worthy white wines in California's Central Coast. The Clementine Carter vineyard designation indicates a site-specific expression, reflecting Casa Dumetz's commitment to terroir-driven winemaking and the distinct characteristics of this particular site's soil, elevation, and microclimate.
records.region: California Central Coast (likely Santa Barbara County based on Casa Dumetz's portfolio)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals captivating aromas of ripe pear, quince, and golden apple, interwoven with exotic notes of mango, papaya, and lychee that speak to Roussanne's aromatic complexity. White floral notes of jasmine, orange blossom, and acacia add elegance, while hints of honey, beeswax, and toasted almond provide depth. Subtle herbal undertones of chamomile and lemon verbena emerge, alongside mineral notes of wet stone and saline that reflect the vineyard's unique terroir.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with lingering stone fruit flavors, honeyed richness, and bright citrus acidity that cleanses the palate. A subtle spiciness—white pepper and ginger—appears on the tail, alongside mineral notes and a hint of salinity. This is a complex, food-friendly Roussanne that will develop beautifully over the next 5-7 years with proper cellaring.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with a luscious, almost oily mouthfeel characteristic of exceptional Roussanne, balanced by crisp acidity that provides lift and definition. The palate delivers layers of ripe stone fruit—white peach and apricot—alongside flavors of Meyer lemon, tangerine, and candied ginger. Mid-palate complexity reveals notes of honeycomb, marcona almond, and brioche, while subtle mineral and saline qualities add structure and length. The wine shows beautiful integration and harmony between richness and freshness."}

records.name: Seppeltsfield Para Tawny (100Y) 1925  100 ml
records.description: An extraordinary centenarian tawny, one of the rarest wines in the world. Harvested in 1925 and matured for 100 years in oak barrels at Seppeltsfield in Australia's Barossa Valley. This wine represents a living piece of history and received 100 points from Andrew Caillard MW.
records.varietal: 100% Grenache (traditional Barossa variety for fortified wines)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep mahogany color with vibrant amber edges. The nose is powerfully defined with bold notes of espresso, ground coffee, and dark chocolate drizzled with wild honey. Complex layers of dried fruits in aqueous solution, candied nuts, mahogany, molasses, and marzipan emerge. Fancy cigar lounge aromas intermingle with espresso liqueur, candied figs, prunes, wood spice, and citrus rind. Walnuts soaked in brandy, star anise, cloves, cassia bark, panforte, and dried mandarin peel add extraordinary complexity.","finish":"Lingering and persistent with pure aniseed cut. Freshness and exceptional length are driven by blood orange acidity that defies the wine's age. The finish leaves impressions of waxy oilskin, coffee grounds, and citrus peel.","palate":"Immediately luscious with incredible volume and mouthfeel. The palate entry is electric and surprisingly sharp for a 100-year-old wine, with technicolor complexity. Generously concentrated and richly flavored with fresh espresso, dark chocolate, and orange rind. Sandalwood, cloves, and fine supple textures create superb mid-palate volume and viscosity. Bittersweet dark chocolate and hazelnuts provide depth."}

records.name: Boxwood West Oaks Farm Market Rose (Private Label) 2023
records.description: A private label rosé from Virginia's esteemed Boxwood Estate Winery, crafted in the Bordeaux tradition with a distinct Virginia terroir expression. This estate-grown wine represents the premium quality that has made Boxwood one of Virginia's most respected producers, offering elegant European-style winemaking in America's oldest wine region.
records.varietal: Likely Cabernet Franc-based rosé (estate-grown Bordeaux varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Enticing salmon-pink hues introduce fresh aromatics of crushed red berries, wild strawberries, and ripe watermelon. Delicate floral notes of rose petals and white flowers intertwine with subtle mineral accents that speak to the vineyard's terroir. A whisper of citrus zest adds brightness to the bouquet.","finish":"A long, dry finish showcases mineral persistence and lingering red fruit character. The crisp acidity keeps the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip, while subtle herbal notes add complexity to the conclusion.","palate":"The palate delivers crisp, refreshing crushed red fruit flavors with vibrant acidity that energizes the entire experience. Mineral notes provide structure and complexity, while flavors of strawberry, raspberry, and white peach dance across the tongue. The wine maintains excellent balance between fruit expression and acidity, creating a refined, food-friendly profile ideal for summer enjoyment."}

records.name: Vieux Chateau Flouquet St Emilion 2022
records.description: A classic Right Bank Bordeaux from the prestigious Saint-Émilion appellation, this wine showcases the elegant, fruit-forward style that has made the region famous. Crafted from Merlot and Cabernet Franc by Vignobles Garzaro, this approachable Saint-Émilion offers authentic Bordeaux character at exceptional value.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents intense aromas of blackcurrant and dark cherry, layered with vanilla and sweet oak from barrel aging. Subtle hints of roasted nuts, violet florals, and dried herbs add complexity, while a delicate peppery spice emerges with aeration. Notes of chocolate and graphite provide additional depth.","finish":"The finish reveals slightly peppery notes with lingering dark fruit and gentle tannins. Oak influence provides vanilla and toast on the conclusion, while maintaining the wine's elegant, refined character typical of quality Saint-Émilion.","palate":"Rich and mouth-filling with juicy characteristics of plum and black cherry fruit that define Saint-Émilion's charm. The wine shows subtle elegance on the palate with delicate tannins that provide structure without overwhelming. Flavors of blackcurrant jam, cocoa, and sweet spice are balanced by fresh acidity, with a slightly peppery mid-palate adding intrigue. The medium to full body carries concentrated fruit with supple texture."}

records.name: Mountain Brook BRX Rose 2024
records.description: A fresh rosé from Mountain Brook Vineyards, a family-owned winery in the Tryon Foothills of North Carolina. This 2024 vintage represents the winery's commitment to producing quality wines from their estate vineyards in the southern Appalachian region.
records.varietal: Estate-grown blend (specific composition varies by vintage)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents bright red berry fruits with floral undertones characteristic of North Carolina rosés. Fresh strawberry, watermelon, and hints of rose petals create an inviting aromatic profile. Subtle mineral notes reflect the mountain terroir.","finish":"The finish is clean and crisp with persistent acidity and lingering red berry notes. A subtle mineral quality adds complexity to the refreshing close.","palate":"Clean and refreshing with vibrant acidity that showcases ripe summer berries. The palate features strawberry, raspberry, and citrus flavors with a crisp, mineral-driven texture. Light-bodied and food-friendly, the wine maintains freshness and balance."}

records.name: Martellotto Red Blend 2017
records.description: The 'Rosso di Sera' red blend from Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, a Bordeaux-style blend featuring Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc. Aged for 10 months in 20% new oak and 80% neutral barrel, this wine received 90 points from both Jeb Dunnuck and Wine Enthusiast.
records.region: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Ripe and ready aromas of black cherry, wood spice, and clove are intense on the nose. Additional notes of blueberry, vanilla, marzipan, and terracotta emerge with air. The aromatics show good concentration with a balance of fruit and oak influence.","finish":"The finish is smooth and persistent with integrated tannins. Dark fruit, spice, and subtle oak notes linger pleasantly.","palate":"Plump, rounded, and sexy with loads of ripe cherries, blackberries, toasted spices, and earth. The palate is rich with dark fruit flavors including blackberry, blueberry, and plum, complemented by allspice, pipe tobacco, and leather. Medium to full-bodied richness provides ample fruit weight. Mouth-coating soft tannins frame the ripe dark fruit and baking spice flavors."}

records.name: Fledge & Co. Skeleton Praeteritus Bosstok Tinta Barocca 2022
records.description: A distinctive expression of Tinta Barocca from South Africa's dynamic Swartland region, crafted from a single heritage vineyard planted in 1971. This wine showcases the complexity and character achievable from old-vine Tinta Barocca, a Portuguese variety traditionally used in Port production but here vinified as a stunning dry table wine.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals intense dark berry fruit with blackberry and wild blueberry leading the charge, complemented by dried violet petals and exotic spice notes. Old vine concentration provides depth with hints of crushed herbs, garrigue, and sun-baked earth. Subtle notes of black pepper, anise, and dark chocolate add complexity to this aromatic wine.","finish":"A long, powerful finish showcases the wine's old-vine pedigree with persistent dark fruit, firm tannins, and complex spice notes. The conclusion reveals earthy minerality and subtle oak influence that speaks to careful winemaking and exceptional terroir.","palate":"Rich and structured on the palate with concentrated dark fruit flavors of blackberry compote, plum, and black cherry. The 50+ year old vines deliver impressive concentration and depth, with layers of spice, leather, and mineral complexity. Fine-grained tannins provide elegant structure while maintaining balance with the wine's vibrant fruit core. Notes of graphite and dark cocoa emerge on the mid-palate, adding gravitas."}

records.name: Knuttel Family Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir, Bill's Hidden Track 2022
records.description: Crafted by William Knuttel, former head winemaker at Saintsbury (1983-1996) and Chalk Hill (until 2011), this exceptional Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir represents decades of expertise in California's most elegant varietal. Bill's Hidden Track is a fruit-forward, medium-bodied wine blended from two exceptional vineyards, both also bottled as vineyard designates, aged eleven months in French oak.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir from two premium vineyards
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright, explosive aromatics showcase wild raspberry, ripe strawberry, and red plum dancing from the glass with captivating intensity. Delicate notes of pomegranate and red cherry add complexity, while hints of violets and rose petals provide floral lift. Subtle earthy undertones and forest floor nuances speak to the wine's Sonoma Coast terroir and careful winemaking.","finish":"An elegant finish reveals persistent red fruit character with fine-grained tannins providing texture and length. The wine concludes with refreshing acidity, subtle spice notes, and a whisper of minerality that invites the next sip. The seamless integration and balance demonstrate masterful winemaking.","palate":"Flavors explode on the palate with vibrant red fruit leading the charge—wild raspberry, strawberry, and cherry dominate with remarkable purity and energy. The wine shows medium body with elegant structure and silky mouthfeel that exemplifies high-quality Pinot Noir. Ripe, focused tannins provide framework without heaviness, while bright acidity energizes the fruit and maintains balance. Subtle oak influence adds vanilla and spice without masking the brilliant fruit core."}

records.name: Alfaro Family Vineyards A  Estate Chardonnay 2020
records.description: A crisp, fruit-forward Chardonnay from Santa Cruz Mountains estate vineyards, showcasing the cool-climate elegance of California's coastal appellations. Small-production wine from this family-owned winery reflects careful vineyard selection and minimal intervention winemaking.
records.region: Santa Cruz Mountains, California (Estate vineyards in Corralitos area)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Inviting aromas of ripe yellow orchard fruits open the bouquet. Fresh pear and golden apple lead, followed by white peach and nectarine notes. Subtle hints of lemon curd add brightness, while delicate honeyed oak provides just enough richness without overwhelming the fruit. Faint white flower and mineral notes add complexity.","finish":"Clean, bright finish with lingering citrus and apple notes. A mineral quality emerges at the end, providing freshness and length.","palate":"The palate is crisp and refreshing with vibrant acidity driving the wine forward. Intense flavors of pear, green apple, and white peach fill the mid-palate with concentrated fruit character. Lemon curd and subtle vanilla oak add layers of complexity while maintaining freshness. The wine balances richness with elegance, showing restraint in oak usage that allows the pure fruit expression to shine."}

records.name: Bodegas Pinea PINEA 2019
records.description: A flagship Ribera del Duero wine from the estate's most expressive Cardisanto parcel, showcasing 25+ year old vines. This critically acclaimed Tempranillo (91/100) represents the pinnacle of modern Spanish winemaking with extended aging in fine-grain French oak barrels.
records.region: Ribera del Duero, Castilla y León, Spain (Cardisanto parcel at 931-942m elevation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Brilliant ruby tones reveal an intense and captivating bouquet. The nose opens with ripe black fruits—blackberry and cassis—layered with complex spicy notes of cinnamon and black pepper. Roasted coffee and cocoa emerge alongside subtle vanilla from new oak, creating a fascinating aromatic complexity that evolves in the glass with each swirl.","finish":"Long-lasting and elegant, the finish extends with persistent dark fruit and subtle oak spice. The refined tannins grip gently, leaving impressions of espresso and dark chocolate that linger beautifully.","palate":"An imposing structure defines the palate, yet refined tannins provide balance and elegance. Big, bold flavors of cooked dark fruits and blackberry compote fill the mouth with intensity. A creamy, concentrated mid-palate shows the wine's approachable nature despite firm tannic backbone. Vibrant acidity cuts through the richness, maintaining freshness and preventing heaviness in this powerful expression."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Chardonnay 2024
records.description: A biodynamic Chardonnay from one of the world's most sustainable wineries, B Corp certified Château Maris in Languedoc. The estate is renowned for its organic and biodynamic practices, producing wines that express terroir with purity and environmental consciousness.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is aromatic and fresh, showcasing tropical fruits including pineapple and mango, complemented by honeysuckle and lemon rind. Notes of peach add stone fruit complexity, while subtle mineral undertones speak to the biodynamic viticulture and terroir expression.","finish":"The finish is crisp and clean with lingering citrus and tropical fruit notes. The wine's bright acidity carries through to the end, leaving a refreshing impression.","palate":"The palate is fresh and focused with vibrant tropical fruit flavors balanced by bright acidity. The wine's clean, pure fruit expression reflects minimal intervention winemaking, while subtle richness from lees contact adds texture without heaviness. The overall impression is one of freshness and balance."}

records.name: Shabo Limited Edition Kakhetian Saperavi Merlot 2023
records.description: A unique Ukrainian red wine crafted using the ancient 8,000-year-old Georgian Kakhetian method, where fermentation and aging occur in clay amphoras called Qvevri. This powerful blend combines Georgian Saperavi with Bordeaux Merlot, creating a distinctive expression from Odesa's coastal vineyards.
records.varietal: Saperavi and Merlot blend (exact percentages not specified)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright, expressive aromas leap from the glass with ripe dark berry intensity. Blueberries dominate the core, supported by blackberry compote and black cherry notes. Fresh violet florals add elegance and lift to the fruit-forward profile, while subtle earthy undertones from the Qvevri aging add complexity and intrigue.","finish":"Velvety tannins persist through a medium-length finish, with dark berry fruit and violet notes fading slowly. The unique amphora aging leaves subtle earthy impressions.","palate":"The palate delivers power wrapped in velvet. Rich, concentrated dark fruit flavors of blueberry and blackberry flood the mouth with intensity. The traditional Kakhetian winemaking imparts unique textural elements—fine-grained tannins feel plush and smooth rather than angular. Medium to full body carries the fruit concentration without heaviness, while the Qvevri influence adds savory depth and mineral notes."}

records.name: Domaine de la Fontainnerie Vouvray Sec 2022
records.description: A dry expression of Chenin Blanc from the Loire Valley's prestigious Vouvray appellation. Aged in traditional troglodytic caves carved into the limestone hillsides, this wine showcases the incredible versatility of Chenin Blanc and the mineral-rich terroir of Vouvray.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with bright citrus notes—lemon zest and grapefruit—alongside fresh green apple and pear. Chenin Blanc's signature honeyed character appears in subtle wax and acacia honey nuances. White flowers, particularly chamomile and elderflower, add delicate floral lift. The limestone soils impart distinct mineral notes of wet stone and flint that add complexity and terroir expression.","finish":"Long, precise finish with citrus, mineral, and subtle honey notes persisting. The racy acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for food.","palate":"Dry and refreshing with vibrant, racy acidity that's characteristic of fine Vouvray Sec. The palate shows concentrated orchard fruits—crisp apple, Asian pear, and quince—balanced by zesty lemon and lime citrus. The middle palate reveals Chenin's textural richness despite the dry style, with a slight waxy quality and honeyed undertones. Pronounced minerality runs through the wine, lending tension and energy. The combination of fruit intensity, bright acidity, and mineral backbone creates exceptional balance."}

records.name: Wonderment Wines Bacigalupi Petit Sirah 2017
records.description: A powerful, age-worthy Petite Sirah from a legendary .5-acre block on Bacigalupi's Frost Ranch in Russian River Valley. Hand-picked Foppiano clone vines from this sustainably farmed vineyard produce wine of exceptional concentration and structure, showcasing why this site is revered among California winemakers.
records.region: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, California (Bacigalupi Frost Ranch)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Opaque purple in the glass, this wine announces its power visually before the first sniff. The huge nose explodes with black fruits—cassis, blackberry, and black plum dominating. Fresh floral notes of violet and iris add unexpected elegance to the intense fruit. Graphite and crushed stone minerality lend complexity, while black pepper spice and subtle mocha from oak aging round out the bouquet.","finish":"Long, structured finish with persistent black fruit, pepper, and fine-grained tannins. The powerful structure suggests significant aging potential.","palate":"An intensely powerful mouthful of concentrated black fruit flavors defines the palate. Blackberries and black mulberries flood the senses with ripe, rich fruit character. Graphite minerality and black pepper spice add savory complexity to the fruit core. Subtle tobacco and dark chocolate notes emerge mid-palate. The firm, ripe tannic backbone provides structure and grip without harshness. Full body and concentrated fruit intensity make this a wine of serious depth and aging potential."}

records.name: Lueria Cabernet Sauvignon Mevushal (MD & DC) 2023
records.description: A super-premium kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Israel's prestigious Upper Galilee region, produced by Lueria Winery using the mevushal process. Located at the foot of Mount Miron at elevations of 840-890 meters, Yosef Saida's vineyards benefit from high altitude, optimal sun exposure, and cool mountain breezes that create exceptional conditions for Cabernet Sauvignon.
records.region: Upper Galilee, Israel (Mount Miron foothills, 840-890m elevation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents concentrated dark fruit aromas with blackcurrant, cassis, and ripe black cherry taking center stage. Layers of cedar, vanilla, and sweet oak spice from barrel aging provide complexity, while subtle notes of graphite, violet, and Mediterranean herbs add regional character. The high-altitude fruit delivers remarkable purity and intensity of aroma.","finish":"A long, structured finish reveals persistent dark fruit with firm tannins and well-integrated oak influence. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet spice linger alongside the fruit, while subtle mineral notes add complexity. The mevushal process preserves the wine's depth and character while meeting strict kosher standards.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied with concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, dark plum, and black cherry dominating the palate. The wine shows excellent structure with firm but refined tannins that provide backbone for the concentrated fruit. Oak aging contributes vanilla, toast, and subtle chocolate notes that integrate seamlessly. Bright acidity balances the richness, while the high-altitude character provides elegance and lift to the powerful fruit core."}

records.name: Martino Malbec 2019
records.description: This Argentine Malbec from the Martino winery captures the essence of high-altitude viticulture with concentrated fruit and supple tannins. The 2019 vintage has begun to develop complexity while maintaining the variety's signature plushness and depth.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is generous and inviting, offering intense aromas of blackberry, blueberry, and dark plum, complemented by violet and lilac notes characteristic of quality Malbec. Oak aging contributes subtle vanilla, mocha, and dark chocolate nuances, while hints of black pepper and dried herbs add complexity. The high-altitude origins are evident in the wine's pronounced fruit purity and aromatic intensity.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with dark fruit flavors persisting alongside notes of cocoa and subtle smokiness. Ripe tannins provide structure and suggest the wine will continue to evolve gracefully over the next several years.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured on the palate, this Malbec delivers concentrated flavors of ripe black fruits, particularly boysenberry and blackberry jam, balanced by well-integrated tannins that are both powerful and velvety.
