The mid-palate shows excellent density with layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet baking spices from oak maturation. Bright acidity, unusual for such a rich wine, provides freshness and ensures the wine doesn't feel heavy despite its concentration."}

records.name: Artis NA Brut Rose
records.description: A sophisticated non-alcoholic sparkling rosé that delivers the celebratory experience of traditional brut rosé without the alcohol. Crafted using advanced dealcoholization techniques that preserve the wine's character, Artis NA represents the new generation of premium alcohol-free wines.
records.varietal: Rosé blend of traditional sparkling wine varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate bouquet of fresh strawberries, white peach, and crisp red apple greets the nose with appealing vibrancy. Floral notes of orange blossom and honeysuckle add elegance, while subtle hints of brioche and almond from the base wine create depth. A whisper of citrus zest brightens the aromatic profile.","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with persistent fine bubbles and lingering notes of citrus and red berries. The mouthfeel remains crisp and satisfying without any cloying sweetness or artificial aftertaste.","palate":"Lively bubbles dance across the palate carrying flavors of wild strawberry, raspberry, and pink grapefruit with remarkable freshness. The mid-palate shows nice texture with notes of stone fruit and a touch of minerality that adds sophistication. Balanced acidity maintains structure and prevents the wine from feeling sweet despite containing residual grape sugars."}

records.name: Sky Devil Cabernet Franc 2020
records.description: An intriguing varietal Cabernet Franc showcasing this noble grape's ability to stand alone outside its traditional Bordeaux blending role. Sky Devil captures the herbaceous complexity and red fruit elegance that makes Cabernet Franc increasingly sought after by wine enthusiasts.
records.region: Unknown (likely California, Washington, or New York)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Captivating aromatics of red raspberry, red currant, and fresh red plum mingle with distinctive herbal notes of bell pepper, tobacco leaf, and dried sage. Floral hints of violet and rose petal add elegance, while subtle earthy elements of graphite, pencil shavings, and forest floor create complexity. A whisper of spice from oak aging adds depth without dominating the wine's characteristic varietal expression.","finish":"Medium to long finish with persistent red fruit and herbal notes. The wine's refined tannins and bright acidity linger pleasantly with subtle savory elements emerging on the fade.","palate":"Medium-bodied and beautifully structured with bright acidity and fine-grained tannins that showcase Cabernet Franc's elegant profile. Flavors of cranberry, sour cherry, and red raspberry dominate with vibrant fruit purity. The mid-palate reveals layers of complexity with notes of black tea, roasted red pepper, and subtle baking spices. Earthy undertones and a mineral quality add dimension while maintaining the wine's refreshing, food-friendly character."}

records.name: Raywood Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant, contemporary Sauvignon Blanc from Raywood showcasing bright fruit expression and refreshing acidity. This wine represents approachable, food-friendly white wine crafted for immediate enjoyment and versatile pairing options.
records.region: Unknown (likely California or Australia based on style)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant aromas of tropical fruit including passion fruit, guava, and pineapple leap from the glass with youthful energy. Citrus notes of grapefruit, lime zest, and lemon add brightness, while subtle herbal hints of fresh-cut grass and jalapeño provide varietal character. A touch of elderflower and honeysuckle adds a delicate floral dimension.","finish":"Clean, refreshing finish with lingering citrus and tropical fruit notes. Crisp acidity leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next sip or bite.","palate":"Crisp and lively on the palate with zingy acidity that energizes the fruit. Flavors of pink grapefruit, Meyer lemon, and green apple dominate with refreshing intensity, joined by tropical notes of kiwi and gooseberry. The mid-palate maintains bright, juicy character with good concentration and a subtle mineral quality that adds depth. The wine's balanced structure makes it wonderfully versatile for food pairing."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Orange NV
records.description: A distinctive organic orange wine crafted from Muscat Petit Grain grapes with extended skin contact and fermentation at red wine temperatures. This natural winemaking approach creates a wine with deeper color, more intense flavor, and subtle tannic presence. Château Maris is known for their biodynamic farming practices in the Languedoc region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose evokes the end of summer with inviting aromas of white peach and nectarine that immediately transport you to warmer days. Bright notes of apricot and candied fruit add sweetness and complexity to the aromatic profile. Despite the wine being completely dry, the sweet Muscat fruit aromatics are beautifully preserved and intensified by the skin contact. Hints of orange peel and subtle floral notes typical of Muscat add layers of interest, while the extended maceration contributes deeper, more complex aromatics than typical white wines.","finish":"The finish shows the wine's unique character with a little presence of tannin providing grip and interest. The dry nature becomes most apparent on the finish, where the initial fruit sweetness gives way to a clean, slightly structured conclusion. Citrus acidity provides bite and freshness that cleanses the palate, while the subtle tannic presence adds length and complexity rarely found in white wines.","palate":"Very fresh for an orange wine, with bright summer fruit flavors of white peach, apricot, and nectarine dominating the palate. The extended skin contact creates an interesting textural paradox: the wine tastes of sweet, ripe Muscat fruit but is bone dry, with that contrast creating intrigue. Hints of seeds and nuts add complexity and earthiness, while a pithy citrus quality provides bite and freshness. Subtle tannins give the wine enough structure to pair with both appetizers and main courses, setting it apart from typical white wines. The overall impression is one of freshness and drinkability despite the unconventional winemaking."}

records.name: Alacer Roble 2020 5001601
records.description: An exceptional Tempranillo from Ribera del Duero's highest elevations, crafted by Bodegas Riojanas from four small high-altitude vineyard parcels located above 900 meters in Santa Cruz de la Salceda and Vadocondes. This wine earned 92 points from James Suckling, showcasing the intense concentration and elegance achievable from extreme-altitude Ribera del Duero fruit, aged six months in French oak.
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Castilla y León, Spain (above 900m elevation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Attractive, lifted aromatics feature ripe plums and fresh blueberries at the core, complemented by delicate notes of violets, lilac flowers, and white pepper that add complexity and refinement. The nose reveals subtle orange peel and citrus zest alongside hints of sweet oak spice, licorice, and vanilla from barrel aging. The high-altitude fruit delivers remarkable aromatic purity and intensity.","finish":"Crisp and focused on the finish with persistent fruity character and mineral notes that reflect the terroir. The calcareous tannins provide texture and length without heaviness, while subtle oak spice and fruit notes linger. The fresh acidity keeps the conclusion clean and vibrant, inviting another sip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a firm yet fleshy texture that showcases both power and elegance. The wine is rich in nuances of ripe red fruits including cherry, raspberry, and plum, supported by silky tannins with calcareous mineral character from the high-altitude limestone soils. Fresh acidity provides energy and lift, while flavors of spices, licorice, and sweet confections add layers of complexity. The slightly fruity character is balanced by serious structure."}

records.name: Quinta Picouto de Cima Loureiro 2022
records.description: A fresh and aromatic Vinho Verde from the Minho region of Portugal, showcasing the elegant Loureiro grape variety. This wine exemplifies the floral character and crisp freshness that defines quality Vinho Verde, with bright acidity and delicate fruit flavors that make it wonderfully refreshing.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is intensely floral with characteristic notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and white flowers that define the Loureiro grape. Underneath the floral lift, there are subtle aromas of lime zest, green apple, and white peach. A gentle minerality adds complexity, while hints of fresh herbs provide an additional aromatic dimension typical of cool-climate Portuguese whites.","finish":"The finish is clean and zesty with lingering citrus notes and a hint of saline minerality. The wine's natural acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip, with delicate floral echoes persisting on the aftertaste.","palate":"Light-bodied and crisp on the palate, this Vinho Verde displays vibrant acidity that energizes flavors of citrus fruits, particularly lemon and grapefruit, alongside notes of green apple and pear. The wine has a characteristic slight spritz that enhances its refreshing quality. Green fruit notes are complemented by subtle stone fruit flavors, while the mineral backbone provides structure and length."}

records.name: Jeff Cohn Pure Yum Blend 2023
records.description: A playfully named yet serious red blend from acclaimed winemaker Jeff Cohn, known for his Rhône-style wines and bold California expressions. Pure Yum represents Cohn's approachable, fruit-forward philosophy while maintaining the quality and complexity that define his portfolio.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Grenache, Syrah, and/or Mourvèdre)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant and inviting nose bursting with fresh blackberry, black cherry, and blueberry preserves showing remarkable fruit purity. Floral notes of violet and lavender add elegance, while subtle hints of cracked black pepper, dried herbs, and a touch of garrigue provide Rhône-like complexity. Gentle oak influence brings notes of vanilla, cedar, and a whisper of mocha without overwhelming the wine's vibrant fruit character.","finish":"Smooth, satisfying finish with lingering dark fruit and gentle spice notes. The wine's plush tannins and fruit-forward character leave the palate content and wanting another glass.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with juicy, approachable character that lives up to the 'Pure Yum' name. Flavors of ripe boysenberry, black raspberry, and plum dominate with exuberant fruit expression. The mid-palate reveals layers of complexity with notes of black tea, cocoa nibs, and subtle baking spices from oak integration. Soft, supple tannins and balanced acidity make this wine immediately enjoyable while maintaining structure and depth."}

records.name: Adir Marselan Rosel (MD & DC) 2023
records.description: A traditionally crafted kosher rosé from the Upper Galilee that showcases the unique Marselan grape variety. This light-bodied wine undergoes minimal skin contact and a long, cool forty-day fermentation to preserve its vibrant aromatics and fresh character. Perfect for summer enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with intense aromas of ripe strawberries and fresh red grapefruit that immediately capture attention. Delicate layers of rose petals and gentle herbal notes emerge, creating a complex aromatic profile. The cool fermentation preserves these vibrant scents, with subtle hints of rose leaves adding an elegant floral dimension that lingers in the glass.","finish":"The finish is long and aromatic, maintaining the wine's fresh character to the very end. Lingering notes of strawberry and citrus peel fade slowly, leaving a clean, refreshing impression. The bright acidity ensures the finish remains crisp and vibrant, inviting the next sip.","palate":"Light-bodied and refreshing, the palate mirrors the nose with bright strawberry fruit at the forefront. The wine's cool fermentation technique ensures intense flavors despite its delicate structure, with red grapefruit providing zesty brightness. Fresh acidity cuts through cleanly, while soft, almost imperceptible tannins from the brief two-hour skin contact add just enough texture to give the wine presence without weighing it down."}

records.name: Priorat Trossos Lo Mon 2018
records.description: A powerful expression of Priorat's unique llicorella slate soils, blending four complementary grape varieties. This wine underwent twelve months in French oak casks followed by an additional eighteen months of bottle aging before release. The 2018 vintage earned 91 points from critics, showcasing the wine's balance of power and elegance.
records.varietal: Blend of Grenache, Carignan, Syrah, and Cabernet Sauvignon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays remarkable complexity with balsamic hints interwoven with vibrant red fruit and citrus peel creating an intriguing aromatic tapestry. Ashy mineral notes emerge from the llicorella slate soils, combined with black spices that add depth and intrigue. Creamy oak integration is evident but never overwhelming, with additional layers of black fruit, cocoa bean, and fine reductive notes suggesting careful barrel management. Mediterranean scrubland aromas add an authentic sense of place.","finish":"The finish is notably long, with the wine's mineral backbone ensuring it doesn't fade quickly. Silky tannins persist, along with echoes of ripe fruit and subtle spice. The llicorella-derived minerality provides elegance and lift on the finish, adding freshness that balances the wine's natural power and ensures a clean, sophisticated conclusion.","palate":"Potent and long on the palate, this wine demonstrates the power Priorat is famous for while maintaining remarkable elegance. The texture is very round with silky tannins that coat the mouth gently despite the wine's intensity. Ripe fruit notes of blackberry and plum dominate, supported by spicy hints from both the grapes and oak aging. The characteristic mineral freshness from the llicorella slate adds a layer of complexity and provides a refreshing counterpoint to the wine's richness, preventing it from becoming heavy."}

records.name: Boron Delle Venezie Pinot Grigio 2023
records.description: A fresh, food-friendly Pinot Grigio from the Delle Venezie DOC in northeastern Italy, where this variety reaches its finest expression. The 2023 vintage showcases the crisp, aromatic character that has made this region's Pinot Grigio famous worldwide, with bright fruit and excellent acidity.
records.region: Delle Venezie DOC, Veneto/Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright and inviting, opening with fresh notes of ripe pear—particularly Bosc and Anjou varieties—alongside crisp green apple and honeydew melon. Delicate floral aromas of violet and honeysuckle add elegance and lift. Zesty citrus notes of lemon and lime zest provide brightness, while subtle hints of white peach and pineapple add tropical complexity. Touches of rich vanilla bean from brief lees contact add depth without heaviness. The aromatics are clean, precise, and beautifully aromatic.","finish":"The finish is bright and clean, with lingering notes of citrus, pear, and subtle pineapple. Crisp acidity carries through to the conclusion, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip or the next bite of food.","palate":"The palate is crisp and clean, featuring lively acidity that brings energy and freshness. Juicy flavors of Bosc pear and green apple dominate, complemented by bright citrus—particularly lemon zest and lime. The texture is round yet vibrant, with a creamy quality balanced by zesty acidity. Notes of melon, white peach, and subtle tropical fruit add complexity and ripeness from the 2023 vintage. Delicate hints of bread crust and minerality provide depth and food-friendliness. The wine maintains excellent balance between fruit richness and refreshing acidity."}

records.name: Quinta da Trovisca Ruby Port NV
records.description: A vibrant and fruit-forward ruby port aged three years in stainless steel vats to preserve its youthful character and fresh fruit expression. This versatile port showcases traditional Portuguese grape varieties in a style that emphasizes approachability and bright berry flavors, making it perfect for both traditional and contemporary serving occasions.
records.varietal: 35% Touriga Franca, 35% Tinta Roriz, 10% Touriga Nacional, 20% field blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with fresh red fruit aromas of strawberry, raspberry, and redcurrant, displaying the vibrant character typical of ruby port. Sweet spice notes of cinnamon and clove emerge alongside the fruit, while subtle hints of chocolate and dried herbs add depth. The aromatic profile is youthful and exuberant, inviting immediate enjoyment.","finish":"The finish offers lingering berry fruit flavors with a touch of chocolate and sweet spice. The wine's freshness carries through to the end, with gentle tannins providing structure without heaviness. A subtle warming sensation from the 19.5% alcohol is well-integrated and not overwhelming.","palate":"Smooth and fresh on the palate with round, approachable tannins that frame the wine's fruit-forward character. Flavors evocative of strawberry and blackberry dominate, supported by notes of cherry and plum. The wine maintains good structure despite its accessible style, with the fruit nuances balanced by subtle sweetness and integrated alcohol warmth. The texture is silky and the body medium, making this port particularly versatile."}

records.name: Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2014 5001618
records.description: A traditionally crafted Rioja Gran Reserva from the esteemed Bodegas Riojanas that represents exceptional value. This wine received 91 points from the Peñín Guide and spent extensive time aging in oak and bottle before release. The 2014 vintage is described as more polished, rounder, and softer than earlier vintages, showing beautiful evolution.
records.varietal: Tempranillo, Mazuelo, Graciano, and Cariñena blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents elegant complexity with well-blended aromas that speak to the wine's extended aging. Nice sour cherry notes form the aromatic core, complemented by developed characteristics of leather and Mediterranean scrub that add authenticity. Hints of wood aging are present but beautifully integrated, never dominating the fruit. The ruby red color with a tawny rim signals maturity and proper development, while subtle earthy notes add layers of interest.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with the polished tannins providing structure without astringency. Echoes of sour cherry and leather persist, along with subtle oak influence that has integrated beautifully over time. The wine's good acidity ensures a clean conclusion that doesn't fatigue the palate, making this approachable for extended enjoyment.","palate":"The palate is very fine and well-structured, demonstrating textbook Gran Reserva character. Beautiful cassis fruit flavors mingle with the wine's aged characteristics, creating complexity without losing freshness. Good acidity provides backbone and ensures the wine doesn't feel heavy despite its concentration. The tannins are notably polished and refined, having softened considerably during aging to create a silky, approachable texture. The blend of Tempranillo with Mazuelo, Graciano, and Cariñena adds dimension and complexity that pure Tempranillo cannot achieve."}

records.name: Giustini Avoglia Susumaniello 2024
records.description: A delightful expression of Puglia's indigenous Susumaniello grape, affectionately known as 'Puglia's Beaujolais' for its fresh, juicy character. This wine is refined exclusively in stainless steel to preserve its youthful vibrancy and is best enjoyed slightly chilled. The Susumaniello grape is a fascinating crossing of Garganega and Uva Sogra, creating a unique flavor profile.
records.varietal: 100% Susumaniello (a crossing of Garganega and Uva Sogra)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Super-fresh aromas of black cherry and raspberry dominate the nose with exuberant fruit purity that immediately appeals. Violet notes add floral elegance and lift, while a subtle touch of fresh strawberry jam provides an inviting sweetness. The ruby red color with violet reflections signals the wine's youth and freshness. Additional layers of blackberry, plum, and hints of black pepper and spices emerge, creating surprising complexity for such a fresh, approachable style.","finish":"The finish is clean and fruit-forward, with soft tannins fading gently without astringency. Lingering notes of cherry and violet persist pleasantly. The wine's fresh character ensures the finish is bright and inviting, encouraging another glass rather than overwhelming the palate.","palate":"Soft tannins and violet-laced fruit create a silky, approachable palate that emphasizes drinkability. The wine showcases lovely ripe purity with concentrated red berry fruits that taste fresh and vibrant. The stainless steel aging preserves a young, fresh, and dynamic character without any oak influence. The texture is round and harmonious, while the soft structure makes this wine incredibly versatile. The slight chill recommended for serving enhances the wine's refreshing qualities and makes it perfect for casual enjoyment."}

records.name: Chateau Josephine Cabernet Sauvignon  Mevushal (MD & DC) 2023
records.description: This semi-sweet kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Yecla, Spain offers an approachable style with bright fruit flavors and gentle sweetness. Perfect for those preferring a softer wine profile, it balances ripe fruit character with just enough structure to remain food-friendly.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fruity and expressive, the nose bursts with aromas of fresh cherries, black currant, and a distinctive eucalyptus note that adds herbal complexity. The semi-sweet style showcases forward fruit aromatics with hints of vanilla from oak contact. Inviting and approachable, with bright berry fruit leading the way.","finish":"The finish is smooth and fruit-forward with lingering sweet cherry notes and a touch of vanilla. Pleasant sweetness persists without heaviness, making this wine particularly enjoyable for casual sipping.","palate":"Rich flavors of black currant and dark cherries dominate the palate, complemented by creamy vanilla notes and gentle sweetness. The semi-sweet profile provides roundness and immediate accessibility, while moderate acidity prevents cloying. Soft tannins and plush fruit create a crowd-pleasing, easy-drinking experience with noticeable but balanced residual sugar."}

records.name: Rock Ferry Orchard Pinot Rose 2022
records.description: A gold medal-winning organic rosé from Rock Ferry's Orchard vineyard in Marlborough, New Zealand, crafted in an elegant French style. This certified organic and vegan wine combines Pinot Noir with small percentages of Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris, all harvested together and aged on light lees for six months to develop complexity and texture.
records.varietal: 83% Pinot Noir, 9% Pinot Blanc, 8% Pinot Gris
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays a beautiful salmon-pink hue's aromatic promise with delicate scents of fresh strawberries, raspberries, and red cherries. Floral notes of white blossoms and rose petals add elegance, while subtle aromas of rock melon (cantaloupe) provide a unique dimension. The French-style winemaking contributes hints of brioche and subtle yeast character from the lees aging, adding complexity beyond typical fruit-forward rosés.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with red berry flavors lingering alongside subtle floral notes. The wine's organic farming and minimal intervention winemaking allow the purity of fruit to shine through, while the light lees contact provides a gentle, textured finish with excellent length.","palate":"The palate is refreshing and well-balanced, showing the precision of cool-climate Marlborough fruit. Berry flavors—particularly wild strawberry and cranberry—are complemented by notes of watermelon and rock melon, creating a harmonious fruit profile. The wine maintains crisp acidity that energizes the palate, while the six-month lees aging contributes subtle texture and a hint of creaminess. The small percentage of Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris adds depth and complexity to the blend, with delicate citrus notes enhancing the overall freshness."}

records.name: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Rouge 2022
records.description: A delicate red Sancerre crafted from Pinot Noir by this family-run Loire Valley estate. This wine showcases the elegant, fruit-forward character that makes red Sancerre so distinctive, with traditional winemaking methods preserving the purity of the terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of red fruits, particularly ripe cherry and morello cherry, layered with subtle floral notes. Delicate hints of forest floor and fresh herbs add complexity, while maintaining the bright, lifted character typical of Loire Valley Pinot Noir. The aromatic profile is clean and precise, inviting further exploration.","finish":"The finish is bright and lifted, with lingering notes of red cherry and a subtle mineral edge. Light and fresh, the wine concludes with fine-grained tannins and a touch of earthiness that adds depth without weight.","palate":"The attack is supple and welcoming, with red fruit notes taking center stage—think fresh cherries and wild strawberries. The tannins are well-integrated and harmonious, providing structure without overwhelming the delicate fruit. Medium-bodied with refreshing acidity that brings energy and balance to the wine. The texture is silky and refined, showcasing the elegance of Loire Valley Pinot Noir."}

records.name: Collina San Ponzio Barolo 2018
records.description: A classic Barolo from Piedmont's legendary Nebbiolo vineyards, crafted by Collina San Ponzio's Linea 1878 collection. The 2018 vintage earned 91 points from Wine Enthusiast, showcasing the power and elegance that defines great Barolo with excellent aging potential through 2033.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with captivating aromas of rose petal and violet, classic hallmarks of Nebbiolo. Black-skinned berries—particularly black cherry and crushed raspberry—mingle with savory notes of chopped herbs, tilled earth, and freshly turned soil. Layers of culinary spice, particularly star anise, add aromatic complexity, while subtle hints of leather and tobacco provide maturity and depth. The nose is elegant yet intense, promising the structured palate to follow.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with fine-grained tannins providing grip and structure. Flavors of dark fruit, spice, and earth linger, with subtle notes of rose petal and tobacco carrying through. The wine concludes with vibrant acidity and an elegant, refined character that invites another sip.","palate":"The palate is elegantly structured and full-bodied, offering ripe black cherry and crushed raspberry flavors at its core. Savory elements emerge with licorice, black pepper, and tobacco leaf, adding complexity and Old World character. The tannins are youthfully austere but polished and refined, with a taut structure that promises excellent aging. Bright acidity provides backbone and freshness, cutting through the wine's richness and ensuring balance. While approachable now, the wine rewards patience with its sophisticated interplay of fruit, earth, and spice."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2014
records.description: A distinguished Gran Reserva from one of Rioja's most historic bodegas, established in 1890. The 2014 vintage received 91 points from critics, showcasing the exceptional quality and traditional character of extended oak aging combined with modern winemaking finesse at an exceptional value.
records.varietal: Tempranillo-based blend with Graciano and Mazuelo
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is complex and inviting, opening with rich aromas of black cherry and black currant, layered with cocoa powder and dark chocolate. Cedar chest and violet add elegance and floral lift, while hints of anise provide spice complexity. Subtle notes of cassis emerge, adding depth to the dark fruit profile. The extended oak aging contributes beautifully integrated wood notes without overwhelming the fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is drawn-out and silky, with lingering notes of dark fruit and chocolate. The plush tannins provide a soft, velvety texture that persists, making this a hedonistic and satisfying gran reserva. Subtle spice and oak notes carry through to the conclusion.","palate":"The palate is polished, round, and notably softer and more approachable than traditional gran reservas, showing modern winemaking influence. Rich flavors of Chambord liqueur and black currant dominate, complemented by roasted red pepper and milk chocolate. Violet and anise provide aromatic complexity that carries onto the palate. The texture is defined by plush, velvety tannins that fill the mouth with luxurious weight. The wine shows wonderful balance between fruit, oak, and acidity, with a smooth, approachable character that makes it accessible now while retaining aging potential."}

records.name: Hendry Block 28 Zinfandel 2021
records.description: An exceptional single-vineyard Zinfandel from Hendry Ranch's historic Block 28 in Napa Valley, planted on St. George rootstock at 60 meters elevation. Rated 92 points by Wine Enthusiast, this wine showcases refined power and structure with 15 months aging in 65% new oak, built for graceful aging.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is handsomely structured and aromatic, opening with rich aromas of blueberry tart and dark berry compote. Poached rhubarb adds a distinctive fruit character, while cigar box and sweet baking spices—particularly cinnamon and clove—contribute complexity. Mocha espresso notes from the oak aging provide depth and richness without overwhelming the fruit. The aromatics are intense yet refined, promising the full-bodied palate to follow.","finish":"The finish is long and polished, with fine-grained tannins providing grip and aging potential. Flavors of dark berries, espresso, and sweet spices linger, supported by vibrant acidity. This is a wine built to age gracefully, concluding with power and refinement.","palate":"Full-bodied yet refined in approach, the palate features concentrated blackberry and black cherry flavors at its core. These dark fruit notes are beautifully laced with mocha espresso and cinnamon spices that build richness and complexity. Burnt orange zest adds a citrus brightness that lifts the wine, while firm yet integrated tannins provide structure. Bright acidity keeps the wine fresh and balanced despite its power and concentration. The wine is powerful and tightly bound, showing excellent balance between fruit intensity, oak influence, and structural elements."}

records.name: Domaine du Joncier iCI 2017
records.description: An exceptional organic and biodynamic Lirac from Marine Roussel's family estate in the Rhône Valley. Rated 91 points by Wine Enthusiast, this Grenache-dominant blend showcases the distinctive terroir of a single parcel covered with large rounded pebbles, creating a fresh, elegant wine with outstanding balance.
records.varietal: Grenache-dominant blend with Syrah, Carignan, and Cinsault
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is dark and compelling, revealing concentrated black fruit aromas of ripe cherry, blackberry, and plum. Aromatic spices dominate—particularly black pepper, cinnamon, and cedar—adding complexity and Rhône character. Fresh herb notes and subtle camphor provide additional layers, while the organic farming practices contribute to the wine's purity and precision of aromatics. The bouquet is both powerful and refined.","finish":"The finish is elegant and long, with persistent notes of dark fruit and pepper spice. The silky tannins carry through, supported by bright acidity that keeps the wine fresh. The conclusion is warm and satisfying, with excellent length and complexity that lingers.","palate":"The attack is fruity and soft, immediately welcoming on the palate before becoming warmer and more structured as it develops. Bright flavors of tart red cherry and plum are beautifully spiced by shavings of cinnamon, cedar, and camphor, creating an aromatic complexity that elevates the wine. The wine is full-bodied yet crisply balanced, with firm acidity providing freshness and energy. Taut, fine-grained tannins frame the wine elegantly, while silky texture adds polish and refinement. The single-parcel terroir expresses itself through distinctive minerality and a sense of place."}

records.name: Born Rambla Rose 2024
records.description: An organic rosé from Barcelona's all-female winemaking team at Born Rosé, crafted from Grenache and Tempranillo grapes grown in the Penedès region. This Bronze Medal winner at the Decanter World Wine Awards represents the new wave of Mediterranean rosés—100% organic, dry, light, pale, and low in alcohol, embodying the team's philosophy that 'we don't make wine, we make rosé.'
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Fresh and inviting on the nose with aromas of ripe strawberry, red apple, and subtle red plum. Delicate floral notes add elegance, while a distinctive herbal undertone—characteristic of the Grenache-Tempranillo blend—provides Mediterranean character. The organic farming practices allow pure fruit expression without heavy intervention, creating a clean, vibrant aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit flavors and that distinctive herbal note providing interest. The dry finish leaves the palate ready for food or another sip, with subtle minerality and bright acidity ensuring the wine maintains its vibrant character through the aftertaste.","palate":"Fresh, buoyant, and distinctly dry on the palate, this rosé showcases the best of Spanish rosado tradition with a modern, refined approach. Flavors of crisp apple and strawberry dominate, complemented by notes of plum and subtle citrus. The subtle herbal undertone noted on the nose carries through, adding complexity and a savory edge that balances the fruit. The wine is light-bodied with refreshing acidity, while the low alcohol level (typical of Born's style) contributes to its exceptional drinkability."}

records.name: Trespass Petit Verlot 2018
records.description: A distinctive Napa Valley red from Trespass Vineyard, blending Petit Verdot with Merlot to create a powerful yet balanced wine. Trespass Vineyard ranks in the top 10 estates in Napa Valley with an average rating of 4.5, and this bottling showcases their expertise in crafting age-worthy wines that marry concentrated fruit with savory complexity.
records.varietal: Petit Verdot and Merlot blend (exact percentages not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense aromas of ripe plum and blackberry jam, followed by intriguing savory notes of scorched earth and tobacco that provide wonderful complexity. This balance where 'jam fruit meets mouthwatering savories' defines the wine's unique character. Hints of dried herbs, cedar, and dark chocolate emerge as the wine breathes, while subtle notes of vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging add polish to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and layered, with dark fruit flavors persisting alongside spice notes and a touch of minerality. The powerful tannin structure becomes evident on the finish, suggesting excellent aging potential, while the wine's natural acidity maintains freshness and prevents heaviness despite the concentration.","palate":"Powerful and concentrated on the palate, this wine delivers rich flavors of black cherry, plum, and dark berries. Warm spices of clove and cinnamon add complexity, while tart currants provide brightness and balance to the ripe fruit character. The wine shows excellent structure with firm, well-integrated tannins that give it presence without harshness. The Petit Verdot contributes intensity and grip, while the Merlot adds supple texture and roundness. The balance between acidity and tannins is expertly managed, creating a harmonious whole."}

records.name: Aratas Los Carneros Chardonnay 2024
records.description: A premium Carneros Chardonnay from the cool-climate Napa side of this renowned appellation, showcasing the region's signature elegance and mineral-driven character. The 2024 vintage captures the essence of this fog-influenced terroir, producing a Chardonnay of depth and complexity.
records.region: Los Carneros AVA, Napa Valley, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Noticeably dark golden in the glass, the nose reveals an intriguing and layered bouquet of dessert spices, crème brûlée, and honeysuckle. Aromas of dried straw mingle with ripe melon, suggesting both richness and maturity. The aromatic profile demonstrates the complexity achieved through careful winemaking and potential barrel fermentation.","finish":"The finish lingers impressively, with notes of vanilla and toasted oak persisting alongside ripe stone fruit. The wine's richness carries through to the end, leaving a lasting impression of California Chardonnay at its most expressive.","palate":"Rich in flavor with notable viscosity and a somewhat creamy texture, this Chardonnay delivers layers of vanilla, baked apple, and tropical fruit. The mouthfeel is generous yet balanced, with good acidity providing structure to the wine's opulent fruit. Oak influence is present but integrated, adding complexity without overwhelming the Carneros terroir character."}

records.name: Valdemar Estates Walla Walla Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
records.description: This powerful Walla Walla Cabernet showcases the intensity of Washington's premier wine region with 19 months of French oak aging. A blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Merlot, and 12% Malbec creates a wine of remarkable concentration and structure. The wine displays both muscular depth and elegant refinement, with International Wine Report suggesting cellaring until 2025 for optimal enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals a complex interplay of dark fruit and earthy aromatics, opening with rich aromas of brambly red fruits, roasted beets, and dried figs. Fig and black cherry dominate, accompanied by subtle notes of black tea, fresh earth, and sage. Floral violet notes emerge alongside savoury stone and mineral undertones, while sweet tobacco leaf and cedary herbs add further complexity to the lifted, elegant bouquet.","finish":"The finish lingers with attractive hints of baking spice, cedary herbs, and concentrated dark fruit. The grippy tannins persist, suggesting excellent aging potential and rewarding those who cellar this wine for several years.","palate":"Chewy, dense, and massive on entry, the palate shows remarkable concentration with flavors of braised black plum and baked boysenberry pie. Sweet tobacco, cinnamon stick, and attractive baking spice notes weave through the concentrated fruit core. The wine is powerful yet polished, with sweet but very grippy tannins providing substantial structure mid-palate. Elevated acidity balances the wine's impressive density and full tannin profile, creating a harmonious whole."}

records.name: Paris-Simoneau Les Georges Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: A distinctive Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc from the Simoneau family estate in Saint-Georges-sur-Cher, where the family has cultivated vineyards since the French Revolution. This IGP Val de Loire cuvée earned 1-star recognition in the 2024 Guide Hachette des Vins, representing excellent value from a 74-hectare estate now managed by Carine Simoneau and Sébastien Paris, who focus on expressive varietal wines.
records.region: Saint-Georges-sur-Cher, IGP Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with intriguing notes of brioche and subtle yeast character, reflecting the wine's tank aging on lees, which adds complexity beyond typical Sauvignon Blanc. Bright citrus aromas of lemon and grapefruit emerge alongside white fruit notes of pear and white peach. A distinctive touch of bonbon arlequin (mixed fruit candy) adds a playful element to the aromatic profile, while subtle mineral and grassy notes typical of Loire Sauvignon Blanc provide freshness.","finish":"The finish offers good length with lingering citrus and white fruit flavors, complemented by those distinctive brioche notes from lees contact. The slight sweetness persists gently on the aftertaste, balanced by refreshing acidity that keeps the palate interested and engaged.","palate":"On the palate, this wine shows good expression with notable roundness and slight sweetness that distinguishes it from the razor-sharp acidity of Sancerre. The tank aging contributes to a fuller mouthfeel with subtle creaminess, while flavors of citrus fruits—particularly lemon and lime—blend with white orchard fruits and tropical notes. The wine maintains refreshing acidity balanced by its inherent roundness, creating an approachable yet characterful style. The subtle sweetness referenced in professional notes is gentle and well-integrated, adding to the wine's appeal without making it cloying."}

records.name: Hertelendy Legend 2018
records.description: An exceptional Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from the prestigious Hertelendy estate, the 2018 Legend earned 98 points from multiple critics including Robert Parker Wine Advocate and Jeb Dunnuck. With only 88 cases produced, this wine represents the pinnacle of California winemaking, combining Hungarian and French oak aging with meticulous vineyard selection.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is profound and captivating, offering layered scents of blackcurrant cordial, blackberry pie, and blueberry compote. Deeper exploration reveals touches of mocha, licorice, and black truffles alongside cedar chest and exotic spices. The aromatic complexity reflects both the wine's exceptional fruit quality and its 23 months of barrel aging in 90% new French and Hungarian oak.","finish":"The finish is extraordinarily long and persistent, with layers of dark fruit, spice, and oak unfolding over time. Fine-grained tannins provide structure for decades of aging potential, while the wine's notable acidity ensures freshness and longevity.","palate":"Full-bodied yet beautifully balanced by notable acidity, the wine displays remarkable concentration without heaviness. The 95% Cabernet Sauvignon base provides intense cassis and black fruit, while 5% Petit Verdot adds structural complexity and floral notes. A remarkable tannin structure creates a well-defined, almost architectural mouthfeel. The wine's power is tempered by exceptional balance, allowing both fruit and terroir to shine. Oak integration is seamless despite high new barrel percentage."}

records.name: Zacuto Ruby Port NV
records.description: A kosher Ruby Port produced by Oscar Quevedo in Portugal's Douro Valley, representing the intersection of traditional Portuguese Port-making with kosher certification. This wine offers an approachable introduction to the Ruby Port style with rich fruit character and pleasant sweetness.
records.varietal: Traditional Portuguese Port varieties (Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz blend)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is complex and inviting, revealing red cherries, cherry jam, and dark chocolate alongside a distinctive touch of black pepper. The aromatic profile showcases the traditional Portuguese grape varieties used in Port production, with concentrated fruit character from fortification. Secondary notes of spice and cocoa add depth to the forward fruit aromatics.","finish":"The finish is pleasant and clean with no off notes, showing persistent dark fruit flavors and subtle warmth from fortification. Blackberry and dark chocolate notes linger, with gentle tannins providing structure through the finish.","palate":"Rich flavors of blackberry and rhubarb dominate the palate, providing a beautiful balance of dark fruit sweetness and tart fruit complexity. Young and vibrant, the Ruby Port displays gentle tannins and a slightly dry mid-palate that prevents cloying despite the wine's natural sweetness. The fortification provides warmth and structure while allowing fruit flavors to shine. Well-balanced and approachable, avoiding common pitfalls of overly sweet or hot Port styles."}

records.name: Jump Mountain Sparkling Gruner Veltliner 2021
records.description: An exceptional Virginia sparkling wine crafted from Grüner Veltliner using méthode traditionnelle. This wine represents Jump Mountain's commitment to growing Austrian varietals in Virginia's Shenandoah Valley, producing a sparkling wine that showcases both the grape's signature characteristics and Virginia's emerging wine quality.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intriguing and complex, the nose presents a fascinating blend of brioche and vanilla from extended lees contact, complemented by bright citrus notes of lime and lemon zest. Some tasters detect a Riesling-like petrol note that adds complexity and suggests good development potential. The aromatic profile balances yeast-derived autolytic character with Grüner Veltliner's signature fresh fruit and subtle white pepper spice.","finish":"The finish is clean and lengthy with lingering citrus notes and subtle yeasty complexity. Bright acidity keeps the palate refreshed and calling for another sip, while fine bubbles continue to enliven the finish.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing with vibrant acidity characteristic of Grüner Veltliner, the palate delivers layers of citrus fruit, almond, and subtle bread dough complexity from traditional method production. The fine, persistent mousse creates an elegant mouthfeel, while the wine's underlying structure provides both freshness and depth. Virginia's climate contributes balanced ripeness, allowing the varietal's natural acidity to shine while developing sufficient fruit character. The traditional method aging adds textural complexity without overwhelming the grape's inherent elegance."}

records.name: Two Mountain Syrah 2021
records.description: An estate-grown Syrah from Washington's Yakima Valley, produced by Two Mountain Winery from their certified sustainable vineyards. The 2021 vintage showcases the intense fruit character and aromatic complexity that Yakima Valley Syrah is known for, with bright acidity and approachable tannins.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is impressive and complex, featuring blue fruit, graham cracker spice, and a distinctive richness of wet tobacco leaves with a sprinkle of black pepper. The aromatic profile also reveals touches of bacon and possibly a hint of reductive rubber that adds intrigue. Bright and expressive, the aromatics showcase both fruit purity and savory complexity characteristic of well-made Syrah.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent with lingering dark fruit, subtle oak spice, and savory herb notes. Supple tannins and bright acidity ensure the wine remains lively through the finish, encouraging food pairing or further contemplation.","palate":"Really bright and juicy with excellent acidity, the palate delivers a beautiful melody of blackberry and Bing cherry fruit complemented by touches of cola and cedar leaf. A savory herb mélange adds complexity, while very pretty oak integration provides structure without domination. The wine shows exceptional balance with great acid backbone and supple tannins that provide framework without astringency. Certified sustainable farming practices are evident in the wine's purity and vibrant fruit expression."}

records.name: Free Spirits N/A Bourbon
records.description: An award-winning non-alcoholic bourbon alternative crafted with natural ingredients and B-vitamins. Free Spirits delivers the complex character of traditional bourbon without the alcohol, making it ideal for sophisticated mocktails and mindful drinking.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with authentic whiskey-like aromatics, featuring prominent vanilla and butterscotch notes reminiscent of aged bourbon. Oak and caramel undertones emerge with subtle hints of toffee, creating an inviting and surprisingly genuine bourbon bouquet. The aroma profile successfully captures the essence of traditional whiskey without relying on alcohol.","finish":"The finish delivers a unique capsaicin-forward burn similar to eating a mild hot pepper, creating warmth in the mouth and gentle heat in the back of the throat. This distinctive peppery sensation lingers pleasantly, mimicking the burn of alcoholic bourbon while the gentle malty and caramel notes fade gradually.","palate":"Initial hints of oak and malt greet the palate, followed by soft notes of sweet apple and vanilla that develop mid-palate. A slight caramel or brown sugar character appears without excessive sweetness, balanced by gentle bitter notes upfront. The texture is smooth with some chocolate notes emerging alongside a distinctive peppery quality that adds complexity and warmth to the drinking experience."}

records.name: Backsberg Family Reserve White 2017
records.description: A premium white blend from South Africa's renowned Backsberg Estate in Paarl, representing over a century of winemaking excellence. The Family Reserve White showcases the estate's commitment to quality with careful grape selection and sophisticated oak aging, creating a rich and complex wine.
records.varietal: White blend (likely Chardonnay-based with complementary varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with tropical and stone fruit aromatics, featuring prominent notes of ripe peach and coconut that suggest oak influence. Aniseed adds an intriguing herbal-spice dimension, while subtle hints of vanilla and toasted almond speak to the wine's time in barrel. Additional layers of citrus blossom, honeydew melon, and a touch of butterscotch create aromatic complexity and richness.","finish":"The finish is long-lasting and creamy with persistent vanilla and peach notes. The oak-derived character continues to shine with hints of baking spice and toasted nuts, while the wine's natural acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion. This is a wine of substance and complexity that rewards contemplation.","palate":"Full-bodied and textured on the palate, the wine delivers concentrated flavors of peach, tropical fruit, and citrus. The oak aging has contributed vanilla undertones and a creamy, almost buttery texture that coats the palate luxuriously. Flavors of ripe stone fruit blend with hints of toasted coconut, spiced pear, and a subtle nuttiness. Despite the richness, the wine maintains balance with underlying acidity that provides freshness and prevents the wine from feeling heavy. The integration of fruit, oak, and texture is seamless."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Langhe Nebbiolo 2023
records.description: Mauro Molino's Langhe Nebbiolo offers an accessible entry point to the noble Nebbiolo grape, crafted by a respected Barolo producer. This youthful wine captures Nebbiolo's essential character while maintaining approachability, showcasing the 2023 vintage's fresh, vibrant profile from vineyards surrounding the Barolo zone.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents classic Nebbiolo aromatics with beautiful expression of red rose petals, wild strawberry, and tart red cherry. Earthy undertones of wet stone, forest floor, and dried herbs emerge alongside subtle tar and anise notes. The youthful 2023 vintage shows energetic fruit purity with delicate spice accents of white pepper and crushed fennel seed.","finish":"The finish is medium-length with persistent red fruit and floral notes. A mineral edge cuts through the conclusion, while fine tannins leave a pleasant grip on the palate that invites the next sip.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied, the wine displays Nebbiolo's characteristic elegance and transparency. Flavors of red cherry, cranberry, and wild raspberry dominate, supported by bright acidity that gives the wine lift and energy. Fine-grained tannins provide structure without weight, while mineral and earthy notes add complexity to the red fruit core. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit, acid, and tannin—a hallmark of quality Langhe Nebbiolo."}

records.name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Zinfandel (WINE CLUB ONLY) 2016
records.description: A wine club exclusive Zinfandel from Paso Robles' exceptional 2016 vintage, showcasing the region's ability to produce powerful yet balanced Zinfandel. The Pomar Junction vineyard captures Paso's warm days and cool nights, creating wines of remarkable concentration with preserved acidity and complex flavor development.
records.varietal: 100% Zinfandel (likely with small amount of traditional field blend varietals)
records.region: Paso Robles AVA, Central Coast, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Exuberant aromatics bursting with ripe brambleberry, blackberry jam, and boysenberry, characteristic of Paso Robles Zinfandel at its finest. Layers of baking spices emerge—cinnamon, clove, and allspice—alongside vanilla and mocha from oak aging. Additional complexity comes from notes of black pepper, dried herbs, and a subtle earthiness. Hints of dark chocolate and espresso add depth, while a whisper of dried fig and raisin suggests the wine's concentration without crossing into over-ripeness.","finish":"Long and warming, the finish extends with persistent dark fruit, chocolate, and baking spices. A subtle peppery note carries through, while soft tannins provide gentle grip. The conclusion is satisfying and bold, with echoes of oak, spice, and concentrated fruit.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured, displaying Zinfandel's hallmark opulence tempered by the 2016 vintage's natural acidity. Flavors of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and plum dominate, supported by notes of mocha, vanilla bean, and sweet oak. The mid-palate reveals excellent complexity with hints of black licorice, dried tobacco, cocoa nibs, and a distinctive peppery spice. Despite the wine's power and concentration, it maintains balance and avoids excessive alcohol heat. Velvety tannins provide structure while the wine's inherent fruit sweetness is balanced by savory elements and bright acidity."}

records.name: Baleia Pinot Noir 2023
records.description: Baleia, Portuguese for whale, reflects the fierce coastal elements that shape these South African Pinot Noir vines near St Sebastian Bay. Grown in pure limestone soil with extremely high mineral content, the wine displays singular character and depth of flavour born from challenging maritime conditions. The unique terroir creates a lively wine layered with fine structure and distinctive mineral complexity.
records.region: St Sebastian Bay area, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant red cherry aromas layered with subtle notes of Italian herbs and earthy complexity. Based on previous vintages' profiles, expect a bouquet showcasing the wine's limestone terroir, with ripe strawberry notes intermingling with cedar leaf and Cyprus aromatics. The maritime influence adds a distinctive mineral edge to the red fruit core, while light spice notes provide additional aromatic interest typical of this cool-climate expression.","finish":"The finish emphasizes the wine's minerality with lingering notes of red cherry, subtle spice, and a distinctive limestone-driven earthiness. The fine structure persists, leaving a clean, refreshing impression that invites the next sip.","palate":"The palate reveals bright sour cherry and red berry flavors with an earthy, mineral-driven character reflecting the pure limestone soils. Turkish delight sweetness balances the wine's natural acidity, creating a harmonious interplay between fruit and structure. The high mineral content of the vineyard shines through, providing a lively, energetic mouthfeel with fine-grained tannins. The wine showcases remarkable layering, with red fruit, herbal notes, and stony minerality building complexity with each sip."}

records.name: Tibouren Isle Saint Pierre 2021 Rose
records.description: This Provence-style rosé from Domaine Isle Saint Pierre showcases the cooling influence of the Rhône River, where the winery's island location provides unique terroir. Founded in 1927 and now run by fourth-generation vigneron Julien Henry, the estate benefits from proximity to water that allows exceptional freshness even in the far south of France. Note: Despite the name reference, this wine is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc with Vermentino, not Tibouren grape variety.
records.varietal: Blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Vermentino
records.region: IGP Méditerranée, Rhône River island location, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright aromatics leap from the glass with lively red fruits at the forefront—fresh strawberry, raspberry, and red currant create an inviting, vibrant nose. Chalk and mineral notes provide a distinctive terroir signature, reflecting the island's unique soils and proximity to the Rhône River. Subtle floral hints add elegance while maintaining the wine's crisp, refreshing character. The cooling river influence is evident in the wine's precision and aromatic clarity.","finish":"The finish is clean and mineral-driven with lingering notes of red fruits and chalk, leaving the palate refreshed. The crisp acidity ensures a bright conclusion that encourages another sip, perfect for warm weather enjoyment.","palate":"True-to-type and crisp on entry, the palate delivers bright red fruit flavors with excellent freshness and balance. The cooling influence of the river location shines through, providing remarkable acidity that keeps the wine lively and refreshing despite the southern French origins. Red berry fruits are complemented by subtle chalky minerality and a clean, structured mouthfeel. The wine avoids the weight sometimes found in southern rosés, instead offering an elegant, food-friendly profile."}

records.name: Fernanda Capello Prosecco Extra Dry NV
records.description: Fernanda Capello Prosecco represents quality-focused production from the Prosecco region, offering the fresh, approachable style that has made this sparkling wine beloved worldwide. The Extra Dry designation indicates a touch of sweetness that enhances the wine's fruit character and makes it particularly versatile.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet displays inviting aromas of fresh green apple, white peach, and pear, accompanied by delicate floral notes of acacia and honeysuckle. Citrus elements of lemon zest and grapefruit add brightness, while subtle hints of almond blossom and fresh cream contribute elegance to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of apple and pear complemented by a refreshing citrus edge. The bubbles persist pleasantly, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for another sip.","palate":"Light-bodied and refreshingly effervescent, the palate showcases crisp fruit flavors of green apple, Asian pear, and citrus. The fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy mousse on the tongue, while the Extra Dry style (with approximately 12-17 g/L residual sugar) provides a subtle roundness that balances the wine's natural acidity. Notes of white flowers and stone fruit carry through the mid-palate, maintaining freshness and vibrancy throughout."}

records.name: Wonderment Wines Pritchett’s Peak Rockpile Zinfandel 2015
records.description: From Sonoma's elevated Rockpile AVA, this Zinfandel showcases winemaker Stephanie Cook's commitment to terroir-specific wines that express each vineyard's distinctive character. Founded in 2011, Wonderment focuses on Heritage Zinfandel from premier sites, with Pritchett Peaks Vineyard producing wines since at least 2012. The 2017 vintage displays an elegant, Claret-style approach to Zinfandel rather than the high-alcohol powerhouses sometimes associated with Rockpile.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a pretty, refined expression of Zinfandel with red fruit aromatics taking center stage—bright cherry, raspberry, and cranberry create an inviting, elegant bouquet. Peach notes add an intriguing stone fruit dimension rarely found in Zinfandel, along with classic baking spices including cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove. The wine's purple hue suggests vibrancy and concentration, while the aromatics lean toward finesse rather than power, showcasing Rockpile's high-elevation terroir.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and bright acidity. The elegant tannins and balanced alcohol create a harmonious conclusion that showcases the wine's Claret-inspired style.","palate":"Medium-bodied with exquisite acidity, the palate delivers an elegant and charming Claret-style interpretation of Zinfandel at 14.8% ABV. Red fruits dominate with bright cherry, red plum, and raspberry flavors complemented by subtle baking spice notes. The wine's exceptional acidity provides lift and freshness, preventing the weight and heat sometimes found in Rockpile Zinfandels. The structure is refined rather than massive, with fine-grained tannins and excellent balance creating a wine of elegance and charm. This approach emphasizes drinkability and food compatibility over sheer power."}

records.name: Lambert Estate First Chapter Shiraz 2021
records.description: Lambert Estate's First Chapter Shiraz captures the essence of Barossa Valley winemaking with bold fruit expression tempered by careful viticulture. The 2021 vintage in Barossa delivered concentrated fruit with fresh acidity, resulting in a wine that balances power with elegance—a modern interpretation of Australian Shiraz.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry, blueberry compote, and dark plum, characteristic of warm-climate Barossa Shiraz. Layers of complexity emerge with notes of black pepper, licorice, and dried violet petals. Oak influence contributes nuances of vanilla, mocha, and sweet cedar, while subtle hints of eucalyptus and mint add an Australian signature to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and warming, with dark fruit flavors lingering alongside spice and subtle oak influences. Firm but ripe tannins frame the conclusion, while a hint of black pepper and dark chocolate carries through to the very end.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry jam, boysenberry, and black cherry preserves. The wine's natural generosity is balanced by refreshing acidity that prevents any cloying heaviness. Spice notes of cracked black pepper, clove, and star anise weave through the fruit core, while velvety tannins provide structure and grip. The oak integration is seamless, adding chocolate and coffee notes without overwhelming the fruit expression."}

records.name: Zephaniah Rose 2023
records.description: Crafted by Zephaniah Farm Vineyard in Virginia's Loudoun County, this serious rosé showcases the quality emerging from the Northern Virginia wine region. The winery has earned recognition as one of Virginia's Top 100 wineries and among the Top 50 Northern Virginia producers, with gold medals at both the 2024 and 2023 Virginia Governor's Cup competitions. Made from Cabernet Franc and Chambourcin, this rosé reflects Virginia's distinctive terroir and climate.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with expressive red fruit aromatics characteristic of Virginia rosé—bright raspberry, strawberry, and red cherry create an inviting, fresh bouquet. Oak influence provides subtle structure and complexity not typically found in casual rosés, giving this wine a more serious character. Red fruit notes dominate with hints of rose petal and subtle spice adding aromatic interest. The wine's Virginia origins bring a distinctive character that sets it apart from typical Provence or West Coast rosés.","finish":"The finish shows the wine's serious nature with lingering red fruit, subtle oak notes, and refreshing acidity. The Cabernet Franc adds a hint of herbaceousness to the conclusion, while the structure suggests this rosé can handle richer foods than typical pink wines.","palate":"The palate reveals concentrated red fruit flavors with the Cabernet Franc contributing herbaceous notes and structure, while Chambourcin adds bright acidity and red berry character. The wine presents as a serious rosé with more body and complexity than typical summer sippers. Oak influence provides texture and weight on the mid-palate, creating a rosé suitable for both warm weather drinking and food pairing. The Virginia terroir shines through with vibrant acidity and a unique flavor profile that speaks to the region's emerging wine quality."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Natural Selection (Red) Syrah-Grenache 2021
records.description: Chateau Maris pioneered biodynamic viticulture in Languedoc, crafting this Natural Selection blend from organically farmed vineyards. The wine expresses the Mediterranean terroir with purity and energy, showcasing the synergy between Syrah's structure and Grenache's generous fruit character in a minimal-intervention style.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents vibrant aromas of fresh blackberry, red plum, and wild raspberry, with the natural winemaking approach allowing terroir and fruit purity to shine. Garrigue elements of wild herbs, lavender, and dried thyme reflect the Languedoc landscape, while notes of black olive, cracked pepper, and violet add complexity. Minimal sulfur use results in pronounced fruit clarity and floral lift.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with lingering red and black fruit flavors, herbal nuances, and a subtle pepperiness. Natural tannins provide gentle grip without astringency, while the wine's purity and energy carry through to a clean conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with impressive energy and freshness, the palate showcases ripe but not overripe fruit flavors of blackberry, cherry, and plum. Syrah contributes structure and savory elements of smoked meat and black pepper, while Grenache adds juicy red fruit and a silky texture. The wine's natural acidity provides lift and prevents heaviness despite generous fruit concentration. Earthy notes of Mediterranean herbs and mineral undertones speak to the limestone-rich terroir."}

records.name: Macauley Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview 2022
records.description: Macauley's Fort Ross-Seaview Pinot Noir hails from one of California's most exciting cool-climate regions, perched high above the Pacific Ocean. The extreme maritime influence and challenging growing conditions yield Pinot Noir of remarkable elegance and complexity, with the 2022 vintage showcasing pristine fruit quality and site-specific character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals captivating aromatics of bright red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry, accented by delicate rose petal and violet notes. Subtle earthy elements of forest floor, mushroom, and damp leaves add complexity, while hints of sandalwood, Chinese five-spice, and tea leaves speak to judicious oak use. The wine's coastal origin shows through in ethereal mineral notes and a saline quality that adds intrigue.","finish":"The finish is long and haunting, with red fruit flavors gradually transitioning to mineral and spice notes. A persistent salinity lingers on the palate, while silky tannins and bright acidity leave the mouth refreshed and craving another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky texture and refined structure, the palate offers layers of red fruit including Bing cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate. The Fort Ross-Seaview site imparts remarkable acidity and tension, giving the wine energy and lift despite concentrated fruit flavors. Savory elements of dried herbs, graphite, and umami-rich mushroom weave through the fruit core, while fine-grained tannins provide gentle structure. The wine shows impressive depth without weight, balancing power with elegance in classic Pinot Noir fashion."}

records.name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Igartzeta 2020
records.description: A pristine coastal white from the Basque Country's Getariako Txakolina DO, crafted by one of the region's oldest producers. This unfiltered, unsulfited txakoli captures the essence of the Atlantic shoreline with its distinctive saline minerality and vibrant citrus character, offering an authentic taste of traditional Basque winemaking since 1930.
records.region: Getariako Txakolina DO, Basque Country, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a sophisticated bouquet of subtle floral notes intertwined with exotic fruit nuances and pronounced mineral undertones. Green apple aromatics dominate, accompanied by fresh grape essence and an intriguing minty accent that adds complexity. Fine and delicate fragrance reminiscent of ocean spray and coastal herbs creates an inviting first impression.","finish":"The finish is fresh and easy-drinking with lingering salinity and citrus zest. Mineral notes persist, leaving a clean, refreshing aftertaste that invites the next sip, characteristic of the finest coastal Basque txakolis.","palate":"Light-bodied and refreshingly lemony, the palate delivers gorgeous salinity that transports you seaside with each sip. Vibrant lime notes dance across the tongue, balanced by the wine's natural effervescence from carbonic fermentation. The texture is crisp and clean, with a mineral backbone that speaks to the wine's coastal terroir and traditional production methods."}

records.name: Boxwood Gris 2021
records.description: An elegant Virginia white wine from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, crafted from the distinctive Sauvignon Gris varietal. This ENTAV-certified French clone demonstrates the potential of premium Virginia viticulture, earning recognition with a silver medal at the 2022 Best of Loudoun wine competition and showcasing the sophistication achievable in the Mid-Atlantic region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatic profile opens with delicate stone fruit notes of white peach and nectarine, interwoven with subtle floral accents characteristic of Sauvignon Gris. Hints of fresh melon and citrus blossom add brightness, while a gentle mineral undertone speaks to the Virginia terroir. The nose is refined and inviting, displaying the varietal's distinctive character.","finish":"A clean, refreshing finish features lingering stone fruit notes and mineral accents. The conclusion is elegant and moderately long, showcasing the wine's careful winemaking and quality Virginia fruit.","palate":"The palate offers medium body with a silky texture that distinguishes Sauvignon Gris from its more common cousin. Flavors of ripe pear and golden apple dominate, complemented by notes of white flowers and a touch of honeyed richness. The wine's natural acidity provides excellent structure and balance, while subtle oak influence adds complexity without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Chateau Josephine Cabernet Sauvignon  Semi Sweet  (MD & DC) Stained Label 2023
records.description: A kosher semi-sweet Cabernet Sauvignon from Yecla, Spain, imported and distributed across America including Maryland and DC markets. This approachable wine balances Cabernet character with measured sweetness, offering an entry-level red that showcases Spanish winemaking while catering to preferences for softer, fruit-forward styles.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents bright aromas of ripe cherry and red plum, complemented by notes of milk chocolate and vanilla. Subtle hints of sweet spice and oak appear in the background, while the wine's semi-sweet style adds an inviting fruity lift to the aromatic profile. The bouquet is straightforward and accessible.","finish":"The finish is gentle and fruit-forward with lingering cherry and chocolate notes. The semi-sweet character extends through the conclusion, creating a soft, approachable ending suitable for those preferring less dry red wines.","palate":"Cherry and chocolate flavors dominate the palate in this entry-level Cabernet, with the semi-sweet style providing a soft, approachable mouthfeel. Ripe red fruit notes of cherry and berry blend with touches of cocoa and vanilla oak, while the wine's measured sweetness balances any tannic structure. The texture is smooth and easy-drinking."}

records.name: Darms Lane Cabernet Sauvignon, Bon Passe 2016
records.description: The signature estate wine from Darms Lane's prestigious Bon Passe Vineyard in Napa Valley's Oak Knoll District. This elegant Cabernet showcases the cooler-climate characteristics of this southwestern benchland appellation with refined structure and classic varietal character.
records.varietal: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from Bon Passe Vineyard
records.region: Oak Knoll District, Napa Valley, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic Napa Cabernet aromas of black cherry and blackberry are immediately evident, surrounded by elegant notes of cedar and cocoa. The nose reveals a cooler-climate influence with refined aromatics rather than overt ripeness. Complex layers of black currant add depth, while hints of vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging provide additional complexity without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"Long, structured finish with persistent dark fruit, cedar, and cocoa notes. The dusty tannins provide excellent grip and suggest this wine will continue to evolve beautifully in the bottle for many years.","palate":"Rich, smooth, and tannic with a deep core of cassis and berry flavors beautifully framed by those distinctive dusty Oak Knoll tannins. The palate is round and lush in texture, showcasing classic black cherry and blackberry fruit complemented by cedar and dark chocolate notes. Despite the wine's power and concentration, there's a cooler-climate crispness and slight astringency that adds elegance and lift, preventing the wine from feeling heavy."}

records.name: Conde Villar Alvarinho 2024
records.description: A fresh, elegant Alvarinho from Portugal's Vinho Verde region, produced by Quinta das Arcas. This wine represents the finest expression of the Alvarinho grape, delivering the crisp acidity and complex aromatics that have made this varietal famous along Portugal's northern coast.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Abundantly fruity with complex notes of citrus that leap from the glass. Ripe grapefruit dominates the aromatic profile, joined by tangerine and fresh peach notes that add richness. Tropical hints of passion fruit and guava provide exotic appeal, while delicate mineral nuances speak to the wine's terroir. The acidity is beautifully integrated into the aromatic profile, promising freshness on the palate.","finish":"Refreshing finish with lingering citrus and mineral notes. The crisp acidity leaves the palate cleansed and invigorated, while subtle tropical fruit hints persist, creating a complex and satisfying conclusion.","palate":"Bulky and well-structured in the mouth, this wine delivers excellent crisp acidity that completes the package beautifully. The palate mirrors the nose with ripe citrus fruits, particularly grapefruit and tangerine, alongside stone fruit notes of peach and nectarine. Tropical nuances add complexity without overwhelming, while pronounced minerality provides depth and interest. The wine is elegant, well-balanced, and demonstrates why Alvarinho is considered the premier white grape of Portugal."}

records.name: Baleia Vinho Rocas Red Blend 2023
records.description: A Portuguese red blend from the Vinho Regional Lisboa region, showcasing the maritime influence of Atlantic coastal viticulture. This contemporary expression balances traditional Portuguese varietals with modern winemaking techniques, offering exceptional value and food-friendliness.
records.varietal: Traditional Portuguese red blend (likely Castelão, Touriga Nacional, Aragonez)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant red cherry and wild strawberry, interwoven with subtle notes of Mediterranean herbs—rosemary and dried thyme. A whisper of ocean breeze minerality emerges, characteristic of the coastal terroir, alongside hints of black pepper and crushed stone. As the wine breathes, delicate floral notes of violet appear, adding complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, marked by lingering red fruit and a savory, almost umami quality. A mineral edge carries through, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip, with subtle herbal notes echoing in the aftertaste.","palate":"Medium-bodied with refreshing acidity that drives the palate forward. Bright flavors of cranberry and pomegranate mingle with earthy undertones of clay and wet stone. The mid-palate reveals touches of sun-dried tomato and dried sage, reflecting the Portuguese landscape. Silky tannins provide structure without heaviness, while maintaining the wine's inherent freshness and vivacity."}

records.name: Dominio de Taurum DO TORO 2023
records.description: A powerful and expressive red from Spain's Toro region, crafted from Tempranillo (Tinta de Toro). This wine offers rich dark fruit flavors with a perfect balance of intensity and elegance, characteristic of the warm Toro terroir known for producing concentrated, bold red wines.
records.region: DO Toro, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Sweet and inviting aromas of black cherries, blueberries, and ripe plums dominate the nose. Oak influence is evident with hints of vanilla, cigar box, and warm baking spices. The wine shows concentration and depth typical of Toro's powerful style.","finish":"Smooth and persistent, with soft, ripe tannins providing structure. The finish lingers with dark fruit, spice, and subtle oak notes.","palate":"Rich and bold, the palate bursts with dark berries, plum, and warm spices. The Tempranillo displays its full character with concentrated dark fruit flavors, complemented by notes of vanilla and toasted oak. At 14.5% ABV, the wine maintains balance despite its power, with a smooth, mouth-coating texture."}

records.name: LaMontagne Pinot Noir (Wine Club) 2015
records.description: A wine club exclusive Pinot Noir showcasing the elegance and complexity that comes with bottle age. This 2015 vintage has evolved gracefully, developing tertiary characteristics while maintaining its core of refined fruit and structural integrity, representing the producer's commitment to expressing site-specific terroir.
records.region: Specific region unknown; likely Oregon or California based on style
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet has matured beautifully, displaying evolved aromas of dried cherry, cranberry compote, and stewed plum. Earthy notes of mushroom, forest floor, and autumn leaves dominate, interwoven with hints of cedar, leather, and pipe tobacco. Subtle nuances of potpourri, dried rose petals, and a delicate herbal quality emerge, showcasing the wine's graceful evolution.
