A whisper of baking spice—cinnamon and nutmeg—adds warmth and complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and contemplative, marked by lingering earth tones, dried fruit, and a gentle tannic grip. Subtle mineral notes persist, along with echoes of spice and leather, creating a satisfying and complex conclusion.","palate":"Medium-bodied with softened tannins that have integrated seamlessly over time. The palate reveals flavors of tart cherry, raspberry coulis, and hints of fig, balanced by earthy undertones of tea leaf and composted earth. Secondary characteristics include notes of soy, dried herbs, and a touch of truffle, creating a savory dimension. The wine maintains lovely acidity that keeps it fresh despite its age, with subtle oak integration providing structure without dominating. The texture is silky and refined, characteristic of mature Pinot Noir."}

records.name: Luis Blanc Treilles White  (Wine Club Only) 2023
records.description: An exclusive wine club offering that showcases unique white wine character and distinctive winemaking. This small-production white represents careful vineyard selection and artisanal cellar work, crafted specifically for discerning club members seeking something beyond the everyday.
records.varietal: White blend (specific varieties not disclosed, possibly Sauvignon Blanc-based or Rhône white blend)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with fresh orchard fruit aromas of green apple, Anjou pear, and white peach, complemented by delicate citrus notes of lemon zest and lime. Floral undertones of white flowers and honeysuckle add elegance, while subtle mineral hints of wet stone provide depth. A gentle oak influence brings whispers of vanilla and toasted almond without overwhelming the wine's fresh fruit character.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent with lingering stone fruit and citrus notes. Mineral character carries through to the conclusion, joined by subtle oak-derived spice and a refreshing zesty quality that leaves the palate cleansed and ready for food.","palate":"Medium-bodied with vibrant acidity that drives the wine's freshness and length. The palate reveals layers of citrus and stone fruit—Meyer lemon, white nectarine, and golden apple—balanced by crisp minerality. Textural complexity from careful winemaking creates a rounded mouthfeel with subtle weight, while hints of brioche and hazelnut from possible lees contact add sophistication. The wine maintains excellent balance between fruit richness and refreshing acidity."}

records.name: Thelema "Vin de Hel" Muscat Late Harvest 2022  375 ml
records.description: An exceptional dessert wine from South Africa's acclaimed Thelema Mountain Vineyards, earning 95 points from Tim Atkin and 5 stars from Platter's Wine Guide 2025. This golden nectar represents one of South Africa's top 25 dessert wines, crafted from Muscat de Frontignan grapes harvested at optimal ripeness and fermented with extended skin contact for maximum aromatic intensity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is gloriously perfumed with classic Muscat aromatics, opening with vibrant tropical fruit notes of pineapple, candied papaya, and ripe mango. Layers of stone fruit including apricot and yellow peach add depth, while bright citrus elements of mandarin and lemon curd provide lift. A delicate touch of orange blossom honey and acacia flowers creates ethereal complexity, complemented by subtle floral notes of rose petal and jasmine. The aromatic intensity is remarkable yet refined.","finish":"The finish is long and luxurious with persistent fruit and honey notes. The wine's fresh acidity ensures a clean conclusion despite the sweetness, leaving flavors of apricot, citrus, and floral honey lingering beautifully. The balance achieved is a testament to exceptional winemaking.","palate":"Lush and indulgent on the palate, the wine delivers perfect balance between generous sweetness and fresh, vibrant acidity that prevents any cloying heaviness. Flavors mirror the nose with waves of pineapple, apricot, and candied citrus, enriched by honeyed sweetness and hints of ginger and baking spice. The texture is silky and coating with medium body, while the bright acidity cuts through the 149 g/l residual sugar, creating harmony and drinkability. Each sip reveals new layers of tropical and stone fruit complexity."}

records.name: Trespass Intrigue 2018
records.description: An artfully crafted red blend that lives up to its enigmatic name, combining complementary varietals to create a wine of complexity and intrigue. This blend represents modern winemaking at its finest—selecting the best components from each vintage to achieve harmony, depth, and exceptional drinking pleasure.
records.varietal: Red blend (composition unknown; likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, or similar)
records.region: Specific region unknown; likely California, Washington, or another New World region
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with an intriguing melange of dark cherry, blackcurrant, and plum, interwoven with nuances of cedar, graphite, and dried herbs. Subtle notes of violet and rose petal add floral complexity, while hints of vanilla, cocoa, and sweet oak from barrel aging provide depth. Additional layers reveal black olive tapenade, dried sage, and a whisper of smokiness. The aromatic profile suggests a sophisticated blend of Bordeaux and possibly Rhône varietals, creating multilayered complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and contemplative, marked by persistent dark fruit, earth, and spice. Firm but refined tannins provide grip and structure, suggesting the wine's aging potential. Echoes of oak, herb, and mineral complexity linger, creating a satisfying and multidimensional conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with excellent structure and integrated tannins. The palate showcases dark fruit flavors—blackberry, black plum, and cassis—balanced by earthy notes of graphite, tobacco leaf, and dried Mediterranean herbs. Oak influence is present but judicious, contributing vanilla, baking spice, and a subtle toastiness without overwhelming the fruit. The mid-palate reveals touches of dark chocolate, espresso, and a distinctive savory quality reminiscent of black olive and cured meat. Bright acidity maintains freshness and balance throughout, while the wine's texture is simultaneously plush and structured."}

records.name: Colle Corviano Sangiovese 2022
records.description: A pure expression of Sangiovese that highlights the grape's natural elegance and food-friendly character. This 2022 vintage offers authentic Italian winemaking with emphasis on fruit purity and terroir expression, delivering classic Sangiovese characteristics in an approachable, everyday format.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Aromatic notes of fresh red plum and morello cherry dominate the nose, layered with violet petals and crushed raspberry. Earthy nuances of leather, dried fig, and a hint of balsamic add savory complexity. Subtle undertones of graphite and clay minerality speak to the wine's Italian heritage, while a delicate spice note of cracked black pepper emerges with aeration.","finish":"The finish is persistent and savory, with red fruit notes gradually giving way to earthy minerality and a pleasant tannic grip. Hints of black cherry skin and espresso grounds add depth, while the bright acidity cleanses the palate completely. A subtle iron-like quality typical of quality Sangiovese lingers, ending with refreshing tartness.","palate":"The palate showcases pure, focused red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and red currant, supported by Sangiovese's signature bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. Medium weight with excellent balance, the wine displays subtle earthiness mid-palate with notes of dried mushroom and sun-baked earth. A touch of fennel seed and dried orange peel adds aromatic lift, while maintaining the grape's characteristic lean, elegant structure that makes it so versatile at the table."}

records.name: Rock Ferry 3rd Rock Chardonnay 2019
records.description: A distinctive New Zealand Chardonnay that balances Old World restraint with New World fruit expression. The 2019 vintage showcases careful oak management and extended lees aging, resulting in a wine of considerable complexity and aging potential that reflects thoughtful winemaking and terroir expression.
records.varietal: 100% Chardonnay with oak fermentation and lees aging
records.region: New Zealand (likely Marlborough or Central Otago based on producer style)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents ripe stone fruit aromas of yellow peach, nectarine, and apricot, interwoven with subtle oak notes of toasted hazelnut and crème brûlée. Citrus blossom and fresh grapefruit zest add brightness, while a mineral flinty quality provides complexity. Delicate spice notes of cardamom and white pepper emerge, along with a saline coastal character that speaks to New Zealand's maritime climate.","finish":"The finish is long and sophisticated, with toasted oak and ripe stone fruit harmonizing with a chalky mineral quality. A pleasant salinity emerges on the back palate, adding complexity and freshness. Lingering notes of lemon zest, vanilla, and almond provide an elegant conclusion with excellent persistence that suggests good aging potential.","palate":"Rich and textured with a creamy mouthfeel from extended lees contact, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of baked apple, poached pear, and golden delicious apple. Well-integrated oak provides structure and complexity through notes of vanilla bean, cashew, and subtle butterscotch, while maintaining the wine's elegance. The mid-palate shows layers of Meyer lemon curd, white peach, and a distinctive mineral streak that adds precision and length. Balanced acidity ensures the wine remains fresh despite its richness."}

records.name: Paris-Simoneau Brut Rose
records.description: An elegant French sparkling rosé that combines the celebratory nature of fine bubbles with delicate fruit character and refreshing acidity. This Brut Rosé offers sophisticated effervescence suitable for aperitifs or pairing with lighter cuisine, showcasing careful winemaking and attention to balance.
records.varietal: Traditional sparkling blend likely including Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and/or Pinot Meunier
records.region: France (specific region not designated, likely traditional method production)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate aromas of fresh strawberry, wild raspberry, and white cherry greet the nose, accompanied by hints of rose petal and orange blossom. Subtle notes of brioche and toasted almond from secondary fermentation add complexity, while a mineral quality provides elegance. Light citrus notes of pink grapefruit and blood orange add vibrancy, creating an inviting and refined aromatic profile that speaks to quality sparkling wine production.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit notes and a pleasant mineral quality. Fine bubbles continue to dance on the palate, while subtle toasty notes and citrus zest provide complexity. A slight salinity and chalk-like minerality emerge on the back palate, leading to a crisp, mouthwatering conclusion that encourages another sip.","palate":"Fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy mousse texture on the palate, carrying flavors of red berry fruits including cranberry, strawberry, and pomegranate. The wine maintains excellent freshness through bright acidity, balanced by subtle yeasty richness from lees contact. Mid-palate notes of watermelon, white peach, and a touch of almond paste add dimension, while the Brut dosage provides just enough sweetness to round out the wine without masking its essential dryness. The overall impression is one of elegance and refinement."}

records.name: Central Valley Banner Day Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant, newly released Sauvignon Blanc from California's Central Valley that captures the grape's characteristic aromatic intensity and crisp acidity. The 2024 vintage offers immediate freshness and exuberant fruit character, perfect for warm weather enjoyment and casual dining.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic with intense notes of grapefruit, lime zest, and passion fruit dominating the bouquet. Fresh-cut grass, gooseberry, and jalapeño pepper add classic Sauvignon Blanc herbaceous character, while hints of lemongrass and elderflower provide additional aromatic complexity. A subtle tropical note of guava and kiwi emerges, suggesting optimal ripeness and varietal purity. The aromatic profile is youthful, exuberant, and immediately appealing.","finish":"The finish is clean and zesty with lingering citrus notes and a pleasant herbal quality. Mouth-watering acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion, while subtle tropical fruit and mineral notes provide persistence. A touch of green peppercorn and fresh-cut grass linger, creating an invigorating finish that cleanses the palate completely.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on the palate with zingy acidity that defines quality Sauvignon Blanc. Flavors of green apple, white grapefruit, and Meyer lemon dominate, supported by herbaceous notes of fresh basil and bell pepper. The wine remains light to medium-bodied with a lean, focused structure that emphasizes purity and freshness. Mid-palate flavors of lime cordial, white peach, and a distinctive mineral quality add interest, while maintaining the variety's characteristic bright, energetic profile."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Barbera d'Asti DOCG Leradici 2022
records.description: A distinguished Barbera d'Asti from the renowned Piedmontese producer Mauro Molino, whose family has crafted exceptional wines in the region for generations. The Leradici vineyard site produces Barbera with exceptional depth and complexity, showcasing the grape's signature acidity alongside concentrated fruit and careful oak integration.
records.region: Barbera d'Asti DOCG, Piedmont, Italy - Leradici vineyard site
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals intense aromas of ripe black cherry, plum compote, and blackberry jam, intertwined with notes of violet, iris, and dried rose petals. Subtle oak influence adds layers of vanilla, cinnamon, and toasted hazelnut, while earthy undertones of truffle, wet earth, and tobacco provide Piedmontese complexity. A hint of balsamic vinegar and dark chocolate emerges with air, suggesting the wine's depth and concentration. The aromatic intensity speaks to low yields and optimal ripeness.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent with dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to earthy and spicy notes. Bright acidity continues through to the end, providing a mouthwatering quality that belies the wine's richness. Lingering notes of cherry skin, coffee grounds, and subtle oak spice create complexity, while a pleasant mineral quality emerges on the back palate. The wine's structure suggests excellent aging potential beyond typical Barbera.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied with Barbera's hallmark bright acidity providing structure and balance to concentrated dark fruit flavors. The palate delivers waves of black cherry, boysenberry, and damson plum, supported by fine-grained tannins from oak aging. Mid-palate complexity emerges through notes of espresso, dark cocoa, and sweet spice, while maintaining remarkable freshness despite the wine's richness. The acidity cuts through the density, creating a wine of considerable energy and length that pairs beautifully with rich Piedmontese cuisine."}

records.name: Raywood Moscato 2023
records.description: A fresh, aromatic semi-sweet Moscato from California's Central Coast, showcasing the Moscato grape's intensely floral and fruity character. Crafted through long, cool fermentation with a touch of natural effervescence, this wine offers an accessible, refreshing style at excellent value.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense floral aromatics burst from the glass with honeysuckle, orange blossom, and jasmine notes dominating. Fresh fruit aromas of ripe peach, apricot, and strawberry add sweetness and appeal. Hints of lychee and rose water contribute exotic elements, while subtle citrus notes of mandarin orange provide brightness. The wine's natural effervescence carries the aromatics beautifully.","finish":"Clean, fruity finish with lingering peach, honeysuckle, and strawberry notes. The light bubbles refresh the palate beautifully.","palate":"Amazingly fresh, fruity, and smooth on the palate with a light, approachable body. Sweet peach and apricot flavors take center stage, balanced by bright strawberry and citrus notes. The slight carbon dioxide from fermentation creates gentle effervescence that adds liveliness and prevents the sweetness from becoming heavy. Sufficient acidity balances the residual sugar perfectly, making the wine light and refreshing rather than cloying. The smooth, almost creamy texture enhances drinkability."}

records.name: TVH The Boss Block 8 Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
records.description: A distinguished single-block Cabernet Sauvignon demonstrating the structured power and complexity that define premium expressions of this noble variety. The 2018 vintage offers concentrated fruit with well-integrated oak and the firm tannic backbone characteristic of age-worthy Cabernet.
records.region: Single vineyard block (region not specified, likely premium wine region)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals classic blackcurrant intensity accented by cedar, cigar box, and graphite mineral notes. Layers of dark cherry and blackberry mingle with bourbon vanilla and toasted oak from barrel aging. With aeration, subtle eucalyptus and dried tobacco leaf emerge, adding complexity and intrigue. A hint of crushed violets provides an elegant floral counterpoint to the wine's darker elements.","finish":"The finish is long and authoritative, with firm but polished tannins carrying dark fruit and oak-derived spice through to a persistent conclusion. Notes of black tea and pencil shaving linger, promising excellent aging potential over the next decade.","palate":"Full-bodied and assertive, the palate showcases ripe cassis and black cherry fruit supported by substantial but refined tannins. The wine's high phenolic content provides structure and grip, while pronounced acidity maintains freshness and balance. Mid-palate concentration reveals layers of dark plum, espresso, and dark chocolate, framed by well-integrated French oak that contributes vanilla, baking spice, and a creamy texture. The wine's power is evident but controlled, showing the careful winemaking that defines premium Cabernet."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao White 60 Year Port   500 ml
records.description: An extraordinary aged white port representing six decades of careful oxidative maturation. This rare expression showcases the profound complexity that extreme age brings to fortified wine, offering a meditation on time and the winemaker's art.
records.vintage: Aged approximately 60 years (blend of vintages aged in barrel)
records.varietal: Traditional white port grapes (likely Malvasia Fina, Rabigato, Viosinho, Gouveio)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals extraordinary complexity born of 60 years of oxidative aging, with intense aromas of toasted hazelnuts, dried apricot, and orange marmalade. Notes of caramel, butterscotch, and toffee mingle with hints of dried flowers and aged wood. The wine shows tawny-like characteristics with honeyed richness and subtle rancio notes that speak to its extended barrel aging. Delicate spice notes of nutmeg and cinnamon add further dimension to this profoundly complex bouquet.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and complex, with waves of nutty, caramelized flavors interwoven with citrus peel and honey. The wine's richness lingers beautifully, leaving impressions of toasted almond, orange zest, and gentle spice that invite prolonged contemplation.","palate":"On the palate, this 60-year-old white port delivers concentrated flavors of candied orange peel, dried fig, and roasted almonds, balanced by surprising freshness that defies its age. The sweetness is rich but not cloying, supported by bright acidity that has survived decades of oxidative aging. Flavors of crème brûlée, honeycomb, and toasted nuts layer over a core of dried stone fruit, while the wine's fortification provides warmth and structure. The texture is silky and refined, with seamless integration of all elements achieved only through extensive time."}

records.name: Hendry HRW Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
records.description: A refined expression from Napa Valley's renowned Hendry Ranch, this HRW bottling represents exceptional value from estate vineyards. The wine balances concentrated fruit with elegant structure, showcasing the distinctive terroir of the property's benchland sites.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of mouthwatering blackberry and black currant, complemented by subtle hints of mint and caramelized sugar. Underlying notes of smoke, grape skins, and earthy loam add complexity, while gentle oak influence brings whispers of vanilla and dark chocolate. The aromatic profile is medium in intensity with a slight violet hue that suggests youthful vibrancy.","finish":"The finish reveals bittersweet cocoa and a touch of soy sauce, with persistent berry fruit and a final note of smoky oak. The tannins slowly build and drift away, leaving a clean, structured conclusion that invites the next sip.","palate":"On the palate, this medium-bodied Cabernet delivers silky texture with tangy blackcurrant and dark berry flavors at its core. Fresh red fruit notes weave through the darker fruit spectrum, creating layers of interest. Black tea, bramble, and spice add savory complexity, while the wine's vibrant acidity keeps the flavors focused and mouthwatering. The tannins are firm yet polished, providing structure without weight."}

records.name: Remhoogte Honeybunch 2023
records.description: A reserve Chenin Blanc from a registered 36-year-old single vineyard in Stellenbosch's Simonsberg region. The 2023 vintage was harvested before rains arrived, with around 5% of bunches developing beneficial botrytis that adds the wine's signature honeycomb character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic with yellow fruit notes of ripe peach, quince, and pineapple. Floral notes of orange blossom and jasmine intertwine with the characteristic honeycomb aroma unique to this vineyard. The presence of botrytis adds a subtle waxy, honey-like dimension that elevates the complexity.","finish":"The finish is both sweet and savory, perfectly balanced by fresh acidity. It lingers with notes of honeyed stone fruit and citrus zest, leaving a refreshing yet complex impression.","palate":"Bright acidity forms the backbone, beautifully coated with ripe, yellowed fruit flavors. The botrytis portion gives the wine its signature honeycomb and waxy coating on the palate. The 12-hour skin contact provides a slight grip and textural weight, creating impressive depth while maintaining beautiful balance."}

records.name: Zephaniah Rose 2024
records.description: Zephaniah Rose 2024 represents a fresh, vibrant expression of rosé winemaking with the exuberance and energy of a just-released vintage. This wine embodies the modern approach to rosé—crisp, aromatic, and designed for immediate pleasure, perfect for warm weather enjoyment and versatile food pairing.
records.varietal: Rosé blend (likely Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Pinot Noir, or similar varieties suitable for rosé production)
records.region: Region varies by producer (could be California, Provence-style, or other quality rosé region)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose sparkles with vivacious aromas of fresh wild strawberries, watermelon, and white peach, creating an instantly appealing and summery bouquet. Delicate floral notes of rose petal, orange blossom, and white flowers add elegance, while subtle hints of fresh herbs like basil and tarragon provide a savory counterpoint. A whisper of pink grapefruit zest and crushed raspberries adds brightness, while underlying minerality suggests careful vineyard selection and gentle pressing techniques.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent red berry notes and zingy acidity that leaves the palate invigorated. A subtle herbal quality and mineral edge linger alongside the fruit, while the wine's brightness invites another sip, making it dangerously easy to drink.","palate":"On the palate, this rosé delivers refreshing, mouthwatering character with vibrant acidity that makes it exceptionally food-friendly and thirst-quenching. Primary flavors include crisp strawberry, raspberry, and cranberry with undertones of nectarine and citrus peel. The wine shows light to medium body with a dry to off-dry profile, likely with minimal residual sugar to maintain elegance. A mineral salinity runs through the mid-palate, adding complexity and structure, while the wine's fresh, youthful character speaks to the just-released 2024 vintage."}

records.name: Clementine Carter Larner Syrah 2023
records.description: A recently launched Syrah from the acclaimed Larner Vineyard in Ballard Canyon, Santa Barbara County. Clementine Carter, known for producing 'Pinot Noir lover's Grenache,' has added Syrah from this legendary Rhône-focused vineyard, bringing the same attention to detail and elegant winemaking style to this powerful variety.
records.region: Ballard Canyon, Santa Barbara County, California (Larner Vineyard)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep purple color signals the wine's youth and concentration. The nose opens with classic cool-climate Syrah aromatics—black olive, smoked meat, and cracked black pepper lead the savory profile. Dark fruits of blackberry and black plum provide a ripe fruit core. Floral notes of violet and iris add elegance, while subtle garrigue herbs (thyme, lavender) speak to the variety's Rhône heritage. Hints of graphite and wet stone minerality add complexity.","finish":"Long finish with persistent dark fruit, pepper spice, and chalky tannins. The savory elements linger beautifully, showing excellent complexity for a young wine.","palate":"The palate balances power with elegance in Clementine Carter's signature style. Concentrated dark fruit flavors—blackberry, plum, and black cherry—fill the mid-palate with intensity while maintaining freshness. Savory elements of black olive, cured meat, and black pepper add complexity and prevent the wine from being overly fruit-forward. Medium to full body provides substance, while bright acidity and fine-grained tannins ensure balance and drinkability. The Larner Vineyard's limestone soils contribute mineral backbone and structure."}

records.name: Queiron Mi Lugar 2019
records.description: A distinctive Rioja from the village of Quel in Rioja Oriental, bearing the prestigious 'Vino de Pueblo' (Village Wine) classification. This 90% Tempranillo, 10% Garnacha blend showcases the unique terroir of a specific village, representing a more focused expression than traditional regional Rioja blends. Scored 91/100 by critics.
records.region: Vino de Quel (Village Wine), Rioja Oriental DOCa, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Luminous black cherry color with radiant intensity and purple-ruby nuances at the rim. The nose is pronounced and complex with ripe black fruits dominating—blueberries, blackcurrants, and blackberries lead. Red fruits of cherries, redcurrants, and plums add brightness. Spice notes of cinnamon and clove combine with mocha, fig, and balsamic complexity. The oak integration is excellent, contributing subtle vanilla without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"Extensive finish with tight-grained tannins, spiced plums, cherries, and subtle minerals. The succulent fruit and balanced structure linger beautifully.","palate":"A vigorous, lively attack greets the palate with pleasant balance and nice smoothness. Generous, complex flavors of bramble berries and dark plums fill the mouth with concentrated fruit character. Well-integrated oak adds structure and subtle spice without dominating. Bright acidity maintains freshness throughout and lifts the fruit. Medium to full body provides satisfying weight. The wine is structured yet elegant, showing both power and finesse. Fabulous length extends the flavor experience."}

records.name: Campus Oaks Chardonnay 2016
records.description: A mature California Chardonnay from Campus Oaks that has developed additional complexity and richness with bottle age. This wine represents classic California Chardonnay style with oak influence and full-bodied character, now showing evolved tertiary notes from its aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Evolved aromatic profile showing layers of baked apple, ripe pear, and honey mingling with buttery notes and toasted oak. The bouquet reveals mature characteristics including hazelnut, butterscotch, and crème brûlée from extended oak aging and bottle development. Subtle hints of vanilla bean, baking spices, and a touch of caramel add richness, while whispers of dried apricot and fig emerge with aeration.","finish":"Long, luxurious finish with persistent notes of oak, butter, and ripe fruit. The wine's creamy texture lingers pleasantly while subtle spice and nut notes emerge on the fade.","palate":"Full-bodied and rich on the palate with creamy texture from malolactic fermentation and extended lees contact. Flavors of golden apple, poached pear, and tropical notes of pineapple blend seamlessly with oak-derived elements of vanilla, toasted almond, and butter. The mid-palate shows impressive depth and viscosity with notes of lemon curd, caramel, and a subtle mineral quality. Balanced acidity prevents the wine from feeling heavy despite its richness."}

records.name: Sutherland Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: A cool-climate Cabernet from Thelema's Sutherland Vineyards in Elgin Valley, positioned just 9km from the Atlantic Ocean at 140-250m elevation. This maritime-influenced expression showcases Gyles Webb's vision for elegant, balanced Cabernet that emphasizes finesse over power, offering exceptional value at around $14.
records.region: Elgin Valley, Cape South Coast, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents ripe, concentrated aromatics with plummy dark fruit and glossy black cherry leading the way. Undertones of cassis and blackcurrant reflect the Cabernet varietal character, while spice notes—cinnamon, clove, and black pepper—add complexity from oak integration. Distinctive cigar box and cedar aromas emerge with air, creating a classic Cabernet profile with admirable restraint and elegance rather than overripe intensity.","finish":"The finish emphasizes spice and oak character, with cigar box notes becoming more prominent alongside dark chocolate and espresso. Tannins remain present but polished, suggesting 5-7 years of positive evolution ahead.","palate":"Ripe, sweet, and succulent black fruit fills the palate with generous fruit expression—think blackberry compote, dark cherry preserves, and cassis liqueur. The cool-climate origins reveal themselves in the wine's supple texture and bright underlying acidity that keeps the concentrated fruit in balance. Oak influence is present but integrated, contributing vanilla, mocha, and subtle toast without dominating. Mid-palate juiciness gives way to structured tannins that provide grip without astringency, showcasing the wine's impressive concentration within an elegant framework."}

records.name: Oceano Pinot Noir 2021
records.description: Oceano Pinot Noir captures the essence of coastal viticulture where ocean influences moderate temperatures and create ideal conditions for this finicky variety. The 2021 vintage showcases the elegant, aromatic character Pinot Noir achieves in maritime climates, with bright acidity, silky texture, and layers of red fruit complexity.
records.region: Coastal region (likely California Central Coast, Sonoma Coast, or similar maritime-influenced appellation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is quintessentially Pinot Noir with alluring aromatics of ripe red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry compote, accented by floral notes of rose petal and hibiscus tea. Coastal influences bring subtle maritime minerality and a whisper of sea salt, while earthy undertones of forest floor, mushroom, and damp soil add complexity. Subtle oak integration contributes hints of sandalwood, clove, and vanilla without overwhelming the delicate fruit, while a distinctive note of dried herbs and tea leaf speaks to the variety's savory side.","finish":"The finish is persistent and refined with lingering red fruit flavors and a gentle grip of fine-grained tannins. A savory quality of dried herbs and umami richness appears in the conclusion, while the wine's natural acidity keeps everything fresh and balanced. The coastal terroir signature of mineral salinity extends through the finish, leaving a clean, elegant impression.","palate":"The palate is elegant and medium-bodied with the silky texture that defines well-made Pinot Noir. Bright flavors of red cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate dominate, supported by vibrant acidity that provides lift and freshness throughout. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit intensity and earthy complexity, with flavors of beetroot, black tea, and subtle truffle emerging in the mid-palate. Coastal influence is evident in the wine's bright, focused character and distinctive saline minerality that adds dimension to the red fruit core."}

records.name: Black Elephant Vintners Back Roads Petite Sirah 2019
records.description: A powerhouse Petite Sirah from Black Elephant Vintners' Back Roads series, celebrating off-the-beaten-path vineyard sources and bold California winemaking. This wine embodies the intensity and deep color that defines the Petite Sirah varietal, crafted for lovers of big, structured reds.
records.region: California (likely Paso Robles, Lodi, or Sierra Foothills)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dense, almost opaque aromas of blackberry jam, black plum, and crushed blueberries dominate the bouquet with impressive concentration. Layers of violet, graphite, and black pepper add complexity, while notes of charred oak, espresso, and dark chocolate from barrel aging create a brooding, powerful aromatic profile. Hints of leather and dried herbs emerge with aeration.","finish":"Extraordinarily long finish with gripping tannins and persistent dark fruit that seems to last minutes. Notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and black pepper linger powerfully while the wine's structure slowly softens on the palate.","palate":"Massive and full-bodied with grip and intensity characteristic of top Petite Sirah. Flavors of black fruit preserves, blackberry liqueur, and cassis flood the palate with remarkable power. The mid-palate shows excellent depth with notes of mocha, black licorice, and a savory, almost meaty quality. Substantial, chewy tannins provide serious structure while ripe fruit concentration balances the wine's formidable presence."}

records.name: Boplaas Alvarinho 2024
records.description: A fresh expression of Alvarinho (Albariño) from South Africa's renowned Boplaas Estate, a six-generation family winery in Calitzdorp. This wine showcases the estate's expertise with Portuguese varietals and represents South Africa's growing excellence with this aromatic white grape in their unique terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and aromatic nose bursting with white peach, apricot, and honeydew melon alongside zesty citrus notes of lime, lemon zest, and orange blossom. Floral elements of jasmine and acacia add elegance, while subtle mineral and saline notes hint at the wine's depth. A whisper of fresh herbs and white pepper provides additional complexity.","finish":"Medium-length finish with persistent citrus zest and stone fruit notes. The wine's bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed while subtle mineral elements linger pleasantly.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on the palate with vibrant acidity that defines the Alvarinho style. Flavors of ripe stone fruit including nectarine and yellow peach mingle with citrus elements of grapefruit and Meyer lemon. The mid-palate shows nice weight and texture with a slight viscosity that adds richness without heaviness. Mineral notes and a subtle salinity create an intriguing savory dimension that balances the fruit."}

records.name: Poggio Scudieri Chianti Classico Riserva 2019
records.description: A Chianti Classico Riserva from the historic Tuscan winemaking family Poggio Scudieri, whose roots in the region date back to 1890. Made from Sangiovese as required by DOCG regulations, this wine underwent extended aging before release. The 2019 vintage received a CellarTracker score of 87 based on consumer reviews.
records.varietal: Sangiovese (as required by Chianti Classico DOCG regulations)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents classic Sangiovese aromatics with raspberry as the dominant note, expressing the grape's characteristic red fruit profile. The wine shows moderate intensity with a focus on purity of fruit expression rather than overwhelming complexity. Subtle oak influence is present, adding a gentle vanilla and spice background that supports rather than dominates the fruit. As the wine opens, hints of dried cherry and subtle earthy notes begin to emerge, adding dimension to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is moderate in length with the light berry character fading gracefully. Oak influence is most noticeable on the finish, adding a gentle toasted quality without bitterness. The soft tannins persist just long enough to provide structure, while the overall conclusion is clean and approachable, making this an excellent wine for pairing with a wide range of foods.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with an approachable, easy-drinking character that makes this wine perfect for casual occasions. The raspberry fruit from the nose carries through to the palate, joined by light berry flavors that remain fresh and vibrant. Low acidity makes the wine softer and more immediately appealing, though this also means it should be enjoyed relatively young. A bit of tannin provides structure without making the wine aggressive, while the oak influence adds subtle complexity and a light spicy note. The overall impression is one of balance and drinkability rather than power or concentration."}

records.name: Well Crafted Prosecco Freschissimo Keg NV  20000 ml
records.description: A large-format keg Prosecco designed for on-tap service and events. While specific producer information for this brand is limited, this wine follows the classic Prosecco style from the Veneto region. The 20-liter keg format ensures maximum freshness and is ideal for entertaining or commercial service.
records.varietal: Glera (the primary grape for Prosecco DOC)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents classic Prosecco aromatics with fresh green apple and ripe pear leading the way, creating an immediately appealing and accessible bouquet. Delicate white floral notes add elegance and lift, reminiscent of acacia blossoms or white flowers. Citrus hints of lemon zest provide brightness and energy, while the overall aromatic profile emphasizes freshness and vibrancy. The keg format helps preserve these delicate aromatics by protecting the wine from oxygen exposure until service.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with the fine bubbles persisting pleasantly. Light fruit notes fade gracefully without becoming cloying, while the wine's natural acidity provides a crisp conclusion. The off-dry style means the finish is approachable and never austere, making this an excellent choice for aperitivo or celebrations.","palate":"Light-bodied and refreshing with persistent fine bubbles that create a creamy mousse on the palate. The primary fruit flavors mirror the nose, with crisp green apple and pear dominating, supported by subtle citrus notes that add zest. A hint of almond characteristic of quality Prosecco provides subtle complexity, while the overall flavor profile remains clean and focused on freshness. The wine is off-dry with just enough residual sweetness to balance the bright acidity, creating an appealing, crowd-pleasing style. The keg format ensures the wine tastes as fresh with the last pour as the first."}

records.name: Domaine Chevallier Chablis 2022
records.description: Domaine Chevallier's Chablis exemplifies the pure, mineral-driven expression of Chardonnay that has made this northern Burgundy appellation world-renowned. The 2022 vintage captures Chablis' signature steely character, with the region's ancient Kimmeridgian limestone soils imparting distinctive chalky minerality and razor-sharp precision to unoaked or lightly oaked Chardonnay.
records.region: Chablis AOC, Burgundy, France (grown on ancient Kimmeridgian limestone soils)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is characteristically restrained yet complex, opening with aromas of green apple, fresh lemon, and white peach alongside pronounced mineral notes of wet stones, crushed oyster shell, and chalk dust that define classic Chablis. Delicate floral hints of white flowers and acacia blossom add elegance, while subtle notes of fresh herbs, lemon verbena, and a whisper of honeycomb speak to the wine's complexity. The maritime influence of Chablis' northerly location is evident in the wine's saline quality and bracing freshness.","finish":"The finish is long, clean, and mineral-focused with persistent citrus notes and a pronounced saline quality that leaves the mouth watering. The wine's high acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion, while the distinctive chalk and limestone minerality lingers impressively, inviting contemplation and food pairing.","palate":"The palate is taut, focused, and intensely mineral-driven with flavors of Granny Smith apple, Meyer lemon, and unripe pear balanced by Chablis' signature flinty minerality. Razor-sharp acidity provides structure and energy, cutting through with precision while showcasing the 2022 vintage's freshness and tension. The wine shows medium body with excellent phenolic texture—a slightly chalky, almost saline mouthfeel that adds dimension beyond simple fruit. Subtle notes of wet stone, iodine, and sea spray reinforce the terroir-driven character."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Rose Cans NV  250 ml
records.description: An innovative organic rosé from Languedoc's pioneering Chateau Maris, presented in convenient 250ml cans perfect for outdoor enjoyment. This wine earned 90-91 points from Wine Enthusiast, showcasing elegant fruit expression and the estate's commitment to biodynamic viticulture and sustainable packaging.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is delicate yet expressive, opening with subtle aromas of fresh peonies and pressed carnations that provide an elegant floral lift. Ripe summer berries dominate—particularly strawberry, wild strawberry, and watermelon—alongside hints of fresh raspberry. Delicate garrigue notes add a touch of Mediterranean herb character, with whispers of thyme and lavender. The aromatics are fresh, inviting, and beautifully balanced between fruit and floral elements.","finish":"The finish is clean and crisp, with lingering notes of summer berries and citrus. A subtle hint of acidity provides energy and freshness, making this rosé ideal for warm weather enjoyment. The wine concludes with delicate herbal notes that add complexity.","palate":"Light and refreshing on the palate, the wine features juicy peach and wild strawberry flavors that meet vibrant, zesty acidity. The texture shows both roundness and freshness, creating an appealing balance that makes the wine highly drinkable. Orange zest and raspberry notes add brightness and complexity, while subtle mineral undertones provide depth. Nice minerality balances the fruit-forward character, keeping the wine lively and food-friendly. The wine is powerful yet refined, with concentrated fruit that never becomes heavy."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Marie 2024
records.description: A Loire-inspired white wine crafted in the Languedoc from Vermentino and Colombard grapes. This refreshing blend earned 92/100 points for its purity and finesse, offering exceptional value as a sophisticated aperitif wine with Mediterranean character.
records.region: Languedoc-Roussillon, Southern France (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"An expressive and complex nose bursts with tropical pineapple and bright citrus fruits, accented by a delicate touch of honey that adds richness without heaviness. The aromatic profile is clean and lifted, with fine floral notes emerging as the wine opens in the glass. The Vermentino contributes elegant Mediterranean herbs while Colombard brings characteristic aromatic citrus intensity.","finish":"A tapered, saline finish with persistent citrus and a lovely acid line that cleanses the palate. The conclusion is pure and fine, with lingering grapefruit notes and mineral undertones that invite another sip.","palate":"Crisp and dynamic on entry, the palate delivers fresh, pure citrus fruit with excellent textural interest. The wine shows lovely acid structure that keeps everything lively and precise, while subtle saline notes add complexity and a sense of place. Grapefruit and lemon dominate the flavor spectrum, supported by white peach and a hint of tropical fruit. The blend achieves wonderful harmony - Vermentino provides delicacy and smoothness while Colombard adds pop and aromatic freshness."}

records.name: Libertine Gradient Vineyard Chardonnay 2022
records.description: An extraordinarily limited production Chardonnay from Oregon's Willamette Valley that defies convention. With only 66 cases produced, this wine embraces a minimalist winemaking philosophy with native yeast fermentation in neutral oak and zero additions beyond minimal sulfites. The style is more Chablis than California, emphasizing minerality and precision over richness.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Lemon pulp and lime zest burst from the glass in a delightful citrus-driven bouquet that immediately signals the wine's fresh, precise style. Subtle background notes reminiscent of marine fossils and chalky minerals dance around the rim, evoking ancient seabeds. The neutral oak barrel fermentation allows these pure aromatics to shine without any oak influence, creating a nose that is both intense and refined, with an earthy undertone that adds complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven, with chalky notes persisting alongside bright citrus. The wine's natural acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate energized. Flinty, saline notes emerge at the very end, making this an ideal oyster wine and demonstrating remarkable precision.","palate":"The palate showcases racy acidity that provides a vibrant backbone to concentrated citrus flavors of lemon and lime. This wine emphasizes its earthy side, with mineral notes more prominent than fruit, creating a Chablis-like character that prioritizes tension and energy. The texture is lean and precise, with the neutral oak providing subtle structure without adding flavor. Native vineyard yeasts contribute complexity and a distinctive sense of place that commercial yeasts cannot replicate."}

records.name: Vina Albina Verdejo 2023
records.description: A classic expression of Rueda's signature white grape from the respected Bodegas Riojanas. This 100% Verdejo showcases the grape's characteristic freshness and aromatic intensity. The 2023 vintage received 87 points from the Peñín Guide, while previous vintages earned 90 points from James Suckling, demonstrating consistent quality.
records.region: Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"High intensity aromatics burst from the glass with elegant complexity that is immediately engaging. The bouquet combines pronounced white fruit notes of crisp apple and juicy pear with exotic tropical hints that add intrigue. Herbal aromas of fennel and chamomile provide an authentic varietal signature, while a balsamic background adds depth and sophistication. The bright straw yellow color with greenish iridescence signals the wine's youth and freshness.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing, with that signature Verdejo bitterness providing structure and encouraging another sip. The wine's natural acidity ensures the finish doesn't linger heavily but fades gracefully. Subtle herbal notes echo from the nose, while the overall impression is one of brightness and vitality perfect for warm weather enjoyment.","palate":"Bright, fresh, and crisp on the palate, this Verdejo shows classic varietal character with light to medium body. Golden berries and blanched almonds provide subtle complexity beneath the primary fruit flavors. The wine maintains excellent balance between its fruity taste and refreshing acidity, with light flavors that never become heavy. A characteristic hint of bitterness at the finish is typical of quality Verdejo and adds interest, preventing the wine from being one-dimensional."}

records.name: Sun Break Idyll Acres Perfection Cider   500 ml
records.description: An exceptionally dry, wine-like cider crafted by Sun Break from 100% heritage cider apple varietals sourced from Idyll Acres Orchard in Oregon's Willamette Valley. Bottle-conditioned using méthode champenoise with extended lees contact, this small-batch, unfiltered cider showcases the sophistication of artisan American cidermaking.
records.varietal: 100% heritage cider apple varietals from Idyll Acres
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Beautifully aromatic and wine-like in character, the nose opens with complex aromas of caramelized apple and baked apple tart. White tea and dried herbs add elegance and sophistication, moving this cider beyond simple fruit character. Subtle notes of bread dough and lees from the bottle conditioning provide depth and complexity. The aromatics are refined, layered, and inviting, showcasing the heritage cider apple varieties used in production.","finish":"The finish is bone dry and refreshing, with lingering notes of white tea and subtle apple character. Clean and crisp, the wine concludes with sophisticated herbal notes and persistent natural carbonation that cleanses the palate.","palate":"Remarkably dry on the palate—this cider truly \"doesn't even understand the concept of sugar.\" The attack features concentrated caramel apple flavors that develop into more nuanced characteristics. White tea and herbal notes provide a sophisticated, wine-like quality that distinguishes this from commercial ciders. The natural carbonation from bottle conditioning creates a fine, persistent mousse that adds texture and elegance. The unfiltered nature contributes to a fuller mouthfeel and more complex flavor profile. Small-batch production ensures attention to detail and quality throughout."}

records.name: Sun Break Liberty Red Cider   500 ml
records.description: A heritage-style artisan cider from Oregon's Willamette Valley, featuring Liberty apples among heirloom varieties. Crafted using méthode traditionnelle and bottle-conditioned for complexity, this cider represents Sun Break's commitment to small-batch, orchard-based production using heritage apple varietals.
records.varietal: Heritage apple blend featuring Liberty apples (45%), Frequin Rouge, and other heirloom varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright and zesty red apple aromatics pop from the glass, accompanied by distinctive rose petal and floral notes characteristic of Liberty apples. The heritage apple blend contributes subtle orchard blossom and fresh-picked fruit complexity. Natural bottle conditioning adds a layer of bread dough and subtle lees character that enhances depth.","finish":"The finish is clean and dry with lingering red apple and subtle floral notes. Bright acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while the natural effervescence continues to enliven the finish.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing with vibrant acidity, the palate showcases bright red apple fruit with Liberty apples contributing their signature aromatic quality. The dry profile is food-friendly and complex, with heritage apple varieties adding layers of flavor beyond simple sweetness. Natural carbonation from bottle conditioning creates a fine, persistent mousse. Unfiltered character provides additional texture and authentic orchard expression."}

records.name: Hertelendy Signature Mountain Blend (12 pk) 2017
records.description: Hertelendy's Signature Mountain Blend represents a carefully crafted expression from high-elevation vineyards, showcasing the intense concentration and structural complexity that mountain-grown grapes provide. This 2017 vintage displays remarkable depth and integration, with the seven years of development bringing forward tertiary aromatics and silky tannin refinement.
records.varietal: Red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon-based with Merlot, Syrah, or Petite Sirah)
records.region: Mountain AVA (specific appellation varies by vineyard source)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with profound layers of dark berry compote, blackcurrant, and wild blueberry, interwoven with sophisticated notes of cedar box, tobacco leaf, and graphite minerality. As the wine breathes, nuanced hints of dried lavender, black tea, and sweet pipe smoke emerge, creating an aromatic tapestry that speaks to both mountain terroir and careful cellar aging. A subtle whisper of vanilla and baking spice from oak integration adds further complexity without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish extends impressively, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to savory notes of dried herbs, black pepper, and crushed stone minerality. Fine-grained tannins provide texture through the long conclusion, while a refreshing lift of acidity ensures the wine finishes clean and inviting for another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers concentrated flavors of ripe black plum, cassis, and dark cherry preserve, supported by a firm yet refined tannic backbone that provides excellent structure. The mid-palate reveals layers of cocoa powder, espresso, and forest floor earthiness, while bright mountain acidity keeps the wine vibrant and focused. The wine's full body is balanced by elegant restraint, showing the precision of mountain viticulture where cool nights preserve freshness even in ripe fruit."}

records.name: Dominio de la Abadesa Verdejo 2016
records.description: Dominio de la Abadesa produces this Verdejo from the renowned Rueda region, Spain's premier white wine appellation. The 2016 vintage offers a more mature expression of Verdejo, showing how this variety can develop complexity with bottle age while maintaining its characteristic freshness and vibrant aromatics.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents evolved aromatics with notes of Golden Delicious apple, ripe pear, and quince, alongside fresh citrus elements of grapefruit and lime zest. White flower notes of jasmine and orange blossom remain present despite the wine's age, while subtle hints of fennel, fresh grass, and wet stone add complexity. Some bottle age has introduced delicate notes of honeyed apricot and almond.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering citrus and mineral notes. A pleasant bitterness reminiscent of grapefruit pith adds complexity to the conclusion, while the wine's acidity leaves the palate refreshed.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent freshness retained from the 2016 vintage, the palate delivers flavors of orchard fruits, citrus, and stone fruit. Verdejo's characteristic herbal notes of fennel and fresh-cut grass provide distinctive personality, while bright acidity keeps the wine lively despite its age. A subtle glycerin richness has developed with time, adding textural interest without compromising the wine's essential crispness. Mineral and saline notes carry through the mid-palate, speaking to Rueda's chalky soils."}

records.name: Chateau Josephine Merlot  Mevushal (MD & DC) 2023
records.description: A kosher Merlot from Spain's Yecla region, this wine represents excellent value from high-altitude vineyards where ideal ripening conditions develop concentrated fruit character. Mevushal certified under OU and Rabbi Padwa supervision, offering traditional kosher certification with accessible Mediterranean styling.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with reserved aromatics that benefit from gentle coaxing, revealing layers of gravel minerality and concentrated blackberry juice. With patience, earthy notes emerge alongside dark fruit, characteristic of Yecla's warm climate and calcareous soils. Subtle hints of dried Mediterranean herbs add complexity to the bouquet.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of dark fruit and subtle earthy minerality. Mild tannins fade gracefully, leaving a pleasant impression of sun-ripened Mediterranean fruit.","palate":"Medium-bodied with approachable tannins, the palate shows ripe cherry and blackberry fruit supported by dusty mineral notes. The warm Spanish growing season translates to generous fruit expression while maintaining food-friendly structure. Soft tannins and balanced acidity create an easy-drinking profile suitable for everyday occasions."}

records.name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Merlot 2013
records.description: A mature Merlot from Paso Robles' renowned Pomar Junction estate, this wine has developed additional complexity with age. The 2013 vintage showcases the warmth of Paso Robles while maintaining varietal character and food-friendly structure.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The aromatics are initially reserved, requiring patience and aeration to fully express themselves. With time, the nose reveals gravel minerality, concentrated blackberry juice, and subtle earthy notes. Ruby in color, the wine shows some evolution appropriate to its age, with hints of dried cherry and leather emerging alongside the fruit.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderate in length, with cherry fruit and soft tannins fading gradually. Secondary characteristics of dried herbs and earth linger gently, reflecting the wine's maturation.","palate":"The mouthfeel is moderately light, with gentle, well-integrated tannins that have softened considerably since release. Ruby red cherry fruit dominates, supported by subtle earth and mineral notes characteristic of the Pomar Junction vineyard. Full-bodied for the somewhat delicate structure, the wine delivers accessible fruit flavors without heaviness. Acidity remains fresh despite the wine's age."}

records.name: Bodegas Tandem Inmune Garnacha 2023
records.description: A pure expression of mountain Garnacha from the cool-climate Yerri Valley in Navarra, made by leading winemakers José Maria Fraile and Alicia Eyaralar. This 100% Garnacha is crafted without oak influence, allowing the fresh, powerful character of high-altitude fruit to shine. Fermented with native yeasts and rested 10-12 months in cement tanks, the wine showcases the modern northern Spanish approach to Garnacha.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays powerful intensity with concentrated black fruit at its core, enhanced by distinctive Mediterranean scrubland aromatics. Subtle hints of thyme and rosemary weave through the ripe fruit, creating a compelling expression of terroir. The cool climate origins are evident in the wine's freshness and aromatic precision, with the mountain fruit showing remarkable purity and definition without any oak influence masking the varietal character.","finish":"The finish is long and clean with lingering notes of black fruit, Mediterranean herbs, and a final touch of minerality. The super silky texture persists, making this a very good example of fresh, enjoyable Garnacha ideal for any occasion.","palate":"Fresh and clean on entry, the palate reveals soft, subtle fruit with super silky texture that glides across the tongue. The gentle tannic structure provides just enough grip without overwhelming the wine's approachable nature. Broad and savoury flavors unfold with appealing texture and good volume, showcasing the powerfulness of cool-climate Garnacha balanced by refreshing acidity. The wine exemplifies cooler climate northern Spanish Garnacha at its finest—fruity yet structured, powerful yet elegant."}

records.name: Rioja Lar de Paula Reserva 2016
records.description: This award-winning Reserva from Lar de Paula represents classic Rioja craftsmanship with extended aging that develops remarkable complexity. Scoring 89/100 from critics and 92 points from Penin Guide, the wine has earned multiple accolades including Concours Mondial de Bruxelles Gold Medal and Decanter World Wine Awards Silver. The 2016 vintage showcases the winery's commitment to traditional Reserva production with modern precision.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with traditional Rioja blending grapes
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals bright, powerful aromatics with creamy oak seamlessly integrated with ripe red fruit. Spicy notes emerge alongside toasty characteristics and complex dry nut aromas, indicative of extended barrel aging. The oak influence is present but refined, complementing rather than dominating the fruit core. Classic Rioja aromas of tobacco, leather, and vanilla develop alongside red cherry and plum, creating a sophisticated, multi-layered bouquet that speaks to the wine's maturity.","finish":"The long finish showcases the wine's excellent structure with persistent fine bitter notes, toasted oak, and lingering ripe fruit. The extended aging provides a smooth, refined conclusion that demonstrates the wine's quality and careful craftsmanship.","palate":"Rich flavor dominates the palate with good structure providing a solid framework for the evolved fruit character. The wine shows remarkable integration of oak and fruit, with ripe red berries, spice, and toasty notes working in harmony. Good concentration and body create satisfying weight on the mid-palate, while balanced acidity keeps the wine fresh despite its age. Fine bitter notes add complexity and prevent the wine from becoming overly sweet or heavy, characteristic of well-made Reserva."}

records.name: Aratas Veneration Red Blend 2019
records.description: Aratas Veneration is an award-winning proprietary red blend earning 98 points and 'Best in Class' Double Gold Medal from the 2022 North Coast Wine Challenge. Crafted as a fruit-forward ensemble showcasing Napa Valley's expression of Petite Sirah and Syrah, the wine reflects a softer, more approachable style than typical Petite Sirah-based blends. Barrel aged for 18 months in Hungarian and French oak, then bottled unfiltered and unfined, this is a homage to American Heritage Petite Sirah.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a generous display of dark fruit aromatics with Petite Sirah's characteristic black plum and blueberry notes complemented by Syrah's exotic spice and violet nuances. Soft vanilla and toasted oak undertones from the 18-month barrel aging integrate seamlessly without overwhelming the fruit-forward character. Hints of black pepper, graphite, and dark chocolate add complexity while maintaining an approachable, inviting profile. The wine's unfiltered nature contributes to aromatic depth and textural richness.","finish":"The finish is long and fruit-driven with persistent dark berry flavors, gentle spice, and smooth tannins. The wine's approachable style ensures a satisfying conclusion without aggressive tannins, making it enjoyable now while retaining aging potential.","palate":"Fruit-forward and purposefully softer in style, the palate showcases ripe blackberry, black plum, and dark cherry flavors with velvety texture. The blend's design emphasizes accessibility and drinkability while retaining Petite Sirah's natural concentration and depth. Syrah adds mid-palate complexity with peppery spice and meaty notes that enhance the wine's savory character. The Hungarian and French oak provide subtle structure and vanilla notes without dominating, while the unfined bottling creates a rich, textured mouthfeel. Despite the softer approach, the wine maintains excellent balance and prevents heaviness."}

records.name: Wonderment Wines Pritchett’s Peak Rockpile Zinfandel 2017
records.description: From Sonoma's elevated Rockpile AVA, this Zinfandel showcases winemaker Stephanie Cook's commitment to terroir-specific wines that express each vineyard's distinctive character. Founded in 2011, Wonderment focuses on Heritage Zinfandel from premier sites, with Pritchett Peaks Vineyard producing wines since at least 2012. The 2017 vintage displays an elegant, Claret-style approach to Zinfandel rather than the high-alcohol powerhouses sometimes associated with Rockpile.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a pretty, refined expression of Zinfandel with red fruit aromatics taking center stage—bright cherry, raspberry, and cranberry create an inviting, elegant bouquet. Peach notes add an intriguing stone fruit dimension rarely found in Zinfandel, along with classic baking spices including cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove. The wine's purple hue suggests vibrancy and concentration, while the aromatics lean toward finesse rather than power, showcasing Rockpile's high-elevation terroir.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and bright acidity. The elegant tannins and balanced alcohol create a harmonious conclusion that showcases the wine's Claret-inspired style.","palate":"Medium-bodied with exquisite acidity, the palate delivers an elegant and charming Claret-style interpretation of Zinfandel at 14.8% ABV. Red fruits dominate with bright cherry, red plum, and raspberry flavors complemented by subtle baking spice notes. The wine's exceptional acidity provides lift and freshness, preventing the weight and heat sometimes found in Rockpile Zinfandels. The structure is refined rather than massive, with fine-grained tannins and excellent balance creating a wine of elegance and charm. This approach emphasizes drinkability and food compatibility over sheer power."}

records.name: Monte Real Cepas Viejas  (6 pack) 2021 5001599
records.description: This limited edition expression from Bodegas Riojanas showcases old-vine Tempranillo from two small vineyards in Cenicero—Los Paletones and El Plantizo—planted in the late 1970s at 470 meters elevation. Part of the Monte Real Vanguardia range, this wine undergoes 12 months of oak aging to develop complexity while allowing the concentrated character of nearly 50-year-old vines to shine. Bodegas Riojanas has crafted wine since 1890, bringing over a century of experience to this modern interpretation of Rioja.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo from vines planted in late 1970s (old-vine)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals a beautiful cherry red color with a violet rim, followed by aromas of ripe red and black fruit that showcase the concentration of old-vine Tempranillo. Vanilla notes emerge from the 12-month oak aging, intermingling with sweet spices and toffee characteristics. The calcareous clay soils of the vineyards contribute subtle mineral undertones, while the elevation and maturity of the vines provide aromatic complexity and depth. The wine presents a harmonious integration of fruit, oak, and terroir-driven elements.","finish":"A sweet aftertaste lingers with persistent notes of ripe fruit, vanilla, and spice. The good structure ensures a long, satisfying finish that balances sweetness with refreshing acidity and fine tannins.","palate":"Good acidity greets the entry, providing freshness and lift to the ripe fruit core. Sweet tannins coat the palate with a pleasant, approachable texture that makes the wine immediately enjoyable despite its structure. The wine is well-structured with good volume and body, showcasing the concentration that old vines naturally provide. Ripe red and black fruit flavors dominate, complemented by vanilla, spices, and subtle toffee notes from oak aging. The calcareous clay terroir adds complexity and prevents the wine from becoming overly sweet or heavy."}

records.name: Free Spirits N/A Negroni Cans   250 ml
records.description: This ready-to-drink non-alcoholic Negroni from Free Spirits (less than 0.5% ABV) delivers the classic bitter-sweet complexity of Italy's iconic cocktail without the alcohol. Crafted with award-winning non-alcoholic alternatives that replicate bitter red aperitif, herbal gin botanicals, and sweet vermouth, the drink includes B-Vitamins (B3, B6, B12) and capsaicin to simulate the warming effect of alcohol. This represents a serious approach to alcohol-free cocktails for mindful drinking occasions.
records.varietal: N/A - Non-alcoholic spirits blend (bitter aperitif, botanical gin alternative, sweet vermouth alternative)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents the distinctive aromatics of a classic Negroni with bitter herbal notes, botanical complexity, and subtle citrus undertones. Orange zest provides bright, uplifting aromatics while herbal elements reminiscent of gin botanicals add depth and interest. The bitter red aperitif character comes through clearly, creating an authentic Negroni nose that doesn't compromise on complexity despite the absence of alcohol. Subtle sweet vermouth notes round out the bouquet with hints of spice and vanilla.","finish":"The finish is smooth and lingering with a pleasantly bittersweet aftertaste characteristic of a traditional Negroni. Botanical notes persist alongside orange zest, creating a satisfying conclusion that invites another sip. The warming effect from capsaicin continues gently through the finish.","palate":"A harmonious blend of bitter and sweet notes greets the palate, delivering the perfectly balanced flavor profile that defines a well-made Negroni. Hints of botanicals including juniper, coriander, and angelica root provide the herbal complexity typically contributed by gin. Orange zest adds bright citrus notes that lift the palate, while subtle herbal undertones from the aperitif component create layers of flavor. The capsaicin provides a gentle warming sensation on the palate that mimics the heat of alcohol without any harshness. The drink maintains impressive complexity and depth for a non-alcoholic offering."}

records.name: Monte Real Crianza 2022
records.description: Monte Real represents one of Rioja's most established and respected producers, and this 2022 Crianza showcases the house style of balance, elegance, and food-friendly structure. While unusually young for Crianza release (typically requiring minimum aging until the third year after harvest), this wine demonstrates the fresh, vibrant character of modern Rioja with classic oak aging.
records.varietal: Tempranillo-dominant blend, likely with Garnacha and/or Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals quintessential Rioja characteristics with bright red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry fruit layered with classic American oak signatures of vanilla pod, coconut, and sweet tobacco. Floral notes of violet and dried rose petals add elegance, while earthy undertones of leather, tea leaf, and subtle balsamic hints speak to the region's traditional winemaking. A whisper of white pepper and Mediterranean herbs adds complexity to the youthful fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent red fruit character and a gentle grip of tannins that invite another sip. Subtle spice notes and a touch of bright acidity linger, while the oak influence provides structure without weight, exemplifying the elegant style Monte Real is known for throughout Rioja.","palate":"On the palate, this Crianza displays medium body with lively acidity that makes it immediately accessible and food-versatile. Flavors of tart red cherry, pomegranate, and red plum dominate, supported by fine-grained tannins that show the polish of oak aging without excessive extraction. The oak influence brings notes of cinnamon stick, vanilla cream, and a hint of dill, beautifully integrated with the fruit. A savory thread of dried tomato and mineral salinity runs through the mid-palate, adding dimension."}

records.name: Rueda Reina De Castilla Oak Aged Verdejo 2019
records.description: A distinctive expression of Verdejo from Spain's premier white wine region, Rueda, showcasing the grape's ability to develop complexity through oak aging. This wine represents the modern approach to Verdejo, balancing the varietal's characteristic freshness with added richness and texture from barrel fermentation and aging.
records.region: Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals a sophisticated interplay between fresh fruit and oak-derived complexity. Opening with bright citrus notes of grapefruit and lemon zest, the aromatics evolve to include ripe stone fruit—particularly white peach and apricot. The oak aging contributes subtle vanilla and toasted hazelnut nuances, while a distinct mineral edge reminiscent of wet stone or flint adds terroir character. Delicate herbal undertones of fennel and fresh herbs provide additional complexity, while white flower notes (acacia, orange blossom) lend elegance to the bouquet.","finish":"The finish is lengthy and refined, with lingering citrus and mineral notes supported by subtle oak influence. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh through the close, while gentle vanilla and toasted nut flavors fade slowly. A slight bitter almond note adds sophistication, characteristic of well-made Verdejo.","palate":"On the palate, the wine displays excellent balance between richness and freshness. The entry is clean with vibrant acidity characteristic of high-altitude Rueda vineyards, immediately refreshing the palate. Flavors of green apple, citrus fruits, and ripe pear dominate, enhanced by a creamy, slightly buttery texture from oak aging and possible lees contact. The mid-palate shows honeyed notes and hints of sweet spice, while maintaining the crisp, mineral-driven character that defines quality Verdejo. The oak integration is seamless, adding body and complexity without masking the varietal's natural brightness and herbal qualities."}

records.name: Bierzo Pilgrim Mencia 2021
records.description: A vibrant red wine from Spain's Bierzo region, honoring the ancient pilgrimage route of El Camino de Santiago. Produced by Bodegas Godelia, this 100% Mencía showcases the grape's fresh, aromatic character and the unique terroir of Bierzo, where slate soils and continental climate create wines of elegance and minerality.
records.region: Bierzo DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic and wonderfully fresh, displaying the floral character that makes Mencía so distinctive. Cherry red in color with violet reflections, the wine opens with beautiful red fruit aromas of strawberry, raspberry, and bright red cherry. Floral notes of violet and rose petal provide elegance, while hints of pomegranate and wild berry add complexity. Subtle herbal nuances of Mediterranean scrubland and dried herbs emerge, along with delicate spice notes of black pepper and licorice. A mineral edge reminiscent of crushed slate or wet stone reflects the region's unique terroir, adding depth to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, with persistent red fruit and floral notes. The tannins are soft yet present, providing gentle grip without astringency. Mineral and spice notes linger, along with a refreshing acidity that invites another sip. The wine leaves a bright, fresh impression on the palate.","palate":"Fresh and lively on the palate, this Mencía bursts with vibrant red fruit flavors that mirror the nose. Sour cherry, red currant, and pomegranate dominate, delivered with purity and precision. The wine's medium body provides enough substance to carry the fruit without feeling heavy, while bright acidity keeps everything fresh and energetic. Peppery spice notes weave through the mid-palate, adding interest and complexity. A characteristic bitter cherry pit flavor from the wine's fine-grained tannins provides structure and a slightly savory quality. The subtle minerality—described as crushed gravel or granite-like—adds texture and a sense of place, making this distinctly a wine of Bierzo."}

records.name: Ontanon Tempranillo Blanco (White) 2023
records.description: A remarkable expression of Tempranillo Blanco, a rare white mutation of red Tempranillo found exclusively in Rioja. This 2023 vintage showcases the grape's elegant character with exceptional freshness and structure. Awarded 90 points by James Suckling and 91 by Planet Grape, it represents the innovative spirit of Bodegas Ontañón.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting tropical notes of fresh pineapple and ripe banana, complemented by cooking apple aromas. White nectarine and green plum provide a stone fruit dimension, while delicate hints of white blossom and orange blossom add floral elegance. Subtle touches of sea spray and dried pineapple bring complexity, creating a multifaceted aromatic profile that is both vibrant and refined.","finish":"Clean and structured with a medium to full length. The stone fruit flavors persist through a fresh, balanced conclusion marked by crisp acidity and a pleasant phenolic backbone that provides definition and staying power.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with remarkable texture and phenolic structure unusual for white wine. The palate delivers crisp lemon zest and apricot flavors alongside banana chip and ripe stone fruit characters. A creamy touch provides volume in the mouth, balanced by vital acidity that keeps the wine fresh and lifted. The wine shows both elegance and substance, with a slightly tannic quality that adds grip and interest."}

records.name: Domaine du Vieux College Fixin Rouge Les Champs des Charmes 2021
records.description: A distinguished Burgundian Pinot Noir from the Fixin appellation, crafted from vines over 45 years old grown on clay-limestone soils. This 2021 vintage scored 91/100 from critics and represents the quality and terroir expression that Domaine du Vieux Collège consistently delivers from this special lieu-dit.
records.varietal: 100% Pinot Noir from 45+ year old vines
records.region: Fixin AOC, Côte de Nuits, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with a beautiful array of summer flowers and sour cherries, creating an immediately appealing aromatic profile. Dark garnet with purple hues in the glass, the nose reveals sweet plum and red berry notes intertwined with delicate floral characteristics. Black fruit aromas of cherry and cassis emerge, accompanied by subtle herbal spiciness that adds complexity and intrigue.","finish":"Long and supple with a velvety texture. The red berry flavors persist through the conclusion, supported by refined tannins and bright acidity that ensures the wine finishes clean and elegant with excellent length.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with impressive volume and texture. The palate is marked by crushed red berries and sweet plum flavors, structured with fine-grained tannins that provide grip without harshness. Fresh acidity deftly lifts the wine, maintaining balance and energy throughout. Mild herbal spice notes weave through the fruit, while the clay-limestone terroir imparts a mineral quality and well-kept freshness that is characteristic of quality Fixin."}
