records.name: Mate Mania Cabernet Sauvignon IGT Toscana 2022
records.description: Mate Mania's Cabernet Sauvignon represents a modern expression of this international variety in Tuscany's diverse terroir, where the variety thrives in warmer microclimates. This 2022 IGT Toscana offers approachable fruit-forward character with Tuscan personality, showcasing the region's ability to produce vibrant, contemporary wines alongside its traditional Sangiovese-based offerings.
records.region: IGT Toscana (Tuscany), Italy - likely from warmer coastal areas or southern Tuscan zones where Cabernet Sauvignon excels
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry, cassis, and black cherry, accented by characteristic Cabernet notes of green bell pepper and fresh mint that speak to the variety's herbaceous character. Underlying Tuscan influences emerge with scents of dried Mediterranean herbs, sun-warmed earth, and a hint of wild fennel. Subtle oak integration brings whispers of vanilla and mocha, while the youthful 2022 vintage shows vibrant floral notes of violet alongside the concentrated fruit.","finish":"The finish shows good length with persistent dark fruit and a drying tannic grip that calls for food pairing. A pleasant herbal note of dried oregano and bay leaf lingers alongside the fruit, while bright acidity keeps the wine fresh and vibrant despite its full body.","palate":"The palate is full and generous, showcasing the warmth of the 2022 Tuscan vintage with concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, ripe plum, and dark cherry compote. The wine's youth is evident in its fresh acidity and bright fruit character, while medium-plus tannins provide structure with a slightly grippy, textured mouthfeel. Tuscan terroir contributes earthy notes of dried sage, leather, and dusty minerality that complement the primary fruit, while judicious oak aging adds layers of sweet spice, cocoa, and a creamy mid-palate texture."}

records.name: Spicy Wings Tango with Me White NV
records.description: Spicy Wings Tango with Me White is a playful, food-focused non-vintage white blend designed specifically to complement spicy cuisine and casual dining. The whimsical branding suggests an approachable, fun wine that doesn't take itself too seriously while delivering refreshing acidity and aromatic character to pair with bold, spicy flavors.
records.varietal: White blend (likely Riesling, Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Grigio, or similar aromatic varieties blended for balance)
records.region: Likely California or international blend sourced for aromatic character and food versatility
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is immediately engaging with bright aromatics of fresh lime zest, green apple, and white grapefruit, creating an invigorating citrus-forward impression. Tropical hints of pineapple and lychee add exotic appeal, while subtle floral notes of jasmine and orange blossom contribute perfumed elegance. A whisper of fresh-cut grass and wet stone minerality provides an earthy counterpoint to the exuberant fruit, suggesting possible Sauvignon Blanc or Riesling influence in the blend.","finish":"The finish is clean and zippy with lingering citrus notes and bright acidity that leaves the palate refreshed and ready for another bite of spicy food. A subtle hint of sweetness persists alongside the citrus, while the wine's light body ensures it doesn't overwhelm lighter dishes.","palate":"The palate delivers crisp, refreshing flavors with mouthwatering acidity that's perfectly calibrated to cut through spicy foods and refresh the palate. Primary flavors include tart green apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach, with a subtle tropical undertone of passion fruit and guava adding depth. The wine shows light body with a slightly off-dry character (likely 5-10 g/L residual sugar) that provides just enough sweetness to tame heat while maintaining refreshing balance. A mineral salinity runs through the mid-palate, adding texture and interest."}

records.name: Grateful Palate Bless Your Heart NV
records.description: The Grateful Palate's Bless Your Heart represents a southern-spirited wine with charm and character, designed to bring joy and approachability to everyday drinking. The playful name suggests a wine that doesn't take itself too seriously while delivering quality and personality, likely showcasing fruit-forward character and smooth drinkability.
records.varietal: Red blend (possibly including Zinfandel, Merlot, or other fruit-forward varieties blended for accessibility)
records.region: Likely California or multi-regional American blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with welcoming aromas of ripe strawberry, fresh raspberry, and red cherry, creating an immediately approachable and friendly nose. Floral notes of rose petals and honeysuckle add southern charm, while subtle hints of watermelon candy and cotton candy suggest a slightly sweet profile. Underlying nuances of vanilla wafer and a whisper of white pepper add gentle complexity without diminishing the wine's easy-going nature.","finish":"The finish is gentle and fruit-driven with lingering berry flavors and a touch of sweetness that makes the wine comfortable and crowd-pleasing. Soft acidity provides enough lift to keep the wine refreshing, while the absence of harsh tannins or sharp edges ensures a smooth, pleasant conclusion.","palate":"On the palate, the wine delivers soft, fruit-forward flavors with gentle structure designed for broad appeal. Primary flavors include juicy red berries, sweet cherry, and hints of strawberry jam, balanced by modest acidity that keeps the wine from becoming cloying. A subtle sweetness (likely semi-sweet profile with noticeable residual sugar) makes this highly approachable for those new to wine or preferring softer styles. The texture is smooth and rounded with minimal tannins, creating a silky, easy-drinking mouthfeel."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Reserve de Jeanne 2020
records.description: A harmonious blend from the Cabardès appellation where Atlantic and Mediterranean influences converge. This approachable yet structured red showcases the estate's commitment to terroir-driven winemaking with high-density plantings yielding concentrated fruit. Tank-aged to preserve vibrant fruit character while developing complexity.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with restrained elegance, presenting fresh aromatics that convey a sense of vitality and purity. Initial scents of ripe red berries emerge alongside subtle floral undertones of violet and lavender. As the wine breathes, gentle whispers of aniseed and liquorice add complexity, while a delicate herbal note reminiscent of garrigue brings a Mediterranean character to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering notes of dark fruit and a gentle tannic grip. A subtle mineral edge emerges at the close, reflecting the terroir, while soft spice echoes fade gracefully. This is a wine that rewards both immediate enjoyment and short-term cellaring.","palate":"More expressive than the nose suggests, the palate reveals a sunny disposition with flavors of blackberries and plums taking center stage. Pleasant sweetness balances the wine's tannic structure, which remains lively and requires patience to fully integrate. The medium body carries juicy fruit forward with finesse, while subtle spice notes weave through the mid-palate. Fine-grained tannins provide framework without overwhelming the fruit's natural generosity."}

records.name: Les Brebis Eola Hills Pinot Noir 2018
records.description: A bold expression of Oregon Pinot Noir from the esteemed Eola Hills region, where cool-climate conditions create wines of intensity and character. This wine showcases the Willamette Valley's ability to produce Pinot Noir with both power and elegance, aged in a combination of French and American oak barrels.
records.region: Eola Hills AVA, Willamette Valley, Oregon (95% Willamette Valley fruit)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an assertive and spicy character with prominent coffee bean aromatics intertwining with ripe dark fruit. Unlike subtle Burgundian expressions, this Oregon Pinot announces itself boldly with concentrated blackberry and cherry scents. The oak influence is evident but integrated, contributing vanilla and toasted notes. Underlying hints of forest floor, dried herbs, and a whisper of cola spice add layers of complexity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is robust and persistent, with coffee and dark fruit flavors lingering alongside gentle oak-derived sweetness. Soft tannins provide structure without astringency, while balanced acidity keeps the wine from feeling heavy. The close echoes with dark chocolate and dried cherry notes, leaving a satisfying and mouth-coating impression.","palate":"Big-shouldered and expansive on the palate, this is Pinot Noir with presence and structure. A wide seam of roasted coffee runs through the core, anchoring ripe and juicy flavors of blackberry and black cherry. The fruit expression leans toward the dark and concentrated rather than delicate red fruits. American oak contributes sweet vanilla and slight coconut notes, while French oak adds spice and subtle toast. The wine's generous body carries substantial flavor concentration, making this an everyday Pinot with plenty of character to enjoy."}

records.name: Barcelona Lolea White Spritz NV
records.description: A refreshing and artisan white sangria spritz crafted from quality Macabeo and Chardonnay wines blended with natural citrus juices and a hint of vanilla. This light-bodied, slightly sparkling beverage captures the vibrant spirit of Barcelona in a bottle, perfect for warm weather enjoyment and casual gatherings.
records.varietal: Macabeo and Chardonnay blend with natural orange and lemon juice, vanilla extract
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is immediately inviting with bright and charming aromatics of citrus and white flowers dominating the bouquet. Fresh lemon zest and orange blossom create a perfumed quality, while peach and pear notes add fruit character. A subtle herbal background provides depth, with hints of chamomile and lemon verbena adding complexity. The delicate vanilla accent contributes a sweet creaminess to the aromatic profile without overwhelming the fresh fruit and floral elements.","finish":"Light and bubbly, the finish leaves a delicately sweet impression with lingering citrus essence and floral notes. The carbonation lifts the flavors, creating a clean close that invites the next sip. Subtle hints of vanilla and white fruit fade gently, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for more.","palate":"Effervescent and refreshing on the palate, the wine delivers a sparkling experience with fine, gentle bubbles that dance across the tongue. The entry is crisp with vibrant acidity balanced by natural fruit sweetness from the citrus juices. Flavors of white peach, ripe pear, and juicy orange segments combine with the wine's inherent character. The Macabeo and Chardonnay base provides structure and body, while the vanilla adds a soft, rounded quality. The sweetness level is moderate—present but not cloying—with enough acidity to maintain freshness and drinkability."}

records.name: Darms Lane Chardonnay, Oak Knoll District 2023
records.description: A classically styled Napa Valley Chardonnay from the cool-climate Oak Knoll District, where morning fog and afternoon breezes create ideal conditions for balanced, elegant wines. Sourced primarily from the estate Bon Passe Vineyard, this wine exemplifies California Chardonnay at its most expressive, with generous oak treatment balanced by natural acidity.
records.varietal: 100% Chardonnay (primarily from Estate Bon Passe Vineyard)
records.region: Oak Knoll District AVA, Napa Valley, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is immediately captivating and multifaceted, opening with an exotic array of tropical fruits including fresh pineapple, ripe passion fruit, and honeycomb. These vibrant tropical notes are beautifully complemented by orchard fruits—particularly yellow peaches, apricots, and ripe Bartlett pears. The generous oak regime contributes layers of complexity with toasted hazelnut, butterscotch, and vanilla bean aromas. A streak of lemon meringue adds brightness, while subtle hints of crème brûlée and baking spice round out the opulent aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is crisp, clean, and surprisingly refreshing despite the wine's opulent style. Citrus notes persist alongside creamy vanilla and toasted oak flavors, while the wine's natural acidity provides lift and balance. The close is long and satisfying, with gentle fruit sweetness and oak spice fading harmoniously. A subtle mineral edge emerges at the very end, a signature of the Oak Knoll terroir.","palate":"Rich and creamy on entry, the palate delivers the buttery character prized in California Chardonnay while maintaining remarkable balance thanks to the Oak Knoll District's cool climate. Full malolactic fermentation creates a luxurious, velvety texture that coats the palate. Flavors of ripe pear, creamy lemon curd, and fresh pineapple dominate, supported by the wine's medium-plus body. The oak influence is evident but well-integrated, providing structure and vanilla-tinged sweetness without overwhelming the fruit. Bright acidity cuts through the richness, preventing the wine from becoming heavy or cloying, while mineral undertones add complexity and length."}

records.name: Sky Devil Malbec 2019
records.description: A robust Malbec showcasing the variety's characteristic dark fruit intensity and structured tannins. While Sky Devil Wines is primarily known for their California Bordeaux varietals from Knights Valley, Sonoma, and Napa Valley, this expression demonstrates the winery's ability to craft compelling wines with depth and character from Malbec grapes.
records.region: California (specific AVA not disclosed; Sky Devil sources from Knights Valley, Sonoma, and Napa Valley)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry, dark plum, and black cherry, complemented by notes of blueberry compote. Subtle hints of violet and lavender add floral elegance, while undertones of cocoa, espresso, and sweet baking spices—vanilla, cinnamon, and clove—emerge from oak influence. A whisper of leather and tobacco leaf adds complexity.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and subtle smoke. Firm but polished tannins lend grip and structure, suggesting excellent aging potential. The conclusion is both powerful and refined.","palate":"Rich and full-bodied on the palate, this Malbec delivers bold flavors of blackberry jam, dark plum, and cassis. The wine's velvety texture is supported by ripe, well-integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness. Mid-palate notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and toasted oak blend seamlessly with the fruit core. A touch of black pepper and dried herbs adds savory complexity, while the wine's generous alcohol provides warmth and weight."}

records.name: ZaHa El Corte 2019
records.description: An exceptional red blend from the high-altitude Toko Vineyard in Paraje Altamira, Mendoza, crafted by TeHo winery. This wine showcases the elegance and complexity achievable at 1,200 meters elevation, where dramatic temperature variations and calcareous soils create wines of remarkable depth, finesse, and aging potential.
records.region: Paraje Altamira, Valle de Uco, Mendoza, Argentina (Toko Vineyard at 1,200m elevation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is sophisticated and multifaceted, opening with intense floral aromas of orange peel, rose petal, and violet that provide elegance and lift. Dark fruit notes of blackberry and black cherry emerge, complemented by red fruit nuances of cranberry that add brightness. The wine's complexity reveals itself through scents of tar and char from the oak aging, along with subtle eucalyptus that adds a cooling, herbal dimension. Mineral undertones reflect the unique terroir, while hints of graphite and crushed stone add further depth. Spice notes of black pepper, licorice, and sweet baking spice round out the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant, with persistent flavors of dark fruit, spice, and minerality. Subtle hints of mint and eucalyptus emerge at the close, providing a refreshing quality. The tannins remain soft and integrated, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean, refined finish. Notes of dark chocolate and licorice linger, along with the wine's distinctive mineral character.","palate":"Linear in structure yet full in expression, the palate displays remarkable depth and excellent balance that defines this wine's quality. The entry is silky and refined, with a texture that feels luxurious yet never heavy. Flavors of red and dark fruits dominate—black cherries, ripe blackberries, and cranberry—delivered with purity and intensity. Soft, fine-grained tannins provide framework without aggression, integrated seamlessly into the wine's structure. Harmonious acidity balances the fruit richness, ensuring the wine remains fresh and lively despite its concentration. Nuanced flavors of spice, licorice, and dark chocolate emerge in the mid-palate, while creamy notes add richness. The mineral edge persists throughout, adding complexity and a sense of place."}

records.name: Giustini Areale Primitivo di Manduria 2022
records.description: A powerful and generous Primitivo di Manduria from Tenuta Giustini's Areale line. This 2022 vintage reflects a challenging year where careful vineyard management resulted in a small, high-quality crop. Aged in French barrique before light filtration, the wine showcases the rich, warm character that has made Primitivo di Manduria famous.
records.region: Primitivo di Manduria DOP, Puglia, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep, intense aromas of ripe cherry and plum compote dominate the bouquet, creating an immediately appealing fruit-forward impression. Damson plum adds darker fruit tones, while tobacco and sweet spices provide complexity and sophistication. Fine roasted aromas from barrel aging complement the fruit, adding layers of vanilla and toasted oak. The overall aromatic profile is generous and shamelessly powerful, yet maintains elegance and balance.","finish":"Long and warming with persistent cherry and plum fruit. Sweet tannins carry through the conclusion alongside roasted oak notes, creating a satisfying, full-bodied finish that showcases the wine's power while maintaining balance and drinkability.","palate":"Big, firm, and correct in structure with rich cherry and damson fruit at the core. The palate is velvety and dense with lots of ripe fruit presented in a lush, warm package characteristic of Puglian Primitivo. Sweet, spicy tannins provide structure without harshness, while the generous style delivers impressive power and concentration. Plum compote flavors dominate alongside fresh cherry, perfectly rounded off by fine roasted notes from oak influence. The texture is mouth-filling and opulent."}

records.name: Dogwood & Thistle Merlot 2019
records.description: A refined Merlot from the 2019 vintage that showcases the variety's characteristic softness and approachability. This wine balances ripe fruit character with moderate tannins and acidity, displaying the hallmark velvety texture that makes Merlot such a versatile and popular choice.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with inviting aromas of black cherry and plum, core characteristics of quality Merlot. Subtle notes of blackberry and cassis add depth and complexity to the fruit profile. Secondary aromas of cedar and tobacco leaf suggest careful oak aging, while hints of dark chocolate and mocha provide richness. Delicate herbal notes of mint and eucalyptus add freshness and lift to the nose.","finish":"The finish is smooth and persistent with soft tannins that coat the palate. Echoes of dark fruit linger along with subtle oak-derived notes of chocolate and coffee. The wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean conclusion while the plush tannins invite another sip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with the soft, lush tannins that define quality Merlot. The palate reveals flavors of ripe black plum, black cherry, and blackberry, showing excellent fruit concentration from the 2019 vintage. The wine's moderate alcohol and balanced acidity create a harmonious structure that's neither too heavy nor too light. Oak influence is well-integrated, adding complexity through notes of vanilla and spice without dominating the fruit. The velvety texture provides immediate pleasure while maintaining enough structure for short-term aging."}

records.name: Shabo Sparkling Classic Brut NV
records.description: A classic Brut sparkling wine crafted in the traditional method, offering crisp acidity and refined elegance. This non-vintage cuvée showcases the precision and balance that defines quality sparkling wine production, with fewer than 12 grams of residual sugar per liter ensuring a distinctly dry profile.
records.vintage: Non-Vintage (NV) - blend of multiple harvest years for consistency
records.varietal: Traditional blend (likely Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and/or local varieties)
records.region: Ukraine (Shabo is a historic wine region near Odessa)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet reveals fresh aromas of green apple and citrus, hallmarks of quality Brut sparkling wines. Delicate notes of white flowers and brioche emerge, suggesting extended lees aging that adds complexity and depth. Subtle hints of almond and minerality provide additional layers of interest. The fine, persistent mousse releases these aromatics gradually, rewarding patient contemplation.","finish":"The finish is clean, dry, and exceptionally refreshing with persistent fine bubbles. Citrus and apple notes linger along with a subtle mineral quality that cleanses the palate. The wine's bright acidity ensures a crisp conclusion perfect for stimulating the appetite.","palate":"Crisp and refreshing on the palate with vibrant acidity that defines the Brut style. Flavors of lemon, green apple, and pear dominate the mid-palate, showing excellent purity of fruit. The wine's dry character—with fewer than 12 grams of sugar per liter—allows the natural acidity and fruit to shine without sweetness. Fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy texture that balances the wine's crisp structure. Subtle yeast-derived notes of bread and pastry add complexity from secondary fermentation and lees contact."}

records.name: Giustini Illuminato Fiano 2023
records.description: An aromatic and intensely flavored Fiano from Italy's Campania region. This 2023 vintage showcases the variety's hallmark characteristics of honey, spice, and floral notes, delivering the complexity and weight on the palate that makes Fiano one of southern Italy's most distinctive white varieties.
records.region: Campania, Italy (likely Fiano di Avellino DOCG or IGT designation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with intense, aromatic character that defines quality Fiano. Prominent honey notes lead the way, accompanied by delicate white flowers—jasmine and orange blossom—that add elegance and lift. Spice notes of white pepper and subtle nutmeg provide complexity, while hints of hazelnut suggest the wine's potential to develop with age. The aromatics are concentrated yet refined, showing the variety's hallmark intensity without heaviness.","finish":"The finish is long and complex with lingering spice and nut flavors. Honey notes persist along with subtle mineral character. The wine's vibrant acidity ensures a clean conclusion while the intensity of flavor encourages contemplation.","palate":"The palate delivers considerable weight and texture, a defining characteristic of well-made Fiano. Flavors of honey and ripe stone fruit—white peach and apricot—dominate the mid-palate, showing excellent fruit concentration from low-yielding vines. The wine's intense flavor profile is balanced by refreshing acidity that prevents any sense of heaviness. Hazelnut and almond notes add depth and complexity, while subtle mineral undertones speak to the wine's terroir. The texture is rich yet elegant, with a slight oily quality that enhances mouthfeel."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Balcon de Pilatos Maturana 2020
records.description: An exceptional single-varietal expression of Maturana, an almost-extinct grape variety that the Valdemar family rescued and revived beginning in 2001. Awarded 96 points by Wine Enthusiast as a "Hidden Gem" and named Best Spanish Red Wine of 2024 at the International Wine Challenge Industry Awards, this wine demonstrates the tremendous potential of this rare varietal grown at 500 meters elevation on limestone soils.
records.region: Rioja DOCa, Spain (500m elevation limestone estate)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Complex and intense aromatics lead with black currant, pomegranate, and vibrant blackberry. Dried sage and Mediterranean herbs provide savory complexity, while orange zest adds citrus brightness. Slightly brambly dark berry aromas intermingle with sophisticated notes of cocoa, vanilla, and coconut from oak influence. Blueberry and black currant fruit is pure and concentrated, with subtle hints of aniseed adding an intriguing herbal dimension.","finish":"Long and satisfying with plush tannins carrying through dark fruit, chocolate, and herbal notes. The fresh acidity keeps the finish vibrant while the fleshy texture and silky tannins provide a luxurious conclusion with excellent persistence.","palate":"Tremendously fleshy texture defines the palate experience, with fantastically fresh and lively character driven by vital fruit acidity. Slightly brambly dark berry flavors open generously, followed by layers of bittersweet chocolate, cedar, and dried Mediterranean herbs. The wine is smooth and silky with impressive depth, wrapped in a layer of plush, velvety tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Notes of blackcurrant, blueberry, and pomegranate maintain fruit purity throughout, balanced by complex savory and spice elements."}

records.name: Adir Malbec
records.description: An Argentine Malbec showcasing the classic characteristics of this signature grape variety. While specific producer information is limited, this wine expresses the bold fruit character and structured tannins that have made Argentine Malbec internationally renowned, particularly from high-altitude vineyards where the varietal thrives.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated dark fruit aromas of blackberry and black plum, characteristic of quality Argentine Malbec. Ripe black cherry provides additional depth, while subtle notes of violet and dark chocolate add complexity. A touch of vanilla and sweet spice from oak aging integrates seamlessly with the fruit. The overall aromatic profile is bold and inviting with concentrated fruit purity.","finish":"Long and smooth with persistent dark fruit flavors. Velvety tannins carry through alongside chocolate and oak notes, creating a satisfying conclusion with good length and a soft, approachable texture typical of Argentine Malbec.","palate":"Full-bodied with rich, jammy dark fruit flavors dominating the palate. Blackberry, plum, and black cherry create a core of ripe fruit intensity, supported by moderate acidity that maintains freshness. Velvety tannins provide structure without aggressive grip, while notes of cocoa, mocha, and toasted oak add layers of complexity. The wine shows the characteristic smooth, round texture of well-made Malbec with good fruit concentration and balanced oak influence."}

records.name: Wonderment Wines Bacigalupi Petit Sirah 2014
records.description: An exceptional Petite Sirah from the renowned Bacigalupi Vineyard in Russian River Valley. This 2014 vintage was aged in Burgundy oak barrels and praised by Wine Enthusiast for its refinement and balance. Sourced from a sustainably farmed half-acre block of dry-farmed, hand-picked Foppiano clone vines aligned east to west along Westside Road, this wine represents California Petite Sirah at its most elegant.
records.region: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, California (Bacigalupi Vineyard)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals refined aromatics with strawberry preserve at the forefront, an unusually delicate expression for Petite Sirah. Toasty oak integrates seamlessly, contributing notes of leather, cigar box, and cedar that add sophistication and complexity. The aromatic profile is layered and nuanced, showing excellent balance between fruit and oak influence while maintaining elegance rather than overwhelming power.","finish":"Long and complex with strawberry fruit persisting alongside toasty oak, leather, and cedar. The soft, fulsome texture carries through the conclusion, while refined tannins provide structure without heaviness, creating a balanced and sophisticated finish.","palate":"Refined and balanced rather than brutishly extracted, showcasing a more elegant style of Petite Sirah. Strawberry preserve flavors are wrapped in toasty oak, creating a harmonious marriage of fruit and wood. The texture is soft and fulsome, with richly layered mouthfeel that coats the palate. Leather, cigar box, and cedar notes from oak aging add complexity to the core fruit flavors. Despite Petite Sirah's reputation for massive structure, this wine achieves power through concentration and depth rather than aggressive tannins, making it ultimately delicious and approachable."}

records.name: Wooden Gift Box Monte Real Gran Reserva 1998
records.description: An exceptional limited edition Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, presented in a wooden gift box. This 1998 vintage was the first Monte Real made from 100% Tempranillo and remained in barrels for 40 months before release. With multiple 90+ point scores including 94 from Wine Enthusiast (Editors' Choice), 93 from Josh Raynolds, and 93 from Decanter, this wine represents the pinnacle of traditional Rioja craftsmanship. Only 23,000 bottles were produced.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Elegant and mature with classic primary Tempranillo aromas of bright, ripe black cherry complemented by licorice undertones and leathery hints. Floral cherry and raspberry notes emerge alongside aged wood aromas that are beautifully integrated. Pungent and spicy, the nose shows pure redcurrant and plum, succulent herbs, and vanillin oak spice. A hint of dried flowers adds delicacy, while toasty oak and traditional Rioja spice notes complete the complex aromatic tapestry. The overall impression is one of regal maturity and sophisticated evolution.","finish":"Long and refined with dried cherry and plum persisting through a smooth, integrated conclusion. Gentle tannins and balanced acidity carry the wine to a classic Rioja finish marked by vanilla, spice, and leather notes alongside enduring red fruit character.","palate":"In regal condition with smooth, integrated tannins and perfectly balanced acidity that speaks to excellent aging potential realized. Dried cherry and red plum create the fruit core, supported by herbs and vanilla in a classic Rioja flavor profile. Supple and lush with impressive depth, the palate shows sweet red fruit flavors framed by gentle, harmonious tannins. Fleshy and sweet on the mid-palate with impressive concentration and focus, while maintaining elegance throughout. The wine demonstrates how well this vintage has aged, with primary fruit still vibrant but enhanced by tertiary complexity."}

records.name: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Blanc 2023
records.description: A classic expression of Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc from a family domaine managed since 2005 by Thibault Bizet and his mother Maryline. Crafted from vines averaging 25 years old across 7.25 hectares of diverse Sancerre terroirs, this wine embodies the mineral-driven, crystalline purity that defines the region's finest whites.
records.region: Sancerre AOC, Upper Loire Valley, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant aromas of grapefruit and gunflint, accompanied by enticing notes of tropical fruits, candied apricot, and ripe melon. Fresh wild herbs mingle with delicate floral nuances and soft minerality, while a distinctive crushed gravel character adds complexity. Subtle hints of coriander, sage, and palo santo bring an herbaceous dimension to this expressive bouquet.","finish":"The finish is lively and intense, characterized by excellent minerality and good persistence. Aromatic notes resurface with a touch of spice, while the clean salinity and bright acidity leave the palate refreshed and invigorated. The balanced conclusion showcases both elegance and depth.","palate":"On the palate, this medium-bodied wine displays a supple attack with notable body and structure. Waves of citrus, particularly lemon and lime, blend seamlessly with white-fleshed fruits including ripe yellow apple, pear, and melon rind. The wine's high acidity provides a tart, crisp backbone, while crushed gravel and clean salinity emerge mid-palate, reinforcing the terroir's mineral signature. The generous mouthfeel balances freshness with concentration."}

records.name: Scheid Vineyards Rocklin Ranch Chardonnay 2023
records.description: A Monterey County Chardonnay from Scheid Family Wines' Rocklin Ranch, balancing cool-climate elegance with judicious oak influence. The wine receives partial barrel fermentation and malolactic fermentation, creating a style that bridges Old World restraint with New World fruit expression.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright yellow apple and crisp pear aromas, complemented by citrus notes of lemon zest and subtle grapefruit. Partial barrel fermentation contributes gentle hints of vanilla and salted butter, while subtle caramel undertones add richness without heaviness. The oak influence is measured and integrated, allowing the fresh fruit character to remain front and center. Subtle floral notes and a hint of toasted almond add aromatic complexity.","finish":"Long and complex with persistent citrus and stone fruit flavors, finishing with vanilla notes and refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a vibrant acid structure that provides lift and energy, the palate showcases ripe orchard fruits—think baked apple, Asian pear, and white peach—balanced by bright citrus flavors. The malolactic fermentation adds creamy texture and subtle buttery notes without creating excessive richness, while smooth oak integration contributes vanilla, light toast, and gentle spice. The cool-temperature fermentation preserves freshness and natural acidity, creating a wine that feels balanced between fruit purity and subtle complexity. Minerality emerges mid-palate, adding dimension."}

records.name: Bitch Bubbly (187ml) NV  187 ml
records.description: A playful sparkling rosé from Spain created by renowned winemaker Chris Ringland, who personally selects unoaked Chardonnay and Grenache from high-altitude, cool-climate vineyard sites. Grown on alluvial red-brown loams and white limestone mixed with rocky slate, this fun, party-ready bubbly delivers sweet fruit character and lively effervescence in a convenient mini-bottle format.
records.varietal: Blend of unoaked Chardonnay and Grenache
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an inviting bouquet of sweet red berries and strawberry mousse, accented by vibrant strawberry and citrus notes. Dark cherry and raspberry aromas add depth and complexity, while small, persistent bubbles release waves of fresh fruit character. The overall aromatic profile is bright, fruity, and immediately appealing.","finish":"The finish is light, delicate, and medium in length, with persistent sweet raspberry flavors. Tart raspberry and black cherry notes transition to a unique grapefruit-with-sugar character that balances the wine's inherent sweetness with refreshing acidity. The conclusion is playful and satisfying.","palate":"Sweet and exuberantly fruity on the palate, this sparkling rosé bursts with flavors of raspberries, sweet strawberries, and strawberry jam. Citrus notes of lemon and tart apple provide refreshing counterpoints to the red fruit core, while undertones of dark cherries and currants add dimension. A juicy yet balanced core reveals subtle spicy pepper and anise nuances that elevate the wine beyond simple sweetness."}

records.name: Zephaniah Cabernet Franc 2017
records.description: A bold, full-bodied Cabernet Franc from the oldest vines at Zephaniah Farm Vineyard, a third-generation working farm in Loudoun County, Virginia. This wine represents the estate's commitment to crafting wines with skill and passion, earning recognition including silver medals at the 2014 and 2015 Governor's Cup competitions.
records.varietal: Predominantly Cabernet Franc; some vintages include a small percentage of Petit Manseng for aromatic lift
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is both powerful and elegant, opening with aromas of ripe blackberry and dark cherry, accented by notes of cassis and black plum. Layers of dried herbs—thyme, oregano, and bay leaf—mingle with subtle hints of green bell pepper, a hallmark of the variety. Undertones of cedar, tobacco leaf, and graphite add complexity, while a delicate floral note of violet provides lift.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to earthy notes of graphite, dried herbs, and subtle leather. The wine's balanced structure and lively acidity ensure a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites the next sip.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a supple texture, the palate showcases vibrant flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and soft red fruit. The wine's structure is defined by fine-grained tannins that provide grip without astringency. Mid-palate notes of dried herbs and just a dusting of spice—black pepper and clove—add savory complexity. A refreshing edge of crisp acidity balances the ripe fruit, while subtle oak influence contributes nuances of vanilla and toasted wood."}

records.name: Scarpetta Pinot Grigio DOC Friuli (NOVA only) 2023
records.description: A distinctive Pinot Grigio from Friuli-Venezia Giulia that transcends the variety's reputation for simplicity. Sourced from two distinct terroirs—the Grave and Colli Orientali zones—this wine showcases Pinot Grigio's ability to deliver both elegance and complexity. The combination of soil types yields a wine with body, bright acidity, and exceptional minerality.
records.region: DOC Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy (blend of Grave and Colli Orientali zones)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with enticing aromas of ripe white peach, lychee, and ripe melon, complemented by notes of crisp apple and ripe pear. Citrus accents of lemon and lime zest add brightness, while delicate floral notes—white flowers and acacia—provide lift. A distinctive mineral character of wet stones and crushed gravel emerges, along with subtle hints of guava, coriander, sage, and palo santo that add herbal complexity. A faint salmon-pink hue in the glass hints at the wine's textural depth.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus, stone fruit, and minerals. The wine's bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next bite or sip.","palate":"Light on its feet yet surprisingly complex, the palate reveals flavors of stone fruits—white peach and apricot—and melon, balanced by crisp apple and citrus notes. The wine's medium body is supported by bright, refreshing acidity that provides structure and vibrancy. Mid-palate minerality—crushed gravel and saline notes—adds textural interest and reinforces the wine's terroir-driven character. The overall impression is one of elegance and precision, with each element in perfect harmony."}

records.name: Thelema Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
records.description: An elegant, complex Cabernet Sauvignon from one of Stellenbosch's leading producers. This wine showcases Thelema Mountain Vineyards' commitment to crafting world-class wines with meticulous attention to detail. The 2015 vintage earned a critics' score average of 91/100, with professional reviewers praising its balance of power and refinement.
records.region: Stellenbosch, Coastal Region, Western Cape, South Africa
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is complex and inviting, revealing aromas of crème de cassis, dark blackcurrant, and ripe black plum, complemented by notes of red currant and dark cherry. Distinctive green leaf and bell pepper aromas add classic Cabernet character, while subtle hints of cigar wrapper spice, cedar, and tobacco leaf emerge. Undertones of graphite, dark chocolate, and espresso reflect the wine's 18 months in barrel, 45% of which was new French oak.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and cedar. Fine tannins lend grip and structure, suggesting excellent aging potential. The conclusion is both powerful and refined, leaving a lasting impression.","palate":"Plush yet wonderfully elegant on the palate, this wine delivers concentrated flavors of cassis, blackcurrant, and dark plum, balanced by vibrant red currant and cherry notes. The wine's full body is supported by fine, silky tannins that provide structure without harshness, creating a very fresh and elegant style of Cabernet. Mid-palate notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and subtle oak spice add depth, while a touch of green bell pepper and dried herbs adds savory complexity. The wine's excellent balance ensures that power and finesse coexist harmoniously."}

records.name: Fledge and Co Hoeksteen 2016
records.description: A svelte and contemplative Chenin Blanc from old bush vines rooted in decomposed granitic soils of the Bottelary Hills, Stellenbosch. The dry land vines, planted in the early 1980s with epic vistas of Table Mountain, weathered the tempestuous 2016 vintage to produce small clusters of intensely concentrated fruit. Barrel fermented and matured in old French oak, this wine is intentionally Loire-like in style and benefits greatly from bottle maturation.
records.varietal: 100% Chenin Blanc (old bush vines from the early 1980s)
records.region: Stellenbosch, Western Cape, South Africa (Bottelary Hills, decomposed granitic soils)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is delicate and nuanced, opening with a combination of citrus blossom and yellow fruits—golden apple and ripe pear. Green apple and red pear notes add freshness, while subtle hints of toasted almond and gentle ginger provide complexity. Distinctive aromas of honey, rooibos tea, and a tell-tale chalky minerality emerge, adding layers of interest to this contemplative, shy expression of Chenin Blanc.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven, characterized by a tell-tale chalky texture and bright acidity. Lingering flavors of citrus blossom, yellow fruits, and toasted almond persist, while the wine's Loire-like structure ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion.","palate":"Svelte and medium-bodied with a lovely pithy texture, the palate reveals flavors of green apple, golden apple, and yellow fruits, balanced by bright acidity. Subtle notes of toasted almond, honey, and rooibos tea add richness without heaviness, while a distinctive chalky, mineral texture reinforces the wine's terroir-driven character. The wine's old-vine concentration and barrel fermentation contribute to its complex, layered profile, while restraint and elegance define the overall impression."}

records.name: Remhoogte First Light Chenin Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant expression of South African Chenin Blanc from the Stellenbosch region, Remhoogte's First Light showcases the variety's versatility and food-friendly nature. This wine captures the essence of cool-climate viticulture with its crisp acidity, pure fruit expression, and mineral complexity that Stellenbosch is renowned for.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with fresh aromas of green apple, pear, and white peach, complemented by bright citrus notes of lime and grapefruit. Delicate floral hints of honeysuckle and acacia blossom add elegance, while subtle undertones of wet stone and chalk speak to the wine's terroir. A suggestion of ripe quince and honey emerges with air, adding a touch of richness without sacrificing the wine's essential freshness.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and precise, with lingering citrus zest and mineral notes. A subtle hint of almond and white flowers persists, while the wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed and eager for food or another sip.","palate":"On the palate, this Chenin Blanc is medium-bodied with electric acidity that brings the wine to life. Flavors of crisp green apple and Asian pear dominate the initial attack, followed by juicy white peach and hints of tropical guava. A distinctive mineral seam runs through the core, providing structure and length. The wine's texture is both creamy and refreshing, with a subtle waxy quality characteristic of well-made Chenin. Notes of fresh herbs and a touch of beeswax add complexity without detracting from the wine's purity."}

records.name: Jeremy Nickel Cellars Chardonnay 2019
records.description: A distinctive California Chardonnay from Jeremy Nickel Cellars, this wine reflects the winemaker's commitment to crafting balanced, terroir-driven wines with restraint and precision. The 2019 vintage showcases the beautiful interplay between ripe fruit, judicious oak influence, and refreshing acidity that defines high-quality California Chardonnay.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents a harmonious blend of ripe yellow apple, white peach, and hints of pineapple, complemented by subtle notes of lemon curd and melon. Oak influence is evident but well-integrated, contributing aromas of vanilla bean, toasted hazelnut, and a whisper of crème brûlée. Floral hints of orange blossom add lift, while a touch of minerality and wet stone provides complexity and depth to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of baked apple, vanilla, and subtle spice. A hint of caramel and toasted oak persists alongside refreshing citrus notes, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean, appetizing conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a silky, rounded texture, this Chardonnay delivers layers of flavor that unfold gradually. The palate showcases ripe orchard fruits including baked apple and pear, alongside tropical notes of ripe pineapple and mango. Well-judged oak aging adds complexity through flavors of butterscotch, toasted oak, and spiced nuts, while maintaining balance with the fruit. The wine's creamy mouthfeel is complemented by bright acidity that provides freshness and structure, preventing any sense of heaviness despite the wine's richness."}

records.name: Castoro Cellars Chardonnay Keg 2024  20 l
records.description: An innovative approach to wine packaging from Paso Robles' Castoro Cellars, this 20-liter keg format delivers fresh, fruit-forward Chardonnay perfect for events and gatherings. The keg preserves freshness while eliminating oxygen exposure, keeping the wine in optimal condition from first pour to last, making it ideal for restaurants and large-format service.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bright and inviting, bursting with fresh aromas of crisp green apple, ripe pear, and citrus. Notes of white flowers and a hint of melon add aromatic interest, while subtle touches of vanilla and cream suggest gentle oak contact or lees aging. The overall impression is one of freshness and approachability, with clean fruit aromatics taking center stage.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering fruit flavors and refreshing acidity. A hint of citrus zest and apple skin provides a crisp conclusion that invites another sip, making this wine perfect for casual enjoyment and food pairing.","palate":"Light to medium-bodied with a refreshing character, this Chardonnay emphasizes fruit purity and easy drinkability. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and citrus dominate, supported by a creamy texture that adds appeal without weighing down the palate. Bright acidity keeps the wine lively and food-friendly, while subtle notes of vanilla and butter add a touch of richness. The wine's straightforward, fruit-focused profile makes it extremely versatile and accessible."}

records.name: Cienega Valley Cienega Valley Chardonnay 2023
records.description: A distinctive expression from California's historic Cienega Valley, one of the state's cooler viticultural regions located in San Benito County. This Chardonnay benefits from the area's limestone soils and significant diurnal temperature variation, resulting in wines with natural acidity, elegance, and mineral complexity that sets them apart from warmer-climate California Chardonnays.
records.region: Cienega Valley, San Benito County, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals layered aromas of ripe yellow apple, Asian pear, and white nectarine, accented by bright citrus notes of lemon zest and hints of grapefruit. Floral undertones of jasmine and orange blossom add elegance, while subtle mineral notes reminiscent of flint and wet stone speak to the region's unique limestone terroir. A delicate touch of oak contributes hints of vanilla and toasted almond without dominating the fresh fruit character.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven, with lingering notes of citrus, apple, and subtle spice. A distinctive chalky quality persists alongside refreshing acidity, creating a memorable conclusion that showcases the unique terroir of Cienega Valley.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent structure, this Chardonnay showcases the balance between ripe fruit and refreshing acidity that defines quality cool-climate viticulture. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and stone fruit are complemented by citrus notes and a pronounced mineral backbone that provides focus and length. The wine's texture is simultaneously creamy and vibrant, with integrated oak adding subtle richness through notes of vanilla and hazelnut. The natural acidity is bright and persistent, lending energy and ensuring the wine remains lively despite its richness."}

records.name: Attwoods Vin de Folie Rouge 2024
records.description: A distinctive Australian red blend from cool-climate Victoria, combining 50% Cabernet Franc with 50% Aglianico in a minimal intervention style. This boutique producer operates across Ballarat, Macedon Ranges, and Geelong, crafting wines that express the elegant tension of cool-climate viticulture with Mediterranean varietals.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with bright red berry aromatics—raspberry, wild strawberry, and red currant—layered with subtle green peppercorn and fresh-cut herbs characteristic of Cabernet Franc. The Aglianico contribution adds darker notes of black plum and violet, while 10 months in old French barriques contribute gentle baking spice and cedar undertones without overwhelming the vibrant fruit character.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with persistent berry flavors and a hint of white pepper spice. The tannins are fine-grained and gentle, making this approachable now while suggesting 3-5 years of graceful evolution ahead.","palate":"Medium-bodied with an engaging textural smoothness, the wine showcases crunchy berry flavors—think fresh cranberry and pomegranate—balanced by the Aglianico's darker fruit presence. The cool-climate origins shine through in the wine's natural acidity and lifted red fruit profile, while subtle herbal notes of oregano and dried thyme add savory complexity. The minimal intervention approach preserves freshness and terroir expression, creating a wine that feels alive and energetic on the palate."}

records.name: Adir Plato Cabernet Sauvignon (MD & DC)
records.description: A distinguished kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Israel's Upper Galilee, specifically from the acclaimed Kerem Ben Zimra Vineyards. This wine showcases the potential of Israeli viticulture at high elevation, combining Old World structure with New World fruit intensity in a wine of fascinating personality and elegant complexity.
records.region: Kerem Ben Zimra, Upper Galilee, Israel
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays red-purple to dark blue visual shades, introducing a rich and complex bouquet. Red and black fruits dominate—think ripe raspberry, black plum, and dark cherry—with intriguing slightly sour notes that add freshness and tension. Mineral undertones speak to the terroir, while new oak contributes mocha, roasted coffee bean, and sweet baking spice. The aromatic profile suggests both power and refinement, with multiple layers that unfold gradually in the glass.","finish":"The concentration of fruit combined with sharp tannins and alcohol creates a powerful, long finish that promises rewards for patient collectors. Mineral and coffee notes persist, with the tannins gradually softening to reveal the wine's inherent elegance.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied at 14.5% alcohol, the palate delivers concentrated fruit expression balanced by firm tannins from both grape and oak. The combination of red raspberry brightness and black plum depth creates complexity, while the sharp, structured tannins provide ageworthy backbone. Coffee and mocha notes from oak aging add savory depth without overwhelming the fruit core. The wine shows outstanding and distinguished personality, with more harmony and elegance than earlier vintages, suggesting the producer's evolving mastery of this site."}

records.name: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 20 Year Port
records.description: An exquisite 20-year aged tawny Port from the renowned Quinta do Mourão estate, positioned on the banks of the Douro opposite Régua. This wine showcases the estate's mastery of aged tawny production, receiving 92 points from Wine Advocate for its exceptional complexity and elegance that surpasses many tawnies in its category.
records.vintage: NV (blend of multiple vintages with an average age of 20 years)
records.varietal: Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca, and Tinto Cão
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals intense aromas of dried fruits—figs, apricots, and raisins—layered with butterscotch, bourbon vanilla, and Kraft caramels. Honeyed notes intertwine with orange peel and Christmas spices, creating a seductive aromatic tapestry. The wine displays medium dark amber-brown hues with luminous orange-red highlights, signaling its maturity and refinement.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant, showcasing the wine's complexity with lingering notes of dried fruits, spice, and subtle oak. It seems remarkably full of life for its age, leaving an impression of maturity balanced with vibrant energy that speaks to the quality of the base wines and careful blending.","palate":"Full-bodied and harmonious, the palate offers a rich, elegant mid-palate with intensity of fruit that distinguishes it from younger tawnies. Flavors of dried apricots hover between fresh and dried fruit character, accented by nuts, toffee, and subtle spices. The wine takes the spice and sugar foundation and adds layers of caramel with a touch of brandy warmth, delivering more complexity and serious character than typical 20-year tawnies. Fine balance between sweetness and structure creates exceptional drinking pleasure."}

records.name: Two Mountain Show Pony (WINE CLUB ONLY)
records.description: A specialty red blend exclusively available through Two Mountain Winery's tasting room and wine club, crafted from estate-grown grapes in Washington's Rattlesnake Hills AVA. Produced by brothers Matthew and Patrick Rawn at Washington's first certified-sustainable vineyards, this wine has become a favorite among friends, family, and equestrian enthusiasts.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Merlot blend
records.region: Rattlesnake Hills AVA, Yakima Valley, Washington State
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with rich aromas of perfectly baked cherry pie, exuding warmth and ripeness. A distinctive dash of coriander adds an intriguing spice note, while dried eucalyptus brings aromatic complexity and herbal lift. The interplay of ripe fruit and savory botanicals creates an inviting, multi-layered aromatic profile that reflects the Yakima Valley's unique terroir.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long, with lingering notes of cherry, subtle spice, and a whisper of eucalyptus. Soft tannins provide texture without astringency, making this an exceptionally easy-drinking wine that invites another sip.","palate":"This red blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Merlot delivers a harmonious palate showcasing the best of each variety. Ripe red cherry and dark berry flavors form the core, supported by subtle oak influence and well-integrated tannins. The wine displays medium to full body with balanced acidity, offering both structure and approachability. Hints of dried herbs and spice echo the nose, adding savory complexity to the fruit-forward profile."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Langhe Dolcetto 2018
records.description: A textbook expression of Dolcetto from one of Piedmont's respected producers, the Mauro Molino Langhe Dolcetto 2018 showcases the approachable, food-friendly character that has made this variety beloved in Italy's northwest. With a Community Score of 90.3 on CellarTracker, this wine exemplifies exceptional value in Piedmontese red wine.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a gracious bouquet of violet and red fruit—particularly fresh cherries—accompanied by delicate floral notes and subtle almond hints. The aromatic profile is bright and inviting, characteristic of well-made Dolcetto, with a touch of spice and mineral undertones. The wine's pale to medium ruby color signals its elegant, lifted style rather than heavy extraction.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately long, leaving impressions of fresh cherry, subtle almond, and a whisper of violet. The wine's gracious nature shines through to the end, making it a genuine pleasure to drink with its combination of brightness and gentle texture.","palate":"Medium-bodied and refreshing, the palate delivers juicy dark cherries and red berry flavors with wonderful purity of fruit. Soft, elegant tannins provide gentle structure without any harshness, while medium-minus acidity keeps the wine lively and balanced. There's a pleasant simplicity to the taste that doesn't lack for charm—this is Dolcetto showing its food-friendly, everyday drinking appeal. Floral nuances persist through the mid-palate, adding refinement to the straightforward fruit expression."}

records.name: Toro Fighting Bulls 2018
records.description: The Abelis Carthago Fighting Bulls 2018 hails from ungrafted Tempranillo vines dating back 120 years in Spain's Toro region. This family-run estate produces wines of unparalleled power and complexity, drawing comparisons to Napa Cabernets at twice the price and setting the bar for outstanding craftsmanship in Toro.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo (Tinta de Toro clone from 120-year-old ungrafted vines)
records.region: Toro DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents with the deep color of blueberry pie, introducing an intense aromatic profile. The bouquet reveals concentrated black currant and cassis, layered with violet florals and warming clove spice. These ancient, ungrafted vines produce Tempranillo with exceptional aromatic intensity and purity, capturing the essence of Toro's powerful terroir and continental climate.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, dropping into notes of dark chocolate and espresso bean as the tannins gently recede. The espresso and chocolate elements provide a sophisticated conclusion that speaks to quality oak aging and the wine's overall maturity, leaving a lasting impression of power tempered by refinement.","palate":"Full-bodied and structured, the palate showcases flavors of black plum, cassis, and anisette, accented by rich dark chocolate. The wine delivers substantial tannic grip initially, characteristic of Toro's bold style, but the tannins are well-integrated and steadily soften as the wine opens. The power of 120-year-old vines shines through in the depth and concentration of dark fruit, supported by careful winemaking that preserves complexity while taming the region's naturally robust character."}

records.name: Nikolaou Ktima Nemea 2019
records.description: Produced by Domaine Nikolaou, one of Greece's pioneering organic wineries since 1984, this Nemea PDO wine represents the best of the Agiorgitiko variety from the renowned Peloponnese wine region. The estate's commitment to organic viticulture and traditional winemaking creates wines of authenticity and terroir expression.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright and fresh bramble fruits and bilberry, showcasing the pure fruit character that organic viticulture can achieve. Layers of ripe red and dark fruits emerge—red cherries, blackberries, and plums—accented by subtle Mediterranean herbs and a whisper of spice. The aromatic profile is inviting and clean, reflecting the wine's organic pedigree and careful winemaking.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with lingering notes of dark fruit, vanilla, and warm spice. The wine's organic character shines through with pure, unadulterated fruit flavors and a mineral backbone that speaks to Nemea's limestone-rich soils.","palate":"The palate starts with a light, fresh attack that gives way to a more substantial mid-palate rich with ripe black cherry and sloe berry. Firm yet well-rounded tannins provide structure without harshness, while balanced acidity keeps the wine lively. There's notable depth of fruit at the back of the palate, with additional sweetness of ripe fruit balanced by savory elements. The thick yet smooth texture shows vanilla and wood spice from 14 months in French oak barrels, integrated beautifully with cinnamon and baking spices."}

records.name: La Sala Red Sangria
records.description: A modern, fresh interpretation of traditional Spanish sangria from Bodega La Salá, crafted with carefully selected PDO red wine and natural Mediterranean aromatics. This ready-to-drink sangria emphasizes quality wine as its foundation rather than masking inferior base with sweetness, creating a sophisticated yet approachable expression of Spain's beloved beverage.
records.varietal: Blend based on PDO Spanish red wine with natural citrus and fruit aromatics
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant aromas of ripe red fruits—strawberries and raspberries—alongside blackcurrant cassis. Natural aromatics of blood orange and lemon peel provide bright citrus lift, while subtle hints of cinnamon add warming spice. The bouquet is fresh and inviting, suggesting the quality red wine base and thoughtful addition of complementary flavors rather than artificial sweetness.","finish":"The finish is long and gentle, leaving a pleasant aftertaste of red fruits, citrus, and subtle spice. Very low tannin and balanced sweetness make this exceptionally refreshing and versatile for warm weather enjoyment or casual entertaining.","palate":"Full-bodied yet refreshing, the palate delivers concentrated red fruit flavors balanced by hints of orange, lime, and cinnamon. The wine maintains controlled acidity that keeps it lively rather than cloying, with very low tannin contributing to its smooth, easy-drinking character. The natural aromatics of lemon, blood orange, and cassis integrate seamlessly with the red wine foundation, creating harmonious complexity without overwhelming sweetness or artificial notes."}

records.name: Vermouth Giardino Mediterranean Dry NV
records.description: Villa Massa's Vermouth Giardino Mediterranean Dry captures the essence of Italy's Amalfi Coast, crafted with the finest ingredients from Sorrento. Developed in collaboration with renowned US mixologists Chris Patino and Stacey Swenson, this vermouth was 'made for bartenders, by bartenders' to deliver bold citrus notes and refined complexity for cocktails.
records.varietal: Fortified wine base with Mediterranean botanicals including lemon thyme, citrus peels, wormwood, and proprietary herb blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents an elegant, refined bouquet led by lemon thyme and Mediterranean botanicals. Bright citrus notes—particularly lemon and bergamot—mingle with aromatic herbs including thyme, rosemary, and subtle sage. The profile is airy and bright, evoking the sun-drenched coastal gardens of Sorrento, yet reveals underlying depth that promises complexity on the palate.","finish":"The finish is dry, delicate, and remarkably refined with good length. Lemon peel, thyme, and a whisper of pleasant bitterness linger, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip. The balanced, slightly bitter conclusion makes this ideal for mixing in classic cocktails where it can shine without being overwhelmed.","palate":"The palate offers a smooth, dry texture where the complexity of carefully selected botanicals harmonizes beautifully. Powerful spices emerge—including cardamom, coriander, and bitter orange peel—creating intricate layers against the citrus-forward profile. Notes of flowers and herbs weave through the mid-palate, with a subtle bitterness from wormwood and gentian root providing structure and balance. The vermouth shows tight structure and sophisticated integration of all components."}

records.name: Ontanon Natura 2020
records.description: Bodegas Ontañón's Natura 2020 represents a remarkable achievement in natural winemaking—a Rioja Crianza aged 15 months in American oak with no added sulfites. This wine maintains all the quality and character of traditional Ontañón Rioja while showcasing an extra purity from avoiding sulfite additions, a rarity for oak-aged wines due to oxidative risks.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo from estate vineyards Los Palos de Tanis, La Pasada, and Viña María in Sierra de Yerga (680-800m altitude)
records.region: Rioja Oriental (formerly Rioja Baja), DOCa Rioja, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals intense aromas of bramble fruits—blackberries and wild raspberries—alongside fig and dark plum. Herbal notes of Mediterranean scrub mingle with spicy undertones of black pepper and cinnamon. Coffee and balsamic nuances add depth, while the wine's purity from no-added-sulfite production creates an extra clarity to the fruit aromatics. The profile is complex yet remarkably fresh for an oak-aged Rioja.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long and fresh, defying expectations for a no-added-sulfite wine. Lingering notes of dark fruit, minerals, and subtle oak spice persist, while the bright acidity provides lift and prevents any oxidative flatness. The purity and vibrancy continue to the very end, showcasing Ontañón's technical mastery.","palate":"The palate shows beautiful complexity with notes of ripe blueberry and blackcurrant balanced by savory, meaty characters that add dimension. Supple tannins from American oak aging provide structure without heaviness, while an appealing mineral character grounds the wine. Bright acidity—unusual in sulfite-free wines—leads the palate, maintaining freshness and vibrancy. The texture is smooth and integrated, with oak influence adding vanilla and spice without overwhelming the pure fruit expression."}

records.name: Black Elephant Vintners Three Men in a Tub with a Rubber Duck Blend 2024
records.description: A playful yet serious red blend from South Africa's self-proclaimed 'Rebels of the Vine,' Black Elephant Vintners. Crafted by winemaker Kevin Swart, viticulturist Raymond Ndlovu, and Jacques Wentzel from coastal region vineyards, this wine pushes boundaries of traditional winemaking while delivering exceptional quality and value.
records.varietal: 2024 vintage blend (composition varies by year; 2020 was 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot, 14% Shiraz; earlier vintages included Mourvèdre)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Rich and peppery on the nose, the wine opens with concentrated aromas of dark cherries and ripe plums. Sweet spice notes of black pepper and liquorice add complexity, while the bouquet shows a fruit-driven intensity that's inviting and generous. Subtle hints from extended oak aging provide depth without dominating the expressive fruit character.","finish":"The finish is long with a distinctive spicy note, showing lingering flavors of dark fruit, pepper, and liquorice. Well-integrated tannins provide grip and length without astringency, while the oak influence adds subtle vanilla and toast notes to the conclusion.","palate":"The palate is beautifully balanced, delivering sweet cherry and plum fruit accented by distinctive pepper and liquorice flavors. Extended oak aging—19 months in French barrels for the 2020 vintage—adds structure and has softened the tannins to a supple, velvety texture. The wine shows the power expected from Cabernet Sauvignon blended with the roundness of Merlot and the spicy complexity of Shiraz or Mourvèdre (depending on vintage). Fruit-forward yet structured, it offers both immediate pleasure and underlying complexity."}

records.name: Abadia de Acon Roble 2022
records.description: A modern expression of Ribera del Duero Tempranillo that balances power with accessibility. Aged five months in new Bordeaux oak, this wine earned 4.5 stars from Platter's Guide for its impressive integration of fruit, oak, and structure at an exceptional price point.
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intense and elegant, displaying attractive notes of ripe red and black berries - cherry, blackberry, and cassis - lifted by chocolate and liquorice accents. The oak treatment is evident but well-integrated, contributing spicy background notes with hints of toffee, coffee, and vanilla. The aromatic profile is fresh despite the wine's depth, with ripe fruit taking center stage while wood components provide supporting complexity.","finish":"The finish is enveloping, persistent, and long, with lingering dark fruit, chocolate, and sweet spice. Hints of liquorice and cocoa extend the conclusion, while integrated tannins provide structure. The wine leaves a lasting impression of both power and elegance.","palate":"Powerful and lively on the palate, this wine delivers impressive concentration without heaviness. Good cherry fruit dominates, enriched by layers of chocolate, liquorice, and cocoa that add sweetness and texture. The five months in new Bordeaux oak has left its mark with toasty, spicy notes and hints of coffee and vanilla, but the fruit intensity keeps everything in balance. The wine is juicy and accessible, with the oak well-integrated rather than dominating. The tannic structure is present but refined, providing grip without astringency."}

records.name: Raywood Rose 2023
records.description: A highly regarded rosé from California's Central Coast that earned 90 points from Wine Enthusiast, placing it in their 'Excellent - Highly recommended' category. This wine showcases the bright, fresh character of Central Coast fruit with a vibrant acidity that makes it exceptionally food-friendly.
records.varietal: Blend of red varieties (specific composition not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents a lighter hue in the glass, opening with aromas of dusty minerals and tart red fruit that provide an earthy, savory complexity. Notes of fresh cherry and pomegranate emerge, complemented by distinctive anise and herb characteristics that add aromatic intrigue and Mediterranean flair.","finish":"The finish is crisp and refreshing with lingering cherry and pomegranate notes. The wine's vibrant acidity carries through to the end, leaving a clean, mouth-watering impression with herbal nuances.","palate":"The palate features a fun, energetic level of acidity that pops with bright flavors of cherry, pomegranate, and red berry fruit. Herb flavors including thyme and dried herbs add savory complexity, while the wine's refreshing acidity creates a lively, vibrant mouthfeel. The tart red fruit character is balanced by subtle mineral notes that add depth."}

records.name: DR Colheita Tinto 2017
records.description: A traditional Douro red from Portugal's premier wine region, showcasing the region's indigenous grape varieties and characteristic mineral-driven structure. This wine demonstrates the serious dry core and ageability that distinguish quality Douro reds from more fruit-forward New World styles.
records.varietal: Traditional Douro blend (likely Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents restrained yet compelling aromatics of dark berries and fresh fruit basket notes - blackberry, cassis, and ripe plum dominate. As the wine opens, additional complexity emerges with hints of dried herbs, tobacco, and subtle earthy minerality that speaks to the Douro's schist soils. The aromatic profile shows maturity and development from the 2017 vintage, with tertiary notes of leather and dried flowers beginning to appear alongside the primary fruit.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent tannins, dark fruit, and mineral notes. The dry, structured conclusion demonstrates classic Douro character - this is a wine built for food and aging rather than solo sipping. Fine, lingering tannins and fresh acidity leave the palate cleansed and ready for food.","palate":"The palate reveals the wine's true character with impressive tannic grip and structural density. A seriously dry core provides the backbone, balanced by generous black fruits that are developing beautifully - blackberry, cassis, and dark plum show ripeness without overextraction. The minerality from the region's characteristic schist soils comes through clearly, adding a stony, almost chalky quality that enhances complexity. Medium to full weight on the palate, the wine surprises with its tannic presence and slight bite from balanced alcohol and fresh acids. Tart red fruit and dark plums round out the flavor profile, while the wine's structure suggests continued evolution with age. The tannins are firm and present, characteristic of traditional Douro reds built for the table and cellar."}

records.name: Endhardt Vineyards Lower Block Sauvignon Blanc 2022
records.description: From Virginia's acclaimed Endhardt Vineyards, this Lower Block Sauvignon Blanc showcases the unique terroir of its cooler, shaded vineyard site at lower elevation. Produced entirely in stainless steel, the wine expresses the vibrancy and minerality that comes from grapes facing colder temperatures and less sun exposure compared to its Upper Block counterpart.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents brilliant expressions of fresh citrus with pronounced lemongrass and lime zest. Bright green herbal notes emerge, reminiscent of freshly cut grass and green bell pepper, complemented by delicate white flower aromatics. The cooler growing conditions impart a distinctive mineral quality, with hints of wet stone and chalky undertones that add complexity to the crisp aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is crisp and elongated, with lingering notes of citrus peel and fresh herbs. A persistent mineral quality carries through to the end, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip. The wine's natural high acidity provides excellent structure and ensures a clean, mouth-watering conclusion.","palate":"On the palate, this wine delivers exceptional brightness and precision, showcasing the elevated acidity characteristic of the Lower Block's cooler terroir. Vibrant lemon and grapefruit flavors dominate, layered with subtle notes of green apple and gooseberry. The mouthfeel is refreshing and clean, with a steely minerality that runs through the mid-palate. The stainless steel fermentation preserves the wine's natural vivacity, creating a pure, unadorned expression of Virginia Sauvignon Blanc."}

records.name: Rueda Isabelino Blanco 2022
records.description: Produced by Bodega Reina de Castilla in Spain's renowned Rueda region, Isabelino Blanco showcases the versatility and aromatic intensity of Verdejo, Spain's signature white grape. This wine represents modern Rueda winemaking, emphasizing fresh fruit expression and vibrant acidity while honoring the region's centuries-old tradition of producing distinctive white wines.
records.varietal: Verdejo with Viura (blend percentage varies by vintage)
records.region: D.O. Rueda, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Medium straw in color with brilliant clarity and greenish reflections suggesting youth and vivacity. The wine delivers an absolute bouquet of tropical and stone fruit aromatics including apricot, nectarine, and ripe pear. Vibrant notes of cantaloupe and guava add exotic character, while delicate white flower nuances provide elegance. Subtle hints of fennel and lemongrass contribute herbaceous complexity, and a distinctive minerality reminiscent of wet shale emerges, reflecting Rueda's unique terroir.","finish":"The finish is round and smooth with persistent fruit flavors and a hint of pleasant bitterness around the edges that adds complexity and interest. The wine's natural acidity leaves the palate refreshed and clean, while subtle mineral notes linger. The conclusion is medium-length and satisfying, inviting another sip with its balanced structure and vibrant character.","palate":"The palate opens smooth and balanced with refreshing acidity that makes the wine incredibly pleasant and easy to drink. Lively flavors mirror the aromatic profile, featuring peach, honeydew melon, and stone fruit supported by zesty citrus notes. A mild honeyed character lends subtle sweetness without being cloying, while the wine's bright acidity provides structure and lift. The texture is round yet fit, with medium body and excellent balance. Herbaceous notes of fennel and fresh grass add dimension to the fruit-forward profile."}

records.name: Stel + Mar Rose (DC, MD, and Southern VA Only) NV
records.description: Stel+Mar Premium Rosé is a sustainably produced California rosé that has earned critical acclaim despite its accessible price point. Rated 91 points by Wine Writers' Circle of Canada and named a 'Best Buy' by Wine Enthusiast, this wine demonstrates that quality rosé doesn't require luxury pricing. Sourced from sustainable vineyards across California's Central and North Coasts, it offers exceptional value and drinkability.
records.varietal: California rosé blend (specific varieties not disclosed)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays an attractive pale pink hue with copper highlights. The nose opens with beautiful stone fruit aromatics, particularly peach and apricot, creating an inviting, fruit-forward impression. Delicate strawberry notes emerge alongside the stone fruit, adding red berry complexity. Subtle herbal undertones provide depth, with hints of fresh herbs and wildflowers contributing to the wine's aromatic elegance. The aromatic profile suggests both richness and refinement.","finish":"The finish is crisp and satisfying with lingering stone fruit and strawberry notes.
