Refreshing acidity carries through to the end, cleansing the palate and maintaining energy. Subtle herbal notes persist, adding complexity to the conclusion. The wine finishes completely dry with medium length, leaving the palate refreshed and eager for food or another sip.","palate":"Beautifully dry on the palate, this wine balances stone fruit richness with refreshing acidity. Flavors of ripe peach and apricot form the core, complemented by bright strawberry and subtle cranberry notes. The wine's herbal undertones add savory complexity, preventing the fruit from becoming one-dimensional. The acidity is perfectly judged—refreshing without being sharp—creating excellent balance and drinkability. Medium-bodied for a rosé, the wine shows more substance than typical summer rosés while maintaining elegance and food-friendliness."}

records.name: Mallorca Gallinas & Focas Red 2015
records.description: A collaboration between 4 Kilos winery and charity association Amadip Esment, this organic Mallorca wine represents a turning point in style for the producer. Crafted from 40-year-old Manto Negro vines grown on distinctive red soils in Santa María and Binissalem, the 2015 vintage emphasizes freshness and elegance over power. Rated 91/100 by critics, it showcases the unique character of Mallorca's indigenous grape varieties.
records.region: Santa María and Binissalem, Mallorca, Balearic Islands, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate and fresh, the nose reveals no oak influence, allowing pure fruit and terroir expression to shine. Red berry notes dominate—bright cherry, wild strawberry, and raspberry—complemented by subtle earthy and mineral nuances. Hints of Mediterranean herbs, dried flowers, and a touch of spice add complexity without overwhelming the wine's elegant profile.","finish":"Clean and refreshing, with lingering red fruit notes and a mineral edge that reflects Mallorca's distinctive red soil terroir. The finish is medium in length but persistent in its elegance, with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity providing structure.","palate":"The palate is beautifully balanced with very good freshness. Medium-bodied and silky in texture, the wine shows flavors of red cherry, cranberry, and subtle red plum. Despite 70% fermentation in 4,000-liter oak foudre and 30% in 500-liter barrels, the oak remains imperceptible, allowing the wine's natural elegance to take center stage. Indigenous yeast fermentation adds subtle complexity and terroir expression. The wine is delicious, subtle, and sophisticated."}

records.name: Southern Belle Poor Boy 2020
records.description: Part of The Grateful Palate's Southern Gothic Collection, this Spanish red from Calatayud offers exceptional value and bold expression. The Poor Boy 2020 showcases the concentrated fruit and distinctive character of Spain's high-altitude vineyards, delivered in an approachable, fruit-forward style that over-delivers for its price point.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic with layers of red and black fruits taking center stage. Ripe blackberry, dark cherry, and plum aromas are complemented by creamy notes that suggest oak influence. Exotic spices—star anise, vanilla, and baking spices—add intrigue, while subtle hints of cocoa and toasted wood round out the complex aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is smooth and lingering, with persistent fruit flavors and subtle spice notes. The wine's elegance and balance make it highly versatile for food pairing while remaining enjoyable on its own.","palate":"The mouthfeel is soft, big, and elegant, with a medium-deep intensity of red and black fruit flavors. The wine shows excellent ripeness without heaviness, balancing concentrated fruit with structural elements. Creamy texture coats the palate, while integrated tannins provide gentle grip. The wine's approachable nature belies its complexity and depth."}

records.name: Beefsteak The Beast Red Blend 2019
records.description: The Beefsteak Club's flagship wine, The Beast is a powerful Douro DOC red from Portugal's legendary port-producing region. Crafted from traditional Portuguese grapes and aged in Port barrels for extra richness, this wine delivers concentrated dark fruit and a velvety smooth texture. The Beast represents exceptional value from one of the world's most dramatic wine regions.
records.varietal: Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is rich and inviting, dominated by ripe forest fruits—blackberry, black cherry, and wild blueberry. Layers of dark chocolate, vanilla, and sweet spice emerge from the Port barrel aging, adding complexity. Subtle hints of violet, tobacco leaf, and toasted oak contribute depth without overwhelming the concentrated fruit core.","finish":"Long and velvet smooth, with persistent notes of dark fruit, chocolate, and subtle oak spice. The finish showcases the wine's power while maintaining elegance, with supple tannins that coat the palate. The texture is remarkably smooth for such an intense wine.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful, the palate delivers intense flavors of ripe forest fruits layered over integrated oak influence. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, and Tinta Roriz creates a wine with both power and elegance. Port barrel aging has contributed extra richness and a distinctive sweetness to the fruit without adding residual sugar. The wine shows excellent concentration balanced by fresh acidity."}

records.name: Jean Leon La Scala Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
records.description: Jean Leon's flagship Vinya La Scala represents the pinnacle of Cabernet Sauvignon from Penedès. This Vi de Finca Gran Reserva spends 24 months in new French oak followed by 3 additional years of bottle aging before release. The 2016 vintage earned 93-97 points from critics and won a Berlin Wine Trophy Gold award, showcasing the extraordinary potential of Spanish Cabernet when given meticulous vineyard management and extended aging.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic, revealing layers of cherry and plum jam accompanied by pronounced spicy notes and balsamic nuances. Dark fruit aromas—blackcurrant, black cherry—mingle with cedar, tobacco, and sweet vanilla from French oak aging. Subtle hints of leather, graphite, and dried herbs add complexity, while a distinctive minerality reflects the wine's Vi de Finca (estate vineyard) origin.","finish":"Long and persistent, the finish showcases the wine's exceptional structure and aging potential. Dark fruit, oak spice, and fine-grained tannins linger, accompanied by damp earth and mineral notes. The wine's intensity and concentration are balanced by refinement and elegance, suggesting continued evolution in the cellar.","palate":"Firm and concentrated, the palate showcases the utmost expression of Cabernet Sauvignon aged to perfection. Dark fruit flavors dominate—blackberry, cassis, dark plum—supported by a good tannic structure that provides grip without harshness. The wine is broad and enveloping, with some warmth and subtle leather notes adding savory complexity. Despite its power, the wine remains refined and elegant, with 24 months in new French oak beautifully integrated."}

records.name: Heron Hill Riesling Semi Sweet 2023
records.description: A beautifully balanced semi-sweet Riesling from New York's Finger Lakes region that showcases the cool climate character of Keuka Lake. The 2023 vintage earned Silver at the New York Wine Classic and exemplifies Heron Hill's mastery of this grape variety. At 9% ABV, this is an approachable, food-friendly white wine that captures the essence of Finger Lakes Riesling.
records.region: Finger Lakes, Keuka Lake, New York
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose explodes with intense aromatics of ripe white peach and lemon curd, intertwined with fresh ginger spice and delicate white floral notes. Underlying mineral tones add complexity, while hints of honeysuckle and pear blossom create an inviting bouquet. Subtle honeyed accents emerge as the wine opens, along with whispers of ripe melon that speak to the wine's semi-sweet character.","finish":"The finish is soft and smooth with excellent length, allowing the citrus and stone fruit notes to linger gracefully. A touch of minerality and elegant petrol notes emerge on the tail, adding sophistication to the semi-sweet style. The wine leaves the palate refreshed and ready for another sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with electric acidity that brings the wine to life on the palate, balancing the subtle sweetness with precision. Bright citrus and stone fruit flavors dominate, particularly tangerine and white peach, while the underlying minerality adds structure and depth. The mouthfeel is juicy and fresh, with a pleasant lemon-lime bitterness that keeps the honeyed apple characteristics in perfect equilibrium. This is a wine of remarkable balance, where sweetness never overwhelms the vibrant fruit and crisp acidity."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Tempranillo Blanco (Green Labels) 2022
records.description: A pioneering white wine from Rioja that showcases the rare white mutation of Tempranillo, a grape variety Bodegas Valdemar has championed for years. Harvested from the prestigious Finca Alto Cantabria estate in Rioja Alta, this 2022 vintage earned a Gold Medal at the Concours Mondial in Brussels. The wine represents a modern expression of Rioja's innovative spirit while maintaining traditional quality standards.
records.region: Rioja Alta, Spain - Finca Alto Cantabria estate
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with striking aromatic herb notes, particularly fennel and spearmint, creating an herbaceous complexity rarely found in white Rioja. Tropical fruit aromas follow, featuring melon, ripe pear, and fresh pineapple that add lushness to the profile. A delicate touch of elderflower provides floral elegance, while the wine's pale yellow color with greenish hues hints at its youthful vibrancy and fresh character.","finish":"Long and balanced, with lingering tropical fruit flavors complemented by a refreshing herbal quality. The salty mineral note returns on the finish, adding a savory dimension that makes this wine particularly food-friendly. The clean, bright conclusion leaves the palate energized.","palate":"Mouth-coating and fresh, with exceptional balance between fruit richness and bright acidity. The tropical fruit notes translate beautifully to the palate, where they're joined by a distinctive salty minerality from the calcareous soils of Alto Cantabria. The wine shows impressive length and structure, with the aromatic herb character weaving through layers of citrus and stone fruit. Extended aging on fine lees for 4 months adds subtle creaminess and textural complexity without overwhelming the wine's inherent freshness."}

records.name: O Leao Red Blend (DC-MD Only) 2022
records.description: An elegant Portuguese-style red blend that showcases the refined character of international varietals. This wine presents a silky, mineral-driven profile with exceptional balance and finesse. The blend combines Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Carménère to create a sophisticated wine that bridges Old World elegance with New World fruit expression.
records.varietal: Shiraz/Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Carménère
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright red fruit aromatics—particularly red cherry, cranberry, and raspberry—that provide freshness and lift. These are complemented by notes of fresh spices, particularly black pepper and subtle clove, that add aromatic complexity. A layer of dried fruits, including fig and dried plum, contributes depth without heaviness. The influence of French oak barrels is evident but restrained, offering light touches of mocha, cocoa, and toasted nuts that enhance rather than dominate the fruit. Subtle violet and herb notes add further intrigue to this complex bouquet.","finish":"Silky and persistent, with lingering red fruit notes and a distinctive mineral quality that keeps the palate engaged. The tannins are fine-grained and well-integrated, providing structure without astringency. Light spice and mocha notes return on the tail, while the wine's natural acidity ensures a fresh, clean conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"The palate reveals the wine's defining characteristic: a unique, silky sensation that sets it apart from more robust red blends. Medium-bodied and elegant, the wine shows impressive minerality that provides structure and length. The red fruit core from the nose translates beautifully, with red cherry and raspberry flavors leading, supported by hints of dark plum and blackberry. The oak influence is perfectly integrated, contributing warmth and subtle spice—vanilla, cinnamon, light mocha—without overwhelming the fruit purity. What truly distinguishes this wine is its mineral backbone, which adds complexity and a sense of place, creating a refined drinking experience that emphasizes finesse over power."}

records.name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Grenache Blanc 2015
records.description: A tropical and aromatic white wine from Pomar Junction Vineyard & Winery in Paso Robles, showcasing Grenache Blanc in a blend with complementary Rhône varieties. This 2015 vintage demonstrates the versatility of white Rhône grapes in California's warm climate, balancing tropical fruit richness with bright acidity and aromatic complexity. Pomar Junction has earned Double Gold awards for their wines, establishing them as a quality producer in the region.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with vibrant tropical aromas, particularly pineapple, ripe melon, and juicy white peach that create an inviting, fruit-forward character. Citrus notes of key lime and Meyer lemon add brightness and lift, while subtle coconut nuances hint at the wine's richness. Fresh floral elements—particularly white flowers and hints of honeysuckle—provide aromatic elegance. The bouquet is intensely aromatic and expressive, with the tropical fruit character taking center stage while remaining balanced by citrus freshness. Light notes of stone fruit and a whisper of vanilla round out the complex nose.","finish":"The finish is long and fruit-forward, with tropical and citrus notes persisting gracefully. The wine's natural acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while the spicy quality returns on the tail, adding a final layer of complexity. A hint of white pepper and stone fruit lingers, making this a thoroughly enjoyable and food-friendly wine.","palate":"The attack is generous and fruit-driven, with the tropical aromatics translating seamlessly to the palate. Complex layers of pineapple, melon, and stone fruit create a lush mid-palate, while dancing acidity prevents the wine from becoming heavy or cloying. Citrus flavors—particularly key lime and lemon zest—provide freshness and structure, cutting through the ripe fruit and adding vibrancy. The wine shows excellent balance between its generous fruit character and bright acidity, with a subtle spiciness adding dimension. The mouthfeel is full and coating without being overly rich, creating an approachable yet sophisticated drinking experience. Notes of coconut and light vanilla suggest subtle oak influence that enhances rather than dominates."}

records.name: Domaine Chevallier Petit Chablis 2022
records.description: A crisp and mineral-driven Petit Chablis from one of Burgundy's most celebrated appellations. Produced from 100% Chardonnay grown on Kimmeridgian limestone soils, this wine showcases the pure, unadulterated expression of Chablis terroir with vibrant acidity and classic citrus character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with brilliant clarity, revealing layers of green apple, Meyer lemon, and lime zest. Fresh white flowers emerge alongside wet stone minerality and subtle hints of oyster shell. A delicate note of crispy pear adds complexity, while citrus traces reminiscent of lime zest provide brightness and vivacity to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering mineral notes and citrus peel. Excellent persistence showcases the wine's quality, leaving a mouthwatering acidity that invites another sip. The characteristic Chablis minerality extends beautifully through the aftertaste.","palate":"The palate is lively and chiseled with electrifying acidity that defines classic Chablis character. Flavors of Granny Smith apple, fresh lime, and white grapefruit dominate, supported by fine chalky minerality that coats the mouth. The stainless steel aging preserves remarkable freshness and purity, creating a wine with exceptional tension and verve. Medium-bodied with crisp definition, it displays the precision and finesse that only true Chablis can deliver."}

records.name: Domaine du Vieux College Marsannay Rouge Les Favieres 2021
records.description: An elegant and refined Pinot Noir from the Marsannay appellation in Burgundy's Côte de Nuits. Produced by the seventh generation of the Guyard family using organic viticulture practices, this wine showcases the distinctive character of the Les Favières vineyard with remarkable depth and aromatic persistence.
records.region: Marsannay Les Favières, Côte de Nuits, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intense and elegant, displaying a complex array of black fruits including blackberry, black cherry, and cassis. Warming spices of clove and white pepper add dimension, while subtle violet floral notes provide lift. There's an earthy complexity with hints of forest floor and dried herbs that speak to its Burgundian origins.","finish":"Great length defines the finish, with aromatic persistence that extends well beyond the initial taste. The tannins remain well-integrated, providing structure without harshness. Spice notes and dark fruit echoes linger, leaving a sophisticated and memorable impression.","palate":"Dark ruby in color with violet reflections, the palate reveals beautifully integrated tannins that create a wine of exceptional finesse. Black fruit flavors dominate—ripe blackberry and black cherry—complemented by baking spices and a touch of minerality. The texture is silky and refined, with medium body and excellent balance between fruit concentration and acidity. The organic farming practices shine through in the wine's purity and precision."}

records.name: Dear Mom Sparkletown   187 ml
records.description: A playful and approachable sparkling Pinot Gris from Oregon, crafted by Dear Mom Wine Co. and packaged in convenient 187ml cans. This wine delivers serious quality in a fun format, combining fresh acidity with aromatic complexity while maintaining a completely dry finish that makes it perfect for outdoor adventures.
records.varietal: Sparkling Pinot Gris (some sources mention Viognier, Roussanne, and Marsanne blend; composition may vary)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Straw-colored with persistent fine bubbles, the nose opens with pronounced floral aromatics of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and white flowers. Fresh apricot and white peach provide stone fruit character, while subtle hints of wet stone add minerality. Delicate citrus notes of lemon zest emerge, along with faint traces of toast from the sparkling wine production.","finish":"Completely dry on the finish with cleansing acidity that refreshes the palate. Lingering notes of citrus and stone fruit remain, along with subtle mineral character. The bubbles persist through the aftertaste, maintaining the wine's lively character. This is a finish designed to relax the mind and ease the nerves—nothing pretentious, just pure enjoyment.","palate":"The palate showcases bright acidity and excellent nuance for a canned sparkling wine. Crisp flavors of green apple and Anjou pear dominate, complemented by juicy white peach and apricot. Honeysuckle sweetness appears mid-palate, though the wine remains technically dry. The bubbles are fine and persistent, creating a creamy mousse that adds texture. Light-bodied and refreshing with vibrant energy, this wine punches above its weight in terms of complexity and balance."}

records.name: Priorat Trossos Lo Mon 2019
records.description: A powerful and concentrated red wine from Spain's prestigious Priorat DO, crafted by Trossos del Priorat. This wine exemplifies the region's distinctive terroir, sourced from steep vineyards planted on mineral-rich llicorella slate soils. Aged for 12 months in French oak followed by 18 months in bottle, Lo Món represents exceptional value from one of Spain's most celebrated appellations.
records.varietal: Blend of traditional Priorat varieties (typically Garnacha, Cariñena, Syrah)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep cherry red with violet reflections, the nose is remarkably complex and layered. Balsamic nuances of eucalyptus and Mediterranean herbs open the aromatics, followed by concentrated red fruit notes of raspberry, blackberry, and wild strawberry. Citrus peel adds brightness, while prominent mineral notes of ash, graphite, and wet slate reflect the llicorella soils. Black pepper and sweet spices—vanilla, cinnamon—emerge from the oak aging. Dark chocolate and creamy oak round out this multifaceted aromatic profile.","finish":"Long and warm finish that brings back the aroma of sweet spices and ripe fruit. The mineral freshness characteristic of Priorat's slate soils extends through the aftertaste, preventing any heaviness. Strong tannins persist but remain round and velvety. Dark chocolate and espresso notes linger alongside the fruit concentration.","palate":"Powerful and long on the palate with remarkable concentration and balance. The entry is strong and heavy, delivering waves of ripe dark fruit—blackberry, plum, and black cherry. Velvety tannins coat the mouth, providing structure without harshness despite their strength. Spicy hints of black pepper and baking spices integrate with sweet oak influence. The wine is very luscious and rich, showing the characteristic Priorat concentration while maintaining freshness from the region's high-altitude vineyards. Medium to full-bodied with excellent depth."}

records.name: Alella Marfil Classic 2022
records.description: A fresh and balanced white wine from the small but mighty Alella DO near Barcelona, produced by Cooperativa Alella Vinícola's Marfil brand since the 1920s. Made primarily from the indigenous Pansa Blanca grape using ecological farming methods, this wine showcases the characteristic texture and minerality of Alella's unique coastal terroir.
records.varietal: 90% Pansa Blanca (local name for Xarel-lo), 10% Garnacha Blanca
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Pale yellow with greenish hues, clean and bright in appearance. The nose displays large aromatic intensity focused on citrus and white fruits. Meyer lemon, lime, and grapefruit provide the citrus backbone, while white peach, green apple, and pear contribute orchard fruit character. Sweet, plummy notes add unexpected richness, while balsamic touches of fresh herbs—basil, fennel—provide Mediterranean complexity. The aromatic profile is both vibrant and layered.","finish":"Intense finish for a medium-bodied wine, with white fruit and citrus notes persisting. The characteristic Pansa Blanca texture extends through the aftertaste—slightly creamy yet fresh. Mineral notes and good acidity linger, leaving a clean and refreshing impression that invites food pairing.","palate":"Very fresh and beautifully balanced on the palate, this wine showcases the distinctive creamy texture found in Pansa Blanca wines from Alella. White fruit flavors of apple and pear dominate, supported by citrus zest and a characteristic mineral edge. The notable freshness is perfectly balanced with the alcoholic content and minimal residual sugar, creating harmony. Good acidity provides structure and length, while the four months of aging in stainless steel preserves purity. Medium-bodied with exceptional drinkability."}

records.name: Tibouren Cotes de Provence 2021
records.description: A distinctive rosé crafted from the rare Tibouren grape, a near-extinct Provençale varietal that produces wines of remarkable depth and character. This Cru Classé rosé showcases the unique terroir of Côtes de Provence with extended lees aging that sets it apart from typical Provence rosés.
records.region: Côtes de Provence Cru Classé, Provence, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents an enchanting nose with a salmon-orange hue, opening with bright red fruits including red currant, cranberry, and strawberry, complemented by delicate peach notes. As it evolves in the glass, the aromatics mature into smooth, spicy layers with orange zest, clove, and a distinctive salty mineral character that speaks to its coastal origins.","finish":"The finish is long and mineral-driven with lingering notes of smoke, spice, and salty sea air. The wine's unique aging process imparts a complexity that persists well after the glass is empty.","palate":"Fresh and beautifully textured on entry, the palate is anchored by a pronounced mineral thread that runs from front to back. Layers of smoke and citrus zest add complexity, while the wine broadens in the mid-palate with additional stone fruit and red berry flavors. The mouthfeel is more substantial than typical Provence rosés, thanks to extended lees aging in century-old foudres."}

records.name: Seppeltsfield Grand Tawny  10yr NV
records.description: A distinguished fortified wine from Australia's Barossa Valley, representing the perfect entry point into Seppeltsfield's world-renowned fortified wine program. Component wines are aged individually in small oak casks for 10 years before careful selection and blending into the Para Grand Tawny solera, which is worked annually.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is lifted and complex, showcasing stunning aromas of raisin, sticky toffee pudding, and prunes that speak to the wine's extended oak maturation. Notes of praline, vanilla nougat, and espresso emerge, complemented by toasted Atherton almonds, orange zest, and salted dark chocolate. The aromatic profile is both rich and elegant, displaying the pronounced rancio character that develops from years in barrel.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long with persistent flavors of toffee, roasted nuts, and dark chocolate. The wine's richness lingers beautifully, leaving a warm, satisfying impression with subtle hints of orange zest and espresso.","palate":"The palate is full-bodied, rich, and luscious with concentrated, lingering flavors of toasted almonds, praline, and vanilla nougat. Delectable flavors of cocoa, dairy milk chocolate, and caramel create layers of sweetness and complexity. The wine is smooth and mellow, with a seamless integration of fruit, oak, and spirit that speaks to its careful aging and blending."}

records.name: Raywood Chardonnay 2023
records.description: A beautifully balanced California Chardonnay from the Central Coast that eschews heavy oak in favor of fresh fruit expression and bright acidity. The wine is fermented and aged on the lees for added complexity and richness, creating an elegant, food-friendly style.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents oak-free aromatics reminiscent of fresh vinyl and crisp apple, showcasing pure fruit expression. Aromas of freshly cut apple, sliced lime, and wild mint create a refreshing aromatic profile, with subtle hints of lemon blossom and citrus zest adding complexity. The wine's clean, vibrant character is immediately apparent.","finish":"The finish is crisp and refreshing with lingering citrus and mineral notes. The wine's bright acidity and clean fruit expression carry through to the end, leaving a mouth-watering impression.","palate":"The palate is marked by bright citrus flavors of lemon and lime, complemented by green apple and stone fruit notes. Flavors of lemon pith and ashy chalk add a distinctive mineral quality, while light baking spice from sur lie aging provides subtle complexity and richness. The wine's medium body and refreshing acidity create a clean, vibrant mouthfeel that carries the flavors with precision."}

records.name: Domaine du Joncier Regard 2016
records.description: An exceptional organic and biodynamic red from Lirac in the Southern Rhône, produced by one of the region's most dedicated natural winemakers. This complex blend showcases the minerality and elegance that can be achieved through low-yield viticulture and minimal intervention winemaking in the Rhône Valley.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine presents a beautiful dark purple-ruby color, opening with a velvety and expressive nose of red fruits including cherry and raspberry, complemented by discrete vegetal notes that add complexity. Aromas of black fruits and spices emerge with aeration, creating layers of aromatic intrigue that speak to the wine's biodynamic origins and careful vineyard management.","finish":"The finish is persistent and beautifully aromatic with excellent length. The wine's mineral character carries through to the end, balanced by lingering red fruit and spice notes that invite contemplation.","palate":"The palate shows beautiful substance that is both elegant and mineral-driven, offering a complex flavor profile of red fruits accompanied by subtle hints of leather and earth. The wine is ample with silky tannins that are intense yet well-balanced, creating a mouthfeel that is both structured and refined. The minerality and freshness provide great substance, intensity, and elegance throughout the tasting experience."}

records.name: Bodegas Gieco Familia Gieco Malbec 2022
records.description: A family-crafted Malbec from a small boutique winery in Lujan de Cuyo, one of Argentina's most prestigious wine regions. The Devalle-Gieco family's 16-hectare vineyard in Vistalba produces wines that showcase the unique character of high-altitude Mendoza terroir with careful attention to oak integration.
records.region: Lujan de Cuyo, Vistalba district, Mendoza, Argentina
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant aromas of ripe black plum, blackberry, and dark cherry, complemented by notes of violet and dried rose petals that are characteristic of quality Argentinian Malbec. A fine touch of oak adds subtle vanilla, toasted cedar, and sweet baking spices, while hints of dark chocolate and espresso provide depth without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit flavors, chocolate, and spice notes. The tannins are smooth and well-integrated, carrying through with excellent balance and leaving a warm, inviting impression.","palate":"The palate is rich and concentrated with flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis forming the core, supported by well-integrated oak that adds notes of vanilla, mocha, and sweet spice. The wine shows excellent structure with velvety tannins that are firm yet refined, providing backbone without harshness. The high-altitude fruit contributes notable freshness and acidity that balances the wine's richness and power."}

records.name: Wine Kitchen WK White (COOKING WINE)
records.description: Cooking wine product - not intended for drinking. This is a culinary ingredient rather than a table wine.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"N/A - Cooking wine product","finish":"N/A - Cooking wine product","palate":"N/A - Cooking wine product"}

records.name: Barcelona Lolea Rose Sangria
records.description: An artisanal rosé sangria from Spain that combines Garnacha rosé and Tempranillo with natural fruit and spices. This frizzante-style sangria is unpasteurized to preserve the wine's characteristics, offering an authentic taste of Spanish tradition with a refreshing fizzy touch.
records.varietal: Garnacha rosé and Tempranillo with natural fruit and spices
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is vibrant and inviting with aromas of fresh strawberry, raspberry, and cherry complemented by citrus notes of orange peel and lemon zest. Spicy notes of ginger and cinnamon add warmth and complexity, while delicate floral hints of rose petals provide aromatic lift. The fine frizzante carbonation adds a lively, refreshing quality to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is crisp and refreshing with lingering berry fruit, citrus, and gentle spice notes. The fizzy carbonation carries through to the end, leaving a clean, invigorating impression.","palate":"The palate is refreshing and fruit-forward with bright flavors of red berries, citrus, and stone fruit dancing across the tongue. The wine's natural fruit character is enhanced by a spicy ginger background and subtle sweet spices that add depth without cloying. The fine bubbles create a lively, effervescent mouthfeel that is both festive and thirst-quenching."}

records.name: Mauro Molino Barbera d'Alba 2021
records.description: An outstanding Barbera d'Alba from a respected Barolo producer in La Morra, earning exceptional scores of 91 points from both Wine Enthusiast and Wine Spectator. This wine showcases the elegance and food-friendly character that Barbera can achieve in Piedmont's calcareous-clayey soils.
records.region: Barbera d'Alba DOC, La Morra, Piedmont, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine pours an inky purple color, opening with vibrant aromas of wild red berries including raspberry and wild strawberry, complemented by sour cherries and black cherry notes. Sweet baking spices add warmth and complexity, while subtle notes of violet, iron, and rooibos tea provide additional aromatic intrigue and a hint of the wine's mineral character.","finish":"The finish is long and graceful with fine balance between fruit, acidity, and tannins. The wine's elegant structure lingers beautifully, leaving a sleek, defined impression with subtle notes of iron and violet.","palate":"The palate is plush and silky with a wonderful balance between ripe red fruit and savory herbal flavors. Blackberry, black cherry, and red berry flavors are supported by well-structured, soft tannins that provide backbone without harshness. The wine is tart and bright with excellent acidity that lifts the fruit and creates an elegant, defined mouthfeel. Fresh and fruity at the beginning, the wine turns more savory towards the mid-palate with notes of herbs and tea."}

records.name: Bonelli Bonarda Amabile (Frizzante, Semi Sweet) Damaged Labels 2022
records.description: A delightful semi-sweet, lightly sparkling red wine from the Colli Piacentini region of Emilia-Romagna. This frizzante showcases the charming character of Bonarda with violet and cherry aromatics, offering a pleasant and approachable style perfect for casual enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant violet and cherry aromas that are characteristic of Bonarda, creating an inviting and aromatic profile. The ruby red color shows hints of violet tones that mirror the aromatic expression, while subtle red berry notes add complexity to the otherwise straightforward but charming bouquet.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering cherry and violet notes carried by the fine bubbles. The wine's gentle sweetness persists alongside the fruit character.","palate":"The palate is pleasant and delicate with medium body, showcasing the wine's semi-sweet character balanced by natural frizzante carbonation. Cherry and red berry flavors dominate, supported by gentle bubbles that lift the fruit and create a refreshing, lively mouthfeel. The wine's sweetness is well-integrated, never cloying, making it highly approachable and versatile."}

records.name: Well Crafted Prosecco Freschissimo Sample Bottle NV
records.description: A sample-sized bottle of Italian Prosecco designed for tasting and evaluation. Freschissimo indicates a focus on fresh, crisp character typical of quality Prosecco.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose presents typical Prosecco aromatics of green apple, pear, and white flowers, with citrus notes of lemon and lime adding freshness. Subtle hints of acacia blossom provide floral lift.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering apple and citrus notes carried by persistent bubbles.","palate":"The palate is fresh and lively with flavors of green apple, pear, and citrus supported by fine bubbles. The wine's crisp acidity creates a clean, refreshing mouthfeel that is immediately approachable."}

records.name: Rippa Dorii Salomon 2021
records.description: An exceptional single-vineyard Tempranillo from the Salomón parcel in Ribera del Duero, showcasing a more elegant and fresh style than typical powerful Ribera reds. From 40-year-old bush vines in Fuentecén, this wine emphasizes purity and freshness over tannin and power, representing the excellence of the 2021 vintage.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo from 40+ year-old Salomón parcel bush vines
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Fuentecén, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is intensely aromatic with an almost opaque purple color, opening with complex aromas of very ripe black fruits including currants, blackberries, and plums. Subtle notes of incense, tobacco, clove, and chocolate add layers of complexity, while hints of black olive tapenade and lightly floral, minty notes provide additional aromatic intrigue. The bouquet is both powerful and refined.","finish":"The finish is long and fresh with persistent dark fruit and spice notes. The wine's bright acidity carries through to the end, creating a pure, clean finish that invites another sip.","palate":"The palate is luscious and enveloping with intense, well-integrated acidity that provides structure and lift. Complex flavors of forest fruits, cassis, and balsamic notes create depth, while the wine's purity allows the terroir to shine through. The tannins are sweet and excellently balanced, neither overwhelming nor harsh, creating a mouthfeel that is both rich and elegant with notable freshness."}

records.name: Free Spirits N/A Kentucky Mule Cans   250 ml
records.description: A sophisticated non-alcoholic cocktail crafted with Free Spirits' award-winning Spirit of Bourbon alternative. This ready-to-drink Kentucky Mule combines fresh ginger and Meyer lemon with sweet oak notes, recreating the classic bourbon and ginger cocktail experience without alcohol. With just 75 calories per can and infused with vitamins B3 and B6, it's rated 4.7/5 stars by customers seeking premium alcohol alternatives.
records.varietal: N/A - Non-alcoholic cocktail with Spirit of Bourbon alternative, ginger, Meyer lemon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant ginger spice and bright Meyer lemon zest, creating an invigorating aromatic profile. Sweet oak notes emerge, reminiscent of bourbon barrel aging, adding depth and complexity. The combination is authentic and well-balanced, capturing the essence of a classic bourbon cocktail.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering ginger spice and citrus notes. A subtle oak character persists, providing a satisfying conclusion that leaves no room for cocktail FOMO.","palate":"Fresh flavors of ginger and Meyer lemon mingle effortlessly on the palate, delivering a lively, zingy experience. The Spirit of Bourbon alternative provides sweet oak notes and a subtle warmth that mimics traditional bourbon character. The ginger has a nice burn that adds excitement without heat, while the lemon provides brightness and balance. Real fruit juice contributes natural flavor and body. The mouthfeel is refreshing and satisfying."}

records.name: Gendraud Patrice Chablis Mevushal (MD & DC)
records.description: A classic expression of Chablis from Christophe Patrice under the Gendraud label, certified Mevushal and supervised by OU, Rabbi Padwa, and London Beit Din. Made from 100% Chardonnay grown in Chablis's famous Kimmeridgian limestone soils, this wine captures the mineral-driven purity characteristic of the region. With an average rating of 90.5 points on CellarTracker, it represents quality kosher Chablis for Passover and year-round enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Golden dress with an elegant, fine and intense nose. The aromatics open with delicate white flowers including acacia and elderflower, complemented by bright citrus fruits of lemon and grapefruit. A distinctive mineral background emerges, reminiscent of wet stones and chalk, characteristic of Chablis terroir. Hints of fresh pear and green apple add fruit complexity.","finish":"Clean and persistent with dominant mineral notes. The refreshing acidity carries through to an invigorating conclusion that leaves the palate cleansed and ready for food.","palate":"The palate is balanced and very dry with a refreshing, bracing acidity that's typical of Chablis. The attack is good and lively, continuing with pleasant acidity that lifts the fruit and mineral flavors. Notes of citrus, pear, and subtle mineral nuances create a pure, focused flavor profile. The wine shows excellent tension between fruit and minerality, with the limestone terroir expressing itself clearly."}

records.name: Giustini Vecchio Sogno Negroamaro 2023
records.description: A pure expression of Negroamaro from Tenuta Giustini in Puglia's Salento region, representing 'the beginning of our story' for this four-generation family winery. Located in San Giorgio within the Primitivo di Manduria DOC area, the estate combines traditional passion with modern winemaking techniques. This wine is fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel to showcase the pure fruit character of Negroamaro.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Ruby red color with attractive purplish reflections indicating youth and vibrancy. The nose opens with bright red fruit notes of cherry and red currant, complemented by darker notes of blueberry. A distinctive hint of violet adds floral elegance to the fruit-forward profile. The aromatics are fresh, clean, and inviting.","finish":"Medium-length finish with lingering red fruit and subtle floral notes. The finish is clean and balanced, showing the wine's food-friendly character.","palate":"Soft and balanced on the palate, delivering pure Negroamaro fruit character without oak influence. Flavors of cherry, currant, and blueberry dominate, showing the variety's natural fruit intensity. The wine maintains elegance despite its concentration, with balanced acidity providing structure and lift. The texture is smooth and approachable, making this an easy-drinking red that doesn't sacrifice character for accessibility."}

records.name: Sky Devil Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
records.description: An unapologetically bold Cabernet Sauvignon from Sky Devil Wines' Formation series, crafted by acclaimed winemaker Kirk Venge. This Napa Valley expression includes small amounts of Merlot, Malbec, and Petit Verdot, aged 21 months in primarily new French oak. With only 392 cases produced, this wine represents the collaboration between friends Jeff Goldberg and Matt Vogt in creating terroir-inspired, extravagant wines.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon with small amounts of Merlot, Malbec, and Petit Verdot
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is finessed yet powerful, offering concentrated aromas of dark cherry and black fruit. Notes of coffee bean add roasted complexity alongside cracked black pepper that provides spice. Subtle hints of vanilla and toast from oak aging integrate seamlessly. The aromatic profile is bold yet refined, showing Kirk Venge's signature style.","finish":"Long and impressive with persistent dark fruit, coffee, and spice notes. The oak influence carries through the finish, adding depth and complexity to the conclusion.","palate":"Unapologetically bold and structured, this wine delivers layers of concentrated dark fruit. The Cabernet Sauvignon dominates with cassis and blackberry, while the small percentages of Merlot, Malbec, and Petit Verdot add complexity and depth. The wine spent 21 months in mostly new oak, contributing structure and spice notes. Despite the power, the wine maintains balance and elegance. The tannins are substantial but refined, showing potential for development."}

records.name: Lueria Roussanne
records.description: Lueria showcases the distinctive character of Roussanne, a noble white grape from the Rhône Valley. This wine expresses the varietal's signature richness and complex aromatics with excellent texture and depth.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals generous aromatics of ripe pear, golden apple, and white peach. Honeyed notes emerge alongside hints of chamomile and white flowers, while subtle almond and hazelnut nuances add complexity. A touch of minerality provides freshness to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent fruit flavors and a creamy, nutty quality. Natural acidity provides balance and prevents the richness from becoming heavy.","palate":"Rich and textured on the palate, this Roussanne shows flavors of stone fruit and citrus, with layers of apricot, meyer lemon, and quince. The wine displays characteristic viscosity balanced by refreshing acidity, with notes of toasted almond and beeswax adding depth. A hint of saline minerality enhances the mid-palate."}

records.name: Bacio Semi Sweet Red
records.description: A delightful semi-sweet Italian red wine blend, likely from the Baci Dolci ('Sweet Kiss') line produced by Cantina Colli Euganei in Veneto. This refreshing, slightly frizzante wine combines Marzemino and Merlot grapes from the Euganean Hills. The cooperative, supporting 680 local farmers since 1949, crafts approachable wines perfect for casual dining and social occasions.
records.varietal: Blend of Marzemino and Merlot (likely composition)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intense ruby red color with inviting vibrancy. The nose bursts with aromas of fresh strawberry and black cherry, creating an immediately appealing fruit-forward profile. Hints of rose petals add floral elegance and romance to the bouquet. The aromatic intensity is cheerful and accessible.","finish":"Clean and slightly sweet with lingering cherry and berry notes. The gentle sparkle carries through to the conclusion, leaving a refreshing impression.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with generous cherry pie flavors that dominate the palate. The wine shows the freshness of red berries balanced by a gentle touch of sweetness. A refreshing sparkle provides lift and balance to the semi-sweet finish, preventing the wine from becoming cloying. The slight effervescence adds playfulness and keeps the palate engaged. The texture is smooth and approachable."}

records.name: Heron Hill Riesling Classic Dry 2022
records.description: A benchmark Finger Lakes Riesling from one of the region's most respected producers. Receiving 91 points from Wine Enthusiast, this classic dry expression showcases the minerality and purity that make Finger Lakes Riesling world-class. With wonderful intensity, varietal character, and balance, this wine demonstrates the region's ability to produce exceptional dry Riesling with aging potential of 8-12 years.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose shows wonderful intensity and pure varietal character. Aromas of ripe peach lead alongside bright lemon and lime, creating layers of stone and citrus fruit. Delicate floral notes add elegance, while honey nuances provide richness without sweetness. A distinctive mineral note runs through the aromatics, characteristic of Finger Lakes terroir.","finish":"Long and minerally with persistent fruit and acid notes. The wine's low residual sugar (0.7) ensures a dry, crisp conclusion that leaves the palate refreshed.","palate":"Medium-bodied with energetic acidity that provides excellent structure and lift. The palate delivers concentrated fruit flavors that balance the wine's dryness perfectly. Notes of peach, citrus, and mineral create a complex flavor profile. The wine shows superb length, with flavors that persist and evolve across the palate. The balance between sweet fruit and refreshing acidity is exceptional, creating a harmonious whole."}

records.name: Antonio Facchin Prosecco Extra Dry Mini   187 ml
records.description: A captivating Prosecco from the historic Antonio Facchin winery, established in 1870 in the UNESCO World Heritage Prosecco Hills. This Extra Dry expression in convenient 187ml single-serve format showcases Glera grapes from the Buffer Zone of the Prosecco Hills. The wine balances sweetness and freshness in the Extra Dry style, offering bright straw yellow color and harmonious character.
records.region: Prosecco DOC Treviso, Veneto, Italy (UNESCO Prosecco Hills)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright straw yellow color with persistent fine bubbles. The nose is fresh, fruity, and floral, showcasing the aromatic character of Glera. Delicate white flowers emerge alongside notes of green apple, pear, and citrus. The aromatic profile is clean and inviting, characteristic of quality Prosecco.","finish":"Clean and refreshing with lingering fruit and floral notes. The finish is pleasant and approachable, perfect for celebrations or casual enjoyment.","palate":"The wine delivers a sweetish, harmonic, and pleasant taste profile typical of Extra Dry Prosecco. Flavors of fresh apple, pear, and citrus dominate, supported by delicate floral notes. The mousse is fine and persistent, creating an elegant mouthfeel. The wine balances the slight sweetness with refreshing acidity, maintaining liveliness and drinkability."}

records.name: Shadowbox Sonoma County Outline Red Blend 2015
records.description: A bold red blend from Shadowbox Cellars' limited production portfolio, combining 60% Zinfandel with 40% Petite Sirah to create a powerful yet balanced wine. With only 320 cases produced and 20 months aging in oak (15% new), this wine showcases fruit from premium Sonoma County vineyards. The wine represents the Napa-based microwinery's commitment to food-friendly, small-production wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with concentrated aromas of blueberries, blackberry compote, and ripe plums. Layers of coconut, cocoa, and roasted coffee emerge from oak influence, while black pepper adds spice complexity. The aromatic intensity is impressive, showing the power of the blend while maintaining aromatic elegance.","finish":"Long and satisfying with persistent fruit, oak, and spice notes. The tannins are substantial but ripe, providing structure for aging. The finish is hearty and bold, perfect for rich food pairings.","palate":"Big and fruit-forward with generous flavors of dark berries and stone fruit. The wine shows excellent concentration while maintaining its acidity, preventing it from being heavy or one-dimensional. The Zinfandel provides ripe fruit and spice, while the Petite Sirah adds structure and depth. Flavors of cocoa, coffee, and pepper from oak aging integrate well with the fruit. The wine is powerful yet balanced."}

records.name: Reed Knife Edge Shiraz 2021
records.description: A powerful Australian Shiraz showcasing the intensity and spice characteristic of premium Australian viticulture. The 'Knife Edge' designation suggests a wine balancing on the edge between power and elegance, fruit and structure. The 2021 vintage in Australia was generally favorable, producing wines of concentrated fruit and balance.
records.region: Australia (likely Barossa Valley or McLaren Vale)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep purple color with vibrant hues. The nose is bold and expressive, opening with concentrated blackberry, blueberry, and dark plum aromas. Notes of black pepper, licorice, and dried herbs add complexity. Hints of vanilla and toast from oak aging integrate with eucalyptus and mint character.","finish":"Long and spicy with persistent fruit and pepper notes. Firm tannins provide grip and aging potential.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful with concentrated dark fruit flavors. Blackberry, blueberry, and plum dominate, supported by black pepper spice and savory herbs. The wine shows excellent structure with firm tannins and balanced acidity. Oak influence adds notes of vanilla, cocoa, and spice. The mouthfeel is rich and coating."}

records.name: Bodegas Paco Garcia Seis 2018
records.description: A Spanish red wine from Bodegas Paco Garcia, likely from the Ribera del Duero or Toro regions. The 'Seis' (Six) designation may refer to six months of aging or a special cuvée. This wine represents modern Spanish winemaking with international appeal while respecting traditional methods.
records.varietal: Likely Tempranillo or Tinta de Toro
records.region: Spain (likely Ribera del Duero or Toro)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep ruby color with purple reflections. The nose opens with ripe red and black fruit including cherry, blackberry, and plum. Notes of vanilla, cocoa, and sweet spices from oak aging add complexity. Hints of leather and tobacco emerge with air.","finish":"Medium to long finish with lingering fruit and spice notes. The tannins are well-integrated, fading smoothly.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with concentrated fruit flavors. The palate delivers ripe cherry, plum, and blackberry supported by notes of chocolate and spice. Well-integrated oak adds structure without overwhelming the fruit. The tannins are firm but ripe, providing good aging potential. Balanced acidity keeps the wine fresh."}

records.name: Born Rose Sparkling 2020
records.description: Born Rosé from Barcelona is an organic sparkling wine crafted using the Charmat method from 100% Pinot Noir grapes grown in the Penedès region. This wine embodies the essence of celebration with its elegant pale pink color and persistent fine bubbles, created by one of the region's master winemakers to capture the fresh, fruity character that makes Spanish sparkling wines so approachable and delightful.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Elegant and full of nuance, the nose opens with bright citrus aromas of orange zest and pink grapefruit, intermingled with fresh red fruits including ripe cherry and wild strawberry. Delicate white flower notes of orange blossom and rose petal add a romantic quality, while subtle menthol and mineral undertones provide complexity. The aromatics are lifted and fresh, inviting immediate enjoyment.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing, with lingering notes of sweet red fruit and citrus that persist on the palate. A touch of minerality emerges at the end, adding depth and keeping the wine from being one-dimensional. The bubbles continue to dance on the tongue, leaving a pleasant sensation that invites another sip.","palate":"The wine is crisp and fresh from the first sip, with a balanced mouthfeel driven by bright, refreshing acidity. Red berry flavors of strawberry and raspberry dominate the palate, complemented by citrus notes of grapefruit and lemon. There's a pleasant sweetness of ripe fruit balanced by racy acidity, creating a harmonious profile. The fine, persistent bubbles provide a creamy texture while maintaining the wine's energy and vibrancy."}

records.name: Calyptra Gran Reserva Pinot Noir 2020
records.description: A Gran Reserva Pinot Noir from Chile's Calyptra estate, representing extended aging and selection of the finest vineyard parcels. Chilean Pinot Noir from cool-climate regions shows elegance and terroir expression. The 2020 vintage was generally favorable across Chile's wine regions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Ruby-garnet color with evolving hues. The nose shows red cherry, raspberry, and cranberry aromas. Notes of dried rose petals, earth, and forest floor add complexity from aging. Subtle hints of vanilla and toast from oak aging integrate seamlessly.","finish":"Medium-long with lingering red fruit and earthy notes. The tannins are soft and integrated.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky texture and refined tannins. The palate delivers red cherry, raspberry, and strawberry flavors supported by earthy notes and subtle spice. The wine shows excellent balance and integration from extended aging. The acidity is bright and refreshing."}

records.name: Central Valley Banner Day Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
records.description: A fresh, approachable Cabernet Sauvignon from California's Central Valley, designed for immediate enjoyment. The 'Banner Day' designation suggests celebration and everyday drinking. Central Valley wines offer excellent value and fruit-forward character.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep ruby color with purple hues. The nose is fruit-forward with aromas of black cherry, cassis, and plum. Notes of vanilla and subtle oak spice add complexity. The aromatic profile is clean and approachable.","finish":"Clean and moderate length with lingering fruit and soft tannins.","palate":"Medium-bodied with soft tannins and bright fruit flavors. The palate delivers black cherry, plum, and cassis supported by notes of vanilla and spice. The wine is balanced and easy-drinking, with smooth tannins and refreshing acidity. The texture is supple and friendly."}

records.name: Remhoogte Chronicle Cape Estate Blend  1.5 L 2014  1.5 l
records.description: A premium South African red blend from Remhoogte Estate in Stellenbosch, presented in magnum format (1.5L). The 'Chronicle' series represents the estate's flagship wines. The 2014 vintage has benefited from extended aging in the larger bottle format, which ages wine more slowly and gracefully than standard bottles.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep garnet color with evolving edges. The nose shows ripe blackcurrant, plum, and dark cherry. Notes of cedar, cigar box, and leather add complexity from aging. Hints of eucalyptus and mint provide South African character.","finish":"Long and complex with lingering fruit, earth, and spice notes. The tannins are soft and well-integrated.","palate":"Full-bodied with integrated tannins from aging. The palate delivers blackcurrant, plum, and dark fruit flavors supported by notes of cedar, tobacco, and spice. The wine shows excellent structure and balance, with the magnum format preserving freshness. The texture is smooth and refined."}

records.name: Casal da Coelheira Mythos 2021
records.description: An intriguing Portuguese wine from Casal da Coelheira, representing modern Portuguese winemaking that often blends indigenous varieties with international grapes. The name "Mythos" suggests an artistic, premium cuvée designed to showcase the estate's terroir and winemaking philosophy through careful varietal selection and blending.
records.varietal: Blend of Portuguese varieties (possibly Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Alicante Bouschet)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with ripe dark cherry, blackberry compote, and plum skin, layered with Mediterranean herb notes of rosemary, sage, and dried lavender. Earthy undertones of graphite, black olive tapenade, and cured tobacco leaf add complexity, while hints of violet and iris provide floral lift. Subtle oak influence contributes notes of cedar, dark chocolate, and espresso without overwhelming the fruit. A distinctive mineral quality suggests schist or limestone soils typical of Portuguese wine regions.","finish":"Long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit and spice notes gradually revealing minerality and earthy complexity. The wine's structure ensures a grippy, food-friendly conclusion with echoes of dried herbs and black pepper lingering alongside fine-grained tannins.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a structured yet supple texture characteristic of indigenous Portuguese varieties. Dark fruit flavors—cassis, black plum, and wild blackberry—are complemented by savory elements of black pepper, cured meat, and sun-dried tomato. The wine's tannins are firm but fine-grained, providing structure without astringency, while bright acidity maintains freshness throughout. Mid-palate complexity emerges with notes of balsamic, leather, and black tea, while integrated oak adds hints of vanilla and mocha to the finish."}

records.name: Boxwood Estate Boxwood Red 2021
records.description: The flagship Bordeaux-style red blend from Virginia's acclaimed Boxwood Estate Winery. This wine represents the best barrels from the estate's vineyards in Middleburg, crafted in the traditional Bordeaux method. The 2021 vintage showcases Boxwood's commitment to world-class winemaking in Virginia.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend (Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Deep ruby color with vibrant hues. The nose shows blackcurrant, black cherry, and plum. Notes of cedar, graphite, and dried herbs add complexity. Hints of vanilla and toast from French oak aging integrate well.","finish":"Long and structured with lingering fruit and oak notes. The tannins are firm but refined, showing aging potential.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with structured tannins and elegant balance. The palate delivers blackcurrant, cherry, and dark fruit flavors supported by notes of cedar, tobacco, and spice. The wine shows excellent structure typical of Virginia Bordeaux blends. The acidity is bright and refreshing."}

records.name: Saddleback Zinfandel 2018
records.description: Saddleback Cellars' 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel represents the 23rd vintage of this iconic Napa Valley wine, crafted by legendary winemaker Nils Venge, known as the 'King of Cab' and the first American to achieve a perfect 100-point score from Robert Parker. This Zinfandel showcases the depth and complexity achievable from Napa's heritage vineyards, aged to perfection and ready to drink.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Beautifully balanced aromatics open with fresh notes of black cardamom and exotic spices, layered with bright Japanese plum and white pepper. Deeper inhalation reveals concentrated dark berry compote, brambleberry, and hints of dried herbs. There's a subtle smokiness from oak aging, intermingled with vanilla bean and a touch of cocoa that adds complexity. The nose is inviting yet restrained, showing the elegance that comes with proper aging.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent notes of dark fruit and spice that linger well after the sip. A touch of vanilla oak and pepper remains on the palate, balanced by bright acidity that keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly. The tannins are fine-grained and polished, showing the benefit of six years of aging since harvest.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a gorgeous melange of ripe fruit flavors centered on bright Japanese plum, blackberry preserves, and red cherry. The wine shows excellent structure with supple, well-integrated tannins that provide framework without harshness. White pepper and baking spices dance across the mid-palate, while the wine maintains remarkable freshness despite its concentration. There's a savory quality that emerges, with hints of dried sage and black tea adding dimension to the ripe fruit core."}

records.name: Armstrong Family Winery Ebby James (Syrah) 2020
records.description: Armstrong Family Winery has built a reputation for exceptional Syrah wines from Washington State, with their Discovery Vineyard Syrah winning Best of Show at the 2020 Great Northwest Invitational. The Ebby James bottling represents their commitment to crafting elegant, terroir-driven Syrah that balances power with finesse, showcasing the quality achievable from Washington's premium vineyard sites.
records.region: Washington State (likely Columbia Valley or Walla Walla Valley)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with a captivating blend of wild blackberry cobbler and dark cherry compote, layered with mocha and espresso bean notes. There's a pronounced savory quality with dried herbs, black olive tapenade, and smoky bacon fat that adds complexity. Stony mineral accents emerge alongside violet and lavender floral notes, while subtle white pepper and cracked black pepper provide an aromatic spice component.","finish":"Long and layered finish with persistent dark fruit, savory herbs, and subtle spice that lingers well after the sip. The tannins are polished and supportive, with a mineral quality that adds complexity. A touch of smoke and white pepper remains on the palate, balanced by bright acidity that keeps the wine fresh despite its concentration.","palate":"Full-bodied with substantial structure, the wine delivers a delightful punch on the mid-palate in terms of flavor density and finesse. Dark fruit flavors of blackberry, plum, and black cherry dominate, supported by savory elements of cured meat, olive, and herb de Provence. The wine shows excellent texture with fine-grained tannins that provide grip without astringency, while maintaining the vibrancy and energy characteristic of Washington Syrah. Mocha and dark chocolate notes add richness without overwhelming the dark fruit core."}

records.name: Giustini Avoglia Primitivo 2023
records.description: Tenuta Giustini's Avoglia Primitivo represents the fresh, dynamic expression of Puglia's signature grape variety, crafted by Giuseppe Papadopoli and his sons in San Giorgio Jonico, at the heart of the Primitivo di Manduria DOC. This wine showcases the juicy, approachable style of Primitivo aged exclusively in stainless steel to preserve fruit purity and vibrant character, offering exceptional value from one of southern Italy's most exciting wine regions.
records.region: San Giorgio Jonico, Primitivo di Manduria DOC, Puglia, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with an inviting bouquet of dark wild berries, featuring concentrated aromas of blackberry jam, ripe blueberry, and black cherry compote. There are distinctive notes of dried black fruit including prune and fig, layered with hints of tobacco leaf and supple leather that add complexity. A subtle earthiness emerges alongside sweet baking spices of cinnamon and vanilla, while the wine's ruby red color with violet reflections hints at its youthful vibrancy.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with persistent dark fruit flavors and a touch of spice. Soft tannins and balanced acidity create a harmonious fade, with lingering notes of blackberry and subtle tobacco that remain on the palate. The wine's youthful energy and approachability shine through, making it immediately enjoyable while hinting at potential for short-term development.","palate":"Full-bodied and juicy with excellent fruit density, the wine delivers concentrated flavors of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and plum across the palate. The texture is smooth and approachable, with soft, well-integrated tannins that provide structure without astringency. There's a pleasant sweetness to the ripe fruit that never becomes cloying, balanced by moderate acidity that keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly. Notes of cocoa and sweet spice add dimension to the fruit-forward core, while the wine maintains remarkable elegance despite its concentration."}

records.name: Vins Mosbach Gewurztraminer 2023
records.description: An aromatic Gewurztraminer from Alsace crafted by Vins Mosbach, harmoniously blending the variety's characteristic floral, fruity and spicy notes. This wine showcases the elegant expression of Gewurztraminer from one of Alsace's quality-focused producers, balancing richness with freshness in a dry style.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose combines beautifully expressive fruity notes of lychee - the signature Gewurztraminer aroma - with elegant floral notes of roses, violets, and orange blossom. Exotic spice notes including ginger, cinnamon, and white pepper add complexity and intrigue. Subtle hints of stone fruit, particularly ripe peach and apricot, emerge with aeration, along with a delicate honeyed quality that doesn't overwhelm the wine's freshness.","finish":"The finish is long and harmonious with persistent floral and spice notes. A subtle citrus edge adds definition, while the wine's aromatic character lingers beautifully, inviting another sip.","palate":"Rich and aromatic on the palate, the wine delivers intense flavors while remaining dry in style. The texture is tender and almost oily, coating the palate with concentrated fruit - lychee, rose petal, and white peach dominate, supported by the variety's characteristic spice. Despite the richness, balanced acidity keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly, preventing it from becoming cloying. The wine shows good length and complexity, with layers of fruit, floral, and spice notes unfolding across the palate."}

records.name: Domaine Fevre Grand Cru Les Preuses 2022
records.description: A stunning Chablis Grand Cru from one of the seven prized climats, earning exceptional scores across the board: 96 Decanter, 95 Wine Advocate, 95 James Suckling, and 93 Wine Spectator. This organically grown Chardonnay from Domaine William Fèvre represents the pinnacle of Chablis winemaking, showcasing remarkable elegance, mineral intensity, and aging potential.
records.region: Les Preuses Grand Cru, Chablis, Burgundy, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose wafts from the glass with sophisticated aromas of orange zest, oyster liquor, and brine that immediately signal Grand Cru pedigree. White flowers - acacia and hawthorn - mingle with notes of white peach, lemon rind, and hazelnut. Subtle pie-crust and spiced-apple aromatics from careful oak aging add complexity. A distinctive mineral note reminiscent of wet stones and chalk emerges, while hints of wild peach and faint touches of crustacea add an exotic dimension.","finish":"The finish is ultra-stylish and very mineral with a long, satisfying conclusion. A fine salt and mineral-infused aftertaste persists, underscoring Les Preuses' role as the most ethereal of the grand cru climats. The wine leaves the palate elegant yet substantial, with exceptional length.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a satiny, textural quality that coats the palate luxuriously. The wine is super succulent and juicy, showing compact, concentrated layers of peach, lemon, and melon fruit. Intensely mineral with a distinctive lime and lemon coating that provides definition and precision. The palate reveals beautiful orchard fruit with hints of apricot and wild peach, supported by fine acidity that drives through the rich fruit. There's a creamy richness balanced by crystalline purity, with subtle nutty notes adding savory complexity. The wine shows remarkable mix of richness, grace, and drive."}

records.name: Chateau De Jonquieres Languedoc 2020
records.description: A distinguished red wine from one of the oldest family wine estates in Languedoc, continuously passed down since the 12th century. Under the direction of Alsatian-born winemaker Clément Mengus, this organically and biodynamically farmed wine showcases freshness and aromatic complexity from the Terrasses du Larzac appellation.
records.varietal: Blend of Carignan, Syrah, Mourvèdre, and Grenache
records.region: AOP Languedoc, Terrasses du Larzac, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals a complex bouquet of dark red and black fruits - blackberry, black cherry, and plum - intermingled with garrigue herbs typical of the Languedoc. Notes of wild thyme, rosemary, and lavender add a distinctly Mediterranean character, while subtle hints of black olive and earth provide savory depth. A touch of spice - black pepper and clove - emerges with aeration, along with delicate floral notes that speak to the wine's freshness and biodynamic farming.","finish":"The finish is long and harmonious with persistent dark fruit and herbal notes. Fine tannins provide gentle grip, while the wine's refreshing acidity keeps it lively and food-friendly. A subtle mineral edge adds definition to the satisfying conclusion.","palate":"On the palate, this blend of Carignan, Syrah, Mourvèdre, and Grenache shows remarkable balance and refreshing lightness of touch. The wine delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors - cassis, blackberry, and dark plum - supported by fine, integrated tannins that provide structure without heaviness. The wide temperature variations from day to night during the growing season have encouraged slow, progressive growth, resulting in a wine with excellent freshness and aromatic complexity. Mid-palate flavors reveal hints of dried herbs, black olive tapenade, and a subtle mineral edge. The texture is silky and refined, showing the benefits of organic and biodynamic viticulture."}

records.name: Conde Villar Red 2021
records.description: An elegant red wine from Quinta das Arcas in Portugal's Vinho Verde region, crafted primarily from the indigenous Vinhão grape variety. This wine challenges perceptions of Vinho Verde as purely white and light, offering structure, complexity, and the distinctive character of Portugal's Minho region.
records.varietal: Primarily Vinhão with possible other indigenous varieties
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose displays intense ruby-red aromatics with fresh and fruity character. Aromas of plum and very ripe wild berries lead the way, complemented by notes of rockrose and macerated red fruits. Subtle fragrances reminiscent of high-quality grape marc add complexity, while delicate floral notes - particularly violets - provide elegance. Hints of black cherry, blackberry, and blueberry create a ripe, inviting bouquet with well-marked acidity keeping everything lifted.","finish":"The finish is long and elegant with persistent red fruit flavors. Soft, integrated tannins provide gentle grip, while the wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for another sip.","palate":"The wine shows strong structure that is dense and concentrated, yet maintains elegance and smoothness. Flavors of ripe red fruits - blueberries, black cherries, and blackberries - dominate, with subtle floral fragrances adding complexity. The tannins are soft, well-incorporated, and firm but fruity, providing framework without astringency. The texture is creamy and well-structured with fantastic acidity that keeps the wine fresh and vibrant. Despite its concentration, the wine remains balanced and food-friendly, showing the best of what Vinho Verde reds can achieve."}

records.name: Grateful Palate Strong Arms 2018
records.description: A bold and structured red wine from the 2018 vintage, crafted by Grateful Palate's winemaking team. This wine demonstrates concentration, depth, and aging potential, suggesting a premium blend or single varietal showcasing ripe fruit character balanced with complexity from careful oak aging.
records.varietal: Likely Bordeaux blend or Rhône blend given structure and power
records.region: Unknown (research indicated general premium red wine characteristics)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals concentrated aromas of dark fruits—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—suggesting ripe fruit at harvest and quality winemaking. Secondary aromas of vanilla, cedar, and baking spices indicate careful oak aging, likely in a combination of new and used barrels. Hints of tobacco leaf, dark chocolate, and espresso add complexity and depth. Subtle notes of violets and dried herbs provide lift and freshness to the rich aromatic profile. The wine's intensity suggests significant concentration from low yields or old vines.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent with lingering dark fruit and oak-derived spice. Firm yet refined tannins provide structure and suggest excellent aging potential. Hints of coffee and dark chocolate emerge on the aftertaste, along with subtle earthy notes that add complexity.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with well-integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness. The palate showcases ripe dark fruit flavors—blackberry, boysenberry, and black plum—with excellent concentration and depth. Oak influence is present but balanced, contributing notes of vanilla, mocha, and sweet spice that complement rather than overwhelm the fruit. The wine's generous alcohol is well-integrated, adding warmth and weight without any burning sensation. Layers of complexity unfold with dark chocolate, espresso, and earthy notes adding interest and depth."}

records.name: TVH Block 5 Cabernet Franc 2018
records.description: A distinguished single-block Cabernet Franc showcasing the variety's potential for elegance and complexity. The 2018 vintage allowed for extended hang time, producing concentrated fruit with refined tannins. This wine represents a focused expression of terroir-driven Cabernet Franc from a specific vineyard parcel.
records.region: Unknown (likely premium wine region based on single-block designation)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with captivating aromas of ripe red currant, crushed violets, and dark cherry. Secondary notes of graphite, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs add savory complexity, while hints of espresso and dark chocolate from oak aging provide depth. A distinctive bell pepper note adds classic varietal character without dominating. The aromatics suggest careful vineyard management and physiological ripeness.","finish":"The finish is persistent and refined, with fine-grained tannins and lingering flavors of red fruit and dried herbs. A subtle minerality emerges on the close, with hints of graphite and iron. The length suggests excellent aging potential and structural integrity.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with silky tannins that coat the palate gracefully. Flavors of black raspberry, cassis, and wild strawberry merge with earthy undertones of forest floor and crushed stone. The wine shows excellent mid-palate density with bright acidity providing structure and freshness. Notes of cedar, black tea, and a touch of cracked black pepper add layers of complexity. The integration of fruit, oak, and tannin suggests thoughtful winemaking and proper cellar time."}

records.name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Grenache Blanc 2016
records.description: Part of Pomar Junction's Cotes de Pomar Blanc, a Mediterranean-inspired white blend from the El Pomar District of Paso Robles. This wine showcases Grenache Blanc as 40% of a thoughtful blend with Roussanne and Viognier, creating a distinctive expression of the region's warm-climate white wine potential.
records.region: El Pomar District, Paso Robles, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals subtle tropical character that grows in the glass, featuring papaya, banana flower, and candied honeysuckle. Delicate tuberose and white flower aromatics float above ripe tropical fruit notes. The light color belies aromatic intensity that develops with air exposure.","finish":"The finish features persistent tropical fruit sweetness balanced by crisp acidity, leaving impressions of ripe stone fruit and honeyed florals.","palate":"Clean and refreshing on the palate with decent acidity providing structure to candied tropical flavors. Mango, guava, and banana notes dominate the mid-palate, showing the wine's ripe, sun-drenched fruit character. The Grenache Blanc contributes weight and texture, while Roussanne adds complexity and Viognier lends floral aromatics and stone fruit nuances."}

records.name: Grand Marchand Bordeaux Rouge Reserve 2019
records.description: A solid, well-structured Bordeaux rouge from the eastern reaches of Entre-deux-Mers, produced by Les Vignerons R�unis de Mons�gur cooperative. This Cabernet-dominant blend offers classic Right Bank character with firm structure and generous dark fruit, representing excellent value from a cooperative known for quality.
records.varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blend
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark ruby in color with beautiful aromatics showcasing light pepper spice, vanilla, and cassis. The nose reveals dark red fruit character alongside black currant and subtle chalky mineral notes.
