Hints of cedar and dried herbs emerge with air, alongside the vanilla and spice from oak aging.","finish":"The finish is solid and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit notes and fine-grained tannins. Ready to drink now, showing good integration and balance that makes it approachable for current enjoyment.","palate":"The palate is awash with rich, dense cassis flavors that form the wine's core, supported by a good proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc in the blend. Fine tannins provide structure without harshness, while black currant fruit balances firm, dry tannins characteristic of the vintage. A hint of chalky minerality adds terroir expression and complexity to the fruit-forward profile."}

records.name: Apple Tree Lane Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough, likely from the Orchard Lane Wines portfolio which celebrates the region's exceptional terroir for this variety. The 2024 vintage showcases the explosive aromatics and intense fruit character that have made Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc world-famous, with impressive depth and texture that elevate it beyond simple fruit-forward wines.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose delivers classic Marlborough intensity with passionfruit and lime popsicle aromas leaping from the glass. Tropical notes of mango blend with gooseberry, nettle, and white floral blossoms, particularly elderflower. Underlying mineral notes and hints of snow pea add savory complexity to the fruit-forward aromatics. The bouquet demonstrates lovely aromatic depth with layers of stonefruit and citrus.","finish":"The finish is long and invigorating, with crisp acidity carrying citrus and tropical fruit notes well after swallowing. Lime zest and passionfruit linger alongside mineral freshness, creating a clean, mouth-watering conclusion.","palate":"Medium-light bodied with slippery texture and gentle mouthfeel that belies impressive flavor depth. The palate bursts with ripe tropical fruit including passionfruit, mango, and lime, balanced by crisp citrus notes and herbal undertones of gooseberry and snow pea. Peach and elderflower flavors emerge mid-palate, supported by bright acidity that creates refreshing vibrancy. The wine shows heaps of character with long flavor persistence."}

records.name: Lolea Citrus Spritz
records.description: A sophisticated Spanish wine cocktail that elevates the traditional spritz concept. This ready-to-serve aperitif combines Spanish white wine with basil and bergamot botanicals, creating a refreshing alternative to traditional wine service. At 8% alcohol and using only natural grape sugars, Lolea offers a lighter, more complex option for modern entertaining.
records.varietal: Spanish white wine blend with basil and bergamot botanicals
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals delicate lemon-yellow hues matched by fresh citrus aromatics that blend seamlessly with complex herbal notes of basil. Bergamot contributes distinctive Earl Grey tea-like citrus character alongside bright lemon and lime. The botanical elements provide sophistication beyond simple fruity cocktails, with honeysuckle and jasmine florals adding layers of complexity.","finish":"Crisp and invigorating finish with lingering citrus zest and herbal notes. The combination of wine acidity, botanical complexity, and gentle bubbles creates a refreshing, appetite-stimulating conclusion perfect for aperitif service.","palate":"The palate strikes a perfect balance between lively wine acidity and herbal botanical notes from bergamot and basil. Fresh citrus flavors lead, followed by sophisticated herbal undertones that blossom over time to reveal full richness. Light and refreshing at first sip, the wine's botanical aromas develop complexity as the wine warms slightly. Fine, persistent effervescence provides elegant sparkle and textural interest throughout."}

records.name: Castoro Cellars Zinfusion 2021
records.description: A bold and approachable red blend from Paso Robles that combines Zinfandel with complementary varietals. Castoro Cellars' Zinfusion showcases the rich, fruit-forward character of California's Central Coast with a modern, accessible style perfect for everyday enjoyment.
records.varietal: Zinfandel blend with Syrah, Petite Sirah, and Cabernet Sauvignon
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry and boysenberry jam, interwoven with hints of cherry cola and vanilla bean. Secondary notes of baking spices, particularly cinnamon and clove, emerge alongside subtle whispers of toasted oak and dark chocolate. A faint floral undertone of violet adds complexity to the otherwise fruit-driven bouquet.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long, with lingering notes of dark berry fruit and subtle oak spice. A pleasant warmth from the alcohol content persists, along with a hint of cocoa powder and dried herbs that fade gently on the palate.","palate":"On the palate, this medium to full-bodied wine delivers waves of concentrated dark fruit flavors, led by blackberry compote and plum preserves. The ripe fruit is balanced by well-integrated tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate reveals layers of mocha, sweet tobacco, and a touch of black pepper spice. The wine's approachable nature is enhanced by bright acidity that keeps the richness in check and adds vibrancy to each sip."}

records.name: Calyptra Mosaiko Pinot Noir 2024
records.description: Calyptra's Mosaiko Pinot Noir represents a modern interpretation of this noble grape, showcasing vibrant fruit and elegant structure. The 2024 vintage captures fresh aromatics and silky texture characteristic of well-crafted Pinot Noir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Bright red fruit aromatics dominate the nose, featuring fresh strawberry, raspberry, and red cherry. Delicate floral notes of rose petal and violet add elegance, while subtle earthy undertones of forest floor and damp leaves provide depth. A whisper of sweet spice and cola completes the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is refined and persistent, with lingering red fruit flavors and a touch of minerality. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh and clean, inviting the next sip.","palate":"Medium-bodied with silky texture, the palate reveals layers of red fruit including cranberry, pomegranate, and wild strawberry. The wine shows beautiful balance between fruit purity and earthy complexity, with hints of mushroom and tea leaf adding interest. Fine tannins provide structure without heaviness."}

records.name: Antonio Facchin Prosecco Extra Dry 2024
records.description: A vibrant and festive Prosecco from the Veneto region that embodies the classic Italian sparkling style. Antonio Facchin's Extra Dry expression offers delicate effervescence and fresh fruit character, perfect for celebratory occasions or as an elegant aperitif.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is lifted and aromatic, bursting with scents of crisp green apple, Asian pear, and white peach. Floral notes of acacia blossoms and elderflower add elegance, while subtle hints of lemon verbena and honeydew melon provide freshness. A light waft of wet stone minerality and yeasty bread dough from the fermentation process adds textural interest to the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with delicate fruit flavors fading into a whisper of almond skin and white flowers. The fine bubbles continue to energize the palate, leaving a refreshing sensation that invites another sip.","palate":"Bright and lively on entry, the wine displays gentle bubbles that create a creamy mousse-like texture across the palate. Flavors of orchard fruits—particularly Golden Delicious apple and Bartlett pear—dominate, enhanced by nuances of citrus blossom and candied lemon peel. The Extra Dry designation means a touch of residual sweetness balances the wine's natural acidity, creating an off-dry profile that is refreshing rather than sugary. A subtle salinity and mineral backbone keep the wine focused and prevents it from becoming too fruit-forward."}

records.name: Finca Buenaventura Aureo Malbec 2019
records.description: From the prestigious Uco Valley at 1,174 meters altitude in the foothills of the Andes Mountains, this Punto Aureo Malbec represents the pinnacle of high-altitude Argentine winemaking. Estate vines drink pristine snowmelt from the Andes and bask under brilliant blue skies, producing grapes of exceptional concentration and purity that are aged in a combination of French and American oak.
records.region: Uco Valley, Mendoza, Argentina - 1,174 meters altitude
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The wine displays a striking violet-black hue in the glass, immediately signaling its concentration. Bold and fruit-forward on the nose, it opens with intense aromas of ripe blackberry and black plum, complemented by seductive hints of dark chocolate and vanilla from oak aging. Floral notes of violet add elegance, while subtle hints of mocha and spice suggest the wine's complexity and careful barrel selection.","finish":"The finish is lingering and satisfying, with dark fruit flavors persisting alongside soft tannins and subtle oak influences. Notes of dark chocolate and espresso emerge in the finale, adding sophistication and length. The wine's vibrant structure ensures a clean, fresh conclusion despite its richness and concentration.","palate":"Smooth and vibrant, the palate reveals multiple layers of dark fruit that unfold sequentially rather than simultaneously. Ripe blackberry leads, followed by black cherry, plum, and hints of blueberry, each distinct yet harmoniously integrated. The wine's high-altitude origins contribute fresh acidity that balances the fruit richness, while 12 months in 20% new French and American oak adds structure, vanilla notes, and a touch of toasted spice without overwhelming the pure fruit expression."}

records.name: Chateau Maris Natural Selection (Red) Syrah-Grenache 2017
records.description: A certified biodynamic wine from Minervois-La Livinière, crafted by English visionary Robert Eden at the world's first hemp cellar. Certified by both Demeter and Biodyvin, this wine represents supercharged organic farming at its finest. Blending 60% Syrah with 40% Grenache, this is a wine that reflects terroir, philosophy, and environmental consciousness in every sip.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Open and expressive from the first pour, the nose reveals great aromatic complexity with layers of ripe black fruits leading the charge. Blackcurrants and elderberries dominate initially, followed by more nuanced characteristics including black pepper, garrigue herbs, and dried lavender. The biodynamic farming practices seem to amplify the wine's expression of place, with earthy undertones and mineral notes adding depth and intrigue to the fruit-forward profile.","finish":"Long and delicate, the finish belies the wine's power, showing refinement and elegance. Soft, integrated tannins provide structure without gripping, while the fruit and spice notes linger pleasantly. The biodynamic farming shines through in the purity of the finish, which is clean and expressive without any harshness or residual heat.","palate":"Supple and fruit-loaded, this medium-bodied wine delivers remarkable generosity and weight without heaviness. The Syrah component provides structure and spice with black pepper and herbs de Provence, while the Grenache contributes round, ripe red fruit and a fleshy texture. The wine shows beautiful integration despite its complexity, with each element supporting rather than competing with the others. The aromatic character follows through on the palate with additional notes of wild berries and Mediterranean herbs."}

records.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 1998
records.description: A magnificent example of aged Rioja Gran Reserva at its peak, this 1998 release from Bodegas Riojanas has developed stunning tertiary characteristics over more than two decades of aging. Rated 94 points by Wine Enthusiast (Editors' Choice) and 93 points by both Vinous and Decanter, this is classic Rioja in regal condition that beautifully showcases the elegance and complexity that extended aging brings to traditional Spanish winemaking.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is elegant and mature, displaying the hallmarks of perfectly aged Rioja. Floral notes of dried roses intermingle with cherry and raspberry, while aged wood contributes cedar, tobacco, and leather undertones. A lovely rustic character runs through the aromatics with barnyard notes that add complexity without detracting from the wine's refined nature. Hints of dried flowers, chocolate, and herbs create additional layers that reveal themselves gradually as the wine opens in the glass.","finish":"The finish is graceful and perfumed with excellent length and persistence. Dried fruit, leather, tobacco, and cedar continue to evolve, while bright acidity provides lift and freshness. The tannins are gentle and harmonious, fully integrated after decades of aging, creating a fleshy, satisfying conclusion that invites another sip.","palate":"In regal condition according to Wine Enthusiast, the palate demonstrates how beautifully Gran Reserva can age. Smooth, integrated tannins and balanced acidity frame classic flavors of dried cherry, red plum, and tart cranberry. Tertiary characteristics dominate with tobacco, leather, cedar, and earthy notes creating a complex, evolved flavor profile. A lovely animal thread provides rustic charm, while succulent herbs, vanillin oak spice, and black pepper add dimension. The wine is supple and lush despite its age, showing impressive concentration and focus that speaks to excellent winemaking and ideal storage."}

records.name: Heron Hill Baco Noir Reserve 2019
records.description: A Reserve bottling of Baco Noir, a French-American hybrid grape variety that thrives in the Finger Lakes' cool climate. Heron Hill's Reserve designation indicates their finest expression of this distinctive varietal, which produces nearly opaque, full-bodied wines with unique character. This wine showcases the potential of hybrid grapes in the hands of skilled winemakers in one of New York's premier wine regions.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Nearly opaque ruby in color with blue tones, the wine announces its concentration visually before the nose reveals abundant aromatics. Bramble and wild blackberry lead with rustic charm, followed by raisin, black currant, and distinctive earthy tones that speak to the Baco Noir grape's hybrid heritage. The wine's aromatic intensity is impressive, with layers that unfold gradually as the wine opens in the glass. Hints of forest floor and damp earth add complexity.","finish":"Long and fruit-driven, the finish emphasizes the wine's cherry and berry character while maintaining freshness through balanced acidity. The tannins are present but not aggressive, providing structure without astringency. Earthy notes linger alongside the fruit, creating a satisfying conclusion that invites food pairing.","palate":"Medium-to-full bodied with surprising depth and structure for a hybrid varietal. Strong cherry flavors dominate the initial impression, exactly as described by visitors who noted the \"strong cherry on the first sip.\" The wine transitions beautifully on the palate, revealing strawberry notes in the mid-palate that add a lighter, brighter dimension. Fresh acidity provides lift and balance, preventing the dark fruit and body from becoming heavy or cloying. The earthiness from the nose translates to savory undertones that add complexity and food-friendliness."}

records.name: Noble Hill Sur Lie Chenin Blanc 2021
records.description: Noble Hill Estate in South Africa's Simonsberg-Paarl region crafts this expressive Chenin Blanc using extended sur lie aging to add texture and complexity. The 2021 vintage showcases the versatility of Chenin Blanc, balancing fresh fruit with richer, more textural elements.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is inviting and multifaceted, offering ripe pear, golden apple, and quince alongside honeysuckle and acacia blossom. Sur lie aging contributes subtle notes of brioche, almond paste, and fresh bread dough that add richness without heaviness. Bright citrus notes of lemon zest and orange blossom provide lift, while hints of chamomile and wet stone add complexity. A subtle tropical element of guava and pineapple emerges with air.","finish":"Long and satisfying, the finish features lingering stone fruit and citrus flavors with a creamy texture from lees influence. Bright acidity provides a clean, refreshing conclusion while subtle nutty and mineral notes add complexity. The wine fades gracefully with hints of honey and white flowers.","palate":"Medium-bodied with excellent texture and a creamy, rounded mouthfeel from extended lees contact. The palate delivers flavors of ripe orchard fruits—apple, pear, and white peach—balanced by refreshing acidity that keeps the wine lively. Sur lie aging provides a yeasty, almost nutty quality that adds depth and complexity. Notes of honey, lanolin, and beeswax contribute richness, while citrus acidity maintains freshness and prevents the wine from becoming heavy. A mineral thread runs through the wine, adding structure and length. The balance between fruit concentration, textural complexity, and bright acidity is exemplary."}

records.name: Scheid Vineyards Rocklin Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
records.description: An estate Cabernet Sauvignon from the unique terroir of Arroyo Seco in Monterey County, where ancient volcanic foothills, the sunny Salinas Valley, Pacific Ocean wind and fog, and oversized river rocks create distinctive growing conditions. Scheid's certified sustainable vineyards (GLOBALG.A.P., BRC, and California Sustainable Winegrowing Alliance) produce approachable yet structured Cabernet with immediate enjoyability.
records.region: Arroyo Seco, Monterey County, California - Estate Vineyards
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is bold and inviting, showcasing classic Cabernet character with a Monterey twist. Ripe black plum and blackberry provide the foundation, while blueberry adds a unique dimension often found in cooler-climate Cabernet. Dark mocha and toasty vanilla from oak aging contribute richness and complexity without overwhelming the fruit. The aromatic profile balances power with elegance, hinting at the wine's structured yet approachable nature.","finish":"The finish is satisfying and moderately long, with dark fruit flavors persisting alongside well-integrated tannins. Notes of mocha and vanilla linger, while the wine's natural acidity keeps the conclusion fresh and balanced. The overall impression is one of richness tempered by elegance, structure balanced by approachability.","palate":"Full-bodied yet immediately enjoyable, this wine demonstrates how Monterey's cool coastal influence can create Cabernet with both intensity and accessibility. Concentrated flavors of black plum, blackberry, and blueberry layer across the palate, showing the purity and ripeness of fruit from Scheid's sustainably farmed estate vineyards. Dark mocha and toasted vanilla notes from oak aging add depth and a creamy texture, while the integrated tannins provide structure without harshness. The ancient volcanic soils and oversized rocks of the Arroyo Seco contribute a subtle mineral quality that adds complexity to the rich fruit."}

records.name: Costers Del Segre Petit Sios Blanco 2020
records.description: A vibrant white blend from Catalonia's Costers del Segre region, showcasing Mediterranean freshness. This wine reflects the high-altitude vineyards and continental climate that define this innovative Catalan appellation.
records.varietal: Blend of local white varieties (likely Macabeo, Parellada, Xarel·lo)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with inviting notes of white peach and green apple, complemented by delicate citrus blossom and hints of fennel. Subtle mineral undertones emerge, suggesting the limestone-rich soils of the region. A gentle herbal character adds complexity, with whispers of thyme and fresh-cut grass.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering notes of citrus and a saline minerality that calls for another sip. A subtle bitter almond note on the tail adds sophistication.","palate":"Medium-bodied with refreshing acidity that carries flavors of ripe pear and lemon zest across the palate. The mid-palate reveals layers of stone fruit, white flowers, and a touch of almond skin. The wine's texture is smooth yet energetic, with a fine phenolic grip that adds structure without heaviness."}

records.name: Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2018
records.description: A classic Rioja Gran Reserva from one of the region's historic producers, showcasing the elegance and complexity that comes from extended aging. This wine represents traditional Spanish winemaking at its finest, with time in both barrel and bottle developing layers of sophistication.
records.varietal: Tempranillo with possible Garnacha, Mazuelo, Graciano
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals mature complexity with an elegant bouquet of dried cherry, leather, and cedar. Secondary aromas of tobacco leaf, vanilla, and sweet spice emerge from extended oak aging. There's a distinctive earthiness—dried mushroom and forest floor—alongside notes of preserved plum and dark chocolate. Subtle hints of balsamic and dried herbs add further dimension.","finish":"Long and satisfying, with the fruit and oak elements in harmonious balance. Lingering notes of dried fruit, sweet tobacco, and a hint of orange peel persist, while fine-grained tannins provide subtle structure through the extended finish.","palate":"The palate shows beautiful integration, with silky tannins fully resolved from years of aging. Flavors of red cherry compote and cranberry are interlaced with savory notes of cured meat, cigar box, and roasted coffee bean. The American and French oak influence is evident but refined, contributing vanilla, coconut, and toasted spice. Mid-palate richness is balanced by bright acidity that keeps the wine fresh despite its age."}

records.name: Finca Buenaventura Descarriados Gran Malbec 2018
records.description: A powerful Argentine Malbec that showcases the depth and concentration possible from high-altitude Mendoza vineyards. This 'Gran' Malbec represents a premium selection, likely from older vines and extended oak aging, delivering intensity and complexity.
records.region: Mendoza, Argentina (likely Luján de Cuyo or Uco Valley)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Intensely aromatic with concentrated notes of blackberry, cassis, and black plum dominating the bouquet. The nose reveals layers of complexity with violet florals, dark chocolate, and espresso emerging. Oak influence is apparent through vanilla, toasted oak, and sweet spice notes of clove and cinnamon. Subtle hints of dried herbs, graphite, and leather add sophistication.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with the dark fruit flavors slowly fading to reveal oak spice, cocoa, and a touch of tobacco. The tannins remain present but refined, suggesting good aging potential.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured, with ripe black fruit flavors filling the mouth. The palate shows dark berry compote, blackcurrant, and plum sauce, supported by notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and caramelized oak. The wine's structure is substantial, with firm but ripe tannins providing backbone. Despite the power, there's balance from the high-altitude acidity that prevents heaviness. Underlying minerality and a hint of black pepper add complexity."}

records.name: Shadowbox Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
records.description: Shadowbox crafts this elegant Napa Valley Cabernet from select vineyard sites, showcasing the exceptional 2013 vintage. This wine represents the pinnacle of Napa winemaking with structured tannins and impressive aging potential.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with concentrated aromas of blackcurrant and blackberry, layered with notes of dark chocolate and espresso. Cedar and tobacco leaf emerge with air, complemented by hints of vanilla and baking spices from careful oak integration. Subtle violet and crushed rock minerality add complexity to the bouquet.","finish":"The finish is long and persistent, with lingering flavors of dark berries and cocoa powder. Fine-grained tannins provide grip without astringency, while the wine's natural acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion.","palate":"Full-bodied and powerful, the palate delivers ripe black fruit flavors of cassis, plum, and black cherry. Mid-palate richness is supported by firm yet polished tannins, with integrated oak contributing mocha and toasted walnut nuances. The wine shows excellent structure with bright acidity balancing the concentrated fruit."}

records.name: Anko Cabernet Sauvignon Flor de Cardon 2019
records.description: Anko's Flor de Cardon vineyard produces exceptional Cabernet Sauvignon from high-altitude terroir. The 2019 vintage showcases concentrated fruit, structural elegance, and the distinctive character of this premium site.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with intense aromas of blackberry, cassis, and dark plum, accented by notes of crushed violets and graphite. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco add complexity, while hints of eucalyptus and sage reflect the terroir. Oak influence is well-integrated with vanilla and cedar notes.","finish":"The finish is impressive in length, with layers of dark fruit, baking spices, and minerality. Polished tannins persist alongside bright acidity, creating a harmonious conclusion.","palate":"Concentrated and powerful on the palate, this Cabernet delivers flavors of black fruit compote, boysenberry, and black cherry. The wine shows remarkable density balanced by fresh acidity, with flavors of dark cocoa, black tea, and charred oak. Firm, structured tannins provide backbone for aging."}

records.name: Cobden Wini Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: Cobden's Wini Sauvignon Blanc captures the essence of this aromatic variety with crisp acidity and vibrant fruit expression. The 2024 vintage showcases fresh, lively character perfect for immediate enjoyment.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose bursts with classic Sauvignon Blanc aromatics of grapefruit, lime zest, and passion fruit. Fresh cut grass and gooseberry add herbal complexity, while hints of white flowers and wet stone provide elegance. A subtle tropical note of guava emerges with air.","finish":"The finish is clean and crisp, with lingering citrus flavors and a pleasant minerality. Mouthwatering acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that invites another glass.","palate":"Bright and refreshing on the palate, the wine delivers flavors of citrus, green apple, and tropical fruit. Zesty acidity drives the palate forward, with notes of lemon verbena and fresh herbs adding interest. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit intensity and mineral freshness."}

records.name: TVH The Boss Block 8 Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
records.description: TVH's flagship The Boss from Block 8 represents their finest Cabernet Sauvignon parcel. This single-block wine showcases intense concentration, complex structure, and exceptional aging potential from a distinctive terroir.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is powerfully aromatic with concentrated black fruit including blackcurrant, black plum, and boysenberry. Layers of graphite, crushed rock, and wet earth add mineral complexity, while notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and cigar box contribute depth. Well-integrated oak brings cedar, vanilla, and hints of cinnamon.","finish":"The finish is exceptionally long and layered, with waves of dark fruit, tobacco, and mineral notes. Structured tannins persist alongside vibrant acidity, promising excellent development over decades.","palate":"Massively structured yet balanced, the palate delivers intense flavors of black fruit, cassis liqueur, and dark cherry. The wine shows remarkable density and power, with firm tannins providing backbone for extended aging. Notes of black licorice, dark chocolate, and charred oak add complexity, while fresh acidity maintains elegance."}

records.name: Boxwood Ellie Bird Topiary (Private Label) 2022
records.description: Boxwood's Ellie Bird Topiary is a distinctive private label offering showcasing elegant Bordeaux-style blending. This wine represents the estate's commitment to balanced, food-friendly wines with refined character.
records.varietal: Bordeaux blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with aromas of red and black currant, complemented by notes of ripe plum and cherry. Subtle herbal elements of sage and thyme add complexity, while hints of cedar, vanilla, and violet provide elegance. A touch of graphite and forest floor adds earthiness.","finish":"The finish is harmonious and persistent, with fine-grained tannins and lingering fruit flavors. A touch of minerality and spice adds interest to the clean conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with supple texture, the palate reveals flavors of dark cherry, cassis, and blackberry. The wine shows excellent integration of fruit, oak, and tannin, with notes of cocoa, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs. Balanced acidity provides structure and freshness throughout."}

records.name: Maison Roche de Bellene Bourgogne Chardonnay Cuvee Reserve 2021
records.description: Maison Roche de Bellene crafts this elegant Bourgogne Chardonnay from select parcels across Burgundy. The Cuvée Reserve showcases classic Burgundian character with precision, minerality, and refined oak integration.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals classic Burgundian aromatics of crisp apple, white peach, and citrus blossom. Subtle notes of hazelnut, toasted brioche, and butter emerge from careful oak aging, while hints of chalk and wet stone provide mineral complexity. Delicate white flowers and meyer lemon add freshness.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering citrus and mineral notes. Well-integrated oak contributes a subtle richness while acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion.","palate":"Medium-bodied with creamy texture, the palate delivers flavors of green apple, lemon curd, and white stone fruit. The wine shows beautiful balance between fruit purity and oak influence, with notes of vanilla, crème brûlée, and toasted almond adding depth. Bright acidity and mineral tension provide structure and energy."}

records.name: Rhulmann Cremant D'Alsace Brut NV
records.description: An elegant traditional method sparkling wine from Alsace, France, crafted from classic Alsatian white grape varieties. This Crémant showcases the refined character of Alsatian winemaking, delivering a sophisticated alternative to Champagne with the distinctive terroir influence of the region's sunny, dry climate producing riper grapes and more generous, rounded flavors than its northern counterpart.
records.varietal: Blend of Pinot Blanc, Auxerrois, and Pinot Gris
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with subtle restraint, revealing delicate hints of ripe apple and white peach that suggest freshness and ease. Fine floral notes intermingle with fruity undertones of white peach and apricot, creating an inviting aromatic bouquet. Slight yeasty character emerges on further inspection, adding complexity to the otherwise pristine fruit-forward profile. The aromatics are elegant rather than assertive, with very fine persistent bubbles carrying hazelnut nuances that speak to the wine's time on lees.","finish":"The finish is dry and refreshing, with slight yeastiness rounding out the citrus and stone fruit notes. The wine shows remarkable persistence, leaving a clean, mineral-tinged impression that invites the next sip. Fine bubbles continue to dance on the palate through the finish, maintaining the wine's lively character to the very end.","palate":"Creamy and mellow on entry, the palate delivers hints of lemon and baked apple with something nutty around the edges of this elegant, light-bodied wine. Ripe juiciness emerges on the light, dry body, made lively by the frothing mousse and fine persistent bubbles. The fresh attack presents excellent balance and persistence, with peach and hazelnut notes adding depth without sacrificing the wine's fundamental freshness. The texture is simultaneously fruity and balanced, offering roundness full of character while maintaining a pleasant, clean profile."}

records.name: Trespass Cabernet Sauvignon Magnum 2018  1500 ml
records.description: A distinguished single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon from St. Helena in Napa Valley's renowned Rutherford AVA, presented in an impressive magnum format. This limited-production wine (only 380 cases) showcases the elegant character of the 2018 vintage, which benefited from higher yields and extended hang time, resulting in exceptional aromatics and a substantial mid-palate. The wine represents the pinnacle of precision viticulture and winemaking artistry.
records.region: St. Helena, Rutherford AVA, Napa Valley, California
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is captivating with bright, racy red fruit and hard candies that immediately engage the senses. Fresh aromas of dark cherries mingle with bright clove and cassis, creating a complex aromatic tapestry. The wine displays remarkable purity, with the oak providing just the right amount of vanillin incense and structure without overwhelming the pristine fruit character. Subtle hints of graphite and dusty mineral notes speak to the Rutherford terroir, while the aromatic profile suggests elegance over power, finesse over extraction.","finish":"The finish is long and dense, with smooth mineral undertones and pungent dark fruit flavors extending well beyond the swallow. Hints of chocolate emerge in the lengthy conclusion, accompanied by dusty Rutherford tannins that provide structure without astringency. The wine's remarkable balance ensures the finish remains compelling and complete, with flavors continuing to evolve and deepen even after the glass is empty. This is a wine that rewards contemplation and benefits from the additional aging potential that magnum format provides.","palate":"The palate begins with freshly sliced sweet black cherries and bright clove, immediately revealing the wine's impeccable balance. Cassis flavors interweave with red cherry fruit, supported by a small addition of Cabernet Franc (2%) and Malbec (3%) that adds aromatic lift and mid-palate complexity. The architecture is one of purity of fruit, finesse, character, and overall poise—more elegant than pushy, more refined than bold. The substantial mid-palate carries seamlessly toward a dense finish, with the wine's texture remaining plush and integrated throughout. This is modern Napa Cabernet at its most sophisticated, balancing power with precision."}

records.name: Thelema "Gargantua" Muscadel NV  500 ml
records.description: An extraordinary fortified Muscadel of exceptional age and complexity from South Africa's acclaimed Thelema Mountain Vineyards in Stellenbosch. This rare bottling spent an remarkable 18-21 years aging in French oak barrels before being released in limited quantities (4,866 bottles of 500ml). A wine of tremendous concentration and character, it represents one of South Africa's finest examples of traditional fortified wine production.
records.vintage: Non-Vintage (NV) - blended from extended barrel aging program
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Alluring and captivating, the nose reveals a symphony of oxidative and developed aromas that speak to the wine's extraordinary age. Toffee, molasses, and honeycomb dominate, interwoven with rich raisin notes and caramelized nuts that suggest decades in barrel. The aromatic complexity is remarkable, with each swirl revealing new layers—dried fruit compote, burnt sugar, toasted almonds, and sweet spice. There's a luxurious quality to the aromatics, simultaneously rich and refined, decadent yet balanced. The intensity is matched by elegance, demonstrating that age has brought integration rather than fatigue.","finish":"The finish is extraordinarily long and lingering, extending for minutes after the last sip with waves of toffee, nuts, and oxidative complexity. The sweetness gradually fades to reveal subtle bitter chocolate and espresso notes, while the warmth of fortification provides a satisfying glow. This is a contemplative wine that demands attention and rewards patience, with the finish alone justifying the wine's critical acclaim and limited production.","palate":"The palate is profoundly rich and luscious, delivering concentrated flavors that fill the mouth with velvety texture and complex sweetness. Toffee and molasses continue from the nose, joined by layers of dried fig, date, and raisin that have been intensified by barrel evolution. Caramelized nuts—particularly hazelnuts and almonds—provide textural interest and savory counterpoint to the wine's natural sweetness. The fortification is seamlessly integrated, providing warmth and structure without any harsh alcohol presence. Despite the wine's richness, there's remarkable balance, with the oak influence adding spice and tannic grip that prevents cloying."}

records.name: La Domitienne Picpoul 2023
records.description: A vibrant, mineral-driven white wine from the Picpoul de Pinet appellation in Languedoc, southern France. Produced by the Vignerons de Montagnac cooperative under the La Domitienne label, this wine showcases the distinctive saline character of the Picpoul grape grown near the Mediterranean's Étang de Thau lagoon. The 2023 vintage captures the grape's signature lip-stinging acidity and refreshing qualities.
records.region: Picpoul de Pinet AOC, Languedoc, France
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is expressive and inviting, revealing soft delicate florals of acacia and hawthorn blossom that speak to the wine's Mediterranean origins. Floral notes intermingle with pronounced mineral undertones—wet stones and sea spray that evoke the nearby coastline. Fresh citrus emerges with hints of lemon zest and mixed citrus fruits, while subtle notes of clotted cream and lanolin add unexpected complexity. There's a distinct marine quality to the aromatics, with the iodine-tinged salinity becoming more apparent as the wine opens. Green apple and stone fruit nuances round out the aromatic profile, suggesting the wine's texture will deliver more than simple citrus refreshment.","finish":"The finish is defined by cleansing minerality and crisp acidity that leave the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip—or the next bite of food. Citrus and stone fruit flavors gradually fade to reveal the wine's saline, iodine-tinged core, with wet stone notes lingering pleasantly. The finish is clean and precise, medium in length, with just a hint of herbal complexity emerging at the end. This is quintessential Picpoul—refreshing, food-friendly, and utterly Mediterranean in character.","palate":"The palate surprises with its viscous, rich texture—fuller-bodied than the delicate nose might suggest. Stone fruit flavors dominate, with white peach and ripe pear providing a lush core that's balanced by the grape's naturally mouth-watering acidity. Green apple and yellow citrus notes add brightness and precision, while the distinctive saline minerality runs through the wine like a thread, providing structure and a sense of place. The texture is simultaneously rich and refreshing, loaded with flavor yet finishing clean. This is bone dry with medium body, showing the characteristic 'lip-stinger' acidity that gives Picpoul its name, though the 2023 vintage offers more generosity than austerity."}

records.name: Mountain Brook Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
records.description: A distinctive Cabernet Sauvignon from the Tryon foothills of Western North Carolina, where Mountain Brook Vineyards has been cultivating premium vinifera grapes since 2002. This family-owned estate represents the ambitious spirit of North Carolina winemaking, producing Bordeaux-style wines in the Blue Ridge Mountain foothills. The 2021 vintage showcases how careful viticulture in this emerging region can produce serious, food-friendly red wines with regional character.
records.region: Tryon, North Carolina (Blue Ridge Mountain foothills)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with classic Cabernet characteristics adapted to North Carolina terroir—dark cherry and blackcurrant aromas form the core, complemented by notes of cedar and subtle herbs. There's an appealing freshness to the aromatics, with bright red fruit notes of raspberry and red cherry adding lift to the darker fruit core. Hints of tobacco leaf and dried herbs suggest the wine has seen some oak influence, while maintaining a sense of place that speaks to the cooler mountain climate. The aromatic profile is medium in intensity, inviting rather than assertive, with earthy undertones that add complexity without overwhelming the fruit.","finish":"The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to subtle earthy and herbal notes. Tannins provide grip without astringency, while the wine's natural acidity keeps the finish fresh and balanced. There's a pleasant minerality that emerges in the conclusion, speaking to the mountain terroir, along with hints of cedar and dried tobacco leaf. This is a finish that invites food pairing, with structure and freshness that would complement rich meats and aged cheeses.","palate":"The palate delivers medium-bodied structure with ripe dark fruit flavors balanced by the natural acidity characteristic of higher-elevation viticulture. Black cherry and cassis provide the flavor core, while subtle oak influence adds notes of vanilla and baking spice without dominating. The texture shows refinement, with tannins that are present but not aggressive—polished and integrated enough for current enjoyment while providing structure for near-term aging. There's a regional character here that differs from California Cabernet: less power and concentration, but more elegance and food compatibility. The wine shows genuine varietal character while expressing its unique provenance in the Tryon foothills."}

records.name: Clos d'Audhuy Les Polissons 2023
records.description: A vibrant, approachable Malbec from Cahors in Southwest France, the birthplace of this noble grape. 'Les Polissons' (meaning 'the rascals') represents Clos d'Audhuy's youthful, fruit-forward expression of 30-year-old Malbec vines. This wine captures the essence of modern Cahors—maintaining the region's characteristic depth and structure while emphasizing juicy drinkability and fresh fruit over the austere tannins of traditional 'black wine' styles.
records.region: Cahors AOC, Southwest France (not Loire as sometimes mistaken)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is immediately expressive with marked black fruit notes, particularly blueberry and blackcurrant that announce the wine's youthful energy. A fascinating array of herbaceous aromatics emerges—pine, thyme, rosemary, and mint that speak to the garrigue landscape of Southwest France. Spiced notes add complexity: white pepper provides lift, while hints of blond tobacco and turmeric suggest depth beyond simple fruit. There's an appealing smokiness woven throughout, adding intrigue without heaviness. The clean, black robe in the glass hints at the concentrated fruit within, while the aromatic profile balances between fruit purity and savory complexity.","finish":"The finish balances soft texture with structural power, as the velvety tannins maintain their presence without turning aggressive. Black fruit flavors persist with good length, gradually revealing the wine's tannic frame and subtle smoky, herbal undertones. The conclusion is both satisfying and moreish, with enough freshness to cleanse the palate while leaving an impression of concentrated fruit and spice. This is approachable Cahors that doesn't sacrifice character for drinkability—a wine that works equally well for casual enjoyment or thoughtful food pairing.","palate":"The palate is simultaneously soft and powerful—a remarkable achievement that defines this modern Cahors style. Juicy black fruit flavors of blackcurrant and blueberry dominate, delivered with gourmand appeal and immediate pleasure. The structure shows firm, affirmed tannins that provide backbone without astringency, maintaining drinkability despite the wine's evident concentration. The texture is velvety and approachable, with fine concentrated sweetness (from ripe fruit, not residual sugar) that makes this instantly appealing. Herbaceous notes from the nose carry through, adding complexity and preventing the fruit from becoming monotonous. This is elaborated to be fruity and accessible, ready to drink young while hinting at the variety's traditional power."}

records.name: Terra Dives Riah Nero d'Avola 2020
records.description: A distinguished expression of Sicily's signature red grape variety from the Mazara del Vallo area of western Sicily. Terra Dives crafts this Nero d'Avola from hand-harvested grapes grown in clayey soils at 150 meters elevation, capturing the variety's characteristic depth and spice while maintaining Mediterranean freshness. This wine represents the modern, fruit-forward style of Sicilian winemaking that emphasizes varietal character and terroir expression.
records.region: Sicilia DOC, Mazara del Vallo area, Western Sicily
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with an intense bouquet of ripe black fruits—blackberry, black cherry, and dark plum dominate with generous intensity. Aromatic complexity builds with notes of wild strawberries and pomegranate adding brightness to the darker fruit core. Spice elements emerge prominently: sweet tobacco, liquorice, and peppery notes that give Nero d'Avola its distinctive 'spice of Sicily' character. Subtle hints of leather and Mediterranean herbs add savory complexity, while the warm vintage delivers notes of cocoa and wild fruit that suggest richness on the palate. There's an appealing combination of ripe fruit purity and savory depth that makes this immediately engaging.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with the wine's spice character becoming more prominent as fruit flavors fade. Dried fruit notes emerge, along with hints of fennel, tobacco, and subtle tar that suggest the wine's aging potential. The tannins are smooth and sweet, providing structure without astringency, while the finish maintains the wine's fundamental balance between fruit richness and savory complexity. This conclusion is satisfying and complete, inviting food pairing while demonstrating the wine's standalone appeal.","palate":"The palate is medium to full-bodied with robust structure and smooth, sweet tannins characteristic of well-ripened Nero d'Avola. Ripe black cherries and plum flavors form the core, delivering concentrated fruit character without excess weight. The variety's signature spiciness carries through—peppery notes, liquorice, and sweet tobacco add layers of complexity and prevent the fruit from becoming monotonous. Cocoa and chocolate flavors suggest oak influence that's integrated rather than overt, providing structure and depth. The texture is plush yet maintains freshness, with moderate acidity balancing the ripe fruit and higher alcohol (14%+) typical of the variety. Wild fruit character and flawless spiciness create a compelling flavor profile that's simultaneously powerful and refined."}

records.name: Maison Ventenac Diane Rose 2021
records.description: A delicate and elegant rosé from the Cabardès appellation, named after the winemaker's niece. This wine showcases the perfect marriage of Mediterranean sunshine and Atlantic freshness, creating a sophisticated expression of Southern French rosé with exceptional finesse.
records.varietal: Blend of Mediterranean and Atlantic varietals typical of Cabardès
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is delicate and perfumed, opening with vibrant notes of red fruits including fresh strawberry and juicy raspberry. These primary fruit aromas are lifted by subtle floral hints and a gentle minerality that speaks to the terroir. The aromatic profile is bright and inviting, with excellent purity of fruit expression.","finish":"The finish is remarkably long with distinctive iodized notes that add complexity and a sense of place. Mineral undertones emerge alongside lingering strawberry and raspberry flavors, creating a refreshing conclusion that invites another sip. The wine maintains its freshness and vivacity right through to the end.","palate":"Fresh, voluminous and lively on the palate with beautiful texture and weight. The wine shows impressive structure for a rosé, with the red fruit flavors carrying through seamlessly from the nose. There's a wonderful sense of fullness without heaviness, and the acidity provides excellent balance and energy throughout the tasting experience."}

records.name: Pasquiers Gigondas 2021
records.description: An elegant Southern Rhône red from the prestigious Gigondas appellation, crafted by Domaine des Pasquiers. This Grenache-Syrah blend showcases the sun-drenched character of the region while maintaining exceptional balance and structure.
records.varietal: 50% Grenache, 50% Syrah from organically farmed vines
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals bright, sun-kissed plum and cherry flavors complemented by notes of jammy black cherries that dominate the aromatic profile. Delicate notes of wild thyme and mint speak to the garrigue landscape of the Southern Rhône, while white pepper adds a spicy dimension. Hints of wild herbs and Mediterranean scrubland create an evocative sense of place.","finish":"Long finish on spices and fruit, with the garrigue notes returning alongside jammy black cherry flavors. The exceptional length showcases harmonious integration of all elements, from the ripe fruit to the peppery spice. The wine concludes with lingering hints of wild herbs that echo the aromatic profile.","palate":"Beautiful structure and amplitude on the fruit define the palate experience. The wine shows generous, direct flavors with excellent balance between spicy notes and the freshness of the fruit. Well-structured yet delicate tannins provide framework without heaviness, allowing the bright cherry and plum flavors to shine through. There's an attractive fullness that gives the wine presence without overwhelming."}

records.name: Pinea PSOUL (wooden boxes) 2018  1500 ml
records.description: An ultra-rare, limited edition Ribera del Duero masterpiece presented in magnum format with only 333 bottles produced worldwide. The name 'PSOUL' stands for 'Pinea 500L,' referencing the single 500-liter cask used for production and aging. From the prestigious Cardisanto limestone plateau, this wine represents the pinnacle of Spanish winemaking.
records.region: Ribera del Duero DO, Castilla y León, Spain - Cardisanto limestone plateau microparcel
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"A spectacular blend of fruit, floral and spicy aromas creates an olfactory masterpiece. Dominant notes of blackberries, ripe black cherries, dried figs, strawberries and blackcurrants provide a foundation of concentrated fruit. Perfumed aromas of hibiscus, violets and lavender add an elegant floral dimension, while hints of tobacco leaves, fresh leather and cedar wood contribute complexity and sophistication.","finish":"Long and flavourful with harmonious integration of all elements. The finish showcases the wine's exceptional craftsmanship with lingering notes of dark fruit, coffee, and subtle smoke. The concrete vessel aging has created impressive texture and depth, while the limestone terroir contributes distinctive minerality that adds length and refinement to the conclusion.","palate":"Medium-bodied with a powerful yet elegant approach and a rich, velvety texture from beginning to end. Sweet black forest fruits, blackberries and ripe black plums blend seamlessly with aromas of eucalyptus and spices including clove and black pepper. Sculptured tannins are perfectly integrated, showing exceptional balance as they pass through the mouth. Vibrant acidity provides lift and energy, while mild flavors of nuts, coffee and smoke enrich the experience."}

records.name: Mate Brunello di Montalcino 2018
records.description: Mate's 2018 Brunello di Montalcino exemplifies the elegance and power of Sangiovese Grosso from this legendary Tuscan appellation. Crafted from 100% Sangiovese grown in the warm, dry hills of Montalcino, this wine underwent extended aging to meet DOCG requirements and develop its characteristic complexity.
records.region: Brunello di Montalcino DOCG, Tuscany, Italy
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Classic Brunello aromatics unfold with time in the glass, revealing layers of red cherry, wild strawberry, and dried cranberry. Floral notes of violet and rose petal emerge alongside earthy tones of leather saddle, turned earth, and forest undergrowth. The oak influence is subtle and well-integrated, contributing whispers of vanilla, cinnamon, and sweet tobacco. With air, hints of balsamic, dried herbs, and orange peel add additional complexity characteristic of Sangiovese.","finish":"Long and persistent, the finish showcases red fruit, leather, and a distinctive iron-like minerality. The tannins remain present and structured, indicating this wine needs several more years to reach its full potential. Notes of cherry pit, dried herbs, and a touch of coffee linger, with the wine's natural acidity keeping everything fresh and vibrant through the extended finish.","palate":"The palate is both powerful and refined, showcasing Brunello's signature combination of elegance and structure. Bright red fruit flavors of sour cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate are complemented by savory notes of dried mushroom, truffle, and black tea. The wine's acidity is pronounced but beautifully balanced, providing lift and energy to the concentrated fruit. Tannins are firm and grippy—typical of young Brunello—but show fine grain and excellent quality. The mid-palate reveals layers of complexity with each sip, displaying terroir-driven minerality and subtle spice."}

records.name: Noughty NA Rose Wine NV
records.description: Noughty Non-Alcoholic Rosé offers a sophisticated alcohol-free alternative that doesn't compromise on flavor or enjoyment. Crafted using gentle dealcoholization techniques, this rosé maintains the fresh, fruity characteristics that make rosé wines so appealing, perfect for health-conscious consumers or any occasion calling for a lighter option.
records.varietal: Rosé blend (typically Grenache, Syrah, or similar varieties pre-dealcoholization)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Delicate and refreshing, the nose presents classic rosé aromatics of fresh strawberries, watermelon, and white peach. Floral notes of rose petals and orange blossom add elegance and lift. Subtle hints of citrus zest—lemon and grapefruit—provide brightness. The overall impression is clean, fresh, and inviting, with no off-notes from the dealcoholization process.","finish":"The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of red berries and citrus. A gentle acidity keeps the palate lively while subtle floral notes provide elegance. The wine leaves you wanting another sip—exactly what you want in a rosé.","palate":"Light-bodied and crisp, the palate delivers vibrant red berry flavors of raspberry, wild strawberry, and cranberry. A touch of stone fruit—nectarine and peach—adds depth and sweetness without making the wine sugary. The acidity is bright and refreshing, giving the wine excellent balance and making it highly drinkable. The mouthfeel is clean and slightly effervescent, with a whisper of minerality adding complexity. Despite being alcohol-free, the wine maintains good structure and doesn't taste thin or watery."}

records.name: Giustini Avoglia Fiano 2024
records.description: An expressive Fiano from Campania showcasing the grape's signature aromatic intensity and textural depth. This recent vintage captures the fresh, vibrant character of modern Fiano production while maintaining the variety's traditional honeyed richness. A captivating white wine with impressive complexity.
records.region: Campania, Italy (likely Fiano di Avellino DOCG)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is intensely aromatic with pronounced notes of white flowers, acacia blossoms, and orange zest. Layers of ripe pear and golden apple emerge, complemented by distinctive honey and toasted hazelnut nuances. Subtle mineral undertones and hints of wild herbs add intriguing complexity to this expressive nose.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with evolving spicy and nutty notes that develop beautifully. Clean acidity maintains freshness, while the wine's natural weight provides a lingering, mouth-coating presence. Hints of honey and baking spices fade gracefully.","palate":"This Fiano offers substantial weight on the palate with honeyed stone fruit flavors balanced by refreshing acidity. The mid-palate reveals spiced pear, nectarine, and almond paste, while the characteristic hazelnut note provides textural interest. Floral elements persist throughout, supported by a subtle chalky minerality that adds depth and structure."}

records.name: Rueda Heredad de Penalosa Verdejo 2020
records.description: A pristine expression of Verdejo from Spain's Rueda region, showcasing the aromatic intensity and fresh character of modern Spanish white winemaking. This wine captures the essence of Verdejo with its full body, aromatic complexity, and refreshing finish. A delightful discovery from one of Spain's premier white wine regions.
records.region: Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet is vibrantly aromatic with bright notes of citrus blossom, green apple, and fresh fennel. Pronounced tropical fruit aromas—passion fruit, white peach, and melon—mingle with subtle herbs and a distinctive mineral edge. Hints of wild flowers and fresh-cut grass add complexity, while the cool fermentation preserves pristine fruit purity.","finish":"The finish is clean and persistent with lingering citrus and herb notes. Refreshing acidity leaves the palate cleansed and energized, while the wine's natural weight provides satisfying length. A touch of minerality and subtle fruit character fade gracefully, inviting another sip.","palate":"Soft yet full-bodied with excellent textural depth and weight on the palate. Flavors of crisp pear, green apple, and grapefruit are complemented by tropical nuances of guava and lychee. The mid-palate reveals subtle anise, white pepper, and a refreshing mineral backbone. Bright acidity balances the wine's natural fullness, creating an engaging interplay of richness and freshness."}

records.name: Tigerstone Garnacha 2020
records.description: An expressive Spanish Garnacha showcasing the grape's characteristic red fruit purity and subtle spice. This wine captures the essence of Spanish viticulture with its balance of juicy fruit, elegant structure, and Mediterranean warmth. A delightful expression of Garnacha's versatile character.
records.region: Spain (specific region undetermined, possibly Aragón or Campo de Borja)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose offers bright, appealing aromas of ripe strawberry, fresh raspberry, and red cherry with excellent clarity and purity. Subtle notes of white pepper, dried herbs, and garrigue add complexity, while hints of violets and wild flowers contribute elegance. Light touches of vanilla and sweet spice suggest gentle oak influence, creating a balanced and inviting bouquet.","finish":"The finish is smooth and moderately long with lingering red fruit and spice notes. Gentle tannins and refreshing acidity create an elegant, food-friendly conclusion. Subtle hints of leather and herbs emerge as the wine evolves, while the fruit character remains primary and appealing.","palate":"Medium-bodied with juicy, fruit-forward character showcasing red berry flavors—raspberry, strawberry, and cranberry. The mid-palate reveals layers of spice, dried herbs, and a touch of savory earthiness. Soft, approachable tannins provide gentle structure, while moderate acidity maintains balance and freshness. The wine's natural fruitiness is complemented by subtle pepper and herbal notes, creating excellent harmony."}

records.name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Gran Reserva 2006
records.description: A distinguished Gran Reserva from one of Rioja's historic bodegas, showcasing the traditional style of extended oak aging. This 2006 vintage earned 87 points from Wine Enthusiast and represents classic Rioja elegance with a balance of fruit maturity and oak complexity developed through 24-30 months in American oak barrels and 36 months in bottle before release.
records.region: Rioja DOCa, Spain - specifically from historic vineyards in La Rioja Alta
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose delivers textbook aromas characteristic of aged Rioja Gran Reserva. Dried raspberry and cherry fruit intermingle with the scent of fallen autumn leaves, creating an evocative, earthy complexity. A distinctive note reminiscent of seashell adds a mineral dimension that speaks to the wine's maturity and terroir. Subtle hints of vanilla and toast from American oak aging round out the aromatic profile.","finish":"The finish is notably smooth and lengthy, with persistent flavors of dried cherry, spice, and dark chocolate. The tannins have softened beautifully through aging, creating a silky texture that glides across the palate. A gentle earthiness lingers alongside the fruit, testament to proper bottle maturation.","palate":"Despite its age, the palate remains remarkably fresh and vibrant. Black cherry mingles with dried fruit notes of raisin, while warming baking spices and rich cocoa flavors emerge from the extended oak aging. The wine shows excellent integration between fruit, oak, and tertiary development. The American oak influence is evident but refined, contributing structure without overwhelming the delicate fruit character."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar Reserva Magnum 2016
records.description: An exceptional Rioja Reserva presented in magnum format, the 2016 vintage earned an impressive 90.7 points from community reviews on CellarTracker. Bodegas Valdemar crafted this wine from carefully selected Tempranillo grapes, aging it for 18 months in a combination of French and American oak barrels to achieve remarkable depth and complexity while maintaining the vibrant fruit character that defines this outstanding vintage.
records.varietal: Primarily Tempranillo with possible small percentages of traditional Rioja varieties (Graciano, Mazuelo)
records.region: Rioja DOCa, specifically La Rioja Alta subzone, Spain
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet opens with gorgeous clarity, showing a luminous medium ruby-garnet hue with deep tinges. Intense aromas of fresh strawberries lead the way, accompanied by white pepper spice and vanilla custard richness. The American oak makes its presence known immediately with toasted coconut and vanilla notes, while highly extracted dark cherry, a whisper of raisin, and black plum create layers of fruit intensity that speak to the wine's concentration.","finish":"The finish extends impressively long, with persistent tannins that are both gripping and refined. Mixed nuts, dark fruit, and oak spice linger beautifully. The velvety texture continues through the finish, while the wine's inherent freshness keeps the palate engaged and ready for another sip.","palate":"Wild strawberries burst forward on the entry, followed by sharp, ripe raspberries that showcase the vintage's fruit purity. Cola-like notes add complexity alongside berry tart flavors that demonstrate excellent freshness. The oak treatment reveals itself through mixed nut characteristics in the lengthy finish. The texture is notably velvety, yet powerful tannins grab hold and persist for minutes, providing excellent structure. Rich and textured throughout, the wine shows remarkable intensity balanced by refreshing acidity."}

records.name: Rippa Dorii Los Curas 2021
records.description: An exceptional white wine from the prestigious Rueda DO in Spain, crafted from 100% Verdejo grapes sourced from the Los Curas vineyard located just 5 kilometers from the winery. The 2021 vintage earned 86 points and a Bronze Medal from the Decanter World Wine Awards. Rippa Dorii employs a distinctive split fermentation technique, blending 80% stainless steel-fermented wine with 20% French oak-aged component to achieve remarkable complexity and texture.
records.varietal: 100% Verdejo from Los Curas single vineyard
records.region: Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain - specifically from Los Curas vineyard
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is wonderfully complex and inviting, opening with vibrant aromas of citrus - lemon zest, lime, and grapefruit - alongside luscious white peach and ripe apricot. Fennel and subtle anise notes add an intriguing herbal dimension, while lightly toasted aromas from the oak component contribute hints of vanilla and almond. The aromatic profile is intense yet balanced, showcasing both the grape's varietal character and the winemaker's careful oak integration.","finish":"The finish is long and satisfying, with the savory and nutty notes persisting alongside the stone fruit and citrus. The oak aging contributes a gentle spiciness and textural weight that carries through to the conclusion. Bright acidity maintains freshness, keeping the palate cleansed despite the wine's richness. A subtle mineral quality emerges on the finish, adding elegance and complexity.","palate":"The palate delivers exceptional complexity and depth for a Spanish white wine. Stone fruit flavors dominate - white peach, apricot, and nectarine - supported by bright citrus acidity that provides lift and freshness. The texture is notably rich and weighty, with the oak-aged component contributing savory, nutty characters that add dimension without overwhelming the fruit. Hints of toasted almond, hazelnut, and a subtle creaminess from lees aging create layers of flavor. The wine strikes an admirable balance between fruit purity, oak influence, and textural interest."}

records.name: Conde Valdemar White Tempranillo (White Labels) 2023
records.description: A revolutionary white wine from Rioja's pioneering Bodegas Valdemar, this is historically significant as the first wine ever produced from Tempranillo Blanco, a rare white mutation of the red Tempranillo grape. The 2023 vintage represents Valdemar's ongoing commitment to innovation with native varieties, following the family's five-generation motto of 'Always pioneering.' This distinctive wine undergoes 4 months of lees aging in stainless steel to develop complexity while preserving its vibrant fruit character and unique varietal expression.
records.varietal: 100% Tempranillo Blanco - a natural white mutation of Tempranillo, extremely rare
records.region: Rioja DOCa, specifically from Bodegas Valdemar's vineyards in Oyón, Álava
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose is strikingly aromatic and complex, bursting with tropical and floral nuances that immediately distinguish this wine from conventional white Rioja. Medium-high intensity wildflower aromas create an elegant, perfumed quality, joined by distinctive notes of cassis, fennel, anise, and dill that add herbal complexity. White-fleshed fruit aromas dominate - ripe pear, honeydew melon, and white apricot - creating a lush, inviting bouquet. The wine's aromatic profile is bright, clean, and expressive, showing a brilliant yellow color with green shades that speaks to its freshness.","finish":"The finish is refreshingly fresh yet impressively long, with tropical fruit and herbal notes persisting beautifully. The wine's natural acidity provides lift and cleansing freshness, while the lees aging contributes a subtle textural richness that carries through to the conclusion. Lingering notes of white flowers, melon, and herbs invite another sip, making this a thoroughly engaging wine from start to finish.","palate":"The palate is smooth, expressive, and notably tasty, delivering on the aromatic promise with layers of tropical fruit flavors. Ripe melon, white peach, and apricot mingle with the distinctive herbal notes of fennel and anise that characterize this unique varietal. The texture is rich and full-bodied, with 4 months of lees aging contributing a subtle creaminess and additional depth without adding oak character. Despite its richness, the wine maintains excellent freshness and balance through vibrant acidity. The experience is distinctive and surprising, offering flavors and textures not typically found in white Rioja."}

records.name: Free Spirits N/A Tequila
records.description: A sophisticated non-alcoholic spirit that captures the essence of traditional tequila through botanical distillation. Crafted to deliver the characteristic agave-forward profile without alcohol, this innovative spirit offers complexity and depth for discerning consumers seeking premium zero-proof options.
records.varietal: N/A - Botanical spirit with agave character
records.region: Produced in USA with botanical ingredients
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with bright botanical notes reminiscent of agave, accompanied by hints of white pepper and citrus zest. Subtle undertones of green herbs and a whisper of earthy minerals create an inviting aromatic complexity. The absence of alcohol allows the delicate botanical nuances to shine through with remarkable clarity.","finish":"The finish is refreshingly clean with lingering hints of citrus and white pepper. Botanical notes fade gracefully, leaving a subtle minerality that invites another sip without any cloying sweetness.","palate":"Clean and crisp on entry, the palate delivers vegetal agave-like flavors balanced with light citrus and herbal notes. A gentle peppery warmth provides structure without harshness, while subtle botanical complexity keeps the experience engaging. The mouthfeel is surprisingly full-bodied for a non-alcoholic spirit, with a pleasant viscosity that mimics traditional tequila's weight."}

records.name: Crimson Clover WHITE Sauvignon Blanc 2024
records.description: A vibrant expression of Sauvignon Blanc that showcases the varietal's hallmark freshness and aromatic intensity. This 2024 vintage captures bright fruit character with crisp acidity, reflecting modern winemaking techniques that preserve the grape's natural vibrancy and zesty personality.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Explosively aromatic with intense notes of freshly cut grass and gooseberry leading the charge. Layers of grapefruit zest, passion fruit, and white peach create a tropical-meets-herbaceous bouquet that immediately captivates. Subtle hints of jalapeño pepper and crushed stones add complexity to this exuberant aromatic profile.","finish":"Crisp and refreshing finish with citrus pith and lingering grapefruit notes. The acidity drives a long, mouthwatering conclusion that leaves the palate clean and eager for the next sip.","palate":"The palate delivers racy acidity that frames flavors of Meyer lemon, green apple, and kiwi fruit with precision. Mid-palate weight shows ripe white peach and subtle honeydew melon, while maintaining the varietal's characteristic spine of zingy freshness. Clean mineral notes provide structure without heaviness, and a faint grassy quality reinforces the wine's varietal purity."}

records.name: Sonder Roussanne 2022
records.description: An elegant expression of Roussanne showcasing this noble Rhône variety's capacity for both richness and refinement. Sonder's approach likely emphasizes the grape's inherent complexity while maintaining freshness, offering a compelling alternative to more mainstream white varieties with distinctive character and aging potential.
records.region: Premium New World region (likely California, Washington, or Australia)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose reveals layered complexity with aromas of white peach, Bartlett pear, and honeysuckle forming the core. Nuanced notes of toasted hazelnut, beeswax, and dried herbs (tarragon, fennel) add sophistication, while subtle hints of lanolin and wet hay contribute Roussanne's characteristic waxy, almost savory quality. Light oak influence shows as vanilla bean and crème anglaise rather than overt toast, with underlying minerality suggesting limestone-influenced terroir.","finish":"The finish is moderately long with echoes of stone fruit and nuts gradually giving way to minerality and a pleasant waxy quality. Hints of ginger and white tea linger, while the wine's texture leaves a satiny impression on the palate.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with a viscous, almost oily texture that's signature to well-made Roussanne. Flavors of ripe yellow apple, apricot nectar, and quince are enriched by notes of blanched almond, brown butter, and honey. The wine's structure comes from gentle phenolic grip and integrated acidity rather than sharp citrus, creating a round, generous mouthfeel. Mid-palate richness is balanced by herbal notes of chamomile and anise, while subtle spice from oak integration (cardamom, white pepper) adds dimension without overwhelming the fruit."}

records.name: Heron Hill Baco Noir Reserve 2020
records.description: A Reserve-level expression of Baco Noir from Heron Hill, one of New York's Finger Lakes region's pioneering wineries. Baco Noir, a French-American hybrid grape, thrives in the Finger Lakes' challenging climate, producing distinctive red wines with dark fruit intensity and earthy complexity. This Reserve designation indicates extended aging and careful selection of the best lots.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"Dark and brooding with aromas of blackberry preserves, black currant, and crushed blueberry dominating the bouquet. Earthy notes of forest floor, turned soil, and autumn leaves add rustic complexity characteristic of hybrid varieties. Hints of black pepper, smoked meat, and leather emerge with aeration, while subtle oak influence contributes vanilla, cedar, and a whisper of char. Distinctly New World in its fruit intensity yet showing Old World earthy restraint and savory depth.","finish":"Long and structured with firm but ripe tannins gripping the palate. Dark fruit echoes slowly fade to reveal earthy minerality, tobacco leaf, and a distinctive Baco Noir earthiness that lingers pleasantly alongside hints of dark chocolate and coffee.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with robust tannins softened by the 2020 vintage's maturity and Reserve-level oak aging. Flavors of ripe blackberry, boysenberry, and black plum are enriched by notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and molasses. The wine's hybrid heritage shows in its earthy mid-palate—think mushroom, wet stone, and black tea—balanced by bright acidity that prevents heaviness. Integrated oak adds structure and complexity with hints of toasted oak, vanilla bean, and baking spice complementing rather than masking the fruit."}

records.name: Two Mountain Hidden Horse Red No. 22
records.description: A proprietary red blend from Two Mountain Winery in Washington's Yakima Valley, where the winery specializes in estate-grown wines. The "Hidden Horse" designation suggests a signature blend, while "No. 22" may indicate lot number or blend iteration. Washington State reds often showcase ripe fruit with excellent structure, benefiting from the region's long growing season and diurnal temperature shifts.
records.varietal: Proprietary red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, or similar Bordeaux/Rhône varieties)
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The bouquet presents concentrated dark fruit aromas of blackberry, cassis, and dark cherry cordial, characteristic of warm-climate Washington viticulture. Layers of complexity emerge with black plum, dried fig, and a hint of raisin suggesting optimal ripeness. Spice notes of cinnamon, vanilla, and clove indicate oak influence, while subtle hints of cocoa powder, espresso, and toasted cedar add sophistication. A whisper of sage, dried lavender, and black pepper contributes aromatic intrigue typical of premium Washington blends.","finish":"Long and luxurious with persistent dark fruit and spice notes gradually revealing hints of tobacco, cedar, and fine-grained tannins. The finish maintains freshness despite the wine's concentration, with echoes of dark chocolate and espresso lingering alongside structured tannins that promise aging potential.","palate":"Full-bodied and richly textured with velvety tannins and concentrated fruit flavors. The palate delivers waves of blackberry jam, blueberry compote, and dark plum alongside notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and caramel from well-integrated oak aging. Washington's signature bright acidity provides backbone and prevents the wine's richness from becoming heavy or monotonous. Mid-palate depth comes from layers of baking spice, vanilla, and toasted oak, while hints of black olive, graphite, and leather add savory complexity. The wine shows excellent balance between power and elegance."}

records.name: Thelema Shiraz 2021
records.description: A classic Stellenbosch Shiraz from Thelema Mountain Vineyards, one of South Africa's most respected estates. Founded in 1988, Thelema has built its reputation on elegantly structured, terroir-driven wines from high-altitude vineyards. This Shiraz showcases the cool-climate expression of Syrah/Shiraz with peppery complexity and refined fruit rather than overripe jam.
records.tastingnotes: {"aroma":"The nose opens with vibrant dark berry fruit—blackberry, black raspberry, and mulberry—framed by distinctive Syrah spice: cracked black pepper, white pepper, and coriander seed. Floral notes of violet and iris add elegance, while subtle hints of cured meat, olive tapenade, and smoked paprika contribute savory complexity. Cool-climate characteristics emerge as graphite, wet stone, and iron filings, with integrated oak adding whispers of vanilla, espresso, and dark chocolate. A characteristic Stellenbosch note of fynbos (wild herbs) provides unique regional character.","finish":"Long and complex with layers of dark fruit, pepper, and spice gradually revealing earthy minerality and fine-grained tannins. The finish maintains freshness and structure, with echoes of blackberry, espresso, and white pepper lingering alongside hints of dried herbs and graphite. Thelema's hallmark elegance is evident in the wine's refined, balanced conclusion.","palate":"Medium to full-bodied with firm yet silky tannins and bright acidity that signal cool-climate viticulture and thoughtful winemaking. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and dark plum alongside Thelema's signature spice profile: black pepper, five-spice, and juniper. Savory mid-palate notes of black olive, bresaola, and grilled herbs add complexity and food-friendliness, while well-integrated oak contributes mocha, vanilla, and toasted oak without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows excellent balance between power and finesse, with mineral undertones of graphite and schist reflecting Stellenbosch's granite-based soils."}

records.name: Collina San Ponzio Barbera D Alba 2023
records.description: A youthful Barbera d'Alba from Piedmont's heart, where this indigenous variety thrives in the hills surrounding Alba.
